reviews.review: Wow what a building. Hadn't planned to got to the top of the New Trade Centre, but spent a very emotional morning at the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and decided to buy tickets, did have to queue for tickets because we hadn't planned this visit, but only for half an hour. So glad we did though, what an experience!! Will always remember.

Amazing visit . Having already been up another tall building in New York, I was sceptical of the need to visit another. I am so glad we did though! One world observatory is a must do in my opinion. We pre booked which was perfect as we walked straight in late afternoon. With 5 and 8 year olds, we decided to rent the iPads to make the experience a learning one for them. It would also allow us to stay longer. It was $15 well spent. The views were amazing, it was a beautiful clear day. I recommend visiting for sunset although it did get crowded. The staff were excellent throughout and made it a very enjoyable experience. I wish we had gone here first! Only downside was dealing with glare from Windows for photos. Any food and drink you buy there is also very expensive! Be warned.

Amazing experience!. Visited NYC for the first time this month so did the "touristy" things we could fit in. The elevator ride is interesting with its time lapse video and the arrival on the 102nd floor ushers the group into a small area with a picture of the NY skyline, a quick audio intro and then the photo lifts to reveal the real view below. I believe everyone in our group gasped. We spent a long time enjoying the 360 degree view. I think this is a must-see for first-timers. I did buy our tickets in advance (3 adults) and purchased the flex tickets. A wise decision worth the extra $ after seeing the long lines out front. The flex ticket is for a specific day any time during operating hours. We were able to walk right up and go inside. A real time saver. Stunning views and am so glad this was on our time constrained list of to dos.

Well worth the money!! A must see!. Was a little apprehensive about paying $37 for a ticket but so glad I did. It was amazing. The elevator ride to the top was very cool. It was busy but the lines moved fast and it didn't affect our viewing at the top. The views were spectacular. You could see for miles around. It really puts things in to perspective being that high off the ground. I could have done without the little presentation they show before letting you into the observatory deck. Oh and felt super secure, there were armed army personnel, police and security presence everywhere! Bathrooms were really clean too.

"ONE" Great Experience. We were at the WTC in 2000 and made the mistake of not going to the observation deck in the Twin Towers. We were at Ground Zero a month before the dedication of the Pools. We've been back a few times to watch the progress. We went back this year to experience the 9/11 Museum and the One World Observatory. These were worth making the trip. The Museum was awesome and emotional. The One World Observatory was like nothing we've ever experienced in an observation deck. The weather was perfect that day so the views were incredible. The technology and sensory experience is breathtaking. Both elevator rides are worth the price of admission. We will most likely enjoy the experience any and every time we visit NY. To all who were responsible, wonderful job and thank you!

Breathtaking. I had intended to go see 1 world trade or "The Freedom Tower" as it hadn't been completed last time I was in Manhattan, and decided to go to the observatory on a whimCost was about $34 dollars, and yeah, there's was a bit of a queue. Visitors are let in in timed batches (2pm, 2:15 and so on) which quite a few people, including New Yorkers couldn't seem to get their heads around.There's quite a lot of security, akin to an airport, but that's understandable really.The elevator ride up is interesting, and pretty rapid considering it's 102 floors!The view is stunning, truly breathtaking, and I could have spent a lot longer just taking it all in.I'd have preferred a less busy day, as it was fairly packed, and I would suggest waiting to see what the weather is like before booking tickets, as a cloudy day would ruin the experience.Yeah, the coffee shop/restaurant is expensive, but I expected that and at the end of the day, no-one forces you to buy anything.The gift shop isn't ridiculously expensive.The staff were really friendly as well, even the guys on the door dealing with people moaning that at 1:55 they were being made to wait, despite having a ticket for 2:15.Well worth the money.

AMAZING. We went upto 102 floors to the top great lifts so quick plus film show inside them once up on top..... film show & talks etc then the views over New York amazing .....I think better views than Empire state or The Rock( Rockefellers building ) for views plus talks after on what happens during after and the future of Wall street with new 13 subways etc....Unfortunately misty over new York but still well worth it....

Excellent elevators, exceptional views, and superb cake!. OK so you don't go for the cake but I needed to mention it just the same...lovely lemon pound cake and great coffee at the cafe at the top....we needed it as it was so interesting up there, we spent far longer there than we had anticipated.We visited on a Wednesday afternoon, we hadn't booked in advance because you need to see what the weather will do...if we had gone the previous day we would have seen nothing.The queue to get in looked long but moved very fast and in no time we were heading downstairs to take the elevator to the top.I am not saying anything about the ride except to say it is brilliant; you feel very moved by it (and not just in a physical going up way!).When you emerge into the bright sunlight the views are obviously spectacular; it is so absorbing and interesting to merely walk around but there are staff members if you have questions and there are interesting presentations at the City Pulse feature (and a good chance to sit down after walking round and round and round).Nice restrooms, plenty of seating and decent gift shop with everything you could imagine at every price point.And lovely cake....what a great day out!

Best Views in the City. Wow!!!!!!!!!!! Just Wow!!!!!!!!!60 seconds to ascend 102 floors, that 1776 feet. You even get a visual display when in the elevator. For those who don't like elevators, you don't feel it moving or coming to a standstill.As with everything in NY your visit is well orchestrated and security is always tight.There is a coffee shop and bar at the topand both are expensive, but what isn't in NY if you are a tourist? My cake cost $10!!!!!!! yummy though.You can spend as much time as you want at the top and there are regular commentaries given at 2 central points.We paid $15 for the Macbook guide, but to be truthful, if you did your homework before visiting, you would recognise what you were looking at. The only advantage to the Macbook was you got an audio description and a snippet of some facts to do with what you were looking at.
A must see. Book as part of a package so you skip the ticket queueViews are breathtaking. You really see forever
Loved it!. No need to pre buy a ticket in September. Waited for a sunny day and went at 10am! No queue! It was a wonderful experience and the lift up was fantastic!!

Amazing views. Was a little busy the day we visited but the lines kept moving and it was never a problem. From the moment you enter the lift, the "view reveal" then through to spending time walking around the observatory floor was fascinating. That high you can see planes and helicopters below your window line, view across the bay and Manhatton was brilliant.

Stunning views. Went to visit One World Observatory on Wednesday and have to say this is one of the ultimate ways to view New York if you're pushed for time! The Observatory offers truly spectacular views of all angles of New York City. Once at the top, you can spend as long as you like in the tower, looking out onto the landscape. Reasonably priced at $34.00 USD (about £28.00 on today's exchange rate) this is for sure a must-visit site!

Okay but I felt a bit cheated . I expected a chance to take amazing sky photos of the town but the lack of outside and glass free space and dirty glass soon but an end to that idea !! Shame as it was €72 for us to go up and long queue and pushy tourists... we even had to queue to exit!! I wouldn't bother again. And I was a bit concerned that should anything g require an emergency exit then you'd have next to no chance ... way too busy even off peak. Two lattes were €14 ! We savoured it for sure ... disappointment all round to be honest. I'm sharing the best of my phone pics so you don't feel you need to go! Come on New York.. sort it out.

Best Building for view of NYC. This was sensational. As you take the elevator up, there is a video playing showing the development and growth of NYC. Once up top, you get the best view of NYC - so much better view than from Empire State Building or Rockefeller Center and much less wait. This is our building of choice for a great view.

Best View of NYC Bar None!. Finally made the trip up to the Observation deck of One World Trade Center and was not disappointed. Spectacular views of the entire city, both rivers and across into New Jersey. The Observatory I'd located on the 100th thru 102nd floors and tickets cost $32 with discounts for seniors and kids. A must see if you are in lower Manhattan.

It Just Has To Be Done - Breathtaking On A sunny day. As we were part of the 'All Access Tour' (Walking tour WTC, 9/11, Museum & One World Observatory), we had our tickets and then there was no queuing, no hassle, as there was a large queue and they let them in timed blocks. also, I wish someone had told me about the elevator experience, it was simply brilliant a journey through construction over the ages, I'll say no more as it would spoil it, the speed was also incredible. When you arrive you are corralled, then about 30 or so people stand against a rail in a long line, facing a screen, then the show starts,with music, vocals and then the big reveal of the skyline, all good stuff, very professional and slick.. You are then moved around two floors ,so they can get some money off you (they did with me $5.00 for a bottle of water,!as it was so hot), down two floors to the 360 observation deck. It was fairly busy trying to take photo's. The view was 25 miles+ on a fab sunny day, it was quite spooky when the planes are flying so close.

Really Enjoyable couple of hours. Loved the elevators that took you up with displays on all sides detailing the skyline changes over the years.Observation level obviously had amazing views.We had food and a couple of drinks in the restaurant and they were really good too. Pricey but good. Book your tickets in advance its so much quicker.
Amazing. Great experience, amazing views of the city and very well organised, like the rest of nyc it's quite expensive

An absolute MUST!. We been on our last visits on Empire State Building and Top of the Rock, but this view is the absolutely amazing. We purchased the tickets in the morning and went during midday. So we had no queues. An express pass is not necessary, you can save that money. Plan 1-2 hours for the being at the observatory platform. There is so much to see. The adventure begins already in the elevator! But I won't tell. Experience on your own and enjoy it.

The Tower reborn. Having visited the previous twin towers on more than one occasion this was a must do for me.
Great views as you would expect, well organised and not busy when we were there.
Having taken the ipad option art $15 I would not recommend this.

Views are amazing. Didn't know what to expect from this but it was so worth it the lift is so fast your ears pop when you reach the top the views of the city are amazing up there with the top highlights of my trip depending on the time of day you are going is worth pre booking can be quite busy early morning we didn't have to queue for long by the time we got out the queues were huge well worth a visit

Amazing. From the moment we got In the lift our visit to One World was amazing, we have Previously been up all the high view buildings In New York and this one beats them all, we went up late afternoon so the line was short and we stayed until it got dark for the view of New York in lights. it is expensive to go up but you can eat or have a cocktail at the top, be warned the bar closes early.
Nice view from the top. This is one of the tallest buildings and the view is great.The high speede elevator zooms you to the observation level. You can see for miles.

view to die for!. be sure to buy the ticket in advance on-line. was so easy to just walk in - hand them the ticket and continue through the check-in and ride to the top. excellent lay out of the building and scenery and education of the building process.

Great views but they always want more money out of you.. Lets start with the initial cost shall we? It's $74 and change for 2 adults. Yup, just shy of SEVENTY FIVE BUCKS!! Then the very fast elevator does not take you to the observation deck. It takes you 2 floors above it where you get to stand through a presentation about renting ipads for an additional $15. After that you go down one floor and you have to stand through this long boring video of New York street scenes while a sound track tries to build drama for the unveiling of the view. The movie finally ends and the curtain moves to reveal the spectacular view. For all of about 10 seconds. Then you finally get to exit this room and enter an area where they want you to pose against a photo backdrop instead of the actual view from the tower. When you are finally allowed to exit this area you are sent through there deli/bar area. Because you might have more than $3 left and they want a chance to get it! Leaving this area you finally take an escalator down to the observatory floor. Here is where it's interesting. You can see miles in every direction, watch planes flying past on their way to Kennedy, they are actually flying below you. You get fabulous views of several major attractions including a great view of the Brooklyn Bridge. Just in case you were wondering, the souvenir stand is near the exit to the elevators.

Excellent. Having been up to the "Top of The Rock" and Empire State building we were dubious about paying out another $32 each to go up another tower! However- very glad we did! A very interesting experience with different views from the other buildings. Bit of a disappointment though that they have no information as to what you can see but do have these fantastic ipads loaded with information - but then ask you for another $15 dollars to hire one! Very few people hired one when we were there which just goes to prove that they are too dear and tehy would probably hire more if they had a more reasonable charge of 5 dollars and would probably make more money overall. They did have 2 "tour guides" who did very interesting talks within the building. Worth while "trip" though

What. A. View.. Obviously the view is amazing, but to think where exactly you are looking from really makes you understand the tragic events of 9/11. To think there people trapped from virtually the place you were standing with no where to go is indescribable. The building is gorgeous and the staff very friendly. A must see and xperience.

A new "view" of Manhattan. Before One World Observatory opened, you would go to the Empire State Building and Top Of The Rock for amazing views of Manhattan.With this new building, you get to see the island from another perspective (quite literally) and Brooklyn and the New Jersey are no longer excluded from the picture.They also did an amazing job with the installations with lots of emphasis on the digital.One advice without spoiling anything: get your cameras ready and start filming NON STOP from the moment you get in the lift until you are invited to move on to the view. Trust me, I wish someone had given me this tip!

Very fun and you can't beat the views . Good place to take in the views and relax after visiting the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The weather had been iffy - low clouds and rain and the skies cleared just as we were approaching One World so no line. Very nice intro to the observatory after you get off the elevator- I won't ruin the surprise. You can rent an iPad with a cool app that explains the skyline you are looking at and gives info on the buildings. Keep the kids interested. We had drinks at the bar. Expensive but not unexpected, given the location.

One World.... wow. Although only 102 floors (same as the Empire State Bldng), and nowhere near being the highest building in Manhattan, this is a must-see. First visit the Twin Towers Memorial Pools, and the Oculus, then take an ear-popping trip up, whilst watching a video ON THE ROOF of the elevator! Beautifully presented view of NYK, and then you're ushered through to walk around, and enjoy the view. The chap who was doing a presentation on the building and NYK in general was so enthusiastic and genuine, and had some fabulous insider tips for travellers - for eg, take the FREE Statten Island Ferry across for the best views of NYK, and a great view of the Statue of Liberty, without having to actually go to the island! This building does not 'sway', due to the construction of rounded edges!
Must see. Great if it wasn't raining. Glad got the tickets on line since the lineup was sooooo long. Great view, better during end of day.

Amazing views. Yet again a must when visiting the city. The elevator ride is really spectacular before you see the views for real! There is plenty of space to move around and take in the views. There is also an opportunity to hire an interactive iPad, which tells you which buildings you are looking at. Very interesting.

See Forever. A must attraction. Located adjacent to the 911 Memorial and Museum. The tallest building in the western hemisphere. The elevator brings you to the 102nd floor in 42 sec. The observatory provides 360° views of the entire city. Breathtaking views all around. If you are in town, don't miss this. Reserve about an hour and a half minimum unless you want to eat at the restaurant. Buy your tickets online to choose your ti!e and avoid the lines. I bought mine for $34 each.

Super duper!. Very nice view from a other side of Manhatten! We made the prebooking and didn't wait to go in and up to the top! The lift goes very fast! Arrived on the top you can walk around, take your time to take pictures and even drink a coffee and have a snack! Worth to go!

Good for Clear Days. The views are nice, but nothing spectacular, so only go on a clear day. I went on a cloudy day and everything was hazy and we couldn't see far. I got a great deal on my ticket (free from a stranger) but wouldn't have bothered with all the long lines just for that view. Line into building, line to elevator, line from elevator to theater room, watch short video, line up again to exit room, then final line to see out the window and then to walk around the top circuit then last line to take elevator down. They also sell overpriced food/drink/trinkets at the top. Exactly what you would expect.

Stunning Views of New York!. A testimony to New York's strength in rebuilding, affording visitors the unique opportunity to view the city, harbor, monuments, all from atop this tower. It's especially meaningful to those affected by the memories of 9/11, to experience the rebuilding and celebrate the present/future - and co-located with the 9/11 memorial and the Hudson's Highland Trail is a memorable trip, indeed!

The View!. One World offers the opportunity to see NYC and beyond from the 101st floor. Of course the view is amazing. The elevator ride up is fun. Take your camera and take your time walking fully around. We purchased tickets in advance, you save a little bit. It was expensive and will not do it again for this reason, but I am glad we went. Note: Think about the time of day you would like pics from and the directions you want to photograph.
One World Observatory . Went to catch the sunset with my best friend. Had an amazing time especially at that time of day as a lot of people tend to come in to catch the sunset over the Hudson

A must see in NYC. Amazing doesn't begin to describe it. We arrived to NYC on a bus trip and had limited time. When we arrived, the line to buy tickets was about 45 minutes. I asked if I could just buy them online with my phone and they said yes. So I did and 5 minutes later we were heading up! From the elevator ride up, I knew this was going to be impressive. The elevator had digital screens and it looked like the city was changing right before your eyes based on the year! I wish I would have recorded it! Amazing! When you arrive at the top (like a minute later) they show you a brief video on the walls and then that walls fold up and you see the view! Again, totally impressive and I wish I would have recorded it! I'm torn, because if I would have known, I would have recorded it, but not knowing made it so impressive and such a surprise. The views are beyond amazing. 102 floors above NYC make for wonderful views. You have the option to rent an "iPad" for $15 for assistance with your viewing. . We loved it. You hold it up to your view and it labels the buildings in front of you. It you click on the building link, there is a short video that plays describing the building. There is a cafe in the sky as well. Very expensive with no seating. But if you want breathtaking views while you have lunch, this is where to do it. We ordered for three (basically a sandwich and a beverage each and it cost $60). Would I do it again, yes!

Amazing. No one makes an experience out of anything like americans can.
This obersvatory isn't only a top floor visit, it's a whole Disney World-like ride.
It's so much of an experience that is worth the price and it doesn't take up much of your time.
Congratulations on being outstanding as always!

A bad cloudy day ruined the experience and there was zero visibility.. This review is not about the place but a bad cloudy day (Sat, Oct 8 at 5pm) totally ruined it, but the main issue was we were not informed of bad visibility. Apparently others told me that people who had paper tickets were being stamped and told specifically about visibility and since we had mobile tickets we were waived in and we missed the warning. Wish they would have told us. Once we were up there realized total zero visibility and chatting with some others came to know of the warning!! I wish @oneworldnyc would do something to make our experience better #seeforever #1nspired Thanks!

Fantastic building, best elevators ever.. This is undoubtedly an extremely impressive new building, and the elevator ride is an experience in itself. We were unfortunate in that we hit a bad day weather wise, so our views were not good. I am sure that on a clear day the views will be awesome though, as they were from the WTC. Plenty going at the top though with information and presentations and also plenty of food choices. The obvious advice is to try and pick a clear day to visit, if you have the choice.

what a view..... this is really nice. the view is great.. there's a lot of reflection from the sun in the windows so depending on the time, it's hard to take picture... late afternoon would be a great time to go. we went early morning and their was not a lot a people but it got filled quite quickly. you can find some rebate ticket on line. go buy your ticket on line so you skip the long lineup...

Amazing Lift Ride and views. If you are visiting NYC this is a MUST do. The lift ride itself is an experience! The views are spectacular and the fact the Americans have built something so huge to replace the World Trade Centre is testament to the spirit of many Americans.

A must. If you haven't been on Twin Towers this is the brand new tower to visit even if you don't see Central park from up there and it was disappointing to me! Anyway it worths the visit as well as the skyline you admire from up there, especially the Hudson river and bay.

Awesome Views. Of all the tourists observatories I have visited in NYC, in my opinion, this was the best. We visited after a day of rain, the air was clear and the sun was shining. The views of NY and beyond were breath taking. We were there early when it first opened up. The line moved rapidly. The ground floor when you first entered had pictures and explanations about the building. On the elevator going up was introductory remarks which set the tone for the visit. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and the entrance fee was well worth it. A must see.

Must see views. If you are a tourist to the big city then you need to visit this site in respect to all of the first responders who died when the twin towers fell. You will love the 360 views from the top of the observatory. All of New York is visible. You will love the elevator ride up and the surprise that waits you. Be prepared for long lines, but they move fast.

It's crazy how fast they put this building up.. It's crazy how fast they put this building up. It was just like yesterday I was here and they were barely starting construction. One World Trade Center is definitely an architectural wonder, the tallest skyscraper in all of New York City. It's like a big middle finger standing out from the rest of the city going out to the guys who took the original towers down.

A worthwhile visit to the top of Manhattan.. The admission lines moved quickly when we visited. The ride up in elevator is very visually innovative and interesting. The views on the observation deck are spectacular. The Ipad rental was helpful in giving context to the views.
On a clear day..... We saw 40 miles away. What a great way to a wrap up a really solemn & thought provoking 9/11 museum tour. Both a must see.

Great views. Visited on a sunny Sunday afternoon and the queue was surprisingly short and moved quickly. I realised why when we got to the ticket office - $37 per person which is a bit steep (pardon the pun) considering this is just a lift ride to 102nd floor. The view is great though.

Didn't go up...... I didn't go up so stop now if that's what your after...The q's at 9am were massive..at least a 2 hour wait.. but just to be next to the building was spine tingling and I must admit I passed a few tears. Metro close by so no issues with that. Food and general shops also and food carts .. look for the fire station across the road about 3/4 meters up also brilliant sight.. good place to take lunch and reflect..

Breath taking views. You should either do this or the Empite State Building they will both give you 360 degree views of the city....we chose this, you could spend hours just sitting at the cafe drinking a cup of coffee and just looking out over the city.

Amazing!!. This is fantastic. 23mph going up in the lift and when you get to the top be prepared for a wonderful sight. The price is not as expensive as the Empire State Building either. Only thing is you are surrounded by glass whereas on the Empire you are outside. Nonetheless a brilliant experience - we loved it!

Top of the world. Wasn't as amazing as I had hoped but it was good. Still think the view from 30 rock is the best in the city. Ate at One World while we were up there. It's definitely worth a trip. Lots of snack bars and gift shops at the top. Would encourage you to buy your tickets ahead of time to avoid lines
Fascinating view over NYC. Great view over New York. One of the fastest elevators of the world transports you in approx. 60 seconds to the 101th floor.

The elevator ride was just the beginning!. I didn't give it 5 tars because price was high for what you actually got. The elevator ride going up was fun to see. I won't spoil it, but the elevator ride and initial orientation were a production. Then there was the hard sell for the iPad tour, which was good but another $15.00. If you are not a NY'er then get the iPad tour, just one for your group. It helps ID the buildings you are looking at. Some locations have a recorded description, but not for most of the locations and the compass was a off. There were several docents providing a lot more explanation of the sites, which was really helpful too. If you're on vacation in NY, go ahead and splurge on this activity, do it after the 911 museum, it's very uplifting (pun intended).

Fantastic Views, Too Disneyesque!. Worth it for the views alone but the process of getting in (line control pathetic) and the Disney type lead up to getting on the lift and then getting out to the viewing platform is just annoying. Despite this the actual lift ride is fast and fun. The views are spectacular. Just go for this and accept the razzmatazz, you won't be disappointed. Top tip is to buy the ticket and book your time well before you go. As an aside, the close by 911 museum is a great experience. We made the mistake of only leaving two and half hours to see this before going on to the One World Observatory. You need the best part of a half day to fully enjoy the museum.
Very emotional.. Great 360 views.. there is a number of staff that give great information, on all areas of New York, and also what events will be happening.

Awesome must do experience !!!!. We took the boat ferry over from NJ and arrived just before 9 when they opened. Extra security, and a cool elevator ride up to the 102nd floor. We spent an hour and half here just looking out over the city, it was awesome. We bought some souvenirs, bought some breakfast items too. No rush at all. It was very busy by the time we left. And there were long lines on our way out of the building.

Another high thing to do in NYC. gives good 360 degree views around Manhattan & Burroughs, though because it's not more central you miss seeing Central Park as its hidden behind buildings. Make sure it's a good day so views aren't shrouded in haze or cloud .

Great views across Manhattan. A clear day a must!. Fantastic views at the top. I got confused going in as the sign for tickets points to the left and if you glance to the left, it's a glass balcony overlooking the stairs. I asked the guy where I should go to purchase tickets and he said I had to join the line outside. I told him i had just come from the line but was confused. You actually buy your tickets from the line at the counters directly in front of you as you enter the building which states it is reservations only. As soon as you leave the awesome entrance video, you are stopped from proceeding any further until the staff demonstrate their ipad/audio gadget which they excitedly tell you will locate any of the buildings circumnavigating the Observatory. Everyone gasps at the delight in this until they discover you have to pay extra for the privilege. A bit naughty really as you are ushered here and have no way of knowing you are being subjected to a sales pitch! The view at the top is stunning, a 360 degree view as far as the eye can see. On a clear day anyhow.
Fabulous experience. Beats all observation decks I have been to. Starting with an elevator surprise and a wonderful, knowledgeable,host.

Amazing view from the top of 1 World Trade Center. We spent about an hour and a half in the observatory at the top of 1 World Trade Center. The cost was reasonable considering the view and information available when we visited.

Plan on waiting in many long lines!. We purchased our tickets online prior to getting to NYC, and they state on the tickets to arrive at least 15 minutes prior to your entry time. Don't believe it! We got there an hour early and the lines were around the block - even for those who already had tickets! It was a madhouse. People with all variety of entry times were in the same line. The people in front of us had tickets 45 min. earlier than ours, and they missed their entry time. Fortunately for us, after waiting 45 min, they pulled those with our entry time out to form a different line and we got to enter at the correct time. Then more lines! Lines for security, lines for the theater presentation, lines for the elevators to go up, and even lines for the elevators to go back down. Not very well planned to accommodate the crowds that they should have expected. The view was great, but I'm not sure it was worth the $64 we paid for two tickets!

Wicked Great. I took my nephew and his wife (from Boston) on Sunday, Oct 9 and even though it rained, it was still a terrific experience. I purchased tickets online. The elevator ride was fantastic...don't miss it. They have employees every step of the way directing you. Very organized. Well worth it!
A Must See!. We were not disappointed with our visit to the Observatory. We got our tickets for 9 am and didn't have any crowds to deal with. We spent about 2 hours.

See Forever!. What a mountaintop experience! The views are quite amazing, and the elevator ride was smooth, fast, and cleverly educational, showing a progressive timeline of the city. I had been worried, since I have a fear of heights, but it was perfectly fine. It is an experience I would love to repeat.

Unique experience - and a ripoff. If you love New York City, One World Observatory will be like renewing your vows. If you are just about to fall in love with NYC, this place makes you scream yes loud and clearly. The views are just breathtaking, amazing, wonderful. One sees all the iconic buildings, landmarks and neigborhoods in a majestetic setting. Hard to stop saying oh and vow over and over again.The elevator tour and the short film are dramatic in a good way.But a couple of tips: The lines are long, not very well organized. We bought tickets in situ but even people with online tickets had to queue. 37 dollars for an entrance ticket is a lot of money but the worst are all the extras - you are kindly forced to be taken photos that you can buy later and offered a 15 dollar tablet lease for recognizing the buildings. Both offers can be ok for many but most visitors don't really realize that you can also say no to the extras.

Not on a cloudy day. I give it a 5 on a clear day but on a cloudy day the rating goes to a 3.
The 102 floors up has a cloud view sometimes. Get them to open the curtain anyway and hopefully you get a glimpse of the city as the clouds pass by.

Great experience!!. You can go all the way up to the 102nd floor viewing deck and it will cost $37 for an adult. Book early and you skip the line. Do not forget to have your video on during ascent and descent on the elevator as it portrays how NYC was built from the scratch few hundred years ago and on the way back you would experience similar view if it was a glass elevator. On the top you can get electronically guided tour for another additional $15. There's a nice restaurant spend some time and a gift shop as well. Great views around NYC and don't for get to take you camera.
Amazing virws. One world views are exceptional. The staff and overall experience amazing!If you had to choose between Empire observatory and One world I would definitely say One World !!

Great Views. The Elevator was great going up, although so quick we would have liked to have done it again as we had tall people standing in front of us and it was hard to see the story with pictures being told. I highly recommend getting the audio, Lap Top as it really helped in finding certain hot spots of NYC and surrounds. The volunteer helpers were brilliant and had a lot of valuable input and knowledge. Views are outstanding. We didn't buy anything from the stores as they were extremely expensive.
Great views of New York City. Amazing point of view of New York City!! You can take a lot of pictures from the 102th floor. The sunset is the best I have ever seen in NYC!!You have to go there!! =D

Go & see it at sunset!. We left the 9/11 museum & memorial & were head back to time square when we walked pass one world observatory. It was the best find, we enjoyed it so much. We accidentally got there just before sunset, so lucky, it was beautiful! They offered an iPad type device that we declined & I thought after it would have been awesome. If you've ever been to the top of twin towers before 9/11 or Empire State Building these views are so much better. It's a don't miss attraction. We'd been gone all day & just missed the restaurant closing but they had a small grab & go that was still open that had fresh pizzas, hit & cold sandwiches, wraps, salads. It was all very good.

Incredible view, but a bit of a hassle. Expect long lines (even if you bought timed tickets). And expect to go through a metal detector manned by gumpy people. But also expect an absolutely incredible view. The people in our party who are uneasy with heights did not have any issue with this. The observation level is entirely indoors and doesn't feel scary at all. Food options are crazy expensive.

Great way to end our trip to NYC!. This was the last thing we did during our girls trip to NYC and it was the perfect way to end an amazing week. Make sure you keep your eyes open on the elevator ride to the top because it is awesome! We purchased our tickets online, which I highly recommend because we were able to skip the line and go right in at our selected time. We chose to arrive just before sunset so that we were able to see everything during daylight, then we enjoyed the sunset up there, and then got to see the city light up when it got dark. You can see everything up there...the Statue of Liberty, Central Park, Empire State Bld, etc. I highly recommend you make time during your trip to enjoy the One World Observatory.

Excellent. Buy tickets on line as queues are long.. We got fast track tickets so no waiting. Well worth it. Try to get sunset. Views are fantastic. You can stay as long as you like. Only down side was ticket said we can enter anytime from 6pm up to 9pm but it closed at 8pm. Fortunately we went at 6pm.

Best on the top experience in NYC. Been to both the Top of the Rock and Empire State Bulding, and if you only have time for one - do the OWO. Great view, combined with a better multimedia experience. We went there at sunset, which was a great time for a visit.

Zero visibility but still fun. We waited until our last day hoping the low cloud would disappear, it didn't so we decided to take a ride up anyway. The staff were all really nice, letting us know there was no view, but we persisted and it was worth it just for the ride in the lift. Really amazing, be sure to stand with your back to the doors to watch the animation. Will be going back some day hopefully on a clear day.

Breathtaking!!!. Once inside you'll go up over 100 stories in 60 seconds on an educational elevator ride to an awesome 360 degree view of the city and far beyond! This really is worth the $34.00 admission price. My advice is to get tickets in advance if possible online, also go on a clear day and early rather than late,take your time and walk around the observation floor. I think you will enjoy this experience.

AMAZING VIEW!. Probably they hay the best elevator in the word, as you are speeding up to the top of the world, you travel at the same time through time, from the way NYC was before man showed up to the present moment. And once you are up there, and given that is a clear day, the view is astonishing!!

Great views - not ideal for photography. The views from the top of One WTC are breathtaking and worth a visit. This was the first time we had been up there and watched the sun set over Manhattan. The biggest gripe for me was the design of the viewing deck doesn't lend itself to photographers as it is all enclosed glass, unlike the Empire State Building or Top Of The Rock which have open decks. Also the view looking north towards mid town is at the narrowest point of the building behind the large video display so space is limited and everyone wants to squeeze into the small area. That aside, it is definately worth a visit, if oly once. They have the usual tourist photo and try and add on as much as they can to get you to spend. It is nonetheless an impressive view of a great city!

Great views, but not quite sure what looking at. Lot of history about the structure. Spectular views. Would be much better if there were maps of the city that pointed out what you were looking at (similar to sears tower). Opted for the VIP ticket, which skips the lines. Right up, right down. About double regular ticket, but worth it for us.

Breathtaking!. Visited with my family that consists of two young children. The view is spectacular. Be aware, that Central Park cannot be viewed. You are truly memorised from the moment you enter the observatory. I won't spoil it for you but have your camera ready as you are greeted by the employee that welcomes you. I pre purchased tickets and thus skipped a massive line of people.

A great elevator ride. The elevator ride up is unbelievably quick. How the thing is so quick yet you barely feel the acceleration/deceleration seems to violate the laws of physics. The view is fantastic as you would expect. We also rented one of those tablets which identifies the sights as you walk around. Pretty neat.

Skip a cloudy day. A lot of money for what you get. A cloudy day is not the best time to go as it limits your distant sightings. The digital player for $15 is really not worth it. Offer someone leaving $5 to use theirs. They'll get some money back and $5 might be worth it. Nice views, but I wouldn't do it again. Service people can be short with you. (Typical New Yorker stereotype. Most unusual on our visit.) Few smiles. Some of the photographers were pushy and unfriendly. The young lady giving a talk was quite good and appeared happy.
The View from 102!!!. And I'm not a fan of heights! You will see it all and you will get fabulous pictures. You'll love it! You certainly don't need a guide, in fact, I recommend you not!

Stunning views-A MUST SEE. If you want the best view of NYC, the top of World Trade One is a must on your list. It costs a little over $30 to take the elevator to the top, but trust me it is worth it. I don't want to spoil any of the surprises, but there is an incredible video that you will watch inside the elevator and then when get out you will watch one more before you can enter the observatory, but trust me it's worth the wait!!! You will get a 360° view of the city, clean restrooms, and a small gift shop. You can spend as much time as you want up in the Observatory. If you have fears of heights, I don't believe you will have any issues either, as you don't really look straight down at any point, it's more out.

A absolute MUST!!!. I have to say that I was a little apprehensive about this. Not because of the tragic history because I as with everyone else around the world mourned. The apprehension was because of going up 102 floors. I needn't to have worried because it just faded away. The graphics in the lift (elevator) are stunning & then you go out into a platform where there is another graphics display & then the display wall lifts & you get an absolutely stunning view. It was really quite emotional. You then go through to the observatory itself where you can spend as much time as you like soaking in the views all around. We had great weather & so could see for miles. There is a restaurant serving food & beverages. We opted to use the iPads that pinpoint places of interest around NY & give you a little history lesson as well. These were being hired out for $15. There are guides around giving out information & there's a kind of a periscope glass floor (that's the best way that I can describe it) that you can see the traffic & people going about there business below. I would recommend that you buy your tickets in advance as we did which meant we skipped the queues.

Pricey but worth it 1 time. Everyone should visit the One World area. The observatory offers spectacular views of NYC and surrounding area. Recommendation: Get a couple seats at the bar, order a NY Craft Beer and a burger, spin your stool around so you can look out the windows.

One World Observatory. The best part of One World Observatory is the elevator ride up and down. Projected images on the elevator walls were great. Unlike the original World Trade Center, there is no outside observation area. The Sky Portal was disappointing. I went early in the day and it was not too crowded. The outside view was very hazy and visibility was limited to 10 or so miles. The haze disappeared somewhat around noon but the crowds started coming in. There were lectures about NYC that were interesting and were presented in a very professional manner. The cafe was expensive, with coffee costing $5. There was also a gift shop and a rental video tour. All in all, it's pretty expensive for a view of the city.

A new classic in NYC. It's not a free experience, but they're trying to make up for costs of rebuilding plus lost revenue during the time they were rebuilding plus current maintenance costs. You'll realize after you visit and see the security they've got going on here. The elevator ride is a highlight as everyone says. Watch NYC build itself up all around you as you zoom to the top!Staff are helpful and have good energy. The views are fantastic. Take lots of photos but also don't forget to peek out from behind your camera / smartphone and see the city with your own eyes. It's beautiful.

Breathtaking. Though sombre and poignant the building was breathtaking and to begin with you go up a lift that gives a brief visual history of the area and the building. Once on top the view is simply amazing. So worth any penny spent going up this fabulous building.

The best views over lower Manhattan. Decided to visit the Observation Deck on a beautiful clear day while the in-laws were in town. Bought the tix online (saved 30 min or so of standing in line). Definitely recommend doing so. The line was short (very surprising?) and we were on the 102 floor within 15 minutes of arriving. The views are stunning.

Breathtaking. Incredible way to spend a few hours in NY. This is a great experience for all. We went up in time to see the sun go down over Staten Island, great to get the contrast of the city in daylight and then at night. The lift ride is an experience in its own right. I will go back.

Great views of the city!. The price is decent, but always check online. We paid $27 USD for the entrance when buying the tickets online with a discount from C21stores. The view from the top is amazing and the elevator ride is just awesome!!!! So, please go up the OWO! You will not regret it!

Great view and a well put together adventure. Seeing NYC from a highrise is a nice thing to do when visiting Manhattan. We´ve been to The Rock and Empire State several times, this time we wanted to visit The Freedom Tower. In other words, it was a first for us, and we highly recommend it. One thing is the view, but it´s a package deal that´s very informative and powerful which makes it such a nice experience. Just the elevator ride is nice and meaningful and the movie at the beginning with a very surprising ending (that I won´t reveal here) is such a powerful and nice treat. Once on the obeservation deck, the staff is very knowledgable and very easy to approach. I recommend getting the priority tickets and for the 9 am time slot. My daughter and I were first up the day we visited the tower. We were by ourselves in the elevator and spent approx 5 minutes by ourselves in front of the view towards uptown Manhattan. It was insane!

Awesome. Most amazing views of NYC. Get the iPad for $15 that gives you tons of details about the landmarks. Make time to enjoy the restaurants with a phenomenal view. Also, plan ahead to make sure the weather is good and sky's are clear. No point in going up there to stare into white clouds or hazy skyline.

One must experience it.. One World Obsevstory (One World Trade Center) has so many amazing things to offer its visitors. The entrance fee is $37, however if you buy it online, you may get it for $28-$34. It has SUPER high speed elevator that will take you to the top of the building, 102nd floor in 60 seconds. It's really cool.Staffs are well informative and helpful and they do outstanding presentations. I would strongly recommend you to experience it when you are in NYC.See some of my pics that I took when I experienced it with my friends last week.

Indescribable . Combine the history of 911 with the view of NYC. I saw the World Trade Center buildings, I saw ground zero, I saw them start building, I saw the building before it was complete. I finally got to see it from the top. Don't miss it!

Stunning views of NYC in all directions!. This is a MUST VISIT attraction in NYC even if you have seen the NYC views from Empire State or Rockefeller Center. One World Observatory offers 360 degree views covering NYC skyline, NYC bridges and NJ Skyline as well (You don't get to see the last two from Empire State or Rockefeller) Lastly, the elevator journey to the top is an amazing experience in itself. DON'T MISS IT!
OK view, long lines, very crowded.. A long wait for a mediocre view with big crowds. Not really worth it, the Empire State Building observation deck is still better!

must do in NYC. The observatory is so cool. The view is amazing and you can see new jersey. brooklyn, manhattan, queens, long island , all the bridges.........you can rent an ipad that will identify many things you can see. To get the most out of the observatory rent the ipad for $15. You will be glad you did.I would avoid the food it is not the best and expensive other than that enjoy

Pricey but unique. Great 360 degree view of harbor, rivers, and lower Manhattan. Virtually no lines getting in on a Friday afternoon in September. You can linger as long as you like. I'd use my own maps rather then the $15 rental I-pad they pitch.
Beautiful view!. Stunning. Really great visit and amazing 360 degree view of the area. The elevator is surprisingly fast and is an experience in itself. Be sure to purchase tickets online beforehand!

Great Views! However.... When purchasing tickets, you are placed in a set time slot. If you pay more, you can obtain a Flex Pass for use at any time that day, plus you blow by all of the lines for priority service. I HIGHLY recommend spending the extra money. The elevator ride up and back is AMAZINGLY FAST but provides different entertainment each way. I won't give it away, but let you experience it for yourself. Be warned, there is a bit of tourist schlockiness to this place, with the photos you pose for, and the upselling of handheld IPads you can rent to $15 so you can zoom in on any buildings you see on the skyline that you want to know more about. The views are breathtaking! The greatest shortcoming of this tour comes in the form of the facility's eateries. Your tired, you want to sit down, but you can not enter a sitting area to eat unless you want to pay for their premium restaurant. When you first enter the eating area, there is a bistro on your right, for paninis, etc. It was unclear to us (and many others, we observed) of where to queue up, and that you had two dining choices (the restaurant and the bistro). It may be clear to those who work there, but it is a virtual unknown to the guests. If you order bistro food, you must STAND while you eat. This is just simply...STUPID! I know they are afraid of people settling in for too long and admiring the view while they eat, but this does not take into consideration foot weary tourists. You could tell many many people were less than thrilled by this situation. This truly takes away from this exhibit being as fine as it could be. So pony up the dough for premium eats and a seat, or be prepared to stand. This could (and needs to) be done better.

Great, but.... ...I miss the WTC experience. The earlier you go the less important is the priority access. Everything well organised and breathtaking show at the beginning. Worth to visit and clear preference over the Empire State Building.

New WTC Observatory, but feels like Disney Land. I actually visited this Observatory twice. First time when it opened on May 2015, when I lived across the street on South ENd Avenue, second time couple months later. Both times did not quite appeal to me much, except for the spectacular views.What I did not like is the way everything is setup. To get as much tourists is, it is strictly organized from bottom to the top. One can not slide though and just enjoy the elevator ride, its a mass happening. Once up there its like Disney land with animators telling stories and jokes and such. If I don´t like than while travelling, I certainly don´t want that up there, too!I managed to get away from the masses and have a look around. But anywhere you went and tried to take a picture, there was always someone in your way, or just passing while you took the pic, utterly annoying. It should be limited to just a bunch of visitors to enable everyone a nice happening. But as it seems, here again, like Empire state, everything is for profit. Anything else is worthless. So, yes, I did enjoy the view, as I lived just across the street and it was spectacular to watch my 35th floor apartment from higher above. Been waiting long enough for its opening but I must say, the view on Empire state is a much better one, as it is also out in the open, which here it is NOT!Anyone make their own opinion on this WTC experience. I´ve been there twice, but I don´t need to go there again.
See forever!. Go on a clear day! It is worth it to buy the expedited tickets! Chew gum if your ears bother you with changing altitude!

Great views. We decided to do this at the last minute. The wait wasn't too bad but it was unfortunate that the information booth located outside didn't mention we could make a reservation on our smart phone and could have been in much faster. The views of NYC are unparalleled. We had a late lunch at the top. Food was excellent, service was good and for NYC our meal was surprisingly affordable. I highly recommend a visit to this spot where a grim but important part of our history is memorialized

Felt like cattle hurded..... It was a great adventure, except do either this or the Rockefeller Center (not Both) as you get pretty much the same thing, except the location here is around the 911 memorial.

Amazing experience . I would absolutely recommend this to anyone visiting New York. The views you get are incredible. The lift going up to the top it's also an amazing experience as it shows new york from the start and where it is now. We got the vip pass as the lines can get a bit crazy for this attraction.
Wow! Take it all in!. You'll love the birds eye view from the observation deck, the friendly and very professional staff, and you can even grab a bite up there!!
See Forever!. Very impressive, far reaching views. The elevator ride up to the observation deck is worth the entry price alone. A must do
Absolutely Amazing!. This is a great experience for anyone! I was ecstatic, it's the best view of Manhattan without the lines and the wait. I recommend buying tickets ahead of time online. Have fun!

Good views. personnel y i felt it was a lot of money for what it was. Maybe because we had been to the Empire and Top of the Rock where you can get great views from outside. guess its more to say you was up in the Tower and thats what your paying for.

Flying Hawk made it this high. This is where we stared our day. We had reserved tickets so moved right thru the enty point and assent in the elevator. Just the walk to the elevator was a treat with construction workers, in videos, taking about the challenges and accomplishments in erecting the world Center. The elevator ride has a marvelous time travel change of the city landscape - which greatly alleviates the apprehensions of the elevator ride. Once at the top nay apprehension of the exposure to the 360 degree surround is diminished.We were not impressed with the tablet you could rent that would point out points of interest. Otherwise the view is amazing.We did have lunch at the Observatory restaurant one floor below. The food was very good, ample and of course, the view was exceptional.Yes, a must do in NYC,

Not the best views. To visit the building For what it represents is a great experience. It's very expensive though for what it is. I prefer the view from Empire State / Rockefeller simply because you get to see the world trade centre from them. It feels very commercialised which spoils it a little. I still think Rockefeller is the best and would recommend it still if you only want to pay to go up one building.
spectacular. glad i went to see this place. its a nice memorial place and the 360 degree views from the top is amazing!

Freedom Tower. It's the best $35 elevator ride you'll ever take. To describe it would be to give away the great surprises you will encounter as you walk thru the line, then board the elevator for the 47 second ride to the top. Just be sure to keep your eyes open the whole time!
Awesome view. Great time. Best view of the memorial and the city had a ice cold beer at the bar also. The elevator ride will leave you speechless

best views.... this was the first thing me and my wife done in NYC.was simply amazing.not to spoil it, but the video when your first start - wow, left speechless and the view...stunning. do it, you wont regret it
Great view, nice lunch. Great day, no major queues. An expensive but nice lunch. Could do with a more extensive menu. iPad idea is great but could do with being more detailed and up to date.
It's all about the view.. The view! Simply stunning... We paid for the VIP access avoiding the queue, but when we got there, there was no queue. We went late August.

On a clear day. Went because I felt I had to....having been to the ground zero site right after 9/11...views (windows) were better than the old trade center..but no observation deck on the outside..restaurant is nothing compared to Top of the World that was the old one.Bar there is very small and faces away from view...overall experience was nice..not much int the way of lines but got a little crowded was there around noon time looks like it is advisable to get tickets ahead of time if you know when you are going to arrive
impressive. Very clean. The system for procuring tickets, getting in the place is so well organized. The best place to get a 360 degree view of NYC. Best time to visit is around sunset.

Breathtaking views. The 360 degree views from the top are amazing...and designed for the entire family. Wow! That's all I can say....and don't worry about the elevator ride up because you can't actually see outside during the ride, its like a virtual reality video that plays so if you close yours eyes, you'll be fine..... The restaurant at the top doesn't serve coke/pepsi products so if you need, the building across the street has many little restaurants with an average cost of 10 per person for lunch not including a beverage. Because parking is scarce, wear good walking shoes.... Leave plenty of time to find reasonably priced parking if you decide to drive into the city because Icon parking is a total rip off. They charge around 50 dollars for 4 hours...don't pay it, there are other places that won't rob you.

Oh so high - One World Observatory. I splurged and decided to see One World Observatory when last visiting NYC. I was glad that I did, as the views are amazing. I purchased the iPad viewer and was pleased that I did although my viewer - which you essentially point out at something and it will tell you what you are seeing e.g,. Statue of Liberty, UN etc. - was slightly off if you can believe it... hmmm.. a wee bit annoying. The food in the cafeteria section (where there is NO seating) is pricey for a pre-made sandwich or chips and the like. Eat before you go. Regardless, a nice once of a lifetime. If I were coming to NYC and could only do one "tall building" - I might choose Top of the Rock for the views of the city. Especially awesome at sunset.

The must see attraction. It's cheaper to book online than just turn up. I arrived around 11.00 and joined the line to buy tickets which took half an hour. Once you get your tickets you go through airport style security. Once clear of security you go along a passage of a rocky terrain to get to the elevators or pods. Once in the pod it takes a minute to go to the 102 floor. The pod has a video screen which shows you the New York skyline and how it changes from way back to present. This distracts from the journey up. Once you arrive you come onto a landing and there is a short presentation which ends with the screens lifting to reveal New York. This is the first time you realise how high up,you are. You leave this area then there is a sales pitch to rent an iPad for 15 dollars to know which buildings are which. Most people left when the price was revealed. The observation deck is well organised and has plenty of room to see all the views. What you see is breathtaking and makes you wonder how it was built. There is a restaurant and gift centre on the deck. I spent an hour looking through all the windows and that was sufficient to me. In the pods on the way down you get the impression you are going along rather than down and the video screens show the outside of the building. I hate heights but had no issues with this building whatsoever and it's a must see attraction

Consider the options before buying a ticket!. We visited the 9/11 Memorial Area on out first morning in New York. We hadn’t planned on going up to the One World Trade Centre Observatory – but we were there, and there were no queues, and it’s the tallest building…. so we bought our tickets! We were planning on going up either the Empire State Building or the Rockefeller ‘Top of the Rock’ later on in our stay. On reflection, we should probably have stuck with our original plan! I can’t compare, as we didn’t have time to visit either of the other two icons – but this place has three definite disadvantages:The main problem is that there are no signs to indicate what you are actually looking at! The only way to have this information is to pay 15$ for an ipad gadget! Most unfair, when you have paid a high price for a ticket to get up there to see the views! Secondly, there are no seats in the interior of the observatory – even though there is lots of space! People sit on the window-ledges, which makes it very difficult to get close to the windows to see the views – particularly when so many tourists are constantly videoing or taking ‘selfies’ of themselves in front of the views!!! Finally, there is no open-air area, so photos are all affected by glare and reflection! The extensive, panoramic views from the One World Observatory are indeed absolutely fantastic – but would be more interesting if you knew what you were actually looking at, and if ‘selfie-sticks’ were banned so that you could get a clear view through the glass, unmarred by the hundreds of selfie-stick poles brandished by so many tourists! I suggest you research all three before deciding which one to go up. I wish we had stuck with our original plan for either the Empire State or the Top of the Rock! The prices are all on a par.

Beautiful! . Beautiful architecture and views! There were 2 "awe factors" in this tour. One was the awesome technology in the elevators (don't want to spoil anything so I'll leave it there) another was the "unveiling" of the observatory deck. I don't want to spoil anything; no expenses were spared for this building and it's a def must see!

You can see forever. When you enter this massive building you get the feeling you are going to witness something magical. Before you know it you are whisked upwards in an elevator whose walls become a picture window indoors. Up up up to the 102 floor horizon level where you watch a short video presentation. Then a short walk down to the 101 floor imaging level which comprises of restaurants and cocktails and a see forever interactive electronic capture system. Then another short walk to the 100 floor discovery level. There are employees everywhere to help you find landmarks and point out places of interest. You can literally see forever . Brooklyn, the Queens, Manhattan , New Jersey and beyond ! Kind on the expensive of side $35 plus tax. But well worth it.

Best view of the city. 360 view of New York, higher than any other building. This is a beautiful building and you get the most amazing views. Well worth the $36. I would recommend going for sunset. It does get pretty busy around this time, book your tickets online or get from one of the people selling them around the corner in the street.
Must see. We are a family of 6 and we took a 3 day trip to NYC and this was our favorite activity!! Amazing! The views were breathtaking.

Great View. I loved it, if you buy a ticket in advance, there is no line on control. The elevator is very quick, wich you feel in the ears. But because of the speed you can't properly see the views on the screens, but they are still interesting. I was in the prime time, so it is better to choose the place for the viewing properly and stay there till the sunset.

Best view of NY. Last visit one world was not finished and had been up the twins so looking forward to this. Had booked tour and observation, but day was rainy and low cloud so visibility not great, but still worth the view. Had a beer a from bar, over the top price, so up to you. But still worth the ticket price.
Amazing Views. Terrific views from this102 level observation deck. Be warned buy your tickets online for quicker entry!

Great place to see the city-don't miss it!. Don't be surprised when you ride the elevator to the top that you really aren't looking outside as the elevator is inside the building. That being said, the elevator ride was smooth, fast and entertaining. Once you get to the top there is a place to eat and get drinks. There are 3 observation floors and you really do get an amazing view of the city. The only negative to this attraction, in my spouse's opinion, is that there is no outside observation deck, as there is at the Space Needle. We also did Top of the Rock, and if you are choosing between them, we would recommend you do One World Observatory.

Top of the world. . Not cheap but worth it. Lines move quickly. Great views and overall worth the crowds. Good selection of food, again not inexpensive. Take your time and enjoy. They do try to sell you on pictures and iPad view experience, did not personally see the need.

Biggest but not the best.. The Observatory is at the top of the Freedom Tower, the tallest structure in the western hemisphere. But for me it isn't the best view in the borough.On the plus side, there were negligible queues at 9.30am on an October midweek morning. You won't get a better view of the Statue of Liberty unless you take a helicopter. The free wi-fi had a strong signal, although it was relatively quiet when we visited.On the negative, the viewing areas are entirely encapsulated by glass. On the bright morning we were there, that created unwelcome reflections on photos. The open air elements of Top of the Rock and the Empire State are distinctly better in this regard.Also, there was nowhere to sit between views, not even in the coffee shop (12USD for a tea and cappuccino both served in paper cups). Again, Top of the Rock beats this.There is no guidance on what landmarks are where - unless you rent a special iPad at 15USD. We didn't, so can't vouch for value.
Best lift ever. I wont ruin it for you but I thoroughly enjoyed the lift up to the top, great experience. We also had the most amazing sunset whilst we were up there... I didnt want to come down .

Great view with one or two issues. First time visit to One WTO, we didn't pre book our tickets but found there to be no queue when we arrived at about 10:30am on a weekday.The lift up is fast and interesting (I won't spoil it) and the intro video/skyline reveal was impressive (again, no spoilers) and once you get to the viewing deck, the views can be amazing if the weather is right. Don't use flash when taking photos, it does nothing apart from hit the glass and ruin your shots.You can roam around the two floors and spend as much time as you like up there, there is also a cafe (didn't use) and a gift shop.What I didn't like:No open air platform, all indoors, much prefer the Rockefeller inside/outside viewing decks.Sales pitch, once getting out of the lift and you have watched the intro video staff try to get you to pay $15 (I think) to rent an ipad which points out all the landmarks which you can see from the observation deck. Don't get me wrong, it's not a hard sell but this could be done down at the bottom when you pay for the tickets. Would I visit again ? Probably not, unless I was going with friends who had never been before.

A surprise in store ... and a bit disappointing. Book tickets in advance - makes life so much easier but make sure you have downloaded/printed them first as wi-fi is a bit slow.There is a surprise at the start which is worth the wait, and after that the views are great. The fact there is a coffee area/cafe helps on cold days.The only disappointment is taking photos .... we were there on a day which was both sunny and cloudy .... the reflections on the windows is terrible .... if you want to take a photo of the Memorial pools - best of luck. OWO should cover the windows with a non reflective film.
This is a must see sight of New New. The Trade centre and tribute centre is a must visit. A sad and traumatic time for New York to be remembered by evferyone

Best view in All of New York City. Definitely worth the cost of a ticket for a ride to the top of the One World Observatory. At the top there's an incredible 360-degree view of the Big Apple. The elevator ride up is totally fascinating! As you make the super fast 47 second ascent to the top, the elevator walls give you a panoramic view of the New York skyline from the year 1500 to today. Watch as buildings rise from the ground up!
WTC trip. Excellent although the weather prevented us from seeing very much. The displays and elevator ride in both directions were very educational.

SECOND VISIT TO ONE WORLD OBSERVATORY. You will observe the formation of New York City in the digital wall during the 7 sec elevator ride to 102nd floor. And the presentation on top and the view from there is mind boggling! Every person visiting New York should not miss this experience. Please book your tickets in advance. After this you can visit the 911 memorial next to World One. You can have refreshments at the top floor eatery with a view of New York City.

Rain check disappointment. I purchased tickets online for a special outing for a friend's birthday. On the day of our scheduled visit, my friend was ill and unable to come. In addition, the day was quite cloudy - the top of the observatory was not visible from the street. I checked the website to see if I could reschedule our visit and the site said explicitly "There are no refunds or rain checks for your tickets – tickets must be used on the date/time listed on the ticket."Thinking that it was better to use the tickets, rather than just waste the money (we paid $134 for standard admission), we went without my friend. When we got there, it looked like same-day tickets were being sold at a discount, and as we were entering we were told that we could, in fact, change our tickets for another day. Given the effort we'd made to get there, we really didn't have a choice but to stick to our plan, but we felt that we'd been ripped off.As a New Yorker, the WTC site has deep meaning, but I am disappointed in our experience. Buyer beware.
Only my third choice .... As I said before: Empire State and the Rock top it ... but the 9/11 Memorial at it's feet makes it a must
Amazing. What a view the best in New York in my opinion I would highly recommend a visit and the lift on the way up is fantastic.

Breathtaking views, wonderful experience high above Manhattan's streets!. We recently took out-of-town guests to One World Observatory. (It was a first-time visit for us, too.) And it was fabulous! Part Disney ride, part unique New York experience, the observatory is an absolute must for tourists and New Yorkers alike. I won't give spoilers here, but I will say that there is a surprise for visitors once they arrive at the observation level after a fun elevator ride that gives one a sort of "time lapse" view of Manhattan from prehistoric days to the 21st century. Aside from the star of the show -- the amazing views in all directions -- there is shopping, food and drink available up top. There is a quick-eats cafe as well as an honest to goodness sit down restaurant (with a bar/liquor license). We had a proper meal in the restaurant, and it was great. Not only did we have unparalleled views up and down the Hudson River and the harbor, but the food was sophisticated and quite good (not the norm for tourist attraction eateries). The fare is on the expensive side, of course, but then this is not a budget site in the first place. A tip: If avoiding long lines and controlling the timing of your visit are important to you, purchase timed tickets online in advance. We did that, and we were glad to know we could do other sightseeing (we went to the 9/11 Museum just before our visit) right up to the entry time on our tickets, because we would not have to stand in long queues just to purchase tickets to the Observatory. In any event, do go. It's a wonderful way to spend time in lower Manhattan, especially on a clear day!

The Highest views in New York. While visiting the 911 memorial museum, we decided to visit the One World Observatory which starts with an elevator ride that shows the same view of New York City via time lapse for 400+ years. The height of the observatory is 1200 feet, the tallest building currently in New York. Their presentations were very unique and educational. You can spend all day viewing the 360 degrees of New York and New Jersey. You can rent an iPad which syncs with the live views from the observatory and identifies and describes the landmarks. This was a spectacular exhibit.

Experience THE VIEW!. Wonderful view of NYC, Queens, NJ plus...then top it off with drinks and appetizers at the restaurant with magnificent views of it all too...if you haven't been, you don't know what you are missing out!!! Unbelievable time well spent.

It almost has a theme park atmosphere... Of course, people go to the top of one world trade center for the dramatic views. We got our tickets in advance which gives you a specific time to enter and so there was no long line on the day we went on October 1st. I suspect that the lines can be quite long during high season and waiting online to buy tickets would only add to the time you have to wait to go up. You have to pass security which is much like airport security(belts off, walking through a metal detector, bags, phones placed ina bi to be screened, etc) Once you pass security you essentially go through what looks like an underground tunnel that gives you video information about the people involved in the building of one world trade center. You see another short intro movie and then go to the elevators. 3 sides of the elevators are TV like screen that show you how the NY skyline has changed over the last 500 years. The elevator ride to the observatory is fast so its 500 years in 60 seconds. When the doors open you are at the upper level of the observatory(101st floor) . Here there are restaurants and gift shop. You can walk down one flight to the 100th floor and here is where you have a 360 degree view of the skyline. You can rent an IPAD that essentially will tell you what your looking at when you point it out the window. helpful but pricey at 15 dollars. If you have been to the empire State Building or the original towers observatory you get the feeling that this is more touristy. However, it is well done and for someone who has never been up that high, it is set up to give you a thrilling experience. It was foggy on my day and the views were limited. I would bring binoculars....
Brilliant!. We had to queue for awhile but it was well worth the wait! The views are stunning, you can see from every corner. It is a must see for anyone!

Spectacular!!. We visited the Centre using our Sunset Flex ticket. This allowed us to visit anytime between 4 & 7.15. We went around 6 to make sure we saw the city in the daylight and also to see the city lights at night. From the elevator lift, where you see the city changing around you over the centuries to the build up before you actually get to the observation level it is a breathtaking experience. The view of the city, and beyond, from the observatory needs to be seen to be believed. Don't miss it!

View from floor 102 and picture taken. We visited this building last month.It is quiet new and in order to get to the entrance you have to walk through a shopping area.The building is quiet high.We received a gift card for Century 21 store.

A view worth the cost of the ticket. This was at the top of my NYC to-do list (pun intended). It was worth every penny. Pictures would have come out better if the grates were not directly under the windows, they create a reflection. The elevator ride up and down were fantastic, the ride down feels like riding the "wonkavader."

Excellent. While in the area for the day, we went to the statue, Ellis island, 9-11 Memorial and then the One World Observatory..this was the highlight of the day. The elevator is amazing...some of the fastest in the world. The views are incredible and just the height of the building itself is incredible! My husband says it's like giving the "finger" to the terrorist that tried to destroy us. Yes it's pricey but it was worth it. We spent 2-3 hours previously at the 9-11 museum, and while it fulfills more of our understanding of that fateful day ...it was nice to end the day on an uplifting high note by visiting One World Observatory...we stayed till dark to try to get some night photos. The glare from the indoor back lighting is difficult. I held my camera right up to the glass to try to compensate and it seemed to help with city landscape shots.

Emotional. We were very lucky that we visited on a perfectly clear day & were able to see the curvature of the earth, incredible! I was grateful that we'd visited the location the day before (when I completely broke down as we rounded the corner to the 2 pools). You need to be ready for this. I still fought back tears going to the observatory, the films as you go in of the people who worked on the project are both moving & inspiring. They make you proud of America (& I'm from the UK)!No more spoilers, just to say that, yes, it's quite a costly treat but it is absolutely worth every single one of your hard earned dollars.Well done New York.

Moving. I saw this 1 yr. ago & it is still memorable. I didn't like the wait time but, it was all worth it once I EXPERIENCED (& that is what happens) the walkways filled with photos/videos; leading up to the elevator (with videos) to the observatory level-which BLEW ME AWAY with emotion.

Awesome building. One of the highlights of the visit, the building is awesome. Inside is really well done out and the lift to the top an experience on its own. Up in the viewing area the sights are incredible too. Not to be missed, eating up there was expensive, but expected nothing else. Well done New York.Bill Beynon

Just OK. Over-priced for the experience.
