Although the animated display in the elevator on the way up was interesting, I would have like to have seen the view of the city while in the elevator, atleast on the way down. Especially because there was cloud cover on the day we went, so we couldn't see much from the observation floor but would have been able to see if there was a view from the elevator. There was really nothing else interesting on the observation floor, I was expecting more.

Unmissable. Unmissable, a fabulous experienceBook in advance to skip the queuesForget about the electronic guide it's not worth the extra chargeKeep your eyes open in the elevator good videosAll the way to the top in 45 seconds and you don't feel a thingA real surprise near the end

Amazing Views and Great Story. We arrived around 12pm and there were almost no lines which was surprising. We went to pay for the priority line and they said it wasn't necessary, a nice surprise. The elevator up is special and the views from the desk incredible. This is a must see experience!

Amazing views. The elevator ride is something to behold in its own right. Whilst taking you to the observation deck you observe and experience the growth and development of New York. This of course includes the building and then the disappearance of the Twin Towers. The view of Manhattan and beyond is amazing. Expensive but recommend.
Get there early. . An essential spot when visiting New York. Get there early to avoid the long queues. Views fabulous on a sunny day.

Amazing Architecture, Not Just the Tower!. No wonder this project took so longer! This is an architectural wonder for blocks! We can certainly be proud of our country springing back with this masterpiece in design. Everyone needs to experience this One World Trade in it's entirety.
W. O. W.. Thought the price to get there was pretty ridiculous. The view was amazing. Go right before sunset!!

Beautiful sunset. What an awesome view over New York. The lift was great loved the video such a good idea I won't say anymore about it don't want to spoil it for others. We went when the sun was setting what a stunning site would recommend.
An awesome building day and night time. Very impressive building from the outside, difficult to get a full camera shot. Nice area to visit. I believe the view from the top is amazing.
The best view of New York city. Booked my tickets in advance but think you could sort when you get there.a must see if you're in New York.

A trip to New York must include this place.. I regret not doing the twin towers, however I've made up for it by going up the one world observatory. We waited in line not for too long. The elevator up is an experience in itself. Of course the view is to die for. I even had a pretzel and coffee at the top. Beware of the street vendors below, although we did buy. $10 bag of 3 books with interesting photos and story. Price was bargained down at least 1/3. I'm not sure about buying fast track tickets from the vendors at higher price. We did wait line but not for too long. The whole visit was handled efficiently and professionally as you would expect from USA.
Amazing. The elevator gives a brief history of NY. Detailed tour guide gives one the first hand review. The view from the deck is truly astonishing.

A must see. A bit pricey but a must see. The elevator to the 102nd floor takes you there in seconds. The view is amazing. You are enclosed by glass panels but can see NY, NJ and Conn.Worth the price of the ticket.

Check the weather . Great attraction. Bought tickets 3 days in advance. Weather on day of visit resulted in zero visibility. Staff informed us before going up. Rental of tablet device was key in showing what we could not see. Elevator ride up and down was awesome.

Overpriced View. On a clear day the view is fabulous but the admission charge is high. You do not need to add on the ipad experience for an additional $15.No need to book in advance nor pay for the priority experience. We did not purchase tickets in advance and only ended up waiting about 10 minutes in line to purchase them the day we wanted to go. The elevator ride is quite an experience with a surround screen on 3 sides. Face the back as you enter. Seeing it once is enough.
Amazing Views - Be Ready. This is going to be short and sweet. The views are amazing. I included this with my visit to the 9/11 Memorial/Museum. The entire day was nothing less than amazing.

Great views. We visited here on a Sunday morning. Queue took 20 minutes to get in and it costs $37 each. The lifts to the observatory have screens all around which show the views as you go up. Once up top you first walk into a corridor where there is a short video presentation before the screens rise showing the actual view.After this you can walk around the 102 and 100 floors to take in the view. Great views of Staton Island etc. Personally I would have liked to see an open air observatory. There is also a restaurant and gift shop. It didn't seem too busy, but you do get some glare from the windows when taking photos. You can also hire ipads which give you virtual location and building names. These cost $15 to hire.Overall worth a visit, but my favorite is still top of the rock.

Be brave!. If, like me, you are not so good with heights, you may be wondering if this was really worth putting yourself through the anxiety to do, but believe me, it is!!! I hate heights and was really worried. There is one lift which speeds you to the top in under a minute. Your ears pop and you can feel the pressure changing but it is smooth. On arrival at the top you are shown a presentation and then the blinds raise and you get the most incredible view! I must admit that this was a knee knocking moment and I was concerned that I would be able to cope, but after a while it was fine and I am so pleased that I was brave enough to do it.We pre booked a day flex ticket which meant we could roll up at any time on the selected day, This was more expensive than the standard admission but we skipped all the queues and it meant that we were not pressured for time. We had walked over the Brooklyn Bridge from the Brooklyn side prior to this and the WTC was just a short walk from there.

Wow wow wow. Pre booked the observatory trip with priority access and had to wait no more than 5 mins to go up 102 floors to get the best views in New York. From the exciting lift ride up all those floors nothing prepares you for the spectacular views. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Fantastic views of NYC. Well organised attraction. Really enjoyed the 'lift' experience where they show a film detailing the development of New York. I'm not a great lover of heights, but I had no real issues here. The viewing deck is so wide that you can stand quite a way back and still enjoy the views, although I was able to go near the windows. I thought it a much better experience than the Empire State, but the latter has the history and is so iconic. There is a cafe and restaurant on the viewing deck.
First visit. Elevator ride up and more impressively down were one of the highlights of our visit. Views were spectacular, despite the weather being overcast.

A marvelous visit. We came with visitors from Spain to the observatory and then for dinner at One Dine. Every thing was fabulous, especially the elevator ride back down.I highly recommend this visit to everyone.

One World Observatory. When we visited New York 2 years ago they were still building at this site, so when we returned this time it was on our list of things to see and didn't disappoint. Views from this location are something that you can't miss. Definately a must see on your trip to New York.

Best view of the city (June 2015). Visited on the very first day that it opened to the public so really didn't know what to expect.We had a time allocation ticket but that meant absolutely nothing as they were running over two hours late and it was a bit of a free-for-all! This might have been teething problems as I say it was opening day. I don't want to spoil it too much but the lift to the top is amazing - very well constructed. The views are incredible- even though you are inside (rather than on the roof of a building like the Empire State) you can get right up close to the glass and look directly down - something that's difficult with other skyscrapers. There were a few interactive activities at the top but you probably won't need them. I'd love to go back late at night to see the view again

excellent views of NY. I preferred going to One world observatory tower rather than Empire State building during my recent(first) visit. This is 4th largest tower in the world and there are amazing views from 102/100th floor. the elevators takes you to top floor with in less than a min. One more reason for selecting this tower rather than Empire State Building is that ground 0 is next to it and we could visit it without much hassles.

More than the view review. Yes the view is amazing, even on a somewhat hazy day. It would be awesome to be able to see it on a clear blue sky day. My time in NYC was limited and I decided to go anyway. I had been struggling with the decision to buy timed tickets in advance. At $37 it was expensive enough. I didn't want to spend an additional $20 for priority tickets or $30 more for a flexible time. Just not worth it to me, as I was in no particular rush, but no one wants to waste time in lines. I arrived on a Tuesday around 1:30pm. There was a quick moving line to purchase tickets and it was not an issue at all. I waited maybe 15 minutes to enter the building. Before I got in line I purchased a bottle of water from the vendor on the corner. It was $2, I later discovered the café upstairs charged $ 5 for the same size bottle. Glad I picked it up outside. First you go through a security check point. It was quick and not an issue. An attendant then asks how many people in your party, before assigning you to an elevator. I was one of the last people to fit into the elevator. It was pretty packed with about 20 or so people. You are instructed to go in and face forward, with the elevator door closing behind you. I wish I had known that there would be a video being shown only on one back wall. I'm on the small side and could not see ANY of the NYC through the years video, over the heads of all the people in front of me. I did see above their heads the sky and years quickly rolling by. If you are small or have children, make sure to ask to wait for the next elevator rather than get in the back of 20 people and not be able to see anything. Really surprising with all the technological wiz going on, they could not have the video on more than one wall in the elevator. The ride is lightening fast and you don't realize how quick you are on the 102 floor. When you get off there is a long wall with a rail. They ask people as they get off the elevator to either move left or right and stand along the rail. When our elevator arrived all the spaces directly against the rail had people standing there. Again you had to cue up in back of them. Once again there is a video that I had trouble seeing much of because I was in back of taller people. The best spot to view the video is in the center, not to the right or left. At the end of the short video, a screen goes up and you get your first glimpse of the view. The screen quickly drops and you are encouraged to move to the observation floor 2 floors down.  On your way there you are ushered into the up-sell room where they do a demonstration of the $15 iPad rental. Then ushered into a photo op area. If you want, you can just keep walking and avoid both the iPad demo and the photo op. Unless you are interested in either there's no reason to stand and wait. You finally arrive at the observation 360* floor. The views really are incredible. I liked that you could spend as much time as you wanted, wherever you wanted on this floor. Pictures taken from the windows were very disappointing because of a predominate glare/ window reflection. It was not too crowded and I was able to get up against the windows and see the views from every vantage point. There is a café/bar on this floor as well. I walked through and the food looked good but I did not purchase anything. I'm not sure it's worth the premium price you would pay to eat there. I spent about 1 hour enjoying the view before descending and heading over to the 9/11 memorial. Overall well worth going. Possibly if it was a weekend or a holiday it would be worth getting the premium/flex/pre purchase pass. For mid afternoon, mid week, it was fine to go without advance tickets. I'm glad I didn't buy them ahead, as you need to account for weather conditions, when forecasts are notoriously inaccurate even a day or two out. I also would have had to adjust my schedule if I pre purchased for a specific time. I arrived at the OWO much earlier than I anticipated and earlier than I was thinking of purchasing a timed ticket. It's well worth going to, but use the tips to get the most out of the visit.

as an old New Yorker, visiting the City again, this is a special place. worth every penny..
educational, great views but miss the windows on the world in the old one world trade.
The best view of the city. If you want to see the view of New York go here instead of the Statue of Liberty or the Empire State Building

WOW !. Don't know how to describe this "adventure" but it is something that needs to be on your bucket list and something that truly cannot be put into words or pictures ... This can only be experienced ... The view, the feeling, the elevator ride up and down ... Just WOW
A must visit. This was one of the most amazing experiences. We went to the top level in no time. The lifts gives a panoramic feel. The view was stunning.

At the top of the beautiful Freedom Tower.. There is a wonderful view from the top of the tower. It is not included in the New York city pass but they do give a bit of a discount. Well worth the cost for the views! There is a bar and restaurant too.

Thrilling experience with an excellent aerial view from top. One World Observatory provides a thrilling experience of reaching 100 plus floors in a jiffy on the lift without even having a feel of the fast climb up.The city view from the top is exhilarating.A good experience not to be missed.

102 Stories Up!. This is a fantastic attraction. It's one of the must see attractions in NYC, probably only surpassed by the 9/11 museum in terms of "must-see-ness". The cost for a ticket is about $35-$40, depending on what time you go up. It may seem expensive, but it's totally worth it. I would recommend going at one of the earlier prime times that are available. By doing this, you will get some good daytime and sunset photos before it gets dark. One thing to note though is that a lot of people come at the prime time, so it can be difficult to get good views and photos while it's at it's peak time. What I noticed is that everyone that shows up around the same time tend to leave at the same time. This results in a huge line for the elevator. I would recommend rather than waiting in that line, going up above to eat a pretzel or something and wait for everyone to leave. By doing this, you'll have a much easier time getting good nighttime views and photos. Rather than having to maneuver through 3 or 4 rows of people, you can just walk up to the window. The downside to doing this is that you'll end up spending a lot of time there. The views are fantastic, especially at night.

An Experience to Remember. Had a few hours between business meetings and experienced this fantastic structure. It makes a statement that as Americans we will not give up and it shows with this building. A must if you visit and suggest you make reservations on line so there is no wait. A great view of the City.

Great for views, awful for photography. The building and surrounding area is stunning and it's certainly worth a visit.The trip to the observation floors costs $37 and the 360 view is fantastic, especially the view uptown. The video screens in the lift showing Manhattan through the ages is also very good.Unfortunately it isn't a great place for photos. Being fully behind glass means there's always a reflection, which is worse at night making a low light shot almost impossible. Furthermore, only two windows look directly uptown meaning a queue forms at those spots.It is really a great view and a fantastic place to visit. But compared to Top of the Rock for photography, given it offers rooftop views rather than behind glass, it's just not that good.

A must see. The ride in the elevator to 102nd floor takes less than 30 seconds, very smooth ride. The view is spectacular as your walk around and clouds were not far above. This is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. If you have at least an hour, this is a must see.

Absolutely Unparalleled Views!. A bit of nostalgia you are welcome to skip over...My first trip to NYC was in 1987, when I was 21. I was mesmerized by the city and its scale - and on that first trip, I visited BOTH of the Twin Towers: the observation deck in the south tower and Windows On The World for Sunday brunch. I am truly grateful that the site has been turned into a memorial with a museum that is a must-do while you are there.I HIGHLY recommend that you purchase tickets online before going - and the VIP pass is like a fast-pass at Disneyland - you go in any time near your reservation time. The elevators going up (and there are multiple) become a 3-D/360 experience of the growth of New York over the years. You are entertained whilst literally being on the smoothest elevator in the world!That spirit of "awe" and "larger-than-life" I experienced in the old WTC buildings so long ago was completely re-awakened on this trip - the view is simply beyond belief. The windows go entirely around 360 degrees, so the entire area is completely unobstructed (minus the core of the building). You arrive on the 102nd floor, and descend two floors as you enter the observation area. An iPad rental is available that matches what you see with the name of the buildings - we didn't purchase this option, as $15 seemed a bit much; however, if you want that option, it is there and available in multiple languages.We ended our multiple-photo day with a drink in the bar. That will be reviewed separately; it is recommended!The ONLY negative I have to say involves a color choice: white trim at the base of the floor air conditioning vents. There is a cute row of Manhattan-skyline buildings cut out of wood to discourage anyone from sitting on the venting - and that I'm more than fine with - it's the bright white color that is the problem: it reflects TERRIBLY when trying to look down to the base of the building. I wanted a picture of the site from above, but the glare is almost too much. A darker color would cut the glare down dramatically.

Amazing. What an amazing place to visit, the views were well worth going up to the top, no waiting around for the elevator, everything was well organised! The surprise once you reach the top is great!
Lovely. The visit to this incredible and unique building was very impressive. Friendly stuff, views were unreal.

Great Views. We visited about 9.30 a.m. There were no queues. We went in the lift and saw pictures on the screen. Great. Then onto at the observation deck. The views were stunning. We had a screen which told us all about the various buildings and landmarks. A great morn ing out.
On a clear day you can see for ever. This is a must see, but do it on a clear day. We did it in July. There was not a cloud in the sky. The view was breath taking 360 degrees
Futuristic. Like being in the clouds. Panoramic view. Fast tricked out elevators show the city starting in 1925 to the best of my recollection. Great Photo spot. Food bar with seats with view.

One world observatory. Very interesting and clever the way you go up in high speed lift (101 floors in 60 seconds) - you don't realise it as the lift walls have a projected peaceful woodland scene which opens up when you reach the top!!Views are amazing with lots of photo opportunities. Gift shop and cafe expensive as you would expect.

One of the greatest experiences in NY. Not to miss when in NY.This is not just a siteseeing thing, its an experience. From the moment you walk in untill you exit, its a true story fabously well told. The elevator ride up and down is amazing, the videowall, the moment you walk to the observation deck - breathtaking. Worth spending minimum of 2 hours. It shows you so much and gives you the perspective of the NY area that is unprecedented. Strong recommendation for everyone visiting.

Great Panoramic views of greater New York . This building is a fitting replacement to the WTC towers. The building facade &interior are all magnificent. The view from the observation tower reminds one of the old song saying -on a clear day you can see forever! The twisted structure to minimum sway shows the clever design. We had a fabulous visit to the whole complex. Very impressed with the oculusbut most of all the tower.

NY Has Risen . If you ever saw NY's Twin Towers, then saw them gone, you must return to be inspired. 1 WTC makes you proud to be American. Visit the tower, and the 9/11 museum. You owe it to yourself!
Great View. Went to One World Observatory and was amazed at the 360* views of the New York area. We even ate a sandwich up there and it was excellent. A must for a trip to NYC.

A great location to see NY. After a great visit to the 9/11 memorial, we visited the one world observatory. The weather was reasonable and we were able to get a great view of the NY skyline. Would not have missed this on our visit to NY.

Wow. After visiting the 9/11 memorial we decided on the trip up the tower to visit the One World Observatory. What a good decision - breathtaking views and not a ridiculous cost. Possibly a once in a lifetime experience and highly recommended

Great view from the top of NYC!. Great views of Manhattan from the tallest building of NYC!I would strongly recommend to reserve your spots online in order to avoid queues ;)Shame that they don't have any outdoorr terrace, but the view is juyt amazing, anyway !

Slightly disappointed. When we visited one world observatory I could stop remembering when I had visited Observation deck of World Tower. The views are awesome however, there is not much info to go with. We rented $15 info guide tablet, that was piece of junk. It would not lineup with the skyline. In the world trade center each window had a white outline of the skyline pointing out building and land marks of interest. One world has nothing. The people there are also do not have information. When we asked for information brochure they told us they had run out of those for weeks.

Definitely worth a look!! . You just have to do this while in New York. The view is breath taking. I actually shed a tear when I first say it!! (haha I know I know) We went on a Tuesday afternoon and there was no wait at all. $37 for adults. I liked it because you could just pop up there quick if you have less than an hour to kill. Or you could spend a few hours there and rent this iPad thing of the skyline ($15). You hold it up to the skyline and it will actually point out the buildings and tell more info about them. There's also a cafeteria to eat at and souvenirs etc. It's just a must do!
visited Ground Zero Memorial and visited observatory. First class; definitely reccommend purchasing tickets in advance and using preferred pass to avoid a long line wait. Good restaurant at the top.
Amazing experience. The One observatory is simply amazing. You can see all the City from a 360º window. There are some expositions on top, a cafeteria and a nice enviroment.
Beautiful, Sweeping Views. We loved the observatory. It was amazing to see the whole city laid out in front of you. My 2 year old daughter loved the elevator ride and looking out the windows!
st paddys week. one of the trips on our sightseeing trips they do every thing very good and make it all easy to understand

A MUST See. This observatory is incredible and is a required stop if you're in NYC. The facility is extremely well done and the view from the observatory is like no other. If you can, stop in the bar and enjoy one of the ONE wines. The staff is very friendly and the elevator ride to the top is amazing! A MUST See!!

Wonderfully restored One World Observatory. The One World Observatory is a great toursist attraction. Since it is now the tallest building in New York, it has the most wonderful views of New York city on a clear day. The ride in the elevator up shows you New York city over the years and how it has evolved and also the construction of the One World Observatory. As you reach the top, there is another beautiful video presentation on New York city.

See forever. We spent and hour an a half enjoying the 360 degree view. Spectacular! Go on Century 21's website before you go and get a big discount on tickets. Don't forget to visit the Oculus as well. What an amazing transformation this entire World Trade Center area has undergone.

Fantastic. Although not a fan of heights this is something I had to do and I wasn't disappointed!!! The views from the top are superb (although I didn't go to near the windows!!) The organisation and the way you get to the viewing level is brilliant and I would urge everyone visiting NYC to visit here - you wont be disappointed!

This is a 'must-do' activity when visiting NYC. Be prepared for large crowds but it is worth the experience and the view. We bought the VIP tickets and they were worth every penny to bypass the lines. You must do this and then the 9/11 museum afterwards. Allow 30-40 minutes for the observatory, but a minimum of 2hrs at the 9/11 memorial. The memorial could easily take longer and is worth a longer stay, so allow flexibility in your schedule (we did not and wish we would have).
Beautifully done and worth every penny. The elevator ride up was just amazing watching a video and once on the top it all was very well put together an the views were spectacular
very good. enjoyed this, been a few years trying to get back to NYC to visit this and the 911 memorial, both excellent. I thin the pricing is high but on par with Empire State and Top of the Rock.

Amazing view. This tall building is worth a visit. It's a bit expensive but it's worth it. You get an attraction when going to the top. The view is splendid and the floor is spacious so there is plenty space to enjoy the view.

A must on your to do list in New York. An amazing experience spectular views but at the same time an over whelming feeling of the tragedy that occurred there 15 years ago.Give yourself plenty of time as there is always a long line of people queuing to buy tickets.We bought ours with the authentic ticket sellers outside who will give you a good deal if you buy for another attraction in New York also it saves you for queuing as u can walk straight in pass the Q.Eat also before you go cafe & bar very expensive inside it cost me over $20 for a toastie,fruit juice & a small snack bar. The tour is very well run & an experience you will treasure always.I won't give to much away but the lifts to the top are awesome.

The best elevator ride of our life. It's not just the 360 degree view from the Observatory and not just the breath-taking introduction on the 102nd level to what you'd see but the fastest ride to the observatory while the history of the city is shown and the higher and higher elevation we reach are indicated, all in less than 60 seconds, that makes the visit unforgettable.If you are pressed by time don't regret to spend the extra money for priority ticket that helps you jump the line at the entrance and at the elevators.

Definitely worth doing. Would recommend booking on line as it saves standing in the queue, and it is cheaper, without doing a spoiler, when going up in the lift look around, the opening show is spectacular and the views are stupendous.

A truly special place. A truly special experience visiting the place that changed our future. The two large memorial are set in the foot prints on the twin tower buildings. The names of the people that died that day are beautifully carved in the surround of the pools that have water cascading down them. Even though I didn't know any of the people personally, it was still moving to read their names and remember what happened on that dreadful day.

Beautiful views. I enjoyed the views, the stories, and history shared by the tour guides. Breathtaking views and great pics. Elevator ride was amazingly fast (ears popping, dizzy)...l believe we reached 100 floors in a minute or so.

A little expensive but was an amazing experience.. I personally felt this was a little expensive pricing for four was over 100.00 just for the observatory. Then of course if you want any add ons they hit you with fees for those as well like $15 dollar rental for an iPad to tell you what you are looking at but aside from that everyone should see this at least once. The view was amazing and even though you can be done in as few as 10 minutes its still something I am glad I took my kids to go see. Overall it's a yes its a nice experience but to me it was expensive.

Breathtakingly beautiful . If your ever in New York is definitely go up this tower as your then looking down towards the Empire State Building and the Rockefeller. The views are beyond stunning, I could of spent all day looking out over New York City! The facilities were great and the staff were friendly and offered help if needed. I would 100% recommend and will be revisiting again in the future.

GREAT VIEWS. You can literally see all 5 boroughs from the top of the Freedom Tower. It's so high up it makes the Statute of Liberty look unusually small. Elevator ride is an amazing virtual experience, not to mention it goes up 102 floors in about 45 seconds!! Tips: Buy your ticket online, save $3 and avoid having to wait on two lines instead of one; iPad experience is not necessary

Wonderful. They were still finishing work on the Tower but the tours are amazing.The elevators start the journey up with really quick graphics of New York lighting up all around you, was so good wish it had taken longer to get to the top. At the top there are more brilliant graphics then a quick sneaky peak at the skyline! You can then go to the viewing areas & can hire an interactive iPad which will tell you about all the tourist attractions you can see from the tower.Has a souvenir shop & nice reasonably priced cafe with all the views! Really loved it here.

Breathless. You absolutely have to visit One World Observatory. This state of the art building is just beautiful and a must for tourists as well as natives. Please be aware that like most public venues today there are metal detectors so please go without knives, guns and other unneeded metal. The elevators are an experience just great and the trip up as smooth and as fast as can be. Once you get to the first platform there is a person there relating all kinds of interesting facts to visitors. But lets face it the view is just beyond spectacular. There simply isn't a bad angle. New York is just beautiful from this elevation and you really see how awesome New York and New Jersey are. If you choose to do anything this is an awesome destination great for all ages. Please reconsider if you have a fear of height.

Awe-Inspiring. I remember my parents taking me to the World Trade Center observation deck in the mid-90's....now here I am 25 years later at the top of this building - a testament to the true American ingenuity and perseverance that defines our nation. The whole experience of walking towards the elevators, going up, and the 360 view from above is really well thought out and done - it will give you "the feels"! There is a nice restaurant, gift shop, and restrooms as well. The pictures are endless. Book online in advance and google promotion codes - I saved about $8 on an adult weekday ticket. I arrived around 10:30 am on a Monday and it wasn't busy. But on the way down, I started to see the line form.
So Sad. I visited here because you should, however I found it very emotional and so sad for all of those who so unjustly lost their lives that September day

Firemen don't get a discount ! . So, you would think, hmmm the place, the vicinity, where so many firefighters lost their lives trying to save others, would offer some type of discount to the men who now wear the uniform! but nope ! My bf ( who is FDNY firefighter ) decided to head there on Sept 10th, not looking for a free ticket but maybe a discount off of the 75.00( total for two ) price to head up and sure enough we were told that only military gets the discount . God bless the troops but I'm sure if their were any issues in that building where they needed my boyfriend to go put out a flame they would not charge him to go up then ! You should be ashamed !

Trip with my mom . It was Breathtaking you can not go without crying and having emotions while watching the slide show was an awesome experience and I would tell everyone who goes to New York they need to go experience it .

Amazing !! . A Phoenix truly rises from the ashes with OWO.From start to finish the experience is done so well,with interesting and a little emotional (but in a good way) surprises along the way.Really don't want to spoil it for anyone,so for your own "WOW" moments of OWO - just go !.
A must See in New York. It is very well organized getting to the top floor and of course the views from everywhere are amazing, especially on a clear day.

Great view. We probably made the mistake of doing the One World Tower after already having a Chopper flight around Manhattan earlier that morning. People say you cant beat the view(well a chopper out does it easily) and it was great but I recommend Top Of The Rock as a better all round view of Manhattan.

24 Hour visit . If you only have a short time in NY then this is a must do. Whilst you can pre book we only waited 20 minutes to buy tickets on the day. Also bought a visual iPad to help view the 360 views - well worth it.Helped to see key points to visit whilst in NY for a short time $15 well spent . Amazing views and history shared via IPad.

Great views. I was surprised that I didn't have a sense of being that high up when viewing the sites. It was a bit overcast when we visited which was almost better as we did not get our own reflection in the glass when taking photos.

Clever concept and a positive experience. Having visited the 9/11 memorial a few times the first time I visited I left feeling angry, that after this tragedy a further 900,000 civilians were killed in attacks around the world and majority were from US combat. And there was no mention of this in the memorial. The second time the museum was open I gave it a go (it was beautifully done but still no mention of the aftermath) it was very confronting and I left feeling sad. This time I went to the one world observatory and loved it! It really is sleek and more about a fresh start and if you are new to NYC do this in your first day it will help you with your bearings plus there are shows with interesting and relevant history to your stay.

DON'T MISS IT!. This was BY FAR the highlight of our trip. On our last trip we went to the top of the Empire State Building which was awesome but this put it to shame! From the moment we walked through the door.. everyone was friendly and everything was so well organized and put together. I decided to wait til we got there to purchase tickets because I wasn't sure what time we would get there. Once there, instead of waiting in line, I purchased tickets on my phone and went straight through. The Sky Pod elevators were amazing and took us to the top in 60 seconds. The first view of the skyline from the top took our breath away. It was such an incredible presentation and experience. We could've stayed up there all day just looking out. I recommend to get pictures without the glare of the glass to hold your phone right against the glass. My Mom who is very afraid of heights and almost chickened out when we got in the elevator LOVED it and didn't want to leave. If you're on the fence about going... do it! You won't be disappointed!

Good Views, But a Complete Ripoff with Sales Pressure. Can't beat the views, but the experience leaves a lot to be desired. Almost $50 a person to get in, then you're pressured into buy your photos that you have to stand there and take, then you are pressured into renting an iPad for $15 per person so you can understand what you're looking at. All that before you even get to see anything. For $50 the iPad should have been included. Don't even think about getting thirsty or hungry. We bought a Gatorade for $7.00!!!!! Stupid expensive . . . .

All the Better to See New York With. Couldn't let this visit to New York pass without taking the opportunity to visit yet another observation point having already been to the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building). This is a great new attraction. The amazing production that went into the photos and video at both the (under)ground level and following the elevator trip sets visitors up for the viewing spectacle to follow. If you haven't been yet, you should go.

Moving and Emotional!. We travelled to NYC specifically to see the Memorial, Museum and Observatory. These places are a MUST SEE for all. It is a fantastic way honor those lost on 911as well as show off New York at it's finest. We had a crystal clear day with the Forever Views they boast. Having lived in the city for many years, it was fun to see allyou knew from a totally different perspective. WELL DONE NY! We were in awe

360 degree view of the city. This is a wonderful way to see the entire city from above. The building is beautiful and well designed for large crowds. Buy the tickets in advance and pay extra for the "jump the line" tickets - well worth it.

Wow!. Very, very impressive. My first visit since they opened, even the elevator ride to the Observatory was cool. The short presentation on arrival with the surprise ending had everyone applauding. We had lunch at the restaurant, the food was as great as the views. I will definitely return again on my next trip!

Once in a Lifetime. Having travelled to New York in 1998 and visited the Top of the World observatory, we felt compelled to visit One World. Visiting with time at a premium, we opted to purchase Day Flex tickets at $67 each in advance. Whilst this did save us a little time, we saw no lines in the late afternoon and felt a little cross that we had paid so much. That's the gamble! I think if we were in New York again, we would probably see how long the lines were and if not too long, pay there and then. Lesson learnt!

INCREDIBLE!. As a New Yorker, I am reluctant to do "touristy" activities but I had family visiting who had never been to NYC so I had to suck it up. We decided on walking thru the 9/11 memorial and then going up to the observation deck at One World Trade. I purchased tickets ahead of time (which I highly recommend). We did not have a wait... we went right in. From the elevator ride to the 360 degree views... the whole experience is INCREDIBLE! Any one who lived here or is visiting here must visit the observatory!

Excellent visit. We visited back in February when it was very cold and the day we had booked to go to the top it was snowing. The staff were very friendly and explained to us that there would be nothing to see due to the weather conditions and asked us when we would like to rebook our trip for. This was excellent they could have just let us go to the top or not accommodate us in rebooking. We rebooked for the next day and went to the top. The lift (elevator) was excellent and really clever. The rest is meant to be a surprise. The views are excellent you really can see for miles around and that wasn't even on the clearest day, once you are up at the top there is plenty to do and look at and staff to talk you through things. They do offer you iPads which you can use to work out where things are but it's for a charge and with the staff and other people you can pretty quickly work out what is where. The lift back down is again very clever and different to the way up. The only thing about the view is of course you can't see the building you are in itself! The rest is spectacular!

Very good attraction. It's worthy to pay for this attraction, but... Maybe it's because I've visited CN Tower in Toronto couple of days before this one, One world observatory cannot get 5 stars from me. Lift experience was great both ways and videoshow at the top was amazing. I can recommend you to go there.

A must see!. The World Trade Center is a must see when visiting NYC. You should buy your tickets in advance or couple with the museum ticket, it will be a better value than purchasing that day, plus you get right in. It is amazing how NY turned this tragedy into a tourist attraction, but it is worth the money to look out from that far above. The elevator rides up and down provide extremely informative and interesting information. You can get a bite to eat or a cocktail on the top but be prepared to pay! We ordered two bloody Mary's which were $17/each but after tax and automatics 18% gratuity, it was almost $50! Rather ridiculous, but, we were on vacation AND just chalked it up to live and learn!

Can't beat the view!. What a view from the 100-102 floors of One World Trade Center. We were lucky that it was a clear day. You can rent an iPad for $15 that tells you what all the major buildings and landmarks in view are. After what it costs to get in, you might as well spend the additional $15 on the iPad. We had a six and eight-year-old with us and they really enjoyed it. Definitely worth getting to.

Breathtaking!!!. This just has to be the biggest must to include in your trip to New York! On a busy one -day schedule we took the time to get tickets (easily available online) and visit this spectacular attraction. Well worth it. Excellent organization and friendly, welcoming staff. Well done New York!!!!

Great Memorial. Remember seeing the live action on television back home of the tragedy unfolding, but to actually be here where the towers were is awesome!
Great tribute to the fallen, and a beautiful building, the lift is brilliant!
Though we had to queue to get in, the actual building itself wasn't overcrowded.
One to do if you are in New York.

State of the Art Observatory. There is no doubt that the One World Observatory embodies the latest in viewing platform technology, from its high speed lifts to its tablet viewing aids. But having visited the other major tall building attractions in NY over the years,I did not think the experience was sufficiently different to justify the high cost (over $30, before hiring the $15 tablet) . We were there just on sunset, which is an interesting time to view New York, but still only spent about an hour on the attraction.

Moving. The airport style security was something we had got used to on the trip. the elevator ride up was a show in itself (have your camera in hand!) With a little bit of history, you are then at the top of the building, amazing views over to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis island, I also managed a photo of the one memorial pool below. So sad to think why this building is here, but well done New York, you got up, brushed yourself off and got on with it.

Cool way to see New York . Being 100+ floors above New York City is quite an experience! It was a little cloudy on the day we went up but the view was still great. We were directly overlooking downtown Manhattan, the Brooklyn & Manhattan Bridges, and Jersey City. We also had great views of Brooklyn, the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and midtown Manhattan. Well worth the price of admission!

Wow!. Recommend, we combined a trip to 9/11 memorial and museum then headed up to the observatory which is across the street. Impressive views! We decided not to go to Statue of Liberty, but this is also close to Battery Park if you wanted to plan out a full day in this area.

Stunning!. Excellent place to view the city and surrounding, well, everything! The elevator ride was well done, the video "entry" was great also. Only thing I wish it had was an outdoor viewing platform. Taking pictures through the windows is tough - too much reflection. For that reason only, I think the Empire State Building is a bit better. See both and decide for yourself!
The sky is the limit. You need to go, it is incredible. I believed that after going to the Empire State it will not amaze me..... Wrong it is also a must for NYC

WONDERFUL INDEED !. A visit to NYC without a visit to ONE WORLD OBSERVATORY is not a visit at all , so don't even think about it just do it . The lines were snaked when I got there at 9.30 am but it moved really quick . Keep your eyes wide open when going up in the lift as the experience starts right there . The views are really different and real amazing from this end of the city ... I spent about 3 hours at the top which felt like 15 mins ....there is so much to See and ponder on . Only snag I found was there are no window opening gaps to take good pictures from. I personally feel it is a must visit and I will do it again when and if in NYC .Jenni ... Cape Town Sputh Africa

Unbelievable Sites. You must have a reservation. The cost of $35 per person is worth every penny and more. The ride up, in the elevator, is a historian's treat. Make sure you attentively watch each of the 4 walls in the elevator as you go up as it shows the actual time slice of growth of Manhattan over a 300 year period. The ride is only about 1.5 minutes so watch carefully it is incredible. Once at the top you have views 360 degrees, gift shops, restaurants, very nice rest rooms and videos of each aspect of the Observatory for all to see. The gift shop has a charm/necklace piece that sells for $49. It looks like pure gold studded with 4 diamonds and is guarenteed not to tarnish. It is in the shape of the WTC and worth every penny. A real looker. Have fun

An amazing accomplishment, and worth the trip. You are literally on top of the world when you get to the top, but the trip up is equally fascinating. From the bedrock left exposed while you wander to your elevator, and then the ride up which shows how the skyline has changed over the last century. The observation area is big enough that you don't have to be bothered by tourists. It's worth going twice, to experience during daylight and again at night.

Top of the world ma, top of the world. We bought advanced tickets through tripadvisor and it paid off. We saved a few dollars but we saved time on arrival. We got right on line for the tour, while others had to wait on line for the purchase , then get on the line for the tour. I call it a tour because it is much more than an observation. The elevator ride will blow you away. Get out your video cameras when the door shuts. After the ride, there is a short , historical video and then you go to the deck. I have been to the top of the twin towers, top of the rock and The Empire State building. Hands down, this was the best experience. It seems the best time to go is early Sunday morning. The crowds start around 1100am. This is well worth the money .
Well worth the visit!!. Great views and very interesting!! Very glad we paid the money, well worth the cost!! I think better than ther empire State.
Gorgeous Views. Very high up if you have a problem with heights. You can see everything. There is one section that shows what is going on 100 floors below. Interesting.

One world one word, WONDERFUL! . The presentation is akin to a theme park attraction. There is no need to pay extra for VIP at later visits (5 pm to closing ). The best time to go is an hour before sunset. It gives you the opportunity to see the city by day and watch the sunset. As the sun sets you see the city light up. Beautiful sky line. The bridges are spectacular. There is a variety and restaurant at the top. You can enjoy a glass of wine and either have dinner, by reservation only, or walk to dinner near by. Excellent attraction. A must do if you visit New York.

Different view of the skyline. We visited here after the ground zero memorial as they are not to each other. Again well managed and quick to get to the top. The views of the bay and the islands is excellent and completely different from Empire State etc. as you are at the tip of Manhattan Island. Worth a visit to get the views.

Incredible Technology and Views. The elevator ride with the history of the geography and development of New York was incredible, the views on the 102nd floor amazing. The IPAD for an extra $15 was okay but not amazing - but you are at a tourist attraction so what's another $15? I wouldn't recommend any of the higher priced tickets, we got the basic entrance ticket and were satisfied and didn't have any problems with seeing the sights and getting in timely.

Great Lower Manhattan Views. Bought the VIP tickets and skip the waiting in line outside and inside. VIP express tickets get you past the lines and in the elevator ASAP. Great Lower Manhattan Views. Good for tourists - but views from Rockefeller Center are far superior! OWO has an expresso bar and cafe on for a quick bite. Prices are reasonable.
Floor 201. WOW. I really didn't expect the whole experience, stunning views and totally worth the price. It's like being on an helicopter: observing the city from above makes it look so calm.

Nice views. The slogan is "See forever" and this is true. The elevator ride is fast so make sure you have your camera ready. When they reveal the view at the beginning it is a superb piece of showmanship and everyone clapped. The views are nice but finger marks all over the windows spoiled photography a bit. I went at 6 and stayed for the sunset and early evening. Very crowded at that time.

Amazing views. This is a must,it has amazing views and you only take 45secs to get to the 102 floor in a lift that shows a video how it went up through the month, yrs it was built brilliant. Cafe there so you can sit and take in the views,well recommend this.

Breath taking. If you are a student and have your student id bring to get a discount. This was a experience that was one never experienced prior, in going to top of many of the tall NYC buildings. Once you get in the elevator, it shows the elevator view from a construction crane and being build by levels (really cool). The once up at the top you are shown a video the is honestly probably the best part of the experience. Once up and able to see out it is breath taking to the views. No outdoor viewing FYI, but there are guides on each side that will explain what you are seeing and what is historical about that side of town. I found it worth the visit and experience and would refer it to anyone going to NYC.
Do NOT miss this!. All the multimedia presentations, the elevators, the views, the memorials, the whole experience, you just have to go.

Wow! What a view!. Having been to New York before and visiting the Empire State Building before, I decided to give One World a go. Not only was this observatory not open yet the last time I visited, I also wanted to see the New York skyline from a different angle. And wow, was I impressed by the whole experience. I prebooked my ticket and it didn't take long at all to get through ticket checks and security. There are about 8 lifts to take you up and that is an experience on it's own. All the walls of the lift consist of video screens and it shows an amazing video of you going up but at the same time it takes you through how the city developed over time. Amazing!When coming out of the lift there is a short video shown on a wall of blocks and then they lift the blocks to show you the skyline. It was AMAZING!There is no restriction to the amount of time you can stay up there and I decided to wait until sunset. I am so glad I did so as the whole feel of it changed when it got dark. I would really recommend booking your ticket for a time that's an hour before sunset and staying for 2 hours up there.

a celebration of modern design. The whole experience was uplifting. Views second to none. Ride in the lift special. One tip, good an hour before dark, then see the view in the light and then at night, both are special. It is quite expensive but probably worth it. At busy times you can book.

Holiday. Great views but incredibly expensive for what it is. The cafe's prices are extortionate, but needed something to eat and drink as well as having a rest. However, what you don't realise when queuing for food is that the eating area has no seats and you have to stand, which defeated our objective for taking the weight off our feet for a while.

Awesome view. We visited the center in the afternoon and although we paid extra to bypass the expected crowds it wasn't really necessary as it turned out on the day. The elevator experience was great but happened that quickly that I felt I hadn't got the total experience. The view is awesome from the observatory. New York at its greatest. I purchased one of the ipads but felt that I spent more time trying to get it to work so for me, I wouldn't bother again as the views are enough. Visited the café which had good snacks and drinks but was very disappointed as there were no chairs - in a café, come on! It was a bit pricey and obviously they don't want you to hang around. My husband and I are OAPs so managed to find a bench to sit on but there wasn't many. Even the windowsills had structures on to stop people sitting on them. The shop was very expensive but guess they have to help pay for the building. Overall a wonderful experience and well worth a visit.

Magnificent experience in an Incredible Building. A 'must see' experience if visiting New York - The building is an incredible achievement. It was great to stand up there and take in the fabulous views and think to yourself Freedom and Liberty will always triumph.

View from the top of Manhattan. Pre booked this trip ,but went in early although there was aqueue outside. This was a fabulous experience starting from the ride in the lift. The views are 360 and fantastic. Right by the museum of course so the two can be done in a day.

Amazing views... We visted the tower during the evening and its a great experience. Its well run apart from the guys trying to sell you a virtual guide as ipad for 15 dollars... the views are amazing and this is a must visit for NYC. The elevators taking you up and down are mega cool. I would keep about 1 hour for this visit, literally next to Ground Zero.
Oh that view!. What fun! We bought tickets ahead of time and were able to bypass the line. We visited on a nice clear day and the views were awesome!

Be patient with tourists to enjoy this!. There were plenty of people who were not polite, could not follow signage or instruction...but if you can get past that, the views are great, of course. The elevator ride is impressive and the shows are nice.

Amazing views. Fantastic experience from start to finish. Breathtaking views. Don't bother hiring an i pad when you get on the observation deck as you will spend too much time messing about with it instead of taking in the views. A must do for any tourist.

Great views!. This is a great thing to do in conjunction with a visit to the 911 museum.I would not recommend the priority ticket as it only pertains to the security line. You still have to wait in line for an elevator. We went first thing in the morning and had our tickets in hand in 10 minutes. Military get free admission.The views are breathtaking! The ride up is very fast and the elevators show the growth of Manhattan through the years which takes your mind off the time in the elevator.

A must see at sunset. We went at sunset a couple of weeks ago as lots of TA reviews say this is the best time - and we would certainly agree, the "red sky at night" was wonderful. We booked this about a month before to make sure we got the time we wanted and there was only a very short queue. The elevator ride is an experience in itself , albeit very short and the 360 views are amazing. The Empire State and Top of the Rock are good too but this was the best one for us, make sure you do the Ground Zero Memorial and Museum too.

A wonderful view!. The view is wonderful at the top with Windows looking over every aspect of New York. The lift is also an experience in itself as is the presentation just going out of the lift. The food from the cafe is delicious. On,y negative side is that the gift shop is far too expensive and You have to stand up in the cafe as there are no chairs!

Stunning views at a cost. As many reviewers state the views are second to none. There is nowhere else in the City that you can get the kind of panoramic views one can from OWO. It's not cheap, but one can occasionally score discounted tickets on partner sites like Groupon and Living Social. The staff are all very helpful and friendly. What negatively impacted the experience most were the other tourists! People sitting on the edge for extended periods obstructing the views for others. People setting up their tripods to time a perfect shot. In that sense, I would ask that OWO do a better job of people management to ensure everyone has the same experience. Sure there is plenty of space; however, there are spots that become more congested at certain times. For example, at sunset the entire west and north side of the observatory is mobbed. At night the north end becomes clogged because people want to take photos with Midtown in the background. Oh and skip the iPad experience. Your phone can do the same thing, and it'll save you $!5.

Bar with a view. My tip is to go up to the top about 7pm (in summer). You'll miss the tour hordes and once you have finished having a look around you can head to the bar on the top level for a quiet drink and one of the best views in the world as New York starts to sparkle. We'd still be there now but they shut !!
Crowded but worth it. Very nice way to see NYC. I enjoy it. Special and I would recommend it as something that is very American and New York.

One of the best expriences ever!. The moment you walk in... it's an experience! It's starts with the best elevator experience, a short movie, the view and than back to the elevator! Truly amazing experience! The only thing that would have been better if it had no glass because depending on the light, you get glare on the photos. Other than that, highly recommended!!! Loved it!!!

Breathtaking. Every single minute there was amazing, starting for the lift which is fascinating how they presented everything, the changes of the city but then when you are up there they show you another video finishing with the amazing views before get in the observatory. Once inside the views are breathtaking, can't stop talking pictures because every centimeter of the room it shows a different part of the city that never sleeps.We decided to go at 10 am FANTASTIC election, the day was sunny and we enjoyed the sightseeing.

Too Expensive But A Great View. I think the Empire State Building is a better value, although the elevator ride here gives you an unusual visual history of New York City on the way up. But they charge an arm and a leg. Also, they offer the rental of an iPad that helps you identify buildings while you're taking in the View. This feature costs WAY TOO MUCH and most people don't really care which building is which.
Fabulous Views.... the Ultimate . Get tix on line. Great experience on a clear day!! You can see everything. Beautiful for locals and tourists alike

Eye Opening. The views are incredible!!!! My favourite part of NY, the ground zero memorial right up to the observation deck! So much history and character, there's been a hell of a lot of effort put in to this so enjoy it, spend time there, look around and listen - it'll soon be your favourite place.

What a View!. Took the Walks Of New York tour with Allison. Our tour guide was not very knowledgable about her subject, many times being unable to answer our questions. Several people got lost due to her inability to manage a small group and her pace left many of the more physically able of the group scrambling to keep up with her. The best part of the tour was when we finally left the guide to go up to the observation area. We were able to acquire a table at the observation deck restaurant where we enjoyed a delightful meal and the views.

A bit underwhelmed. It's a nice view, but by no means as breath taking as the view from the Empire State Building. The whole experience is a bit underwhelming. Probably the most exciting bits where the video animations in the elevator going up and down. You can move around two floors to get your 360 view, however you are behind glass at all times which unfortunately means dirty finger prints and reflections will ruin each and every shot you might take. The 'dining experience' on the 101 floor is so overpriced, you wouldn't believe it. We paid $6.50 just for a bottle of iced tea. Is this really necessary? It would have been nice to sit down, have a drink and enjoy the view. Instead you have sky high prices and nowhere to sit. Been there done that. But I don't think I will be back.

Great views in a thought provoking area. Next to the 9/11 memorial. Tallest building in the USGreat views but my personal opinion is that it is better than the Empire State Building but not as good as the Observation deck that gives true 360 degree views of NYC.The aforementioned are on the NYC pass where as this is extraNo major queues and the lift ride is a good experience

Incredible. Incredible is the soul word to describe this experience. The elevator ride to the top took about 20 seconds and it didn't even feel like you were moving. Plus, it was digital and looked like a window, but wasn't. Honestly, I was a bit nervous about the height of the elevator ride, but it was very entertaining and cool! Once you arrive at the top, there is a projection show. Then, the wall OPEN in front of you and the magical city of New York lays before your eyes. This was an absolutely breathtaking experience. It was just incredible.

Fantastic views. We came here just after visiting the 9/11 Memorial. They did a wonderful job here, lots of room to get a 360° view of the New York City's grid, New Jersey, and the surrounding city. Highly recommended on a clear day..Best to Buy your tickets the day of just in case of foggy or bad weather.
Stagasourus. The mall is huge with wide open spaces and viewing platforms. The stores are pricey. I wish there had been a Macy's. A new hotel is coming. Wonderful views.

Amazing Experience. We paid extra for priority access and bypassed all lines. The experience is very well done from start to finish. Cocktail lounge was casual but well equipped for anything you cared to try. We timed the visit to get day, sunset and lights at night. Perfect way to see it. Only downside is the souvenir pricing was absurd.

Top of the city. This is definitely one of the best places to view the city. Empire State and 30 Rock are still the class of NYC skyline views but this place is great. Very modern and great place to be. They have great promos it is definitely worth the money. I hope they add it on the City Pass itinerary soon!

BreathTaking Views. The tour is a little pricey, but the views are amazing from the 103rd floor of the building. An elevator whisks you to the top in 60 seconds, where you are given a little history before being allowed to the actual observation area.

MUST VISIT. One World is the new and the tallest World Trade Center, it is right next to the Ground Zero Memorial, and is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. I am was heart warming experience, from the moment you enter the building and until you get off, its unbelievable. Must Visit and totally recommended.

Well worth a visit. Everyone said we should visit the Observatory - nicknamed the Freedom Tower and it was definitely worth it. The views are amazing. The elevator is the fastest I have experienced. The restaurant is also very nice and continue the viewing experience

Much better than Empire State. I've previously been up The Empire State and Top of the Rock but this is probably the best. The views are amazing, the building is amazing. It's clean, spacious and incredible modern. The evaluator ride to the 102 floor is an experience in itself.
Trip of a life time.. Fantastic views from the 102nd floor where you can see 4 different states. This attraction is a must see
Worth every penny. I would love to re-experience the absolutely fabulous "Image-Show" in the elevator on the way up and of cause the view. Expensive entry though.

Omg...the view! . My best friend and I went to see just what rose from the devastation on 9/11/01. I was apprehensive because I was in the Wall Street area when the towers fell. Much to my surprise "The Freedom Tower" is spectacular! As as soon as you walk to the elevators pictures of the rebuilding efforts projected on the walls. The elevators are lighting fast and you're on top of the building in a flash. Ooohhhh....and the view is a sight to behold. You can see forever! The city buildings are like gems dotted on the landscape. You can only see the Brooklyn bridge from that vantage point to see just exquisite it really is. And the Hudson and East River blend into one another like old friends that were glad to embrace once again. The staff was very friendly and the food is good, if you can sit still long enough to eat. There was plenty staff to explain what you were looking at or you could rent an iPad that explained what was what when you point the device at a specific site. This is a venue that you cannot miss if you are in New York. As a New Yorker I'm always amazed at the majesty of this of this city. If you come here you will do yourself a disservice of you don't visit this awesome landmark. Enjoy!

Do it!. Having been to NYC a few times now, we wanted to do this as it was new. We weren't disappointed. Firstly, buy your tickets prior to going online and if you can, get the priority ones which avoids the queue after security. The great thing about the view from here is that you get to see the southern part of Manhattan as well as over to Brooklyn, Liberty and New Jersey - things that you cant see from either the Empire State Building or Rockefeller Centre. The ipads that they use to help give you information on the sights you can see from the observation deck are great and I think are worth getting. Not an essential but a nice to have. If you have the time, also have a drink at the bar. Great food and what a view.
Great views of NYC. It has some great views of the NYC skyscrappers and Liberty island, but you won't see central park, the entry is limited so be sure to buy tickets at least 2 days before you go.

A New Beginning.... The resilience & determination of the Human Spirit is shown on this new "Freedom Building" One World Trade Center!! A tribute of strength and in memory of every soul who was so senselessly murdered. When our spirits are strong and we stand together we can see forever!!!

DO NOT MISS THIS EXPERIENCE. Words fail me to describe this experience, if you thing this is just a view you are in for such a surprise. I won't spoil it just go and experience.I recommend arriving early in the morning or late in the evening. This place gets busy. On the downside the cafe is a let down, over priced and has a poor food selection.

Great observatory- simply amazing!. Breathtaking views of the New York city. Amazing experience for everyone in the family. This is a must visit in NYC. Experience from the start till end was astonishing.

You really shouldn't miss seeing One World Observatory. Would suggest that you book online and specify a time if you're able. We had booked for 5:15 as we had reservations at ONE Dine at 6:15. The cost was $36.00 per person at that time but it seems like I read that it goes up closer to sunset times. I was a little worried about this excursion for a couple of reasons: 1- I don't like being packed like a sardine in an elevator and 2, I'm afraid of heights! My worry was for nothing! The elevator, while being packed, was an event not to be missed! First, LED technology allows the walls to flash 500 (?) years of New York history as you quickly ascend. And I mean quickly! More than 100 floors (you start below ground) in something like 49.5 seconds - my husband timed it on his phone. And then when you get to the top, the views are without equal. Yes, it is tricky to take pictures through the glass and there are lots of people wanting to do the same but the views/pictures you get are not ones you could get anywhere else. Take the time to sit at the "City Buzz" area and listen. It is so interesting to hear more about the city. The couple sitting next to me was from Long Island so I don't think it matters whether you're from that area or from Arkansas like me. There is something that appeals to everyone in what is being said. I would allow at least an hour to explore ONE World. We enjoyed our time there and definitely made some good memories. The website for ONE World is great and gives a good picture of what you will experience. Do be aware that you will go through security which is very similar to TSA at the airports. It's a good idea to allow a little extra time for that although it did move quickly. Don't miss this amazing place!

You just have to.... This truely is one of those 'have to do' things in NYC, like the statue of liberty, Central Park, or Kat's deli... the views are simply incredible, & the trip up 102 floors in less than 50 secs is worth the entry alone!

What a view!. The observatory is well planned and presented. When you get off the elevator at the top of the observatory, a brief film of New York is shown and then you get the view. It is awesome. Don't forget your camera as the view of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Staten Island and New Jersey is unforgettable. Visitors are permitted to stay in the observatory area as long as they wish. Food and trinkets are a tad pricey here. It was a great experience.

Go to watch Manhattan turn from day to night. Well worth a visit - great view towards the Empire State and all over the city!We watched the afternoon turn into night and the view was even more special. Ate in the restaurant - expensive for the quality of the food but it's the view you pay for and that's well worth it!!

Must see!. One World Trade Centre is a must see in NYC. It is the tallest building with breathtaking views of Manhattan, Bronx and Queens, Statue of Liberty, Ellis island and NJ. The total time you would probably spend is 2 hrs. Get priority pass and you are all set!

Great views of Lower Manhattan and New York harbor. My visit to One World Observatory was the last major thing I did during my 2016 New York visit, and I'm glad I made the effort. The experience begins when visitors enter the elevators that take them to the 102nd floor, and doesn't end until they exit again on the ground floor. I visited late in the evening and stayed until the sun had set, and was happy that I did so. While the views during the day are magnificent, the tinted windows make taking great photos difficult. However, once it gets dark, the window tinting doesn't seem to effect the quality of the images as much (see my photos). As for the facilities, due to the overwhelming demand to visit the observatory, visitors are not encouraged to stay more than absolutely necessary. The cafe does not provide seating for visitors, and very little seating is available on the main viewing floor. The setup appears to be geared to getting people in and out of OWO as quickly as possible. Still, if you are going to visit the Empire State Building, then a visit to the OWO should also be on your schedule.
Absolutely amazing. Excellent place. Feels great being here. We spent almost 2 hours here. If you want to visit museum also then you need more hours.

Best 360 view of NYC. This was the highlight of our visit to NYC, we bought the Day Flex tickets online, because we wanted the flexibility of entering at our convenience and skipping the line to the elevator. From the elevator ride to the 360 view of NYC this is absolutely worth every penny and there are not enough words to describe the whole experience. This is a must see, when visiting NYC.

Great views without the long queues you get at Empire State.. The views aren't as spectacular as the Empire State Building which is located amongst very tall skyscrapers which you get to look down on. That said, we were straight in with a short queue, unlike the hours spent queueing at the former. We stopped for a meal in the restaurant and it was excellent quality and good value. Recommended for a visit.

Beautiful tower w/amazing 360 views. Everything about One World Trade is worth the trip. We would suggest getting tickets online and having them on your phone so you will not have to wait in line. From the elevator ride up (which is a little anticlimactic since you just have digital screens all around you) to the full 360 degree walk around at the platform level, this is a place you must visit when in NYC. The observation windows are not very packed in as they do a good job of staggering the amount of people up there at any one time. We were lucky enough to be up there on a beautiful day and every view was perfect. It would have been nice if they had used some type of film on the glass so you did not get so much glare and reflection on the lower parts of the windows...but that is a very minor problem.
One World Observatory. On top of the magnificent views, I loved the thought put into building this majestic Tower. Lovely reference to the US independence, the Twin Towers.
one world trade centre. A must visit, amazing views of the bay and New York... enjoy lunch or a snack at the top of the building.....
Rent the iPad. Don't forget to get the iPad! It will make the experience that much better because it explains all the sights.

Over-priced for a shopping trip. We enjoyed the One World Observatory, but we found it to be much more expensive than the Top of the Rock, with not such good views of the city.The lift on the way up is very cool, with views of how New York would have looked from various heights over the years, depicting how the city skyline has changed.There is then a slightly pointless video wall presentation before you enter the viewing areas. The necessarily thick glass means that the views are good, but awkward to photograph.The Top of the Rock has better city views (without the glass), but the OWO has better views of the rivers, Statue of Liberty, etc.The Gift Shop is eye-wateringly expensive!For the price I'd not come back to OWO, whilst I would go back to Top of the Rock.
awesome view from the top. we were all skeptical, but the view is amazing and takes every bit of an hour to enjoy everything you can see from 1250 high. enjoy!!!

Wow. A must visit when in NY. We took a tube to Brooklyn then walked over the bridge then visited the memorial then this amazing tower. The views are phenomenal 360 degrees. Hats off to all those concerned in building and planning this fabulous attraction.
Cousins from Norway visit.... We were glad that this visit was so enjoyed by our Norwegian cousins ! They were impressed with the experience and so loved the views !!

Awesome views of the city. Well worth the time and cost. 360 views of the city, New Jersey and all the way to ConnecticutJust be sure it is a clear day as sometimes the top is shrouded in cloudsIf your queasy be careful as you can feel the building shake but not bad (it is built to do that)souvenirs are expensive, save your moneyalso get the iPad they offer as you can point to an object and it will give you some info about it - worth the $20

Absolutely breathtaking . After 9/11, it's hard to imagine any beauty coming from devastation, but with One world tower, it's a huge becon of what the USA stands for. Absolutely gorgeous views. The elevator ride was really neat, as you see what New York was from the beginning to now with screens on the walls. It was an unexpected surprise but really helped with the ride up 102 stories in less than 60 seconds. When you get off the elevator they load all the people into a dark room to watch a video that opens up to the skyline. It was very neat. Then you are free to explore the observatory floor that is 360° views of New York and New Jersey. Supposedly you can see 5 states on a clear day. We were very fortunate as we had 100% visibility everywhere. We could see the statue of liberty and Ellis island perfect. The harbor was beautiful. The city was breathtaking. Couldn't have had a better experience. It's worth the money to do at least once.
Amazing view.. The photo is real! I went at afternoon on a Saturday but it was ok. Definitely worth to visit!!! Enjoy!
Beautiful Building with a great ciew. Such an amazing way to see the city. The building is gorgeous! Lines can be long, so try to be there as soon as possible, or expect to wait.

Wow!. When we saw the price of $37 we thought it was really expensive but as a one off we decided to do it. It really is worth the money when you get to the top. The views are amazing and we had a relatively cloudy day but we could still see plenty. On offer for $15 is an iPad telling you what each building is. We chose not to do this as we felt we didn't need it. We didn't queue much either. Definitely worth a visit.
Worth the visit . Views were spectacular. Well worth the cost. Restaurant food (pastrami sandwich) was very good but expensive.

Loved the 360 degree view. We travelled to the Observatory on a clear, sunny day. Could see miles in all directions. Get there early or purchase your tickets on-line as certain times are assigned. If you go off the street it could be a long wait. View, sadly, is similar to what you would have seen from the twin towers many years ago.

Enough with the up sale at this price!. Thinking this a must do in New York, we went on a Saturday in September. While in line, bought the tickets online and saved probably a 20' additional wait, wasn't bad that way. Price of tickets is an identical (and steep) $37 per person. The elevator ride is cool and very fast, and the view of course great. But the up sells along the way are annoying - VIP service bypassing the line, a photo in front of a fake skyline, and the an iPad gizmo showing which building is which for an extra $15 that really could have been included at $37 pp.Worth doing in general, but not worth the money imo.

Unparalled View. We spent the $37 a piece to go up to the top--first of all, it takes no time to get to the 102 floor. Then you step out of the elevator and you are reputed to be able to see the curvature of the Earth--it was very clear when we were up there and if we couldn't see it when we visited, you couldn't see it. Anyway, the view was great and the exhibits were also informative. However, I don't think I'd ever go up again. We also went up to the deck of Rockefeller Center (about 63 floors) and I liked it much better. Big difference for me is that at the Rock, you can go outside on three levels. Next, you can see Central Park from the Rock and not so from the OWO. We weren't disappointed but, again, we wouldn't go back.
