The reflections from the windows was not conducive to any quality in the pictures I took. Lesson learned - we won't do that again. We did enjoy the views, but or photography suffered.

Impressive visit . It is worthy to visit because it used the fresh way to present the City! Specially it used the theater way to show you the city images on the screen and after the show finish, the screen is pulling up and show you the real image of the City just in front of you! Suggestion: try to reserve your tickets online to avoid the long line of the ticket office! And last thing to remind you is trying to protect everything in the building! I saw most of the people tried to take pictures very near the glass and stepped on the edge of the Windows or sat on the little building decoration on the edge of window!

Amazing but let down by man in shop. Great view . Great experience. Only let down by a man who served me when I was buying something from the shop. Really sarcastic when I didnt know where to sign for my goods. Bare in mind the UK used chip n pin for ages....

What a way to see New York. This was an amazing experience. It's not cheap but the views from the top are well worth the entrance fee. The guest experience has been well thought out from the walk to the lift, the lift journey itself and the short film before the best reveal ever. Very helpful guides are on hand to answer any questions you have about the view and life in NYC. David gave a very informative talk on the Brooklyn Bridge and Yellow cabs. Apart from a bit of attitude from the shop manager all other staff were professional and friendly. Needless to say we didn't bother spending our dollars in the shop though we had intended to. For a special treat we went to the bar for a cocktail - Manhattans and Uptowns of course! Delicious. Overall a fantastic two hours spent looking out over New York and beyond. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful view. The event experience is very well done. Of course, you can't beat the view. And, be sure to take advantage of the knowledge of the guides up there. They are full of great information as to what you are seeing. Definitely recommend going early in the day as it gets crowded.
Brilliant. Smooth well organised attraction, not overpriced. Very informative, explaining the building and the history of New York. Well worth a visit

Endless views. A pleasant surprise awaits the top of the new World Trade Center. A wonderful restaurant with unlimited views and reasonable prices. Casual attire is OK so feel free to stop in after a day of sightseeing in shorts and tee shirts.
Nice view of city. The view from top is awesome. We went during night and there was not much wait. We had a good time over there.
AMAZING!!. Well worth the price of admission! The views are unbelievable! The elevator ride is so fast and fascinating! A must do!!

Really great views!. I took my 6 and 16 year old daughters here. It was very good, views were nice the best part for me though was the elevator ride on the way up! Amazing! For me I would have loved this to be made more into a feature and have more detail on the story, that's all I can say without ruining the surprise! This in my opinion is a to do, well worth a visit.

Amazing Views. We enjoyed this view very much. Go later in the day its not quite as busy. The entrance fee for the One World Observatory is $37. The building is new and very modern - the lift up to the 101 floor is amazing you get there is about a minute - taking in all the views around the city. The lift counts the floors and the height you are at. Once you reach the 101 floor you are shown a short film then you go through to the restaurant and the 102 floor at this stage you are 1776 feet up with spectacular views all around you. Most of the city landmarks are recognisable. You can hire a tablet which you just point at an area and it tells you where your are looking the cost of this is about $15. You can get the same information for free from any member of staff - who are all helpful. I felt that the gift shop was a little over priced but it didn't stop me buying. Its busy but well worth the trip. The is also known as the Freedom Tower. Its the newest building in the World Trade Centre buildings.

Gorgeous views at night!!!!. Pick a start time close to sunset where you can see the views both day and with the sparkling lights at night!! You hardly notice the ride up to the 102 floor because they provide a slideshow on the walls of the elevator showing how the area has changed throughout time. They take your picture at the top if you want to purchase. Really enjoyed it - must do at least once!!!

Labor Day weekend . We went to the observation deck for the first time. We had been on top of the World Trade Center before. They have made this quite the experience. Very commercial though. I miss being outside as this is all enclosed. We did this after walking around the memorial. #neverforget
Amazing views. Great experience, amazing views and great photo opportunities. It is worth booking your tickets online so that you don't have to queue on the day!

Excellent!. The One World Observatory is brilliant. I have been to top of the Empire State building and to the top of the Rockefeller, and this new facility provides the best views (in my opinion). It is actually really cool to see the two iconic buildings from the One World Observatory. If you are debating which tower to go up and money is not priority, I would recommend this!

Spectacular views. . Very well organised experience. I'd highly recommend you get your ticket before going in order to avoid the queues. If you're worried about heights, don't be. I usually am affected but this is done so well that my brain didn't register we were going anywhere high until I saw the view at the top. The lifts have film inside them to distract nervous passengers. I was disappointed that there was no downloadable app as there are in other NY sights to get the most from the experience. Instead, there are iPads for hire for a further $15 to identify points of interest in the spectacular views. My friend and I took a map and managed with that to help us figure out what we were looking at. We went on a Saturday and encountered very little waiting time thanks to the slick organisation. However, we believe that there were too many people on the observation deck as we couldn't get close to the windows for any length of time as there were always people waiting to take our place. Watch the weather forecast before going as you need a good day to get the most from this.

GO ON A CLEAR DAY TO ENJOY TO ITS FULLEST!. We were originally scheduled to go to the One World Observatory - World Trade after seeing the 9/11 Museum and Memorial. That was our first mistake. It was a rainy day and once you exit the 9/11 Museum and Memorial, you cannot reenter, so we left after 4 hours, but did not get to see everything. When we got to the One World Observatory, we were told that we could still go up, but there was no visibility because of the clouds. We were pointed towards their ticket windows to reschedule our visit at no additional fee. That was nice, but since we bought our tickets online, we did not get the same discount. The next day the clouds broke and we went back for our One World Observatory experience. It was very good, but not something I would do on a repeat trip; primarily because of the cost. It is fairly expensive, but definitely worth it the first time. One note of caution, "Take your time." If an area is blocked that you want to view or take a photo, just wait until it is clear. The only annoyance that I found was the well-intentioned speakers at different locations in the observatory broadcast their talk over the PA system and literally were so loud you could not have a conversation in a normal voice even on the opposite side of the observatory.

Great view, specially for sunset.. We enjoyed very much, amazing 360o NYC view. Once up there we rented one of those tablets for information on buildings (I don't recommend, I'd pass if I'd go again). Much nicer view that from Empire State Building. We watched the sunset from the restaurant up there, it was a very pleasant time along with drinks.

Nice view- a little too commercial, and expensive. This is a great view of Manhattan- just felt like I kept being "upsold" throughout the trip- from taking a mandatory picture to being sold an iPad with an app that shows you what builiding your looking at... just a bit too much for my liking. The snacks/ drinks up top were very pricy and nothing special.... I guess its one of several observatories you can pick from- we picked this because it was the newest... don't regret going here, as it was a nice trip if you can avoid all the "extras".

Inspirational . What a magnificent building borne out of such tragedy. The elevator to the observation deck was quick and sights of the city are I like no other this wanderer have seen. The usual photo opportunities available on your own and also the professional shots taken at entry.I think every American should visit the 9/11 Memorial as well as this magnificent building. Btw the guides in the building are quick to help pointing out landmarks and a presentation detailing historical aspects of nyc is held at regular intervals. Wonderful experience
Simply WOOOOOW!. We couldn't speak, coz it was so amazing, fantastic, awesome! It's quite expensive, but I didn't regret! We saw The Statue of Liberty, Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, etc..

Disappointing visit. Last week we had a disappointing visit to the One World Observatory in the so called Freedom Tower.The elevator ride up was good fun. So was the short movie that was shown after reachting the top.After that we, but also a lot of other guests, were very disappointed. Let's find out why? What did we want to do when planning the trip to the observatory:1. have a good view on New York City,2. make some nice pictures of the City,3. make some nice pictures of our kids with the city on the background as a souvenir4. experience the City (see, smell and hear it).All of these options are not possible, because you are behind glass! The glass is bended backwards due to the shape of the tower, so it is not possible to look downward. It is impossible to make nice pictures, because the faces are inside in the shadow, so the city as background is overexposed. If you use a flash it is even worse because of the reflections in the glass. My advice: I don't know how the other observatories (Top of the Rock and Empire State Building) are organized. If you have similar intentions as I did, then please explore what their proposal is.

A bit too badly organized view. The new Observatory offers a great view but overall, it's a bit of a disappointment. The fast elevator ride to the top is nicely animated but then when you step out they lead you through a shop-like thing to push a rent-a-tablet on you. Then, you have go down in a line for, finally, the view you came for. Meanwhile, the coffee place is slow and sitting impossible. Better go elsewhere where the view is as great and the experience all good.
Spectacular. For the spectacular view of the city do visit this giant tallest building in Western Hemisphere. WTC Path station is amazing with lot of shopping options,

Don't miss the opportunity to see NYC from the top of the city!. If it's a clear day, you have to go! The views of the city and the region is amazing – 360°...the iPad you can rent is worthwhile for anybody not knowing the points of interest well-walk around with it and you get an interactive display of what's in your view. We loved the elevator ride-smooth as silk to 100th Floor in less than a minute-my 88 year old father was just in awe. Great experience for all of us.

Low expectations, but I was utterly blown away. . This entire building has been marred by corruption and questionable decision making. Also, it doesn't really do a lot to stand out or live up to the legacy of what used to be there, even though that's an impossible task. Plus, you're not really in the best location for views of the city. The majority of the iconic buildings and locations are in Midtown, and can best be seen from the Top of the Rock. However, this is something you absolutely *must* witness. Whoever designed the observation area and the way it's presented to you deserves the biggest raise in the history of human civilization, because it's sheer perfection. Everything from the elevator ride to your initial glimpse of the view couldn't have been done better. If you want more details, go somewhere else. I'm not going to give them to you, because it'd spoil the experience. But if, by chance, this is the first review you've read, close the app now, and don't read any more. Don't allow yourself to know what's coming. Just put your phone in your pocket and head for the ticket line. Yes, it's *that* good. The hair on my arms stood straight up.

Interesting . We pre-purchased priority tickets for the tour. That is a big waste of money. You will still have to stand in a line, so there is really no priority. You're taken through the rock they hadto drill through for construction. You also see pictures of the workers and stages of development. You are taken up an elevator up to the 100th.fl If you have motion sickness, beware. The views on top are 360 degrees and are very cool. There's a pricey restaurant and bar but the wait was too long.

Huge vistas and a bit of showbiz. Visited the Observatory for the first time in June, absolutely magnificent views of Manhattan especially the South of the island and Brooklyn Bridge in particular. I won't spoil the surprise for anybody here, but get ready for a bit of showbiz in the elevator. A must see attraction.

Wow. Didn't book tickets in advance as I wanted to make sure we went on a clear day. There was no problem at all however getting in and walk up wait was just a few minutes. The experience of going up in the lift (elevator) was very well done and the show at the top was just breath taking. The view all around was jaw dropping

View is good, the rest is a tourist trap!. We enjoyed the view, however to get to it you have to "suffer" through a lot of useless things, they actually hoard you through like sheep. We bought tickets online, which really helped, you can skip the first ticket lines and go downstairs to the entrance. Once you're in, they hoard you into an elevator. The movie you see while going up is pretty cool and well made. Once out of the elevator, they hoarded multiple elevators full into the first room where you see a really short movie (city skyline & some explanations), it's very artsy fartsy but not informational at all. At the end of it, they pull up the wall they're projecting on and you can see the view. However, due to so many people there, if you stand in the back you can't see much because there's so many people in front of you. Next they hoard everyone into another room and try to rent you some kind of ipad or similar which you can use to look through and it will show you what buildings there are etc, for an additional $15. A total rip off. I don't understand why people can't just enjoy the view, but need to view everything through a digital lens. And who cares what exact building it is, just enjoy! Anyway, once you pass that, you can finally go and enjoy the view. However, it's very difficult because there's hoards of people everyone, all taking selfies with the view, and running around into your pictures. The view is very nice, you can see far and it's great to be over downtown. Definitely different from the top of the rock. One very annoying thing is that there's 2 spots around where they put some person to explain about New York and what's on (events). One lady had an extremely shrill voice and yelled into the microphone. If I want to know what's on, I'll check it out online, I don't need someone up there when I'm trying to enjoy the view! In addition, most visitors are foreigners and don't understand them anyway. Just offer guidance to people who ask! Why do you need to constantly have noise and entertainment around?! Just let people enjoy the view in peace! All in all, I definitely wouldn't go again. The view is great but everything else....I'd rather forget!

Stunning views, shocking price. Yes, the views are amazing, and yes, the elevator ride is unlike anything I've experienced before. But I think the $56 price tag for the no-line option was way too steep. I'd put a value of probably $15 on it, given the number of people they let in at once and therefore the difficulty actually getting a clear, unobstruted view out the observatory glass.

amazing. If u don't do anything else in New York,make sure u do the observatory,it's breathtaking!!We went at eight o clock at night,just starting to get dark,we got some truly beautiful pictures,we went to the restaurant and had a meal,while looking down at the amazing view!!

unmatched. make this a visit but buy the flexi day entry as you will be fast tracked in and you have the choice of what time you go in and not be given a time slot if you go to the top its worth every pound won't spoil it

Must do. I just recently moved to New York and had family come visit. We had talked about going to the observatory, but weren't sure if it would be worth it...let's just say, you cannot leave Nyc without going here. Must do

New York City at Your Feet. From the ashes of 9/11, One World Observatory soars into the Manhattan Sky. A phenomenal architectural building with foundations embedded in solid rock formed 450 million years ago. Amazing elevator ride. 1243 feet in about 30 seconds! 102 floors. 360 degree views. Wow!
Nice view. Has a nice view from Manhattan and New Jersey. Buy online and save. iPads with city view are offered at a reasonable price, although I didn't get one

A must when visting New York City. We first thought it is going to be endless lines and where surprised, it goes pretty fast, strong security, which i understand totally, the view is unbelievable! go up there worth every penny

Best view i have ever seen!. I had done Top of the Rock The first night i was on holiday and thought we would do one world the next day.Honestly blew me away, one of the highlights of my trip and should be of any new yorkers......

Incredible. Bought tickets from street vendors and were able to go straight through and skip the queues, which was great. Elevator travelled the 100 floors in about 50 seconds - super fast. When we got to the observatory, the views of New York and beyond were simply incredible... Mind-blowing. I never expected the views yo be so good. But they were. The building is beautiful also.
Spectacular . The whole experience is very good, starting from the elevators ( so creative, but I won't say more) to the little movie on arrival to the whole view up there. It is really a must !

The new "must do" in NYC. Visiting our son in Brooklyn ...took us on a hike to see the 9/11 Memorial ... and just by luck we were able to get "walk in" tickets to the Observatory. Wow ! Impressive from the elevator ride up to the 360 degree observation deck/floor (w/ laptops to identify buildings from where ever you are standing). Well worth the admission price ... now I can cross that of my bucket list !

Wonderful day!. We had a great experience at the Observatory! We paid the extra fee for priority tickets. It was well worth it. We never stood on a line.The views are fantastic!The restaurant was excellent- the ribs & heirloom tomatoes we exceptional!We also had the coconut creme brûlée perfection!

Premium nyc view. Very nice view of nyc from floor 100 observatory. Buy tickets in advance in the website to avoid a long line. We bought priority access but it is not worth it. The priority is only for the elevator and the price is double.

Unbelievable experience and view!. Make sure to tell them if you're military, there is a discount although not advertised. Amazing experience from elevator ride forward. No rushing you at the top, can stay as long as you like and there is a snack bar with coffee, etc.

Uplifting experience. Following a tour of Ground Zero and the 9/11 Memorial Museum, it seemed very appropriate to cap off that moving experience with a ride to the top of this beautiful building. It's very existence expresses the thought that America can be hit but not defeated. It stands at 1776 feet tall as a symbol to our resilience . The views from the Observatory are spectacular and the educational displays with lectures added to our appreciation of NYC as a remarkable city.

Must see. Compared to Empire State Building, this was a better, and better organised tour. Queue was not bad, went at 4pm on a Sunday, and was at the top 25 mins after joining queue. Not too packed at the top, nice bar and not too expensive, $11 for draught beer, so I had 6 of them!

Views to die for. As a group we booked the tickets on line, saved a lot of time when we arrived.
Very slick entry to the viewing gallery, and what views when you get there, stunning

One of the must do things. Went up the one world observatory as its the new high place to visit. Problem for us was that it was a rainy day so views were not good so we hung around for the rain to clear. Decided to have a snack and a drink which we though was an extortionate price.

Amazing views (as you'd expect!). We hadn't planned to visit One World Observatory, but found ourselves at the entrance having walked through the Oculus terminal late on a Sunday afternoon. The queue was almost non-existent so we took the opportunity to go up!The lift was pretty impressive but, as you'd expect, the views at the top were unique! We were fortunate enough to see Manhattan and Brooklyn by day and then stayed for dinner, which offered an opportunity to see the same views by night (good tip to try and catch the time of day for both!)I gather the difference in cost between peak and off-peak is around $5, we went an hour before off-peak but it was worth the difference!

Outstanding . See lower Manhattan from a different perspective outstanding 360 views. The trip in the lifts is brilliant with different views in different directions. Snacks are reasonably priced considering they have a captive audience.

High !!. Despite hating heights I agreed to go up, boy it's high, it's hard to understand how it's possible to get up so quickly. I spend a lot of time at the back but my partner loved the views, amazing really. Worth it.

Great for views. Booked our timed tickets online $34 per person. Went through security quickly then up the elevators,small presentation with a wow moment. Then it's just walk around yourself, spacious large glass with views all around . Small gift shop, cafe and an expensive bar/restaurant .

Wow - fantastic Building & Wonderful Views ❤️. Worth the money to just travel in the lift (102 floors in 60 seconds), watch the film show during that journey, then to spend as much time on the viewing platform as you like . Information board as you enter the lift area gives great information on number of visitors, where they are from and other bits & pieces

breathtaking view. what great breath-taking views from the observation floor we have previously visited the empire state and rockerfella towers but this is some thing special from start to finnish well worth the money

Simply breath taking!. Had the pleasure of visiting on a beautiful clear Friday evening, it was well worth the experience as the views at night are quite simply astonishing. Will be going back in December for a daytime view, and am looking forward to it. The Freedom Tower is a truly beautiful building and is such a great tribute to perseverance after such a horrific tragedy. When you do visit the observatory, take a moment to reflect and honor those that perished in the towers that day. The new Freedom Tower and the 911 Memorial and Museum are something that every American should see and experience, I urge you to do so.

Excellent show.. The technology they use on the elevator and the introduction film are fantastic. You can see lots on a clear day. On the negative side, there is no outdoor viewing platform (See Top of the Rock for that) and it is very expensive even before you consider renting the ipad guide. The self serve cafeteria has no seats, is extremely expensive and the first place I have been prompted to add a 20% tip after serving myself!

One World Observatory is truly Top of the World. The One World Observatory is one of the most exciting visits ever! I would recommend renting the iPad that shows various landmarks and structures to get a better perspective of what you are seeing. A snack at the top, while enjoying the view of the wall of windows is also a must.

Breathtaking, sweeping view !. This is truly a "must see" stop. The view from the top is amazing and beyond description. The Sunday we were there was lovely, and you could see everywhere. A plus was the stationing of several friendly guides who were very helpful pointing out the countless points if interest !

Tourist destination. This is a destination our son who lives in NYC said we should see. It is a special and historic place for sure. You kind of get a feeling of pride seeing the rebuilding of the Trade Center it is spectacular. We didn't have too long of a wait at the Observatory. The price is reasonable. It is well worth it because once you get to the top you have a total view of NYC. You have large windows great for photography and you can walk around the area to see all of NYC. This is a must see at least once.

Worth it!. My friend and I spent $56 each to have an assigned entry to the observatory- very expensive! We had absolutely no wait, the elevator is crazy fast and you don't realize you're moving. The views are astounding!! There's an offer to rent an iPad which you hold up and it identifies some of the more major buildings and areas you're looking at- I suggest going for it. It's nice, important and really pretty much necessary if you've spent so much to get up there otherwise you'll recognize the Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty and the Chrysler Building but probably will miss some other sites. The building is magnificent and so is the underground shopping area. The architecture absolutely amazes me. Note: I was in NYC earlier in the month with another friend who had no interest in seeing the Freedom Tower- she thought it was built on the site of the World Trade Centers that were destroyed on 9/11. It's NOT. There was no mention of 9/11 and no tribute- that sacred ground is not far from the Freedom Tower but is not part of it.

Overpriced and overrated. 37 USD to go to the top. just very expensive. top of the rock is kind of the same and half of the price. you are paying for an elevator that gets you to the top of a building, where then they want to rent you ipads and sell you food... avoid it. spend the money in a restaurant

Do not miss it. Is it your first visit to NY or not, do not miss the World Observatory. New technologies have been largely used to make your experience in the observatory something really unforgettable.

Excellent. A great 360 degree experience seeing NYC from the top! The turbo lifts and entertaining video makes the journey to the top quick and easy - only downside is the lack of seats in the cafe at the top and the prices of the drinks.

Worth every penny. Don'e be put off by the price ($37 - adult), the 360 degree 1250 ft view is truly second to none. The tallest building in the Western Hemisphere offers stunning views of all five boroughs of New York, New Jersey and beyond.I would advise going at around 6 o'clock, there is a price rise between 6:30 - 7:30 but no time limit on how long you can stay up there! The sunset over New Jersey is simply astonishing and you really feel as though you are on top of the world with New York spread out below you. Very helpful and accommodating staff.Only problem would be price of both the gift shop and the restaurant/cafe. Combining these with the price of the ticket does create an expensive couple of hours.

Wow!. What an amazing place. The building, the view, just wow! Looking down at the 911 memorial and the city below makes you feel quite humble and very thoughtfulDefinitely worth a visit. Book in advance and choose your time slot

Brilliant view. We chose this over the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock and it did not disappoint from a view point. Be aware that the price goes up to 37$ at 1830 - 1930 for sun & stars.We purchased our tickets at 18:15 by chance and got the lower rate. I will not spoil the initial wow you get when they do a presentation on its history,The view is fantastic but be aware that the glare from the windows is not great when taking pictures - especially in twilight - hence 4 stars.
Be prepared for the Elevator Ride!. The view from the third tallest building in the world is awesome of course, but be prepared to pay attention to the elevator ride!

Great views and inovative lift and opening view. Very helpful staff, we arrived early and were able to alyer our ticket without fuss or cost. Great lift journey (wont spoil it for you guys).
Fantastic vistas, and smooth as, nice one

First visit to OWO family of 3. Wow, wow and wow!Amazing views, the whole reveal and lift experience left a lump in my throat and a tear in my eye. Not too crowded and nice and light and airy. Quick and rushed photo opp. Were given a talk about hiring an iPad for $15 to pinpoint other landmarks etc and surrounding areas (we declined). Restaurant was hugely expensive as was the shop. To be honest felt the staff here were disinterested and felt a sense of going through the motions here with no real passion. As for the guy in the shop who was looking at some paperwork while my daughter waited ages to pay and knowing she was standing there waiting with her money to pay, well let's just say he was lucky he didn't get a real mouthful. To be honest I wish now I had spoken up but we were tired and it had been a long day and didn't want to further upset my daughter. Would still recommend this as an attraction though and would visit again

Amazing experience.. This attraction is really good experience with visual effects on the lift, much different views then Empire or Top of the Rocks. But must say I personally think Top of the Rocks is better because of the open views.

Magnificant!. My god, the entrance....! I wont tell too much so it still is a surprise but I had tears in my eyes (but I truelly love NYC). The view is great but the only thing I think is a pitty is that you make pictures behind glass. And then you have the reflection of people behind you or light. But the view is great!!! And the entrance magnificant!

Wow 360 experience. This is a great experience although I would have to say second best to the rockafella 'top of the rock'. You get great views all the way round and you do feel incredibly high up! the elevator ride up is enchanting and the small presentation after is great especially when the screen comes up that is a very magical moment. One criticism it can be difficult to get amazing pictures because of the glass marks and reflections

Fantastic views!. Enjoyed going up in the superfamily elevator and the show in the elevators was great too. Once you get to the top, the views just beat any others in the city. One word of advice, don't plan to eat there unless you're willing to pay! I had a grilled cheese off the kids menu and a bottle of water and it was almost 20$!! That's NYC for you. I felt bad for people with 2 or 3 kids though.

Top of the World. There are no words to truly describe this experience. 102 stories above New York and 360 degrees of sight The elevator ride and the brief intro were great, but the vista speaks for itself. Whether you are a first time visitor to NYC or a frequent flyer this is not to be missed!
One of the greatest views in the world. One of NYC's don't-miss attractions. Pretty pricey, but you've gotta do it at least once. Enjoy the elevator ride!
Top of the world ma !. What amazing view all around Manhattan the elevator so fast 102 stories in a blink really impressive!

Amazing Views. The elevator takes you 13,000 ft in about 10 seconds. The views at the top are incredible. We were told we could exchange our tickets and come back on a day that wasn't as cloudy, but chose togo up anyway. I can't imagine being able to see any further than we did.You can rent(15.00)iPads that hone in on landmarks around the city and give brief explanations of them.All I could think of was the poor souls who were sitting at their desks on 9/11 and seeing those airplanes flying towards them. It's an amazing yet sobering place.

Stunning. An amazing building - Very close to the wonderful Gardens and Museum.The elevator ride to the top is out of this world - a show is put on of the growth of New York through the years - brilliant.The views are astonishing and must be seen - cameras are definitely required.We were lucky to have a clear day so our views were excellent but to just visit this building is truly amazing.

Best view of NYC. We visited the three buildings, ESB, TOR and One World Observatory. This one was the last one we booked based on many reviews that recommended TOR as the best view in the city. I thought this one was the best of all of them. We arrived at 9am on Monday and it took us approximately 10 minutes to get to the top. The elevator ride was an awesome experience (the ride down was also excellent). When we arrived at the top, there was another presentation and it was pretty cool, I almost expected to see King Kong. If your goal is get great photos from the top, at this time of day, you will be shooting into the sunlight when you face the Empire State Building and Brooklyn Bridge. The other side, Statue of Liberty, will be in the sunlight, but, it is still a distance away. If photography is your primary goal, i would try to go mid day, you won't have the shadows, but, you also won't get the haze by shooting into the sun. At this time of day, there were no crowds, so there was no need to fight for position to be able to see, unlike the other buildings. They also have two informative sessions that we found very interesting. I liked the views of the other buildings but since they are all priced about the same, we felt that we got more for our money with this experience. There are many reviews out there that claim that TOR is the best view, but I have a feeling its because this view is fairly new, just over a year since it opened.

Fantastic views spoilt by dirty windows. We pre booked our tickets before leaving the UK to beat the queues and it worked we had a time of 1500 and arrived at 1430 to see an enormous queue that went around the corner of the building but we just showed our tickets and walked straight in. After passing through security we very quickly found our selves in an express lift that was certainly quick. The views from the top are breathe taking and well worth the trip up. What was very very disappointing though was that by 1500 the windows had been touched, smeared, coughed on and were in a real mess making photography near impossible this was not helped by the angled glass and bright sunshine.The other option we had offered to us was an interactive Ipad so you held it up and it pointed out building etc that you could see all sounds very good but it wasn't.It had to be reset every few minutes as when paused it lost its place, it failed and needed replacing and it only told us about the main buildings that we already knew not the smaller odd looking ones that caught your eye.We also ate in the cafe area, nothing to write home about and certainly not worth the cost and they dont even let you sit down?Would I go again? No not unless the sky line changes in a huge way.Tips: Pre purchase tickets and if you use a Mastercard you get a discount.Tips: As with everything in NY go early.Tips: If you want to take good photographs take a cloth to clean the windows.Tips: Dont waste your money on the interactive Ipad.

Amazing!!! Go up at Dark.. What can I say? Taken up to floor 107 in a lift, in a few seconds. The lift has some sort of visual effects in it that are great to look at. When you exit you are all lined up in front of windows that have blinds on to conceal the view. They then raise up and...WOW. I was overwhelmed at the view across the city. You then walk down a floor where you spend an hour wandering around. For 15 dollars you can rent an Ipad programmed to tell you what you are looking at through the windows. We booked online in advance and went up at 9pm so we saw the city all lit up in the dark. The only down side was it was difficult to get decent photos as it reflects off the glass, but no big deal. I have been up the Rockerfeller building at night to see the Empire State in the dark, but this was even better.

Vacation Visit. This place is amazing in every sense. From the speed of the lift access through to the stunning views from the top gallery.The attraction can get busy and as such I would suggest allowing yourself a 30-40 minute waiting time in order to get your tickets and be security screened prior to accessing the lifts.However, that said it is truly worth the wait for the spectacular views.

Mixed emotions due to visiting twin towers.. The actual building is awesome to look at. I really like the modern look inside and out. Unfortunately for me, the view is nowhere near as good as the view from the roof from the twin towers that I was lucky enough to visit back in Nov '98. The city pulse section where staff used technology giving great info on everything about New York. A nice idea was hiring the iPad style monitor which gave info on the area you pointed the pad towards. The cost of the pad was $15, no thanks. Enjoyed the overall experience.
Great Attraction. Fantastic experience, a great view of New York. Very well presented by the staff. We used the express entry but not required on quiet times.

Historical location . It actually gives you chills once you get there. This is the location where those two planes hit the towers back in September 11, 2001. It's unbelievable even when you'd see all those names of the people who died there that particular day.

Wow wow wow. This is such a Must Do! The elevator die alone is worth it, but the views are insane and something you'll remember forever. My advice- have lunch or dinner at the restaurant.t the top which=ch is amazingly reasonable and the food is good. You cannot visit NYC and not do this. It's like going to the Grand Canyon and not peeking over the edge. With every cent and it's actually reasonable

Wow wow wow. This is such a Must Do! The elevator die alone is worth it, but the views are insane and something you'll remember forever. My advice- have lunch or dinner at the restaurant.t the top which=ch is amazingly reasonable and the food is good. You cannot visit NYC and not do this. It's like going to the Grand Canyon and not peeking over the edge. With every cent and it's actually reasonable

Great place. We loved going here, went smoothely to get to the top as we had prebooked tickets.On the top the view is amazing and the experience for visitors is well thought through. Would also recommend to stop at the restaurant for food or drinks.

Impressive Different Views of New York. Very touristy, sometimes felt forced, but nevertheless, impressive views of downtown and the bay area. Restaurant and cafe costly as were most the items at the gift shop. View through glass, which and dusk was very grubby. Not outdoors so unlike the ESB and Rock it lacks atmosphere. Still a worthwhile experience, but if you only do one viewing platform in NYC, I'd suggest the Top of the Rock which still blows my mind!

If you have the time stay for the sunset .. I am sure that everything I want to say has been said before.The 360 views and all that jazz, the height and whole experience of the landmark etc. Well that was all good as expected Now for the important matter or making a physical memory of your visit (photo and videos). The one advantage over the Empire State is that you don't have a fence which can sometimes get in your photos if you are not close enough to the front. Another advantage is that you can rest your fancy iPhone against the window and take a time lapse of the sunset. However taking photos after the sun has gone down is an issue as the window reflects the lights of the observatory to your camera lens. This making your photos look a bit amateur. But the most important factor is the view you actually get. From one world tower, you can see the Empire State, at Empire State you can see one world. However the Empire State gets lost in the distance and looks just like any other building as it is that far away from down town. But one world tower is taller and stands out better for a photo. From someone else's review - if it is your first time in NYC , head to Empire State then go to one world the next time.

Best experience of our trip. We went late afternoon on a Friday and waited only about 10 minutes. Got a group rate for our family of 8 (2 sets of 4 tickets at slight discount). The elevator ride is really special and the video they show at the top took my breath away! The views are the best in NYC and the whole experience seems very well planned. First class experience!
Great views. Great all round views of NYC.The lift ride is very clever. I prefer it to the Empire State Building and Top of The Rock.

Spectacular views!. The tickets are very expensive, but the 360 degree views of the city are breathtaking. The trip in the elevator itself is worth it. There is a restaurant on the observation deck, but we did not eat there. There's also a small gift shop area.
not to be missed.. The view from the top is extraordinary. it's a view of New York not to be surpassed. Probably best to go earlier in the day because it gets crowded. A very fast elevator to the top
Humbling experience. We took a tour of the area with all the history of the 911 the area although busy gave a feel of peace, very humbling experience.

Obviously Designed for Profit. This is a sleek operation from the minute you buy your ticket. The elevator ride to the 102 floor is vertigo inducing, as the walls of the elevator displays the New York skyline which morphs thru history the higher you go. Hard to explain, but just imagine a three sided video inside the elevator. It made me dizzy. Arriving at the top, they try and rent you an ipad-like device which will identify buildings for $15. We passed. I bought a Gatorade at the snack bar for $6.50. Yet, despite this money grab, it was a great 360 degree view as you walk around a spacious circular viewing area. On a clear day you can see 4 states - New Jersey, New York, Connecticut and Pennsylvania. The descent was another dizzying video - very weird how it affected my balance. Commercialized, yes - touristy, yes - worth it, yes!

A great all round view of Manhattan!. The ride up was quick, the 360 degree view was superb, although it was all behind glass, but it felt so commercialised as an attraction rather than the Top of the Rock which let you get on with it!

Well done. A welcome sight.. This amazing venue made us all very proud and thankful for the freedom it represents. They moved great numbers of people through with skill and professionality. There was no waiting at all. A couple of the features seemed a bit unnecessary like the person prattling on with some review of New York City when clearly the Observatory and what it represents should have been the only focus. My elderly mother tripped on an unmarked curb outside the tower and fell injuring her ankle. We made sure security wS made aware so these elevation changes can be marked in white or yellow as the dark gray pavement is difficult to differentiate levels for poor eyes.

Great experience. We did the One World Tower. Do not pay extra to jump the queues there are none. We went straight up to the 103rd floor. I enjoyed the Tower bower unlike the Empire State Building you are not able to go outside so it all looks misty through the glass. You could see all of Manhattan as far as the eye could see, Brooklyn and The Statue of Liberty Ellis Island. I would recommend doing the Tower.

Very good, but not my favourite in NYC. The WTC looks amazing from the outside. The ride up to the observation deck is good with the video they show in the lift. The observation area itself is good, great views of all around the city and it feels unreal to be up so high. I think it would be better if there was an outdoor area. My favourite observation deck in NYC however is still Top of the Rock however.

Stirring and specatcular. This is a must see for the views from the top. The build up is stirring and you won't be disappointed. Book online as better discounts and arrive before ten to beat the queues. Finish with a walk to the site of the former world trade centre where there are two water features and a museum. Very tastefully and respectfully done and still pulls at the heart strings
Wow...the elevator ride itself is pretty awesome.. After viewing the museum we went to the observation deck. Even the ride to the top was pretty spectacular. It is a once in a lifetime experience.

Breath taking. The whole experience was excellent, easy to purchase tickets, super fast lifts with really funky walls then an great experience with breath taking views when you arrive. The snack bar is good with nice seating and nice staff

Amazing!!!. Without spoiling anyone's thoughts, this is amazing! 102 floors up and eating a flatbread! Watching tiny cars and helicopters flying lower than what we are! Expensive food but worth it and would recommend the iPad to tell you what you are looking at for $15

Top of the world!. If you catch it on a cloudless day, it is an outstanding visit where you can see everything New York stands for. The elevator ride features a video showing you the progression of the New York landscape as you rise to the top. Sightlines are great and you just to have patience as everyone is taking pictures. Surprised how small the bathroom was! Reservations to the top are a must but the process is rather quick.

Nice views of New York. If you have never been to New York before the One World Observatory, although crowded, is a good place to start as you get a great view of the immense size of the New York metropole. It's worth a visit.
Highest point in NewYork. Quite expensive and to my view Empire State has more feeling as the viewing is more open. The lift is certainly very speedy but we weren't at the attraction too long.

A high-tech enhanced experience. Over the last few years I have been lucky enough to visit a number of the highest buildings on this planet, and to a certain extent have become a little blasé about another view from a great height. However, upon visiting the World Trade Centre I was pleasantly surprised by the way that the experience has been enhanced.First of all, the 60 second trip to the top of the tower is turned into an educational journey. The sides of the elevator show Manhattan change from original empty fields into the New York that you see in front of you today. You are then greeted upon arrival at the top by another video presentation that ends with a spectacular view of the city. You then have the opportunity to see New York from every angle, and if you choose your time right (at a slightly higher cost) you can watch the sun go down and the lights come on around this great city.Only negative point that I would point out is that there is an additional charge of $15.00 for an iPad that will highlight the key points of the city for you. I found the iPad to be fairy useless as it didn't really enhance the experience (the highlighted points are fairy obvious to anyone that has spent time in the city), and the iPad quickly becomes more of a burden to carry rather than something that improves your experience.An experience that I would be happy to recommend, but if you are going to do either this or the Empire State then I would go for the latter. The Empire State has the history and similar views, and now appears to be a lot less crowded, probably due to the fact that the majority of tourists will now choose to go up the World Trade Centre and to the One World Observatory.

One World Trade Center a must see. Visiting the One World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan, New York City is a must. This place is not only a touching experience living in memorial , but a great place to view the surroundings. Good shopping for collectables are available. Food is also very good. There is a good number of staff to help you navigate through the various avenues of exploration. If you are not familiar with NYC, suggest you rent an I-Pad -like which will help you locate the various wonders of the city. Just point to the area you want to learn about and "click" to learn more.

WTC. Paying Extra money and no priority what soever - not worth it.Please go see the "Best VIEW" but don't pay extra money - It is a gimmick. Tourist from all around the world - but the staff and service on top floor is outdated,No excitement, (in my Business I wouldn't HIRE some of those employee !!!).

Nice views, but not for a photographer. I didn't know what to expect from this place, so I have to say that I was surprised how nice the views are.The down side of the place is that for some reason the pillars and windowsills were too bright white to get nice photos through the windows, because also the window material is selected so that when I was standing in front of the windows, trying to take a photo I was always in that photo as a reflexion, even when I took the photo so that the lens was touching the window.They should apply some kind of film on the outside to reduce the sunlight coming through and making these reflexions possible, or then go there during the evening when the sun is not shining straight into the tower.Overall the views are excellent, but the observatory is quite noisy (not enough acoustic panels?), windows are really dirty and if you want nice photos be prepared to get disappointed. Also the price is too high for the quality of the place and the elevator videos are really nice, but they should be made with at least 4K and 60Hz to be more immersive.

Excellent Views. This was a must see for me as it wasn't open the last time I came to NYC. The views are spectacular - very different from the other observation decks. My only criticism is that the refreshments at the top are a little on the expensive side & the gift shop gets in the way at the top, it should be near the exit.

Breath Taking. We pre purchased tickets , so we had a time to be there. What a great set up. Straight through, into a lift. Going up in the lift was amazing. Have your camera ready. When you arrive at the top there is a short presentation then they open the curtains and what a view. You then go through to the full observation floors. Really really well set up. We had dinner there. We had to book. The food was great, good choice and service.

Amazing! Best NYC experience. The views are amazing! not too busy. No queues and good control of people going up- unlike empire state! Everything from the elevator up is brilliant! The bar staff were friendly and their house wine is delicious! Menu looked good but we didn't eat
The best view on NYC. The elevator is itself already an attraction. Then you'll have the presentation of the city that will let you literally speechless

FREINDS . Awesome opening day experience. Not everything was ready for the big day, but enough were open and prepared to do business. Bakeries, coffee shops were not yet set up so we had to go back to midtown for breakfast. We took the train from midtown and were able to walk through a new tunnel that was just built to connect the World Trade Center by a short walk to the New York trains. Walking up the train from New Jersey was just coming in. Beautiful indoors. Outside look like some kind of large scale outer space toy with open ribbed structure. Famous French architect designed it. Much more attractive inside than out.
Amazing . The views were incredible and everything about the room was phenomenal. Without giving anything away, make sure you have your phone on video in the lift up. Simply fantastic!

Just Go. Probably the highlight of our 8 days in the USA.This place has the most amazing lift I've ever been in.Views from the top are excellent although to be there at sunset expect it to be busy as everyone knows how amazing it it lol If you miss this place you've missed out.

Best View!. I've been to NYC about 10 times and done Empire State Building and top of the Rock multiple times. This was my first time going here and it hands down has the best the view! The presentation till you see the view is really cool too! definitely my favorite thing I did on this last trip.
OWTC. Breathtaking views, top notch bar, bit pricey but worth it just to say yu have drunk there!!! Tallest building so got to be done!
Great experience!!!. Very impressive presentation in beginning of tour!!!! We are very happy, that we saw this place! Westfield Would Trade Center is awesome!!

All the way up to 100th story. Not really what we expected. Much preferred Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Plaza where you can go outside. The place is just big and high. Somewhat disappointed we left after 30 minutes. To expensive. Elevator show was nice but lasted only seconds. Will not return.
Great views. Great views of the city, including the statue of liberty and ellis island. I suggest coming early in the day when it isnt too crowded, but overall a nice experience.

Stunning views but a bit too much light. We went up the One World Observatory on 22nd August after visiting the 9/11 memorial museum. The cost was $35 (around £25) per person. We went up at 9 p.m. Getting into the tower was pretty quick, we didn't really have to queue for very long at all. The escalators take you up to the observatory levels in under 60 seconds where you are greeted by a short film before getting to see the views. The views itself across the city at night were stunning. You could see for miles. I'd definitely recommend going up at night as I'd imagine the sun could prevent good views and photos. That being said the only downside to going at night was the lack of darkness inside the observatory. It would be nice to have had part of a floor at least with no lights to enable clearer photos. I managed to get some decent shots by placing the camera lens directly onto the windows then blocking out any light around it with my hands but it was quite fiddly. I found it quite moving looking down onto the 9/11 memorial pools all lit up and trying to imagine that those two towers should be there.

Good Value!. What a view! Nice facility with a spectacular view of the city. I recommend a night visit too. Be prepared for line ups and security though. Tickets bought beforehand will speed the process.

Great experience and views. We've been to Orlando and theme parks before but the opening experience is fantastic, I won't spoil it but you will not be disappointed. You are then left to enjoy the views, you can hire an iPad for $15 to enhance your knowledge of the sights. A great experience and would definitely recommend

Excellent views - too much selling. It's not cheap, but it is worth it, although I would have enjoyed it more without being sold something at every turn. Why do the Americans try to ruin everything by trying to sell you anything?Went Monday at 10 am - no queues.MasterCard offer either discount on standard entry or priority at standard price - if that makes sense?
Great experience. Well organised and obviously exceptional 360 views of Manhattan. Lots of information given in talks at the top and didn't feel crowded or hurried despite being very busy.
Memoir. Salute to all brave citizens who stood with courage and strength to rebuild this memorial tower again .

Excellent views. Bought an Expidited ( fast track) up to the top . We were on a quick weekend break to New York so wanted to get as much done as possible so the fast track ticket although a bit pricey meant we skipped all the queues. Great views from the top and informative.
remembering. a must visit but choose correctly (I mean visiting time and day) see the skyline from up high and see the various other memorials underneathbreathtaking scenery 360 degrees

Could be better. This site is worth the money paying to go up and have a bird's eye view of the city and the experience of riding in a really fast elevator that tells you the status of your ride. However the observatory expects you to pay even more if you want an orientation of the sights by paying an iPad device that will enlighten you as you go round 360. I think the observatory is already making more from this than any hotel and should simply put up information signage to enable their guests to be informed of the sights instead of asking them to pay more for this service.

A humble experience, feeling small in such a big city. This is a must visit place if you are in Manhattan. I recommend to go here on a Sunday between 3-4 pm, no queue.The whole experience from the elevator going up to the observation room until going down again to exit the building.They did an amazing job to make you feel like you just entered a 3D movie of Manhattan.I remembered feeling humble and small, being so up high in such a big city.Definitely a recommendation!

Crass commercial experience. Obvs the views are astounding. But the experience is tainted by the crass commercialisation of it all. Esp if you have come from the harrowing 9/11 museum. You are shepherded this way and that with people always trying to get you to buy vastly overpriced family photos and if you try to duck out they get very shirty. Shame. It could be much more of a celebratory experience and informative but you leave with a bad taste. The people who did the monologueS about the city did a good job. And as for charging 15 dollars for an iPad to use, in this day and age, where is the app?????
breathless view. it's a very special place which keeps alive the memory of a tragedy but gives you a view on the future and on the whole NYC. Simply amazing
On a clear day you can see forever. Great view. The immersive elevator experience was very cool. Rent the iPad, it's a little overpriced but worth it.

First time to the city. Great views of the city. If you can't afford too pay $200 for a 15 min. helicopter tour this is close. This also has significant meaning to many people. Well run and orderly with places for everyone to view the city. There is dinning available at the top. Security is high with must the same as air travel.

Amazing. The views from the observatory are phenomenal. It was a pretty clear day but I can only imagine how breathtaking it would be on a 100% clear day. The staff were polite and the people doing the "Buzz" were engaging, entertaining and knowledgeable. Buy tickets in advance, even if it's only minutes before. We drove down to the area (it was a Sunday so were able to find street parking) and after we parked went on line to book tickets. That enabled us to bypass lines. You are led to believe that you save $3 booking on line but there is a $3 / ticket "processing fee". Cheap shot advertising and a bit pricey.

Fantastic views of New York City and beyond. Upon reaching the 104th floor you are given a presentation that will make you say "wow". You will be offered rental of iPads, that looked impressive but I don't feel I missed anything that I could not get from the map.For those of us who were lucky enough to visit the Twin Towers, this impressive view has been sadly missed. A great experience.

Freedom Tower. The view is amazing from the top of the tower, it was nice to see the tower finished as saw the footings being laid then next visit there was only the last piece of glass to put in place and clear up around the building site

Stunning view over Manhattan, Jersey and Brooklyn. We booked tickets online which meant we didn't have to queue at all. The security is fantastic and the elevator ride to the top an experience in itself already. I don't want to ruin the whole experience for you guys already, but there is a big surprise up top which is just mindblowing. Definitely worth the money.
Incredible . If you will go to NYC, you should go, if you can, buy your ticket from Internet, it will help you to avoid the lines. Completely futurist and brand new technology

Outstanding. We visited just after the 9/11 Memorial and this attraction immediately lifted our spirits. It was a rainy day and they told us that there was zero visibility, but since we had already purchased our tickets, we decided to take our chances anyway. Well we could see the entire city clearly and we were able to avoid the crowd. The elevator ride both up and down are simply spectacular. You will need to experience it for yourself as there are no words to describe it. We watched a thunderstorm complete with lightening strikes from the observatory bar where we ordered a flight of tasty craft beers. Truly a memorable experience!
Beautiful. Great views of the boroughs seen on a clear day. The show in the elevator on the way up is a neat treat also.

Spectacular 360 views of the city and three states. Visited Freedom Tour on a Thursday afternoon. The lines were minimal and the observatory wasn't too crowded. We purchased our tickets from the attendants selling them just outside of the entry doors to the building (this seemed to be a quicker option than waiting in line inside at the ticket booths). Took an elevator up to the 102nd floor....smoothest and quickest 102 floor climb I've ever experienced! The walls of the elevator show a video of Manhattan's transition since the 19th century...fascinating quick look at the city over the decades.Once on the 102nd floor, you have your picture taken (you can purchase it for $20) and then are encouraged to rent an interactive tablet for $15 that shows you the names and history of each building in the view, when you point the tablet's camera in that direction. Interesting option, but we opted not to get one.The views of the city were utterly spectacular, thanks to a very clear day. We were also told that three states could be seen from this high up. You can walk around the entire floor, giving you a 360 degree view of the city. Just beautiful.We stayed for about an hour and felt like we had plenty of time to take in the sites and beauty. There is a small gift shop and bar in the observatory as well....we didn't stop in either, but nice to know they had these amenities.

An excellent job to justify the $37/head price tag. With the view being the prime goal and it being a clear, sunny afternoon the primary goal was met, in spades. Lift was an impressive start to the experience. Arriving at the top was OK but could have done without the PR video session but it was just made acceptable by how they finished it. The viewing area is well designed with lots of glass and not too many pillars (could have cleaned the glass more frequently as lots of greasy palm and finger prints meant getting a clear photo was never going to happen).Wanted to have an early dinner but all the tables were booked so just had a sundowner cocktail. Not surprisingly they were on the high side price wise (no pun intended) but were well made. Had to ask 7 (yes, seven) times for the bill and even when I started to walk out in annoyance no-one bothered to ask me to pay. Conscience prevailed and I had to tell the concierge I was either paying then and there or thanks for the free drinks - they got my bill pronto.Not quite the same quality experience when I had dinner at the old Top of the World but view was still worth the effort.

I wish I could give it more stars!. I'm so glad we did this! Everything about this place is amazing, starting with the elevator ride up. I have to say that it was the best elevator ride I have ever had. When we got up to floor 102, they let you out and have a presentation. I would recommend getting in the front for this and in the center if you can. After that you are directed to the viewing area, and are offered an iPad for $15, that shows you landmarks and describes them to you. I found this very helpful, because you can see so far, that it is hard to focus on building far away. Definitely do this during your visit. You will not be disappointed!

An amazing site. The entrance to the Observatory starts with a walk though bedrock. Pictures and words of the people and the quotes for a great NY. The elevator ride up was a trip through time from the beginning of New Amsterdam through present. A short presentation then off to the Observatory.The view was stunning although the sun glared on the windows. I went at 10 am so the sun was midway east. definitely worth a trip up.

The best views of NYC. The One World Trade Centre is a great way to see the views of Manhattan and beyond. Queues, when we went, were minimal and although it is expensive, it is worth it. They offer rental of an I Pad to help you work out what you are looking at - my advise - don't do this, just take a map or your guide book with you and use that instead.

Such A One-In-A-Lifetime Experience. I went with a coupon, so it was half price for me and my friends. Amazing views of Manhattan, all of its landmarks and some part of Hoboken and New Jersey. Try to listen to the guides inside there. What they have to say is really interesting. Take your time and stay as long and possible, to see the city change colors from day to night.

No words... More than excelent. Like I have mentined on the title... This is a must see in NYC that is more than an excelent visit. Not only for tourism, but also for the beautiful view. It's a must see for sure

Fantastic 360 view of NYC and NJ !!!. I've had a great time visiting the OWO and recommend everyone who's going to pass by NYC to do the same. During the week the lines are smaller. There are some expositions along the way to the elevators telling the story of the rebuild and a final presentation before the visitors are give access to the 100th floor where everyone can enjoy a 360 view of NYC and NJ.

Definitely do this. A must do if you are in NY. We had been up the Burj Khalifa the week before which was incredible but this beats it hands down with the presentation. Superbly done from going up the elevator to the video presentation and the quick glimpse they give you of the view before entering the main viewing area. Very well done. We did this in the day, the Empire State Building very late at night and Top of the Rock at sunset. Can't beat a good view. Had no trouble getting tickets. Enjoy

Spectacular Views. It is well worth visiting this site. Wish that the elevator ride up would be slower so that you would have a better opportunity to see the changes to NYC that have evolved over the years. Found the photo op tacky and it should be eliminated.

If You Have to Pick One Observation Tower, THIS is the ONE!. This was amazing, history-making, and awe-inspiring! You get a view of the harbor and the city, I could have spent much more time just gazing out at the city from all vantage points. It's kind of expensive, so make sure you check Groupon and Living Social for deals before you go. We did not do that, only to discover we could have saved quite a bit!

"An Awe-Inspiring Experience!" . Myself and my family visited New York City in early August. This trip was a leisure trip to show my two nieces New York for the first time! Each time I visit New York, I love it even more than the last time I visited! On my previous trip to New York, The New World Trade Center (Freedom Tower) was under construction. I told myself then, that a visit once it opened would be at the top of my list!  On this trip with my nieces, One World Observatory was one of our first attractions we visited! And, what an amazing, awe-inspiring, thrill it was!! There were five people in our group, age ranges 15-61 years old, and we all thoroughly enjoyed One World Observatory! Out of all the things we did while in New York, this was everyone's favorite attraction!  One World Observatory is a must-see, world class attraction! The building itself is a sight to behold! Stunning and majestic in every way! The attention to every detail is stellar.  Our trip to the top flowed smoothly, and effortlessly through the lines of people, and we never felt like it was taking too long, moving too slowly, nor did we ever feel rushed. They have an express pass to the top (which we did not purchase), and I do not recommend the express pass because you will miss a very exciting part of the tour if you purchase this option!! We all felt like the lines flowed quickly, and we are glad we did not purchase the express pass!  One World Observatory is a truly amazing experience! The experience brought tears to my eyes and made me proud to be an American! I don't want to give too much of the experience away... Let me just say, it is a must see, worth every penny, and I would do it again in a heartbeat! Make sure it tops your list on your next trip to the Big Apple!!
Well done. They did a great job with creating the experience. I think the observatory was a little pricey for an attraction. Good activity for tourists

Excellent views. We were expecting long queues but went straight in. Too much extras pushed onto you. Why charge extra for the iPad option....why not have signs with the building names on it like all the tall building viewpoints in the world.
Good points
The view
The lift plays an amazing film for the duration up and down. Very neat.

perfect view. After standing on the twin towers for many times, we wanted to be on the new building, Also to remind the tragedy! They did a good job, it,s a remarkable place. Unfortunately there is no outside deck anymore, so pictures or movies are not the best quality. It's quite an experience to go up with the elevator to level 102.

Absolutely stunning. It was my first time to my boyfriends hometown, and it will not be the last. We couldn't travel back to norway before experience NY from above. We expected it to be very pricey, but it wasnt at all. There were no lines, and everything went very smooth and quickly. The tour was very nice, and the staff was very friendly. After the tour, we stayed back in the restaurant and had a lovely glass of wine and an appetizer. The restaurant was packed, but we didnt have to wait long to get service. A nice place to enjoy a breathtaking view of NY.

The best of the "top of a tall building" attractions in NYC. We've done Empire State and Top of the Rock. This was a lovely experience. Nice video intro (rather loud soundtrack), incredibly fast elevator up to floor 102, during which video is shown on a screen to show you where you are. A little frustrating that when you first get up there the windows are screened. Then finally they cut you loose, you go down one flight, and voila--unbelievable panoramic 360 degree views. The Statue of Liberty never looked so small (in stature, still big in our hearts). Wonderful guide Katie up at the top was providing information about the building and about other New York City topics, and facilitating debates amongst the kids about whether Titanosaurus is in fact the largest dinosaur. Thanks for everything Katie, you were the best. Also, if you didn't come in that way, it's worth peeking into the Oculus, the strange new transportation hub down below. The 9/11 memorial was very moving, but due to the kids sensitivity we only gave it a brief peek.
Great views. Definitely worth a trip up to the top of the Freedom Tower. Very touristy but the views are worth it if you go when the line is short.

Stunning and breath taking view of the city.... My friend and I visited the One World Observatory during our last visit and we loved every moment of it. First of we didn't know that if you pay with a MasterCard you get VIP entrance. Which is very nice when you go during peak season. You get to skip the long general admission line. the experience begins in the elevator...it will amaze you. Once you get to the top you will love the view. I know many saw it is similar to the Empire State Building i been there numerous times and the view from the OWO is yet my favorite. If you have not yet visited this amazingly beautiful building I highly recommend it.

What a view of New York. This is a must to see the views of the whole of New York from 100 floors up. Go in the afternoon to avoid queues. You can also eat in the restaurent at the top or get a drink. Looked good quality and not expensive.

A good experience!. -Elevator ride was super cool-Video montage of NYC that led to the reveal of the observatory deck was great!-Ticket prices fairly expensive-great 360 views of NYC but I think I prefer top of the rock better due to that it's more eye level with the rest of the city. One world towers over the city so you get a bird's overlook view-I also preferred that the Top of the Rock wasn't enclosed like One World is (all around glass coverage)-Over priced food items-Friendly staff-Overall a good experience and would definitely recommend to others-I suggest purchasing advance tickets and early morning start times to avoid the rush and long lines

Incredible view. You pay a serious price for the visit, but the view is unmatched. Kitschy, overpriced trinkets for sale on observatory level worth avoiding. Tablet visual guide ($15) provides brief audio and visual descriptions, is limited to mostly well known landmarks, and is best shared among family group.
Very simply designed attraction. Good view, location privilege and good height. However, I'd say top of the Rock and Empire State Building observatory are way classier.

Amazing!. Don't skip this! We booked online and picked a specific time (10am), Standard Admission, the cheapest price, $34. That worked FINE. We pretty much walked right in, through security, and to the AWESOME elevator ride. Wow! (wish I could've done that part twice) We got the ipad for $15--one for our group of 4--that told us what each building was. Probably not necessary, but I like to be in the know. The views are breathtaking, the building is beautiful, the technology is cool, and the guides inside, if you want to sit and listen or just keep an ear open, have GREAT info on NYC, lower Manhattan, and the WTC. When I did the Empire State years ago we waited in lines FOREVER. One World Observatory is WAY better. And you can see the Empire state from the view. :)

360 view was fantastic!. We went early in the morning and there were no lines. The trip from the first floor to the 101st was cool. They give you a video when you get to the 101st floor and at the end of the presentation the presentation wall raises and you see that you really are at the top of the world. It is a goose bump moment. You can enter a room that has a 360 degree view. Spectacular! You can spend as much time as you would like to look at the different directions.

Summer night Music was a bust. Let me begin by saying that I live in Manhattan and saw an ad in Time Out for music, sunset and drinks at the Observatory. The picture in the ad was a romantic couple dressed up with champagne. Upon arrival we were forced to take the tour and then finally arrived to the observatory at 6:10. Our scheduled entrance/ viewing time was 6:00 pm. Thinking that music started at 6:00pm. We were finally told that the music started at 7pm and the place was filled with kids and strollers. No area was roped off for the guests expecting drinks and live music. We waited till 7:15pm- still no music and then we left as we had dinner reservations for 7:45pm. It was such a huge disappointment- and a total rip off! We spoke to Kim Fitzgerald who was there representing the marketing team. She offered no refund and you could tell that they didn't care at all that the event was so badly planned. She said the event started at 6:00pm just in case someone wanted to get a drink and stare at the view for an hour prior. This event has solidified my feelings that the Freedom tower wants nothing to do with actual New Yorkers and is purely a tourist attraction. Avoid this place at all costs. The drinks were pathetic and all they care about is the tourists.

Touching Heaven. I've been to the top of The Empire State, Top Of The Rock but this is by far the most outstanding, breath-taking view of the city. Unlike the Empire State it is very spacious at the viewing levels with lots of room to take in the views and the captivating lift ride really sets the tone. To anyone visiting NYC this is a must.
Amazing!. The introduction before entering the observation floor is truly incredible. A great show! The views are amazing. Worth the visit!
Nice view. A little expensive. You can rent a tablet that gives you information about the buildings. Highlight was the interesting elevator ride that takes you through time.

Wow. Be ready for a suprise.having previously visited the empire state and top of the rock I had an idea in my head of what to expect. I was wrong it was above my expectations. Good staff and worth the money

WOW. The best way to see this incredible city. We purchased our tickets in advance so the queueing was a matter of minutes. The walk to the elevator offers slideshows, information and facts about the tower. The elevator itself is a bit special with the walls being screens which show spectacular graphics on the way up (which is very fast!) upon reaching the floor, you are directed into a room where you are told to face a wall to watch a rather dramatic video presentation with equally dramatic music. The presentation ends in an amazing way which I won't say here so as not to spoil it but if you have a camera or phone you may want to record the presentation until the end! After that, you are free to roam at your own pace to take in amazing 360 degree views of the city. You can spend as long as you want roaming around. Take your camera for some really great pictures.
Better than top of the rock. Fast moving queue. Get to the top pretty quick. Superb views of the city, Brooklyn, NJ, worth it. iPad guide for $15, you don't need it though.

One World Observatory......Beautiful....Well Worth It. One World Observatory is a trip well worth the money. It offers a spectacular view that goes on for miles. The observatory itself is enclosed with huge windows. The elevator ride up is a trip in itself. It goes so fast and so high, your ears will pop. Well worth it. And, right next door is the 911 memorial.

It left me speechless.... As you can see by the tittle of my review there isn't much for me to tell you.Just that those 32 or 34 dollars were so well spent at the Observatory.If I return to NYC on vacation again, I will certainly return to the One World Observatory.

Exceptional views of NYC. I'm not a fan of heights but have experienced The Shard in London and The Burj Khalifa in Dubai - this experience tops both. The trip up to the top takes a short moment but he lift makes the experience a pleasant one. The views are something else.

Awesome. The Americans definitely know how to do these attractions, great way to see the views of Manhattan & the surrounding districts of New York, great restaurant & bar at the top too, if I was being picky, the Windows could have been bigger for better photo shots, but maybe that's a structural thing I know little about, it's. Must do attraction in NY
