hawk eye view. seems surreal, when you are on the top your mind cant fathom that there is this actual city with each of the little building with people living and working in them. If you are in nyc, this is an unmissable place
An unforgettable experience. An unforgettable experience which is thoroughly enjoyed. Great views, lots of information for visitors, even the lift ride up is memorable. Unrivaled views of NYC.

you can see fooo eva!!. since this excursion is expensive --- be sure you have an absolutely cleat day. Also do your homework--there are discount opportunities which make the experience even better. Well organized movement of guests and interesting information when you get to the top.

A must do!!. As you walk up to the One World Trade Center, you see a very long line to enter.. Don't stress, this line goes very fast, and is worth every penny. Even if it is just for the elevator ride, which gives you an overview of the history of New York City. It has interactive ipads which allow you to zoom in and see attractions off into the distance. Just one little tip: Eat before you go.. Prices for food and drinks are astronomical

Worth a trip but admission is steep for what you get. For those who remember the original WTC observation deck - this is not that.The entire observatory is indoors (no rooftop access) and, while the views are spectacular, you can make a loop of the floor and be out in less than an hour. Basic admission is over $30pp and priority is over $50pp. We bought priority but there was no line when we got there so the basic people went up at the same time and saved $20. If there are big lines, it could be worth the extra cost. If you have a Mastercard you can buy a basic ticket and get it upgraded, but have to go to the booth to do it. Again - not an issue if there are no lines, but you take a chance.After going through security, you walk through an exhibit on the construction of the new building and get to the elevators. The elevator ride to the top was the coolest part. The walls of the elevator are screens which surround you with an evolving look at the surrounding area from the 1600s unitl today in one minute. You watch settlements form and farms and then office buildings, and skyscrapers until ultimately you reach the top, So well done.After leaving the elevators, they stop you to try to get people to rent an ipad for $15 which shows what you are looking at in multiple languages. Seemed like a needless novelty, and if you don't care about that, just walk past the people and head to the observation area. You will have to stop at a photo op station first, but it was quick.There is a gift shop, a snack bar and restaurant at the top as well. You have to buy admission to the deck to get access to the restaurant. Worth a visit, but was pricey for the experience.

A View of the Century. This is done the correct way. I was blown away and taken in Awww. From the elevator ride from Bedrock to the 102 floor the experience and use of technology was mind blowing. The experience and view was breathtaking. a bit pricey but well worth it. Purchase your tix online prior to arrival to avoid long lines.

Well worth doing. Pre book ticket, we had 5 pm tickets but got their at 3.30pm and went straight in missing the queues
Fantastic views over statue of liberty, manhattan skyline, brooklyn bridge etc
Need about 40 mins to 1 hr

A must visit!. Amazing views - better than the Empire State Building ( in my opinion)Very well managed - have a drink at the bar, you do not have to eat in the restaurant.The incredibly fast lift is brilliant!
Be ready. When you enter the elevator, get your video camera ready. Don't say I did not warn you :-)When at the observatory level, be prepared to be blown away by the views over NY.

Beautiful panoramic view from the Freedom Tower. We went there as soon as they opened on a Sunday morning so the lines/queues were really good. Once you're inside and up the top at that time of the morning there are plenty of time and space to take in the surrounding view. The sky was clear when we were there and we were able to get great views.If you get there before it opens there's a cafe pretty much across the road who do a great salmon and cream cheese bagel. Their coffee is a bit how you going though. Even before they allow you to line up you can go inside and buy your ticket/s, just go through the revolving doors.The 911 memorial is a must see, but upstairs maybe not so much as it's only through glass but still good if you can afford it and you have time.

"WOW!" is enough, but doesn't come close to doing it justice. My wife and I had been to the Empire State Building, and we visited the 9/11 Museum on an earlier visit this year, but wanted a clearer day to go to the top of One World Trade Center. We looked at the forecast, picked a date and time, and bought the tickets.There is a main entrance at street level (which we took in); however, there appears to be a way in from the Oculus level, as there is a way out that way. In either case, expect to have airport-like security- shoes stay on, but belts come off, pockets emptied, and bags all screened through an x-ray machine while you go through a metal detector. After that, you walk past projections on walls with vignettes about the building of the building; you also walk through passages dug through the bedrock as other facts are flashed on the rocks. You finally get to the elevator bank, enter a pod, and if you just close your eyes for the ride (less than 60 seconds!) you will miss a fantastic show on the elevator walls, showing what floor you are going past, how high up you are, and a look at how New York City looked at that height from about 1500 on.Your first stop at the top after your ears pop is a brief video feature about the city and the building of One World Trade Center (with a surprise twist ending). Next is a talk about where to go an a pitch to have you went a One World Explorer- an iPad that will show you what you are looking at on the screen, highlight some buildings/features, and in many cases allow you to get more information about them in a number of languages. It uses GPS technology to know which way you are looking (you may have to recalibrate it as you go, mine at least kept going off the mark)- if you know your city, you can skip this, but it does have some fun information on it. It also doesn't point out EVERY building/landmark, and it also appears to point out some you cannot see, like St. Patrick's Cathedral. Somewhere at or before this point you get to have your picture taken in front of a green screen; at the end of your time at the observation level you can view your picture and order it to be waiting for you at the bottom when you leave, a digital download is included in one package of two pictures.There is a restaurant / carry out area with a display of some historical items. There is a talk by a guide who an use a circular video wall (think "City on the Edge of Forever" from the original "Star Trek" series, but with the pictures on the ring instead of in the middle) to go into a bit more depth on various topics; that person and other guides are there to answer questions. There is a gift shop (surprise) at the exit to the elevators.Oh, the view, which is why you came up here in the first place. I'd say spectacular, but that would be an understatement. It was pretty impressive to be looking down at the hotel we were staying at, on the 47th floor, and see it was not even halfway up to where we were. It was a bit hazy otherwise we could have seen far north (I believe Bear Mountain can be seen from the top on a perfect day); the view of the bridges and the skyline (obviously) cannot be beat (although the iconic Empire State Building is in the same league).What will it cost? Our discount tickets up were $25 (normally about $35); the rental of the One World Explorer iPad was $15 (tax included); the set of two pictures was $27.18 (tax included). Note that it might be hard to get pictures out the windows depending on the lighting/reflection. But with the camera at or against the glass there does not seem to be much of a problem.

What a view. I would definitely advice to do this after the museum. The museum is amazing with so much time and thought put into it to really honour the fallen, but it could and probably will leave you feeling very sombre. We were glad to have the observatory to attend after to pick us up.Not too long of a process to get to the top although it could be if busy. We visited in February and therefore quieter. Once at the top the views are truey incredible. We were blown away!There is a shop at the top and also a restaurant/cafe. Well worth the visit.

Nice view but look through glas. The view you get over New York, New Jersey amd Brooklyn up there is beautiful. The only problem with the view is, that you see this all through glas. Another problem that comes with the glas is the light from insight. And when you visit the Observatory after the Sunset, you must hold you Camera against the glas, to not capture the people behind you instead of the city. Otherwise the tour is good thought out.
Beautiful Views. Loved the 360 views of NYC and NJ. We went mid-day on. Saturday and surprisingly it wasn't crowded nor long wait. It helped to have bought the ticket online ahead of time.
Absolutely breathtaking view. Better view than the Rock and well worth the trip downtown.. Absolutely breathtaking view. Better view in comparison to "The Rock" and well worth the trip downtown.

Amazing!!. The view from One World Observatory is amazing! You can see New York City in it's entirety. The elevator ride up and back down is really cool and it makes you forget how high you are actually going. We went early on a Sunday morning and it was not crowded when we arrived. However, when we left the Observatory was getting pretty busy. One World Observatory has the best views in the city!!

Better than Empire State Building. Another well thought out tourist attraction. 360 degree views inside. You can rent ipads to interact with and tell you the history of whatever you are looking at. The restaurant on the next level down was the best food I had on my whole trip!
A must see. You can simply see everything from the observation deck and I won't spoil the surprise but the elevator ride is a trip by itself.

Well worth the visit. . Went early for 09:30, no queues and straight to the top. Views were fantastic, looking out over towards the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. If you combine it with a trip out to Statue of Liberty and climb up that you get the view the other way!

Worth visiting. This gives you a fantastic view of Manhattan and the waterfront. The elevator ride is fun - while ascending they show you in very fast forward film how the area has developed from the first inhabitants came and up to now.There is a restaurant and bars at the top. We enjoyed a glass of wine while admiring the view.

Too little time for good view. It is as good as other high rise buildings.In the beginning they show a movie and opens that for an awesome view. But thye close it in no time. people standing behind wont even get a proper view.

Great 360 view of the world around NYC.. NYC trip for a day. last stop before we drove back. Went to the top of the new world trade at 6:00 pm and stayed there until sunset until all NYC was lit up. Was lucky to have a cloudless day. Mornings may not be good as the tower was foggy. Get your tickets before 7:00 pm and save as they jack up the prices at 7:00 as its a popular time to go. There is a bar and light meals with prices to match the height of the tower. 16 oz water bottle $5? There was a water fountain for free.

Great 360 view of all the city. The 360º view is great!! The elevator was amazing! We went to watch the sunset. The glass is a bit annoying to take photos because it reflects, but also is beautiful and can take very good pictures.

Best Attraction in New York!. Very cool Elevator ride up. Feels very short but pretty cool. Overall pretty organised... they move you along pretty quickly. We booked from my phone 15 minutes before arriving saving us a bit of money. It's not cheap but the views of Lower Manhattan are pretty priceless. So high up and so beautiful. If you're coming to New York a must for any tourist.

A must. Obviously, it's a must go...it's the most famous place in the world at this point. Very much love the fountains in the front, in the footprints of the old towers. Feel like they could have done more inside to be honest, but it's still a magnificent view...and the elevator ride is really cool.

Nice view and experience but not cheap!. The one world observatory is an interesting experience: From the foundation of the new WTC building through the elevator going through time while climbing up, to the launch of the visit made with a show. And the view, which is really great.The experience overall is better I would say than what used to be Windows on the World (restaurant with a view) and the top of the former WTC tower visits.However, the price of the visit is really expensive with more than 65$ for me and my 7 years oold son. The cost of picture of us taken upstairs was 20$, I decided to pass.The only benefit from the expensive price is that you don't have to wait. I went at 3 PM on a Monday, and I virtually had to wait 10 minutes from outside the building to inside the elevator!The only thing missing would be an outside platform. I did like it however. This remains a must-see in NYC.WTC forever.

A Must do in NYC. Great views of the City, but the elevator ride up is also very cool. Zipping up to the observation level the digitized sides of the elevator buildout the construct of the NYC skyline throughout history, even on a cloudy day it was still worth it. Definitely buy your tickets ahead of time so you can walk straight in.

Amazing views. Well worth a visit but at prices starting from $34 per person, could be expensive for larger parties. Also pre-book on line to get this cost but suggest doing it as late as possible having checked the weather first - booking weeks in advance means you are taking chances with the weather (clouds/rain will spoil the views but assured there is no wind affect).Entry to lifts is via airport style security and there are queues which you can skip if you go premium for an extra $22 per person. Depends on how valuable your time is as to whether this is worth it as it does get busy.Lifts get you to the top in 47seconds which is fast (not that you notice) and walls show you the story of New York's development in time lapse which is cool and very clever.Once in, you are given an introduction and then pitched the interactive I-pads which are pretty cool, but already out of date (through speed of development outside) and give overview of key landmarks only. Suggest you save your $15 and hunt out one of the floor walkers who are very knowlegable. Big Mike with the moustache is particularly good and happy to answer questions. Additionally there are presentations held in the north and south corners although we didn't listen to one.There is a restaurant on the upper level although we didn't eat there so no clue on the cost or quality. There is also usual merchandise and official green screen photos (why green screen?) if you are inclined.But ultimately you are there for the view! Stunning 360 views of the entire area which you can do at your leisure and they don't cram the floor so you can always get a window. The view up Manhatten to the north is especially breathtaking. If you are in New York, has to be on your 'to-do' list.Highly recommend but avoid the add-ons.
A MUST See !!!. It Is An ABSOLUTE Must See If Going To NYC . A Little Pricey But Worth It When It Opens Up & You See For Miles !!!

Beautiful views...............check the prices. The views are spectacular on a clear day but it is very costly and you have to purchase the screen for another fifteen dollars if you are unfamiliar with New York City.It is especially annoying to pay for timed tickets on days when there is little activity.I would go early and purchase just the regular tickets in the future. There were no lines on Monday August 22 and I overspent by 50 dollars for nothing

Incredible. This place is very clever - I won't spoil the surprise but once you go up in the lift and have the short video intro - what happens next will take your breath away. The views on the observation deck are 360! But the reflection on the glass when trying to take photos means that I much prefer top of the rock for iconic snaps. Superb visit.

On the top of the world at One World. One world observatory gives the best view of city. Despite of rush, the place is well managed, and you don't have to stand in queues for long. Elevators take you to 102nd floor in less than 30 seconds.Book your tickets in advance and take prime slots (during sun set). If you are travelling in group, go for family package tickets for group of 4. It would save few bucks.

Breath taking. The elevator was amazing! The informative presentation gave the place a warm touch. Before entering the observatory the introduction clip was amazing! You should bring your family here,

Peaceful and moving . Positioned within the plaza of the ground zero memorial of the 9/11 attacks, this huge building puts into perspective the size of the twin towers. The highly reflective glass means that the building itself almost disappears into the skyline and gives a sense of peace and reforming back into the city. Along with the Ground Zero memorial itself, this is certainly something to see

Great views, though not one for a rainy day. Slightly strange ascent to the top - I won't spoil it - and we weren't that impressed with it but the view from the top is something else entirely. The intro from hate top is also good but again I won't spoil it for the reader.It did rain an hour into the trip and it was strange to see rain from above !Restaurant was really expensive but a captive market.Would I go again, probably not because once you've seen the view that's it really.

Freedom tower. The newly built tower is a star attraction for every tourist to NY.Superfast lift takes us to the top of tower which provides panormic Eyeview of Manhattan/Newyork.A must see for every tourist to NY
fantastic views. unusual experience on the way up and fantastic views from the top.The tallest building in the western hemisphere.

Revisiting the top of the WTC. When out-of-towners would come to visit from the 70’s to the 90’s, I would take them to the top of the WTC. I have many photos from those trips. Returning to the top of One World Trade Center was bittersweet.Arrived on Monday 8/22/2016 at 7:00PM and purchased tickets on-site. I had heard the line can get very long but it wasn’t for us. There are informative and poignant video montages about the building of this New York City icon on the way to the elevator. You walk through the “bedrock” and onto the elevator where you see the growth of the skyline portrayed on the screened walls. The old North Tower, which would have been right next to this building, is glimpsed for a moment but it was a nice homage. This isn’t about 9/11. That’s for the museum down below.If anything, I miss being able to go outside on the roof like on the old tower. Taking photos through the windows with a lot of light reflection is the only option. The views were great on such a clear night. Other than not being able to go on the roof, my only gripe is the narrow areas of the building are aligned with the lower and upper part of Manhattan and are behind a video based info/demo area. This made for limited, direct, uptown and downtown viewing unless viewing at an angle.No matter. If visiting NYC, it’s a must!

What a view!!. The experience start the minute you hop in the elevator, starting with an amazing animation of the evolution of the city. It has an outstanding view, you are able to see extremely far away, but have in mind it is located in the south of Manhattan, in comparison to Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center), here you are not able to see the Central Park (probably the best attraction this city has to offer).

Amazing Views of the City and Beyond. The views from here are absolutely amazing and like nothing else that you can get in the city. Definitely strive for a clear day if you can. There is an option to rent an ipad that walks & talks you through all of the different attraction points that you can see and this is well worth the $10/15 it cost. It allows you to take your time and take in all that there is to see. A note of caution though that there is no mention/learning about 911 so if you're seeking that then be sure to visit Ground Zero Memorial.
Amazing!. OMG that was amaziiiing! The big video-wall with NYC-pics left everyone speechless! I would definitely do this again!

GORGEOUS 350 views. So beautiful! the Presentation going up to the observatory gave me goosebumps! the "reveal" really is so great! wont share anymore so you are surprised. Best time to go is right before sunset so you can enjoy a drink at the bar on top and capture the sunset from the 360 wrap around floor to ceiling windows!

You will not be disappointed about the vertical journey!. Try to avoid peak times which we did and went almost straight through to start the tour. You will be given a few retail 'opportunities' along the way but you can ignore these and just enjoy the fabulous views and experience. If you are an avid tall building collector this is a must see trip. Not going to give the game away but the elevator is journey is cool.
Eorth every penny. Amazing from the begining to the end. Since downstairs (the shopping) the elevator ride and all the "prosuction inside" amazing.
On top of the world. It gives beautiful view of Manhattan, River, Sea, and surroundings. worth visiting, if one is visiting New york city.

Amazing. Fantastic. The views are the best in New York. Very well presented. Taking the lift to the observatory is an event on its own. Spectacular 360 views. We had 12 and 9 year old with us, they also loved it.
Memories. Haven't been back since 9-11. It's amazing what they have done since that day. A great job honoring the people that lost their lives. A most if in the area.
What a view!. We went on a clear day and could see forever, the elevator ride is fantastic with led screen walls. Security was better than in an airport.

Worth a visit!. This is a must do in New York City. Amazing views around 360 degrees. Quite expensive to visit and then they offer on the top floor for extra cost a iPad like device to help identify the landmarks in the panoramic views.

Stunning exhinit. Wow, this far exceeded my expectations about an observatory viewing. The exhibit was well designed and the production value was amazing. Everything from the elevator ride that blows your I mind to the unveiling and lifting of the curtains. Just awesome. Oh yeah and the view...

Awesome. Awesome views....had birthday lunch at the very top with my husband ...the new building is beautiful and everyone put their heart and soul into rebuilding the WTC...we will never forget 9/11...continue to stay strong NYC!
Best Views in town. Althougth quite unconfortable, the views well worth be standing up for the whole tour. Do not expect tables or chairs for a coffe. All stand up, but a Must See.

Top of the World. Breathtaking view of the city...seemed more intimate and closer than the original world trade center observation deck....the elevator ride was 53 seconds to the top...the guides were helpful and informative. But expensive but worth the view.

Amazing views. Without knowing what to expect the visit did not disappoint from beginning to end. Stay near the elevator door for the ride up in order to take in the 60 second evolution of NYC on the elevator walls. The initial movie upon arrival was also a very cool surprise. Entering the observatory was amazing. Being able to see the city from EVERY angle. Watching the currents, seeing the planes, watching the boats, taking in the grid from above... I could have spent more time up there, listening to the knowledgeable guides at the north and south end. I always love learning more about the city and the experience certainly allowed for it.

Amazing. Don't miss the new observatory... impressive !And the 9/11 museumA wonderful testimony of american people resilianceBreathtaking view... You can buy your tickets with some other New York City attractions from the accredited vendors on the corner of 34th street and 6th ave. You'll save a few dollars

Breathtaking. We made reservations for a specific time, 9AM (opening), as we wanted to make sure we got to go up when we got there. We had no idea how crowded it would beIt was a terrific experience, whether you remember 9/11 or not. There's nothing really there to make the visitor think of the Trade Center bombings per se, so if you are a non-US visitor or a young child, the visit to the OWO will still be meaningful. But, if you do remember 9/11, this building will be even more meaningful. On the way up to the observation floors, elevator passengers are treated to a video of NY through the ages in about 60 seconds. Before entering the observation floors, the visitors get to clear their minds with a quick video. Then ... wowser ... the panoramic view is enough to take your breath away. Getting there @ 9AM means at first there aren't that many people, so it's easy to see out and down. Looking at NYC's boroughs from above distorts distances - at least it did for us - we thought "we can walk to __" then we realized it was much further than we thought. There are two observation levels and a couple of places to eat. We did not eat there, so I cannot comment on prices, food, or how tasty it is. We walked around the city, so to speak, a couple or three times. It is positively and totally terrific.

A must do!. I was a bit nervous but as soon as I got on the elevator I forgot all about them. The elevator goes up to 102nd floor but on the way up the walls change from the beginning of NYC being built to present. It helped my niece as well who hates elevators. Once at the top they show you a short presentation with a AMAZING ending. Then they send you out to view the panoramic views which are priceless.

Amazing!!!!. One of the best things we did in NYC. Only negative is you don't get a view of Central Park however what you do see makes up for this!!! It was fab!!! We used the iPad one world explorer at a cost of $15 but I wouldn't bother again, felt it was a money grabbing idea, we didn't gain anything from it. The shop and cafe are VERY overpriced.

Amazing views. Great 360 deg views of the New York city. Went early Saturday morning so avoided long lines. The elevator is 3rd fastest in the world and the movie experience is one of the best. World elite mastercard members get priority access for standard price so do avail it if you have one.

New York In The Clouds. The trip up to the Observatory is worth the trip. We had a beautiful day and could see all of New York City. The gravity of where you are really takes a hold of you when you gaze down and see the reflecting pools of the World Trade Centers 1 and 2. A moving and special experience!

Do It. Didn't know what expect but did this rather than Empire State or Top of the Rock. Wow. The multi media technology is impressive. The 60 second elevator ride with 360 degree video is followed by an impressive introduction on what to expect. The view is fantastic, you can see forever. Feel that signage for exit could be a little better, we seemed to be walking in circles on a few different levels to find the way out. Also Ipad tour guide was useful (US$ 15) but "how to use" not very well explained.
Fantastic . One of the best attractions in Downtown area for sure .. Very nice and clean ... And the views are awesome .. Definitely worth a visit A good tip is get your tickets online before you go

Lovely view of lower manhattan and surrounding island areas. Really nice 360 degree view but all glass enclosure so pictures are full of reflections from the glass. A stunning view from 100 plus floors above the financial district

Best View in the City. This giant work of architectural genius is exactly 1776 feet (not meters) tall and is the tallest building in the US. From the top you see straight down Manhattan, easily worth admission and then some. Caveat: don't buy the ipad no matter how cool it looks.
Spectacular view. Wonderful experience. Well worth visiting and seeing Manhattan from the aerial tower. Looking forwatprd to the completion of the skyscrapers that will fill the site.

A must see!. As a New Yorker, I have seen the building go up after the 9/11 devastation. I really enjoyed the "initial" process: going up the elevator and the presentation after you get off the elevator. The views are incredible. Make sure to get tickets in advance (especially during the peak tourist season), and hope for a clear sky.Finally, visit the WTC Memorial Museum which is a must-see.

It's high. It's cool to see something so magnificent in the shadow of Ground Zero. Views are amazing. Elevator rides are fun. A few too many sales pitches along the tour, though. We've already paid out money for admission so leave us alone.

Great view, high price to pay!. Amazing view of the city, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The elevator ride was fast and everything nice and new of course. The overlook is all enclosed wall to wall windows, kind of freaky when you are a little afraid of heights, but cool! $38 to go up to see the view I think is a little pricey when compared to the other lookout buildings.
Truly breath taking . This is one place, you simply, have to experience. The show at the top is amazing . The views spell binding. DO NOT VISIT NEW YORK WITHOUT SEEING THIS.

Great views . Have been to New York on numerous occasions but finally decided time to go up the tower. Went at 6pm on a Sunday and to our surprise no queues just the 2 of us in the elevator to start this journey. . Great video footage then in the theatre great in flight footage before lifting the screens and showing the breathtaking views. Onwards to the next stage and you get the sale of would you like more information get this ipad for 15 dollars unlimited time and it identifies the landmarks great if your first visit to new York. Otherwise I would give it a miss the coffee shop is a nice touch but standing only so a little disappointing you couldn't absorb the views with a coffee or beer. Would definitely recommend a visit great for all ages views are fabulous and on a clear day amazing

Sunset view is amazing! . I'm not going to compare it to Empire State building because I think each of them is a bit different on their own. The view is amazing but it is a bit difficult to take good photos on the phone. The best is to go towards the afternoon so you can see the sunset from there which was definitely a highlight for me. I had the best of day and night (views) which made it worth it for me.

Must Do when in NYC. Fantastic views over the city, very friendly staff, restaurant at the top is very good with good food at reasonable prices considering where you are. Poignant and sad given the tragic history, but a stunning experience worth visiting.

Unbelievable views. Fantastic though expensive! Quick security clearance and then very fast lift yo 102 floor. Incredible views! 35 dollars a head for 12 years and above so for a family of five - expensive hour!
NICE BUT PRICEY!!. Visited here when i visited NYC on business, went to the observatory with my family later in the day. Views were spectacular but very expensive - not sure if there are any coupons.

Be prepared to be dazzled!!. The entire experience from the moment you walk in, to the elevator ride, to the introductory talk, to the audio/visual tour is fabulous! The attention to detail is phenomenal and makes your visit totally worth it.
Stunning View. If you like to see the city from above this is a place where you must go. Full of history, Beautiful view of the city and neighborhood.

Breath Taking View. You were see some of the most outstanding views of Manhattan from the top of One World Trade. You get a different vantage point than you would from Empire State, or Rockefeller Centre. Views of both the Hudson, and the East River.

views were awesome. The views are awesome, but I didn't do well on this at all. I could feel the building moving and my son had a total panic attack as well. We didn't stay up very long, but if you don't have an issue with heights, then I highly recommend the view at least once. Even if you do have an issue, you should try it anyway:)

Quick queues and amazing views. For the attraction the queues weren't too bad to say we bought tickets at the venue. Pre booked had quicker access. After queuing outside there was a quick security check and another short queue before the lifts.Lifts were speedy but the in lift video display was too much! I couldn't look but sure plenty of folks will like it. Up on the observation floor we could see for miles due to the clear skies. Plenty of time too which was nice and never felt rushed. All in all a well run experience and this is from a guy absolutely feared of heights.

A memorial of the TWIN Towers. Visiting this place gave me goosebumps and the place refreshed my memory about those people who died from this very tragic event during 9/11. But making such memorial like this is a testimony of how people become ONE again after the event. I highly recommend that if you visit NYC put this in your bucket list to visit with.

A must do. Everything about this place is truly breathtaking. Even the lift of special, both on the way up and down, when it 'flies' you out of the tower and all around it. The views are incredible. Well worth a visit.

Breathtaking . This was a magnificent experience, from the staff to the views. He very scary claustrophobic elevator was neither scary, nor claustrophobic. It was genius. As were the lovely employees, gift shops and views. We will definitely be doing this again!

Absolutely incredbile. Wow! Just wow! Amazing views of the city with viewing all around the building. There is a wonderful surprise as you reach the top of the observatory, which I will not spoil!! I would recommend to do this if you visit New York. We hope to go back again one day and maybe do it again!

brilliant and impressive, it really is an impressive place, makes you reflect but also forces you to look forward!. truly impressive and inspirational building with the best vista's of NYC, it is more than a 'replacement' building it is a monument and you should definitely go here and be impressed!

A must see. I would recommend the One World Trade Centre Observatory but it is expensive about $65 per person. The lift itself is an experience because it includes a visual experience. I do not want to spoil the surprise but when you get to the top you get a breath taking experience. I would recommend this rather than the Top of the Rock if you can only afford or only have time to do one.

A ripoff . Spectacular view, however an overpriced greedy venture from the moment you pass the first security. At close to forty dollars a person, the price is excessive. For one individual it might be acceptable but for a family with teenagers it becomes a burden. Once at the top, there is a corralling off with pressure to rent an iPad full of digital information on the sights around the city. Chalk up yet another fifteen dollars. I declined. There is no truly outdoor portion and there is a portal on the floor which you can stand on with a movie loop apparently depicting the traffic below. Heavens help us of they were to show there actual traffic. The food concession stand prices are also overly inflated. Much can be forgiven through as the spectacle of the distant horizons is indeed thrilling. The best northerly view however is partially obscured by a large doughnut shaped information kiosk with a young overly enthusiastic person offering help and guidance. There is no mention of September 11 or the attacks, which is probably for the best given the sheer commerciality of this operation.

Overrated...go to. Empire State Building is way better simply for the fact that you actually go outside for the 360degree view. At one One World you are actually a few feet from the glass curtainwall and don't the full effect of seeing things below. The restaurant was average as well...the price didn't match the taste. Money better spent elsewhere. Time better spent at WTC Oculus...google it...it is an amazing structure. Go eat a Eataly (inside Oculus).
well worth it. It's got to be done - fabulous perspective on the greatest city on earth, and a well-organised visitor experience.

One World Observatory. Total let down! I was stoked to be at the new World Trade Center and to experience the attraction that I hoped would emphasize my patriotism and pride as I reflected on how 9/11 changed our lives. It started out good but once we actually got to the observation deck it was totally commercialized and any pride or patriotism that could have been present was sucked out of the event because of the atmosphere created by the greed associated with the overpriced crap for sale not to mention the views were crappy. If you want to reflect on 9/11 go to the memorial, if you want to experience the views of the skyline...go to the Empire State Building!

Incredible View of the New York Tri State Area. The elevator rides going to and from the observatory were very interesting as it show cases the history and development of the NYC skyline. The video presentation at the See Forever Theater was excellent to showcase the sights and sounds of NYC. The grand finale where the screens moved up to show the real skyline at the windows was also an excellent final touch before moving onto the observatory itself. There were plenty of staff around if help was needed, food and gift shop is a plus. The 360 degree view offers plenty of picture taking opportunities. It seems to get more crowded at night though.

Views are lovely but the attraction is so Disneyfied. The elevator is super fast and you have no sense that you are rising so quickly. The whole way they parade you through with ropes and partitions and rising screens along with the picture taking and hawking of ipads before allowing you to enter the observatory was off-putting. I still like the view from Top of the Rock best, and the ambience and history of Empire State Building better.

Breathtaking and Inspirational. A symbol of resolve and resiliency, 1 World Trade Center is a masterfully designed building and experience. Schedule your tour in advance as they tend to fill up quick. The experience starts as you approach the building. It is a beautiful building standing out as a symbol of resolve and remembrance. Once you enter you are able to walk though an exhibit of pictures and voices of the workers who built the tower and what they felt as they worked. Once you pass through that portion there is a spectacular elevator ride to the top observation deck. The elevator gives you a glimpse into the history of the city of New York since the beginning to today. The observation area is phenomenal. 360 degree views of the city are breathtaking. There are team members that put on discussions and talks if you are interested as well as an area to dine plus another area for purchasing gifts, if you are so inclined. Though we did not use it, you can rent an ipad that allows you to point at any part of the view and it will tell you what you are looking at, historical information, and much more interesting data. Would be worth it if you are able to spend the time to go through everything it has to offer. I highly recommend this site as a follow on to the 9/11 Memorial. It shows first the pain, then the triumph and resolve. Very powerful.

Amazing , breathtaking views!!. Right from the time you start your experience, you will be in awe of everything around you. The unique elevator ride, the informative movie before stepping into the viewing gallery all add to the experience in a perfect way. And not to mention the views of new york, new jersey. We could also easily spot the statue of liberty. We timed our visit in a way so that we could see the views in daylight as well as the whole city light up at night. I would suggest a time of 7/7:30 to enjoy both the views( in summer). My parents who were first time tourists in new york were mesmerized. As for the price there are packages available for families which are certainly wallet friendly and also the ticket price in itself is economical for a one time experience. Definitely a must visit while in new york.
Amazing. Great views of nyc and the hudson, although a fairly short trip it was most definetely worth it. Great view of ground zero too

Breathtaking!. Visited the One World Observatory with my wife and we both absolutely loved it! From the lift journey to floor 102 to the pre-observatory video to the actual view itself - it was brilliant!Very well organised from start to finish, with the lifts properly controlled and the volume of people managed carefully.There was no time pressure when at the top, plus there was a cafe (rather pricey of course!) and a gift shop too.There is no outside viewing - it's all indoors but that doesn't detract from the experience.It's a must-visit attraction if you're in New York!

Amazing views but out-of-the-ordinary expensive on add-ons.. Definitely worth a visit, but keep it simple. Just buy a ticket to go up to the observation deck and skip the iPad tutorial and the photo option. Also, do not buy some drinks or food in the bar. Prices are way over the top !! But again,...... the views are amazing and obviously it has something special because this building was the replacement for the WTC buildings,.......

What an amazing way to see downtown. The view from up here is spectacular. The view is 360 degrees of all of downtown, Brooklyn, NJ and beyond. It was worth it and breathtaking! We were not lucky enough to score the living social deal but the next day one was on there so check websites.

Fantastic. I have to admit I was feeling nervous before our visit! No need to be, it was a wonderful experience, worth every cent! We went at 1000 on a Sunday morning, no lines, went straight in. The views are incredible and the elevator ride up and down was amazing. Thoroughly reccommend

The best experience and views, even better than the Empire state building.. This building has by far, the best views of NY. This building is not only beautiful, new, and interesting but it offers the best views ever.. Different form ESB and TOTR, definitely prefer this. We went in at 9:00 p.m. which I belive was the best time since there was hardly anyone else there. In sum, and after visiting the crowded and over rated empire state building, the One World observatory puts every other Manhattan building to shame. Do yourself a favor, and go here before visitng the empire state building, you won't regret it.
Wow. The view from the top was unbelievable. Really stunning building wonderful all round views. A definite MUST. Had some really nice gifts.

Incredible!. I think I still have a smile on my face a week after visiting the One World Observatory. We only had 3 hours in NYC and the 911 memorial plaza was the highest priority of our time. After the plaza we went up to the observatory in the One World Trade Center. I had never been to NYC and I feel like I got as good of a taste as I could in the short time we were there. This was worth every penny. Highly recommended.

Amazing panoramic views of Manhattan, Brooklyn and New Jersey. Starting with a unique ride in an elevator which uses floor to ceiling LED technology to take you on a journey through 500 years of New York evolution, you are transported 100 floors to the observatory where you can take in a fabulous panaromic view of Manhattan, Brooklyn and New Jersey

Awesome!!!. This was fantastic!!! The elevator ride was an unexpected bonus, detailing the history of the construction of the tower/s. The kids, 9 & 11, really loved the interactive ipads which enabled them to look up information on the buildings they were looking at. A shame we had to pay extra for those though. Amazing views! I recommend about an hour to visit, however that wouldn't include time to line up.

Great place, military gets free admissions, . Millions of times we had been to NYC but this is the first time we actually decided to c the observation desk at One World Trade Center. Absolutely fantastic. The animations inside the elevators, the entire story of why and how and what exactly those men and women achieved since 9/11. A great place for a new start on our most hallowed ground.That's why I have to add this now for all military (active duty members like me) and their families and especially for ONE person from Texas who complained about a $2 military discount here on June 15th. First: that's NOT true, military (active duty) were always free here, I heard it from all my comrades in central PA and I visited the One WTC today, Sat Aug 20th 2016 and got FREE admission, my wife got $3 off, this is really really appreciated! So I never heard about a $2 discount for military, now as of today it's FREE!!I cannot imagine how much it might cost to run a place like this, all those enthusiastic employees working in a building which stands for everything our great nations values... That's why here comes...... Second: how do people DARE to complain about Discounts. Especially YOU Sir from Texas??That is absolutely disgraceful and shows that we still have to many people in our service who give a damn and needs some discipline. A discount is a benefit , it's like a gift, u get it or u don't. This building on our most hallowed grounds needs $$ to b able to give everybody the opportunity to enjoy this spectacular view and that's all what trip advisor is about what Mr Texas doesn't understand, to give a feedback about this wonderful place which my wife and I really enjoyed. Shame on everybody who complains about discounts!!! That's extremely unamerican.This is a great place, I give full 5 points and not just 1 point like a guy from Texas did cause of being unappreciated. LOL

Good view but expensive. The views are great but it is a bit over priced at $37. You can also rent an iPad that helps identify the buildings for another $15. We went at about 5:00 on a Friday evening and there was almost no line.

Pessoas than expected. The experience is not as good as expected for a few reasons:1. Over the top sales pitches (the picture, the ipads, the 'experiences' circles);2. The glass is not anti-reflection - pictures not as good as they could;3. The best areas for pictures are occupied by the above mentioned 'experiences' circles.Only plus point - the elevator rides.

Ellen. This is breathtaking! I encourage you to take an evening tour and plan to watch the sunset from the bar/restaurant. The peach sangria is divine and the sunset is so beautiful. Be sure to book this one for your NYC trip!

The ultimate 360º view of NYC!. We went with my wife for her birthday and it couldn't be any other than perfect. Remember to watch the whether so you'll find the best day to see the whole picture.Pros:360º view of NYCA really high view of NYCCool idea for the elevatorWell organizediPad guide is helpfulThere's no time limitGreat restaurant on the upper mezzanine Easy to reach by subway and busCons:Shop is expensive but has some cool stuff

Cool But I Liked The Empire State Building Better. We were excited to get to the top of the World Trade Centre tower as the last time we were in New York it was just starting construction. The views are definitely very good however I enjoyed the Empire State Building more as you were able to be outside. The tour is not inexpensive but not totally crazy priced like other attractions in NYC but make sure you bring water with you as you don't want to pay $5 for a small water at the top. Talk about great margins as you can buy the same bottle for $1 on the street. The elevator ride to the top was definitely the coolest thing about the tour.
Great views. Great views interesting and worth doing. Different form ESB and TOTR, definitely prefer this. We went in the morning but it would be good to try and book a sunset slot.

Very impressive and made to be interesting and exciting. The modern use of digital and technology makes the Museum of Natural History look dated and ancient! This is a great example of updated museum design - the flow and helpful staff and the tour itself makes it seem interesting rather than taking people to one floor and looking around and leaving. Great site!

Definately a must if its your first trip to NYC. This building is just amazing and the price to enter wasn't too bad either. The tour went fast and smooth without too much waiting or standing in lines. The resturaunt located on the top has a view to die for, great selection of beer from many local micro breweries and good food with a descent amount of choices. Definately worth the visit.
Visiting Ground Zero - A Must Visit. When visiting New York and you visit Ground Zero you must come here to understand the scale of what happened here.It opened my eyes.

Must-do for your New York trip!. If you're in New York, you HAVE to do this. It's worth every penny. Leave yourself plenty of time to get the full experience both inside the observatory and also around the WTC Memorial/Museum.

A must place to visit if you want the best view of Nyc . This elevator takes you up to the tallest building in New York. The whole city is overlooked from the top of the building. The best way to go up there is to take a cab and get to the commercial center beige entering the one worls trade center. It's quicker and less queues. The restaurants at the commercial centers are fabulous.

Weather is key to a great view. It is a bit pricey, but I bought my tix online beforehand and found a nice promotion on the One World Observatory website. Since we were there on a Monday, we didn't bother with the priority admission upcharge. There was no line for ticket holders when we arrived. It was a gorgeous day with clear views of both the Hudson and East Rivers. My kids were excited by the helicopters flying at eye level, the commuter ferries to NJ and Staten Island, etc. I enjoyed the short movie about the building of One World and remembered the falling of the Twin towers, though the movie didn't really mention it. There are plenty of opportunities to spend more than necessary to have a great time, but it is worth a look.
The Top of the World!. After a few moments of deliberation regarding heights and speed, made the choice to "just do it". Wonderful, uplifting experience.
Interesting. The elevator ride was one of the high points. They kept the lines moving and the view was amazing. A little pricey, but I would recommend going at least once.

The elevator ride !. Great views, that's for sure, but from behind glass unlike the Rockefeller Center. But the real reason to go is for the elevator ride . . . not so much up, as down. Not for those who don't like heights much, but the sensation created by visual effects is simply stunning. Better than an 'E' ride at Disneyland !

brilliant views. The experience begins in the lifts (fantastic). Great views at the top but the only small point would be the reflection on glass when trying to take photos or video. This is well worth doing. Souvenirs at the top are very expensive for what they are. Overall this should not be missed. Great views, great lift experience.

Great view, a must see. Buy your tickets in advance on line. If you go early in the day its less crowded. The elevator ride up to the top is really fast. Magnificent view; friendly staff, very clean! Good attraction for touristsIf one day I go again, I will choose to go during Sunset

An unforgettable experience!. On June 1, 2016, we had the pleasure of going to the top of the One World Observatory. Our feeling of awe began as soon as the elevator started going up. No one made a sound, but was completely captured by what we were seeing on the walls of the elevator. Once we got on top of the observatory, my breath was taken away by the scenery. I'm not going into any detail ....it's a must see, and when I go back to New York, I'm going again!

What a tower.... The beauty of this tower, inside and out, staggered me. Standing at the base of it, it appears to disappear into infinity as the mirror-like exterior reflects the sky. Even the lift-ride up impresses - 3 sides of the walls of the lift depict the build up of New York from its earliest settlers to how it stands today. Then the big reveal comes, and the view presented. You'll love it.

Rip off. Don't get me wrong, you have a nice view being on the 100th floor of a magneficent new building. The view is amazing.BUT as a tourist you expect to make some beautiful pictures to show to friends and family.Sorry for all of those who expect this. You are behind glass, and the glass is highly reflective. 40$ and not able to make a decent picture. pffff

Excellent views, amazing building, a bit pricey. The views from the observatory are amazing and the tower itself is an amazing building to behold, the ride up in the elevator has been superbly done. Knowing you are standing near the top of the tallest building in the Northern Hemisphere is also pretty cool!However, having visited both OWO and the Top of the Rock, the Top of the Rock edges it because of it being right in the middle of all the major buildings/sights you want to see. OWO does give a great view of the mid town skyline and out across to Liberty Island and Brooklyn but if you can only do one I would choose Top of the Rock.I think part of my reasoning apart from the location, is that OWO felt literally like they were trying to take more money at every opportunity. I wouldn't bother with the extra $15 for the iPad viewfinder guide if you know the key skyscrapers to look for.We had a bite to eat at the cafe and I expected it to be pricey as they have a captive audience, so swallowed the fact that it cost $6 for a muffin but $5 for a small bottle of water is not acceptable.

Spectacular Views. On my visit I enjoyed spectacular views of NYC. From the East River to the Hudson River, from the Statue of Liberty to Ellis Island, and all the bridges connecting Manhattan to the outside boroughs. The elevator ride was fast and interesting.

One of a kind views! A must visit! . The One World Observatory offers the most amazing, unique views of NYC. If you enjoy the Empire State Building experience you'll absolutely love OWO. The price is on the higher side, especially for a family with children, but totally worth it. Once you get to the top, via an awesome interactive elevator ride, there are guides, info, and interactive displays. We will most definitely return in the future!

Stunning 360 degree views over Manhattan and beyond. This is a must coming to NYC for the first time. I was there in January, the weather was fantastic, cold but clear views forever! Absolutely a 360 degree view on 2 levels, just breathtaking. You will not regret this. Also, come in the off season to forego the long lines...(Also not recommended in cloudy, foggy, rainy weather!)
Top of the City. This was really a great view of the city. I suggest purchasing your ticket online before you get there, so you don't have to stand in line.

Born from the ashes. Loved the new World Trade - great views of the entire area. Loved the elevator ride up with the movie of the growth of NY over the years. Enjoyed the visit. Not cheap, but if you want a great view this is it.

Inspiring . Perhaps the one and only landmark I'd wanted to visit since the rebuilding of the WTC complex taking the One World Observatory experience was breath taking.Simply standing at the foot of The Freedom Tower creates a feeling of eerie wonder and presence which commands respect. Staring up the magnificent structure is like gazing to the stars aside a seemingly never ending steel vertical.The lift ride is a mere 60 seconds from ground floor to the observatory deck. Within that lift are surround screens telling the story of all the efforts of each person who made this iconic building a reality following 9/11. The view from the deck is beyond any description I can cast. A stunning view of New York from every conceivable angle. Is like nothing else I've experience prior to. If you are lucky enough to to visit NYC this is a must on anybody's bucket list. Be sure to visit the 9/11 memorial fountains / museum too. Truly brings the wonder together as a compete story of tragedy to triumph.

World third Tallest. Man made Everest.! ;) kidding thoughBut yes not less than that. Watch the entire new york from a 1250 ft of observation deck. And you will be reaching that height with the help of world's fastest Elevators. If you are not afraid of heights then bang it.!
Weekend Visit. Not like Windows on the World, but One Mix had great views and friendly bartenders. The highlight of our visit.

Puts Empire State to shame!. Very well thought out attraction - the big reveal when you first get up there is incredible! The interactive iPads are a great idea too if a little steep at $15 when you've paid $37 each to go up there in the first place!

University Trip. This is a great place to see New York by going to the top of the new world trade centre. I was lucky enough to be in New York whilst it had snowed and the snow made the views of New York look amazing.
Obligation. Everybody, who is visitting the New York city, has to visit the One World Observatory. Incredible breathtaking experience and views.

Great view. Well worth a visit.We were fortunate to arrive at a time with no queues. I suggest you check this out as it looks like the One World Observatory can get very busy. The views are excellent. My only criticism is that the cafe does not have sit down seating, just standing.

Awesome!. This is a must see. Beautiful view! This was a great experience and well worth the admission fee. Everything from ticket purchase to the express elevator ride was well organized and smooth operating. No long lines or wait times. Just beatifful and would certainly visit again!

The New Westfield Shopping Plaza. Recently opened ! We checked out the brand new shopping center at one World Trade Center. With only a portion of the stores open and just a few restaurants, it's easily accessible from the street, subway or path. A leisurely stroll down the west concord you find yourself at Brookfield Plaza, this too has an amazing amount of restaurants and shops. A nice outing for a day out of the sun or rain.

Worth Paying to Go To. I loved the time at One World Observatory. Well worth it. You will get a great view of the Statue of Liberty and lower New York City. Having also visited the Empire State Building, both offer great views of the different parts of New York City If you are wanting to see more of midtown from high above, you will be better suited to do the Empire State Building. But if you want to see lower Manhattan you need to visit One World.

Beautiful view but pricey.. You get a great view of NYC but pay $37 for a ticket? That's way too much. Not only that, they want you to pay for an iPad that tells you about different buildings in NYC. I think it was at least another $10. This is obviously a money-sucking building even with a great view of NYC.

Amazing Experience!. I had a great time at One World Observatory. The views are breathtaking! Everything underneath seems so small (even Statue of Liberty). We didn't book any tickets in advance, but yet were able to get them pretty fast (in about 10 minutes), considering that it was a Saturday in July. The line was not long, and moving fast. A must-see site in NYC!

Amazing views in an amazing building. Booked tickets online for 9:30. Arrived early and there were no queues. Your experience starts as soon as you leave the security area. Walk through the granite, the building is built upon you have a wonderful elevator ride to the observation area.You then have a small visual introduction before getting let loose in the observation area.Needless to say the views are amazing.It may seem prices to isn't but it is well worth it.

Hazy Downtown. Visited at lunchtime. There was a queue of about 10 minutes to purchase walk-in tickets. We were advised that the haze would restrict views to 3-4 miles, but our tickets - which, at $37, are more expensive than the other observatories - were promptly marked with 'zero visibility'.You might expect that discounted tickets would be offered if visibility is poor. On this occasion, things did improve somewhat over the course of our viewing. The view from midtown skyscrapers is arguably better, but this is the largest building in the Western Hemisphere and it was somewhat less crowded and easier to get around. There was also a very enthusiastic speaker who spoke about some of the things to see and do in NYC.
very nice. Very very high building. Views comparable with Empire and Rockefeller observation decks. I think from the other ones it's better to admire NY

Great. We were warned that the queueing would be horrendous.but we got in within 20 mins.saw the videos,at the bottom,and foundation rock.fast lift to floor 100 in 60secs.fantastic views of Hudson River,staten island,Ellis island,and Statue of Liberty.enjoy this thoroughly.
Night view. The 102 floor gives you astounding views of New york city. You can see all three bridges (BMW apparently) and the skyline of the city as well as a bit of Jersey.

Beautiful views but not enought atmosphere. I have visited the observation deck of the Empire State Building and the Rockefeller Centre before coming to One World Observatory.The view from this observation deck is marvelous. No question! It is nice that you can walk around with a 360° view of NYC. Also the floor to ceiling windows helps seeing a lot. In comparison to the other two observation decks I was missing some atmosphere though. I didn't like the fact that One World Observation is not open air and that you are always surrounded by glass (one fact why I preffer Top of the Rock). The glass windows also make it really hard to take nice pictures. It is worth a visit but next time I go to Top of the Rock again.
Excellent - must do. I don't want to review too heavily and spoil it for potential visitors - but the price is well worth the view/experience! A must do when site seeing in NYC

Awesome view. Went at sunset and had premium tickets. Travelled with 3 children. Booked online so no queue for the tickets. We were let in slightly early as well. The elevator was excellent and the kids loved it. At the top view was awesome. It was busy but not oppressive. Worth a visit definitely but premium tickets not worth it in my opinion.

Best view of Manhattan! . This probably has the best view of Manhattan and also Brooklyn and the water. This is now the tallest building in New York! One bad thing is that you can't see Central Park, but you could go on the Empire State Building for that!

It was just amazing so well done a credit to the people who worked on it and to the memory of those who didn't make it. I was awed by the experience tight from the start in the lift when you saw New York as farmland and then the beautiful buildings as they appeared The two men who gave talks were inspiring and very informative about it all

Wow. Good Job. I have been to Top of the Rock, Empire State and the old WTC. This was a great visit and wonderful views. Security was tight but quick and I liked them having guides at the top to tell you other things to do in NYC. The Apple Ipad was a bit over the top in terms of cost. But for the best view of the city, choose the World Trade Center Observatory and book on line first.

Amazing views of the city. Amazing views from the highest viewpoint in the city and a real must for first time visitors. The only disappointment was that it was difficult to get good photo's due to the reflection from the glass.

This is a bucket list venue: you've gotta go, but the experience itself is not that thrilling. I went on a Tuesday at about 1PM in August. There was not much of a line outside (just as well because the weather was sweltering); still it was over 30 minutes before I got my ticket, waited for my group to enter and could take the elevator up. The cost is $35 - rather steep, in my opinion, and then they try to get you to rent their augmented reality iPads and get your picture taken to add substantially to that total. But they are not terribly pushy, and if you just want to take in the view and take a few shots, you are welcome to do so. The thing of it is that it is very far away from eveything. You do see the Statue of Liberty, but really tiny. The Midtown Manhattan skyline is there in all its glory, but a little too far away for great viewing. So, in my opinion, it was worth it for checking off the One World Trade Center view from the top on a bucket list. I'm glad I went, but I don't need to return.

Disappointing. . We went there a day after doing the Empire State Building and were very disappointed. There is no time left for imagination. All is organized, supervised. The view is great but the way the visit is organized, is killing our enthusiasm.

Don't miss it!. I don't want to ruin the surprise effect of this place, what I can tell you is they didn't forget any details, the view is out of this word.Some tips: be on time, if your online reservation says 6pm, you will get in the elevator at 6pm.Try to get there by sunset, see the city getting lighting up is very cool.There is a coffee place at the observatory, not that cheap!Get your tickets online! you will avoid any possible line.Enjoy it!

Beautiful Attraction!!!. My family was visiting from Chicago via Baltimore. Building was beautiful. Lots of interactive information. Cafe, gift shop. Only negative was the weather, view from top was a little foggy and we were only in NYC for the day. Afterwards we walked to see the beautiful memorial of former World Trade Towers.

Tourist Trap. This place has better security than the Pentagon, no joke. It was actually ridiculous. Full body scanners like the airport, full X-ray or all bags, I was shocked we weren't all strip searched. I was screamed at for wearing a bangle, the same bangle which had managed to get into the USA from Australia, past all the other security, but it was somehow a huge risk here. Finally after our quick frisk were were off to the top! Or actually, a long dark corridor or stuff to show how they built the tower. Finally squashed into the lifts with no room to move and about 15 new close friends we were off to the top! The lift has screens which show images, great if you don't get motion sick or can actually see them between the crowd. at last the top! Nope, still not there. We were literally pushed into lines like sheep and made to watch some video about the city. The one we were all at, and had experienced just moments before. People need to realise these screens are not fun for people with eye problems who cannot see and feel sick from quick moving things with 3d effects. After some nauseated moments the screen dramatically disappeared and we saw the view. Ok, this is it, we are finally free. Nope. Pushed again we had to watch a sales pitch about $15 iPad rentals. What! No! So we walked again and finally were allowed to go off and look at the view, 45 minutes after entering the building. Absolutely ridiculous. A waste of time. There is food and drink available up the top but no where to sit so good luck with that.

I visited my first time NY City in 1975 accompanied by my (former) English teacher. I finished my school in 1974/75 and travelled to NY City and to the USA. I liked my English teacher very much (very beautiful young woman) and asked her to accompany me to NY City and to travel with me all over the USA.It was a phantatsic experience for me in my youth as a young man of 18-19 ys. to travel with a young very beautiful woman of 28- 32 ys. who had been my English teacher in my school.We enjoyed NY City very much, visited many interesting places. Of courses we visited the (old) WTC Center. I can really recommend you to visit the new WTC Center! It's really worth to take at least 2-3 hs. for the visit! Maybe you will visit it twice. You'll enjoy the phtantastic view from the top of this building!After our trip thru NY City we travelled all over the USA where we visited our family from the German grandfather. They live almost in the New England States and in Florida. After the family visits we travelled to the West Coast to visit San Francisco and the Bay Area, and L.A.I liked my (former) English teacher very much, but we unfortunately lost out of sight: she got married and became a mother of 2kids - I began my studies of business administration and engineering at a Technical University in Germany.Some 15 - 20 ys. later we met again and there was still this magic between us, but she was a married mother of 2 kids. - Ce la vie! That's life!

Enthralling Building. Very insightful and interesting observatory with stunning views across NYC, very tall too. It was good to see the memory of twin towers lives on through the observatory. Must see attraction.
So Humbling.... A must see if you travel to NYC to never forget the 9/11 tragedy. You feel so many different emotions when walking around. A great lesson for our next generation as well.

Well run & a great visit. We went last evening and the Observation area is really well organized , for entry and circulation.The elevator ride up and down are very cool and of course the view is awesome

Breathtaking. As a lifelong New Yorker, this took my breath away. A must do! Exquisite view of the city, the staff were very friendly and ensure that you have a great experience. My favorite part was after watching the film, the screen rises and you see the view for the first time and it is awe-inspiring. We went for my son's 9th Birthday, and he said loved it. I would recommend getting the tablet as there is so much history in the city to learn about. My son loved the interaction. Wonderful experience, well done!

Birthday Trip for my Husband. So this is a little spendy (even for New York) at about $50 a person to go up to the observation deck I was not jazzed about the price, but upon reaching the top, the view is BREATHTAKING. Really fascinating and very tech-friendly. Great for taking pictures if you go early evening and wait until night. The city is amazing and you can see EVERYTHING for Miles! Excellent views of Mid-town Manhattan and the financial district.If you are hungry there is even a little bistro at the top along with a restaurant for you to have a bite in. But beware, just like the price of admission, the food, along with any merchandise in One World is really spendy.
The view of my life. Go there, and for the love of God buy the sunset ticket. Fantastic bar with an excellent wine and drink selection, my all time greatest tourist experience.

Simply breath taking . As the title suggests, simply breath taking. The views are fantastic, 360 across the whole of New York and mikes beyond. The staff are an asset to the whole set up and nothing is any trouble for them. There a education areas on the viewing deck that really do open the mind. One of the fun aspects is the elevator rides up the the tower. Well thought out

Beautiful views of the city. Pricey admission (save a few dollars and buy tickets online) but it's a neat experience, and gorgeous views of NYC. They say on a clear day you can see 25 miles. The day we visited it was hazy and visibility was only 5 miles, but still great photo ops of the city. They tell you at the desk before you buy the tix what the visibility is, so you can always choose not to go if you feel it's not a good day for it. They show some nice video intros to the experience.

Brilliant views. DO NOT hire the I pads they push onto you, total waste of money - they do not work, staff give no training and could not care a jot in helping you once they have taken your money !!Take your time, you will see for miles and can easily pick out the famous buildings and landmarks.

Exceptional views from the top. Having done Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock, I have to say that this is my favourite. They all have different views of the city of New York, but here you can see it all. The draw backs are that they try to get you to hire the electronic guide which if you're a real enthusiast would be an extra $15 on top of the $34 entrance fee. You might think it's worth it, but I didn't. Again, they try to take your photos that you can buy at the end for another $20 but a selfie is much more economical and more genuine than your body being superimposed onto an image of the views. I love NYC and this is the highest point you can get to. So pleased they rebuilt the World Trade Centre. Definitely worth a visit to see the memorial site outside, especially the reflection pools.

Good total package. On one of the hottest days of the year One World Observatory was one of the best activities to do! Elevator ride up was very fun and unique, presentation was great, and, of course, the views from the top were fantastic! Can't comment on the iPads since we opted not to take them, but would recommend getting priority admission ticket to avoid any lines. Also do yourself a favor and search online for some discount deals on those tickets and get them up to 20% cheaper what they cost.
Stunning. As always NYC has it all!! stunning views , amazing space.. I live in NY and I enjoyed every view I really loved the elevator video

New approach to the observatories!. Of course, the view of NY from 100th floor is spectacular! But what I liked the most about this place is that it provides you not only panorama view on NY, it tries to do that in the most entertaining way. This is absolutely different approach from the one in Rockefeller building and Empire State Building. Observatory offers amazing experience while riding the elevator, than after, with a short movie and finally there are two spots where guides are telling interesting stories about life and history of NY. I highly recommend to come around 30 minutes before sunset so you can see both, daytime and night NY. The tickets are a little expensive, but we got 20% discount for the week day, which we found just googling. Also, if you can, buy tickets online - so you can save additional 3$ for each ticket.

Good as part of the overall memorial Visit. The OneDine restaurant is on 101st floor of the new One World Trade Centre building. Entry requires buying the Observatory Deck ticket, you get to do the viewing deck experience too. The views from the restaurant seating are good but from the observatory deck better. The food is good, waiter served and comfortable. It's open plan with the observatory below so noisy/lively. Do note that this is NOT 'fine dining' like the John Hancock, Chicago or Shard, London or Peninsular, Hong Kong. More Bistro and casual dining with no dress code, which is good for lunch etc. as part of the tour. If you are only interested in a posh meal this is not fit you, and spend half as much at street level. Overall a visit to the memorial, museum, the observatory and lunch is a very nice way to spend 3-4 hours and we enjoyed it very much. Worth a visit.

You SHOULD go!!!. I know many places in NW, but this one is just INCREDIBLE !!!Better time do go, in my opinion is between 7:15 to 8:15 pm, then you can enjoy the sunset and the lights in all Manhattan.Have fun!

See forever as advertised. Must see for visitors of the 911 Memorial. It is uplifting and of course has an amazing view of the city. Restaurant and bar at the top is great. We saw the sunset, awesome.

First time (have done empire and rock). Amazing views, just a word of advice , contrary to website instructions you DO NOT need to waste time and paper and ink printing your ticket, it is 2016 and your phone can be scanned :)

Great observation deck. Good value ($34) and a lot quicker to access than ESB and TOTR. We were there around 3pm midweek and were at the top within 20 minutes.Elevator has a twist with 360 video as you go up.Views breathtaking, no outdoor area but not really needed due to the size of the windows.Staff do try to sell you ipad with information on but we skipped this.
Fantastic. What a view and experiance, the lift ride is amazing. Fantastic views from the top well worth going up all of N Y and beyont.
A Fabulous View of NYC!. What a fabulous spot. Great views of NYC. It can get really busy here so get there early to get unobstructed views of the city!

MUST GO. By hearing so much about it - positive and negative - I was curious but I was amazed! You see Manhattan from totally different views and the beginning when they lift the curtain is just breathtaking.

Family Holiday. Visited as part of our trip to 9/11. Well worth a visit with plenty to see and do. represents also evidence of New York's hope and confidence. We also visited the near by financial district, including Wall Street, as part of this visit.

Amazing!!!. It's absolutely stunning how a tragedy of such magnitude could be taken to this level of excellence, passion, and remembrance. Every step of the experience takes you to another level, and lets you learn about this amazing city and its resillience. The food is quite expensive and the service at the sandwich shop is not very goid. Other than that, the hosts are amazing and incredibly knowledgeable, the ushers are service oriented from the first step theough the doors.

Amazing!. Really worth doing for the elevator ride alone and the surprise film when you get out at the top. Tastefully and respectfully done. I wouldn't bother with the iPad you can hire though, as it was glitchy and only showed a couple of dozen places. Can probably get an app to highlight important buildings instead. Go early to avoid queues.

VIP tickets. We paid for VIP tickets thinking that you get what you pay for. Definitely not the case here. It is not worth the extra money. Once you get up in the elevator you have push around people to get pictures or just be able to see the sights. Then returning back to the main floor, you get in line with everyone else. The bar tenders were just so unfriendly. Not a smile to be had among them and at 12 dollars a beer, better off going around the corner to the local pub

What a view!!. Amazing bldg with even more amazing views. The ride in the elevators is quick and easy and the flow of people is organized and moves along smoothly. The restaurant at the top is a bit pricey but affords you the opportunity to sit down and really enjoy the view.
Worth the money. Make sure there is good weather so you can see everything...you get a 360 degree view of NYC from so high up. It it worth the money for this.
It was breathtaking!. My family and I really enjoyed the One World Observatory, the views were amazing! We purchased our tickets ahead of time so we did avoid the long lines.

Stunning. This was our favourite visit in NYC. It's very well managed from the moment you get in the elevator to take you up. Visibility was at 25 miles on the day we went up. Absolutely breathtaking, we did hire the iPad and as I suspected it wasn't worth it!

Awe Inspiring . Obviously the views are great. A few of the best views (e.g. The Statue of Liberty) were obstructed from straight on by support structures and video shows.
