It was a magical birthday and my wife loved it.I would recommend this to anyone visiting the city.

Freedom Tower. BEAUTIFUL view... Breathtaking ... Must do in New York ... We went in the afternoon and there was no wait to buy tickets or to get thru the lines... You do go thru security similar to the airport

Impressive but pricey if you don't book in advance. Having visited The World Trade Centre back in 2000, this was an emotional experience as memories of 9/11 were with me on this visit. The proximity of the Reflecting Pools is also a sad reminder - but very beautiful.So, the new building is, of course, very impressive up close and the handling of tourists seems well organised and efficient. We paid extra for the 'fast-track' which made it very expensive, but it was a hot day and we didn't want to queue outside too long.I found the staff rather brash and insensitive to the reason why this building is here. At every turn, you are greeted by young people trying to sell you something all done as if they are auditioning for a Broadway show. It's like organised sugging (though the approach is informative, the payoff is always that they want you to spend more).The 'reveal' at the top is impressive though I do wonder why the feel the need to prevent you from seeing out of the windows in certain areas. Of course, the views are amazing and New York is truly beautiful seen from this perspective. You can walk right up to the full-height windows and get some great photographs and you don't feel as if you're being hurried.I personally prefer the view from The Rockefeller Centre, but would recommend a visit to One World Observatory providing you book in advance and try to get the best deal.

FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience of seeing New York City from the One World Observatory. You can rent (recommended) an iPad which gives you names of buildings and what you are looking at which was extremely helpful. When you are a visitor to NYC and don't know the landmarks, this device was most useful. Congratulations on the way the staff coordinated the crowds.
Nearly out of this world!. Absolutely amazing views and elevators! :-) We visited the Empire State and Top of the Rock yesterday and they were both great, but One World is in a class of it's own!

A must-see! . The One World Observatory is a world-class attraction! The 360 -degree views on a clear day are stunning and they alone are worth the price of admission. But our visit (at 10:15am on a busy summer Tues) was superlative in every other way, too: the limited admission (pre-ordered tickets recommended) keeps the crowds manageable, and the clean, welcoming and informative presentation creates a very positive atmosphere that remains respectful of former events at the site. We also found the staff throughout the facility to be extremely friendly and helpful. Overall we highly recommend a visit!

Even native New Yorkers can be amazed!. The pricey ($32 pp) observatory needed a full four hours to do it justice. As NYers, born, raised, educated and lived in NY, the sight from 102 stories gave us a new perspective with views unmatched anywhere. Once is enough, but keep walking around, lest you miss something.
worth a visit to take in the beauty of the building. worth a visit to take in the beauty of the building, its probably a better building to be taking picture of though, not from
I CAN SEE FOREVER!. Fabulous views of Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. I loved the elevator ride to the top....very historical.
One World Observatory. A must for anyone visiting New York City. The views are fantastic. The lift going to the top is a show in itself so enjoy.

Breathtaking Views. We loved the One World Observatory! It was set up so well from the timed entries, to the incredible elevator ride where they show Manhattan growing over the years (wish we could have been in it by ourselves to see it all), to the breathtaking views! Definitely bring your camera! The cafe and gift shops were pricey, but expected. I would plan to eat and buy souvenirs at other locations. I highly recommend going to the One World Observatory, along with Top of the Rock. Between both buildings, you will see the majority of Manhattan.

Just another view from a tall building. Nothing special here. It's just another view from 400m up in the sky. You will see what you expect to see. Been there on a Tuesday evening. The place was not crowded and everything is well organized.
You can safely try this one.
top of the world. I have been to this observatory. It was terrific. The views of New York are amazing. Try To go on a clear day. I got some great shots of the Hudson river. Worth a visit

My Favourite Observatory By Far. Being to lots of Observatories around the world, this one if by far the BEST. From the elevator up which we were lucky enough to have only 4 of us in there, Its nice to see how much thought has been put in.From getting out of the lift to watch the video, to the surprise (which I wont spoil), it was great. The views from here are by far the best, everything can be seen. I also like the viewing platform they have on the floor, with video screens which shows the roads with cars driving. Its like you are standing on a glass roof. The only reason why I have not given 5 out of 5, its the ridiculous pricing at the bar. For 2 drinks, I paid over $50!!!!!It was certainly a shock to me and my wallet!

Amazing views of NYC. The elevator ride up is quite incredible. The walls show a visual evolution of the city from its beginning to today.The views from the observation floor are amazing. Daylight and evening views are equally spectacular. If you are an amateur photographer, be prepared to wait for the best viewing spots, but it is worth it!

Beautiful Presentation. The view is spectacular (though a bit South from everything); the thing that really impressed me is the amount of thought that went into the overall experience. From the elevator ride up to the 100th floor, to the presentation before the observation deck, everything was thought out for a great user experience in mind!

Unique and Interesting, but.... ... recognize that this is wholly and completed unrelated to 9/11. As long as you go in with realistic expectations, this is likely worth doing -- once. The elevator ride is fascinating, but it's difficult to see the images if the elevator is full. Employees need a lesson in customer service. The optional "iPad" device is not worth the $15 rental fee.

Excellent, A Better Choice. This is THE observation deck to do, not ESB. Much less crowded and the area is MUCH larger, making it easy to get your spot at the window. It's better looking thru tinted windows as it cuts the haze and glare down substantially. The views are better here too as there is more to see downtown than at midtown. You can see the bay, statue of Liberty, many other tall buildings, brooklyn bridge etc. Pricier than ESB but very much worth it. Go here and skip Empire State Building

Great views, a bit trashy. You cannot go past the views of the wider New York area from here. They are spectacular. It is a great place to visit in tandem with top of the rock where you will see much more of Manhattan and Central Park etc. However there is quite a bit of trashy/touristy promotion at One World, which we found unnecessary and a bit tiresome but I guess they feel you need to get something for your money with adult prices starting at $37! Look out for the automatic 18% gratuity in the bar/restaurant too.
Can't miss in Ny. Clearly a great view on a memorable location. The iPad tour adds little value. The rest is impressive and well organised. Shop is overpriced as can be expected on such location.

Great experience. Excellent viewsA lot of effort put into graphics on your journey up to the deckWell priced professional photos compared to other places (2 photos for $25)Interactive iPads giving historical information and up close images of sites being observedFriendly staff

Beautiful and Emotional. I worked at WTC in the mid 90s and lived through 911, this was our first visit to the WTC site and was a very intense and emotional visit. The elevator ride is awesome and the presentation at the top was beautiful and very well done.

Spectacular Views. There are no better views of New York than from the top of the Freedom Tower! You feel as though you can see the curvature of the earth. Truly spectacular and it must be done at least once in a lifetime! However, the dining is extraordinarily expensive, limited and only mediocre. There is no seating if you are eating at the café. I would suggest eating somewhere else.

beautiful view. Wait to buy tickets. Our tickets were not able to use for the time we had because there was no visibility with our pre purchased tickets. After talking to some people they said we could use them for a future time, when we came back to do this. We were told that is not correct and were told we had to go to customer service who wanted to charge us extra fees. Luckily someone did override this, but this would have been avoided if we bought tickets at the box office when we knew it was good visiiblity. We had no idea that sometimes there is no visibility, which should be clearly explained. Once you buy the tickets there is no refund even if there is no visilibity at the time of your tickets, so beware of this.

Breathtaking Observation Deck. Not only are the views spectacular from the World Trade Center Observation Deck, but the overall visit is overwhelmingly exceptional. From the moment you step onto the elevator to the top be prepared for a breathtaking, impressive experience.

One World - One Word - AMAZING!. We visited the memorial 3 years ago and the observatory was not complete. We visited again since we close to the area. Thankfully we did. The ticket prices are very high. $42.00 per person however once we entered the elevator, it made sense. The only negative were the windows. The windows are dingy which is to be expected however they should have use a better glass. Pictures are very hard to take through the glass. Otherwise - an amazing time.

ELEVATOR ride was AMAZING!. I, of course, enjoyed the 360 degree views at the top, HOWEVER, the best part of the visit for me was the elevator ride up to the top. The second best was the short film they show you before they let you into the observation deck. It was so amazing!

TOTALLY NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!. We went on a beautiful day and was able to see very far out, however, the view was just not worth the money we paid for it. We think the most they should charge for this one hour visit is fifteen dollars. Paying more than that is not worth it for a New Yorker. Most of us know the Shpiel that the guides are giving.Perhaps they should charge $15.00 admission and keep the $15.00 charge for the guide laptop.

Great views of NYC and the surrounding area!. I was able to get a discount ticket using the MC Monday special. I waiting in line for about 4 minutes before we were let inside and it was quick and easy to get thru the security checkpoint. After walking past some exhibits they elevator ride was really quick and I enjoyed seeing the video that was presented. The video that you see after the elevator ride was very good and it is neat how the wall raised up to reveal the windows.I did not get the iPad that you can rent for $15 because I know a lot about NYC but I saw others using it and it looks pretty cool and would be nice for those not familiar with the area. You definitely want to go when the weather is clear as you can see for miles!I never found any problems with getting to the window as people would roam around to the different views.I found that I could have easily seen what I wanted to in about 30 minutes but I can also see how you can spend close to an hour as well, especially if you rent the iPad.The only reason I would go back would be to see the nighttime view or to attend with others.
Superb!. The views when the screen drops are exceptional. Much better experience than Empire State Building. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Great views. Amazing views at the top, and it's very well organised, and not too crowded. Only complaint is that the reflections in the glass spoil your photos. Also the best views are obscured by the ring of screens - really stupid. However if you go up just before sunset and then go to One Dine - just for a drink at the bar, you have an amazing view of the sun going down whilst sipping something nice- very special.

Wow..... A must do experience . We did this at 9pm for the last hour mid week and this worked perfectly, no queues and not many people up top. The staff were very friendly and you are whisked up to over 100 floors in about 47 seconds!Try and have your back to the doors in the lift to experience the video walls on 3 sides... Down as well as up...The nighttime views were just fantastic....

Beats Top Of the Rock. Visited for my birthday. It was so much better than I thought it would be. The view was tremendous. You could see all the way across the city, up the West side HWY, across the waters to staten island and all the way to Queens. I got the ipad that they rented (it was a bit helpful to identify a few buildings I wasnt familiar with but put it aside after 10 min. Unsure if it was worth renting. I enjoyed the presentations by the guides. The big Info wheels were awesome. I would definitely recommend this to everyone visiting the city and all New Yorkers who simply enjoy visiting the city in which we all live. I loved it!!

Amazing!. We pre-booked a priority admission which was well worth it, the ride up in the lift was brilliant and the views amazing, never seen anything like it before! It spoilt all the other visits we did after to Rockefeller and Empire State as they were not as good.Cafe at top is overpriced, no seating, just standing at tables - seats in restaurant only. Fabulous views but we were lucky and had a clear sunny day.
One world. Spectacular; it is worth visiting for sure. The ticket is a little expensive though! Make sure to stay for the night view.

Fantastic City Views. A must if you are in NYC. The whole tour is set up in a very educational manner and I thought the prices were fair. It's a busy place on the weekends, no telling what it is like during the week. We went on a Sunday but got right in. We enjoyed the tour and opted out of the $15 rental of an iPad that gave you more info. We just wanted to see the city. There is a little gift shop and a restaurant to buy food. We spent no other money other than what we spent to get in. There is a 360 degree view and once you get through the presentation, you get your view. The tour does not talk of the past but seems to have a moving forward message. There is a photo opt and a photo package they have for sale, we opted out of that too just because we didn't like our picture. My kids are older and did not really appreciate what they were seeing but they were not bored at all. They really did like moving around and looking out and were amazed at the buildings below.

Amazing!. We did the 9/11 memorial in the morning and this in the afternoon. After a somber experience this tour is extremely uplifting! The rebirth of the skyline, the hard work and dedication of all those involved is quite evident. A lot of fun and it makes you proud of your fellow countrymen. We ate lunch at the restaurant which was a lot of fun, not many chances in life to break bread at 1,200ft!
Absolute MUST. This is a great attraction for any age group and is very educational and enjoyable. The value for the price paid is perfect. It is very well run and has so much to offer

Manhattan @ sunset. Don't purchase the VIP tickets. It's a waist of money. You are able to go to the front of the line @ the security check point, but after that you have to wait on line just like everyone else. Ample space to walk around, not a lot of sitting. Restaurant is more for adults, not child friendly. Staff needs to be re-train, not friendly at all.

Nice but OK. This was OK. Just another tall building. Beautiful but just OK. The elevator was interesting and when you get to the top, they try to sell you a laptop rental for $15. We did not take it. In some towers they have boards with labels to point out what buildings we are looking at. Not here since they want to get another $15 from your pocket.

One World Trade: Not to be missed!!. As a local to the tri-state region, a few friends and myself decided to check out this amazing new building. We got there around 12 and preordered tickets. This expedited lines in the beginning. After going through security and up a really cool, interactive elevator, we got to the top and the true experience begins. A small video and amazing sights. This is truly a fun experience and well worth the money. There were minor waits to get back down, but nothing crazy. If you are local or a visitor, I highly recommend this attraction. A truly out of this world experience!

Absolutely brilliant experience . Fabulous experience - from the entrance to exit, everything was done well and with care. The flow of people was done brilliantly so you never felt like you were waiting. The entry to the observation deck was amazing- I won't give it away! Only complaint was the cost of drinks instead. $5.50 for a small bottle of water!

Modern tall building with 360 view. This building is worth to visit. As the highest building in NY, it offers perfect view to see the entire city and surroundings... There is an interactive guide using ipad which is enjoyable for my kids. Also, it is save because all cover by glasses, so there is no open window.
Brilliant again. Visited the twin towers 30 years ago amazing. So sad about the terrorist attack. Was good to come back and visit again. Terrific views and the iPad was very useful. Spectacular day

Super Modern Adventure!. I had been to the top of the original World Trade Center so I was anxious to experience the new World Trade Center. I took my son into NYC for his birthday and he loves skyscrapers so he was excited as well. I booked the tickets online very easily. I spent the extra money to get the express passes because I did not know how long the lines would be and since my son has ADHD, I did not want to be waiting in long lines. When you buy the tickets online, you have to select a time, which is different then the Empire State Building, which does not require a time slot. We arrived and immediately bypassed the first line of people buying tickets onsite. Because we had the express pass, we were given wristbands so we could bypass the lines. But the lines were not very long so was there much time saved, probably not. They lines seemed to move more swiftly than at the Empire State Building. The elevator ride up was completely awesome...I don't want to give it away but it was one of the coolest parts of the trip. As soon as you get off the elevator, they usher you into a room for a short movie, then to another room to try to sell you their iPad rentals (no thanks!) and then off to the observatory. Very spacious, lots of room to move around. They had a guy giving a presentation but we did not sit around for that. They also have a souvenir shop, snack bar and full service restaurant available. Pros - the views are magnificent. Never felt cramped or was never waiting too long to get a particular view. Cons - It's all inside, which is not terrible in the middle of summer in mid-90 degree heat but the outdoor deck is what draws you to the Empire State Building. The snack bar food was AWFUL! I got a BLT wrap and my son got a grilled cheese plus two bags of chips $30. My wrap had (and I almost hate to say this) but too much bacon. I couldn't even eat half of it. So would I recommend it...sure. It's a bucket list place to go. I would probably go back one more time to take my daughter but other than that, I am good. Been there, done that...

Get ready for the elevator ride.. Best part of trip is the elevator ride up and down. You watch how lower Manhattan evolved over the centuries. Don't order the ipads for informational viewing. They are not updated on the new buildings around lower Manhattan, and the don't detail everything. very disappointed to have to pay $15 extra for the device and not get much for it.

If you can only go up one tall building in New York make it this one.. If you can only go up one tall building in New York then you better make it this one. The whole experience is fantastic and the 360 views are stunning.
Vacation. The view is stunning. Too bad the entry is so expensive. It´s not easy for a family to afford bringing their children.The stuff in the souvenir shop was really expensive as well.

My new favourite place for a view of the city. Great visit - and a great view of the southern end of Manhattan, that you won't get anywhere else. The elevator ride is also amazing - it's fun to see how the city as expanded over the many years. ... make sure you stand as close to the elevatordoors as possible to get the best view of the movie as you go up.

Sight to see. This was a little disappointing. I really didn't know what to expect. I thought there would be more seating to sit and enjoy the view. The scenery is beyond description - must see yourself. Recommend buying the iPad.Very neat to see.

If you see nothing else in NYC see this. First I am terrified of heights, but the way this observatory is set up it is not at all scary. Secondly, you can rent for a small fee a tablet that rotates with you and gives you information about all you are seeing around you all the way to New Jersey, so visiting here is a great way to see iconic sites, and also get an idea of what else you might want to see.The staff here from the docents, tour guides, elevator operators, and ticket sellers are friendly and knowledgeable. The memorials built in the footprints of the twin towers are at the bottom of this beautiful observatory are beyond words. It appears they could not have done a better job with this site of such tragedy.

Awesome View . Came here around 9:00 in the morning. We bought our tickets online but there wasn't a wait so we were able to get right in. If you are wanting to go later in the day I would recommend buying them online that way you won't have to wait in line for as long. Both elevator rides were pretty cool with the video screens. Once upstairs they play a video that builds the suspense and then you get to see the view. I recommend wearing dark colors this day because light colors reflect off the glass and then you see yourself in the picture instead of the view. The view was awesome even through that day we went was slightly cloudy you could still see everything.

Best View in NYC. The elevator ride is incredible and makes your ears pop! You are then greeted with a fantastic video culminating the the reveal of the best view in New York.Ushered through into the next room, you are offered the option to rent an iPad which gives information on certain buildings when you point it at them out of the 360 degree viewing window. A cool idea and at only $15 it seems worthwhile. Having rented the iPad we soon discovered that there are guides on the top floor that are very knowledgeable about the surrounding buildings, and whilst a cool technological piece, the human guides trump the iPad.Watch out for Fontaine, he is a particularly fantastic fellow in the observatory and knows everything you could possibly want to ask. He also has some great personal stories to share. It seems expensive at $37 but honestly well worthwhile.Only thing that would be better is if they offered family pricing discounts.

An outstanding presentation. I don't know if we were just there at a good time or not (around 10am on a weekday), but I would not recommend getting 'skip the line' tickets because there was no line. Perhaps if you are going for the sunset, it would help, but we just walked right to the ticket counter with no wait. The presentation from start to finish is excellent, well thought-out and beautifully done. From the visitor statistics at the entrance to the walk through of the foundation stone model to the videos going up the elevator - everything was fabulous. The presentation at the top was truly the best and then you get to wander for as long as you like, looking at the amazing views. Even at the top, they had interesting video presentations and plenty of people walking around to help you find landmarks, etc. I would highly recommend this as a whole NYC experience not to be missed.

Breathtaking Views. I was disappointed there wasn't an outdoor viewing area, still, it's the WTC and a must see. Seeing the footprints of the original towers was breathtaking. Careful, if you go after dark it is beautiful, but photos through the glass capture a great deal of glare and reflection. I don't know if it would be different during the day. There's also a number of up sells along the way (photo, explorer tablet thingy, etc.) It was still a once in a lifetime opportunity I'm glad I did. Oh, the elevator is super fast and awesome.

Stellar views and a wonderful way to cap off a visit to the 9/11 site. We enjoyed the visit to the One World Observatory, and the views are absolutely amazing. The entire experience was tastefully and thoughtfully done with information on the workers and design behind the building, and it's role and place in this post-9/11 world.

Fantastic view of the whole of NYC. Not only of the burroughs, but also the views not seen from the street (as the tourist), roof gardens, street grids. Also the elevator up was a surpricing experience - not just a fast elevator ride. We went on a Friday at 10AM, no que, friendly staff.
Very emotional experience. I've been at this site several times since 9/11. The completed tower, sculptures, reflection pools, etc make you feel that we can recover and be stronger than ever.

Great city views!. We bought our tickets on line for a timed entry, but were allowed in early which was great-no lines to wait in. Security check was like an airport, but was efficient. The elevator ride up was very quick and showed the development of NYC landscape over time-very impressive (wish I could do this again-it went too fast- should have videoed it!). There was a short film when you arrived at the top, which was really more of a lead in to the spectacular city view (at the end of the film, the screen went up and there was the amazing NYC skyline). We had purchased the iPad option in advance (one iPad for the family of 4), which was very convenient to have done ahead of time and we did not have to wait like the crowds who had just come up the elevator to purchase. Had to work out some family sharing rules, but one iPad worked for the four of us.The iPad was good to orient you to where the points of interest were located. I found it very helpful. There were also some videos on the iPad about some, but not all, the points of interest displayed on the iPad screen. The city view displayed on the iPad changed to your current view as you moved around the large observatory with 360 views. One World is likely the best observation point in NYC as you can see so many points of interest including Lady Liberty and Ellis Island clearly from here (we have previously been up the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock).There were also short interpretative talks on the city skyline going on periodically during our visit for free. We stopped to listen to some, and they were interesting, but honestly if you are interested in knowing and understanding the NYC skyline, the iPad was way more convenient and helpful.We had lunch in the cafe ( there is both a cafe and a sit down restaurant at the top). The cafe is cheaper than the restaurant, the food we good. Points to know: the cafe has only stand up tables to eat at, but with an amazing view. Also, a bottle of water was close to $5, so we got minimal drinks here and rehydrated after we exited. I found the food price was Ok, pizza the size of a dinner plate was about $12-$13.Our family really enjoyed our visit.

Lunch and drinks with the best view of NYC!. Once you get to the top and recover from being treated like a herd of sheep with a matching IQ.......its certainly worth the bother! Amazing views of NYC...we got a table in the restaurant and ordered so,e amazing food with cocktails and sat there for hours taking in the breathtaking views!

360 View of New York City on 102th floor!!. When you need to go to 102th floor using elevator one thing come up on your mind is how long it takes? So when we do try this elevator after we pay $72/person its take only 30 seconds to getting on 102th floor. Inside elevator you will suprised with a 'view' from elevator's wall. The wall is not ordinary wall its plasma screen show how NYC build from years ago.After you come out you can fell that the building is moving, yes its. Its move around 3 to 6 inches depend on how strong the wind outside. Can you imagine it? Then another big screen showing history before the curtain moving and show NYC from 102th floor. Its free wife, you can borrow ipad for free on that floor showing more about one world observatory, there is small coffee shop and of course payable picture's man will take ur picture.The view is 360, you can see New Jersey and Bronx from there also Liberty. Better you bring small telescope to see around. Going down need 25 seconds. Better coming at summer to see clearly. Have fun fellas. And make America Great again.
First time visit. . Great views from the top. Very informative tour as well, everything was great from the elevator ride to the top and the food. A+ job.

Amazing views. Expensive to visit but worth it for the experience. he lift journey alone was an attraction. One on the observation deck you have great views of NYC and beyond. Free wifi available too, called my Mum on FaceTime from the top to show off :-)
Wonderful experience. Great views at twilight and felt much less crowded than Empire State. Beautiful building on the outside and friendly staff on the inside. Definitely a " must see " in NYC.

Must do. The views from the top are amazing, with a 360 degree view of Manhattan. We booked our trip for 7, to be just before sunset. We therefore got great daytime views and then we watched as the city lights started to come on after sunset. The initial ride in the lift was very fast, a bit ear popping at the top after about 40 seconds. The view at the top when they open the curtain is amazing.

Proud. We visited One World Observatory on a Sunday morning. We pre-bought our tickets and everything ran really efficiently. I thought that the lines, and security all moved very smoothly. It did not take us very long at all to get to the observatory level. Everything has been very well thought out. The layout is tactfully, and beautifully done. Once you arrive at the observatory floor it is very spacious and spread out and you do not feel crowded. There is a gift shop on the same level as the observatory that you can enjoy as well. Unfortunately, we did not have time to explore other areas of the Trade Center such as the restaurant etc. but hope to come back to see more areas.
The new one. Amazing building with an elevator where shows New York in the last years. Incredible view of Big Apple.
Amazing!. The views from observatory is amazing. The lift ride from bottom is also unique and worth seeing. 360 degree view of New York city, one of the MUST DO things...

Amazing First View!. The way they display the view from the top to you is absolutely breathtaking - I shed a tear! Do not Google this - don't spoil the surprise!We didn't queue to go up and the lift is very quick. We had a cocktail in the bar at the top - expensive but a nice addition.The view is absolutely incredible, a real difference to the view you see from the Rockefella Centre further up Manhattan and I found it very emotional looking down to the 9/11 Memorial Fountains.I have given 4* as there is no outside space here which I was expecting, it is a 360° viewing platform but does have some interesting live information points throughout.

We hit all of the skyscraper observation decks on our visit to NYC and this was the best.. This is the new New York City! Everything is modern and efficient. The views are great. Lines move efficiently and staff are helpful and courteous. We enjoyed some of the others too, but no trip to NYC would be complete without checking out the view from the top of the One World Observatory. The visit to the 9/11 Memorial is tough, but worthwhile. The One World Observatory adds balance and inspiration.

Tips from a first timer . A few tips:1. The observatory is enclosed (not open-air like the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock). 2. Make your reservation online (we did this same day). Make a reservation that assigns you a time slot. 3. Prices are $34 each, $32 for seniors, $28 for youth (6-12), and free for children (5 and under). 4. You will be able to choose a time slot. I recommend a time during sunset. We went at 8pm and it was perfect. 5. Have your video cameras ready for the elevator ride up to the observatory. 6. Allow 10-20 minutes to walk from the Fulton subway station. 7. There will be a line for each time slot. Arrive at least a few minutes before your reservation.
The view is brilliant. My favorite of all the sky scrapers in NYC, the lift experience is amazing taking you to the top,and once there the view on a clear day is breathtaking.

Incredible view. The building and elevator ride were fabulous and the view at the top breathtaking. Expensive - so If I had to choose between this and Top of the Rock I'd definitely go with the Rock, as you are outside and it feels more real. Don't go on a cloudy day!

Too expensive for a family. The last time I was in NYC I went up to the observatory on the World Trade Center. With this new building I wanted to take my family but at $37 per person it was too expensive. I ended up just taking a few of us up. In order to help justify the expense they begin the experience with a short multimedia presentation and present the skyline in a dramatic fashion. Even the trip up in the elevator is a part of the experience with 3 walls being ceiling to floor screens. Once on the floor you have access to all sides. There are also a few presenters on mic in the corners if you would like addition info on the city.

One of a kind experience. As others have said, yes it's a bit pricey. But, the views are incredible - and it is the most unusual elevator ride you'll ever have!The fact that the view is as high as the twin towers makes it emotional and very moving. The view is better than from the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock and, at least when we were there, had more space so better able to handle crowds.Highly recommend!

Better than Empire State Building. We had a choice to go up in the One World Observatory or the Empire State Building and a friend of ours said to do the One World. Glad we did! We thought it offered a much better view of the NY skyline, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Brooklyn, etc. And funny thing is, we never eat at cafes at these types of places...but we had a snack up there and it was really good!

One of the best July 4th celebration's ever. My friends and I visited One World Observatory to join in the July 4th celebration's. What an excellent experience!! From the elevator ride (one of a kind!) to arrival on the observation floor and then the 4th of July celebration party, I don't think the fun ended till after the fireworks over the East River (sight to behold from the 102nd floor of the Freedom Tower!!). Beautiful building and kind staff made this one of our best stops in MYC

Feel high. I would like to recommend One World Observatory to everybody who visits New York, although they charge high amount $34 per person. No need to visit Empire State Building, as I did in the past. It is the tallest building in Western Hemisphere.

AMAZING AND EMOTIONAL!!. What a wonderful place to visit. I am so glad my family and I did this tour. It was emotional and informative. You can not put into words how great this experience was. I would recommend this to every person who is visiting NYC! The 360 degree view of Manhattan was out of this world!!
Breathtaking Views. Well done ! The spectacular presentation as the curtain rises on your first glimpse of the city is breathtaking! Then the 360 degree vision only makes it even better!

Great view. Great view from the top. Expensive but you can see all around New York. Make sure the visibility is good before going up or you won't see much. They really made the viewing area very nice and spacious. Good to see once.

Very good . Have been to a few observatories however this stands out in a few counts. Prima facie the sheer feel of being at WTC us unnerving and exciting simultaneously. Moreover the city view from the rooftop is remarkable. And the theatre leading to the curtain raising moment elevates the experience. I will rank it higher than the current #17.

WAUW!. OK, I was in Dubai before, so I have been in a higher building, but the way NYC have built the experience to up, live the surroundings from the top and bring you back doen are really AMAZING! Well done! This was a WAUW factor!

Great views. This is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere, 1,776 feet. The elevator quickly takes you up to the 102nd floor. There are a couple dining options on the 101st floor also. The views are fantastic. The prices are a little high. They offer a "priority access" rate that is about $20 higher. Don't know whether that's worth it. We walked in without a reservation and went right up after passing thru the security area.
Easy to get in and out. Normal Queues for a lovely vista ---check timings ---nice stroll all around ---great place to be just to feel the atmosphere shared with so many visitors

Rude awakening . I went to visit the world Trade Center. The building is stunning. The memorial is nice and the grounds are all still under construction. I was very upset with the security guards outside. They were extremely rude and unhelpful. They don't allow you to even stand there outside for more than 30 seconds unless you pay for a ticket inside. I was flabbergasted.
Beatiful view. A great view - U see a really large part of New York. It is near of "Twins Tower memorial". Great for lovers of architecture.

Best views . I live in NYC. I've taken many visiting friends and family to all the other observatories. This is the only one worth paying any money for. The elevator ride, screening and reveal of the view feature front and center the city's history and all the things that make NYC so incredible. The observatory is entirely indoors with 360 degrees of unobstructed city views. I would repeat this again with any other visitors!
Blown away . Have to say it amazing, the staff are full of info and are only too happy to fill you in on their extensive knowledge.The place left me in awe.

Too expensive. I loved the view from the top. You could see 15-20 miles. At least that's what we were told. You are encouraged to rent an iPad that was suppose to tell you what you were looking at. It didn't work very well and was a rip off for $15.00. There weren't any other signs to tell you what you were looking at. I'm glad I saw the beautiful views but I wouldn't recommend the IPad.
Better view than Empire satate building. I visited this place with my mom and must say the view at night is awesome.Better than empire state .
Great way to view the city. If you want a fantastic view that is not to crowded and not that expensive come here. It is the iconic New York attraction.

Outstanding Views . We nearly never went, been on if we get time list... but I'm so glad we did, the best views we seen and 360 degree. A really cool elevator ride and very informative... we'll be making a visit again in December.

Nostalgic Visit. I visited the Twin Towers in 1998, so it was a nostalgic return to the area where these great structures once stood.I booked my ticket in advance, got a time slot and did not queue for very long. The elevator is very fast and the views are worth it. As a photographer though, there's too much glass, so the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock provide better images. I'm glad I went though, but wouldn't rush back.

Simply Amazing. There are really no words to describe the spectacular view from 102 stories in the air. We started out visiting the pools and observing the serene experience of taking in the awe of what happen at these monuments. We then made our way into the Observatory which was a very pleasant experience, from the amazing elevator ride to the top of the One World Trade Center, to the Icing on the cake the View. It was simply breath-taking. I highly recommend this for ANYONE visiting NYC. My significant other and I enjoyed ourselves tremendously, and have a lifetime of memories to look back on.

Great views, avoid the cafe, viewing app doesn't work. Impressive views, even the lift (elevator) ride is fun (won't spoil it by explaining what they've done). Mini film at the beginning with a super "reveal" - v impressive and thoughtful.Service at cafe dreadful to the point we walked out and had refreshments at the much better places in Brookfield Place Mall across the road...Not sure I'd bother with the visitor application / tablet the sell you at the beginning - constantly needs recalibrating, doesn't work properly and doesn't really help you pinpoint all the interesting sites.
Amazing. It was amazing experience, the way they organize the tour is great and the videos are amazing for how they built it in the same place of the 9/11 towers. great view and great shopping

Fantastic!. I took my parents up the WTC tower in 1995, and ran with my daughter as the same tower fell in 2001. So I needed to see the new building. One World Trade was a great experience - views are amazing and I can't believe how fast the elevator takes you to the top. Best new thing to see in NYC (besides Hamilton).

Impressive!. Even if you do ESB or Top of the rock, you should do this observatory : the views are amazing ( even if it is not outside ) . The elevator ride was fast and fun .Also , there are lots of informations on the observatory level about the city and he history .

Overpriced tourist trap. For what you get, which is an elevator ride to the observation deck at the Freedom Tower, the price is too high. On the good side, the security was good, there were no lines, there is a nice display about how the tower was built, and the time lapse photography they show you on the way up was excellent. But they also herd you in front of the green screen for a photo that they will try to sell you afterward, and they group everyone together for a presentation about how you should pay $15 to rent an ipad that will explain what you are seeing. And of course there is a gift shop at the top as well. The views are beautiful, but it's all just too much commercialism and feels like they are taking advantage of the situation.

the staff. Let me start by saying my review has zero reflection on the observatory itself. The elevator rides and videos are incredible and I'm sure really add the experience. Unfortunately, I have no idea what that experience was suppose to be. You see when I got to the top and finally able to look out the window... all I could see was clouds. It honestly looked like I was looking out a frosted window.Now you maybe asking... didn't the staff warn you? Well no... what the staff said was 'less than a mile of visibility.' To which I took to mean that I'd still be able to see something. NOPE. What they should have said was 'zero visibility.' I'm positive that everyone else with me was thinking the same thing.When I came back down the elevator almost immediately after getting back up... I went over to guest services where the man quickly explained to me that 'less than a mile' is a technical weather term that means 'zero'.Uh no sir.

ABSOLUTELY TOP OF THE WORLD!. the 360º view over NYC is absolutely unforgettable
the experience with the lifts is amazing
marvelous experience
for me that have been at twin towers twice before 9/11, I must say that this is a great "coming back" of the city and the American people.
Fantastic!
A Must DO!
Wow. A fabulous visit with breathtaking views, very humbling g experience given circumstances. Walking tour of ground zero as part of visit

Incredible views!. The views are spectacular! It's amazing to actually see the nyc grid from up here. Most things line right up.
You can see all of the nyc boroughs, nj, long island and st
Gorgeous
Try the ipad rental. Really cool

Great but better views from the Top of the Rock. I felt I had to visit OWO as on my last visit to New York I had stood at the top of the World Trade Centre. The security was tight as you would expect but overly so. The views from the top are fab but I think the Top of the Rock offers a better view of the city.

Wow. We were not planning on going up after visiting the 911 Memorial, but it was quiet and no lines, so we went for it. Incredible is all I can say, the whole presentation and experience was stunning. See it for it for yourself

Amazing. Great trip to NY and this building was spectacular. Not to long to queue for tickets security very good, it brought a lump to yr throat to read all the banes on the fountain of the people who perished there. Well worth going

Awesome!. This was probably one of our fav things to do in NYC- breathtaking views. I highly recommend using the technology (similar to the size of an iPad-very easy to use) to get more info on the various points of the skyline. Can't wait to go back.

Most spectacular view. We absolutely loved the pictures of New York through time on the elevator ride, you forgot that you were climbing 102 stories. The elevator was so smooth and fast. The little video that starts off is a little corny but for people that are not familiar with New York, it's appropriate. We rented the iPad to point at building and landmarks to explain their names and history. I would do it again with a group of friends or family that had not experienced it. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting New York.

Touch the heavens. Our first visit to NYC since just after 9/11. We had to visit the new One World Observatory.The design of the building as it tapers makes it look as if it goes all the way into the edge of the atmosphere. A fast lift up an impossible height to reveal a city below.A must for anyone visiting NYC.

Very Good Experience. I visited the Observatory with my husband and our two sons, 6 and 9. We had pre-booked timed tickets a few days ahead of time, when we knew the weather report. We did not spring for the Premium tickets, and that was a good decision. The standard timed tickets worked fine. The attraction is very organized. Everything went smoothly and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. I did find it a little annoying that we were corralled from one holding area to another several times before reaching the observatory. In particular, I did not care for the narrow dark bedrock hallway at the beginning of the attraction. I am not especially prone to claustrophobia, but I did feel a bit claustrophobic anyway, winding slowly through this area. I also was annoyed with the holding area just before being let loose in the observatory where we received a mandatory sales pitch for the ipad rental. Just let us into the observatory already! The observatory itself was lovely. The views were great and the facility was very clean.

Amazing new view of the best city in the world. I travel a lot to NY and have done the other tall buildings. I was bringing my fiancee on his first trip and had never been to One WT. I booked in advance and we got down there for 9am. We visited the 2 pools before and there was a sombre sense of sadness there. I thought that the World Trade building woud be more of the same feeling but it wasn't. The experience really is all about what a string and thriving city New York is. The way they present the view initially is sublime (no spoiler alert!), It is amazing. Would reccommend,
Fantastic Tribute. Worth every minute and dollar. Highly recommend attending and looking at the spectacular of New Your and New Jersey.

Can't Miss. The building itself from the outside is spectacular but nothing compared to the inside. The elevator travels to the top in 60 seconds and the inside of the elevator is digital. It displays the evolution of the city from colonization to today. The top has an Ipad type piece of technology you can use to electronically zoom in to see and obtain pictures and information about the city and it's parts. There is information presentations about the city and staff to help answer questions about what you are looking at. You might even run into a celebrity. Former NY Giants coach Tom Coughlin was there when I went.

Worth the cost and a wonderful view. Buy timed tickets as it will save you lots of time. The theatre at the start ends with a surprise reveal - have your camera ready!Wonderful views from the top. Well worth the cost as it is a good 1-2 hrs trip.

Amazing. Worth every penny. Loved it!Some fantastic views of new york, such a beautiful building as well. Very fast lift doest take long to get to the top. Security was quick as well, staff are very friendly. If you are in New York this is a must. I liked downtown a lot nice part of the city.

Good, Not Great. I was hoping this would be something special to be worth the hefty price, but now having been I'd have to say it's overpriced, although still obviously a must-do, regardless of cost. At $37 for a single visit, this compares very poorly with $21 (online, no time restrictions) for two (both day and nighttime) visits to the 94th floor in Chicago's John Hancock building. The lift up is good, with a full height and width video showing how Manhattan has grown over the centuries, then you step into a short video presentation which ends with the wall lifting to reveal Manhattan and Brooklyn below. Very impressive. Then you're herded into another room and forced to listen to a spiel to rent iPads for $15, but there were hardly any takers. Following that, you're free to wander down to the next level, where you can see the 360 degree view. I'd say this is the best high level view in Manhattan, as we find the Financial District more interesting from both historical and scenery perspectives. There are great views to the Statue of Liberty, Governor's Island, the Brooklyn Bridge, Greenwich Village and Midtown. One disappointing thing was the very significant amount of glare on the windows, spoiling many shots. Using a polarising filter didn't help, as it showed distortion in the glass, again spoiling shots. I'm not sure if I was unlucky, or if it's a design fault, but I don't remember having that problem in Chicago last week on an equally sunny day. In summary, it's a great viewpoint, but for that money I'd expect to have a second nighttime visit thrown in.

Spectacular Views of 3 States. We visited on just the right day - clear and sunny with minimal pollution & haze. There was plenty of room to get close to windows and soak in the views and get the photos desired. The elevator ride to the top is amazing, a video montage of how lower Manhattan evolved over a 400+ year time frame. And the initial view of the city is unfolded to the visitor in a highly unique manner. Well worth the time and money to visit.

Stunning. The ride up to the top was an adventure in itself. Pay close attention to the walls as the elevator travels not only through space, but also through time! Once at the top, try to position yourself in the center of the video show...although every spot is great.When letting out of the video portion, you wind up on a floor that you think is the observatory. However, cleverly, they set it up as a food court. To get the full 360 view you have to go down one flight. Spend as much time as you like finding parts of New York. They will offer an iPad with key locations identified - for $15 rental. We used Google Maps. Not as easy, but it was fun trying to figure things out. There is a gift shop and a short presentation and you can go up and down the levels as you please.

Outstanding Views. Located close to the financial district and the World Trade Centre Memorial this amazing tower offers the finest views of the whole of New York City in every direction. The lift to the top is fast and has an internal walled video display and on arrival at the top a second video show on the walkway leads to a pleasant surprise.... Taking photographs through the glass can be spoiled by reflections when the sun is strong but patience and picking the right angle will help.There is a great souvenir shop with a 'See Forever' theme which has a good selection of merchandise.There is also a restaurant and bar but didn't have the opportunity to try either. Entrance fee and taxes $37 per person...

Must do experience. Given I was visiting New York on that fateful day in 2001 I HAD to visit the new tower and take a very swift journey up to the 102 floor. I was very lucky, there was no waiting with immediate entry. The experience starts in the elevators with images projected on to the walls showing New York through the centuries and the building of the tower on the return journey back to ground level. Then an introductory film showing atmospheric images from the city, which then opens up to introduce you to what must be one of the most stunning city views anywhere in the world. You then move to another area where there are a 360 degree view of every area of New York city. I was lucky - totally clear view, with approximately 25 miles visibility and, looking closely, you could see the curvature of the earth. I stayed up there for nearly 2 hours, had a bit to eat in the cafe and left having enjoyed the views and the presentations from the helpful staff. If your in New York, just do it!!!

Top Notch Presentation from Elevator up. The elevator ride begins your experience when you see the visual representation of New York growing in time as you rise to the top. Then there is the reveal and it is as impressive as you'd expect, even on a low visibility day. Traversed the views with the optional rented zoom in pad, which wasn't all that pack full of information, but it did entertain the kids a bit longer than the views offered. Then the ride down with the pristine view of the descend. Well Presented!

Amazing Views. I really enjoyed this experience. I pre-booked our tickets before travelling to New York. We decided to visit at night so we could see the city lit up. We weren't booked in until 8.15pm but, had reservations at the restaurant beforehand. Due to the fact we had tickets already we skipped the queues, even though I wouldn't say the queues at that time were overly long. They scanned our tickets and allowed us in before our allotted time - no questions asked. The elevator to the top was amazing, it was so smooth and you reached the top in less than a minute. The videos they show you going up of New York and also the video coming back down was great. The views were amazing and the initial viewing in the Theatre where they 'unveil' the view is a nice touch. The only downside is the glass reflects quite a lot meaning you struggle to get any good photos. You often see reflections of other people walking behind you or the illuminated Exit signs which is a shame. Still it doesn't take away the amazing views you will be seeing.

America!. If you have time, start somewhere Midtown, walk down the Avenue of the Americans and see the new statue of a free world flirting with the sun. Take the elevator, open your eyes, say wow and walk over the observation deck with the city that never sleeps 1776 ft below you. It's a mind blowing experience!

Unbeatable experience for an affordable price. From the outset of this experience you know you're in for a treat.Even the elevator ride feels like an amusement. The planning that goes into every aspect of this attraction can be felt by the meticulousness of it; and appreciated by the pay off.From the unveiling of the first view, to the panoramic sights, this attraction is not one to be missed.The staff were so informative and so happy to help with any queries.Could not recommend this attraction enough!
Amazing views. Very much worth it.Nice presentation and excellent views of the city. We went on late evening so got a chance to experience the sunset aswell.Highly recommended

Over the top, but fun!. We went on a day that ended up being cloudy, so there wasn't much of a sunset for us to view. However, the staff was upbeat and had some interesting presentations. The augmented reality iPads are worth it if you're unfamiliar with New York geography, history and/or architecture. Also, the elevators are pretty wild and make the time go quickly.

Amazing views. The lift goes so quickly up 100 floors that your ears block! - but its great. fabulous when the view is revealed at the top, and great to walk around looking at all the fabulous views of the City.

Very fast elevator!. This replacement for the World Trade Center is a modern building with probably the fastest elevator I have ever been in. As you ascend, the walls of the elevator show the changes to the New York skyline over the years. The observation deck is fully enclosed with glass windows. It was quite cloudy on the day of our visit so the views over New York were not as good as those from the Top of the Rock and Empire State Building which we were able to go to when it was sunny. There are interactive media pads available to hire for $15 but they don't give very much additional information on the buildings that can be seen from the observatory. There is also a restaurant and small gift shop. The website says that admission is by timed ticket but due to the late finish of an earlier activity, we missed the time on the tickets (which had been bought beforehand to avoid queueing), but this did not seem to matter as the staff just waved us through.

WOW!. Just getting to the top floor 102 is already an event which you won't forget. Simply the top of NYC and absolutely well presented with interesting presenters and story tellers - not to mention the pictures you can take from there!

Great Presentation however no refunds on 0 visibility. We booked the tickets on the day of the visit to avoid waiting in lines and showed up at the required time to visit the observatory. However on arriving we were informed that there was 0 visibility. On requesting for a refund, they said they could provide a ticket for later date any time before the end of the year. We were visiting from LA and one does not travel to NY all the time. I suggest One World Observatory management should provide refunds in case of no visibility to win the people visiting to get the view from the tallest tower in USA. One must not be penalised for making online reservations and online reservations should provide that there will be 0 visibility at that specific time. Ethically, the user should be provided with all information at the time of booking and so that they can make the right judgement.

Beautiful, but I miss the outdoors experience. The building and the monuments around it are awe-inspiring. We have to remember that is the place where thousands of people lost their lives... The building is beautiful, and has 360degrees of view. However, it is not possible to go outdoors. There is something special about being up there in the open, like at the Empire State Building, that is missing here. The iPads with VR location of landmarks is nice, though.

One World Trade Observatory. Gorgeous views - beautifully done. The fee to the top was nearly $40. Be prepared for the amazingly quick - elevator ride with view, but not what you may think. Would make for a great video. A bit touristy at the top is what I thought with ipad (building recognition app) rentals and gift shop. Definitely a money-maker.

360 view on Manhattan. Amazing views all around Manhattan. Breathtaking views.I would recommend to go there by time of Sunset as it adds an extra spark to your visit. Tallest building in North Hemisphere so far.

Mediocre. Approximately $36/person is very very expensive for the experience. Waiting, overcrowding, waiting. VERY rude security detail who tried to scan my pin barcode (he said "how do you know you're not going to get the pin if I scan now?") UNBELIEVE and he should be fired. The views were alright but there is a terrible (cutesy) skyline cutout along the edge to prevent you from sitting, creating mobscenes around the good spots. The angle of the observatory glass is horrendous, and the reflection from the exit and display signs prevent you from getting ANY good photo. The gift shop takes up a huge chunk of the walking space causing traffic. Chaotic at best, though the presenters were fabulous, overall it was completely not worth it.
Spectacular Views. Amazing 360 degrees views of the city. Absolutely amazing. Elevator ride up shows you a history lesson on what NYC looked like throughout time which was really neat to see.

Best View in Town!!!!!!!!. This is a must when you visit the Big Apple. You have the chance to see the city from 360 degrees, and all the views are different. The views are breathtaking!!!!! It does not get any better than this. The price of the ticket is 34 dollars, but there is a fee of 3 dollars. It might seem a bit expensive, but if you want to have the most awesome pics, you have to go up. There is no time limit, so you can stay as long as you want. These views are worth the money.

Great view. Don't waste your money for the 4th of July event. First off, if you are visiting OWO for the view, I highly recommend it. However, we purchased VIP tickets for the 4th of July. We were supposed to be in the building by 7:50 so that the festivities could begin at 8:00pm. It was after 8pm before we ever got in the building. We should have had 2 full hours at the top to see the view, eat and drink. Because we were late getting in, we did not get our expected and paid for 2 hour experience. Very disappointing.

Great location to see the view. While I prefer to be at a outside location (balcony or roof) for taking pictures, the location of the one world tower gives a great view of the areas around lower Manhattan which I think is more interesting than looking at the top of a lot of buildings.It took 3 visits to get a clear day, however the staff warned us on the first two visits before we used our tickets, and changed them twice to a time when the weather was better so we did not miss out on the view. There are some fake (hollow) rocks to look at on the way in (like Disney rides!), the video in the lift and at the top is very well done. The lift video tells a story of NY from early development to today.

Unsurprisingly the views are quite good..... .....which is reassuring as you are very high up in the middle of a a large city filled with interesting buildings and landmarks surrounded by water with lots of boats and ferries. Something there for most tastes. This is a well planned even slick operation from the moment you enter the lift to ascend the tower until you step out of same when you exit. The observation floors have plenty of space and you are able to see NY in all directions. The restaurant is comfortable with good views and the food is good with a fairly short menu. Can't comment on value for money for the observatory as I was a guest but it's NY so not going to be cheap.

Breathtaking. I loved the view from the observatory. I hired an iPad which made it more interesting as I was able to put the city into perspective and it also gave you information on various points of interest.
Amazing views. Definitely worth a visit... views are unreal! So much information from the guides and interactive zones. Great lift up to the observation deck too!
Stunning!. The views from the one World Trade Center took my breath away. The elevator ride up was also memorable. The experience was well worth the entry price.

Lf. What an absolutely fantastic experience!! We drove into the city which I don't recommend unless you plan your trip for sightseeing in advance by proximity..I had been to the twin towers in the past and like the rest of the world was devastated by the 911 tragedy.i almost didn't want to see the freedom tower fearing the powerful emotions it would create.. My husband,who came from Indiana,had never been to NY&was excited to finally get there!! Taking him there&experiencing it thru his eyes was the best!!! Very beautiful building,tasteful, loving,strong statement for our country!!!
OWO. From the moment I got into the elevator to the 360 deg view from the observatory; every moment is breathtaking. The initial 2 min film which opens into the real manhattan view is simply wow!
Of course, the views are amazing!. Better to try for a less crowded time, but to see a sunset from here in good weather is a special treat.

Nice view--but not worth the price. I guess I went up to the top as sort of a tribute to the fallen Twin Towers, but it was not as I thought it would be. I've been to the Empire State Building and that is a beautiful Art Deco structure that is worth seeing just for the architecture as well as the view. From the Empire State Building you can see the WTC to the south, and also north to Central Park.The new WTC looks good from a distance, but up close the architecture is very plain and blah--even cold. And, surprise, if you want to know what you are looking at from up there they charge another $15 for an IPad that will locate the sights for you. The food court at the top is very poorly designed--the less expensive cafe has only bar height tables at which you have to stand to eat your $6 hotdogs and $5 sodas. The gift shop probably has nothing anyone would want to keep for longer than a day.Save your money or go to the Empire State Building.

The highest observation deck in North America in a Skyscrapper. A great experience, visited on a Wednesday at 6:30pm, no queues, got a fantastic view from the 102nd floor - Can recommend the bar (You can reserve a table in advance), enjoyed cocktails with my wife, great atmosphere and great views, watched the sun set on New York - Recommended.

Astonishing. Went here after 16 years from my visit to Twin Towers. My heart was full of nostalgic memory for what happened in between. The view from the observatory is amazing, as well as the presentation of the view. It is a pity you cannot go outdoor as it was possible once...

Great views but a very BUSY experience.. If you are prepared to brave the crowds and spend a pretty penny, One World is for you. Great views and a nice interactive experience makes for an impressive visit. We thought to take the ride after visiting the 9/11 Museum so that we might understand what it would have been like at the top of one of the Twin Towers.Definitely impressed by the solid job of managing the herd that must visit each day. But at the top, there is only so much time one can spend with unruly children slobbering on windows...

Wonderful Views. Gorgeous building....LOVED the elevator ride up. Ticket is a bit pricey (starts at $34 if you purchase on line). Tons of security and staff on hand. I didn't like the sales pitch to rent a tablet $15.99 (I think) which lays out the landmarks. It would be nice if they gave you a map along with the entrance ticket so you can identify what you're looking at!

Incredible views and very well organised. . Having been to all of the main tourist places in NYC including Rockefeller and Empire State on precious visits, we decided to visit the observation deck at the One World Observatory. We booked tickets in advance online but it didn't seem to make much difference as the ticket queues weren't too busy on a Friday morning. The whole operation from door to observation deck was seamless with great security and organisation at all stages. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We were very impressed! The bar at the observation deck was open but this was the only down point in our visit. We bought a wine and a beer to enjoy whilst looking at the great views. We didn't realise that where we bought it was separate to the bar (the bar was behind a curtain). We asked our server if we could take our drinks into the bar and he said it should be fine but we were stopped by bar staff as they said they are separate franchises. That's fair enough but with no where to sit with our wine and beer we felt we had been dealt with unfairly. The observation deck and shop were both excellent and restroom facilities were clean and tidy. It was a fantastic tourist experience and one I would possibly do again!
Impressive. Pay special attention to the film they show you before they let you in! Great start of the experience. The lift is also a story worth telling and makes the trip very short :-)

A MUST SEE if you are visiting!!. A definitely MUST GO and MUST SEE place when you first visit New York!! You get to see the entire New York from 100 levels up (although Empire State Building and Top of the Rock also can), and experience different looks of the city!! The elevator to the top impressed me the most. Not sure if a video can be uploaded here but why see a video?? You should go experience it yourself!! :)

TOTALLY worth the $40!!!. This is the BEST view in the city. The entire experience is very modernized including an awesome digital show in the elevator with screens covering every wall of the elevator as you go up to the 103rd floor, with iPads you take around with you that show you what you're looking at (as you point the ipad, it moves along as you walk around) and you can click on the different monuments and buildings and get some history and info. It's got a great gift shop with really cool souvenirs. Our whole family loved it.

Fabulous and fast ride to the top!!. Great spot to get an overview of NYC once you get to the windows. Seems to be a bit a push to spend another $15 for an IPad that will name the buildings, or the photographer waiting to take your picture, or the extremely expensive food booth and gift shop! Thats after paying $35 to ride to the top! Yes the views are awesome, and you can stay as long as you want, but prices seem a bit out of line even for New York City!

AMAZING. I don't want to say too much because you just need to experience it. I'm afraid of heights but this was all a-ok for my nerves. Relax and enjoy the elevator ride. Watch the pictures on elevator!!! Don't worry they won't shock you with a elevator view or anything. When you finally see the view, it will be awesome and not frightful! Get the interactive iPad for a little extra (1 per family is plenty but worth it).

Must See. This building is truly amazing. Definitely reserve your tickets/select time online before going. I was lucky and there wasn't a line, but that is not the norm. Pay extra special attention when you get in the elevator, you'll want to face the wall. A lot of people will tell you to record the ride up. Don't. Actually enjoy and appreciate it for what it is. It is super cool, though! Once upstairs, there's a short video and then you can take as long as you like in the observatory. The views are spectacular and show a different side of the typical Manhattan views you get from the Empire State Building or the Top of the Rock. However, with that being said, you should save your money and only do one of these. Keep in mind, you cannot see Central Park from One World.

amazing. This was the main reason for our visit to NewYork and it didn't disappoint. We booked our tickets online before we travelled but the queue wasn't long for tickets there. It opens at 9am so we took a cab while it was quite in the morning had breakfast nearby and wandered over. We had time to reflect at 9/11 memorial pools which are beautiful and so thought provoking. Its amazing what the New Yorkers have achieved in so little time and its a wonderful tribute. You pass through the slick but efficient and friendly airport style security and then into the elevators. I'm not going to give any more away as there are some amazing surprises . The view is just awesome. We went on a clear day and you could see for 10s of miles. You look down on the helicopters and light aircraft. The deck is huge and enclosed in glass so if like me you hate heights - its fine. You can enjoy the view in peace and reflect on whats been achieved here. Even our teenage son was impressed .
Wow . What can I say. Absolutely breathtaking and very emotional. The lines aren't too busy and great value for money. Can spend as little or as much time there as you want to.

Truly, Truly, Amazing. What a "come back tribute" to the surviving families and to this great USA than the One World Observatory. This building being supposedly, the tallest building in the western hemisphere is truly amazing. The elevator takes you from the 1st floor to floor 102 in less than 60 seconds. AND while you are going up, it shows you on the elevator wall the surrounding buildings that you are passing on the way up. Beware of your eardrums pressurizing...........kind of like being on an airplane! Just keep swallowing and the pressure should normalize. When at the top, the views are nothing short of "spectacular". Supposedly, you can see 4 of the surrounding states on a clear day. Not to mention to look down on the surrounding skylines, since you are probably 40 or 50 stories taller than them. And to look down on the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, was breath taking.........making them seem so miniature! This is a "must site" if you ever visit New York City!

Emotional. Humbling, sentimental and awe-inspiring.
Beautiful place for such atrocities. One world centre is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. Wonderful visit and a must see place for any visitor

Missed this view! . Last time my wife and I were up at the observation deck of the World Trade Center was March’01. We really missed this view, and 15 years later, with our kids, got to enjoy it again. This time around the multimedia set-up, starting with the elevator ride, is just awesome. Must come!

No view. this observatory its covered with window frames its really hard to get a good picture unlike the top of the rock it does not have an outside section, and they have covers the uptown side of the view with this big circle of pictures from this in NYC but you cants actually look out.I think it was a waist of time I was disappointed.
Amazing!!!. The view was incredible!! We went early to avoid the lines. Just wish there had been a gift shop at ground level.
Great. Great view. Very fast impressive elevator. Very kind personal. The shop and the restaurant are pretty expensive. A must.
What an experience!. This is a must do when going to Manhattan. The 360 degree view is phenomenal. My advice, but tickets online and pay extra for the speed line. Worth the money. Enjoy!!

Great New York experience. This is a must do in New York. We visited with Sunset flex tickets as we didn't want to tie ourselves down to an exact time. Really well organised and quick going through security and into the lift. Takes 60 seconds to get to the top and it's well worth it. Amazing views as we were lucky to visit when the weather was great. You can hire an iPad for 15 dollars which will tell you all the different buildings when you point and line it up to a vista. There is also a cafe and a shop. Guides at the top give further information. Really great experience and totally recommend.

Breathtaking and emotional. This was our first visit to One World. We were on the observatory at the World Trade Center on Sept 8,2001 so the trip to One World was very emotional for us. They really done an amazing job honoring the past while looking toward the future. From the time you walk into the building till the time you leave, you will not be disappointed.

Out of this world! . Visited the one world observatory today (8th July 2016). From the moment we stepped inside, he journey was incredible. The lift experience is awesome - you watch a video on how New York has developed over the last hundreds of years. Once you reach the top, you watch a short video on New York and its iconic surroundings. Once the video is finished, the screen lifts and you are left looking straight out of the glass to the view below. This was truly breathtaking and not expected at all. Once you reach the observation deck, 360 views are amazing. You really can see 'forever!' Stayed a little longer and went to the restaurant for a drink. Drinks expensive but as expected, magnificent views from the bar/restaurant.

A must go see in NYC. This was the most exciting and well presented event I have ever been on. From walking into the building, meet & greet by staff who are proud to do their job to the amazing views of New York. We went early morning so no queuing at all. You were taken on a journey that was informative and enjoyable and paced just right without being hurried on to the next area. 47 seconds to rise to the 132nd floor was fast but you did not feel it, unbelievable. A cafe is available and you had the tourist sop up there too but I found it expensive for what it was. Some nice quality items but also some trash not worth the money in my view. On reaching the top you have a choice to rent an iPad so when you looked over New York it would highlight key tourist areas and buildings which you could select to give you more information on. I would suggest you visit the key sights before going to the observatory so you get that sense of proportion of where you have been. Do not miss this opportunity as it is well worth the money. We paid at the door and it was a good deal.

Excellent Views. The views from the One World Observatory were amazing - we went a little before sunset but didn't stay until dark - I would definitely recommend this time period. Also we went on a Thursday to try and avoid weekend crowds and that worked well for us.The only negative is the amount of people that are there - it can be a challenge trying to look out of the window at times due to the throngs of people. But it is something to see.

Commercialized to the Max. When my wife asked what I wanted to do in the city the World Trade Center was at the top of my list. I had not been back since 9/11 and had very high expectations. The ticket price seemed high but I assumed it would be worth it in the end, I was wrong. If you don't mind paying $37 to ride an elevator to the top of the tallest building in the city then One World Observatory is for you. Free tips for management: offer the IPad viewers for $5 per family instead of $15, drop the cost of water from $5 to $2 and send 50% of your staff home as they are unnecessary and ineffective. Don't force me to get my picture taken and for God and the victims sake have some sort of acknowledgement of what happened here. And one more thing, $20 per ticket is more than fair for free AC and a view to take pictures from. That is all for now!

The 'Freedom Tower'. A stunning testament to the indomitable human spirit.
