View is breathtaking but a little Disney like at first.. Well of course the view is spectacular, as expected. But felt a little Disney-like after getting off the elevator and moved into the first viewing area. I kind of felt like I was on a ride at the magic kingdom. Once you got through that you are free to walk around on your own. It is amazing and worth the price of admission, especially if you have never been there before.

Fantastic view.... The view from the top of the One World Observatory is awesome. To quote them "you can see forever." The only complaint is the admission fee they charge. The higher the cost, the more specific you can pick your time to go to the top. And if you miss your time....no refunds. I think they should just have one fee for everything.

Amazing View, Pricey. There is no doubt, it is an amazing view of the entire city. It feels a bit like visiting Disney at first with the way they handle the lines and channel you through. The Apple Viewers they try to upsell as they channel you through are a good idea for being able to identify what all the sites throughout the city are as you take in the view. The upsell sales pitch was rather off-putting for us though. Once you finally get to the actual top viewing area you can truly take in every bit of the city. They have several stations where they have staff explaining some of what you are seeing and the history of the sections of the city. The view is great but not sure it's worth the high price tag.

Holiday. An amazing experience - a must do attraction and close by the memorial and museum. Queues on my visit were short: went early. Tip: when taking photographs position the lens next to the millions to reduce reflections. Excellent

Amazing and emotional. Being a New Yorker, this site really had an effect on me considering all that happened. The views are breathtaking and the tour is great. The elevator ride is also super cool. Definitely worth the money. Also check out the memorial. It's very nice.

Majestic views, humbling experience. It was the most impressive attraction from the elevator ride to the observatory that I experienced. It is a must on your next visit to the city. Could do without the commercial ploys from photos to ipad devices--but what do you expect from NYC?

Just wow . I don't want to ruin it by telling you the secrets of what happens but all I can say is WOW! The view from the top of here is just absolutely amazing, it dwarves all the other skyscrapers around it. We did one World Trade Center after doing the 911 memorial and museum and found that definitely the right way round to do it. The only thing I found frustrating is the way they try and sell you an iPad to look at the view with which is annoying after it not being cheap to get to the top. Glad I did this and not top of the rock/Empire State.
Do this instead of Empire.. Much more streamlined experience but you can't go outside like at Empire. Great views of course. You can see the 9/11 Memorial fountains beneath you from the top.

Favorite Spot in NYC. The views are incredible and absolutely worth the price. If you're looking for a fancy dinner or an upscale lunch, go around meal time and have a bite upstairs next to the window so you can linger.

Stunning View!. Unbelievable view. Elevator ride was invigorating...very, very fast. Once on top had access to top three floors with 360 degree view of New York. Unfortunately the gift shop was extremely expensive.

Incredible views of Manhattan. One World Trade, aka Freedom Tower, is 1776 ft high giving unprecedented views of Manhattan and adjacent boroughs from it's location at the southwest edge of Manhattan. Worth a visit.

This is one of the must-do's in New York!. Booked this in advance and got a choice of times to visit.Arrived well on time and went in straight away - no queues.The story and facts are fascinating and the way you go through the building is very well thought out.The views are stunning - 360 degree for miles and miles. Plenty of time and space to take photos - too many probably!If you only have a short time in NY, make this one of the things you do.

Magnificent Panoramic View. We visited at the noon on a Sunday. We expected to be pending to get tickets but within a quarter of an hour we paid ($ 30 per ticket) and we were ready to get on the elevator. The elevator had screens that were showing the history of Manhattan! In less that a minute it climbed 102 floors. Coming out of the elevator you can rent an ipad for a tour of the city from above. The view is breathtaking. We were lucky because the sky was clear and we could see far away .. Ηighly recommend…

Hello World! Best elevator ride ever :). We went to One world Observatory for a private party. Amazing venue! We were whisked up on the elevator which must be the most interesting elevator in the world because the walls of the elevator become a movie screen, yep, really. You are treated to a video history of the settlement and development of NYC. It's beautifully done. I won't say too much about so I don't spoil it for you. The views from the Observation room are as expansive and wonderful as you'd expect. Our private event was evening to night so it was special to see the city lights come on. My one comment to management is to add more seating for private events. It is unreasonable to expect women in sky high heels to teeter for three hours. Our bar service was very good as was the food. The sushi was excellent as were the passed appetizers including the best bacon ever and lamb lollipops.
Amazing view. Incredible view, the elevator ride was fantastic as well. The Explorer should be included with the admission price instead of adding $15 to the bill, otherwise, pretty sweet.

Fantastic views. Right from the time you step into the elevator which gets you up in a jiffy to the drama with the video screens and the final views of the skyline from the deck are fantastic . Recommend visit just before sunset and stay for an hour so you can see both daytime and with lights and enjoy the views from all sides .

Great views but very commercial. Visited with husband and friends. Tickets quite expensive. Elevators and views are fantastic but the whole experience felt very commercial and without character. No choice given if we wanted our photo taken and the first experience you encounter after leaving the elevator is a 'presentation' on hiring i-pads to describe points of interest. Don't know what purpose City Pulse served as no one explained what it did and what it was for. Not sure if the glass floor views were real or a film. Basically it is just a ride in a fast elevator with fantastic views. Probably would not visit again.

Breathtaking!! Must see!!. If you are in New York you must do this. So much information, breathtaking views, it's hard to describe it all. It starts with an elevator ride that is mind boggeling. When you get in the elevator do not look at the doors, watch the walls because you back in time and travel through the making of a beautiful city, and that is just the beginning. I won't tell any more, just go and see for yourself, enjoy!

Some nice added features to the experience. When we went to visit the 9/11 memorial, we originally not planning on the observatory and the $37/per person price tag almost got us to walk away. I am glad we did it. After the security area, they really took some attention to detail with exhibits all the way along including the elevator ride through time to the 102 floor.They offered an ipad for $15 that was oriented to the view that you were looking at, it had lots of information and was a bonus. Avoid the $4 water bottles.

Took in the views and had lunch!. If you're in New York as a tourist this is a must do attraction! From start to finish this is awesome! I won't spoil it too much but the elevator ride and the introduction video make this even better, and the big reveal....WOW! The restaurant is very good at the top of the tower and not what i'd consider over priced given the location. The views are what you are there for though, and frankly, this makes the Empire State building obsolete now!
Impressive views!. This is a must see. Gorgeous 360 views of the city. The presentations from staff was somewhat theatrical, but didn't take away from the point of being there--seeing the views!

Amazing view!! . The ride to the top is incredible with the video monitors showing you the development of New York City from the 1700's to present time. Very cool. They funnel you into a "movie" which doesn't show you much but THEN...the wall rolls up to show you the most amazing view from the top of the building. The presentation was well done for sure. They then funnel you again through the iPad rental station ($15) and the "we'll take your picture and sell it to you" station (not sure how much) - and then you get to explore the views which are incredible. $36 to get up with a fee to buy the ticket online is a little steep - the view is amazing though.

Incredible experience. Glad we went up to the One World Observatory before going to the Ground Zero Memorial. Exhilarating and stunning views. We paid $15 extra for a tablet that gave us very helpful input about that which we were seeing.

An amazing place.. The Observatory is an awe-inspiring place. The elevator ride up is beautifully done. A trip through the decades. The slide show/presentation with the men who built the tower was a very emotional experience. I highly recommend stopping to watch it before you get on the elevator. When you get to the top, go ahead and splurge for the iPad/audio device that tells you what you're seeing. It's very interesting and creative. It's a beautiful space and I highly recommend going, with children or without.

As we walked among the pools, I could feel the presence of those lost lives. This building stand for what we all Americans believe in – Hope for the best life in the best country in the world. Take you time and walk all around from the North + South pools, the museum and the observatory. You will see items from that unfateful day displayed.It was an honor and good fortune to shake one of the fireman's hands who responded to the call that day. Everyone was a hero and they shall forever be remembered.Recommend you take the photo of the building from far away – the full view is best.

One word...Views. The views from the top are breathtaking..107 floors up. You step into the lift..blink and you have reached the top. There are screens showing what happened on that terrible day which makes the experience that little bit more emotional. Would definitely recommend visiting

Spectacular. Booked my ticket before travelling to NYC for 10am, got there a little earlier but I was able to go up. The lift takes you in seconds and what a spectacle as they lift the curtains ! I have been up both the ESB and TOTR, but this is the best views of the city ! You can walked all around and see the city from each direction. Stunning ! As I was l leaving it was starting to get busy, so I suggest early morning visits. Lived it !
Amazing. On a whim. We went to the to tower then the top was early in the morning No lines. From the start the experience was awesome and well done! Suprise and awesome all the way

FABULOUS OVERVIEW OF NEW YORK, BETTER THAN THE EMPIRE STATE BLDG.. Having lived through 9/11, I have had no desire to see the Memorial Museum. However, a friend of mine was up from Florida and very anxious to see the Observatory, so I went.This is one tourist attraction which I would happily recommend to anyone, including New Yorkers, like myself. It's exciting from the minute you enter the elevator for the 8 minute ride to the 100th floor. The glass elevators show fast changing photos of New York City and then, suddenly, they are gone, and you are looking at the most awe inspiring vista of the actual city ... all 5 boroughs. Although the day was overcast, we were able to recognize Long Island, Staten Island, the Catskill Mountains, and everything in between. To see the West Side Highway with ant-like cars moving north and south was amazing. We even spotted people in red uniforms playing soccer. We wouldn't have noticed them (they were so tiny) if not for their uniforms. The people who work there, including security, were very nice and helpful. The only thing that disappointed me, but I should have expected, is their attempt to sell: pictures, souvenirs, rent Pads to see what you could look out the window and see, etc.A little advice: Don't bother with the pictures (take your own) or $15 pads, but do have lunch in the 100th floor restaurant. The food was delicious and abundant, and the prices moderate by tourist attraction standards. We walked around the memorial pools, which was very touching, and then went to see the Brookfield mall, which was beautiful, and had drinks by the water. It was a lovely day all around.

Slightly dissapointed. Whilst the elevator ride up to the top is very nicely done, and the big reveal before you step onto the observatory is also great, the whole experience felt slightly too commercialised, with a gift shop, cafe, and sponsored advert space all taking up floorspace at the top. Decent views, but would recommend Empire State Building for a more raw experience.
It is expensive. if you have your choice between the Empire State Building or One World go see the Empire State Building. This attraction is taller - but the Empire is special.
Amazing views of city. Beautiful building with amazing views of the city. On a sunny day you can see for miles. A proud addition to the New York skyline.

Great concept falls short.. Visited One World with my family, living on Long Island we have plenty of opportunities to come in NYC and do things. I was hoping this would have been a WOW! moment for us - it fell short. Unlike Top of the Rock or Empire State Bldg this is enclosed so you really lose the full effect. Glass reflection really hurt the pictures. It was quite warm up there as well and this was at 8pm at night on a beautiful 77 degree day. Felt like concession stands were everywhere - the focus should be on the view. Staff was very nice, process getting in & up was smooth -- views of the rivers were great - it's a shame the venue wasn't.

Views average, left underwhelmed. Observatory is more expensive than Rockefeller Center or Empire State Building. The views are wholly from inside meaning that photographs are never great. For me it was too much of a production and very focused on gaining maximum profit from each customer. Tablets with information on the views are available to rent for $15, good info but i begrudge paying extras on top of an overpriced entrance fee.The views are nowhere near as impressive as Rockefeller center, but happy i have experienced it although i shall not be returning.

disappointing. The elevator ride up is a nice experience, but the view was disappointing compared to similar views from Top of the Rock or the Empire State Building. Because of the plastic plates separating you from the outside, photographing without a terrible reflection is impossible. And everything on top is extremely expensive. This is obviously an overrated tourist trap.

Worth it for the elevator (lift!) ride itself. What a fantastic building. Well organised trips to the observatory, lots of demonstrations and talks. 102 floors in less than 30 seconds and you don't feel the acceleration; how do they do that!? The view over the city at the top is fabulous.
Wow! The views. Totally worth it. About $32.it takes 45 secs to reach the top and once there, the views are incredible. Along with top of he rock - a must

Endless view . I went up to the observation deck as it was a "touristy" think I haven't done. The use of video inside the lift on the way up and down, as well as renting out iPads to assist with viewing is very innovative. But in the end it is the same gift shop as Empire State and the Rock, so choose one of the three. As I had done the others before, this didn't impress me much, but will likely be awesome for a first time visitor to one of the high observation decks in the city.

Spectacular views of the city. As we where staying mid-town (5day visit) we chose to spend a full day downtown.. To be honest 2 would have been better.. Still, hindsight is a marvellous thing.. We used our Big red bus ticket to get there and as we had tickets for the Hornblower river cruise we did that first... Back on land we made our way inland towards the 9/11 memorial. After time at the pools ( a tranquil and fitting reminder of the atrocity that happened on that very spot) we made our way to the tower. Ticket queue was not huge and we where asked if we 'would be paying by card'..'Yes'.. 'Step out of the queue I'll take payment and you can go through..'.. I won't spoil the journey up but it's good.. 1 point is before you are allowed to wander and take in the views you are offered the rental of an iPad programmed with details of the city below.. Hired one and was disappointed .. So much so I handed it in early.. Personally I don't think they are worth the price. Our weather was sunny and the view superb. Wifi was available and my son skyped his grandad back in the UK from the top.. NYC to Liverpool live!!! It's 4⭐️ not 5 because you are inside and whilst I appreciate that there are reasons, part of the buzz at Top of the Rock was sensory with city noises and a breeze in your face. In all a must, after all it's the new icon of the city. All staff where courteous with an air of enjoying what the did, especially our lift operator.

Not worth the proce. I typically go to observation decks for getting good pictures. I decided to try out the one world observatory while I was in New York but do not realize it was a glass observatory until I went up. I could not get any good pictures because the reflection from the glass prevents you from getting good shots. I enjoyed going to Empire State observation much more because it's an open air observation deck. Plus I think everything at one world was highly commercialized including the expensive family photos and gift shop.

Would you like an ipad with that. It's a great experience but there is also a pitch for the rental cost of an i-pad before you get to the viewing windows ($15). I visited both One World Observatory and the Top of the Rock last week and out of the two - Top of the Rock was my preference. We had clear days for both. I bought the flex anytime tickets which, whilst more expensive, meant that we could visit at any given time on our selected day. It was very convenient and, in my mind, worth the extra. It seemed whilst queues were not huge, lots of people were buying tickets to come back at a later time or date so the flex tickets worked for us. I am glad I visited and ticked the box but I probably wouldn't visit again.
Love the lift ride. From the lift ride up to the top, to the wonderful view, this was an experience not to be missed - all very well managed and some decent gifts in the gift shop

Breath-taking. It's pricey but it's worth it. If you want to, they offer tablets to carry with you as you walk around the observation area. When you hold up the tablet to the window, it shows where you are relative to certain buildings/attractions. It's interesting for the whole family!

Don't miss this. We started at the two adjacent reflecting ponds which "brought it all back." From the excellent pre-show, to the best-ever elevator rides, to the unbeatable view of Manhattan (and way beyond), this is a class A super-well-done attraction. Don't miss it!

Utterly Amazing Views - almost futuristic. I like visiting tall buildings when traveling to different cities so this was a no-brainer for me. First off, both the ride up and the ride down were amazing experiences. My 9 and 7 year old were completely mesmerized by the cool videos they played as you go up and down. It almost felt like we were birds flying around the trade center as we reached the top and bottom.Once you get to the top you won't be disappointed as you get the best views of the city. This place is definitely worth the extra $$$s you spend for the visit.

Top of the World!. This was really the only thing I wanted to do in my short visit to NYC. My cousin got some vip tickets and we were able to walk right into the tower. They have lots of help and are very efficient. We rode the 102 story elevator to the top while watching a snapshot video of NYC from the early 1900's thru now. I was concerned that if I was looking out, the height would get to me but this was great. The observatory was wonderful and although it was an overcast day you could still see forever. My cousin and I of course went to the bar restaurant and had a glass of wine. Very beautiful. Enjoyed, however the gratuity was added and I didn't know it until I left a cash tip. Oh well. You need to look at your bill I guess. Anyway, the tower was well worth it.
Fabulous views. Rather pricey but excellent views from the top. Paid 25 dollars for a photo which I did not think was too bad. Would highly recommend.

Can't beat the views. This was a great experience for adults and kids alike. Getting through security seemed like the worst part--slow and no signage (at least in the scheduled ticket line) that explained you needed to take electronics out of any bag you were carrying. The elevator ride is fast (be sure to pay attention to the time lapse photos happening on the walls of the elevator). The mobile device interface is great, and worth the $15. There's a cafe for to go food and a sit down restaurant, as well as a souvenir shop at the top. Bathrooms were spotless. Views were amazing. Entire experience was well-worth the ticket price.
Incredible! Worth every penny!. There is a movie if New York through the ages as you go up the elevator. The views are incredible and there are guides at the top that talk about NYC and things to do.

Blown away - Will return for sunset view!. Thirty-one and a half years ago I visited New York City for the first time & fell in love with this spectacular city! On that visit, my family & then boyfriend (now hubby) went to the top of the World Trade Center. I remember being awestruck at the views below. On this trip I shared the experience with my husband and children. The views are still jaw dropping! We have been to the Top of the Rock & the top of the Empire State Building. Love them! But being able to see this city that I love from the top of the "Freedom Tower" is almost indescribable! After walking around the entire 360 degrees, we took a seat at the bar & had some drinks while drinking in the view! Pay attention in the elevator on the way up too. From beginning to end, I was blown away! Definitely worth the price of admission. I look forward to returning for a sunset view!

Awesome!. First trip to NYC and had to see Ground Zero and the One World Trade. The 360 degree viewing deck was breath taking. Yes, we were the typical tourist, but I was so happy and proud to be where I was. I couldn't believe I was standing there looking out over the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island....I could go on and on. We took so many picture's, and will treasure them for ever. We also ate in the restaurant above the observatory, and that was fantastic also. I don't see a review on Trip Advisor for the restaurant, however, I'd be happy to review and rate that if it ever shows. Can't wait for the other building to be finished, so we can take another trip to NYC! I'm hooked!

Worth the cost..... I've been up to many observation platforms in many countries but this is one of the best. It's pricey, but worth the cost. It really gives you a better appreciation for Manhattan and the metro area. I wish they'd dial back the sales job...photos a la Disney, $5.00 bottle of water, etc, etc, but ignore it all and enjoy the panorama!

Brilliant. Have over the years watched this building take shape,last year in new york we missed the opening by 2 days,got the chance to go back this year,booked tickets and we weren't dissapointed,the lift is so fast and the show when you come out of the lift is brilliant,the views are fantastic,if you are in the city you must go

See Forever ..... Well, they say you can see forever and it really feels that you can. Don't miss this wonderful attraction. The whole experience from the lift ride onwards is outstanding. The views from the top are spectacular and you can stay up there for as long as you like. There's a shop and café too.  We went up on a beautiful evening and watched the sun setting and the lights coming on all over the Big Apple. What a fantastic experience! Just do it, it's amazing.
Spectacular view. This is the only building that can do justice to the city. Could actually see curvature of the Earth.

Incredible. I was initially not that fussed about going to the top of the new WTC but it was recommended to us so we thought we'd give it a go. We were so glad we did as the views from the top were incredible and the entire experience has been well thought through to give you a great overall experience.
Amazing views. The staff was very friendly. Views are amazing. Even the elevator ride up is fascinating. We went mid morning on a Friday and did not need advance tickets.

An Utmost Priority When Visiting NYC. Constructed beside Ground Zero , this has become the latest attraction in the ever evolving New York City skyline. One WTC is actually the first of the 4 (?) skyscrapers to be assembled around the fallen Twin Towers. Made of sterner stuff guaranteed to survive disaster or any terrorist attack , this is one sight to behold. The experience starts once you ride the ultra high speed elevators. It is literally a visual spectacle , then once you arrive at the top , it is like curtains open to breath taking scenery of the whole city. If you have time, take the interactive I-pad which costs you just a little below 20 dollars , but it would be worth it. And before going down , how about taking some snacks in their nice restaurant , and buying the souvenirs.

Definitely go for the sunset!. I had been advised to go up the One World Observatory for a nice 360 degree view of New York and I wasn't disappointed. I also ate at the restaurant within there on my own and was made to feel very welcome.
best views of NY. Very slick operation.Go early to avoid ques. fantastic views. About the restaurant : It could have been so much better The Eiffel Tower should show them the way.

This is the best ariel view of New York!. 102 floors up in a very fast elevator to a view worth every penny!A complete view of New York various Islands, plus New Jersey and 4 other states can be seen from here. Higher than the helicopter flights which can be seen some distance below. Brilliant!

Worth the trip downtown . We had been to the 9/11 memorial and museum in our last trip to New York but had not gone to the observatory. One of the highlights of this trip. The views are spectacular! The ride up is amazing and part of the fun. We paid the extra 15 dollars at the top to use the I pad program that explains what you are looking at. Would definitely recommend especially if you are down there already. We bought our tickets in advance for the regular admission and there was no line . You reserve for a specific time so I'm not sure what the premium price ticket gets you.
Awesome views!!!. went in the evening about 1/2 hour before closing, no lines. we were moving at the same pace as the vip line. the night time views are amazing.

WOW. Went into the observatory by chance really just bought a standard ticket $37 £25 best money I've ever spent if you do nothing else in new York this is a must the views are breath taking , the experience starts as soon as the lift door closes as you go up it looks like your on the outside of the building very clever 100 floors and a few seconds later your led to a room facing a wall where for the next 3-4 minutes you watch the sites and sounds of everyday new york at the end the whole wall goes up to reveal the view of new york through the window spectacular views the whole room involuntarily broke out into applause, all around the building were views that is just so hard to put into words ONLY IN AMERICA

Breathtaking Views. We visited here on my husbands 50th birthday and all we can say is wow!! A definite must on anyone's to do list when visiting New York City. From entering the elevator, this is an amazing experience. I don't want to give anything away, but please believe this is an experience not to be missed. The views across manhattan and the surrounding areas are fabulous. Enjoy your visit!!

One of the best tourist trips to do.. I wasn't planning on visiting the One World observatory and it was only by chance that when I walked past with my daughter and there were no queues that we decided to go in. Its a bit dearer than some of the other attractions at 37 dollars for an adult but after visiting felt it was worth the cost. Going up in the lift was a wow as you climbed and on arrival to the top there is a short film that is very entertaining and then you get to see the views. Without spoiling it for those of you yet to go, but there was a round of applause from everyone as we got to see the views. You get a good look over 9/11 and different views from when you visit Empire etc. I think the drinks could be cheaper in the restaurant . We also decided to buy a picture and this was dearer having it sent to e-mail than printing out as we didn't want to carry it so think this could be improved but visiting this is a must do on your tick list is visiting New York. .
Incredilblew views and experience.. Time entry which is great and immensely better experience that Empire State Building. Highly recommend.

If you have not seen NYC from the air - - -. Then this is the perfect experience. Both the ride up and down were "special" - but we won't break "the secret" for you. Got e-mail tickets for a go time, but it did not appear to make any difference. We just entered in a very short line for security check and up we went. We did not get the computer guided tour because we had been to NYC several times and generally knew the surroundings. But if you are not familiar with the area, it looked the i-pad would be worth it.
Fab Experience. I was worried about how tall this was.. But once you finally get up there it's breath taken and a must when you got to New York.Most amazing skyscraper.

Breathtaking views. Amazing views of New York .. Wasn't sure on what to expect when we booked it but I'm so glad I did .. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The lift tells you the story of how the building was build while your going up.. The view when your stood in. Line is amazing when they open the bilinds. You can hire a tablet but I didn't do that I just walked around the building and looking at New York from different angles .. I wasn't sure at first but so happy that I did I can't express how amazing the views are

Exceptional Views. This was a treat so no idea of the price. Visited just before sunset and the views across the river were amazing and seeing a helicopter flying below was very strange to see. The lift was quick and shows how the building was created at each floor level. Definitely worth a visit for such great views.

Breathtaking views. Wow! The views from this building are just breathtaking! We didn't have to cue long and once inside we went straight to the observation platforms. Would definitely recommend visiting this building.

This place is amazing! Best view of NYC, NY Brooklyn, Queens and SA. I was astonished by the excellent view of the City and all surrounding areas. Better that the Empire State view. On a weekday, it took no time to get all the way up and it was not crowded. I enjoyed it and highly recommend it. This is a new building so everything is top-of-the-line state-of-the-art modern. Try to visit on a clear day so the view is optimal.

Once in a lifetime - but crowded. The views are breathtaking and the fact you can see a 360 view of Manhattan was incredible. The only downside was it was very crowded and busy, hard to take pictures when every window is surrounded by people.

Amazing!!. Absolutely amazing. We had a flex pass which means we did not have a set time to tour. A very good idea unless you know exactly your schedule. The technology was outstanding. I would highly recommend this attraction.
breathtaking veiws. We were very surprised at what an experience it was to go to the top. The staff was amazing and made it a special experience. We will never forget that trip.

Fantastic photo opportunity . The buzz starts when you step into the lift and it shows you how the building was constructed ,at the top you watch a short show then they lift the wall and they reveal the magnificent views of the city , you can hire a tablet that shows what the skyline view your looking at to pick out buildings for $15 . The whole experience is breath taking and well worth it .

Relatively expensive but worth it.. The vistas are stunning you can see from Queens to the Jersey Shore. Access is easy and the short story referred by pictures in the lift (elevator) is edifying if not rapid.The experience is a good one.

I got motion sickness or vertigo on the elevator ride up and down.. Amazing view but I got motion sickness or vertigo on the elevator ride up and down. There is some odd image projection of the landscape that alters with elevation and it definitely messed with my stomach and my sense of balance. If you are prone to motion sensitivity...you have to decide for yourself if it is worth it.

FABULOUS VIEWS. The views at the top are great, however there is more to the OWO. The architecture is amazing; the ride up the elevator is quick, easy , and interesting----you have to go to find out.There is places to eat at the top and it was fine. The gift shop is interesting , but it's all about the views and the architecture.

Great views but $122 for a family of 4...really?. Great views but $122 for a family of 4...really? The elevator takes you up to the 100th floor where they herd you into an area where they try to sell you a $15 iPad rental to match to what you are seeing out the window. Skip this and go down the escalators. View are great, but the attraction seems pretty expensive. Tickets are timed, so buy in advance to skip the lines.
worth the cost. we paid for VIP access and I'm glad we did - we got in a bit before the crowds and no lines. the view of the city from above in the quiet is outstanding.

amazing view and one of the best thing in new york city. its worth going to this place but be smart and go 1 hr before sunset so that you can see the 360 degree view of the city in day as well night.avoid going in the morning or afternoon.this place is close to the metro stations so not a problem .
High Above the Masss. Put on the must do list. Well done, a bit pricey, but worth it.The elevator ride alone will take your breath away.A new shopping area coming!!!

Great Views, Clever use of technology and a fitting setting.. The lifts up to the top have screens for walls which show the rise of Manhattan over the years as the elevator rises through the 100 floors. Once at the top you go into a room for a small presentation which I wont spoil for anyone. You then walk out and have access to floors 100-102. The views, unlike Empire state and Top of the Rock are all from an indoor setting but at that height they are amazing as you can imagine.

Amazing 360 degree view. This visit was amazing from very begging. It takes only 16 seconds for elevator to take you from ground to observatory floor. A lot of animations from elevator to presentation about building before entering observatory. You can experience 360 degree view. After you make a first round you can enjoy presentation about New your that is given from observatory stuff. It was very nice and don't skip it.The best time to go there is around 8pm in summer so you can also see very nice sun set and and after that breathtaking shining New York.The only thing you don't see from this point is central park, but you see ocean, Brooklyn bridge, statue of liberty and much more.
Great Views. You do get marvellous 360 degree views from the 102nd floor, but I wish there was some way that we could go into the open air, rather than have to see everything through glass windows.

Great visit but expensive. You have to do one of the skyscrapers while in New York. This was the newest one and if done top of the rock previously. Compared to top of the rock, the view isn't as good or central in my opinion but there is more to do with the bar/cafe/restaurant, an area where guides come and explain the city to you using screens (fantastic) and both the elevators and the big observatory reveal are big wow moments that are unrivalled by any other observatory. Very pricey and not included in any of the city pass deals but worth doing once.

Amazing views. The views of NYC/NJ are awesome from 102 floors up. I enjoyed the "pre-game" movie whereas the screens lift upwards to reveal a breathtaking view of the city. They spend a bit too long showing films and explaining things but all in all it's a fantastic experience. You can't help but feel as sense of American pride being at the top of this modern marvel! Staff was friendly but not very knowledgeable. But that's to be expected for what they pay their employees. But overall, it's worth the $37 to experience the view. I would have better enjoyed a glass elevator on the ride to the top. They show some really cool 3D stuff but the actual view of the ride up would be neat.

A wonderful view, a magnificent building!. I've been to this place twice and loved it both times!Going up, you pass through an exhibit featuring interviews with workers who helped put the building up, A replica of the bedrock that the building sits on, taking the form of a tunnel you pass through, and some other things pertaining to the history of the site.The elevator is where things really start to get interesting- you are surrounded by full size viewing screens, and as you go up, the image changes, showing the growth and evolution of Lower Manhattan- from nothing but trees and Native settlements to the modern city we all know and love. You even get a cameo appearance from one of the original WTC towers.After that, you get out and find yourself facing a three dimensional screen, which will show you a short (roughly 2 minutes long) movie about NYC. Then they do something awesome- that screen slides up into the ceiling and you're faced with the actual view, facing towards the Manhattan Bridge. The observatory itself has several levels offering a few different dining options, a gift shop with plenty of offerings, and of course, the gorgeous view itself. They've put in a few benches here and there, but overwhelmingly, people like to sit on the heating/AC units around the perimeter of the building. Once up there you can stay as long as you like, or until the place closes and they kick you out, whichever comes first! Do be advised that this place does close a little earlier than Rockefeller Center, or Empire State, especially during the winter months.Really, the only unfortunate thing about this place is that you can't go out on the roof- there's no outdoor space like the other observatories offer. That can make photography tricky, trying to avoid reflections from the glass and all. This is a great way to see Lower Manhattan, and it's unique in that regard- the competition is all uptown, clustered around Midtown.

Wow, on a clear day you can see all the way to NJ shores!. We were fortunate to visit one Wednesday afternoon when there were no crowds. The elevator ride to the top floor - 102 stories (!) is 48 seconds and very interesting. Crowd control is very efficient. Well air conditioned too for the warm weather and STUNNING views. A bit spendy but well worth your time.

Impressive views. The elevator rides up and down are very impressive as well as the presentation at the start. The 360 degree views up there are very nice. All indoors. Given the fairly pricey ticket I would have preferred if the iPad was inclusive instead of an extra charge of $15 but it is still a handy and informative thing to have. Definitely worth visiting.

On top of the world.... Without hesitationI would recommend this experience, when the walls go up to reveal the skyline you really are on top of the world looking down on absolutely spectacular views. You can stay in the observatory as long as you want and ponder NY and the breath taking views. The videos at the start of the tour were emotive and compelling. The staff were professional, well organised, helpful, informative and always smiling.

Beautiful Views :). Decided to take a quick stop here on our first few days in the states. The views from up top were stunning, but the price is a bit steep as mentioned a few times. The only criticism I can level is the desperation to grab money from you in every single way. Almost as bad as Orlando in that respect. Steep entry, then more cash to rent an ipad to tell you the names of buildings you can see, then more cash for a photo of you up there. Pricey stuff in the shop up top along with pricey food. Regardless, its a great place to go and I was happy with my visit. Just make it more reasonable in cost. One tip - book online and visit early as possible - so much quieter

Magical experience . If you're visiting New York and don't visit this observatory, you haven't been to NY! The view is just magical and so calming as you go around and see the skyline. We went there just before the sunset and had the best experience! A must to everyone!

amazing view. this is a great venue to see all of NYC from up high. 360 degree view with ability to rent tablets that will point out all of the points of interest and attractions. huge windows with amazing views of NYC. staff is very friendly. elevators to the observatory are new, fast and provide some education on the way to the observatory. good for all ages. we were there on a week day afternoon and there were no lines. we walked right in,

All I can say is WOW. From the moment you go up until you go back down it is breathtaking. I had chills all over after listening to the video and watching the screen change from each event. It's so hard to imagine just how scared those people who survived felt. That horrific day changed the lives of so many and I appreciate the meaning behind this memorial!! A must see if you go to New York!!

Fantastic Views. Found this whilst planning our trip in January, so pleased I did. Although it was raining the day we went, and the official notification was zero visibility we still could see quite well, we hired the IPad which you stand on compass points and then you can see what all the buildings are when you point the iPad in that direction, we shared one, which worked fine. Great ride in the lift going up the 102 floors - very quickly! Well worth a visit, and incidentally we could have changed our reservations because of the visibility, but we had other things booked, however we were not disappointed, a great attraction.
Wow!!. Beautiful views, breathtaking. Be sure to pay attention on the elevator ride to the top. Amazing video of New York. Ipad rental is great, lets you know exactly what you are looking at.

fantastic, a must visit place.. heartbreaking walking around the fountains, seeing all the names. very peaceful. fantastic experience going up to the observation deck. fantastic views of all new york and surrounding areas. a must visit place.

Out of the world experience. The visit to one world observatory was undertaken along with family and friends yesterday evening just before sunset. It was a splendid sight to see the entire skyline of New York city with the borough's. Enjoyed the hospitality of the bar and restaurant on the top of the observatory with exotic cocktails and was truly outstanding. Must visit place for one and all.
A spectacular view. It's a must see view of the city and beyond. Truly spectacular. The only downside is the commercial feel of the experience--selling something at every turn.

Very moving, a truly emotional visit. Every one should visit the memorial. . Beautiful & heartbreaking at the same moment. God bless all the families and friends. ❤️ visited with our son & daughter In law.
Spectacular view. The Building is really spectacular. Arrived early in the morning and had no waiting at all (around 9 a.m.)

"NYC Skyline at One World Observatory is Amazing.". Our Concierge at our hotel recommended this Observatory, and we were very impressed. We did get a 360 degree view of NYC and we used one of the electronic mapping information tablets that they offer and it was great. This took us just around 60-90 minutes to view. We did struggle with getting tickets to this event, and we were given wrong directions from the doorman at the One World Observatory on where to go to pick up our tickets.

Best Observatory in NYC. Of all the attractions and events we went to in NYC, this one was my favorite. Just about everything about the experience was as good as it could have been. The views are absolutely spectacular, and getting to view the city from all angles with the big windows was a treat. The guided tours and videos about various parts of the city were both entertaining and informational. The only complaint is about the cafe/restaurant... The people didn't seem like they really wanted to be there, and let it show by how they talked to people. The food itself was good, but it wasn't delivered with much friendliness. Overall though, this was an incredible experience. I won't forget the views and getting to learn some history too was great. I would absolutely recommend to any NYC visitor!

Towering above. Spacious observatory with dining available at typical cost, beautiful views and helpful staff make this a pleasure to enjoy. There are optional viewers for rent that will show you the names of buildings when you point it at them. The elevator system, unlike the aging Empire State Building, is about a year old and is super fast with projection screen walls that spend the few seconds showing the evolution of the topography from early times to present going up and a view 'from outside' going down

Top Of The World in One World. The view is incredible from the 102nd floor. We bought our tickets the day before so walked right in from the street. We were on our way up in the elevator within minutes. We didn't appreciate the camera crew waiting to take our photos so we just said No to them and kept going past. The elevator ride is extremely fast and the staff is really efficient in keeping everybody moving. Once we got to the top we didn't feel rushed. The huge viewing area means everybody can look to their hearts' content. When we had seen enough the staff had us on an elevator going down quickly. I recommend going up to see all of Manhattan and the outlying areas. It's beautiful from up there.

Wonderful 360 views. Enjoyed our visit to the One World Observatory! The elevator ride up and down is an experience - and get ready for your ears to pop. We spent about an hour and a half walking around the entire area, taking pictures and enjoying the views. Be aware - the restaurant closes very early so if you want to eat dinner there, check the hours before going.

Out of this world. So the view was stunning we went on a sunny day and could see for miles. I would say the price was steep 36$ a person. An additional 15$ for the iPad guide. The picture we got were beautiful sometimes hard to get with no glare. I don't think we would do it again just because of the price.

Mixed bag!. We pre-booked our tickets before we left the UK and chose the weekday flex option so we were able to choose the day and time we visited. This was not cheap and cost us $85 each but it did give us expedited entry. We arrived for our visit and a member of staff greeted us and directed us to the expedited queue. We went straight through security and then through to the elevator. The trip up in the elevator was pretty good. We went up about 100 floors in what felt like seconds. The elevator turned into a video and as you went up it went through the years showing the landscape of New York and how it has changed over the years. Once we left the elevator we were shown a film of New York with lots of city landmarks on it. When it finished the screen went up and we got a glimpse of the skyline. Make sure you have your camera poised and ready as the screen comes down again pretty quickly. The doors then opened to access the viewing area. So at this point everything was really good and we were impressed and enjoying our visit. However, sadly this changed from this point onwards. As you go through the doors you are accosted by members of staff trying to get you to use an ipad during your visit to see where the landmarks are in the skyline. A nice idea - yes we thought so too and paid $15 to have this experience. You are not provided with any headphones so the narration just comes straight from the ipad. What they don't tell you is that there are two pulse sections in the North and South parts (where most of the landmarks are) and there is a member of staff with a microphone giving out information. We found that this completely drowned out the commentary from the ipad and it was a complete waste of time having it! The information being given in the pulse was actually really interesting so I would just go for that and avoid the ipad if I were you.The views were good but photos weren't great due to the sheer volume of people and the number of reflections making their way onto the photos!It was lunchtime when we visited so we decided to head to the cafe for a snack and a sit down to rest our feet. I really suggest that you don't bother and head to a cafe somewhere else instead. We had a drink each, a vanilla yoghurt and one almond croissant and one cup cake (which frankly I could have made a better one at home myself). This came to a staggering total of $33 - i.e. a right rip off. Even worse we then found that they had tables but no chairs at all so you literally had to stand up to eat. A bit naff really. We eat our overpriced and grossly under rated food and headed to get the elevator down. The journey down was as efficient as the journey up and the view this time was the one world trade centre. As we felt we had been ripped off we didn't bother to visit the shop.So in summary the view is good but avoid the cafe and the ipad!

a must see. Was wondering whether to buy the tickets on-line, but decided not to. We turned up at around 1pm on Saturday 11th June, and bought tickets straight away, very small queue. Through security, and into the very fast lifts. We didn't bother with the Ipad, and as others have said, breathtaking views (check the weather forecast !). There was plenty of space to move around, but I guess it could get busy. An outstanding building, well worth the money.

Excellent!. My husband and I went on a Thursday around 1pm and were able to walk right up and purchase tickets and head to the 102nd floor, no waiting at all. We were under the impression that the observatory deck was actually outside, but it is 100% indoors, so weather shouldn't impact your trip. It was a gloomy day when we went, but we were still able to view the major landmarks.To our surprise there is a bar/restaurant as well as a grab N go style eatery on the observatory deck. It was great to grab a bite and enjoy the views for a while. We paid $37 for standard tickets, I would say it's definitely worth it. We opted not to bring our kids for this trip, as it is a bit pricey, and at the ripe ages of 7 and 3 they would not be able to appreciate it. Crossed off the bucket list!

Wonderful way to spend a few hours. One World Observatory was beautifully designed to show off this great city and neighboring areas. The $15 iPad add on is worth it, you get a terrific narrative of what you're looking at. We upgraded to the priority pass as we didn't reserve tix until the day before. We thought a summer Saturday afternoon would be mobbed, we were wrong. Likely saved 10 minutes of lines. Not worth the upgrade.

Fast elevator. Beautiful building with magnificent view of city. Costs about $38. We did not have a wait. The deck was spacious. Tip- be sure to rent the I-pad device that identifies the landmarks are seeing.

An Architectural and Technical Wonder. If you're an engineer, and architect, an electronic techie, or just someone who loves NYC, you should make time to see One World. A beautiful presentation of NY and 1 World Trade Center

Very, very overpriced for the experience!. So, let me say begin by saying I do not mind spending money on exciting events, adventures, theater tickets, vacations, etc. Please don't misunderstand the title of my review as an indication that we are cheap. Initially, I did not blink at spending $100 for 2 adult tickets and one senior ticket. However, having gone to the One World Observatory, I can only hope to help others save some money. We took a cab because my mother-in-law would be unable to navigate the subway. The ride there and back to our hotel cost $38, which included the tips. When we arrived about 1:00 on a Saturday afternoon, the line was very short. We had a 2:15 reservation, and asked if we could go in early, which they allowed. We wove through a bit of the building, went through security that was a joke, and came to some elevators. The wait there was not very long either. As everyone has said, the elevator ride is pretty cool and creative. However, it lasts only 60 seconds, so don't go just for the elevator ride… Once we got off the elevator, we waited again for a bit to go into a "theater" with no seats. It was very shallow with a huge screen. However, we were so close to it and people were standing right in front of it, so it was difficult to enjoy the same way we would have if the theater had been deeper and with seats. This part lasted a couple of minutes and then we were shuffled into another holding pen. From reading Trip Advisor before I went, I knew this was going to be the iPad pitch, which I had no interest in, so we used this time to go to the restroom. When we came out, the pitch was over and we were allowed in. The first thing I heard and saw was a "hawker" yelling into his microphone about something he was showing on this giant wheel-type screen. All I could think of was a carnival barker. I have NO idea what it was about because I was SO turned off. I realize this is an observatory, and not the "memorial", but it still seemed extremely cheesy and out of place. When we finally moved into the area where all the windows were, I was pleasantly surprised to be able to move about the area quite comfortably, despite all of the people. We never had trouble getting to a window to look out, and yes, the view was great. However, the best is yet to come - since it took only about 20 minutes to weave through the lines to get upstairs, the elevators is constantly bringing people up. There are 5 of those elevators, and it was our observation that most people only spent about 10 minutes or so looking around, and then they were ready to go back down. When we went to get in line, we discovered the elevator line was hundreds of people long, and we had to wait at least another 20 minutes just to get to the elevator to go down. In addition, with the exception of the woman running the elevator, the staff were very unprofessional, loud, constantly joking with each other, and not really paying attention to the visitors. For example, they have this white, silhouette of a city skyline along the windowsill to keep people from getting up on the windowsill. Typical tourist woman was SITTING on the skyline, using her phone, but no one said a word to her. I would not recommend this experience; surely there are other places in the city to see a great view for much less.

A testament to America. It was an exhilarating experience to see so much in one place and to know that the American people built this after 9/11. The one recommendation I would make is to ALSO have the tablets available on the viewing floor - not just when you arrive at the top floor. Until you see all there is to see and to want to know more about what you are looking at, you tend not to rent the tablets that are demonstrated. Also, be sure to pick a beautiful clear day. You can see forever including the curvature of the earth!Other than that small detail, everything else is perfect. It was also nice to sit and listen to the guides talk about highlights of what we were looking at.

Wow just Wow - Great family activity!. Wow just Wow - Great family activity! The tickets are reasonably priced. We booked online w a code for free pin. It was a very plain "one world" but it was still a nice little souvenir. The views are amazing. When taking photos, consider the time of day & the sun. Enjoy this special location & never forget 9/11.

Stunning Views. We were recommended to do this by a local, instead of ESB or TOTR, and so pleased we did.Short queue to pay, and not too long to wait for one of the several lifts to take you to the top. The lift goes from ground floor to the Observatory floor in less than a minute - but it doesnt feel like you are moving at all. The lift journey is brilliant and that is as much as I'm saying :-)Once at the top, another surprise before making your way through to the observation level. On reaching this point, you are pulled together thinking you are getting a talk from one of the guides, but this it to try and sell their Ipad interactive tour, so if you are not interested in this, you can bypass this and continue. We didnt bother.We were so lucky with the weather, bright blue skies and not a cloud in the sky. The views are simply stunning, all 360 degree of them. In the right place, you can take a picture looking down at one of the memorial pools. You can stay in the observatory as long as you want and you can wander around at your own leisure.The staff were helpful and informative.One World Observatory is well worth a visit. However, the cafe is very expensive (as you would expect in this location) so maybe wait until you are back outside for food and drink.We did One World Observatory prior to the 9/11 Tribute Centre and Museum, and for me, that was the right way around to do it.
Great view. The ride in the lift is amazing, the views are impressive but the building is obviously not as iconic yet as the ESB so if you could only do one, then I would say, do the ESB.

The top of New York. A great experience! The elevator up was really cool, I wanted to go up a couple more times. We rented an interactive device that was available when you get off the elevator and it just enhanced the experience, I definitely recommend it. The device turned out to be a fun educational tool for my 7 and 8 year old.

Wonderful. Fantastic experience. Special moment in visiting This place in the new World Trade Center. The building is spetacular, the views are nice but is all about the experience of returning to This special place after Sep. 11th. Wonderful.....

When They Raise the Curtains...... WOW!. Fun trip up to the top. Great panoramic view of NYC, you really feel like you are on top of the world. Personally though, the best view of the city is from Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock).

Moving . As you approach one world the taxis and cars all stop beeping the atmosphere changes . There seems to be less jostling for the queue the observatory is superb well organised they don't over fill the lifts Wich was a thought I was dreading . Plenty of room for photos . The fountains outside where lovely I personally didn't take photos out of respect as there was obviously families of people with flowers to lay on the plaques.

Best views of the city!. We went to the one world observatory and what can I say other than wow! This place is amazing. The views from it were astounding and the staff were helpful. The whole setup of the tour was really well laid out. It was a little daunting looking down from the windows to the bottom and you can't even imagine what ran through the heads of the people in that building that high up all those years ago, so that was a little sad. It was amazing to see though and I think it had all been done really respectfully. I would definitely recommend this tour as there are somethings that they do that are breathtaking but I won't spoil that for anyone. Definitely get it booked!!

Breathtaking. This is the best observatory in New York. We have visited The Empire State and The Top of the Rock,but nothing took my breath away more than here. At one point all you could here from the visitors are gasps of surprise! The views are outstanding. A stunning building standing tall and in honour of what stood before it. We will definitely visit again.

Best thing to see in New York.. This is a must-do thing when in New York. The views are amazing. It was fantastic to be above helicopters as the flew around the skyline. Won't say what the best part of the experience is as I don't want to spoil it for first-time visitors.
No words. This building is so beautiful, the welcome to the observation deck is stunning and the city views unsurpassed. Really spectacular treat.

Fabulous views. Great views....just don't do the ipad thing...its a rip off and gets heavy carrying it around. There are people giving talks which are much more informative. No one is rushed, can walk around and take as many pictures and absorb the view. We had lunch in the restaurant...its not the cheapest but it was very good. There is a café also if you don't want a seated restaurant.
Great View and elevator ride is AMAZING! . Takes a little over an hour. It was a great part of our day along with 9-11 memorial and museum. I recommend you do it first.
One world. This wasn't as good as I thought it would be. A big build up for nothing. Top of the Rock was 100 times better than this.

What a view. Top of the World. Highest Building in New York. Well worth paying to get in. Was not included in the City Pass. The lift was so fast and smooth. The building is so new. It's really good. Don't feel u r so high up. Could have stayed all day. Cafe and bar included. You can see for miles and 360 views. A must do.

WHAT VIEWS. We thought we would visit this tower and it is worth every cent. Once they open the curtains the views of the city are stunning. It has a good cafe and a good if small shop for must have souvenirs.

Great view and history. One World gives you a great tour in the NYC history, from you step in the elevator and until you leave, Its a bit expensive, but In my opinion well worth the money. It is not as many people as the more famous Empire State building, so i would visit One World in stead

Expensive but the best observation tower I have been to.. The price to enter was $37. They try to get you to rent iPads at top for $15. The views are outstanding. They also have a bar which is nice to sit down and enjoy but it's New York so nothing is that cheap. Highly recommended

They got it right!. Take this awe inspiring elevator ride to the top of the freedom tower. It will take your breath away. The views are spectacular and the new tower is a beacon of hope and proof of our indomitable spirit.

Go on a sunny day. The elevator up to the Observatory has a video show on the walls of the elevator. Nice to see but I would prefer to look outside as we go up - although understandably that's not for everyone. There is another display when you arrive at the Observatory and then the walls go up to reveal the skyline view, very nice touch and theatrical. You can then wonder around over a couple of floors and make a full tour around taking in all the spectacular views. The staff are helpful although there were noticeably a lot of them, one came over to to see if we had questions. A nice touch and welcoming. The gift shop is hugely expensive and had nothing of interest for me. The photo shoot was fun but at $20 for the photo, forget it. Overall, definitely worth a visit.

AMAZING!!!!!. Absolutely amazing! You just have to see it to believe it. The building is gorgeous and very high tech with tablets that let you virtually experience the highlights of the city. The staff were all so friendly and really seemed to love their jobs. Overall an awesome experience. We bought the express pass and walked right on in. Highly recommend it.
Dusk and night view outstanding. great experience and if go early evening can stay as long as you like to see night views. Tip just get one iPad and share around.

Best view ever. Best views of any where in the City, very high tech with iPads and movies, but don't eat or drink there. Not good. Tickets are available online for mobile download. They'll take your electronic ticket any time of the day, regardless of what time is on your ticket. Overall, a hopeful space, very symbolic.
Amazing. The elevator is really amazing and the views are excellent. You can hire for $15 a computer which shows all the points of interest worth the money

" not to be missed". I'll start this review with the only negative and get it out of the way, the cost, thought it was a tad expensive. They do have a lot of over heads with security etc so it is what it is.Not giving anything way, the lift ride and reveal are very well put together, top marks.Did not bother with iPad rental, presentation was a bit forced, so just on through to the viewing areas.The views are wonderful, with the uptown side being the most popular, you will still get the perfect photo opportunity, just be patient.One last thing, walking up and just buying a ticket was swift as was security check and lift access,so unless they have a major rush, don't worry about purchasing before hand.

From the Top of NYC. The views from the World Trade Observatory are wonderful. Take time to enjoy all the views. The staff can point out different landmarks that may be new to a NYC visitor. The admission is costly but the experience is "priceless"!

Stunning. I have felt nervous and unsteady on my feet in other shorter tall buildings and would have avoided this one if it were not for friends wanting to visit. I'm so glad we did. I was nervous in the lift and in the upper lobby area but once the view is revealed it is awe inspiring and so other - worldly that you feel somewhat disconnected from the world below. You almost forget you are in a tall building... It's more like looking out of an aircraft window. There is no motion or sway that I have felt elsewhere.

The views are amazing!!!. we pre booked our one world tickets, the staff were very helpful and polite, the elevator is something else, 120 floors in less than 60 seconds!!! the i-pad guide was brilliant, it allowed us to orientate ourselves and know what we were looking at. i found the whole experience exciting, of course its a little over priced, what major attraction isn't? But the views are unrivalled.

Stunning Views - got the package deal of 4 tickets for $105. June 2016. We got the package deal of 4 tickets (this package deal is only available on-line) which can be booked for a specific day and time - it cost $105 including tax. Not sure why there is tax, but the price was less than individual tickets. Ignore the "under 64" age restriction. Not sure why it says that, but our ages were not verified. We booked for 7:15 pm so we could see the sun set (over the rather flat skyline of New Jersey). Views up Manhattan and across to Brooklyn were stunning, especially when all the building and street lights started to come on around 8pm! I think that because the elevator ride was only 60 seconds, it didn't seem we had gone 101 floors and I wished we were another 100 floors higher, to see further beyond midtown. You can see well up to around 34th Street, and the skyscrapers in mid-town block the view beyond that. Looking straight down to the financial district and the new Oculus / Fulton Center and the tops of the skyscrapers in the immediate vicinity was fascinating. Watching the sunset and seeing Liberty and Ellis Island in their entirety was very nice. The iddy biddy Staten Island Ferry boats darting back and forth were charming and there were lots of sail boats going in and out of Jersey City harbor. All in all, a very enjoyable visit. The sales hype for renting ipads for $15 (Audio in English with subtitles in a choice of many different languages) annoyed me because I am a New Yorker and know my way around, but my Italian guests I rented one, and found it useful as it can sense what you are looking at out of the windows. The noise of all the ipads was a bit irritating jabbering all around, but that's me.

THE MOST AMAZING VIEW OF NEW YORK. Along with the Empire State Building and the Top of the rock, this is the third most important viewpoint of the city.Newly built and reflecting the pride of a city that does not stop and that despite the difficulties again stand proudly it stands this majestic and huge building.It is impressive since one admires and is perfectly designed for visitors.The views of the city are stunning from 360 degrees.There is not view like this one in all New York.Unmissable!!Note:It is important to do your online reservation, take advantage and visit the 9/11 memorial museum and park a few steps forward.

One heck of a view!. There were long lines when I went in December but it moved fairly quickly. The elevator ride to the top was really cool. It showed a video of the building's progression over the years but the elevator went at lightning speed so a friend I was with got nauseous from that. The view from the top was spectacular! Only downfall was that it was all enclosed. We had hoped it would be open like Empire State Building or Top of the Rock so you could get the full outdoor experience. Overall good experience!

Truly amazing. This is by far the best tall building I've been up and I've been up a few. The views are amazing and it's a fitting tribute to what was once there. I wasn't going to get the iPad guide but did in the end and would definitely recommend it we also purchased the special pin ticket to get once at the top. To me the start is the best bit with a big surprise, but I won't spoil it.

Fantastic!!. REMEMBER to take a video in the lift going up!!!! Fabulous story in imagery!!!The introduction was interesting if unnecessary - suspect it was there to justify the price!!So saying that the view at the top is fabulous & still well worth paying for...Some hotels will give you a voucher which you need to redeem online....

More than I expected. We visited in the middle of the afternoon so no long queues. The elevator ride was quite an experience in itself and very innovative. The views from the top are spectacular. You don't really need to hire the iPad as the staff are very knowledgeable and helpful giving out more info than the iPad. The down side was the cafe- no hot chocolate left, no chocolate doughnuts left, then there were literally no seats, just tables. So we took our coffee down stairs and sat on a bench. There was no pressure to return to street level to make way for other visitors. The gift shop offered a wide variety of goods for all price ranges. Our visit was well worth the ticket price.

Somber. Went to NYC for my 40th birthday, gorgeous views, nice people but very expensive. I had two glasses of Prosecco and it was more than a bottle I could buy at the store! Very emotional since I was serving my country in England when 9-11 happened. Would go back and try to enjoy more of NYC as a whole.

Top of the World, but New York 101?. I'm a New Yorker, so there's no way I'd miss this. But I write with very mixed feelings. Of course, the views are unrivaled. The technology is mind-blowing. The security is ... what one would expect – very tight. The cost is reasonable and an unforgettable experience. Views - you can't beat them. In all four-plus directions. The cost if you go at off-peak times, is reasonable. If going at peak hours, think twice. The speedy speedy ride to the top of the tower is a wonder. You're shown an amazing illustration of the changing city since the 1600s when it was just a tiny settlement. You won't even feel yourself rocketing 100 stories above the city. That's actually part of the problem – one of the best features goes by way too fast. Once you arrive at the top you're shown a video and a chance to rent an iPad at $15.00 a pop. Not horrible, but little tacky. Don't worry, the hucksterism continues throughout the experience. To be fair, I did not try the food offered. Once you're touring the top floors you'll notice guides offering stories about New York. Sort of. Like what we call Uptown and what we call Downtown. And the chance to buy ... anything. Or the price of real estate. New York 101? All told, I found this aspect of One World Trade highly annoying and disrespectful. This should not be treated as an amusement park. The ground is hallowed as far as I'm concerned; 3000 people died there. The new Trade Center really has fascinating aspects to it, but shouldn't be treated as Disney ride.

Overpriced view. This may be worth doing once but the cost makes it hard to justify a return visit. The staff are good and do a good job to keep people moving along. Staff at the top do a very good job of entertaining you and providing information about the different parts of the city. Worth doing but be prepared to pay a lot for the experience. I

Loved. This is a must do for anyone that remembers the horror of 09/11. The observatory is lovely and has exceptional views. But walking thru the memorial is stunningly emotional. The place is quiet and meaningful. The crowds were very respectful. The atmosphere here is reverential.

A must for your first visit to NY. Buy your ticket on line and turn up to enjoy, the elevator ride, the short video presentation and the Ohhhh so spectacular view (on a clear day). Truly great visit and well presented. You don't need to rent the iPad units if you are reasonably familiar with the city as you can make out more at of the usual highlights

A must see - and there a surprise in store..... Buy tickets online to avoid lines and be wisked away to the top of the city. Don't rush through the halls - watch the thoughtful and touching videos about the thousands of workers that made One World possible. There's a surprise (that I won't give away) and plan to spend at least an hour going through the next floors and even consider stopping for a bite in the restaurant with a nice glass of wine

Views are amazing . We visited the One World Observatory on our last day in NYC and we were so happy we did. This is a whole experience, the highlight for me was the elevator ride to the 100th floor then to be greeted by those amazing 360 degree views was spectacular. Don't miss this one.

Awesome views. I really enjoyed this experience, but I learned from the reviews and got tickets at an early time. I found a discount code from Century 21 that helped with the cost. You can also just have the ticket on your phone. They can scan it off of your phone. We arrived at 9 and didn't have any line at all. Up to the top we went and of course the sales pitch for iPads and what not were there, but it seems like if you wanted to know good info, the iPads were a pretty good deal. We went down to the 100th floor because it was the largest viewing area. It was a great experience with great views!

Must-See Views. Breathtaking views all around. I could have stayed there all afternoon. The iPad rental with the virtual reality tour was worth the extra $15. Even the elevator rides up and down are entertaining.
360 views. Amazing! You are so high up and have a bird's eye view of everything. Better view that 30 Rock or the Empire State building and so modern. Worth the money and wait!

That's a tall building. It's $32 to ride to the observation deck so we just stayed outside. Must say it is a very impressive building. The entire museum and memorial area is very tastefully done. The new tower itself is extremely impressive. I usually am not a big fan of modern architecture but the new tower is nicely done. I think it is worth a trip but between the cost of the new tower and the Memorial Museum it is costly.
One World Observatory. Last destination of our tour. The visit to the 102th Floor and the view from the top was mind blowing. I will cherish that moment throughout my life.
Defintiely a place to visit. Awesome views of New York City. Day and night, Some beautiful pictures of sunset can be taken. can be crowded but security ensures people keep safe.

Incredible views!. Completely worth it! We were told the view would be zero, but we took a chance and went up anyway. The fog cleared and we could see quite well! Wonderful docents at the top, incredible views, even an interesting ride in the elevator. Quite an experience!

Outstanding!. It starts with the most fantastic 42 second 102 floor elevator ride on earth. High tech, entertaining, innovative, are only a few words to describe it. After reaching our destination the drama builds even more with both sites and sound until the curtains rise and the NYC skyline is exposed far below. This should be destination #1 when coming to NYC.

Pleasantly surprised. I visited many tallest building observatories in the world - including the Burj Khalifa and precious WTC tower. I wasn't in hurry to see this one - i thought I knew what to expect - I have seen the view from this perspective before. It was my family from Europe that really wanted to visit this tower and I just came along for the ride. Was I impressed when I got there! It's a truly unique experience that starts even before you enter the elevator. I will not give out details, but please k ow that even the tallest building in Dubai did. Or give me as much thrill as the World One! It's a must go when in NYC. It's fabulous, entertaining and at times emotional.

My Heart is empty. How sad that this no longer exists. It is like a giant hole in the city to not see the beautiful towers any longer. I did get to go to the Observatory before it was tragically taken down

An amazing experience with incredible views. We visited midday on a beautiful clear sunny day. Our tickets had been pre-booked so we made our way straight in. There was no queuing. They have done a really good job - it's not just a lift up to a pretty view, it really is a good experience. The views at the top were incredible and we were able to really take our time going round. The only downside I found was the cafe, horrendously priced but lacking in quality and not great seating.

Great heights!. Unlike similar attractions this is more than just an observatory, it's a full experience about the building and how it was made with presentations and interactive activities on offer. But let's be honest, it's all about the view, absolutely spectacular!
Stunning panoramic veiws. This is a must do if visiting New york! Gorgeous veiws of the whole island, Brooklyn, Liberty/Staten/Ellis Island, and New Jersey!

A must in NYC. We really enjoyed going to the top. We paid a little extra and bought the expedited tickets with open times to attend. No lines - right to the top on our schedule. The view is amazing! We decided to have a drink at the bar, but instead had a light meal and drink overlooking the river and NJ. We did not have a reservation, but walked right in. My wife and had done the same trip many years aon in the old World Trade Center. We did the WT museum first, then went to the Observatory. We strongly suggest that order. Enjoy!
