You have to go. Did not go to the top, but you have to visit the area and park around. The reflection pools and memorial at the site is something you can not miss. Just couldn't take the time or spend the money to go to the top. I am sure the view would have been fabulous.

Emotional, Educational, and Patriotic. The whole trip from start to finish was amazing. Telling the story of what happened as well as how they rebuilt it after 9/11. Something that my children and I will never forget. Although I think the Empire State Building has a better view the meaning and history behind One World Observatory makes it a priority on any travelers list of things to do. Amazing.

Must visit for views and relaxing!. We visited New York city in 2000 and visited world trade center . Now When we visited New York this thing is our must to do list .We booked in advance on May 7th . There is hardly any wait. Great Views. You can see Manhattan, West street ,Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge. Inside some people are explaining about New York history and about art We sat and watched about the history of The Time Square building. I learnt that it’s empty because the owners are getting their money by bill boards ads . WOW! If you need iPads were available for $15. There is a café and restaurant if you want to eat. After that we bought some souvenirs and went to walk on surrounding area and relaxed in star bucks and did Brooklyn Bridge walk. I wish I did some shopping in century 21, may be next time. People are very nice here and gave directions whenever we needed.

Top of the world!. New observatory on the top of Manhattan's tallest building with unrestricted views of all of Manhattan, Jersey City, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island. Well organized entrance, clean, spacious, surprisingly uncrowded considering the number of people visiting the nearby 9/11 memorial.

Great interactive experience. Tons going on at the observatory. The elevator ride is cool and shows the gradual change and expansion of NYC. Really puts things in perspective. One mix bar is pretty cool. Definitely fun to have a drink with a view. The views are phenomenal, However I do wish there was an outdoor observation deck like the Empire State Building. It adds more to the experience when you can hear the sounds of the city and feel the wind on you. I remember visiting the original twin towers observation deck and it was so cool to get that experience. Cool experience over all.

Breathtaking experience!. This was one of my favorite places to visit. It is an amazing building and the elevator ride was breathtaking. A show on the walls of the elevator on the ride up. It took only a short time to ride up 102 floors then the view was amazing of the city! Another must place to visit in NY.

Stunning building - cheesy experience. This pristine building is located directly next to the Ground Zero memorial site. A lift whisks you up to the top floor in about a minute. Then you're shown a sort of 'compilation' film and then the screen goes up to reveal the New York skyline. It just didn't do it for us.

Amazing building and view. This was still only half constructed last time I visited New York so to see it in all its glory now was great to witness in person. The building its self is spectacular. The staff are friendly and help and the views of the city are amazing this is not just a building to climb and then see views there are plenty surprises along the way that I won't spoil! The bar at the top is amazing and not too expensive so don't be put off if your with a loved one and want a romantic drink.Recommend to anyone.

Stunning view. Even if you don't like heights you don't want to miss this! From the 102nd floor you can experience stunning views of the statue of liberty, Ellis Island, New Jersey, Uptown Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island. The One World Observatory is a fantastic way to get a 360 degree view of NYC and its surrounds, an even lets you get a glimpse of the Empire State Building, which you wouldn't get to see if you go up to its own observation deck!

Another must see.... The last time I was here, I took the helicopter ride, which was great. This just as good - it's so high that you are actually looking down at the helicopters circling below. A great was to start a trip, giving as it does a sense of the scale and layout of NYC, New Jersey, Brooklyn and all the rest.
Touching. Beautiful place to visit on a quiet morning. It's a touching place that worthy visiting in a group or alone.

Stunning. If you have issues over elevators and heights this is not for you. Puts the Rock and State into downgraded spots. This for me was spectacular from the journeys up and down to the 'landing' at the top to the views above helicopter level. This is a must visit even at $32 a shot

Breath-Taking. The experience at One Word Observatory at WTC starts on the line outside. While you cue to get to security you stand in the shadow of 1 WTC, and look straight up into the heavens. If there's no cue, stop a moment to look-up anyway.You walk in, then ride down to the security post(s) for a quick check - a la Airport Style. Polite & professional security people make this an easy (non-TSA) process.Collect your change & keys and walk 15 steps into a cool, dim and touching multi-media display of WTC history: Yes, all of it. Take your time, no one will rush you. Absorb the enormity of where you are, and what was there, and who you'll never see again. When you're ready stroll a few yards to the elevators, and prepare for your assent.Your elevator is also a multi-media experience; showcasing the "P.O.V. Timeline" from where you stand, looking out onto the past; going back 300 years to the present. It's a fast ride considering it's over 100 floors up.Get off on the elevator to be met with the spectacular current view. It's amazing and you think, "It's small, but so very nice." However, you then realize that you're on a downward ramp to the main portion of the observatory.The circular observatory itself is modern, well designed and provides wrap-around views. It's almost impossible to have your vision blocked by others since the walls are all glass and run from floor to ceiling.From one side you can look straight out and see the Bridges into Brooklyn. From another side you look straight down to see the WTC Memorial. And Between, every view down-town & up, and into Queens or out to N.J.Note: a) Of course there's a gift shop; but not too expensive considering you're in NYC. And...b) Outlets to charge your phones at every turn. They are there for you to use. And...c) They offer audio tours (with head-sets) for you to rent. Offered in many, many languages.

What a view...worth the time and price of admission. This was a really interesting attraction...we would highly recommend this place for a visit. Even with our friends that had a fear of heights, they were OK with the way in which they have designed this observatory. We visited on a clear day and could see for miles...pay the extra $15 for the interactive iPad that features more detailed verbal information on sites and attractions in the NYC and surrounding area. This place is well worth the visit! Make sure to get advanced reservations before you plan to go.

take my hat off. Visited the 9/11 Memorial and One World Observatory during a recent business trip and was amazed: Great architecture, surprising elements and above all stunning views. a real experience and highly recommended

Incredible views and technology. This attraction is a must do! On the elevator ride up, the walls of the elevator are actually video screens that show how the surrounding area has changed through the years. Once you get to the top, there is another video screen that shows the various sights of NYC, then the screen rises to reveal an amazing view! Then you get escorted down to the 360 degree observatory floor. We opted to pay for the $15 iPad experience. The iPad is calibrated to the views that you are looking at, and you click on the screen of the various landmarks and a video pops up to explain more about that landmark. We were very lucky to go on a clear day.
Best elevator ever!. If you don't want to wait on the long queues of Empire State, this is the obvious choice. Great views.

One world observatory. I love the views over the surroundings. You can also rent an Ipad with the buildings named. The cost for that is to high 15 dollars, and did not work well enough, but did give a lot of information.

Perfect....nearly. First off, if you're reading this then you're probably interested in scaling a tall building for the promised views and wondering if it's worth the admission fee. The answer to that is a resounding yes. The views are stunning and, as long as you book in advance, you'll have very little wait and any gripes over the price are cast aside.The overall experience is nicely constructed. There's a suitable and obvious undercurrent throughout as to why the building exists at all and thankfully it's not overdone in any way, preferring to focus on the technical aspects and the history of the area itself. The build up to the views features a number of 'wow' moments that I won't spoil here, as it will be better if you can avoid them before you visit.What I will mention though, and it's the reason why I don't give this the full five stars, is the moment where you're given the sales pitch for iPad hire which interacts with the view to show you what you're looking at. It almost wrecks the momentum of the build up entirely and by that point you're itching for the views, but are instead shouted at by a guy with a mic about how it would be ludicrous not to spend $15 on one. No, what's ludicrous is that the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere doesn't have a single sign in the observatory pointing out features, other than a tour guide talking through the history of the views at fixed points. It's the most blatant rip-off imaginable and a cynical attempt at avoiding helpfulness to try and extort some more cash out of you. Nonetheless, it doesn't spoil the experience which is otherwise highly polished and one which you'll be glad you did. It features free and fast wifi for uploading the many pics you'll take and there's plenty of seats, food and drink to take your time over. Allow for an hour for the whole experience and enjoy yourself!

Great view. For one of the best views in the city be sure to visit. After paying admission fees they charge $15 additional to borrow a device to help you navigate what you are viewing. It provides a nice history of the city and surrounding neighborhoods but if your familiar with the area, it's not necessary.
A must see. Well worth the money and should not be missed. The lift rise to the top is rapid and very smooth, and the experience of the trip down amazing

Stop pushing the $15 iPads!. After you wait forever in line to get to the top, you're inundated with their sales pitch to get you to rent an iPad or take a picture. I just wanted to see the view of the city and thought all the glitz and pushy sales tactics to be distracting. The 60 second elevator ride was the only highlight, but will give you a seizure if you're so inclined.

Impressive even with a bit of fog.. Even though it was drizzly, we decided to go up. The elevator ride itself was fantastic! The "video" on the elevator was impressive. Because of the weather, it was not crowded at all. We were able to stay and have a drink and snack at the restaurant. By the time we were finished there, it had cleared up, and the view was amazing.

Slow at first.. Your ears will pop in the elevator to the top but It is only about 60 seconds to get there. There is an awkward herding into a standing room only video room. Herding again for an informational lineup. Then the always available overpriced photo opportunity. But once you get past all that the views are amazing. Stop and listen to one of the presenters, they sometimes offer information on how to get to an area most tourists will not find on their own.

Herding tourists and too many screens. Screens and presentations and opportunities to spend more. Crush of tourists almost standing on top of each-other to press themselves against the glass. Tourists glued to their $15 extra screens with their back to the real life view. The real life scene dotted with reflections of said screens. Queues for the exit lift. Maybe we caught the end of the busy sunset period. It got much nicer as the crowd diminished. The view is great eventually, but it somehow lacks immediacy because of the visual noise, the prevalence of screens and of course you're behind glass, so it takes some time to fully appreciate where you are and to begin to take in the view. Pity about the strong headache-inducing fumes from cheap soft plastic solvent from gift shop's keyrings which engulfs the entire southeast corner. The elevator descent was very cool!
Miles and miles. Incredible views, so bearing experience to be standing on top of the old trade towers. A must do for every American.

Great views . I thought this was nicely done and always good to see the city from high up. However it pales in comparison to the 9/11 memorial museum...if you have to choose one go the museum. If you have time to do both definitely do both.

Outstanding. Pick a beautiful day and climb in 47 seconds to the top of this beautiful building. The 360 degree view is exceptional Bring a map with you to be able to identify all the areas and sights. Well worth the price.

Beautiful view of the city. Did the tour and paid extra for the iPad tour. This allowed you to zoom in on buildings you were looking at from the top of the observatory, and gain further information about them.
Brilliant experience.. I think to erect this building so soon after 9/11 was an act of courage and defiance. It's fantastic from top to bottom with restaurant, bar and shops.
Technologic!. A nice view of the city supported by technology but if I have to choose between the One world and the Empire state I really reccomand the second one.

Fastest elevator!!. You have to go to One World if you are in town. Reserving a time online is a must too. The tour and videos you see before you go up are breathtaking. The views are even better. A must!!

One World . This was the best place I visited a sense of what happened that day really hit you. Very busy lots of tourists the Observatory is well worth a visit some stunning views and the show in the lift is typical American entertainment Should make this a must when you go also nice places to eat. Reminds me of the city in London

Visit to one world . Great piece of engineering. Amazing views of Manhattan. At the top of one Theresa's an option to hire a Really clever iPad which had I information about all the key sites in NYC. Lift was super fast! Opportunity to have Casual lunch at the top!

Best views of NYC. We celebrated our baby's 1st birthday here. He didn't want to leave. 3 hours later we left. The views are breath taking from every window. Get in early to not have the windows blocked by lots of other visitors. Entry was $37. For 2 sandwiches and 2 coffees was $42 which we thought was quite expensive for what we got. Nice restaurants didn't charge this much but for lunch with this view I'd pay it again. Photo packages start at $20.

top of the tree. great views around New York from the south. Very impressive building with the meorial fountains just outside and visible from the top as well. Queue time much less than empire state and top of the rock.

Incredible views. Wonderful experience on this tour, from the ride up to the 102 floor in 60 seconds you watch as the the city grows around you. Then you get a preview of what the city was, with the curtain going up to reveal the wonderful skyline of NYC. Also right next to the 911 memorial which you must see.

Stunning ! Breathtaking !. We went on the tour at 8PM, there was no line. You'll have to go through a security process, and then you'll go to the top of the building in a stunning elevator that shows you the story of New York from the ground to the highest floor, and through the centuries. You'll see a short movie, and be prepared for themost breathtaking experience when it ends !!! Totally worth it !!

excellent. we went to visit the observatory on a Saturday i was very surprised that it wasnt crowded..the elevator trip was an adventure everyone will love...the views are amazing and the restaurant in the observatory was excellent !!!

Stunning. They did such a great job with this tour. The elevator takes you to the top in 60 seconds and provides a view of what NYC has looked like throughout the years. We rented an ipad for $15 that told a little more about what you were seeing. We also grabbed a drink at the bar. The staff was friendly. Overall a wonderful experience. Sad when you realize why you are visiting but beautiful none the less.

Superb views. We chose our day and time carefully for this visit as our experience of going up the Empire State Building last year had not been positive. We booked tickets in advance and paid $32 each which I thought was reasonable. We went at around 10:00 on a school day before holiday season had really kicked in so there was no queue at all. We also ignored all the add-ins of the green screen photo, iPad rental etc and therefore got to the top pretty quickly. The experience has been designed to be full of theatrical impact from the 360 degree evolving visuals in the elevator which whips you up to Floor 102 in about 41 seconds (your ears may pop!) to the 'big reveal' when a cinema-style screen rises and you join with others at gasping at what lies before you. I found this very moving. You go down a level or two for the Observatory itself and the views are completely spectacular. I am not bothered by heights myself and at no time did I feel unsafe but I could not help thinking about those people who had once looked out at a similar view but never got back down. Part of my decision to go up was to pay a sort of homage to them and also to say that no-one should ever be able to stand in mankind's way of seeing creativity at its best.
The tallest building in the Western Hemisphere!. After buying a ticket the elevator zips you to the 100th floor in about a minute. The views are unbelievable!

Over priced hustle . Paid for priority entrance and staff just put into the regular line. Only after snaking through a crowded corridor that offered little in the way of information did we realize that purpose priority purchase was never honored. You get a great view; that cannot be denied. But the harangue of trying o take your picture, selling some iPad experience , the whole thing felt cheese you. And we felt duped. The view of course is spectacular. But beyond that it was a waste of two hours.
One world observatory. One of the most amazing experiences I have ever had. The ride up to the observation deck alone was incredible!!!

Spectacular views from the top. A must visit when you NYC. This experience should follow after visiting the 9/11 Memorial. The experience is well worth the money spent. The views of the city and surrounding area are breath-taking. Well Done.

On top of the world.. The One World Observatory certainly has the wow factor. We visited on a sunny clear day and the views were spectacular. Don't bother to hire an iPad, take your time admiring the views instead. We arrived early afternoon and didn't queue for long.
What a view!. I remember going up in the world trade center and being awed by the view and now going up in the freedom tower reminds me of how great the view really is. I must see if you're in nye

Great!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!! . The views are amazing. The way the tower has been done as an attraction is fantastic. There is a lot of information about it and no mention of September 11th which I think makes the tower special in what it represents. I do agree that the tower staff put a lot of pressure on you to sell sell sell everything and anything, it had to be commission based up there! We had one girl give a talk about places to go and things to do using an interactive board which was a real highlight.

Stunning Views. High-tech effects. PROSStarting from the elevator ride to the 104th floor, we were presented with stunning views and multimedia effects.CONSBottom view from the tower was just simulated.TIPS:Save at least 2 hours for the towerPrepare your video cam once you board the elevator- record the elevator experience, then the multimedia presentation once you get out of the elevatorTime your visit during the transition time from day to night so as to uniquely experience the NYC skyline in two settingsWatch the City Scapes presentation- you will learn lots about NYC, from localsIf you plan to eat at the restaurant,and on budget, order the small dishes like the calamari and the dried pork ribs because they actually have large portions. For example, for an average of $20 per pax, youll have a magnificent view of the sunset over New Jersey and NYC.Order your tickets online so as to skip the ticket line and go directly to the tower entrance

A Must. One World Observatory has significance to everyone. From the minute you enter into the elevator, you realize that your in for a unique experience. As the elevator races up to the 102nd floor, three of the walls show a pictographs of the growth of Manhattan Island from the beginning until present day. You then go through. A quick presentation of everything of present day New York City including a rushing subway car. Then...it's time to move down onto the Observatory level, where you are afforded a 360 degree view of NYC, Long Island, New Jersey, upstate New York and on clear days Connecticut and Pennsylvania. This is definitely views that must be seen first hand to truly appreciate.

Absolutely incredible. This was by far the best thing we did while visiting New York City. The elevator ride and surprise as you went to the observatory were amazing. (I won't spoil it!) The 360 degree view of all of NYC was so awesome. You can pay $15 to rent an iPad, which will identify all the buildings in the distance and give you a short video about them. Wonderful for pictures!

Amazing Elevator! and a great view!. We did this as part of a full package tour. We had (x2) 5 year olds and a 7 year old. They had fun and felt welcome! The 5 year olds were free as part of this package. Great view and an amazing elevator! Overall a great day!

Spectacular view . Visited the "One World Observatory" as a part of our tour. Had 1 hour to go in, up, around and then back down which you can do if there is no waiting line ahead of you. Going up the elevator is an experience on its own. A the wall- screens of the elevator change the higher you go showing how NYC changed through the years. Going up the observatory there is an intro presentation that doesn't take long. Now st the main observatory: spectacular views of the whole NYC and beyond. However, and is the lost star: 1. There is no explanation of what you are looking at. You just look.2. If you want to know what you are looking for you need to rent an iPad with an app on it for an extra 15$?? WHAT? I have paid my entrance fee!! Why shall I pay anything more to "enhance" my experience? Just put something by the windows explaining the buildings around it and let the iPad thing for those who are too lazy to read...
Fantastic View. If you are visiting NYC, please go up to One World Observatory. The view is unbelievable. but get your tickets on line and be punctual.

Great 360 vista. We went up to the tower on a sunny day and the views were amazing. The ride on the elevator is very short given the distance you are covering and there is a fantastic video showing the history of the city. It is a bit pricey but unless you book a tour in an helicopter which is more expensive you will not get better views.

Sell Sell Sell. The view is fantastic of course but the staff are rude , only interested in selling photos, iPads - the prices in restaurant and souvenir shop are outrageous - organisation very poor also - lift is spectacular but they cram so many people in you can't get the correct view of it ..

A must!. This is a must visit for all tourists in NYC!!! The views are absolutely breathtaking and iconic. They have really planned the entire visiting experience very well from the elevator ride to return ride.

Brilliant visit. We were fortunate enough to visit the Twin Towers and weren't sure how we would feel about the visit, but it simply blew us away. We were in the city with sun and clear sky's but of course the day we had booked to visit was rain with mist enveloping the tower. The staff were terrific and rebooked us to visit the next morning when it was fortunately totally clear again. I won't say anything about the lift except that it's almost worth the entry money alone, and your introduction to the view from the top sets the hairs on your neck tingling. I hadn't realised that all views were behind glass (doh) but this didn't impair the glorious views or quality of our pictures. The only downside was the attempt to persuade you that you needed to hire an iPad to enjoy the experience - in fact when you reach the observation deck you can just walk past the iPad demonstration and get on with your visit. A wonderful experience

Something To Do If You Can't Find Anything Else. Yes, this is a great view of the city, but you're totally enclosed and see it through glass. I was also a bit irked by the fact that once you got up the elevator, you were made to stop in a line where you can rent a device that you hold up to the window that tells you what you're looking at. So the admission, only covers the elevator rides? Why not have a board by each set of windows showing that? It wasn't a big deal, but just irritated me that we'd just paid for the ticket and before you could get through to see what you'd paid for, they want to make more money.

Sadly disappointed. I was sadly disappointed with One World. I enjoy visiting observation decks but found the staff here to be very unfriendly and wanting to push people into buying group photos and special iPads. The view from the top is fine but no where near the views from the Empire State Building or Rockefeller center. The viewing room is fully enclosed which does not allow you to walk outside and contains many over the top, gimmicky, high tech screens and demonstrations about New York City events. There is very little history of the building, information on how it was built, Information on the design, or other information to make the viewing deck more than just windows on a city. This is the quintessential tourist trap and sadly not worth the money it costs. I personally enjoyed the older New York buildings for better views and a more authentic experience. This place just wants your money.

Unbelievable . This not only has incredible views but is clean and beautiful. With a potty training kiddo right now, I award the restrooms as the cleanest in all of New York City :). The views and the information are really well done. The iPad location tool are a nice added bonus. My kids of all ages as well as my husband and I were very impressed. Extremely well done.
Must do. Wow is all I can say for this place. Well worth a visit as the views are unseen and it's got a lot to it. It's also well organised so didn't find there was ridiculous queues everywhere.

First trip to New York . The One World Observatory was a neat way to see everything in 360 degrees from 1800 ft above. The elevator ride to the top was absolutely something to experience. It was kinda foggy when we went so hard to see a lot, but on a clear day or at nighttime would have probably been the best time to visit

Must experience . Very well organized, the line move fast to buy your ticket, the staff was great, the elevators are incredible ... You'll see what I am talking about ...Great gift shop, don't waist your time eating at their restaurant, too many other great spot in NY, if you like French food, Les Halles is around the corner Anyway back to my visit, I felt safe, not rushed and for the price it is a good value for what you will experience, the views are stunning, don't waist your money going to the crown of the Statue of Liberty after that visit, you will highly regret it, see my other trip post under Statue of Liberty" don't wait your ....Have a great day and God bless NY!!

Very impressive, what a view!. The elevator ride is really impressive and interesting, watching how NYC was built over the years. The view is awesome, the glass is really clean, so you can take beautiful pictures. Loved it!

Unsurpassed NYC view. We're essentially locals (work in NYC, live over the river), so we've done many of the attractions over the years. A visit from out of town friends promoted our first trip to One World Observatory. We purchased tix in advance - regular, no priority. Almost no wait at about 11 am on a sunny day. The elevator to the top was very cool. You're treated to a history of the City. All the pictures don't do justice to how amazing it is to be able to walk around and experience a 360 panorama of the NY and NJ. I've been to ESB and Top of the Rock. I'd say One World is the best.
Not worth it. You are so high up that you cannot see anything below you and thus is not a great view. I recommend going to the top of any other building so you can see the World Trade Tower!

Must See. "Awesome" is a good one word descriptive term. A new classic icon that was on our "bucket list". Visited late Thursday evening around 6 pm. Virtually no line. Paid about $75 for two. Neat fast elevator ride. Fabulous 360' view. The associated memorial and new mass transit stations are special.Foreign visitors were well represented. All Americans with burning pride need to see this new icon.
TOP OF THE WORLD!!. We arrived at about 2:30 and they let us go right away. The people running the tour were all very helpful and pleasant. Would go again if we come back to New York,

Stunning building with amazing visitor interaction and views !. Visited 31st may 2016 , little queueing ,polite and efficient staff , very surprised at the short film at the top of the elevator before you get to go onto the observation areas , very clever and gave the wow factor of the view an added enhancement ! recommended if you visit NYC :)

Nice place to see the city from above. This is a slick new observatory. It is pretty impressive, with 360 degree views of lower Manhattan and the rest of the city. At 102 floors, you get a real birds eye view. The ride up was fast and interesting and it was not crowded when we were there. It's kind of pricey at $32, but if you spend time at the top looking at exhibits and listening to the presentations it is well worth it. I mean, this is New York where everything is expensive.

Superb. A must on any itinerary for NYC, the observation deck offers outstanding panoramic views far better than Top of the Rock or Empire State. The elevator ride is very good as is the surprise before you go through to the observatory itself. Well worth the admission fee, book ahead and avoid the lines.
BREATHTAKING. What an amazing sight. Shock factor built into the tour will leave you speechless. To see forever is an understatement. Such beauty and reverence atop a sacred sight.

Crowded. This place is awesome, however it tends to get crowded with lots of tourists from around the world. It's best to find times of the day that aren't as busy so that you can take good pics. With the exception of the crowd, there are no words to describe the views from the observatory.

Amazing experience!!. Incredible!! Well organized facility. Views are endless. The elevator up was amazing. The whole attraction is very well thought out for you to have a great time. A must see!! Well worth the $$

Brilliant view !. We used our tickets from the hop on hop off bus for this attraction - after having to go across the road for the tickets (which was easy to find) we did not have to queue . The lift up is really good and you don't feel it move - only your ears popping. The views are amazing but we had a lovely clear day .

Amazing views but keep the hard sell away. Once up the top waited in a queue to hear about buying the new electronic guide, then told to stand and get photo taken against a blue screen. Didn't like this at all, we paid our money and that should be it. Otherwise , stunning views, but leave the money grabbing elsewhere ...unless this goes towards 9/11 fund for families

OK but nothing fancy. We were on a choir trip with our daughters HS choir- the 911 museum is a better choice. They try to hype this up but if I had the choice the 911 memorial would be first. The views are spectacular and the elevator ride is neat but I wasn't overly impressed with this. I expected more memorial for the victims. Overpriced gift shop at the top.

Dont book tickets in advance incase the view is zero due to cloud cover!!!!. The building is a great sight but as in my title we could not see a view due to the cloud cover!!!!! The staff knew this but still allowed us to go up to the viewing point.We were offered tickets for the next day which were no use as we were going home!!!!We bought tickets in advance but if we had known that the view was zero we would have bought them on the day.Visit this attraction along with the Empire State at the beginning of your trip, weather permitting to view New York.

One of the best experience!. This was the first "attraction" we visited after arriving in NYC and it was absolutely worth it. WOW! What a fabulous visit and a great view. Amazing shots from this place are definitely guaranteed. Highly recommended :)

Prepare yourself for a breath taking experience. One is lost for words to review this experience. You must visit yourself to be truly amazed and satisfied. Be prepared for the most enjoyable experience of your life after exiting the lift. Won't say anymore Enjoy Enjoy Enjoy.p.s Purchase tickets in advance from One World itself and avoid queues which can delay entrance by up to 1 hour

A must when in NYC. We pre booked out ticket on line prior to our visit and would recommend this for busy periods. Line management is very good at one world and we only took 40mins to get to the top. The lift in its self is a real experience. Stunning views with a big reveal, however when you arrive at the top you are constantly being sold too on your way through to the viewing area, we just kept walking and others followed. Always worth popping to the bar for a glass of something if you have the time as you'll rarely have such a view of Manhattan while sipping on Champagne. Has to be done...

Not worth the cost . I just visited the new One World Observatory . It's $40.00 a person !!! That's insane !! It's so cheesy the way it's set up . You have to listen to a worthless introduction when you arrive . Then the shades are lifted and you see the city - BUT , you can't stay there . You are directed out to the observatory deck - But - before you get there you have to go through the cafe . If you do order food be prefaced NOT to sit down as there are no seats - only tables where you can stand and eat your over priced food ! I personally don't think it's not worth it . If the Empire State Building is cheaper - go there . This place is a tourist ripoff !

Amazing view!. This attraction was set up very good. Going up in the elevator was interesting cause the walls showed the view that you would have seen if it was a glass elevator. The elevator is very fast. At the top, you could walk and get a 360 degree look at New York. They will even rent you an iPad that will follow you and give you info on the buildings you are looking at. Pretty neat and definitely a must see in N.Y.

On top of the world... Think once you have seen one high level observatory you have seen them all? Think again! This was is definitely a must do experience in NYC. While the history of the site is never far from mind, it is still a truly magical view from the top deck and the introduction to the view is really special as well.Couple of hints with this one, book your tickets in advance online to bypass the lengthy queue on the ground. I'd also bypass the Ipad guide ($15). I found it clunky and it didn't add much to my experience and I was sick of carrying it around after 10 minutes. There are incredibly engaging hosts on the floor who point out interesting landmarks as you walk around.Overall, this attraction comes highly recommended, you won't regret taking a New York minute to head up into the clouds!

Blew me away!!! . I'd been told this place was better than the top of the towers that are no more, wasn't convinced until we got in the lift. That bit was really good so have your cameras/video recorders at the ready. The movie was interesting, I don't want to spoil it for anyone yet to visit but OMG!!! An absolute must!!
Great view, spoilt by all the selling. Great view, but spoilt by all the selling by staff. Experience of the empire state is much better & would recommend that if you have to choose between the two.

Wicked Awesome View, but look out for the curbs!. We had a seriously long layover at JFK, so we made an excursion into the city to see the 9/11 Memorial. The visit to the observation deck was spontaneous. We didn't make reservations ahead of time, but the ticket line was non-existent at about noon.I'll cut to the chase. They view is amazing. The day was crystal clear, so we could see all around the city with no obstruction or haziness. Kudos to NYC giving us great weather.now, back to the initial experience... You do have to go through security, so don't bring anything you'll regret later. Pack like you are flying. Once you start down the "experience" you walk past Disneyesque fake rock walls and even fake bricks. Seriously? Fortunately, it didn't last long. The ride to the top is enclosed, so you don't get a vertigo-inducing ride. The video of NYC through the years was cool and provided perspective on the area. After disembarking, they try to get you to rent an iPad tour guide. Don't do it. There are tour guides with iPads around the observation deck. If you aren't fluent in English, it might be a good idea. Otherwise, skip it. They also take a picture of you and yours (available for purchase at $35) in front of a green-screen of NYC. We took the picture, but skipped the purchase. And, now, back to the view. Just. Amazing.When we left the building, my husband tripped over the uneven NY pavement and dislocated his elbow. This prompted a day-long trip to the ER (Perhaps I should leave a review for that?) and a missed flight. Moral of the story? Watch out for curbs that aren't really curbs, but uneven mismatched pavement!

Clear blue sky. From the entrance to the exit this is most impressive. We start with the bedrock walk and the elevatorride (loved it) through the film and then just enjoy the views until it is time for another surprise going down. Great job done...go there

Amazing place. Did this on a spur of the moment because it was a beautiful day. What a fantastic view from the top and you can stay there for as long as you like. There's a cafe on top which looked amazing but a bit prices.

the higher you go the better the view. Modern of course and queue was minimal.Well organised affair and whilst there is a bit of disneyism as is the modern way the ride to the top was stunning. The show was clever as well. Stayed for lunch also

Gasps and applause when curtain lifts!. One a World Observatory is well worth a visit when in the city. Even the short lift trip to the 102nd floor is interesting. When you arrive st the top you watch a short presentation before the curtain lifts, and the reactions to the view are amazing, gasps and applause from the visitors. Superb views are on show all around the top of the Observatory. Definitely unforgettable!

Amazing views, scary elevator!. I was extremely excited to get up the top of the One World Observatory but having visited Top of the Rock (the best view in NYC in my opinion) and Empire State, this didn't deliver as I had expected. Whilst the panoramic view was incredible, you are stuck inside behind glass - rather than being able to go outside and feel the air on your face. I suppose this is a safety factor however I felt it dampened the experience somewhat. The elevator up is scary - augmented reality all around you which left me feeling naucious quite frankly. The view was over within 30 minutes - and then you are sold to by a shop or cafe. I would say do it, but visit Top of the Rock instead!!

Fantastic attraction. We surprised our kids by not telling them we were going to go up the One World Observatory, we went for a night time visit and the view was spectacular with the Empire State Building lit up in Red White & Blue for Memorial day.

They must be able to do better than this!. The view is spectacular, but they do such a poor job with the rest of the experience. The website is hard to navigate, and when you get there, the signage is poor, there is no documentation on the walls to tell you what you are seeing, and they spend all their time trying to sell you things: e.g., iPad guides, photos. The elevator experience is the only thing that is done well. If you go, skip all the commercial sales jobs, enjoy the view, and then go back down and look at the Memorial Pool, which is lovely.

Good view over the Hudson and the statue of liberty. This is a brilliant building. The lift takes u all the way in about 40 seconds and in the lift they show a video going up and coming down they are different each way. fantastic view from the viewing deck you can see for miles on a clear day. Even the helicopters ar flying lower than the floor your on
a breath-taking view of NYC!!. Its amazing. seeing NYC from the top is just breath taking. specially the sunset is beautiful if the weather is good. Only 39$, very affordable.

Late lunch at ONE. We had a late lunch at ONE the restaurant at the top of the world trade centre. It was excellent food, service was friendly and the sweets were very good, not US portions but enough to share .

Wow...the views! . The views here are AMAZING! The staff are friendly and helpful. The day we had pre-booked our tickets for was overcast and really really cloudy. When we went the staff said there was zero visibility so if we wanted, we could change our pre booked tickets to the next day. So we did that and went back the next day. There was no issue at all with the tickets. The day we finally got in was clear and cloudless so the views were incredible. You could see for miles and miles. The photos we took don't do it justice. There's a little presentation when you first go in and that's good too. They only keep you for a minute but it's a good show.Even the ride up in the lift has a show. Overall definitely with going to!
Amazing views . This observation deck was top of our list to visit on our honeymoon to New York and it did not disappoint one bit. Amazing views and experience. Well worth the admission price!

Good views but Top Of The Rock is better!. We got here early to avoid the queues which was a good idea, we didn't wait long and went straight up. The unveil at the top is the best bit. You then get held up by a sales pitch to rent an ipad for $15. The views were great but the tinted glass and relfections meant it was hard to get great photos- it was a little hazy on the day we went up too. A very impressive building, but an expensive and over commercialised experience.

Jaw dropping. Americans are the master of entertainment. The observatory is not only a place with spectacular view, but it also tells the story of architectural development in Manhattan. They show how tragical 09/11 was and they pay huge respect for those who died in this tragedy.Avoid peak hours because tourists get really rowdy for a selfie and they forget the meaning of respect and manners.It costs $34 and it is worth every penny!

A little Overdone. Elevator ride presentation super cool. Observation decks typical if all skyscrapers....prefer Empire State Building as you are outside. The beginning presentation at top was overdone and lack the Wow factor.
Amazing!!. I highly recommend visiting. I had been there in April of 2002, then October of 2012 and now June of 2016, incredible what they have accomplished, must see for all!!

Awesom. Not free, but worth the money for the amazing views of NYC. This is a tall building! We did 9/11 memorials and then walk a very sort distance to this building. Recommended a must do. You can see views from Harlem to Staten island and beyond, and everything, yes I mean eveything inbetween

Great view. This attraction is right next door to the 911 museum and therefore can be done in the same visit. The view was amazing! The best part was hearing talks from the guides about New York. It was pricey though!
On top of NYC. The 360 degree views are simply breath taking! Fabulous for aerial photos but not for the feint hearted.

Great views!. Truly enjoyed our learning experience about NYC at One World Observatory. It is so well done -- from the elevator ride to the top -- to the introductory video and guidance up one floor to the observatory area. A must see for out of town visitors as well as the tried and true from NY, CT & NJ.

Spectaculare views and cool elevator.. Best views of the city. Very pleasant building, with nice multimedia installations and the coolest elevator. Full security check before going up. Probably a nightmare during tourist Seasons. Restaurant and shop on top :-)

A must do!. We went there first thing in the morning and there was no line at the entrance which was great. We were the first people up there so we managed to get some good pictures without all the crowds. There are a few employees who make interesting presentations at multiple part of the observation deck and are available for questions. And the elevator ride was an attraction on its own.Plan to spend about two hours to really take in the view.Definitely recommend!

Stunning views. Really loved our trip up to the observation level. Staff were friendly. Had a great time. Queues were non existent on day we went. Booked as part of a viator walking package. Really worth while experience.
Amazing Experience . Just Wow! From start to finish we had an amazing time / experience during our visit. This is a "must do" on any trip to NY...you won't be disappointed.

Wonderful experience. We went to the One World Observatory on our recent trip to New York. We had pre-booked a 'Date Night' ticket which gives you an entry time and a glass of prosecco and shared dessert in the restaurant. I would definitely recommend this. We went up just before sunset and so saw the view during the daylight, sunset and at night. There was no time limit on this so we were there a couple of hours at least and stayed in the bar for more drinks after the included prosecco. The experience was really amazing and the view is fantastic. It's great that you can also go to the restaurant/bar as part of the experience as that made it really special. We hired one of the viewers which were being demonstrated by the staff there - it's like an iPad that you line up with the view and tells you where things are and gives you more info on the various sights. It was good, but if you are relatively familiar with the sights then it's not hard to pick them out and it probably wasn't worth the money on balance (I think it was about $15 to hire). I'm not sure if we just went at a quiet time (7.30pm on a weekday) but there was also no queue (unlike at Empire State) so that was great. The ticket was also very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend this experience.

Great views - as you would expect!!!!. We were walking around WTC on a Sunday morning and noticed that the queues were virtually non-existent so decided to go for it - glad we did!!! The lift up to the deck is quite something - takes 1 minute and the walls come alive with video of the view outside as if you'd been travelling in a glass elevator. The views from the observation deck are amazing!!!

AmaZING. How fabulous is this like the Phoenix Path station below it rises from the ashes of 911 to give a view of the world (in this case NYC) that gives hope, beauty and wonder. Loved it and an amazing way to spend the morning with my son on his birthday.
Awesome!. Breathtaking views of New York! 360 degrees of pure awe. The elevators are so fast and they have a cool historical visual when you go up. Definitely recommend this.
The view is simply amazing. This is an experience we will never forget. The elevator up to the top is so fast and informative. We ate dinner at the top floor with amazing views.

Breathtaking views. This was our first sight see of the day and we arrived at around 9am. We pre-booked our tickets via trip advisor and saved a bit by doing so. There was hardly anyone else there when we got there so we could leisurely walk around enjoying the views. Just being in the area of the World Trade Centre made me feel emotional. Entering the building even more so. The elevator ride up was so quick and a video is played all around you. The views from the observation deck were just amazing. Downside is the usual rip off prices in the gift shop but this was expected! We didn't use the cafe. Highly recommend including this attraction when visiting New York

Omg!. This was an excellent experience the Technology was amazing and the views were even better. We had some drinks and food at the cafe and it was fantastic and the service was very very good.Can not wait to go back!Enjoy my friends.

Up in the air. Amazing views and you can enjoy them without spending extra for the optional ipad that labels buildings. We booked in advance, which turned out to be a waste of money on a quiet Wednesday afternoon in May, but I can easily imagine a busy line. We spent about an hour working our way around the windows and chatting about the sights. The windowsills have a little "skyline" of buildings which makes it difficult to sit or stand on the edge. There are some seats available at points, and there are "free" talks given at intervals. Restrooms easily accessible and water fountains as well, if you choose not to indulge in the pricey café or bar. Of course there's a gift shop! They also take your photo but ask something like $30 for a print. We might have bought one if it was cheaper.One thing we enjoyed was a very subtle display by the escalator (and it continued in the bar) of the history of vision and photography - old binoculars, viewmaster slides, stereoscopes, cameras etc.
On top of the world.. This is a modern new build observatory. Better than Empire state building. Food is available on the deck. A must see place in NYC.

Girly lunch with fantastic view . My friend and I were in New York for a long weekend. My husband had recommended we try the fine dining after viewing New York from the 102 floor observatory tower. So glad we did . The attraction was very well organised. There were no crowds like Empire State. We pre booked restaurant & ticket. $24 dollars for ticket. No queues!! We purchased the use of an tablet($15 )to give you a little more information about what you can see from the viewing level it was very useful. After taking about 45 minutes to view we proceeded to the dining room . The service,food and views were outstanding. Defiantly worth a trip.

A great experience but.... Views from the 102nd floor were incredible. However, I thought the gift shop was a bit small and didn't contain enough variety of items (certainly in comparison to Empire State Building gift shop). Also the glass windows made the photos come out a bit dirty. Would have loved if they had a semi-open balcony like the one they have in Empire State Building 86th floor..

Good but glass reflections and tint spoil it!. We got the tickets thrown in with something else so worth the visit. Views spoilt by reflections and the tint on the glass. I enjoyed open views from the Empire state building better!

highlight spot in NYC !. I travelled with friend to NYC and we went to One World Observatory, to see New York city view, it was amazing and we have some awesome pictures we took there. Highly recommend.

Excellent. Best organised and best viewing platform in the city. Give the others a miss
Quick and efficient and not rushed at all

Incredible views at sunset. We purchased basic tickets for a 6:30 pm ride to the top online days before going. We arrived about 20 minutes early and had no wait or delays getting to the top. The observatory was fairly crowded and we often had to wait for view in front of the glass but it was worth it. Watching the city and beyond at sunset providing many beautiful views. Definitely recommended. Note: drinks in the lounge on top are very expensive!

Fantastic journey to the top. Loved everything about the One World Observatory - especially the elevator ride! The day we went was very hazy but still the view was spectacular - would highly recommend it

Stunning views - so well done.. I was blown away by the views out every window. Great perspective on this magnificent city. Everything that was done was first class - from the walk through the bedrock before you got on the elevator to the timeline as you ascended and the presentation when you got off the elevator - everyone cheered! Well worth the money.

Even the elevator was part of the experience. I pre-booked tickets for our ride to the top, as we were only in NYC for a day and did not want to wait. As it happened, when we arrived (11.30a.m. on a Saturday) it was actually quite quiet, but it could have been a different story. Security was a breeze, The line was short and the personnel were pleasant. Once we entered the lift. I was amazed. I cannot spoil it for first time visitors, but look at the walls, not the floor! The film at the top, was very short and I felt that we were actually too close to the screen, but that was a minor detail. Once we saw the view we were amazed. It was a little hazy but still worth it. We had the obligatory photo taken and purchased it, as we will probably not visit again. You can hire an ipad ($15) which gives information about all of the sights. It was neat, as it moved with you and gave lots of useful facts. We took our time and enjoyed the views and actually walked through twice. The gift shop has the usual offerings and was pricey for children. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would tell others to go. I did not feel unsafe (and I am not a lover of heights), but I wanted to say that I had been to the top of the highest building in the Western Hemisphere.

Great place to watch the lights of the city come on. Pricey and touristy but nevertheless, you can't beat the view from the tallest building in NYC. For a memorable experience, I recommend going in the late afternoon/early evening. Once you've paid to get to the top, it's worth it to stick around a while, have a drink at the bar (not cheap but more or less comparable to what you'd pay in a Midtown hotel bar), and watch the lights of the city come on.

Rip off. The top of the world trade center is like a cruise ship. There is something for sale at every turn most of it vastly overpriced. Yes the view is gorgeous, but it might be cheaper to take flight out of newark airport to anywhere and take some pictures. So far three of us have spent over $160.00 for admission, three sandwiches and three bottles of water. The cafe has no seats so be prepared to stand while munching or find a bench somewhere else. The Port Authority of New York And New Jersey should be ashamed of itself. First the taxpayers pay for the building and then they get ripped off if they want to actually visit what they've already paid for. AGAIN
spectacular. book in advance, apparently Tuesdays and Wednesdays are the quieter days but it was worth the short amount of time in the queue.

Important Info You Need To Know - Fabulous Building. This building is nothing short of fabulous and a MUST SEE while in New York. Definitely worth the visit along with the 911 Museum next to the World Trade Center Observation Building. No need to go on about how incredible it is, as everyone has already done that. So here is some Very Important info that not many others have taken to the time put on here.  (1) BUY YOUR TICKET ONLINE and print it before going. If you get there without a ticket you will stand in line FOREVER. Please look up "Forever" in the Websters Dictionary so you can fully understand what I mean. We saw people without tickets in line when we arrived and the line had not moved when we came down 1 hour later. BUT YOUR TICKET ONLINE AND PRINT IT.  (2) There are 5 types of tickets to purchase from Standard at $32 to Priority and Flex that double in price. When you purchase a STANDARD ticket, you have a time and date on the ticket. You are supposed to go at that time and if you miss it, you are not accommodated. We found this simply to NOT BE TRUE. Our ticket was for May 20, 2016, at 11:30 am. We arrived an hour early at about 10:20am and they don't check the tickets. If you have one printed you get in a line that is moving fast, and they just accept it without even looking at the entry of the building. There is a bar code on the ticket and they scan it right before the elevator. We were worried the scanner would know we are way too early, but it didn't. I am pretty sure if your date is wrong, you might be denied as the scanner might pick up on that. But the time seems to mean nothing. So don't waste you time on Priority or Flex type tickets at 2 times the price that allow you to go anytime during a specific day because they don't check this.  (3) Allow for at least 1 hour going up and coming down. Not long lines usually and it is quite a quick ride to the top with 6 large and roomy elevators. DO NOT WORRY ABOUT FEAR OF HEIGHTS. The elevator is completely inside the building and you won't be able to see outside as you go up or down. You watch a video on all sides of the elevator of a time lapse from when NY was a jungle through the years of today. Less than 20 seconds to the top. Observatory is completely inside and you are not out in the elements or having the feeling of fear of heights. The designers did this on purpose and it has worked quite well.  (4) There is a restaurant on one of the 3 floors of the observatory and also a souvenir shop. All 3 floors are available to use with any ticket. Also plenty of very nice and clean bathrooms.
Must see on a first visit to NY. Awesome program, for family, couples and adventures. I thought that was money well spent as we had an increadible nice warm and clear day of a visit.

Unbelievable Views... NYC's hottest new attraction and well worth it. I would defiantly recommend going up at dusk as you get a view of both day and night. The only downside is there isn't much public seating so you have visitors sitting on the ledges of the windows which at times can cause difficulty trying to take pictures as the window is being blocked. Although I stayed till closing and by 45 minutes prior to, most people had left and I was able to get a great photo.

Beautiful building, pick your day wisely. No doubt it's a beautiful building and should be done along with the 911 museum! The observation deck should be done on a clear day, the weather wasn't great, there was a little fog but definitely impacts the view, but on a clear day would be much be even greater!

Wow! A must do!. Views forever......great elevator concept....but a quick ride. Really difficult to see everythng and take it in especially when the elevator is full. Take your time at the top. Would advise getting the flex day pass or waiting until you in town to book it as the view totally will depend on the weather. We had a great day, but the next day the entire top of the tower was in cloud cover.

Too Commercialized View. Long lines, $34 to ride the fastest elevators, 102 floors in 48 seconds. Restaurant at top is a short order stop, grilled cheese, no chips, drink was $16. Standing around tables to eat.

Awesome Trip to the Top. Really enjoyed my visit to One World Observatory. The highlight was the elevator ride to the top! Although the day we visited was slightly foggy, the trip up at sunset was great. Enjoyed seeing the city come to life when things started to light up. I had purchased the expedited experience, expecting a large line, but fortunately didn't really need to use it when we got there.

Awesome experience . Let me just say I hate heights. However, it was incredible seeing new york through the decades on the ride up 100 floors in like 20 seconds. It was also incredible getting an iPad that is calibrated to show you various points throughout the city and tell you history about those landmarks. The $15 charge was worth it.
Amazing views. Could see all of NYC...worth getting the iPad with the landmarks for a more in depth tour..really enjoyed the history on the way into the tour

Excellent experience. Amazing! Once the 7 day weather forecast was firmed up and I saw the weather was going to be good - which it was - I purchased timed admittance tickets in advance. We arrived an hour early which on that day was no problem and we were able to get right in. It was a Wednesday, around 1pm and there were no lines whatsoever. No one else was in the elevator with us (except an employee). The elevator ride up is one of the best things about this experience, and to a lesser extent, the ride down - there is a ‘show’ on the glass 3-sided elevator depicting the growth of the city of New York from it’s beginnings to today. The problem is that it goes too fast and you really want to look at it more closely, as each panel is different, so cool to see how the city has changed - I wanted to ride the elevator again and again! So well done, but too fast, as the ride up is something like only 46 seconds, very high speed, no time to savor the ‘show'. So if you have a fear of heights or elevators, this cool ‘show’ will certainly make you forget that you’re climbing super fast to the top of the 4th tallest building in the world! Once the elevator ride is over, you see a brief movie projected against the observatory windows on interesting screens, which then dramatically raise up and you are given a stunning teaser view of the outside - it’s really well done! Next, you’re moved into a side area where you are given a talk about the interactive iPad you can rent for $15 which points out all of the sights and buildings in the 360 degree view there at the top. I recommend that you get it. You only need one for your group as you can share it. Here’s what happened to us - we thought, naahhh, that’s a lot of money, we’re just going to set our iPhone to Google Maps to figure out what we’re looking at. That wasn’t a horrible idea, but it wasn’t the best. A family that was done with their iPad and was leaving, asked us if we wanted to use theirs and for us then to return it when we were done. So lovely of them, we gratefully said, “Yes!” - and it was excellent! SO much better than using the iPhone and Google Maps. We ended up going all around the observatory again, this time with the iPad and really enjoyed the experience - the iPad added so much more information, and on many of the buildings pointed out on the iPad, you can click and then a mini-presentation is given with background info on that site/building. True, we didn’t spend the $15, but knowing how much it added to the experience, I can tell you that it’s worth it.Due to the lack of crowds, we never had to struggle to get photos in the windows, getting some great shots without other tourists in our frame. There are staff that give presentations near the windows, and other staff stationed throughout, to answer any questions. We had been to the observatory at the top of the original World Trade Center so to see the exact same view once again was very moving.
Breathtaking view of city. A must see for anyone visiting NY and even locals! Very well presented and worth the wait! The lines were long but that is to be expected on a weekend.

Sky High. The 360 degree view of New York and surrounding area is magnificent. I highly recommend getting the ipad as it shows you exactly what you're looking at, plus gives you a bit of history/info as well.Along with the view, I found the ride up in the elevator interesting. Pay attention the the sides of the elevator as you rise. A video depicts Manhattan from 1500 through 2016. I hope at some point that video will be available for purchase.

Too much work to get to see the view. It was too much of an ordeal to when you got off the elevator to actually see the view. The absolute worst part was when they forced you to listen to their sales pitch about getting the iPad so you could find out what you were looking at. American capitalism at it's worst.There was too much climbing stairs, taking ramps here and there before you got to see the view. Just take us to where we can view right away. I paid good money for the view not to listen to sales pitches or climb stairs.

Best Views. This was highlight of our trip, what a great place to visit and the lift was impressive too. there is 1h free WiFi so we called our parents to show them the view which made it a special and unforgettable experience.
Symbolic . What a moving and inspiring place. Views from the top are spectacular. A must have to do on a trip to New York. Amazing amazing

Breathtaking. We'd seen quite a lot of negative reviews on here and so were really unsure whether to book or not and I am so glad we did!!On our 3rd attempt to go to OWO (zero visibility on 2 occasions and they rebooked us, no questions asked) we had perfect weather on the last day. No queues, security was easy and they turned the whole experience into a spectacular show! From the film in the lift to the experience at the top this is by far the best view in NYC. We intended to spend about an hour in the Observatory but spent most of the afternoon there, including having a couple of drinks in the bar. It's pricey, but definitely worth it. I loved ESB and Rockefeller but would choose this if I could only choose 1. This is an absolute must for anyone visiting NYC - book a time in advance and be prepared to spend a few hours there. We may have been lucky with the queues but had no problems at all, especially compared to ESB.
Magnificent . This building is breathtaking for sure! This is definitely a must see! Definitely one of NY iconic sites. A new building but for sure is iconic...

Panoramic view. Cost is 37$ - we got there 10.30 on Saturday and only a small queue. Well monitored by the staff so things don't get overcrowded. Bar and restaurant - we didn't eat as too early but enjoyed a beer whilst looking at the awesome view.

Breathtaking . a true monument to the original trade centres, if you only do one thing in new York make it this. The tallest in the western hemisphere, the fastest ride up and down,the totall poinience of the place make it a must do.

Sightseeing. The last time we were in NY they hadn't even started building this yet, I was very impressed with this building. We had booked for a 10am visit but it was quiet foggy on the day we were going so when we arrived they offered to Chang our time to 12 noon. We were not dissappointed when we got up there and a little surprised, I won't say what it is as I don't want to spoil it but I definitely had a tear. The views were amazing. Staff were very helpful as with a wheelchair it could have been a bit tricky however one member of staff took us away to the elevator which was kind of hidden away and we met up with the rest of our party who took the escalator. We had a lovely morning and would recommend this attraction.

Freedom Tower. I have been inside the Crown of the Statue of Liberty and I have been to the top of the Empire State Building. Freedom Tower is an experience that tops them both. The view in unbelievable. The entire experience is breath taking. Not least of all is how fast the elevators take you to the top. All very organized and enjoyable. Sit at on the wall across from the entry and look straight up - we took a picture from there that looks like the building goes up forever!

A must visit -- Even if scared of heights. I'm on a bit of a tall building thing right now... I've recently visited the Burj Khalifa in Dubai as well as the CN Tower in Toronto. I really enjoyed my visit to the One World Observatory. It was spacious and I really liked you could enjoy a true 360 degree view. We didn't eat at the restaurant nor buy anything in the gift shop. I liked that there was a speaker there talking about the building and NY and everything that goes with it. I would have liked to stay longer but we had children with us so couldn't really stay too long. Felt very safe while up there. The building didn't sway at all that I noticed.There is security to get into the building which is kind of a pain but they are far less rude than TSA is at your local airport and they were willing to hold my Leatherman during my visit and I received back upon my departure... If only worthless TSA would do that for me.
Amazing. The view is second to none, nothing could compair, 4 drinks cost 52 dollars but well worth every penny

WOW. Absolutely one the highlight of my trip to nyc. Stunning views and excellent value for money. If I travel to nyc again first place I'd return. The elevator and see forever theatre is worth the admission alone.

Fantastic View but too much commercial sales pitch. We only had 20 minutes at the top. When we got up the elevator, they PACKED us in to a very small theater space for some presentation. I told the girl "we only have 20 minutes" and she said (and I know she's paid to say it), "oh, this is totally worth it".... It's totally not - it's a sell job on the amazing view. I was there for the amazing view and I didn't need a sell job... When we were allowed to exit, we were ushered into a smaller room and, based on our location, were forced to wait through a sales pitch for the "living map" thing you can rent or pay for to enhance your visit and view... If I had more than 20 minutes, this might have been great, but really I JUST WANTED TO GO LOOK.... So we managed to sneak around the back of this sales pitch only to find the lines for the "photo op".... It took more than 2 minutes to actually get to a person so I could say "I don't want a picture, I only have a few minutes".... The view was amazing. It really was. It was from the Old Trade Centers and it is from the Empire State too.... But this was the first time my son got to see it and we literally wasted 7-10 minutes of our very short visitation window. I hate sales pitches, I hate forced photos, and I hate "mandatory" videos that are there to sell me on what I am already there to see.... Also, the people that worked there seemed mostly unhappy and were very short with folks standing in line. The view was awesome but the visit was honestly made unpleasant by the forced sales and unhappy employees. Maybe whoever is running the tours and makes a ton of money just on people riding an elevator should let those who just want to see the view see it and stop the commercial sales pitch garbage.

Awesome in every aspect. So much thought has gone into this whole experience and that is evident from the minute you step through security. The lifts both up and down are an experience that we will never forget - be ready with your video camera. Unforgettable. The view from the observatory is - naturally - stunning and there are just about enough staff around to answer questions. The 'queueing' system is superb and eliminates unnecessary waiting around.

Definitely worth a one time visit at the least!. As a born and raised NY'er, it's not often I do touristy things. The opportunity presented itself when I played the role of tour guide for family in from Uruguay. I am so glad we did it. The facilities are impressive -the elevators and video wall are amazing, as are the wow moments when seeing the amazing views from every angle possible. Yes, it is a bit on the pricey side, but the views are unlike anything you will see anywhere else in the city. Tip -If you don't want to splurge on the interactive ipads that tell you what you are looking at, bring a tourist map of the city and find everything yourself, that's more fun!
A different view. Being at the top of New York, this tower offers a totally different view on the city and on the Hudson, which is worth the money. Don't miss it!

Awesome view!. The cost is pricey, but the views are amazing! Once at the top, I thought I was watching a public relations video for NYC, but when the view is revealed - it's breathtaking! We were there on a crystal clear day and saw for miles! Lots of fun!
Fantastic view. Well worth the$$ for the amazing view you get of manhattan from the top,Bar and restaurant were a little on the expensive side, but you don't have to eat or drink there.

Glad we did it but.... This is a must see and experience. The new world trade center building is more than impressive and the views are amazing. I had the privilege to see and experience the wonder of the twin towers more than a couple of times growing up. To me, that was special and you felt the energy of New York and the towers themselves. I love the new building and it luster but the problem is you are put in the elevator, go to the observation deck, walk around and that's pretty much it. It's enclosed, and the glass is not great for taking photos. You might as well go to Empire State building where you can get the panoramic views for pictures. I also think the management should do more to make it an experience that is memorable. I would have liked to see more of the building...can only imagine the interior is just as impressive as the exterior.

Breathtaking. This is a must to visit in New York it took a long time to wait outside so it is best to book online before you go so there is no waiting then when you get there you can go straight in .the lift to the top was outstanding so quick and then the views were out of this world
Amazing piece of Architecture!. Another attraction well worth the money in terms of views/education and general interest in this particular part of America's history. 5 star visit!

A Great View. This is higher than the Empire State Building and closer to The Statue of Liberty. There is a video animation of New York being built on the way to the top and a different animation on the way down.

Overpriced. Yes the views are amazing. But the view is eclipsed by the impact of the entrance cost on a modest travelers budget. $32 for a 20 second ride on the elevator, and if you want to know what you're looking at from on high, fork over another $15 for the iPad doodads that link the view to the buildings it faces. Your kid wants a t shirt? Try $40. I am embarrassed for the crass high tech commercialism of the place and wonder how this is all perceived by foreign tourists. If graphic high tech is your thing this place provides it -- at a price. G.

Very mixed memories.. Having worked in lower Manhattan the time the first attack to the World Trade Center happened and having moved away 20 years ago, this was a very mixed emotion visit. This experience is worth every cent and it was awesome. Words are not enough to do it justice, it is just something everyone that comes to NY has to experience for themselves. The experience is handled very efficiently and obviously is the benefactor of 21st century technology. I really do not want to say much because you need to see ir for yourselves. The views are just awe inspiring.

Amazing views of NYC. A must do. This really is one of those things you must do if you visit NYC. Being a fourth time visitor the NYC we had already done the Top of the Rock and Empire state buildings which in themselves offer fantastic views. The WTC wasn't open on our last visit to NYC so I made sure we booked to go to the observatory this time. Our tickets were timed for 530pm as I wanted to try and capture both daytime and sunset when we were there. The lift ride to the 100th floor is an experience in itself, prepare for popping ears.Once up to the top the views are breath taking and there are plenty of photo opportunities. We must have spent a good couple of hours or more there. There is also the obligatory gift shop along with a bar and somewhere to eat although if you are only eating (outside of the bar) be aware there is no seating.We went into the bar for drinks afterwards before leaving in what was a memorable experience and one we won't forget.

Pre book your tickets. Wanted to visit last year but the queue was just too long. Went this time and there was no queue at 9am. I would have rated this as a 5 if it wasn't for the fact that the price quoted on the website of $34 is not what you pay on the door. There is a $3 'on the day' processing fee. There are also the other 'additionals' at a cost. You can get an interactive iPad that shows you the landmarks etc and of course the photo!The views are incredible and different to what you would see from the top of the rock or the empire state.

Great views and neat elevator ride but expected a bit more. The elevator graphics as the it went up and down is a great idea and played off the feeling of movement real nice. I did not appreciate the forced sales pitch given upon exiting the elevator. You had to wait while they demonstrated and sold the tablets for customers if they wanted a get a software guide. If you are not interested you still waste your time on this. When you get to the highest level, the view is not 360 as half the floor is the restaurant. It seemed really overpriced so I did not eat there. To get the 360 view you go down a floor. The view is really nice but if you did not rent the tablet there is nothing to get your bearings on what you are seeing if you are not a New Yorker. Nothing else but the view so you don't need much time. Be sure to buy ticket on line to miss the line. The 9/ll memorial and museum is next door so nice to do it all in one day. Note that a subway stop is only a block away and there is a lot of construction going on so don't try to drive/park. Disappointed that after all these years the building still does not appear to be finished as a whole lower section is still being finished on the exterior.
Awesome views. The views from up the World trade centre are truly spectacular. Would highly recommend a visit, but only go on a clear day.

WOW!!! 360•View, City Pulse and John L.. Anything I write here is going to feel short with this amazing experience worth it the money and the time... You must go if you really want to feel on TOP of the world with the most exciting city in front of you.Besides all this, they have this regularly shows host by City Pulse, a very modern and interactive way to tell you all the wonders of NYC (food, history, parks, people, activities, architecture, fun facts and more).I want to write special mention of JOHN L. A Top Notch tourist guide, his show makes us feel proud to be a New Yorkers and the tourist to just get out and explore this metropolis full of adventures... You can see clearly that he feels passion for his job and that he loves New York.
Awesome views. Has TSA-style security check and a quick elevator ride up to beautiful views of the city. Tickets can be purchased at the door for $30.

Disappointing & overpriced . This place gets my first place honor for rip-off-the-tourists in NYC. Tickets on the high tech elevator to the top are over $30.
