The high tech approach to everything does NOT INCLUDE the iPad directional doodad to tell you where you are --that's another $15. Glass of wine in the restaurant? Try $32 for a glass of cab. The views are what you expect in a tall building. It is almost embarrassing to see the foreign tourists reaction to the prices. Made me cringe to see what it cost a family of 5 from Israel who were near me. If someone in your party wants to wait for you down at the bottom, bring your own chair. Big waiting area but not a seat in the space. My advice: don't support the crooks!

Ok but a bit sterile. This is an amazing experience BUT it is brought to you via technology. You feel as if you are herded like cattle through the experience and once at the experience, because it's inside the wow factor is slightly diluted. It is great but he Empire State Building has more to offer, better location, better views of the city, fantastic architecture, history and being outside to view the city makes a huge difference with the noise of the city below.

A must see trip in NYC. You pre-book a time slot for your visit up One World Observatory - World Trade Centre, the CGI elevator ride up was an excellent way to spend the minute and the views over the Manhattan skyline were spectacular!

What a Wonderful job everyone did on this project!!! Don't miss it!!!. The view from 1250 feet up is breath-taking. The best time to visit is early in the day (make your reservations online way in advance). The best day to visit is a clear day after a day or night of rain which cleans out the haze. The I-Pad adder is just OK. The presentations and views are terrific. It's time and money really well spent. It takes about an hour to get the full experience.

Absolutely fascinating views over Manhattan!. Went last week and do not great. I think i have conquered my fear of heights here. The lift video display was absolutely breathtaking completed with the unveiling of the view over Manhattan, WOW!!. Thew views are the best you can get over the city and surroundings.Very well organised visits and no long waits, staff members are extremely professional, kind and attentive.A must when in NY.

What a view!. Very well thought out, a full experience from the ride in the lift to the hand held devices whilst on the observation deck. Great for those like me who hate heights as you feel completely safe.
A View To Remember. It simply reminded me of the trips and dinners I had on the old World Trade Center. It was a great view of New York City.

A must see - highlight of our trip. There are usually 20% discounts available for admission - check with your hotel or online. Price is reasonable for the experience even without the discount- $20-25. Views are incredible from the 102nd floor - enjoyed the 60 second elevator ride also!

Top of the world. What an experience, the best thing we did whilst in the city . I can't put it into words how good the one tower is. The views the height of the tower . How fast the lifts are , the stunning views , and boy , watch the city disappear in front of you eyes when the clouds roll in . I would do this tour every time I went to New York it could never get boring .

Breathtaking. Although I hate heights and elevators, I managed to make myself go up to the observatory. The smooth and quick ride is not traumatic, nor do you feel the speed except for your ears popping. The views are totally breathtaking. We were lucky enough to have Naval ships in our view with Fleet Week. The 360 view of the city was well worth the admission price. I highly recommend this experience, even for those vertigo challenged like myself! It's worth it!

Don't go unless it's sunny. The price for admission I thought is quite pricey, hence, I prepaid for 2 tickets on the MasterCard Monday promo which was a bit more reasonable ($25/pp). This was a huge mistake as the day we were scheduled to go was rainy and cloudy. When we arrived, they offered to exchange our tickets for a different day due to Zero visibility. However, we were leaving the next day so we had no choice as refunds were not an option. We changed our entry time to later in the evening, hoping that when the city lights came on, we would be able to see something. No luck, Zero visibility really is Zero visibility. All we could see was a wall of white clouds outside the window. Remember that the building is really high up so low clouds can actually block the view, especially if it's overcast or raining. I wouldn't recommend going unless it is bright and sunny that day with no clouds. The one thing that is really cool is the elevator ride up and down the building. As you ascend, the 360 floor to ceiling video shows Manhattan being built from swamp land to modern times. As you descend, it shows the city all lit up with views all around. The rest of the props were not worth it at all. Everything is really expensive and they keep trying to push the iPad rental on us even though we couldn't see anything. That was a big turn off, especially since we just paid $50 for only a 50 second elevator ride. Word of advice, don't go unless there's no clouds.

The best way to see New York. Went to the one world observatory despite the price tag and wasen't disappointed.The elevator disply is amazing and the observation is even more breathtaking.Big plus, because its the tallest building there's nothing that blocks the view. A must while traveling in new york.

great view. We purchased tickets on site and had to wait for our time slot to go up in the tower. It gave us time to visit the pools and St. Paul's Church. We learned later that tickets can be purchased ahead of time but you need to go up within a half hour of your time slot. It was a clear day and well worth the cost. They also have a devise that you can rent that identifies all the landmarks for you if you are unfamiliar with the City.

Most impressive Memorial of September 11th. It's hard not to cry when remembering Sept. 11th with this beautiful impressive Memorial. The 360 degree views are incredible, and there is no way you can go to NYC and not see this.

Great use of high tech media-oriented technology for an enriching visitor's experience. Semi-interactive media technologies make this 21st-century observatory an engaging one. Nice surprise after the theatre presentation once you get to the top. High-definition elevator simulations are great bonuses. The downward-viewing simulated glass floor could use some work though, the streaming image is too blurry to be realistic.

YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS!!. you go up 103 floors in a minute and you don't even notice! well worth upgrading to VIP. you can spend as much time as you wish here. can rent an IPAD for 15 to look at sights and hear info about them. the views are AMAZING!! there is even a restaurant on 101 (I think) with breath-taking views. you can walk all around and see so much of NYC and NJ. this is well worth the money! a bit scary when the planes seem to be flying at you because you are so high up! the staff will give presentations about the history of NYC and other topics so you can just sit and listen as you take in the sights.

Poor evening views. Great views in the daytime, awful views at night - whoever's idea it was to use reflective glass needs a good talking too - you cannot take a good photograph once the sun has gone down - all you get is the reflection.We paid extra to skip the queue (I was with a group of friends and majority rules) I personally wouldn't have bothered to go at all, but the group wanted to go.We had a drink in the bar also, nice atmosphere.Overall, quite underwhelming.
Great views. The top of the rock you have to visit at night, you have allocated times so no hanging around in queues.

Must do - amazing views, spacious / lots of room to walk, helpful staff. We went with a total of 5 people including 2 children under 4 and we all enjoyed the experience very much. We were lucky and it was a very clear day and the view out towards miss liberty is just amazing. Yes, you still need to go the Empire State building to get the outside experience which One World Observatory doesn't offer. That is also why I don't think you can compare them. Also fact that One World provides an unique view over the water makes it very different from the Empire State. I think you need to visit both while in NYC. But if you need to choose I would go to the One World Observatory.

Great Views. Bit of a nuisance buying tickets as needed to queue, then go out and wait until alloted time, then back in queue again. It was boiling hot and no shade. Enjoyed the visit as didn't expect the lift experience up to 102nd floor! Also a surprise when you reach the top!!!!! Remember that there are discounts for 'seniors' - sometimes you qualify when 60, sometimes 62, sometimes 64 so always ask.
On top of the world. Loved going to the top of the new tower although a bit expensive. The view is amazing and goes the full 360 degrees. Well worth it.

On top of the world, what an experience. The One World Observatory experience exceeded our expectations. There are multiple options for entry that range from very affordable to expedited entry for 4 Pm to Dusk timeframe. The day before our visit, we were offered via Email the Summit VIP Access for the One year anniversary of opening. It cost an extra $20 per person, Wow , what an experience. This is a private space on the 102 floor that is not well documented, but well worth taking advantage of. This floor has unrestricted views of most of NYC and New Jersey. We were able to get close to the windows and minimize reflections and were able to take fantastic day and night pictures.The Staff were cordial and informative and answered any of our questions.We had dinner reservation at the One World Restaurant on the 101st floor, and were able to get back for the dusk sun set view on the 102 Floor.

Must see if visiting NYC. Can be very cowded. Elevator experience the best part, but if real busy, you cannot enjoy as much. We attended on a very busy holiday, and i would not recommend extra costs for express tickets.

What a view! Must see. . What amazing views!Great way to see the city and orientate yourself but have a map of Google maps to hand to work out what you are looking at.The lift was an surprise bonus super fast and very entertaining. The viewing level was great, loads of space, unhurried and the staff were informed and helpful. We preferred this to empire state as it was so much less cramped and crowded.Very slick and well organised. A real positive message threaded throughout too!Well worth going.
WOW i Love It. Hi Guys...I go to to this place with my 2 sister..i just can say WOW...we can see detail about this lovely city...The Lift....hahahahah......WOW....

A view of the world. Ive spent many times here pre 9/11 and could not wait to see the phoenix rising! It was really spectacular. The elevator ride was a thrill, the information was incredible. The crowds were not too bad. Will visit the museum at a separate time. Want to absorb it slowly.
Great experience! . The experience starts once you get on the elevator. Then once you get inside the theater, you'll be surprised by the presentation. It was an amazing experience for all of us.

Very american and touristy. The 9/11 memorial is really impressive, and when we discovered the one world trade center offered an observatory, we decided to go up there. The setting is super state of the art, but around every corner it feels like they are trying to sell you something. A bit too american for my taste, big, bigger, biggest.Nevertheless, the views are awesome and the ride up in the elevator kind of spectacular
unbelievable. a must do if you are visiting New York. The pre observation deck show is awesome then the views over New York are the best in the city
Pricey but fun. Great views. Book tickets in advance and if you can, buy the family group tickets. Don't order the stupid ipad locating add on. Just use your phone and you can figure out the sights.

An excellent view. The lift to the observation platform is stunning - the display screens on the wall are a very clever idea and give you a great perspective on the development of New York.The observation platform gives unparallelled views of the city as well stunning photographic opportunities. Book your tickets in advance - they are for timed entry. Download the app to identify the buildings you are looking at outside, rather than 'rent' the tablet.
Stunning Views. This has the fasted and most informative lift ever. The views are amazing. Don't forget to take your camera. Amazing sights!
WoW!!!! What a stunning building. We didn't go in but we did take plenty pictures. Unique style & it shines in all directions & glows. Magnificent architecture

Wow!. I was a little bit anxious about visiting the 102nd floor as I don't like heights but I thought I would give it a go. The ride in the elevator was easy. You can't even feel it moving! The only clue to you ascending rapidly was that it made your ears pop. When you get to the top you are lead into a darkened room and watch a short presentation. Then something amazing happens. I won't spoil the surprise but it was breathtaking. We then went down to the observation deck and it was incredible. The views are just amazing. It is very well organised and we could stay as long as we wanted . Definitely worth a visit . Great value for money.

NYC day trip. Don't let the price put you off. If you have to pick one observation deck make this the one. It's a whole experience leading to the elevator and the trip to the top. The 360 view is not to be beat!

Fatastic views! . We went to the one Word observatory after stumbling upon it on the Internet when we were planning our trip New York! We we not sure what to expect but If your looking for a 'wow' factor view of the city then this is the place to come! Great views!

Above where Eagles would soar. Wow! The 60 second elevator ride showing the last 100 years of development in NYC is only the beginning of the experience. The view seems surreal because you are so high.
Amazing views. This is well worth the price. Organized movement of the crowds so waiting is not a hassle. The elevator ride presentation is most impressive.

Disappointed. I hate to be a downer since the other reviews are so great. The view is awesome and the elevator is clever and interesting. I thought it was overpriced. I wish I had read the reviews ahead of time.The view is fine but the line was long. It cost $74 for my wife and me, then we were expected to fork over another $15 for the ipad. There are no plaques or markers to tell you what you're looking at, so you have to rent the ipad. I refused to cough up another $15 after the admission charge -- so I thought it was not worth the money
VISIT TO ONE WORLD. Spectacular views , fantastic service , dont miss out. It seems expensive but once you have completed the tour it is worth every penny

Great view, but that´s it.. This was definitely worth it in our opinion. Even the kids were awed by the vastness of NYC and the great panorama you get from up there. We didn´t do the tablet tour, just walked around and took pictures, but some of the people who work there explained and pointed out certain well-known buildings, which was interesting. We walked around the twin tower water memorials after, but didn´t get a chance to go into the museum. I wasn´t sure about how it would be for kids, but might try that next time. We were lucky to buy tickets and go in without waiting, but friends who went on a weekend bought tickets online in advance and still had to wait quite a long time.
Ahhhh, the breathtaking views!. So glad we got a chance to visit it!. Very well organized. Best elevator ride ever, Awesome accommodations, even the coffee was good! God Bless America!

Too much of an 'experience'. Back in the old days of WTC you got a lift to the top, walked past some posters and there you were. Lovely. Not too much money, good to go. When I went to the top of Empire State many years ago it was the same thing.OWO is an 'experience'. You get shepherded through flashing lights, an oo ahh moment with some rising screen, some more getting driven along like cattle in a, well, cattle run. More nothingness of god knows what and then you get to the viewing windows.Cut the price in half, cut the waffle, lose three-quarters of the staff and take it back to basics, I'm there for the view, 30 min job done, not the 60+ min of garbage.
Good choice. If you like views , this is a great one! You can see the Statue of Liberty and everything else. It is super touristy, therefore very expensive.
Amazing. One of the best views of the city. You must go if want to take good pictures. You can rent na iPad that show the building and places you´re seeing

You've got to do this you will never forget. The header speaks for its self i took my dad who is 74 and never been abroad. This was his top memory out of all the things we did. Trust me an experience not to be missed we also dined at the top the complete memory of a life time.

If Disney designed an observatory experience.... ... it would probably look a lot like this. One piece of advice up front would be to buy you tickets on-line ahead of time. There are a few options, but we bought tickets for a specific date and time. If you arrive early, you can kill time or use the restroom across the street at the Brookfield Place mall. It's just a three or four minute walk and is in plain site from the observatory line queue area. There are four lines for the observatory: three to queue people up for the three upcoming times in 15 minute increments (for example there are lines for 5:00, 5:15, 5:30). Plus one line for ticket purchases for people who did not buy in advance. From our experience, the lines were well managed and efficient and the staff was very nice, polite and helpful.Once inside you go through the usual security checks and down an escalator to the elevator queue lines. The elevator ride up (and down) is actually one of the most entertaining parts of the whole experience (in my opinion). I won't spoil it, but if you're curious just search YouTube for 'One World Observatory Elevators'. Once at the top, there is a dramatic presentation and reveal before being lead down another escalator where you have the opportunity to rent iPads designed to assist you in finding points of interest as you look out over the city. Down another escalator to the actual observation deck. There's not much I can say here.. it's a panoramic view of NYC. And you can see for good long way. We went on a clear day so we had spectacular views. There is a gift shop, restrooms and at least one restaurant as well. The observation deck is spacious and it's easy to move from place to place. There are also two areas where live presentations are given.We went on Memorial Day weekend and I didn't find the observation deck to be overly crowded. I was able to make my way to the windows pretty easily. The elevator ride down was also a show in and of itself. As I alluded to earlier, Disney would have been proud of the entire experience! My group enjoyed this very much and I would recommend this to anyone visiting NYC. Hope this helps!
Well done. We are so glad we visited. It is good to have a new iconic view and the experience was very positive. The team does a great job of helping visitors. Plan to spend hours.
Nice place. It is a nice place to visit but I once is enough. I have been in the top of TWIN TOWERS before and I think it was nicer!

Expected to be more excited. The observatory deck is sold as three floors deck when in reality it's just one, and indoor only. As extra they give you a tablet to help you discover the most famous buildings/landmarks of the city. I booked the ticket online but there wasn't a massive queue.

An incredible visit. What an amazing memorial this is. Definitely worth a visit. An incredible experience which is well worth the cost. Even the ride to the top in the lift is interesting and exciting. We paid extra for an iPad guide which was really useful and helped you to locate different landmarks. There are plenty of staff on hand to help and give talks.

On a clear day, you do see forever!. Top of our list of things to do this trip to New York. Booked tickets in advance with "skip the line" which is well worth it! If require even more freedom in your schedule you can shell out a little more for the flex pass which allows you to go anything during hours of operations. Even with "skip the line" it took a 30 minutes to wind your way through the rope line before the bank of elevators. They keep you entertained however with videos about the building and construction, so not a bad wait. Once on the elevator, the experience starts and is simply jaw dropping! We figured maybe an hour and actually spent 3 (including lunch which was not previously planned). We were fortunate to have a crystal clear sunny day with endless visibility. Huge kudos to their crowd control. Never a problem getting to the window to see and take photos. Spacious walkways made it easy to get around to all sides without bumping into anyone else. There is a cafe and restaurant with better food than your might expect. Overall, a must see when in New York for sure!
Amazing. This was worth the money. The views were stunning! There is a surprise in the elevator and before you walk around.

nice observatory. visited so many of them. this one is like others. nothing especial. will definitely recommend to buy express pass. just $20 more for ticket, but you will save at least 2 hours of waiting. express line moves very fast. observatory is 360 degrees view on the 102 floor. great for kids.
great views. lovely views, a very special way to see the new World Trade Center area with view stretching to Ellis island and the Statue of Liberty

Amazing Views and Powerful Feel!!. I had no idea this is where my dad and I were going when he said he wanted to visit the WTC observatory. It was amazing. The views of the city and the water are beautiful. It is a great feel to be up there and reflect on the history of the WTCs and the lives of those lost. There is a lot of information and the ride up the elevator was so fast and cool. The ticket was like $36 or so I believe in that range. Very worth it. The line for the tickets was a bit confusing but the people there are helpful. I would definitely suggest going!!! It is truly amazing. Over 100 floors.

Spectacular view. The elevator ride and movie are entertaining. The view from the deck is spectacular. There is some nickel and diming along the way (upgrade a ticket, rent an iPad, buy a souvenir, skip the line, have food/drink, etc) but I guess they have to pay for the construction! The speaker on the deck was so knowledgeable and energetic. We learned a lot from him. My teens loved it, as did the adults. We felt it was worth the base price. We didn't buy any special tickets or services and didn't think we needed it. Glad we experienced it.

Amazing elevator ride. We did this last Friday had pre-bought tickets ( this was not needed no long lines) great ride both up and down, will do it again but will wait for a day with better visibility, no outdoor area on top. nice bar also.

Great views but cant see central park. So we went here because we were in the area and there wasnt a que! Pricey, but so is the empire state building and the rock. I had been to the rock on a previous visit, therefore as this was taller and was between this and the empire state building chose here. Lift is very quick to the top and once you get there you have amazing views of the city. Only thing that was a shame was you cant see central park, you can at the rock. Overall worth a visit

Incredible Building and Views. This new building is just incredible. The observatory is great. Amazing 360 views to see the city. Keep in mind that cloudy (rainy days) will obstruct the view. I recommend to go early morning to try to avoid the crazy lines.

Very good a must when in New York. One world is very good . The screening show before going to the observatory itself is good . The lift with the city panorama pictures rolling all around you is great . Book a vip ticket as the line can be very long ,it is a little expensive but it will save you a lot of time .Beware the queue outside the tower are in full sun with no shade. So vip tickets are a good idea.

Amazing views,. The tallest building in the Western Hemisphere , the views from the observation deck are unsurpassed. The lifts whisk you from the ground to 102nd floor in about 40 seconds, although you are not aware of the speed.
Wow! Wow! Wow!. Got there early on a Saturday morning. Was in one of the first groups. Elevator ride is fast, fun and different! Presentation has unexpected ending! Pricey but worth it.
Nice View-but you pay for it!. This is nice to do once. To see most of the city from that height is pretty cool. It is not cheap tho...4-$180.00. The views are unparalleled.

Fantastic . Very nice place and emotional moment to live !! Me and my wife visited there and we stayed very impressed about the new conquest for US citizen !! Around the place we have a lot of restaurants and Brookfield Place shopping the best !!We recommend to visit and lunch there in front of Hudson River !! Amazing !!

Great views and so much to learn. Loved the experience. We had the fast track ticket which was really worth it to skip the security line. Make sure you rent the iPad with the city facts to learn the most you can of what you are seeing

Worth a look. This is next door to the memorial so we decided to go in and have a look whilst we were there. Again a little costly to get in but it's worth the cost just for the views , well worth the visit.

Unbeatable views of NYC. Definitely worth waiting for a clear day then make sure you are up early to beat the queues! The elevator ride was fantastic, showing New York over time in about 60 seconds. Then you watch another presentation which ends with the breathtaking view up towards central park.Wifi was good so I was able to facetime my family at home which they loved. No rush to leave and much more space to mingle than the other observation towers.Only downside is no outside space so takes a few attempts at getting a photo without a reflection.

Amazing, Spiritual and Emotional. One World Tower and the surrounding Memorial Park is truly a must see & do event in NYC.To commence the experience starting with the memorial park and seeing the survivor tree and understanding it's history is moving in itself (there are many tours around the park and you are bound to overhear a tour guide speak about the survivor tree).The foundation footprints of the original Twin Towers are vast, modern and initially plain on first approach. But when you stop to look longer this is when it hits you - spirits of the lost are there as the water cascades down the walls of the foundation footprints and glisten like diamonds in the sunlight, truly moving and stunning. If you see a white rose in any of the names this is because it's the anniversary of that named lost person, again, so moving.Once you gather your emotions of seeing the original resting place of the twin towers to look up to what now can only be described as a living memorial of the events of 911 and a true modern beauty of a tower "One World". The tower is so beautiful modern, almost like something from out of space from another planet has landed there in the park standing immensely proud and defiant of everything that is evil in our world, this really is a stunning building.When you enter the tower to get to the One World Observatory make sure you start rolling your video camera before you get into the lift. I don't want to ruin the experience but as soon as the lift starts to make it's amazing 45 second journey to floor 102 your in for a really amazing experience.Keep your camera rolling as you come out of the lift as you will want to keep the memory forever for what will happen next.As for the views, we had 30-degree hot sunshine and no clouds so could see out towards Staten Island (Statue of Liberty), New Jersey, Brooklyn, all the bridges (as far as George Washington) including the amazing view North of Manhattan and it's beautiful tower skyline of; Empire State, Rockefeller, Trump Towers and Chrysler gold top; in summary we could "See Forever"!!!The One Tower is very interactive and modern. We do recommend to use the iPad's which were $15 = worth it!These show you what you are looking at and also give short videos of the history of most of the buildings and bridges you view.Some reviews had said these iPad's are rubbish?! Not so! This is because if you walk around from various windows with the gadget pointing downwards it loses it's bearings so you need to recalibrate it so when you hold it back up to the window it shows you what you are looking at. To calibrate just swipe either left or right until the view you are looking at is the same on the iPad, it's that simple!We also did Empire State Building (Floor 102) which by comparison can only be described as (One World Vs Empire State) New & Today Vs Traditional, Organised Vs Unorganised, Moving & Spiritual Vs a Movie Icon.I will never forget 911 and the horrors that unfolded on my TV that day, getting to see the Memorial Park and the new One World Tower was a privilege and an honour and we are grateful to the sensitivity of the New Yorkers and USA to respect and remember the lost in such an amazing and touching way!(BTW, we purchased our tickets online using the official website of One World and our printouts allowed us to jump the queue and walk straight in, no issues and certainly none of the nonsense some other reviews have written regarding having to cross the road and go to a ticket office due to tickets they had purchased through agent websites - use the official website and you will be fine ;-)Also please remember when walking into the Memorial Park this is a resting place for those that lost their lives in the 911 tragedy, please show respect and composure as you would in any Church or Graveyard, it's the least you can do.

Buy ticket in advance - cheaper and avoid the queue. I thought that this was a bit expensive, but we saved a little money by buying tickets from a tourist info booth a couple of blocks away, so didn't have to queue. The trip in the lift is weird - 102 floors in 60 secs - your ears will pop! There are interesting projections on the wall on the way. At the top you have as long as you wish to look at the 360 degree views of NYC and beyond which is interesting. There is also a bar and restaurant, which is a bit pricey, but again, it is nice to look at the view whilst nursing a cold beer.

NYC Skyline Experience. Much More Than A View !. Comparison of One World Observatory to "Top Of The Rock" Rockefeller Center.One World Observatory:Advantages of Viewing Skyline from One World:1. Spectacular elevator ride up showing evolution of site from Pre-colonial to current day using 3 walls of elevator on the short ride up. (Tip - Try to stand near the elevator doors to better see the "Elevator Wall Show." It goes by quick.)2. Impressive video presentation with grand unveiling of view.3. 3 floors of 360 degree viewing area spreads out a gigantic crowd for effective viewing MUCH better than the available space at Rockefeller Center.4. View of 911 Memorial Pools can not be seen from Rockefeller Center.5. Statue of Liberty can not be seen from Rockefeller Center.6. Restaurant at "Top of the Rock" is not available to children and is much more expensive than restaurant at top of One World Obervatory. Reservations are absolutely required.7. Only place where you can see view from the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere and from the top of a 4 billion dollar building.8. Far superior gift shop than Top of the Rock.9. Option to "rent"an iPad (for $15) that has an interactive video display and identification of surrounding buildings by pointing the iPad at the view. A better investment if you can share this with an entire family. From my observation only 1 of 25 visitors was choosing this option.Advantages of seeing NYC Skyline from Top of The Rock:1. Outdoor viewing area allows for better photography than the inside viewing area at One World Trade Center Observatory.2. You can see the NYC skyline with the One World Observatory from the Top of the Rock. The skyline is not as spectacular if you are viewing it from the most prominent building in the skyline.3. At sunset from Top of the Rock, you can see the NYC skyline against the sunset backdrop. From One World Observatory you only see the Hudson River and the buildings across the river against the sunset backdrop.4. Many more restaurant options nearby at Rockefeller Center.Bottom line is both buildings offer unique view opportunities. I took my family to both and I would suggest doing both, but if you only have the time or money to ascend one building, I suggest Top Of The Rock because the New York City skyline is not the same without seeing the One World Trade Center as part of that skyline. The cost is similar for both with the One World Observatory being slightly more expensive overall.

Spectacular view. The building is impressive there is a big croud waiting to go inside. The entrance fee is 37$ but you can go online for cheeper.I would say it is worth every penny of that price.The elevator is fast 60 seconds to the top and there are screens showing the distance and the city changing through time.The view from the top is simply amazing.There is also a restaurant and a gift shop.
Great experience. Amazing views of NYC, The VIP section is great if you pay with Advantage Platinum Master Card you can skip the line and go to a special vip section
Great . Nice and fast, friendly service, great security. The view is great. I'll leave it to you to decide if it's worth the price...

Unbelievable views and elevator ride. The elevator ride alone was worth it - 102 floors in under 60 seconds - you would never know it - it was that smooth! Great video displayed on walls of elevator showing how Manhattan has changed over centuries. View at the top was amazing even though an air quality alert caused some haze. We bought timed tickets online ahead of time but it turned out it wasn't necessary as the lines to buy tickets were quite short (although I don't know if it's always like that).

Awesome views across manhattan. Brace yourself for a disorientating elevator ride, you are met with a barrage of eager assistants trying to sell you the use of a viewer that explains the landscape for $15, the a keenly placed gift shop area and blues sky photo shoot, on your exit they want you to purchase the cheesy image of you. The spectacle is amazing but the sales pitches are coming at you in all directions. If you can rise above being bombarded with extras and ignore them, take in the views and get a great perspective of manhattan. It's worth doing.

360 degree views. This is a great way to get a perspective of the entire island and surrounding burrows with the full 360 degree viewing deck. Coupled with a great virtual reality ride to the top floor and back down again. You can even rent an ipad for point and info geographic which is quite cool if you willing to pay more. Just a pity it's all enclosed so photos tend to have reflections on the glass

Enjoyed the Views. Before you know it, several hours had passed and we were still mesmerized by the sites and activities available from this new observatory. Put it on your list of sites to see in your life.

Such a great view. This provides an amazing view of New York and the surrounding area. You can see all 360 degrees as you walk around. The journey in the lift is also interesting as it has a projected image which is really good.

The beauty is what WTC stands for.. Freedom Tower, One World Observatory....it's World Trade Center, and it's the beauty, strength and presence over the 9/11 Grounds that captures each visitor. I also visited the Empire State Building (basic tour package) and found the exterior observation deck was more beautiful than One World Observatory. That said, the overwatch view of the 9/11 Grounds is powerful and a symbol of recovery and fortitude. The building is a modern marvel of security, engineering and a guardian to the memorial below. I received my observation tickets in package from 911/ Ground Zero Tour. Highly recommend this tour group, see additional review for feedback. As others have noted, I would visit WTC in conjunction with the memorial grounds. The observation deck is internal only, but offers beautiful 360 views. I visited on a mid-Saturday afternoon, crowded but not packed to capacity. The elevator ride up / down from the observation deck provide a historical video of NYC's history. Well placed gift shop and cafe are also available on the observation deck floor. There is a small bar (maybe even restaurant) adjacent to cafe. I watched as several visitors attempted to walk in but were coldly turned away. Overall experience is A, and I would return with friends and family.
Loved it . Went up at sunset which was the best way got to see at day and at night would go up again at the same time. Loved the view and that you can just sit and watch for as long as you want.

Take the Tour at Night. We visited the night before Juno hit the city and what a BEAUTIFUL clear night it was, providing stunning views of the city! We visited with our 22 yo niece and were able to ride the elevator by ourselves...and what an amazing ride it is! None of us get motion sickness but we were all a little disoriented when we stepped off of the elevator, just as a warning for someone who does get motion sickness and/or vertigo(we actually laughed about it!) The initial images of the city are fun and exciting and it really is AMAZING when you get your first look at the city. We really enjoyed walking around and viewing the city from a 360 perspective. The atmosphere is quiet and respectful, as it should be, but as Americans we felt a sense of pride while there as well. This is a very different experience than the 9/11 Museum and Memorial but we feel both are very important and essential stops when visiting New York City

Amazing view.. Not cheap for a family of four but actually worth the money. We went up a bit late in the afternoon. It was lovely to see the sunset but we needed to go up a little earlier. We wanted to use the restaurant but we hadn't booked so missed out. The views from the top are stunning, well worth it.
Great View. This is a great observatory for viewing the city. The view from the too is just amazing. Really enjoyed it. Though expensive but worth a one time visit.

Just amazing! . Arrived Saturday 11am and didn't have to queue- well organised ticket booth and security.The lift and welcome show certainly gives this tower the wow factor.The views are amazing- Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn bridge, over to up town Manhattan. We had lunch at the top which was expensive but what a view!

An Attraction Worth Considering (but it's not for every one). RECOMMENDATION: pair this visit with the 9/11 National Memorial which is located right across the street. You will not be disappointed. Set aside at least half a day for visiting both (this includes subway transportation). Also (for both), check their websites and make reservations. If you've got little or young ones, pack a snack. REQUEST: pls provide feedback/thumbs up to help me earn contributor points.REVIEW: As a first time visitor to NYC my "must-do" list included the One World Observatory. Before leaving home we made reservations online for a late Saturday afternoon visit, but when we arrived there was a line so long one of the employees said it would another hour before we'd even make it to the elevator. What made it more frustrating was the absence of bathrooms or place to buy snacks while in line. Instead of waiting we went to customer service and traded our tickets for an early Sunday morning slot. BEST decision ever. After a quick bite at a "Sandwicherie" next to the hotel (I have a review for them as well) we caught a near empty subway. There were very few people at the observatory and we spent as much time as we wanted without interrupting anyone else's photo opps or having ours interrupted. We found the facility clean and professionally run. Spectacular vistas abound from the viewing deck. A once around while emptyish may take 20-30 minutes even with taking photos and listening to presentations. For us, rather than rushing to check this off our list, we used the time to soak in NYC and appreciate the incredible American endeavor it took to build one of the greatest, modern cities on earth. I don't consider the observatory a highly interactive, exciting attraction. It's part remembrance, part reflective given the ground and area it is built on. It's moving to imagine what the place must have been like on 9/11.

One world observatory . We booked online back in the uk , no problems at all , very well organised when we got there , usual security checks on arrival the tower itself is fantastic from the lift ride to the intro at the top to the actual view , if you haven't been to New York this is a must , having done the Rockafella Centre and the Empire State Building I have to say that the one world observatory beats them all well worth the money and a visit.

Best High Rise Feature in NYC. It used to be Empire State Building and Top of The Rock, but One World by far exceeds all of the "high rise attractions" in NYC.Of course, if you can afford to do all of them, then do it (choose some at morning, some at sunset, and some at night). But, if you can only pick one then I would suggest OWO, especially if you have kids (we have a 6&9 year old). We only paid $90 with the Family Four pass...we experienced no wait time, and spent almost 3 hours at the top!! The views are tremendous...and the interactive iPads are way worth it for the non-New Yorker. Purchase your tickets ahead of time, and go have fun at the tip of Manhattan!!

Spectacular, breathtaking, amazing....Freedom Tower/One World Trade Center. Sometimes also referred to as Freedom Tower. If you do one thing in NYC make sure this is it! It is the most spectacular view I have ever seen. This new building is spectacular, spotlessly clean and very impressive. The opening video is informative, touching and well presented but when the view opens up.... wow!!!!! No words can do this justice, you have to see it for yourself...many, including myself shed a tear at the sheer beauty...two weeks later I can still well up at the memory. The weather was absolutely perfect on the day which certainly helped (mid May), it was a huge bonus but the fact is that view is whats its all about. Make sure you do this one!

One word - Wow!. What can I say about One World Observatory? Go visit! We've visited lots of places in NY over the years to see different views of the city, but hands down this is the best! We booked the 9am viewing, there was a small queue when we got there as you have to go through security, but this went down quick and was plain sailing. When you get through security there is a wall telling you stats about OWO, where the most visitors are from, how many people have visited etc. You then go through other sections, which I don't want to spoil for you then go on to the views. I would highly recommend hiring the tablets which tell you what buildings you are looking at, it was really useful and enhanced the experience, its costs $15 for this. There are also talks happening in difference parts of the observatory and again it's worth sitting down at one, they are prob a max of 10 mins long. Views are amazing, out of this world, make you realise how small you are in contrast to everything else and it's also a little bit emotional! We were probably up there for about 2 hrs and by the time we were leaving it was starting to get busy and you were having to wait to get a good view out of the window. Gift shop had lots of choice but some things very overpriced, had the option to purchase a picture that was taken of you, we declined. There are also places to eat and drink there. My one warning - avoid the $5 bottle of water!

Breathtaking. After visiting the 9/11 memorial and museum, my husband and I lightened up the experience by coming here. It was truly amazing taking in the incredible vistas of the city. We also enjoyed drinks at the bar restaurant there. I recommend purchasing a ticket for this attraction prior to your visit.

Surprisingly Amazing Experience.. This attraction is not a memorial to 9/11, the memorial is in the plaza below. We were lucky to have a clear sky the day we went, which gave us the most incredible views of New York and the surrounds. Booking online was easy, and we only had to wait 30 minutes from the time we booked until we entered the queue. The show started in the elevator, to be followed by a short but excellent presentation, and then the stunning views of the City.This wasn't cheap, but we thought it was worth the money.Advice: (1) Unless you aren't familiar with New York, don't bother to rent the ipad-guide.(2) Make sure you go on a clear day.(3) Book online. If you do so, you only need to get there 5 minutes beforehand.

Elevator ride of your life!. LOVED the video shown in the elevator! The views are spectacular. However I was disappointed that we had to shoot any pictures through windows. It would be great if they had a platform with no windows.

Stunning view, rapid accent, amazing . A must do, to see what's been rebuilt on 9/11 site. The view is stunning (higher than Rockefeller and Empire). The elevator ride itself is entertaining- fast 1250 foot accent (your ears pop), with history of New York skyline displayed as you go through time. Top is interesting (don't like that you get guided into dead end restaurant- so find way down to observation deck). You are so high that it doesn't feel high (although looking straight down by window- did make me feel nauseated- but I don't like heights).Unbelievable view. Must must do. Bonus even at 3 on memorial weekend- 10 minute line up.

Great views, amazing elevator. The elevator ride was definitely the best part. You get up there, and you see all of NYC - great pictures, but after a while of guessing which building is where, it gets kind of boring.Would have been better if they included the ipad showing all the buildings name in for free.

Great views. We went at 11am and only had to queue for a few minutes before getting into the lift to the top. The lift is an experience in itself and the view is great once they lift the screens at the top. Gift shop had a good selection.

WA great visit. Had a wonderful visit to the Observatory. We arrived before lunch and the queues were not too long at all. We hired the $15 iPad to aid the visit and it was definitely worth the money as it aided our enjoyment of the Observatory.

Amazing creativity and good crowd management . Better than empire state building where crowd management is poor and deck is at lesser height. Must watch for elevators and the intro movie about new York when u reach observation deck.

First trip to Freedom Tower. This was absolutely amazing! The video at the beginning was amazing but when the screens all rise and exposed the view, it literally took your breath away!! Words can't begin to describe the experience. The tragedy that took place and I remember the day so well could not be depicted in a better way! Truly enjoyed experience and will return again in the future!Stephanie Heth

Aka as freedom tower. Overwelming with the beauty of the view, and the place so sad in memory.
Strongly suggest to go despite the expensive entrance.

Great Experience!. Visited One. World Observatory this week. It was really good starting with the rude in the elevator to take you to the 102ns floor! I hired the I Pad which was worth it as if you position it it will give you the names of landmarks you are looking at and a bit about them. The view was fabulous - it's hard to believe you are so high up! Still very emotional when you come down and visit the 9/11 memorial. I would say this was worth a visit.

One World Trade Center and Observatory: AMAZINGLY SPECTACULAR!!!. One World Trade Center and Observatory is an amazing structure!!! Strongly suggest buying tickets in advance (lines can get long if you don't). Tickets are Adult $32, Senior $30, Child $26. There is a security clearance and staging areas to position people prior to the elevator ride to the top. The elevator ride to the Observatory takes less than a minute and is VERY smooth. There are 3 Levels at the Top including 3 Eateries. Two do not accept reservations but One Dine (upscale restaurant) requires a reservation. The view area is 360 degrees and includes the 5 NYC Burroughs and NJ. You can take amazing photos.

Just WOW. Words can barely so the view justice from the top of One World Trade. From this height even the Empire State and Top of the ROCK appear small. Extremely well organised and controlled so not to allow overcrowding. Food is also available at the top for a spot of lunch (Expensive).If I could do one New York attraction again it would be this!
Breathtaking Views. This is definitely a stop to make if traveling to New York. On a good visibility day, you can see 360 views of New York City and beyond.

Superb view of lower Manhattan and Jersey. This attraction is really well engineered with incredible views of lower Manhattan. Midtown not so much. We arrived about 10:30 and had virtually no wait for tickets or elevators. Even then, the observation decks were fairly crowded. We didn't find the handheld tablets that point out major buildings very helpful. Few people turn down their volume, so the deck is fairly noisy. Go early or late!

Skyline. This is close to 9/11 memorial which is a must see and alongwith oneworld.I decided to buy this one over other tallest bldg in NYC. One is that you already visiting same area and for other bldg, you have to go seperatly.This is definitely worth watching 360 degree of city.

Impressive . I've read about all the negative experiences off people who went to the freedom tower so I was taken aback about going up to the observation deck, I really wanted to see the two infinity pools once there and after walking around we decided to take a chance to see how long the line was going to be we were there around a quarter to 10 no lines no waiting we were on the deck 15 min later, all the staff were really nice and cheerful. Wen we went down about 30 to 45 min later the lines started to form. If you are there I would highly recommend going up the tower, and if you don't want to wait in line go early in the morning. It was a wonderful experience.

erie, peaceful and a warning. With young green trees waiving, the site of the two towers of the world trade center is a peaceful place. The fountain, a yawing, cavernous pit with thousands of names of the dead inscribed around the surrounding wall, however, reminds us of what happened 15 years ago and that the terrorists who wracked such havoc on America are still with us. This perception is reinforced by the coast guard patrol boat, with decked-mounted machine gun, which escorted the Staten island ferry from and back to battery park.
EPIC VIEWS!!. THIS WAS AWESOME! Got some great pictures here! You are able to see so much of NYC from the top! We chose this over any other observatory, and we are glad we did!
Amazing!!!. Such a beautiful building, views are incredible and really enjoyable tourist trip that is set up for a great day out.

Elevator Ride the best part. We'd ordered tickets on-line for sunset viewing which allowed entry any time from 6:30-9:30. After informing all we needed government IDs, none were asked for. We were whisked into the elevator and the ride up (and down) was spectacular. We had to see the 3 minute presentation projected on sculptured panels, which was worth the wait as the panels then raised for a view of the city. We were able to pass up the portrait station, but had to stand for the iPad hawking session before heading to the Observatory. The weather had been iffy, but we were able see the sun setting into the clouds as the city lights came on. The 'hawking' demeaned an otherwise once in a lifetime experience.

Been in many towers in many places and this is one of the best.. I am a sucker for visiting the highest spots wherever we travel and in New York City we have done One World, Rockefeller, and Empire State. This one being the latest, I would expect it to be the greatest and I genuinely believe that is the case.We were not sure we were going to be able to fit this into our itinerary so we did not buy advance tickets for a specified time. We arrived at 1:00 on a sunny Sunday afternoon in May and found almost no line. Within 15 minutes of arrival including buying tickets, going through security, and riding up we were at the top.Many of the tall structure observation decks in the world have some sort of "program" that you watch to give you some history or to relate some amazing details about the structure. The show here is very brief and does not go into any of the events leading to its construction. Bravo. No reason to turn this experience into a documentary. But, truly the history of this structure isn't in the Observation Deck it is in the 9/11 museum and memorial which YOU ABSOLUTELY MUST VISIT.When you get off the excellent elevator ride you will have the opportunity to rent an iPad with tracking displays of what you are seeing out the window at any moment and the ability to touch on hundreds of those things for further information. $15. We didn't do it because we were pressed for time but within 5 minutes I wished we would have anyway.For me, the views from One World are more interesting than almost anywhere else. I think the texture of the mid town skyline from downtown is fabulous (you should check out the whole Manhattan skyline including the Freedom Tower from Brooklyn). The view of the bridges, water, Brooklyn, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Governor's Island are all superior from this vantage point.It is true that the whole operation is run like a commercial enterprise. You will have an opportunity to spend money, pay for photos, buy a snack, or even have dinner, but it is not a requirement and it is not obtrusive.The last thing I like about being on top of the World Trade Center is the fact that I am and the notion that we will never forget the ones who were taken from us and if you knock us down we will come back stronger than ever.

Labor Day Holiday. Visited the observatory at sunset. Spectacular view looking uptown Manhattan, Statue of Liberty, etc. We used the priority pass we bought on the website to enter faster and avoid the immense regular waiting line, is worth the price. It is a must see when visiting the World Trade Center.

Breathtaking Experience!. What an amazing experience! I do not want to spoil it...so, I'll just say it is so worth going! The lines went fast, the ride up was no problem at all for my sister who gets vertigo, and the views are like none other!!! They do not rush you out, so makes plans to stay awhile. A definite GO for anyone visiting NYC!

Great views of lower Manhattan. It was actually a warm and sunny Saturday but weather forecasters had called for rain later in the day so that may have been the reason for the small crowds.We were able to walk right in, present our tickets, go through security and then head directly up the elevators. There is no open deck so as an amateur photographer you need to be aware of reflections off the windows. Great views of the three bridges at the lower end of Manhattan and over to the Statue of Liberty plus all the way back up to midtown. It is worth the cost to see in this relatively new attraction.

Amazing View!. The trip up the elevator was well thought out in the planning of One World. No boring elevator ride here. You experience a short guided tour at the top and then enjoy an "awe" moment when the city is presented before your eyes. After the presentation, you are free to walk around at your leisure.

DON'T RIDE THE ELEVATOR UP WITH OTHER WTC EMPLOYEES. I think that it's inappropriate for some of the WTC employees to be sipping Starbucks and chatting full blast about their weekend in the elevator ride up which has an amazing show on the growth of Manhattan Island. I mean, seriously? Don't you guys have your own lift? This experience starts in the elevator guys, take your own way up. Outside of that horrible start, we had a great time. Even if it was cloudy, they really created a wonderful experience. Very state of the art, and nicely done, especially some of the stories from the construction guys in gallery before the movie. It makes you feel like you came a long way from the events of 9/11.

Wonderful Experience. The view from the top of the Freedom Tower is sensational and the build up to getting to the actual view by way of the fast lift is very well done. If the price of the ticket seems high in the long run it is worth it. Although the admission ticket is timed for entry you can stay as long as you like.A couple of tips:1) Buy your ticket on line in advance. This will avoid long queues. Although the ticket is timed they do not seem to be too precise about the timing.2) Also go to the top of the Rockefeller Centre as well the two views perfectly complement each other. From here you can see the whole of Manhattan Island, the East & Hudson Rivers, Liberty Island and out to sea, but Central Park is obscured by buildings. From the Rockefeller Centre you cannot see as far but have an excellent view of Central Park and a good view of the Freedom Tower itself.

The most spectacular views possible!. If you only go to one of the observatories available then make it this one. The top of the rock has brilliant views, but OWO beats it out by quite a high margin in my opinion. The elevator also has a cool video that shows you the changes to the skyline over the years. Well worth visiting!

Amazing opportunity and view. It was an overwhelming feeling to just be at the sight of the tragedy. The amazing building stood tall and proud a symbol of the New York and American spirit to keep fighting. The elevator right is sort of interactive up and down showing old city to new city conversation as well as the building of the tower. The elevator doesn't fly up fast and drop so fast your stomach drops out of your body. I've never been in a skyscraper elevator quite like it. The view was incredible and more interactive things happened on the observation deck. An iPad pointing out all the city sites, two folks discussing city life. An unforgettable view you won't get anywhere else in America or the City!

Tribute to American Labor. This is a tremendous structure with amazing views of the City. The $24 fee is well worth the opportunity to experience this structure and pay homage to the memory garden next door.

Fantastic Views. I wasn't sure if this would be worth the money after going to the Top of the Rock in the morning, but I read good reviews so decided to spend the money on tickets. I wasn't able to get tickets in advance because we weren't sure what time it would be when we arrived. We purchased tickets quickly and then had to wait about 30 minutes before our specified entrance time, but we went to see the reflection pools first. We got in a line that moved very quickly into the building. Once inside they have more lines that lead you into the elevators. We still didn't find the wait to be very long. The views once you reach the top are amazing. I actually got better photos here than I did at Top of the Rock for some reason. You definitely want to go on a sunny clear day to get a good view.

Great. The ride up and down is just amazing! The view if you have been to NYC before is the same, as you have seen before. The 48 second ride up and down is nothing like you have seen before. It's amazing. Just do it.
Beautiful. OMG this was the best view of the city, I walked all around the observation deck, I took so many pictures, make sure that you see this.

Spectacular, if a little commercialised. We went down to Ground Zero, as many are doing, to see what has replaced the ill fated towers. One of the replacements is the 102 floor One World Trade Center, with its breathtaking views. I could not help thinking that it was a little Disney like, with the video projections and the artificial rock, but once you get through the presentation, the view is unmatched. Adjacent to the tower are the memorial pools, thats special.

top of the world. woww never been that high in my life was a bit scared at first.was brilliant to see everything from there. great views across the river and all over the city. was lucky it was a clear day am I easily pleased hell yes but this was fantastic, without ruining the excitement of the spectacular views, seeing is believing, that's all I'm saying.

Spectacular views . This doesn't dissapoint if you want a fantastic view of the city and its surroundings. The slogan here is 'see forever' and really that's what it feels like. Also the elevator ride up and back down is a show on its own. Book your tickets on line so you will get timed entry.

Stunning!. Ok, so yes its a bit Disneyfied in places, but its worth it! We arrived at 0930. the weather was cloudy with drizzle but we though we would give it a go. Outside the ticket area there were signs saying visibility zero, but when we went to the ticket office we were told the visibility was actually 5 miles. There was no que at the time, so we were straight in to buy the tickets, and then straight into the attraction.The lifts a great, the history of New York unfolding in front of you is impressive, you hardly feel like you have gone up all those floors in such a short time. Once you step off the life you are then lead into a long room where the whole wall is made up of video screens that show scenes from the city. Once finished the screens rise up to reveal the view behind. Its really impressive, probably the highlight of the trip for me by far. When you reach the top its laid out on 2 floors, with a bar / cafe. We had 2 hot chocolates which were tasty and reasonably priced. We didn't opt to hire the tablet computers at $15 each which show us the various things to see around the area. The views are spectacular, even with 5 miles visibility. it was a bit hazy to get long distance photos but it didn't spoil the view, it really was fascinating to be so high up! You get all round views which are spectacular. There is the obligatory gift shop which sold some interesting if slightly expensive souvenirs. No issues on leaving, there were no lines to wait in. Well worth it for the money, even with the lower visibility. Just get there early!

It's all about the money - isn't it always?. This was a disappointing day and it made me miss the original Twin Towers all the more. Despite the tragedy of the attack and the deaths that occurred with the original buildings, I remember its observatory as one where you could view the landscape of NYC (with outlines of various buildings applied to the glass windows so you could identify the buildings you were looking at) and an outdoor observatory balcony. It also was also a "freer" atmosphere where you could walk around and not feel like animals in a pen.Before you even get to the elevator at the new "One World Observatory," one walks through phony "bedrock" (made of fiberglass no less) and passes by "cement" walls (another staged element). You could see a better display at DisneyWorld.How disappointing the new tower observatory is. Besides ridiculously steep admission prices, the elevator going up showed a video on the wall panels of the changing landscape of NYC. Unfortunately, the elevators are full of people so there is no good view of the video and the video passes too quickly to really grasp the landscape changes anyway. Upon exiting the elevator, visitors "see" another video where visitors STAND (no seats! - no much for its "theater") and watch "street scenes" of NYC with visitors standing two-three people in front of them, again obscuring the video presentation (which is pretty worthless anyway as we all know the street scenes of NY - we just came in from the streets and the subways!). Then there is an attempt to take your photo so you can give them more money for the photos at the end of the visit. Then, they try to get visitors to pay $15 for an iPad screen which identifies the buildings (which, as stated earlier, one used to see for free as the outlines were on the windows). Finally, when a visitor is free to walk around, there is no where to walk as there is a huge bakery-restaurant covering most of the floor - yet another attempt to get more money from visitors. One has to walk down a floor or two to see out the windows. The whole experience was very disappointing. I would recommend that if you want to go to a tall, iconic NYC building, go see the Empire State Building; it will make for a much viewing and you'll get more for your money. 'Nuff said!

Amazing. 40th anniversary, first trip to NYC - what a fantastic experience :)The sun shone, then it set, then we had dinner. Lovely food, great service - this will certainly stay with us forever. Just perfect - thank you.

Unfortunately a bit of an anticlimax.. The World Trade Centre Observatory was one of the attractions I was most looking forward to on my trip to New York. I paid for the 'Date Night Package' which entitled me and my girlfriend to prosecco and a chocolate truffle each.Everything was professional and went smoothly right up until we arrived at the viewing level. After being pitched an iPad ($15) you can finally look down on New York after battling your way through the crowds. As it was a Date Night package I wanted it to be special and go at sunset so that could be a reason for the crowds.We arrived at the restaurant and the maitre d' said they were full and to come back in 10mins. She didn't bother to take our name down which led me to believe that they were operating on a first come first serve basis, which includes regular paying patrons to the restaurant, which after paying extra for the package left me in a bit of a bad mood.After finally getting into the restaurant I noticed numerous tables free in good positions to watch the sun set over the city, but it turns out that after paying for a premium package, you have to sit at the bar and not at a table for the prosecco/champagne and truffle. To top it off, they had run out of truffles so me and my girlfriend got one piece of brownie to share between us.My advice is to avoid this package and just pay normally if you want to go into the restaurant, although as you can imagine the prices are pretty eye watering.

Wonderful experience!. This was a wonderful expereine and fantastic views of the city! Loved all the extras- such as the photo history in the evelavator on the ride up! This did not disappoint! We went on a cloudy day but you could still see everything! Amazing! A must do!

Well worth the entrance fee. If you go later in the day it is not very busy.The lift (elevator) is amazingly fast as takes you too a short preview film, which is a bit boring.You are then asked if you want to pay an star 15 dollars for an iPad type device to identify the landmarks. Don't bother as this is a waste of money as it only shows a few on the names.When you go into the observation deck the views are quite simply amazing.I suffer fron vertigo but I had no problems what so ever.You can spend as long as you like looking around. It is all behind glass and covered so no issues with weather.If you have a NYC pass you cannot use if here but the 30 dollars entrance is well worth the money.

A must do. I was lucky enough to visit the original World Trade Centre observatory so I was keen to see how the new building compared. They've done an amazing job.Luckily the weather was kind to us and we had clear 360 degree views (apparently the week before the observatory was in the clouds and you couldn't see a thing).As others have said the trip up in the lift is an experience and very clever as is the visual show that you have as soon as you exit the lift.If you are visiting when the Buzz guide is talking have a listen - he's very interesting and entertaining.
Long queues but worth it. Not the best view, that belongs to the rock but even so this is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere so that fact alone means it's a must do thing in NYC

Amazing!. Surreal to have been in the original WTC years ago and to compare it to the new Freedom Tower... Looking down on the memorial pools in the footprints of the original towers was quite emotional.... A very modern building and amazingly fast lift from ground to 102nd floor. Very tight airport-style security which is good to see. Definitely worth a visit and amazing views of uptown on a clear day. Pricey for drinks at around $20 for a glass of wine, but very enjoyable!

It's all new. Somehow the feeling to the history is missing and the new building may be impressive, has though not the flair of the old ones. It may have been nice to leave something from the original remaining like in Berlin.In any case touchy and surrounding area has to be fixed and construction area needs to finish soon and leave the area in its beauty.

Wow. Incredible views, incredible technology. The lift experience was fast and fantastic - however because it was so fast we did not get the opportunity to fully take in the amazing time lapse images as we whizzed by them. We hired an Ipad but do not feel that was worth it - it was hard to figure out how to use it properly to get the most from it. The views are fantastic but unfortunately the reflection on the windows meant that many of our photos did not turn out well. We pre-purchased tickets so did not have to wait long to get in - there were not long queues at 9am on a Monday morning when we went - you do not get the option to choose your timeslot (or that was how it was on the Viator website) - worth the visit if you have the time especially to get a different perspective of the city than The Rock or Empire State Building.

Way up High. The view is absolutely amazing. It really feels like looking into forever, cheesy as it sounds. The ride on the elevator is surprising! And there are a few stops on the way up that added a special vibe to the ride. Expect it to be crowdy, and sometimes in not so wide spaces. Its kind of an expensive ticket you must pay at least once in a lifetime.

Amazing, but I missed the wind in my face . This observatory is incredible. The escalator is a show, so pay attention. For more 15 dollars you can rent an Ipad with an interactive program that shows dectails of the view! Cool!!!
But there are windows closing everything, and I missed The wind...

The most mesmerizing attraction in New York City.. The elevator raised our expectation and it was dramatic when the curtain raises after the short presentation to reveal city's spirit of unending flow of emotions with its dwellers.The 360 degree view of New York city from the 102 nd floor was beautiful.The birds eye view of of Liberty island,Brooklyn bridge,harbour and the whole city skyline was simply beautiful.daily ticket cost 32 USD and the security was meticulous.A must see place in New york.

Exceeded all expectations . I visited One World Trade Centre with three friends in April 2016. From start to finish, it was a well organised experience, with incredible viewed and unexpected thoughtful touches throughout. The interior of the observatory is extremely modern, in a light and spacious style that makes the most of the incredible view and ensures there's as much space as possible for everyone visiting. Security is tight with airport style scanners on arrival, and tightly controlled groups to ensure numbers within the observatory remain manageable (although there's no time limit on your visit, which feels like the right call). We had booked a time slot for 11.30am but arrived early and were allowed in sooner. It wasn't very busy when we arrived but became busy towards the end of our visit.Aside from the incredible view, we took the opportunity to loan a tablet device with an augmented-reality type programme on it which showed information about different landmarks when you moved around the tablet. You had to stand on a North, South, East or West marker and feed into the tablet your location in order to access the relevant information for each location. We noticed that if we stood anywhere other than the marker, the device didn't calibrate quite right and the buildings didn't quite line up. All very easy to use though, and totally worth the extra 10 USD.An unexpected highlight of the trip was the elevator ascent. Firstly, it was unbelievably quick: less than 60 seconds. Secondly, the whole journey was animated film that displayed on the walls of the elevator, showing the history of the location and explained the geology underneath the tower. It sounds weird to say, but it was a real highlight of the trip, incredible imaginative and informative and really quite beautifully done.This was a real highlight of our trip to New York, I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

Incredible vistas of lower Manhattan and surrounding area. This is an amazing way to see and get a perspective of NYC including the burough of Brooklyn and New Jersey to the West. The elevator ride alone is a time-lapse story told in images as you make your way to the 102nd floor in about one minutes time. Of course, a clear day is the best way to see everything, but as tickets are "timed" entrance and so often need advance purchase, you need to check the weather before ordering. Do NOT bother with an additional $15 for an iPad. I found it not so useful, particularly as it doesn't show most of the few blocks right near the Observatory. Instead opt for the City Pulse where global ambassadors show many close up images and answer questions. The Sky Portal is a large circular disc that gives a bird's eye view of streets below in real time. You can dine here at a cafe, but there is so much to see in the main observatory as you walk around that we didn't do this. A not to miss place. You are then also close to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum. In all, you should plan on at least 3-5 hours if you wish to take in the whole area.

Well planned experience. Great experience for tourists. Since the observatory is enclosed, if you are a New Yorker it does just feel like being on a high floor of an office building. That being said, the whole experience was well planned and I recommend that tourists rent the ipad for the additional fee so that you can identify the buildings you are seeing. Save your money and get much better food down at Brookfield Place, not in the observatory.
Breathtaking View. A wonderful opportunity to see the New York skyline from a different perspective. The lower Manhattan location provides a very unique sightseeing experience
Fab. This is such an amazing building with the most amazing views of Manhattan New Jersey and Brooklyn. You can hire an I Pad pre loaded telling you what all the buildings are for $10.
4 from Texas. Very good view and unlike the 911 memorial it is just a sight seeing adventure for all ages. It is not the Icon as the Empire State Building but worth the visit if you have the time.

There's no other place to get a view like this I'm telling you.. They really built a place of beauty here. The views are spectacular. All of the Memorials have been done perfectly and with respect. I was honored to visit this place.

Great experience and fantastic view of New York and Jersey.. Great experience, nice atmosphere and no queue. The was good room to go around and look out. The food was actually quite good, but a little expensive.

Wonderful, on a clear day.. It was a clear sunny day and the view, all 360 degrees, was magnificent. The ride up in the elevator was entertainment in itself as New York is portrayed from its earliest times to the present.One complaint. Only a $2 discount for seniors!!

Go Early!. By getting there at 8, went around the block for coffee then came back at 845. Stood in line for ticket around 2 minutes, then waited until 9 for first lift up to top. No one up there yet! Got to take all the pictures without anyone in way. By 10 am, crowded!

A must do. As everyone says, this is a must do but it needs planning - you just can't spontaneously turn up and hope to be let in. But once you are in, you will see so much symbolism of what the USA is and what it represents. Apart from that, the view is amazing.

The Best View of Everything!. Fear of height is no excuse not to take the sky pod to the top of this beautiful building!The views are spectacular! You can see several neighboring states! Be aware that the "Multimedia Experience" includes the upselling of tourist photos $20+, rental of an iPod type device (you don't need it if you know the city). This all adds to the length of time it takes to see the view. It is definitely worth the wait! The elevator ride is not scary either!

Awesome views. Great place. Go on a Monday for cheaper prices. Fantastic views all over the city. Well worth a visit. Food can be expensive, we had flat bread pizza at $14 very good but no tables to sit at only stand. Cup of tea or coffee $5 is a bit steep. Go around 7 and watch the sun go down to get two different views of the city.

I will admit that this. Is it is a view and "must" in New York.. It is so professionally done, in spite of the occasions who hit on the 11'th and to build this tower beneath the evil happenings from terrorists is just amazing. The guides and the information was just something to remember. Overlooking New York, Hudson River, Eat River and Manhattan from the top deck was just "Woww"

WOW what a view. Had to purchaes tickets and return at a designated time. My suggestion stop there first and get your time. Then you can plan what you will do with the time while you wait. Reflection pools are very close and if the wait is long the 9/11 museum is also very close.
What a view. This is just a wonderful experience. It is great being up there and being able to look over the City. Great for visitors as well as New Yorkers

The Fantastic One World Observatory. We had book online before our visit in December. We turned up to be told that there was zero visibilty - we were directed to the ticket office where our booking was changed to the day after at no extra cost !!. We went back and enjoyed the whole day- what a fantastic experience - from the elevator ride to the meal we enjoyed in the restaurant.I would recommend going from mid to late afternoon (depending on the time of year). The dusk setting over New York was something I and my family will never forget

A Must See in NYC - Best Observation Experience. As another reviewer said the elevator ride is worth the visit to 1 WTC observation deck alone. The entire experience is extremely well done from start to finish. It is easy to get into the line and it went quickly. The elevator was a true show stopper and so quick. When you get to the top they do a great job of making it an experience when you first see the view. While I agree it is commercialized it is just so well done. There is room to walk around, sit and stay in the observation deck for hours if you want (we ate there only because we were starving, obviously overpriced but great views). We spent hours there looking around and hanging out.
