I think someone else referred to this as being commercialized, but it really just made us feel like hanging out there as there were benches and other aspects that encouraged you to stay. The deck is a circle and on each side there was a cluster of screens and a city guide. We happened upon a presentation (not sure how often they do them) and it was interesting and the technology they used was neat but it was about NYC in general, not just about the WTC. I think a little more geared to the building may have been interesting. And there is absolutely no mention of 9/11 or the twin towers that I saw, which was clearly intentional as they want to focus on the new with this tower and there is the museum and memorial to cover the history. Overall, this is a must see. Even on a cloudy/foggy day the views were great. We enjoyed our time there and the experience was much better then the Empire State building (confusing maze of lines, no where to sit and relax and spend time once you were at the observation deck). Our only complaint was that we felt rushed in the museum since we bought a package with the memorial walking tour, museum, and observation deck. We arrived at the museum at 12 and I asked the staff immediately if we had to be at 1 WTC at 2 as the ticket stated or if we could arrive later, they insisted we had to be there at 2 (and I knew from an experience at the Statute of Liberty that the time on our ticket there was not relevant). We rushed through the museum and didn't get a chance to spend more time at many exhibits and as soon as we arrived at 1 WTC it was clear the time on our ticket was irrelevant. I wish the staff was more knowledgeable about this because I did enjoy the bundled experience but did not like feeling rushed at the museum (and there is no re-entry).

Fantastic view - great inbformation. Our visit to One World Observatory was even better than we expected. You really can see forever - and see everything. It was not very crowded when we went (thurs morning), no long lines, and everyone was moving around. Not too many school groups. The elevator ride up was fun, interesting, and quick!! 45 seconds I believe, and 23 mph. We know a lot of NYC and did not need/use the interactive tablets. But we did see lots of people using them - they seemed easy to use and very informative, and those using them all seemed very happy with the experience. There are people all around the observatory to answer questions and help you. The 2 info-mercial type platforms were staffed by fun, high energy people who gave interesting talks/presentations - perfect for those new to NYC. Food selections looked very delicious and were not ridiculously priced. We prepaid for our green-screen photos, which is something we always getting!Would REALLY LOVE this place to be open at night, when the city it lit up!!

Breathtaking view !!. Right from whizzing to the top of the centre on the extremely fast Sky Pod elevators, which take you to the 102nd floor within seconds !! to the breathtaking 360 degree view of this great city from the observatory, the whole experience is simply amazing. A must if visiting NYC
Amazing viwes .... A nice NYC atraction.. Views are almost the same ss the ones i have seen from the original building some 25 years ago.Nice high-tech appearance.In one word? Views!

Great view of NY. First thing ride to the 102nd floor is amazing and very creative.360 degree View of New York from 100th floor is really amazing.its always very crowded since everyone wants to visit this amazing place.A unique experience.

Breath Taking Views. I'm afraid of heights, but decided that I needed to go up 102 stories. First off when you get into the elevator to go up, the ride is great you get a video of the changes in New York City, as you go up but it is the fastest ride. You go from ground level to 102 flights in 60 seconds. You don't even feel the ride. It was great, and I'd do it again. When you arrive at the top you step out into a room where your shown a video of New York City, when the video ends all of a sudden the screen opens up and your looking out a window. It was breath taking. I will admit I grabbed onto my husband's hand and held tight. But it was awesome. You then go down a set of steps that lead you to the 100th floor. I walked around the whole building there and had a great time. I even posed for a selfey sitting on the ledge. I would defiantly do this again. I saw places that I wouldn't have if I was on the ground.

Great Views, great beer in the bar.. This is the place to go. It beats the Empire State Building. One elevator take you to the top. Then peculate down a floor or two. Great views. The bar service and menu were great. Highly recommended.

Another must see. Again get the e ticket from costco to ensure you do not have to stand in lines too long. They say that there are 20,000 skyscrapers there but from 102 floors up it looks like more then that. Make sure you don't go up to early so your view isn't obstructed by early morning clouds. The view gives you a similar view as the empire state building but from a different angle. Obviously it doesn't have the history of the empire state building but it something to see
Absolutely spectacular!!!. The view is to beautiful. You can see all of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Jersey and far beyond. The lift ride up is fantastic

Grat view but lines after lines. I rate this 4-star only because of the view!The way this works is you wait in line to buy tickets. After you buy your ticket you go downstairs and wait in line for the security check. After that you wait in line for the elevator. When you get to the 104th floor you wait in line to get to a very small space for a presentation. Then you wait in line to get to out of that small room. Wait in line to get down one floor via escalator. And you get to enjoy the spectacular views.When you go down you also need to wait in a line to get to the elevator and then wait in line to get out of the elevator area.I was nervous for the elevator ride but it was not as terrifying as I assumed. During the elevator ride there are monitors all around which shows how New York has been rebuilt from nature to buildings and skyscrapers. This was really cool.Main point - lines after lines after lines to get to a small space full of people and more lines to exit the building.They should rethink their strategy of having closing people in a small room after that elevator ride as a lot of people expressed their discomfort in the small room.I recommend going during the evening (during dinner) when there is less traffic.I would still go back for the extraordinary view - this time during the evening - but I would hate having to wait in all those lines sweating my bal*s off.

Must See!! . You need to go and check this out of visiting NYC! It is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. The observatory is amazing. Also around the area there is more sightseeing like the 9/11 memorial and the museum.

Great views; hold on to your wallet. You can't argue with the view once you finally get there -- pretty spectacular. And the elevator ride -- showing a pictorial history of Manhattan island from the 1600s forward -- was interesting. Aside from that, the exuberant staff tries renting an iPad to identify notable plans and buildings, takes your photo (you can skip this if you really try) to sell you at the end and makes this more like Disneyland than what I remember as a fairly un-commercial visit to the Empire State Building (then the tallest building anywhere) as a child. I really enjoyed the view, but it wasn't cheap getting to the top and I felt somewhat besieged when I got up there.

Window on Mahattan. Unforunately we choose a day when we were told there was zero visability but as you can see from the photo it was far from that. The trip up in the lift is very impressive with you getting a 360 degree view of Mahattan through the ages. It takes about 45 sec. to travel the 200 and odd floors and very smooth it is too. Once on the obseravation floor you are presented with a short history of the structure and then, the screens are drawn up to show the view!. Once inside the main hall you are able to get a 360 degree view on Manhattan and the sournding districts. Take your time as there is a lot to take in. Enjoy.

Amazing views but touristy. Loved the views and being able to spend as much time as you wanted walking around the observation level (Once you got it!). Lots of high pressure to buy photos and rent iPads for the view explanations. Resist it and you'll finally get out on observation floor. Pricey but only $1 more than Empire State Building.
Incredible views. We believe it is completely worth your while to go up to the observatory while enjoying the ride of less than a minute to the top where wonderfull views of NY can be found.

Worth a Visit, but not the Old WTC!. A beautifully designed building, with a very slick entrance experience. The viewing deck is bland. The iPad screens are an expensive waste really. We barely used ours. There is very little seating, I guess to stop you lingering too long. Worth it for the view.
sky shade by windows. Great experience , a little disappointed by not been able to have direct view without glare thru the windows ,prefer the empire building for future trips

Beautiful View Moving Experience. Naturally due to the height you are at you will get a magnificent view of The Big Apple and its environs. In addition there is an employee that stands at the display and fires off various trivia about NYC that you may or may not find helpful. More importantly, for me, after having stood in the observation deck of the Twin Towers and having seen the devastation of the events of 9/11 and going to the Memorial and Museum last year, standing in One World Trade was a moving experience, an uplifting of sorts, a triumph of freedom over tyranny, life over death, democracy over totalitarianism, tolerance over terrorism.I urge you to go!

expected a little bit more. all over a nice thing to do, but I wont go there a secound time. I was missing a spot where you can go outside or get some thrills with a glass bottom eg. but still there is one surprise right at the beginning. hold your cameras ready ;-)

Tallest Building on the Western Hemisphere. No doubts the best view of New York City. Although I think it is a bit pricey it is a great experience. Try to go on a day where it is not too cloudy because otherwise you will not see anything. Line goes by fast, wait is not too bad. Great view!

What a great thing to do. Absolutely loved visiting One World Observatory. From the moment you arrive it's very slick and presentable. The whole lift experience and the actually observation is brilliant and well worth the money

Great view, plan to take your time. The view from the top of the Observatory is great - it's 360 degrees and the highlight might be seeing the Statue of Liberty in the distance. We were there at an off time (later in the day, during the week) and didn't have any trouble getting to the windows to see clearly. During peak times, it might be a little crowded to see well. There are people there to answer questions and the gift shop is nice. Afterwards, it's a short walk to the 9/11 Memorial
Stunning. Even the most jaded person has to be stunned by the view of the city here, only made more special by the fact of where you are standing...just go!

A once in a lifetime kinda thing. Book your time online!!!. First let me say this is Manhatten and things are obviously going to be expensive there. My wife and I took our 5 children here because hey, it's the tallest building in the nation right? It did cost over $200 for tickets but I will tell you it was totally worth the price. My kids still talk about seeing NYC from the top of WTC1. Crowds were not that bad at 10am but you really need to book your time online. I can't stress this enough. If you have an assigned time you can skip the lines and go to the front. If you are simply visiting NYC this is a must see. I promise you won't leave disappointed. (Random unrelated tirade that 432 Park Ave is a horrifically ugly building. Come on NYC you can build something better than a square building)

Love the elevator ride. So this type experience is basically seeing A View, but not that I mind.This one is a plus for me because they have a high-speed elevator with visual of NY, the old and new. Nice.
Great views. This is an inside viewing area and you can look down as well as out. There are great views of the Brooklyn and Manhatten bridges and the memorial site.

Wow!!!!. Having been to New York on a few occasions before, we had only ever seen Ground Zero. One World Trade or The Freedom Tower stands where the twin towers previously were. It is a must see. 2 Levels to view it from and the views are stunning. We were lucky to be there on a clear day and had views for about 25 miles. Don't think about it, just go!!!

Must-See View of NYC. Gorgeous views of New York City from the 100th floor of One World Trade Center! When we went, there was a $99 deal for 4 adult tickets, which was great. Since the windows are all clear/clean glass, you get 360 degree unobstructed views of the city. They offer for you to purchase an iPad device for an additional $15 that syncs as you point it to buildings in the city and tells you what you are looking at. We didn't purchase one and enjoyed the experience the same. They also let you stay as long as you want to and you can eat at the restaurant there as well!

Surptisingly enjoyable experience. We didn't plan this. Once we arrived to the amazing memorial, we asked if it's possible to go up the tower and we surprised is was. it was around 18:00, there was no line at all, the elevator ride was fun, the video in the beginning as well and the view was fantastic. iPad isn't a must. They have someone speaking every 15 minutes and it's highly recommended.

Sunset flex is worth the money. In May 2016, Sunset flex was $130 for two adults, but you have the flexibility of turning up anytime between 6pm and 9.15pm. We had dinner first and spent time at the 911 memorial pools before entering the observatory. The Sunset Flex tickets allow you to skip ALL the queues so within 5 mins through security etc we were in the elevator. The elevator is an experience in itself! We booked our tickets the night before the visit and spent probably an hour watching the sun go down and chance the colour of the city. Not sure what the experience would be like on a rainy day ... We switched our plans we'd made at home to get a good night ... Seemed to be more flexibility for last minute plan changing for the Observatory compared to the Top of the Rock, where sunset availability was more limited and there's no flex. In summary - not cheap but definitely worth it.

The View Is Worth The Price!. The line looks intimidating but it moves steadily along. The views of the city and Statue of Liberty are amazing. The staff tries to up sell you with helpful ipads that identify specifics that you are looking at. I didn't think it was necessary.

Invest in the virtual tour!. Great experience! I highly recommend the virtual tour with the I-pads. Without it you just have a phenomenal yet pricey view. Caution: If you are prone to motion sickness don't pan too quickly.

Really a great stop. This is really an important stop while in the City. Great views of the city, amazing elevator ride and a nice place to look out while enjoying a cocktail. Also a great opportunity to reflect outside at the memorial.

One World Observatory - Incredible view. Amazing 360 degree view. Staff very efficient and knowledgeable. A pleasant experience. Tourists were not rushed and were able to linger to enjoy views as long as they wished. Very commercial, Photos taken with purchase encouraged.

Nice Perspective of the city. Amazing views of the city. Cost was $32 per adult and they do offer a military discount to ACTIVE DUTY ID holders only. I am only an AD spouse. Overall, it's one of those things that you want to do because you're there. I don't think I would spend the money for a family of 4 to go up though.
Great View . The only problem with this attraction is the extremely rude self-centered mob you have to put up with. If you can deal with them you won't find better views anywhere.

Make sure to go on a clear day/night. Very neat! Went on a Saturday afternoon in May. Thought it would be a madhouse, but was not bad. $32 for one adult admission. Waited about 30 minutes to get upstairs. Elevator ride is neat, be sure to pay attention. And don't be annoying and raise up your arms/cameras/phones to take pictures. It blocks the view of others. We were warned that visibility was only about 3 miles that day (on a clear day should be about 10 miles). It had rained in the morning and the sun was just beginning to come out, so we thought they were being overly cautious and decided to go anyway. They were right though. Couldn't see north past the Empire State Building. Visibility wasn't great. We had to go this day as this was the last day my friend had in the city. But if you see the notification that visibility is poor (it is downstairs above the ticket window) I would come back another day if your schedule allows. Overall, very neat. There is plenty of space upstairs to walk around. When I went, it wasn't too crowded.
The great New York from a different perspective.. Well worth visit! The breathtaking views and unique perspective make this visit an extraordinary experience.
IMPRESSIVE. The building, the views, and the technologicaldisplays are outstanding and worth the effort to go there.

Fighting Nerves to Go Sky-High. We had time left to venture to lower Manhattan and see the WTC and 9/11 Memorials. Knowing we would not be able to visit the museum, we decided to try the Freedom Tower observatory. The tix are $32/per adult, unless you pay with MasterCard - the tix are same price, but free upgrade to priority pass: expedited trip up! The elevator ride is a scant 60 seconds long, and as you rise the LED screen lined elevator shows the NYC sky line change from when first inhabited to modern time. The views are incredible, even considering the day we went it was overcast and windy. You can walk a full 360 degrees around and can snap some really amazing pics.

The elevator ride alone is worth the trip!. A visit to the top of the new World Trade Center will give you a spectacular view of the entire city and well beyond. It's not cheap - expect to pay $32 per person for the privilege of riding to the top and looking out the window. When you get to the top you will listen to a brief ad as they attempt to get you to "rent" an iPad which will help you identify whatever you're looking at. While it's pretty cool - I wouldn't waste the extra money on the iPad - but that's just me. Maybe one for the family would be nice. Of course, at $32 per person, you'd think they could let each family borrow one at no additional charge.The elevator ride is amazing. I feel that I really can't say too much about it because it may lose a little of the luster. Let's just say that you have never experienced a ride like this one.

Why no open air viewing?. Having been to top of Original World Trade Centre a couple of times before that fateful day I wanted to see what the new tower would be like.I pre booked online before my visit but at the time of my visit (Thursday lunchtime in mid May) could easily have walked up to ticket windows with minimal queuing. Waited no more than 5 minutes to access the high speed lift (elevator) which is fully enclosed but has screens all around showing the view you would have seen as you rose to top. Instead of being able to access the viewing area you first had to endure an attempt to sell a viewing experience on a tablet computer for rent, then another queue to have the usual 'tourist' photo taken. There was no opportunity to bypass these two things which I found rather annoying and consider yet another way of 'milking the tourist'. The standard entry fee is not cheap and I have marked the score down deliberately due to this.Once I was able to reach the viewing area I was disappointed to find there is no open air gallery and all photographs had to be taken through glass with the consequent reflections ruining some attempts to take a photo. Although the views were amazing things could have been better by reducing the commercialisation of the experience. Don't be tempted to buy any of the snacks which were grossly overpriced. $5 for a small muffin is one example.

Be sure to buy the FAST PASS before you get to NYC. Go online and buy yourself a priority pass online BEFORE YOU GO to NYC. Yes it costs almost double but when we were there some people said they stood inline for 5+ hours. Can you imagine what you can do with 5 hours in NYC. We landed at laguardia at 1030. Took cab to time square checked in hotel, jumped a subway to 1WORLD and because I bought the priority thing we were up at the top by 12:45 with 6 kids and one happy husband. Now that is AMAZING
Seeing NYC from the 102 floor.. Worth seeing the NYC skyline on a pretty day. The elevator ride up has a movie playing on the walls around you. Really neat to see and do.

WOW! GREAT VIEWS AND CLASSIC EXPERIENCE. Tickets and processing more swiftly.Elevators are a marvel to experience.............We sent two hours and loved the point and listen ipad for the various landmarks in New York and New Jersey.Employees were VERY helpful and knowledgeable.
"SEE FOREVER". This is an amazing building. The elevator ride was great and the view is Spectacular. We visit the restaurant great service and we could see the sun set from our table. Don't miss it.

Beautiful views of the city and beyond. We went early in the morning and were able to see far and wide from the observatory. It is very nicely done, crowds are managed well. The elevator ride depicting the construction of New York City from early on to the present day was extremely well done.

New York in December 2015. One World Observatory is a must. Once you get into the elevators three of the walls display a time lapse of New York, We spent three hours at the main observatory. I recommend purchasing the One World Explorer which will identify NY landmarks also purchase your tickets online. We ate dinner at the restaurant....the view was spectacular, wait staff was accommodating and the food was a little over price for what you get however we didn't mind considering the view.
Wonderful new attraction. This was one of the highlights of the trip for me. Always fascinated with skyscrapers and this didn't disappoint .. From the elevator ride up and then that view.

Amazing views. I am not usually a sight seeing guy but noting there were not large lines of people decided to visit this site as a tribute to the people who died in 9/11. The cost of tickets was good and being a senior I got a small discount. The ride up in the lift was worth the price of the ticket and the displays as you entered the first attraction were amazing and that was just the start. Once on the viewing level 350% views of New York City. I was stunned by the height we were at and the fabulous views. There was also a restaurant where I could have had lunch but preferred to wander around the viewing platform. In my mind this is a must see if in New York City. As a tribute to those who died in 9/11 this is as good as it gets. If I am ever return this way again I will definitely go up there again. Well worth the price I paid.
Great views. Getting to the top is a bit of a process, but once you get there, the views are amazing and there is plenty of room to spread out.

This is something you won't want to miss, but check the weather first.. This is not a cheap experience, but one that you won't want to miss out on. The elevator ride up uses large format media (screens that run the entire inside of the elevator) to give you a quick glimpse of the history and how the city has changed over the years. If you get motion sickness easily, this ride up and down will definitely trigger it, you've been warned.Once you get up to the top, there is another short presentation which I promise you'll enjoy. (I won't ruin the surprise for you.) After that, there is an opportunity to get a device that will point out features and locations in the city for you. If you really want to know where things are, get it, otherwise save your cash (You'll need it for a souvenir.)Before you decide to visit, check the weather forecast. You'll want to go on a clear day so you can really see everything. We were there on a day where visibility was only a few miles. While the limited visibility didn't ruin our visit, it certainly didn't help it. We were able to see the Statue of Liberty and most of the major buildings in NYC, but a clear day would have made it that much better.The gift shop was pricey to say the least. A selfie stick was $25, a t-shirt was $30, an embroidered golf shirt was $130. If you want a souvenir, get it here because there is no shop on the ground. Take you time here if you go and get a good look. You'll be glad that you did.

See New York City the best possible way.. I do not like heights, but this building and its' view were so outstanding that I was overcome with the beauty of the sights. Furthermore, they have such informative guides and visual information that we spent the whole morning touring this building. So many tourists attractions in NCY. This one is at the top of my list, and I would go back.
World trade Center. We did not went up, because the weather, as was planned but we took a lot pictures and paid our respects.

Wow breathtaking views. A good Tipp is to go early before it gets crowded! We walked in with no queuing, you get to the top so fast but barely realise you are moving. The History of New York is projected on the Walls of the Lift showing where and when exactly what was built. It's amazing and very interesting. At the top the large space to walk around with the huge windows giving a clear view without any obstructions is fantastic. We had super weather so you could see for miles getting a birdseye perspective. It is uncomparable to other towers a big improvement on Space, No vying for Places to take Photos. You can rent an iPad for $15.- with a Panorama effect also with labels to Click on for info on the buildings etc. its Not a Must but for People that don't know exactly what they are Looking at it a good idea. Its well worth the visit

?where is the open air deck?. Just been there. It is amazing to be so high above the other towers in NYC. However, where is the open air observatory deck just like on the Empire state? The experience didn't feel the same as empire!

Better than you think. As a New Yorker, I never expected to do this, much less enjoy it.I went simply to be a good sport.The elevator ride was fabulous.The views are spectacular, although I can't fathom why a "stranger" would enjoy seeing things they know nothing about. Our out of town guests loved the stories we shared and, of course the ekevator.A lot of thought went into creating this experience and we all found value in it

Super great! . I have to admit that although the view was super, the thing that amazed me the most was the elevator! :) super fast and you don't feel like your going that fast or when the elevator is stoping. I totally recommend this. Buy the ticket the same day you are going to visit it, just in case it rains. We got the attraction with our big bus package, you just have to go to the mall in front of the building to change it. They let you enjoy the view as long as you want. We went around 3:00 pm and it was perfect, because it wasn't crowded. We regret not planing to eat in the restaurant that's in there, so if you can... Do it! :) just for the view.

what views. wow...can not see forever but could see coney island! such great 360 views...kinda weird being in the same place 9/11 happened....humbling and worth it...went early on a Sun..no wait....earlier the better i presume.....

Dissapointed. I am not sure what I expected, but this was very disappointing. We went on a Monday, and the lines (and I want to emphasize lines) were all long. The experience reminded me of waiting for a popular Disney ride, but one that was not as well engineered.
Just go and have a look!. I would visit One World Trade Center during day. The experience already starts in the elevators. But, discover it yourself. Otherwise the fun is gone. Great job New York!!!

Fabulous experience. We loved this, the elevator ride was spectacular, and the view is obviously great. We even splurged on dinner, which was lovely. Great service, and we could see the sun set from our table. Must see in NY!
Breath taking!!. You can see for miles. 45 miles to be exact. The videos of how NYC skyline has changed over the years is fascinating. The 360 views of the city and cities beyond are amazing.

Great interactive experience . I enjoyed this as it did give me more than expected. Not only was the view fantastic, there are cool additional features like the lift which takes you through time showing Manhattan's development and also the option to use an iPad to explore the skyline. I did get the iPad simply due to $15 cost but if there is a group it might be worth it.

Amazing views but you pay for it!. OK, first time to NYC so we figured what the heck. $36 per person. Very nice 360 degree views. We also rented the Ipad $15 that shows you what buildings and landmarks you are looking at. The Ipad viewer thing easily gets disoriented so pay attention when they explain how to get it reoriented.
Amazing... This is an amazing building with an amazing city view... we just happen to be there the day of the US Cup Race.. very interesting..

As close to the old World Trade Center as it gets. The building, now sometimes called the "Freedom Tower,' is technically the tallest in New York at 1776 feet, but that includes the broadcast antenna on the top of the structure. There are at least two buildings where one can be higher, both in midtown and both residential, but in order to see that view, you have to own one of the priciest apartments in the world or know someone who does. The twenty dollar fee for going to the top is worth it--once! There is a unique short animation projected on the elevator wall in the under one minute ascent to the top showing how lower Manhattan changed from colonial times to now. This is fascinating but it goes by too fast to judge its accuracy. The current observatory is all about the view--that of lower Manhattan and the Harbor are unsurpassed, but the views going uptown are not as unique. If you visited the old World Trade Center, there are certain similarities of view and those will give you pause and make you a bit somber, but not as somber as the memorial museum itself.

Stunning and Emotional. The views from the Observatory and the entire experience is top notch. From entrance to exit, the design and flow are incredible. I was expecting it to be a great vantage point for viewing NYC and it was utterly breathtaking. It is impossible however to be in this building and not think about how it came into existence and was brought about by the worst act of terrorism in our country. I was overwhelmed at thinking about the events that took place on 9/11. However, it is not meant to be about sadness, rather more about progress, perseverance, resiliency and the American spirit. An absolute required stop in NYC. Reservation are required.

Breathtaking!. Super fast elevator! Once you are in the observation deck you can see everything! Beautiful and people were quiet,as well as the kids! You can grab a bite to eat, as there is a restaurant. It's worth the money. Highly recommend.

It is worth the money for the IPAD. Absolutely amazing! The elevator ride is as much fun as the actual 360 observation deck. Will teach you history and give you more appreciation of the city itself. So well done!

Simply a must do. We visited the One World Observatory and it was simply awe inspiring.The views are stunning and we both could not take it all in at the time. You see the whole of New York and New Jersey in all of its splendour. We met a lovely Swedish couple and a New York lady and her two sons and shared a few drinks discussing the views and New York. We literally stayed until the place closed and we had to leave. If you are visiting New York, this place is a must see and you will not be disappointed with the Observatory or its views. Make sure you also take time to pay your respects at the 911 memorial site which again is simply stunning and really makes you think of the horrors that occurred there in the most respectful way possible.

102 floors in under 60 seconds. This was a stop on our tour with NY Shuttle Tours. The elevator ride to the top was interactive, futuristic, and made the ride up very enjoyable. We were so high up our ears were popping, but quite worth it for the views you get when you step off the elevator. They have photographers waiting for you when you get off, interactive IPAD rentals, a cafe, and restrooms. We loved the 360 views, it was tons of people, but never felt crowded.

Breathtaking. The lift to the 1250 feet top of One World Trade Centre takes about a minute with projections on the walls of the lift giving the illusion of an outside elevator. Once topside you are in a presentation area with film of old New York etc. Then the screens go up leaving a stunning vista of the area with 3 satiated in view.There are other displays and a very small gift shop. There is a risk of cloud cover obscuring the view. Midweek the walk up line was not large.

Amazing views. A lot goes on at the Observatory as well as the amazing views; there are interesting talks, shops (all very touristy) and cafes. The food was at best, adequate, but the service was friendly and it was nice to sit down during a day of walking.

Memories of the Twin Towers. In the late 70's I was with a group of friends that went to the top of the WTC and to the Windows of the World Restaurant. In April when visiting NYC I decided to go back to One World Trade Center and go to the top. It is an amazing building and I don't want to give away just how it felt to go to the top. You have to experience it yourself without being told what to expect. The day I went I did not purchase my ticket until the morning of. I wanted to make sure that the weather was good. It was a gorgeous day. I got teary eyed thinking about 9/11 and seeing how beautiful NYC looked from the top of the tower. You could see Times Square, the Statue of Liberty, cruise ships departing the harbor and the two 9/11 fountains etc. I capped the day off by trading myself to a cocktail in the bar. Met some really nice people and felt so joyful when I left. Be sure to stay in the area and see the 9/11 museum, St. Paul's Church and the memorial fountains.

Breathtaking views. Having been to the Twin Towers observation deck, we were a bit uncertain about visiting One World Observatory. Boy are we glad that we did. We arrived about an hour before sunset and we saw some of the most beautiful views of the city and harbor.

Best Observation Deck in NYC!. I have visited both the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock and can honestly admit that the One World Observatory provides visitors with the most pristine view of the city. From the exhilarating elevator ride to the extraordinary views over Manhattan, Liberty Island, Staten Island, Brooklyn and New Jersey, this is an experience not to be missed. This is worth the admission price and more!

Great view of NYC and sunset. We have been on the Observatory during the late afternoon. We have seen also the sunset. Great view of the Brooklin bridge and downtown. The visit is well organized and the staff is available and friendly. We recommend to buy the tikets online and with the option jump the line otherwise there could be long line expecially in the morning. It's difficult the take good pics, due to the glasses and the number of people, but if you are patient you can succeed.

See forever . The observatory deck gives you the perfect chance to get an overlook over the city. The animations of the city in the elevators are amazing (kind of sad, that you have only a few seconds drive to 102 floor). A must do when you visiting NYC.

Breathtaking view. It was a great new view of Manhattan for me, and to be able to look down on the Empire State building was pretty impressive. The staff does a great job of getting the visitors in and out, including the information during the elevator ride and the pre-entrance to the observatory. I highly recommend this for a list of places to visit.
Breathtaking view!. A bit pricey but worth it! The elevator ride is amazing! Go on a clear day and you'll be able to see as far as the eye can see!

Amazing Structure & View!. Presentation is everything, and this place knows how to present! I won’t go into details, as I don’t want to spoil anything, but Holy Cannoli they have it going on!!Hanging out and absorbing the view at our own pace was incredible.The only drawback, they think very highly of everything up there! There souvenirs are grossly overpriced compared to any other attraction I have ever been to – in any country! Normally we at least get a magnet – could barely spring for a postcard. Money was better spent at the 9/11 Museum & Menorial.

Fantastic and moving NYC attraction. Very efficient entry into the tower. The elevator ride was amazing. Very cool. Very Emotional, interesting, enlightening and what a view. Visit the Museum, next to Observatory. A wonderful experience. Don't miss it.

SEE FOREVER. Awesome ! I was walking past on my way to visit the 911 Memorial Museum and saw the entrance to One World Observatory. It was around 9 Am and there was no line at all. They have done a great job and it was well worth my time and money. I was there on a clear and sunny day and you really could see forever. The observation area is on the 100th floor and is 360 degrees around the building.

Sunset time offers a breathtaking view of the city! . If you are visiting New York City this is a must see you have incredible views of Manhattan and the borough's. I would recommend paying the extra fee to go up around sunset time as the sun going down brings beautiful shades of sun into the buildings.

Amazing views. First visited the twin towers 30 years ago so no trip to New York wouldn't be complete without going to the top of the new tower! Views were still amazing and top of the tower had great facilities.
Welcome to NEW york. Downtown Manhattan and Jersey city with a lot of skyscrapers... and One World Trade Center is highest!
Exciting. Did not know what to expect - and glad I was surprised on certain aspects. It was a little Disney-ish, however, that being said it was also amazing seeing the views from 100 floors up.

Oh wow!!. What an awesome view! It is a little pricey but no more than the other observatories around I don't think. It gives a surreal feeling of being in the trade center and thinking what it must have been like on 9/11. It is an amazing view of the city and I would highly recommend it.

One World observatory visit. The view even on a partly cloudy day was greatYou truly seem to see forever The elevator ride was also entertainingYou zip up to 1200 feet in a blink with a nice video show on the 3 wallswith a different video when zipping down I would love to do this again when it's clear
Good views... Excellent views over NYC..most tours take you here as part of the package. It's a beautiful building and worth the visit.

must Visit. I visit this observatory first day of my trip in NY, and definitely liked it. the tiring moment was the line for about 50 min but after you get a reward. panoramic view is amazing. NB: if you want to catch day&nighty view better arrive here at 3pm. also here´s cafe (a bit expensive) but if you are extremely hungry - ok. think this place good for people from 5 till 95 y.o.

Great views!. You can take great pictures, need a zoom lens. The elevator was a cool ride. The restaurant employees seemed snooty, but the cafe employees were very nice and friendly. The cafe food was decent. Bought the family pack good value.

Fantastic views of the city!. The views from the top are fantastic. I would recommend going up to the next floor up "The Summit". It was much quieter than the floor below and there is also access to a bar

Queues not worth it. The views are ok, but not markedly better than Empire State Building (ESB).Queues to get in were pretty bad and even worse to leave, whereas I keep returning to the ESB, I shan't return to this one.
Magnificent view of NYC. Amazing building, high speed elevaters, great show before getting the observation deck, amazing view, nothing compares to this.. Highly recommended!!!!

Best Must see in NY. I'm not sure there is a sight better, spotless, great staff...if I lived closer, I would pay to see it again and have lunch there at least 2 times each week..Thank You for creating such a nice place.RDK

Elevator surprise. The entry fee was quite expensive, but it worth it! You'll be surprised in the elevators, but I won't spoiler why. At the top there are a lot of shops and they'll try to sell you many kind of additional gadgets, which i don't recommend to pay for.

great views. the views were amazing. but go on a clear day. with no visibility you wont see anything and it will be a waste. they will exchange your ticket for a different day in that case. itis a breathtaking bldg

A little pricey, but very very cool!. The elevator ride is amazingly awesome, both up and down. And the views are, as expected, absolutely spectacular. There are lots of helpful, excited guides to chat with and ask questions of at the top. Plus there's a little gift shop and cafe (and restrooms).

Breathtaking view, unexpected!. Took a trip to the top and just the ride alone is exciting. When you enter the observatory, you can see every part of the city for miles. Even the Statue of Liberty looks small from 100 stories up. Worth the once in a lifetime view.
Highlight of our NYC visit. To see as far as the eye can see is AMAZING! The impact of the screen rising up to see the view brought tears to our eyes. Our grandson enjoyed the tablet rental.
AMAZING. We stumbled upon this by accident and were beyond pleased. The views were incredible. Weather was crisp and perfectly sunny

amazing views. Some amazing views if you get good weather, we was lucky and got a hot clear day in March... There is some cool views and you can get some good pictures. Sadly with glare off the windows it can be challenging to avoid the reflection from the windows. But either way some cool views. I recommend having your video ready to record when you go up in the elevator (very cool) We was lucky to get a elevator to ourself which was ace. They do a interactive presentations which is interesting and some advise on places to go. I would recommend taking a walk across the brooklyn bridge its free and som really nice views. The 911 museum is worth checking out, not for everyone but worth see and the pools.

See forever tour. We were there on a partially cloudy day so the view was only good when Brooklyn got sunshine. We had a time to eat in the restaurant Ambiance is not good as the restaurant is a balcony and open to the noise from the observation floor sales barkers ruins it. The menu and wine list is odd and limited. Food is not good. Our suggestion is to have a drink here if you wantand then go elsewhere to eat.

See forever. None of the trips up any of the buildings in Manhattan prepare you for what you experience at the One World Observatory! My friends cannot believe the photos I took with just a phone. Stay for the sunset, it is magical!
Don't miss this. We visited the Museum, Memorial and the Observation deck. Everything was done in a superb manner. The employees are well trained and very accommodating.

What a view!. A must when visiting NYC. What a building! Even going up in the lift to go to the observatory floors is an experience.Beautiful view over New York. Definitely worth a visit.We booked our tickets in advance online. Meant we didn't need to queue- we could go straight in. Would recommend doing this prior to visiting if you can.
In the heavens. Absolutely fantastic experience. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour which was full of wonder and class. Very educational and price was just right.

Amazing views - on a clear day!. This gives amazing views of NY - as far as the eye can see. Really well organised (the lift going up gives a visual history of NY - which is a nice touch). Make sure to book

Amazing. Bought tickets ahead of time and was scheduled for 5:15 visit, but arrived at 3:15 and they let us right in. Zero line to wait in. We walked straight in and got on the elevator to the top. The views were unbelievable and I would do this again, maybe at night next time just to see the city lights.

Great experience. My party of 3, including my 6-year-old son, had a fantastic time visiting the top of the Freedom Tower. Being originally from NY but now residing in Miami, it was a very special visit. The views were spectacular. The surrounding Ground Zero area is also something special to see. We had a great time and will likely return to the top in a couple of years.

Memorable visit!. Beautiful! Came here on an 8th grade class trip and both the kids and the chaperones enjoyed it. Definitely worth the visit if you are in town. Wish we had more time to see the 911 Memorial and Museum and check out the Transportation hub outside. This place did not disappoint.

Beautiful. Go with someone who knows the city or rent the iPad . Beautiful. Go with someone who knows the city or rent the iPad. Visit "The buzz" talk, fun and interesting. Very commercial place, constantly selling stuff, pics, food, iPad, merchandise.

Great views . Out of the towers we visited I thought this was the best one the views are fantastic you can see for miles great restaurant on top floor with great views while you eat it does get very busy but we'll worth a visit

Wonderful. We have visited many tall buildings throughout the world and this one surprisingly surpassed them all. The tall 2-story Windows, the vast space to walk around, the 360 degree views and the relaxed atmosphere were pretty awesome. The elevator ride was most enjoyable although very brief. We saw pictures of N Y as it was seen over time but it all happened too quickly. The downside was the hard sell of the guides to pay $15 to use the iPad with explanations and details of the history of various NY buildings and monuments. But if one is not familiar with NY one might benefit more from using it than we did. Food available for purchase. Price a bit steep but worth it.

Spectacular Views. We visited during the week and it was easy to buy the tickets and get to the top. Their management of crowds is not the best. We had to move around and watch some really not very useful presentations. The views are incredible and worth the visit.

AWESOME. This was such an easy tour. Everything from security to the guides were amazing. GREAT staff!!! Every question was answered. There were a lot of people there, but the way they set things up, thing moved fast and simple. THIS is a must see.

Amazing view. On holiday with friends we had been to the Empire State building during the day and Top of the Rock at night. However One World Observatory was recommended by an agent from Attractions Ticket Direct prior to our holiday.We absolutely loved it.I think we were lucky as we went at 4.30pm and there were only approx 6 people in front of us buying tickets.The lift experience is amazing and the view from the top far exceeded our expectations.We packed a lot into our 5 days in New York, but this was definitely one of the highlights.
Stunning!. Visiting the One World Observatory was amazing! It might be a little expensive, but it will be worth it if you like and appreciate amazing views like this one.

If your not going here, don't go to NYC.. Nothing embodies the spirit of NYC like this building. Everything it stands for, the spirit it represents, the glamour and glitz of the views and the theatre are amazing.The lift ride to the top is absolutely stunning. It shows a timeline of how NYC has evolved over the years and some how they have managed to tastefully build in it all in to the 42 seconds that it takes to reach the top.Next you are treated to a 3 minute presentation on what you are about to see and all NYC holds. Next the presentation screen lift and the views you see are enough to send a tingle down your back.This is an absolute must for everyone New Yorkers and tourist even if you see it only once. I went twice.

Spectacular views. Access was easy on Saturday with short lines and little wait. Tickets bought at the entrance without much problem no previous online or other type of purchases. The Hollywood type production on arrival to the top is overwhelming, overdone. People are corralled in and nowhere to go. Finally once in the actual viewing floor it is spectacular. No other way to see Manhattan other than the helicopter tour.
great views. Go on a clear day and you can see so much. It wasn't too crowded either so you could take your time. We had a beer at the top, a bit pricy but you pay for the views.

Unbelievable views. We attempted to go up the Observatory before when there was no visibility so we were delighted that the sun finally came out on our last day and we took the opportunity to rush to the Financial District to go up. We were really pressed for time and there is a lot of steps before you finally get up there. It was incredibly busy but not really surprising as it was the first sunny day in a week! We were able to bypass on of the final stages so we could get to the windows..wow, what can i say- it was spectacular and definitely worth going. It was a shame that we had to rush round but I'm so glad we made it. You can literally see for miles and miles and it is hard to believe that what you are seeing is real and not a postcard (sounds crazy I know but I had to pinch myself as it felt so unreal!). The queues to get down were EPIC but as we were in a rush to get to the airport the staff let us skip quit a lot of it (thank you- we made it in time!). One staff member said that they have between 10-12 thousand people a day visiting so don't be surprised for a wait. Definitely go see :)

Dinner & Sunset. This was the best evening of our 5 night stay in NYC. The whole experience was fantastic & the dinner we had was excellent. The staff were so helpful & courteous. The view is fabulous & also an amazing tribute to those that lost their lives on 9/11. I would recommend this experience to anyone.
Manhattan at a glance. Good views, but it's expensive and you have to wait long queues. Don't try to go up with your camera tripod, they are not allowed.

Stunning!!!!. So worth it....even the restaurants...the views, the presentation, and the atmosphere. My only complaint is there is too much talking from the presentation about the boroughs. While that is a good idea and important, it would be nice if it could be more of a reflection space--especially for NY residents who want to remember 9-11 in a reflective way.

School trip- unimpressed . While the view is outstanding, the interaction with students is minimal and there is no explanation of what you are looking at unless you are willing to pay extra for an interactive iPad. The fountains outside, which are free, are a better remembrance of the day.

Go early!. After our previous visits to NYC, when this tower was still under construction, we couldn't wait to visit. We went early, right when it opened at 9. Which I recommend, there were no lines, and you are ahead of the crowds.The elevator is awesome, you can see a beautiful animation of NYC.And then, the view. It's amazing, breathtaking. You can walk around 360 degr., so you can see the statue of liberty, Hudson, uptown (Empire St. Bldg., Times Sq.), the bridges, Brooklyn, Staten Island, all, etc.The pictures didn't came out that great because of the reflective windows.You can take all the time you want.We went around, enjoyed the view. And during our stay, it became more and more crowded every minute.It's quite expensive (as I remember about $ 32), but it's worth it.So: go early on a clear day, and enjoy.

Expensive but worth it. It's worthwhile booking online through Viator before you go as the queues for tickets are really quite long. The experience was amazing, even the lift up is really quite something! Amazing views of the whole of Manhattan very different experience to the Empire State as you view from inside not out.

Great views with interesting lift ride and short video show.. The view from the top is brilliant, albeit similar to the Empire State just a different viewpoint. The difference for me is the great lift ride where the walls of the lift show the changes in the area over the years. We visited on a very clear day and the final video at the top is very well executed. I'll not spoil the surprise but I was impressed by the video end. This is expensive to visit imho but as a one off its worth it. We picked a quiet time to go and there were no queues so that helped considerably.Try it, pick a quiet time to go and I think you'll enjoy the experience.

ONE is the new one. Many years ago with our wines on the 'Windows on the World' wine list we had a very late dinner looking out on the city of New York.On my return visit this month, and having an afternoon to enjoy this fascinating city, up I went to the 101 floor of the new World Trade Center.The restaurant is designed to capture the amazing views in every directions.Very touristy as a first impression but if ever in New York a great place to have a meal.30 bucks to the top but worth every cent.
Worth it. Amazing views, I did it late evening and think think this is the best time for it..spectacular..although expensive(more than 30usd)..

Loved it! Must do!. The elevator ride up is a wonderful experience. Try to get in an elevator with as few people as possible and face the screens with your back to the elevator doors. The walls are screens that show New York City progressing through time. The higher you go the more the city develops. We did this attraction twice on our visit to New York and the first time we were there when it opened to avoid the crowds. The send time we were there in the early evening on a Friday and there was STILL no line! It was an overcast day the second time so maybe that is why the crowds stayed away.We purchased the use of the ipad the first time up and DID NOT LIKE IT. What a waste of $15. This only shows you a few select buildings. Most of them are buildings you probably know... ie. Empire State and Chrystler Building. What you need to do is find one of the employees and ask questions about the city. They know a lot more. Or just use google. The iPad rental was a waste. We also declined to take a green screen photo. The views are so great up there and it is a special building in NYC. It is neat to see the old world trade center building sites (memorial) from above as well. Go when you can spend some time and look for your favorite from the observation deck. We loved it!
Amazing Views. Had an amazing time with children watching out over New York skyline. We were as high as the helicopter rides. Usual gift shops but had a great time. Cocktails not bad too.

Great views of the city!. Tip to skip the long lines: get there very early! The elevator trip to the top was awesome as well as the views of the city. Would definitely go again if we visit the city again.

Breathtaking views. This is pretty expensive, but it is well organised attraction. Once in the elevator, you are treated to a video as you ascend depicting the changing face of Manhattan from it's inception to now. You are then treated to projected show of the city with people bustling around Manhattan. The wall then lifts to reveal a breathtaking view of the city. You can hire a handy little gadget that helps you identify all the parts of the city and gives you a brief history of major landmarks. I think this is great even if you think you know this city. Seeing things from this height can be disorienting and it's great to be able to know what you're looking at.The views are amazing and it's hard not to be a little emotional about the destruction of the twin towers that used to be so close by. They call it the Freedom Tower and it seems an entirely fitting epithet.

Stunning sunset views from the top of the World. The tag line of this new NYC attraction is 'See Forever' - and they aren't far wrong. Get yourself up to the top of the new 1 World Trade Center and enjoy the best views that I could possibly imagine experiencing, anywhere.The elevator ride is an attraction in itself, as the lift ascends to the 100th floor you are treated to a 360 degree panorama of New York City as it has evolved through history. You get to the top and are ushered into an auditorium for a sensational 2 minute show that will heighten the senses... And has a real 'wow' factor at the end, although I won't spoil the surprise!The views from the observatory are just incredible. You can see for miles over Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, New Jersey, through the Hudson Bay and out to the coast and beyond. Visit on a clear sunny day and it will blow your mind. Or do what I did and visit at sunset and watch night fall across the city. It's truly moving.I'd recommend visiting the restaurant too, the cocktails are to die for and perfect to accompany the view.This place is truly special and well worth the $32 (or $37 at peak sunset time). Don't miss out on this one.

A good one time visit. The best part about the One World Observatory is the the elevator ride up and down and how it shows NYC changing over the years. Once you reach up, it is like on top of any other high rise and you can see the city as well as NJ.

Must visit place. One World Observatory is located on top floor of World Trade Center. World Trade center building is known as one world center which is newly built tower after 9/11 incident. New building built with amazing architecture view. There is 9/11 memorial and museum located at ground floor. This building main tourist attraction.

Great view and moving experience. We were worried about the line based on some reviews, but we didn't wait long at all. We went around 11:30 on a Thursday and we waited just a bit outside to get in to purchase tickets and then the only other wait was extremely short to go to the elevators. The view was outstanding and the drinks at the bar were VERY good.

A must see for the best view in new york. such a beautiful building and defiant in its height. 1776 feet tall to correspond with the year America got its independence. was surprised at how quick the queue went down. only took 35 minutes to get from the front door to the top. what a view, can see for miles in every direction.

Literally took our breathaway!!!. We didn't even know this experience existed! I stumbled upon it when looking at other towers in New York and Im so glad I did! The most breathtaking views we have ever seen, we love visiting tall buildings whenever we go on holiday and this is definitely our favourite! the bar was also great we had some lovely cocktails. A must see...GO AT SUNSET!!!

Definitely a must see in New York!. Even though there are other observatories in New York this is by far the best one!! It is the tallest and you get a 360 degree view of Manhatten along with New Jersey, Brooklyn, Queens and the Statue of Liberty! Just the elevator ride up and down is pretty amazing and unlike the other towers. It is pretty cool to say that you were in the 4th tallest building in the WORLD!!!!! I would definitely recommend this to everyone!
Impressive. Very impressive, absolute must see. Avoid weekends! Try to be there before 10 AM to avoid lines and too busy crowds.
not worth spending money. not worth the price of admission, Views are nice and if there were not charge it might be worth 5-10 minutes. Nothing special, many better attractions in NYC
View at the top!. It was well worth the queuing for the view once you get to the top! Very well organised! Just make sure that the visibility on the day you go up the tower is good

Freedom Tower. Didn't' manage to get up the tower but it looks awesome, we got up similar towers in Chicago and the views are wonderful as long as heights don't scare you!! Would go here instead of the Empire State Building.

Highlight of my trip to NYC!. I'd already done Rockefeller and Empire states and had bad experiences, so went into this a little apprehensive but had a great time.The queues and getting in were well organised and plenty to watch whilst waiting to go up. And a great and uplifting display before you go into the observatory. And once at the top the views are magnificent - you can see for 24 miles they say, all round. There were a lot of people but it didn't feel as crowded as the other 2 sites I mentioned, the gift shop has interesting (although pricey) bits in it. Loved it, would certainly recommend over the other sites.

amazing view. Amazing 360 degrees view of the city and the neighborhood. Before you can actually come to enjoy the view you have to go through an "amusement park-like" path with different shows only meant to sell you a 15 dollars application. The bar/restaurant is a nice place to sit down and enjoy the view though a bit expensive. Suggestion: buy the entrance tickets in advance to skip the quite long line

Must see. The elevator ride up and down were amazing. We went on very cloudy day but enjoyed the tower restaurant had lunch and went back down. If you went to the old towers you owe it to yourself to see the new ones.

High and Mighty Again: A Welcome Attraction. No question that the observatory is already a welcome standard attraction. But like many attractions in this great city, it is overpriced. The view to the north is greatly diminished by midtown's towering architecture. The Windows could use some cleaning, and bring your pension if you want to purchase gifts and mementos at the expensive gift shop.
Amazing views. This was a an interesting building to visit, it had a great introduction to when you first arrive to the top and the staff are very informative, awesome views.

TOP. The most amazing view from New York skyline. If you get your ticket in advance you can go straight inside. They also sell tickets in the line outside. The super-fast elevators show a projection of Manhattan's development from the beginning of all to the 21st century whilst take you up tp the 102nd floor in less than 60 seconds!!!. Besides, being in a place where one of the twin towers were is amazing.

Goosebumps. This tour was very well done. I can't even describe the elevator ride to the top! And the view from the top is amazing! Such a surreal feeling to be here. sobering. Hard when the memory of what happened here hits and you see it first hand. just WOW

Out of this world !. Words cannot describe this tour !From going up in the lift to getting out it was just fantastic...I'm not going to say too much, but have your video camera going when getting in the lift & also after the little talk once you get out the lift & of course when your going round as the views are just out of this world !Have your video going again when going down in the lift also...This is a must see when in NYC !

The best view and the best experience!. It's the best view, but it's not only about the view. The experience starts as you enter the elevator. Get your camera ready... :)tip: book it in the internet, you will avoid big queues. Get your camera ready as you go up and down on the elevator.
very sad to see this. was really nice what they have done but so sad to see they have a westfield shopping complex being built nearby

Amazing views. The tour was a little over-structured, in my opinion, but I understand why, and they finally let you explore on your own after trying to up-sell you a high-tech viewer tablet that shows you what each building/structure is. The views can't be beat.

The new MUST DO thing to do in NYC. Really was a fantastic experience! I booked online in advance, and whilst this can be quite restrictive if you don't have a fixed itinerary, I would definitely recommend doing this, as the queues to buy a ticket there and then were quite long. We didn't have to queue and went right in. Small wait inside due to security but this is welcomed and expected for obvious reasons. Small tip, start taking a video when you get inside the lift/elevator, the 60 second ride up is awesome and very well informed right from the start. I won't give it away, but I was sorry I hadn't taken a video on the way up. We had a glorious sunny day, and as a result the experience really was breathtaking! You get free wifi for one hour, so do this when you get to the viewing platform so you can update your social media with pics etc. I face-timed my husband in the UK the view so it was handy having the free wifi and he also enjoyed the experience! Excellent attraction and value for money experience.

Worth the time and ticket price.. Took my 10y/o son here on Monday morning. Only a short line with little wait. Remarkable elevator ride to observation platform took about one minute. Declined usual photograph sales pitch, and upsell for interactive Ipad rental, without regrets. Observation deck is completely enclosed with floor to ceiling views in all directions.

Great views from the top. Nice views, just don't go hungry. We had 2 gatorades and 2 donuts from the concessions for a total of $26. No, Im not kidding or exaggerating. I imagine the restaurant up there to be wildly costly too, if this is what concessions are, so I would never bother to try that either.
Breath taking. Breath taking views and great memorial in the museum across the street! Great place to take the family. We got lucky and had clear skies the day we went to the top of the observatory.

Fantastic panoramic view. If you want to get an idea of layout of New York, get a ticket to the One World Observatory. The views of The Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge and all of New York are breath taking. The cost is minimal and worth the experience. The building itself is massive and right next to the 9-11 memorial. Line up moved pretty quick for us but I've heard that's not always the case.

You cant miss it if you are in the city.. You cant miss it. Not only for the awesome views but also to have a different view of the city growth. The whole process is really well organized as well. Almost no line and waiting time.

Excellent view - and great service. Had planned and booked tickets to visit the Observatory way in advance. When we arrived for the scheduled time there was no visibility due to cloudy and rainy weather. Got our tickets changed to the next morning without any problem.Arriving the next morning there was still no visibility, so another change of tickets to the afternoon, again without any problems. Finally got to the Observatory in the afternoon, and had great views across all of the city including Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and New Jersey.

Excellent Attraction - really enjoyed our visit. We visited the One World Observatory and really enjoyed the experience. The views are of course stunning and the whole attraction appears to be well thought out from the entry to the exit experience.We booked on line in advance and had to change our initial booking due to the visibility which was very easy to do and a great idea because obviously the weather cannot be predicted sometimes
Indoor view. I would have rated this higher, but the observatory is inside behind glass. views are great, but outside would be better.

Glad I did this!. My friend and I took a weekend trip to N.Y. and this was something she wanted to do, but I wasn't sure. I'm so glad she talked me into it! Yes, it is just an observatory, but the view is spectacular and they have several interactive display's, including the elevator ride up, which doesn't even feel like it's moving! We also had a very expensive martini in the lounge, but all part of the experience. We bought the senior tickets online ($30)

The best view of Manhattan. It's not often that I am left speechless but our visit to the One World Observatory did it! no spoiler, if you haven't been you need to see it for yourself to get the full effect from the experience!
Great view from the highest point in NY. Obviously great views also with a great bar at the top, ideal for chilling out and soaking up the views. Not bad value at around $30 each

Unparalleled views - not to be missed!. Yes, it can be a bit pricey, but the views from the One World Observatory are not to be missed - definitely worth the price of admission! We skipped right past the line by buying our timed tickets online and then we used our World MasterCard to gain free VIP access, so we also bypassed the line to the elevators and got right on one, straight to the top. If you have a World MasterCard, buy a regular access ticket, preferably in advance online, then go to the guest services area under the escalator with your ticket and World MasterCard for a free VIP upgrade. Then sail past the line and right onto the elevator. At the top, we were treated to the captive sales show for the ipad that shows the NY landmarks. I had read about this in other reviews, so we skipped this sales pitch and went down one floor to the observatory level. The views were unbelievable - from the Statue of Liberty to all the way uptown! Beware though - the later entry times at dusk are more expensive and the tower closes early! We paid for a 7pm admission and were asked to leave promptly at 8pm closing time (April). Had we not had the advance tickets and free VIP upgrade, we may have only had a half hour or less to spend at the observatory. Snacks and souvenirs are available at the top, as is a pricey restaurant, which we skipped after reading the reviews. But we're so glad we didn't skip the Observatory - the view was breathtaking!

Must See. I forget how much it costed us, but it really did not matter. If you are in the city, especially in the Downtown are, you have to take the ride to the top. We learned so much history about the World Trade Center and the building itself is just unbelievable. Also, the highest view in the city. Incredible views and a must see.I highly recommend.
You must do this... We had this on our Free Style pass and were not disappointed! Excellent! I would agree that food and drink there is expensive! It really does take your breath away!
Not worth the money. Yes, the view is great; but they keep trying to sell you add-ons, after you have already shelled out $32 (per person) to ride up the elevator. Not worth the money IMHO.
Amazing Views. Great experience, line moved quickly and the main 101th floor was awesome to experience. Eat at the sit down restuarant. Excellent food and service.

Great view, once you avoid the tourist trappings. Being on a tight schedule, we benefited from the more expensive express passes. Elevator ride up was quick but nothing special if you've been in a large city before. Biggest complaint- once off the elevator you are herded in for a photo shoot and a hand held computer rental pitch. The actual observation deck was on another floor. we couldn't get thee fast enough. Again great views of the harbor, statute of Liberty, the rivers, Brooklyn and up to the Empire State Building. This is definitely a "one and done".
OWO. Great experience, you dont need to go to any other building in NYC, this is the tallest and the technology used gives you a very different experience.

1st time in NYC... One World was on out list! Glad it was!. Wow! We went to ESB earlier that day. That was great too, but the One World was out of this world. We arrived at 6:30pm... and stayed until after 9:00. So got to see day and night. Wow. Lot's of space up there. We tried to get a bar seat, but people were not giving them up. (We wouldn't either if we scored 2.) Gift shop and snack shop were more assessable, although very expensive. I wish there was more seating up there, but still very worth while. Bathrooms are up there too, so you really can hang out for as long as you want.

the best choice for a great view of NYC and multimedia experience. in days of good weather is the best option to have the best view of the island, with several truly amazing interactive multimedia experiences.

A complete show. We thought the price was a little steep for an observatory, but One World Observatory is much more than that. The ride up on the elevator was the beginning of the show. Scenes of New York from its very beginning to current times were shown on the elevator walls, very informative. Next, you stand in front of a wall illustrating various aspects of New York life. At the end, the wall rises and you're looking out through the Observatory windows. From there, you pass into a passageway where someone takes your picture. Then, you can wander around to take in the view in all directions. I-pads are available for rent which provide additional information. Naturally, there's a gift shop (my wife bought some refrigerator magnets).The elevator ride down also shows current surrounding views on the walls. At the bottom, you can buy your picture showing One World Trade center as a background (choice of day or night views or both).Allow at least an hour to visit. They ask you to be there 15 minutes before your scheduled visit. Two suggestions: 1. Buy your tickets in advance online, 2. Go early to avoid the crowds (we went at 10:00 AM on a Wednesday and had tickets for the Museum at 11:15 AM, the timing was perfect).

Amazing Observatory!!. Very cool observatory with an entire show before you go up, telling the history and construction of the building and a lots of facts that are visualized. When you're finally upstairs, the view is amazing! Almost like from the plane when you fly into the city. They rent out iPads that have an interactive map of the city noting all the sights and buildings, telling a little bit about them and how it developed accompanied by little video clips.

Great fun but a little pricey. Great attraction to kill a few hours and seemed to be well managed. A bit on the expensive side for entrance fees and food and drink whilst you are in but unfortunately it seems that is the way the industry is going. Great views from the top of you're lucky enough to visit on a clear day.

fantastic. this place is a must for all ages the views alround are great could spend couple of hours up here,and you meet a lot of nationalities her looking in awe at the view make sure its a clear dayto see everything guides are there to tell different information about many land marks well worth the entrance fee book in advance to save queing and going in the enormous lift in 2 seconds up to the the viewing stations is brilliant

Phenomenal Views. The view is phenomenal, and you can see some amazing NYC landmarks (Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, City Hall, Brooklyn Bridge, etc). Granted it does need to be a nice day out. I lucked out when I went this weekend; it was raining in the morning, but when we went up in the evening it was clear. We went on a Saturday evening, so I'd expect it would have been extremely crowded. Getting tickets online was a breeze. We arrive early. The security line and the line to the elevator moved pretty quickly. Compared to the Empire State Building it was lightning speed. The elevator was fast and the graphics were amazing. I the presentation before getting to the observation deck was good as well. The observation deck is great! (Again the weather probably impacts this quite a bit). But for a Saturday evening, it didn't feel crowded. The city pulse presentations were fun to catch snip-its of. The whole venue is clean and orderly.The only negative is similar to what others have mentioned about pricing. I think the price to go up is decent; however, food and pictures are expensive as well.
A must. The top deck is by far one of the must do's in NYC. It is designed to be an experience and it delivers!

Nice view if you are lucky on the day but expensive. The view from here would be spectacular if you are lucky enough to get a perfectly clear day. But by the time you get to the top and get through the presentations the weather can change and view gone. with no queue it took over 20 min to get to the viewing platform. The price is expensive and food and drinks at the top are exceptionally dear. While it was a great view I think given the option I would go up Rockefeller or empire state building instead.

Better than the empire state building. . My wife and I went to see the One World Trade Centre without realising it was possible for the public to ascend it. It was quite expensive but not so expensive to put us off so we went up to the One World Observatory. There were no lines or waiting since it wasn't very busy which probably made the experience a little better. The elevator ride shows the history of the changing New York skyline from its founding to present day. Once at the top, although there is not an outside observation deck you are met with stunning panoramas of the city.

Pricey drinks but with great weather the views are magnificent. Time to philosophise .. We wandered to the area and saw the queues looked short so jumped in. However the clever queue management hides the many short queues but we were processed efficiently. Got to the top about 3.30pm. Thought the sales pitch about purchasing an iPad which shows panorama for $15 unnecessary as it is difficult to proceed until you hear it. We left ours behind after 10 minutes. The views are incredible. The helicopters flying below you , the ships plying their trade, the city and all its angles and streets like a completed jig saw . Over in the distance the bridges that have connected this incredible City and you can see way beyond the commutable distances for the folks that keep the city going. It's a wonderful time to take stock of humanity. Then up for a beer at sky high prices. Staff friendly and efficient. Beer good. Sunset upon us , more philosophical discussion as the city lights power up. A great afternoon had with my son. A great place to take your late teen or young adult and see how they see the world and their roles in it. It cannot fail to impress.

Must see!. Currently this is the _best_ Observatory in New York City! I would recommend a morning visit to this one, and maybe an evening visit to the Rock. This was truly unespected, spectacular and wonderful! The staff are great and helpful, and there is barely any queue on the way up or down. You can esily spend here 1-2 hours, plenty of opportunity to widen your knowledge and take photographs.

Disappointed at OWO. We understood weather wasn't favourable for a good view of the city but expected more of an overall experience regarding 911 and the building of the freedom tower. They offered us iPads to supplement the obscured view for a charge. Albeit discounted but it felt like they were trying to make money at every turn. The minimal amount of info provided was lame. No brochures offered. The museum was fantastic but the OWO was a waste of money! Go for purely the view. That's all you will get.

Worth a visit but a bit on the expensive side. I think my title says it all. Some amazing views, assuming the visibility is good, they gave us a rain check for the next day ....
