But no refunds even if you can't make another day ... It's a great way to see the city, not something I'd feel the urge to do more than once.
Awesome views. Probably my favourite of all the tall buildings. Superb views. It is location, location, location. Great shop and bar. Admin to get in is a bit disappointing.
The new York best view. The highest skyscraper of new York City it's an a best architecture so I recommend you this view you have a best views you can see the top of the Rock the chrysler building

Beautiful views but quite pricey . The views are astonishing, no more to add there. Now, I find $35 to be quite expensive. What I also liked is that there wasn't a lot of people as it usually occurs with such tourist attractions. It was the afternoon on a Wednesday so maybe that helped. Or maybe it's because of the price! ;)

Best Observatory of NYC. Climb up to the best views of NYC, be ready with your video cam in the elevator to record the trip to the top, you'll see the rise of NYC over time. And once you are at the top, enjoy the teaser video and then be ready for the creative surprise. Enjoy the views with the wide windows and see all of NYC up north and down south even the statue of liberty and the bridges including Brooklyn Bridge.If you are a fan of pics, it's one of the best spots.Simply amazing.

Well worth a visit at a reasonable entry price. Stunning views of all parts on New York City from this Obsevatory. Give yourself time to listen to the talks from locals as you walk around all points of the compass.

High Rise Quick Rise. An easy entry with pre-purchased tickets, airport type security before a really great experience in the super fast lift that come to life before your very eyes! That said for an extremely fast ride there was sinking feeling in the pit of your stomach.A nice greeting up top and a great surprise when the 'world' opens up in front of you.Then the sales pitch with the chance to use an iPad at the cost of $15 to show you what all the sights are. Purchased one and found it very useful if a little heavy.The views are quite spectacular and the obvious 360 degree view of New York City and surrounding areas certainly keep the interest alive for a fair amount of time.The usual 'attraction shop' with extremely overpriced merchandise.The eatery was slightly confusing and pricey and the food had to be eaten standing up!A good attraction for all the family.

Amazing experience!. I went there early in the morning, around 9am and 9:30am, and there were no lines at all. I bought the ticket and went directly inside. You walk through halls with videos and information about the building. You go into an elevator, where the entire elevator becomes a video (almost looks 3D ) showing how NYC has changed over the years. I loved it! When you reach the top (going up fells like a few seconds), the line everyone facing the windows and they show another video and suddenly the view is right in front of you! The transition from the video to the view is amazing! For $15 you can rent like an Ipad (you can use one for an entire group, itdoesnt have to be individually) that tells you exactly what you are looking at. I would say it's completely worth it. I've been to the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock and definitely the views here are incredible. It feels less crowded (at least when I was there) and everyone will have a spot to sit and enjoy the view. They have like a coffee shop up there, I wasn't able to go in but I'm sure that enjoying a cup of coffee with those views in front is a great way to start the day.Worth going with the entire family. Everyone will enjoy it!

Great 360 degree view. Great 360 degree view of NYC! Very sobering experience looking down at the 9/11 memorial from the One World Observatory. I'm glad we did this observatory - beautiful place with lots of meaning to the city and to everyone

Worth a trip. The observatory is very well designed and spacious, and the view is very good. There are presentations and people to answer your questions. I prefer the view from mid-town (Empire State, Rockefeller Center) so you can see Central Park and both directions of the City, but I wanted to see One World Trade, and I'm glad I did. I paid extra for expedited entry, which turned out to be a waste of money, since there was no line when I went (10:00 a.m. on a Sunday in March). It's probably worth it in the summer. If you're visiting Ground Zero, which I highly recommend, it's worth a trip to the observatory.
Probably best view of NY. Visited in may. Raining and windy weather but you can still see all New York without pressure. Buy online the family of 4 pack and you get a better deal.

You must do this in NY! it is the most incredible experience in NYC. So This is a must do in NYC! Even if you only have a few hours free time do this! We bought the VIP pass- best extra $36 dollars I ever spent. We avoided the hours long lines and went right up through security and to the top in Appx. 18 minutes. Once up there they have an iPad tour we did not do this - I live local so I was the tour lol. You must bring your selfie stick and "the good cameras" iPhone is ok but our pics from the Canon Rebel rock! it's spectacular photo op. A photographers dream at sunset. Dress nice, do your hair lol and take lots of memorable pics- this may be the family photo of a lifetime! The views are that breathtaking! Yes you shake your head yes when the goose bumps set in. :) There is a cafe and gift shop we loved both. 1 tip make a reservation at the restaurant / bar well in advance for the sunset viewing. We did not and will next time. Sunset was so special we all felt like the Bob Marley "one love" up there during this time. Everyone from around the world smiled and traded turns helping take photos. You bond up there together it's magical and you will know I'm saying when you are up there overlooking the greatest city on earth! Go do it! It's incredible!

A must-see place in New York!!. There are many viewpoints/observatories in NY usually on the top floor of the skyscrapers but One World Observatory is probably the best! You have to pay 32$ as an entrance fee but it is definitely worth it. It is not just an observatory, it is an amazing experience! The experience starts as you enter the elevators that are surrounded by screens showing the development of the city through the years. When you reach the floor of the observatory you get to see an astounding video wall presentation of the city which then retreats and reveals the amazing views. You get to see the whole of Manhattan from the highest point and from a 360 degree perspective. It was worth every dollar. Don't miss it if you visit NY!
Amazing. The elevator experience and the way this observatory is set out is fantastic. I'm so glad I did it. It was an absolutely perfect day and the view was spectacular.

Must visit. I was afraid about the long lines but there was no lines for a visit at 4:00 pm on a Wednesday visit. Amazing atraction in Ny mainly if you shop at Century 21 before your visit to WTC and receive a discount coupon

Very Good Experience!. The only thing keeping this from being Excellent in my book is the price. It just seems really high, but it was quite an experience.This was one of the things left on my husband's list of "touristy to-dos" left over from our last NYC visit as it opened a few months after we were last there. We saved it for our last day "if we had time" since we have already done Empire State and Top of the Rock on other visits. Anyway, we had time mid-afternoon on the Friday we were there, so we went to see how the line was. We pretty much never stopped walking until we reached the elevators. Walked right up to the ticket counter, went through security, and went on to the elevators in less than 5 minutes. The views were spectacular and all of the staff working were very friendly. We spent over an hour walking around the top, seeing what we could from the different vantage points. My husband was able to get some excellent pictures, and we really enjoyed out visit.Overall, it was a great experience and something you should definitely do if you have the couple of hours to spend in NYC.

Meh. Alway Trying to Sell You Something. We bought tickets for a Monday since you can get a discount if you pay with a MasterCard, and even then it's not inexpensive. This tour is not on any NYC pass I have seen. The elevator going up was cool - the walls are video screens showing how the NYC skyline has changed over the years. The elevator is also very fast and made my ears pop from the altitude. The doors open to a spectacular view of the skyline, but then curtains close almost immediately and you are corralled to an area where employees try to upsell you an ipad rental with a skyline app. I think it was an extra $15. Then you are ushered through to get your picture taken (extra charge). After that, you have to walk past the restaurant to get to the other side of the observatory and see the view. The gift shop took up about 1/4 of the observatory and sold just ok items at inflated prices. There was an attendant at each end of the deck with video screens talking about the building and NYC in general, but there were only one or two small benches to sit and listen. I think it would have been nice to listen to them if there were more places to sit. The only other places to sit were in the actual window wells. The views were fantastic if you could get to a window - people were shoving and pushing to get in the front. My dh got knocked over by someone trying to get through and almost took out the video screens used by the attendants. The number of people using the skyline as a backdrop for their selfie photo shoots was hilarious. We bought a magnet as a souvenir, and the cashier said it was not a very crowded day so I would hate to see it when they are busy. The elevator on the ride down shows sunset over the city. I got a little queasy on the way down and I'm not usually a motion sickness person. I guess in all One World Observatory is ok. It's a beautiful building with a lot of emotional ties to it, and I don't want to be disrespectful for what it stands for. I just feel the whole experience was very commercialized and we were constantly being pushed to buy something. I wish I could've went to the top of the Rock or Empire State Building to see if the experience was any different.
The top of New York . Very impressive, starting from the interactive elevator. I have never seen something like this. A must to see in New York. Ticket cost 40$

Nice views but WHY are there windows everywhere??. You'd think that the people who were designing a rooftop observation deck would keep in mind the main reason people want to visit such a thing (apart from enjoying the view): TO TAKE PICTURESWell apparently that was not something they thought would be importantThe observatory is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows, meaning you, the people behind you, the heating systems on the floor and everything else will REFLECT in your photos. Very annoyingOf course the view itself is still magnificent. And I loved the way they surprise you after viewing a video wall…. (I won't spoil it for ya)The elevator ride is also nicely done, but I still don't get the glass. Big disappointment.We bought fast pass tickets for Saturday Morning 9:30 but that was not necessary at all at that time.
Fabulous. Even for us who are terrified of heights this exhibit is wonderful. We were lucky to find a sunny day. A great way to experience the city.
Amazing Sky High Views of NYC. The top of this building gives such beautiful and breathing taking views! Windows surround you which offer endless photo opportunities! Amazing experience!
Fantastic. Everything about this experience is fantastic. Super organized, polished and professional. I do not want to give away any surprises but wow. Rent the Ipad

Nicely done!. This was a great visit on an overcast day which kept the crowds down (mid-week). The lines and pass-through is well-orchestrated. Buy your tickets outside, go downstairs through security. Get in line to the elevators (plenty to look at to keep you amused). The elevator ride is very engaging (I won't spoil it). You exit and are ushered into a theater where you watch a brief and excellent NYC video with a surprise at the end (I won't tell that either!). You are then moved to an area where you can rent ipads to get an interactive view from the top. (I skipped it and didn't get the price). You them move to the observatory and all I can say is what a view! Just wonderful. Lots to do and see at the top. Very worth the $32 ticket price. My only regret is that it wasn't open for night viewing- that starts tomorrow when I head home! Bummer. I will return.
Great Experience!. We loved the One World Observatory! It's so worth it to spend the money and visit! It's so emotional, we were all in tears at one point! To me, it's got the best view of NYC!

Incredible - wow from the go!. Totally the best skyscraper view and 'different' experience ever. Over 100 stories in 30 seconds in only 1 lift with a brilliant 3D elevator simulated view. Awesome opening program with a WOW surprise at end. Have your cameras/phones at the ready!! Wonderful 360 degree enclosed walkway across and view all the way over you can see all the sites.The Ipad was nifty with the tips and views and tells you what you are looking at if you don't know whats what or where. Clever.Worth the high price of $30! Just maybe not the 10$ for 2 average coffees...

THE best observation deck with the most amazing views - it was beyond our expections.totally recommend a visit.. It was an amazing experience to visit One World Observatory. If you get the chance to do it, please take it. 360 degree view of NYC. Staff extra friendly and don't forget to pick up a souvenir or two from the Gift Shop - so much to choose from...

On Top of the World. Do not want to give anything away.....This was just fabulous...Booked in advance on line no q at all straight through and on up in the super quick lift. So impressive right from entering the lift and up that 100th + floor.

Wow!. Best skyscraper view and experience ever. 100 stories in 30 seconds with 3D elevator simulated view. Great opening program with surprise at end. Wonderful 360 degree enclosed walkway and views. Worth the high price of $30.

Amazing. I've been there in september 2014 and they didnt finish to build it. I came back at september 2015 and at the beginnig I didnt want to get in but my husband convinced me to go in- and i dont regret this! It was breathtaking

Amazing!. If you can only do a few things while in NY make sure this is on your list. The ride up the elevator was interesting then you walk out into a hall way. A film starts playing that gives you scenes of NY. Suddenly the panels in front of you begin to move out of the way and the skyline of NY is reveled. It was amazing.The view is stunning on a clear day. There is a sit down restaurant there but it is pricey. You're paying for the view.Make sure you visit this attraction. It's worth it!

More than one view!. Having enjoyed the observation deck, Windows on the World and Cellar in the Sky many times before 9/11, it was an emotional experience to visit the One World Observatory. Commercialized as it is, the views are so spectacular, day and night!We especially enjoyed Uptown Martinis at the One Mix bar at the top where we watched a beautiful sunset. Best to book tickets ahead online. No waiting that way and so easy to do!

Visiting New York, this is a must do!. We had just had an emotional morning on the 9-11 Walking Tour and Museum which was incredible but so sad and then in the afternoon the "One World Observatory" which was brilliant for all the right reasons, great organisation of the queue, friendly staff, and an amazing panoramic view over New York from the 101st Floor whilst enjoying a drink and the souvenir shop. My only slight criticism is that you had to drink standing up leaning on tables, no seats, but I suppose they like to keep the people moving. Recommended to all, confident you will be delighted.

On a clear day, you can see forever. We were not there on a particularly clear day, but we could almost see forever. How can you go to NYC and not do this at least once? There are a few levels of ticket options depending on your time and money, so read those carefully. We were worried about signing up for tickets before we knew the weather forecast so we ended up paying a little more but it worked best for us. I thought i would be nervous for the elevator ride, but they have a video to watch on all the walls of the elevator so the only way you even know you're moving is by your ears popping. Very smooth, and very cool. Yes, the view is amazing!! Beautiful view, beautiful city.

Go early!. Amazing views and experiance. Cannot reccomend enough getting there early. Due to jet lag we arrived at the observatory early at 9am, just as it opened. It was a clear blue saturday morning so would have been prime viewing time. We didnt queue at all and went straight through security up. When we came back down 45 mins later there was already big queues, so absolutly go early!

Unbelievable way to spend a 30th birthday. Absolutely wonderful experience, you have to see it to believe it yourself. The view are spectacular. We were lucky enough that the sun was shining and the views were as far as the eye could see , as they advertise it "see forever"Everything about the few hours I spent there was superb, the speedy security checks, the very interesting elevator ride, the huge video wall with a great surprise at the end. And the icing on the cake, the observatory, I enjoyed a beer whilst my other half enjoyed a cold wine celebrating her 30th birthday, something she wont forget in a hurry.Wonderful

Amazing Views! Midweek at sunset no lines!. We were visiting NYC for college tours and decided at the last minute on a Thurs night to check out the observatory at One World Trade Center. It was worth it for sure!Amazing views, great bar and excellent experience. I have also gone to the museum and would recommend both!

Must go. If you go to NYC you must go to the top of 1WTC, breathtaking views and the overall experience is unique.Try to stop before getting to the elevators, and watch the videos.Then enjoy the 1 minute ride to the top, and finally browse the sky from the windows

Best View of NYC. By far the best location to observe stunning views of NYC both during the day and at night! The wait was short and the staff was very informative. Definitely a must-see for any visitor to New York!

Α magnificent achievement of engineering. The tallest building in the western hemisphere that was build near ''ground zero'' , the place that Twin towers were. It's a sign of what the human being can achieve nowdays . Don't miss the chance getting in the observatory at the 102th floor with the superfast elevators ( it takes you up ther in only 48 seconds) and take some photos of NYC from its tallest point .

Brilliant experience . Surely the best views in New York. Spectacular video and reveal and amazing 360 degree views. We liked the two demonstrators explaining about what was where. Didn't need the extra sale attempt of the iPad with the funky zoom/info.Cannot recommend this enough.

Wow! Just Wow!. From the elevators and the ride to the top to the view this is a great addition to your NYC itinerary. Set high above go when the skies are clear as you will see 3 states and amazing views of NYC and all of its glory!

A tour of the clouds.. This offers a great view on New York City and New Jersey. It costs $35 dollars but it you want pictures above New York, its worth it. Just don't go on a rainy or low cloud day. Usually they will let you know if the visibility is poor as they did with me. I want back the next day and it was beautiful. There is food and drink available, a little on the high end but worth a try with someone special.

See Everything!. This was one of the highlights of my trip. I felt in awe as I saw the view as I was going up the elevator. Everywhere you could see familiar places. As the motto of the One World Observatory is "See everything", you could literally almost see everything that surrounds New York. This is worth the visit because of its spectacular view.

Great view, poor experience. Positives: wonderful elevator to the top. Really liked the depiction of Manhattan over the last two hundred years. Fabulous views. Worth it.Negatives: aggressively commercial atmosphere, especially in light of the quiet, sensitive atmosphere of the 9/11 Memorial and Museum next door. Photos for all....to buy. Tshirts and souvenirs galore. Our sit down lunch at the fancier restaurant was ruined by the constant "pitch" of the employees on the lower level micd' up to interact with the visitors. Too loud to enjoy lunch.Go once for the view. Never go back.

What a jewel! They did this one right.. The wait on a Friday was not very long. The facility is amazing. Employees were friendly & entertaining while you wait. It did remind me of Disney World with the way you are lead into one room & you think you're there but there is another door you go through to another room. Then the tease! They open the curtain only to quickly close it. Take your time in the observatory. No one rushes you out. There is a restaurant & bar a floor above the observation deck. It's a fun place to share remembrances. It is an uplifting experience.

Wonderful Experience!. My husband and I went to NYC for the weekend to celebrate my birthday. My husband really wanted to go to One World Observatory. One of the days we were there, they offered Summit tickets for a minor increase in price. Best purchase ever! We were treated like royalty. Shuttled up back hallways to the Summit. Summit was empty except for the bartenders and security. The entire time we were there, I only saw 4 other visitors on the Summit. The lower levels were packed because it was a Saturday and a beautiful sunny day. Great views, and great experience!

Best views in New York. 4 of us booked tickets for this & it's definitely worth doing. We were all impressed. The lift up is amazing & when they pull the blinds up & you get your first glimpse of the views it's amazing. If you're only going to get tickets for one of the tall buildings with views I would recommend this one.

Brilliant experience . We arrived at one world trade around midday, walked straight in, no queues. Bought our tickets and went straight through the security checks and kept on moving, no waiting at any time. In the theatre watching the film footage of New York, we were given a 'sneak peak' which was definitely a 'wow' moment. The 360 views were fantastic, seeing the downtown area, the Brooklyn and the Manhattan bridges in all there glory can not be beaten. Fantastic experience, all staff were lovely and pleasant.
Amazing views!. I was unsure of which attractions to do when visiting New York but I am so glad I did this one. Very little queues an expected price but amazing views. The best in New York!
top of NYC. I love being on top of stuff ;) Had a wonderful experience and definitely worth it for a overall view of NYC

Amazing views amazingly commercialized. We took the tour of the One World Observatory and the views are incredible. It gets high marks for that, but we were less impressed with the hyper-commercialization and upselling during the tour. Buy your tickets online to avoid extra waiting. It will be crowded, but the staff is good at keeping the people moving.

Great experience . Is a great place to go! Iconic place, it remember us that upon of violence and sadness, they grew again making and iconic and outstanding building!! I love what they did when you are in the elevator! And the view is amazing, saddly the day that I went was a rainy day but no matter that the view will always be great!! I enjoy it so much!!

Another highlight to add to a visit to New York. Booked this as part of a family holiday. Cost seemed similar to Empire State and Rockefeller. We went at end of the day intending to hit sunset. Clouds prevented us seeing this but did see the transition between day and night. Would recommend this as a time to visit. We did not queue for any measurable time although I had expected this. The film on the way up was fun but brief. Could have happily seen it for longer or again. The iPad that shows you where everything is did not work as well as advertised and cost extra. We could have eaten here if we had said so from arrival but it did fill before long. They don't make the cafeteria comfortable. We did think this was worth the visit. It doesn't do exactly what Rockefeller does- different part of town and some sites visible from Rockefeller not visible but is higher and some things are better seen

Great choice for birds eye view of Manhatton. We were torn between visiting the Empire State and this. So glad we code this. No queues. An awesome elevator experience with a great view at the top. It was cloudy today so limited viewing but that did not spoil the day. The staff advise you about the weather prior to paying so the choice is yours. All the staff were brilliant. In all a worthwhile trip which I would gladly do again.

Absolutely spectacular. Even though we went up on a cloudy day the views were still wonderful. We got the tickets as part of our Gray Line hop on hop off bus tours, would still have paid to go up just for the experience on the lifts.

Great view of NYC on a clear day. If you want a great 360 degree view of NYC then this is a fun thing to do but that's about all there is to it. There is a restaurant and gift shop but neither looked appealing to us. We paid extra for the sunset ride up. This gives you the flexibility to go up anytime between 4:00 and 7:15 which was nice but I wouldn't pay the extra money for that again. This is one of those things that was fun to do but not something I want to do again.

Beautiful views. The view up there is very nice, it has to be seen!However, they keep the group together in the begining, as soon as we get out the elevator to watch some welcome screen play, but there is not enough room for everybody, so it is kind of annoying.

Has to be done - but disappointing!. One of the must-dos in NYC, but sadly not a great experience. Although the view is impressive, the viewing area is enclosed and visibility is impacted by the glass and reflections. iPads are available to highlight the landmarks visible from the top, but they charge an additional $15 (on top of the entrance fee) after 'making' you listen to what is nothing more than a sales pitch! Cafe is basic too.

Well worth the visit. This was for us a must do activity during our recent trip to New York. This building which has risen out of the 9/11 attack is an amazing memorial to the previous buildings which stood on this site.As you can expect, security is high when entering this building but once you have paid your entrance fee (approx. $30) you are provided with a modern tourist experience. I won't spoil it for you but the elevator ride both up and down the tower is brilliant and you can't fail to be amazed.Once at the viewing deck, the initial presentation and view of lower Manhattan sets the scene. If there is only one criticism, it relates to the visitors rather than to experience itself. Why are people so inconsiderate with respect to other visitors wishing to take in the view and pictures. If you go up the tower, please consider your fellow tourists who like you have probably traveled thousands of miles to take in the views and experience of this great building.

the beginng of the viewing is just WOW. Other than from ESB here you have a wonderful view over the south part of Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, small islands before Manhattan and New Jersey. All five points for the view.The beginning of the journey (when you exit the elevator) is awsome. I will not say, what it is, because I don't want to spoil your surprise. But I can say that I was not the only one in the group saying loud "woooow".We were there on Thursday afternoon with a normal ticket and didn't have to wait at all.The minus point goes for the fact that because of the window it is sometimes difficult to make nice fotos without reflection.I bought the explorer (15 $) but it was not worth the money, unless you really have no idea about the surrounding.
One World Observatory. Fantastic views from the observatory level. No long queues which was a bonus. We spent time in the memorial park too.

Amazing!!!!. This was incredible!
The journey to the top is such a great build up to the view when the doors open, outstandingly breath taking views!

Nice view, bad service, premium cost. I booked a visit to the observatory through the website. Paid extra to skip the lines, yet I had to go through a queue once I got on the top floor. They try every possible sale pitch to squeeze money out of visitors, but with some patience and endurance you can go through and enjoy a 360 degrees view of the city which is really remarkable.

What a view!!!. I had booked priority tickets for the 6 of us, however the queues were not bad so it only took us about 10 minutes. However book up the VIP tickets which was only $20 more each, trust me it is worth it as you are taken to another floor where there is a bar (you have to pay) but hardly any one else their. We were there for around an hour and for most of that time we had the whole floor to ourselves. There was several staff around to explain the various landmarks. Would highly recommend the visit.

Well worth the money. Great views. We payed online before we got to NY. It was $35 and we booked a time to go.The views from the top was amazing. The staff were friendly and we didn't wait in any lines. We didn't get the $20 interactive ipad as we had a New Yorker with us but if your from out of town it may help get extra information at what you are looking at. The ride up in the elevator which shows the growth of New York was a great touch.Definitely worth every cent. we spent about an hour and a half up there.

Worth paying for the tour. The One World Observatory is breath-taking. The views of Manhattan are spectacular. I was doubtful about paying to go in but it was well worth the money!The entire journey to the 360' viewing deck is an experience. You learn about the history of One World - its construction and inspiration. Even the lift is full of information!

Worth every penny - a magnificent attraction!. This is a must-do in New York - the whole experience from start to finish is quite something - it's done really well and the views are probably the best in the whole of New York. On a clear day you can see the curvature of the Earth! It's breath taking, and the experience as a whole is quite moving.

See forever . What a great experience. The elevator ride up is sixty seconds of the history of the formation of New york. The ride down is a flight thru the town. Once at the top you see a quick movie presentation and then decent two fights to the observation deck. 360 degrees of new york. Take your time and find the many major landmarks. Well worth your time and the price of a ticket

Best of the bests of sky high rise observatories in the world. We did not have too much expectations while waiting on the line for going up to the observatory. However, once in the elevator, we were surprised by the large LEDs on the walls of elevator. While you tried to view the videos of new York city, the elevator already took us to the top. It was very quiet. The introduction of the giant LED wall gave us a great introduction of new York city even though we had been the city for many times. The observatory self is also high tech. You can have a ipad giving you detailed description of the buildings, islands. They are full of history and excitements. My son listened every interest point. The weather was perfect with abundant sunshine. You have a much better view of the city than from other high rise points in the city. We got discounts from our hotel. It helped a great discount. The IPAD was one price for two for introductory promotion. The only inconvenience was the restroom. You have to wait if there is a large crowd. This is must visited site of NY.

Still unknown. Amazingly we had heard very little about this before we visited new York, and yet not to be missed. A far better experience than the empire state or the rock. Elevator ride alone is worth the entrance fee. Highly recommended.

Great views. We are from the UK and loved this viewing deck. Amazing views and loved the lift to the top.
Staff move you through quickly very well organised.

Don't miss this. A really stupendous multi-media experience with the best views in the World. This was my first time and I didn't think the experience would beat the view from the twin towers but it did. Go!

What a spectacular view!. The elevator ride up was pretty cool, but the unveiling of the observatory area was amazing. The only complaint I have is I wish the viewing area was outside like the Empire State Building. It really adds to the experience when you are outside in the fresh air at those heights instead of looking through a window. It was still a spectacular view regardless.

A great time!. We got our tickets ahead of time and they said you need to print them out to enter or go to will call. When we got there I asked an employee and she just scanned the barcode on my phone so don't worry about printing your tickets!! The views are amazing! It's the new must do thing in NYC!

You should do it.... While its not overly cheap and its probably worth it - we got lucky and didn't have to wait in line (which I could see making this much more annoying)...at the top, the views are great and the movie is pretty cool. Suggestion to NOT buy the iPad thing they offer you to see what you're looking at - there are so many people with the thing that its pretty annoying and not as useful as it looks. Another suggestion is if you're with 4 people you can go to the website and get the 'family pack' and only pay 25 a ticket, as well as reserve the time ahead of time which is nice.

Over priced. Way too expensive for what is essentially taking an elevator to a high floor to see out across NYC. The views are great but it's very hard to see why it costs $50 per person. And then you're asked to part with another $50 for an interactive gadget that explains what you're seeing as you look out across the city. Also, the best view of Manhattan is at a corner of the building obscured by an information stand whereas the long sides of the building are at an angle to the best view of the lot!

What a view. Being afraid of heights I was very worried about taking this trip up to the 100th+ floor. The elevator ride was quick which was better for me. The staff that greeted us off the elevator were friendly and understood that some people wanted to stand a little further back. Once inside and exploring the skyline, I had 2 different staff members approach me, as I was standing a little further back from the window, and talk to me about the different things I could see along the skyline instead of things people were seeing with their faces pressed against the glass. I eventually walked a little closer up to the window and it is quite an impressive view, even for someone terrified of heights. I suggest if you're afraid of heights to take the trip up and give it a shot. You can stand against the wall and enjoy the impressive skyline without looking straight down at the ground. We did the day time when it was a little cloudy and you can still see 4 different states and all the important landmarks.
Totally Worth it. The views are simply unbelievable- the skyline looks so majestic from here. Probably sure it be better at night time as well!
Sky high buildings!!!. It's amazing to visit one world obsevatory, view from the obsevatory is incredible...u can experience sound part of new York city from here...
Very cool. Elevator rides are fantastic. Views are great. Book ahead of time. The only complaint is that it feels a little removed by being completely enclosed.

Fantastic views Must see. Would put going up to see the views as a must go for any visit to New York City. While tickets are a little pricey this is a engineering marvel with amazing 360 degree views of the New York area. Also have great guides who are very knowledgeable and more than happy to point out the sites.

Extraordinary Venue. No better view exists than this. Right near the Hudson River and Battery Park, the whole of Manhattan opens before you from the 100 and 100th floor windows. Breathtaking! You can stay as long as you want, with 360 degrees of views to behold!

Not worth the price of admission, see below for a better explanation.. This pertains to the Observation Deck ONLY. Sorry to say, but save your money. Do pay your respects at ground level were the 9/11 memorial is, they did a beautiful job with the pools that are in the footprints of the former WTC One and Two, that area which is almost like a park is free. Also try and visit the museum, there is a cost associated with it, but it is done very well, with a lot of tear jerking displays. The Observation deck is completely enclosed and because the huge windows are probably hard to clean, its just doesn't look that great. I recommend going to the Empire State Building for the observation deck alone, it has a much better view of the city.

Simply WOW!!!. The elevator ride to the top may be the highlight as you are left with a surprise when you get there. The ride up shows a virtual 360 image of the skyline being built and the history of the area. Once at the top you have the ability to walk around and see all of the surrounding areas with breathtaking views. While at the top, take advantage of the opportunity to look through the observation "hole" in the floor which allows you to look 100+ stories straight down. Great experience and definitely recommend.

Excellent views. The 60 second elevator ride to the top was incredible. It's shows timeline of the area. The views are awesome and plenty of space to look at everything. There is a restaurant at the top with these incredible views. Everything moved very quickly and easily. It was a very enjoyable experience.

Breathtaking views of the Big Apple!. The Observation Deck is incredibly well done. The views of NY and NJ are amazing! We rented the iPad to use to understand what you are viewing and that helped us enormously - it was well worth the price and two people can easily share one device.

See forever - it felt like it!. Amazing place, great introduction (won't spoil the surprise) and fantastic views. We were lucky and had crystal clear views thanks to great weather. They do try to push the electronic viewers that looked really good but certainly aren't for free! The photo they take is good and useful to get a group shot. Goods in shop are expensive.
Breathtaking panoramic city view. From the life, to the show to the view, all aspects are unique experience. The view from the top is simply wonderful.

The left hand does not know what the right hand is doing. VERY POOR MANAGENENT. Last December I thought I would do the smart thing and book a ticket online. That was the easy part, however, the online booking system did not coordinate with any weather advisories. There was no advanced warning that bad weather was in the offing on the following day for which two tickets were booked for and noway of getting an online refund.Thus when I and my girlfriend showed up the weather was so overcast that many tourists had to line up to get refunds for the time slot and that in turn led to lines that took nearly an hour or so to shrink. When I got to the ticket counter I was refunded but did not get back the full price of the ticket including the processing fee, which I wanted to use on the first available day in early January. So the motto here is don't book online.The following week we came back and purchased two tickets. As it was the beginning of the year the line was very short and were able to go to the top relatively quickly.While the experience is better than that of the Empire State Building, One World is very expensive if you price in souvenirs , food and a visitor's tablet which is somewhat helpful but way over priced.I guess the bottom line here is that One World is fast becoming a tourist trap just like many other attractions here in NYC. Therefore, I would encourage management to think a little more carefully and creatively about the visitor experience starting with ticket purchases and line management. After all no one should have to wait an hour or so in the cold to rebook or get a ticket refund. This should have all been handled online with live customer reps, not to mention weather advisories. C'mon; this is the 21st Century with smart phones, internet and Ipads. MUCH BETTER COMMUNICATION AND MESSAGING is needed.I will advise my friends and relatives who come to NYC to be "buyer beware,"
Breathtaking . For someone like me to get into a lift up 102 stories was a feat in itself. I'm glad we did. The views over New York were simply amazing. An absolute must do whilst here.

Love the "reveal" when you get to the top. From start to finish a definite highlight - the lift journey up is not for the faint hearted (won't say more as would give the game away), however, doesn't take long - when you get to the top, the views are immense, especially on a clear day which we had

Amazing view. Great experience, amazing views of New York.
Well worth a visit. Lifts are so quick and smooth, within moments you are at floor 103!

Room with a View. A beautifully clear day made my trip to the top of the World Trade Center in NYC well worth it. The elevator ride to the top has a video presentation that was impressive, and the opening film before the observatory was a nice touch. But really, in the end, you have paid these steep prices for a great view of the greater NYC area and this observatory does not disappoint. I paid the extra money to avoid the lines, and I'm not sure it was really necessary.

Amazing views.......very organized and friendly staff. The views are amazing! The elevator ride to the top is one of the most unique i have ever been on. You see the skyline of New York change as you ascend over the last 100 years. Pretty cool. The staff has it together to make your visit memorable and fun! Very sobering to look down 102 stories and see the reflection pools and the 911 memorial. Was a time for reflection for me because the last time I was in the Financial district was just a few months before the 911 disaster when i rode to the top of the World trade center. The ride to the Observatory is expensive but worth it.

See forever!. I went on a weekday, mid-afternoon with the flex ticket which I purchased the night before online. The tickets were easy to purchase and there was NO line with the flex access. You can use your phone to access tickets much like boarding passes etc. The elevator ride is super fast and enhanced by images of NYC on the walls. The introduction film is very well done. Of course, the views are spectacular and I highly recommend trying to go on a clear, sunny day for the best views because if it's foggy or cloudy your view will be very limited. The staff was courteous and the building was spotless despite the high volume of traffic that goes through constantly.
best view for manhattan. a must see in new york city. the views at the top is the best in the city. It is like a show in itself

You can see forever!!. Was not on our list of things to do but as we were passing and the weather was good decided to go in, and so glad we did. One of the best things we did. The views are amazing and the introduction to it takes your breath away. We loved every minute we were there and you do feel that you can see forever.

A must see!. The One World Observatory is definitely one of the must see attractions in New York. The whole experience from the lift ride to the top and the unforgettable views makes this my favourite place to visit in the city. We opted for one of the flexible day passes as we weren't sure what time we were going to be visiting, this was great as it gave you the whole day to check out other places in the area and meant we weren't rushing around to get there on time. The flexible pass also gave us priority queueing so we weren't waiting in the long lines like with most attractions. At the top there's a restaurant, gift shop and 360 degree views of the city. It's just incredible. We spent a good hour up there trying to photograph every angle of the city! A must see for anyone visiting NY!

Great views. The cost to go up is a little expensive but the the views are gorgeous. You can rent an IPad to help you have info on what you are looking at. There were 2 guides on the top (1 north, 1 south) giving out history and other great info. It is nice to see NY from above but you can get better views from the top of Rockefeller Center.

Simply amazing.... Just managed to make this visit and thoroughly enjoyed the view, the excellent lunch and presentations in the observatory. If you're handicapped you get special service and don't have to stand on line. Plan, however on getting tickets in advance.

Astonishing. I have to say I can be quite hard to impress when it comes to modern cities. That said, this is a truly remarkable place. It's impossible not to be moved by the adjacent memorials on your way here and you find yourself in reflective and poignant move as you enter. Nevertheless, the building is about optimism and the future. The queues moved quickly and the security is no more than you'd expect. The lifts are amazing in themselves and the observation decks are superb and with much more going on than just a few windows and an amazing view. I won't give away any of the surprises - you should go and see for yourself, but I think the way they introduce you to the New York skyline is excellent. As ever, staff who must be tired of saying the same thing so often through the day are always genuinely friendly and this left a lasting impression.

Must do. The One World Observatory offers an excellent view of New York City. In my opinion it's not the best view, that one goes to Top of the Rock Observation Deck. The elevator ride up is amazing (keep your camera at the ready before you get in).
Gorgous skyline. It's expensive to go up the elevator to see the view but we felt it was worth it. We also stopped in the restaurant to have a bite to eat. Very pretty view.
Great experience . Totally worth the time and money. Good to go during the week, no crowd. The views are amazing and there's enough space for everyone to take their pictures and hang around.

Don't Miss This One. Our visit to the top of Freedom Tower pretty much gives us a hat-trick for visiting Manhattan’s skyscrapers: Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, and now One World Trade Center. And the views from the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere did not disappoint! An electronic map at the entrance shows, in real time, where each visitor has come from – specific countries, not “Don and Anne from 54th Street.” They actually have you descend to the basement to board the elevator that whisks you to the 102d floor in 60 seconds. During the ascent, a time-lapse video recreates the development of Manhattan Island from a 16th century swamp to current-day metropolis. And the landscape continues to evolve from there until you reach the top. The iconic Empire State Building will always, for me, define the skyline but I have to say that Freedom Tower has pulled out all the stops to give visitors a 21st century experience. You can rent an iPad that tells you exactly what you are looking at no matter where you aim it. At the north and south facing windows they have a sort of tour guide telling you about NYC – again, with extensive use of digital technology. The only negative comment I have is that the gift shop prices are outlandish: $175 for a golf shirt???

Expensive but worthwhile experience . I visited One World Observatory on Monday 18th April with my family. The cost of admission for two adults and one senior was $94. iPads were available to rent at a price of $15 for 2 (buy one get one free); however we did not rent those. There is a security check prior to entering the lift. The security staff were very polite and courteous. My bag contained an asthma inhaler that was detected on X-ray and they politely asked me to show them the contents of my bag. Upon seeing the inhaler they immediately confirmed that was what they saw and let me through. This was in contrast to the following day at security for Liberty Island where the security guard there started routing through my bag carelessly and spilled some of my stuff all on the floor; then left me trying to find all my belongings as he moved onto the next tourist. The elevator ride up the tower is a spectacle in its own right. The evolving NY scenery in the remarkably quick ride is excellent. Once you are out of the elevator, the grand 'unveiling' of the view is also remarkable and well worth the wait. The view is spectacular and there are plenty of wonderful photo opportunities. However, unlike Empire State; there is no 'open air' viewing floor; hence the windows will always be in the way of a perfect photo. We went in the day, and the more expensive evening option could result in reflected flashes of windows when attempting a photo. Approximately one hour would probably be sufficient time to enjoy the 360 degree view plus to take any photos. Hence, although the observatory is a must see; it is a pricey one. Liberty/ Ellis Island takes a full day and costs 2 adults and 1 senior $50 in comparison. There is a cafe in the observatory that we did not use which looked nice. There is a gift shop and an enforced 'green screen' photo opportunity where a package of 2 prints (one day and one night) plus digital downloads costs $25 plus tax. In our case I genuinely liked the photos so I bought them. The fountain memorial outside the tower is both tasteful and moving. Overall this tower is a must see, although it is very expensive, particularly when considering the length of a typical visit.

Great View. Was In NYC for 9/11 and went to the top of new tower. Elevster exhibition on way upshowing New York skylnie last 100 years pretty cool. Observatory is great with stunning views of Brooklyn lower Manhattan Statue of Liberty And New Jersey

Absolutely Stunny and Emotional! A must see!. Being from the Tri State area I was completely overwhelmed with so many emotions on my recent trip back to NY. This is a must see! You will love the experience from beginning to end
Excellent presentation. Fantastic views, very well made. Is worth it to rent an iPad, makes the visit much more informative.

View just goes on and on. Word of advice, if you want to avoid the queues, get to One WTC at opening time i.e. 09h00. You will be able to quickly buy your tickets (regular admission $32 pp adults) and move through the security checks. The whole process is well organised and the staff helpful. The lift up to the 100th floor observatory deck took 56 seconds and can cause a little concern with vertigo sufferers. But even though your ears might pop a few times and your tummy flip, the experience and view is well worth it. The view is 360 degrees and glass enclosed so 100% safe and a pleasure to walk around. The clean restrooms and cafe are a pure pleasure (although the cafe a tad pricey). When you go to the WTC, make sure your camera is fully loaded and you take your time to drink in the Big Apple and beyond. The view seems endless. Definitely highly recommended. Once you exit the building, visit the black pools which are the memorials to those 2606 lives that perished in 9/11. Make sure you have tissues handy as the memorial will definitely bring tears.
You can see forever!!!. It's an amazing experience. You ride the elevator 102 floors. It's really scary. If you are afraid of heights.... Take a Xanax, put your big boy pants on, and just do it.

Definitely worth doing at least once. The view from the observatory is quite breathtaking, as long as you have reasonable weather of course. We bought the tickets that allowed entry at any time of day, rather than a timed ticket, so that we could choose to go up once the morning mists had definitely faded. Used the additional tablet guide, but not sure that it really gave you much extra, though I can see it being more fun for kids.

It's got to be done!. you can't go to New York without going up to the top of the WTC. It's well organised but do expect queues at the airport style scanners. The view is great. The glass looks a bit thin though!!!!
Good Value for Money. We visited on our trip to New York. Really good, well worth a visit with fantastic views of New York.

Amazing!. This is a must if you're in the city. Splurge on the interactive iPad and take your time learning what's what and what's where. Really, what a cool idea; you can point your gadget at pretty much anything down (and out) below, and it'll give you the name and history of what you're seeing. Another great idea is the platform to stand on that shows what things look like waaaay below. It's digital, but really realistic. :) Ya may want to stay out of the gift shop, as everything is terribly overpriced and made in China. Save the cash and spend it on the photo book you'll make after your trip.

Stunning !. A must do !!!!!The views are simply stunning, lift up and down are an experience as well.The walk through to the lifts are good,with interviews from the workers and the history etc.We arrived about 9am and disability was only about 10 miles according to the ticket office so we got tickets for 2pm and spent the morning in the 9/11 memorial.At 2pm the sun was up and the cloud had gone. The view is simply breathtaking.I thought it was a reasonable price as well.

Reached New Heights. Having been up the original Twin Towers; it was lovely to see what a great Job they have done with the new observation Deck. Really nicely organised and great use of technology. Great to book priority tickets on line before hand. Do it in combination with the memorial site. Best for photography may be mid day when the sun is shining down Manhattan

Fantastic views of the city. Worth a visit for the views, however you don't need to pay extra for the ipad devices which zoomed in on various buildings/attractions as there are plenty of helpful friendly guides in the building

Place this on your bucket list!!!!. World One Observatory is a great mix of history, charm and fun! From the walk through museum, to the elevator up the observatory to the observation deck itself, the observatory delivers! This is a must for those traveling to the area and looking for a great experience. Make sure to sit in on the presentations as they are fun and interactive!

Great view but not the one you are looking for . So how many tall buildings can you go up in Manhattan...it's now seems three. For me the best view is the top of the rock as you get the entire Manhattan skyline. From this tower well you look uptown...it's nice...but it's not fabulous.

Views but sort of tacky. This is something that should be seen when in NYC. The views really are something, and some of the moments experienced are quite special. After being ushered into the "theater", we were treated to a big screen video of NY scenes after which the screen rises to expose the city below. It's quite a nice spectacle. But there are some downsides to this attraction:1. We bought vouchers from TravelZoo, which I printed out. My bad that I didn't read the fine print about needing to go to the WTC website to get tickets. Thinking that the voucher was enough, we went with just those docs. We were told by the girl scanning the tickets that we had to go across the street to the "redemption center" to get the tickets. Once there we were told that they could do nothing for us, that it had to be done on the WTC website. Had we been told that we could have used our phones to access the tickets right on site instead of traipsing around a shopping center looking for a non-existent redemption center. It would be nice if staff were updated on these processes.2. It is sort of tacky that at every turn there is another attempt to wrangle more money from the visitors. From the hard sell of the Apple interactive tool, to the forced photo op in front of a green screen, to the never-ending souvenirs, it would be nice if there were less of a hard sell during the entire visit. We already have the Empire State Building for that.This observatory will become a classic spot for tourists for years to come. I hope that it will strive to maintain the dignity and good taste that this spot deserves.

NYC weekend. Overall, it is an amazing experience. You go for the views and that's what you get. I won't give away the surprise on when you get your first view though I am sure it is in other comments. The first view is great. And eventually the 360 view is awesome. Even the elevator ride up is really cool. We rented one of the ipads for the family. I would definitely only do one for a group. It's pretty cool technology and worth it for someone who isn't familiar with the metro area. The down side is all of the marketing you have to go through like Disney World, but that's to be expected and is not a take-a-away. Enjoy!

holiday. this is a must on your visit. we came to new york 3 yrs ago when they were still building this building. so was determined to visit this time. oh my it takes your breath away . but also makes you remember why you are there.

Wonderful experience!. I celebrated my 21st birthday at the top of Windows on the world 40 years ago, and was back with my husband to celebrate my 61st! Going to the top of the observatory was extraordinary and the staff was so courteous and helpful. Also the restaurant was great fun and was an experience I'll never forget. Every American should visit the museum and memorial as it magnificently honors those who were lost, and stand as the greatest tribute to the resilience and goodness of the American people against all odds! Highly recommend to anyone wanting that unforgettable New York experience!

Exciting. I was excited to visit 1 World Trade Center. I go every year to visit NYC and watched it being built. I didn't like having to pay $15 for an iPad to tell me what I am looking at. We paid to go up, pointing out sights or famous buildings should be part of the cost. If it is on an iPad, we should be able to add an ap. We went to the bar and sat looking out over the city 102 floors up. A very memorable experience.
Nice experience. We didn't have to wait very long.(30 min total waiting) level 102!! Wow. I give a 4 just because we're inside but still very good.

Windy day at OWO. We ended up here due to Liberty Island being closed due to the high winds on the river & were so glad we did.The elevator ride is an experience in itself & the views from the top outstanding! All the latest technology & informative guides make for a great visit....highly recommended.

Great views, excellent presentation. Tip, pay attention at the video presentation before you head to the viewing deck, there is a little surprise...Great viewing deck, bigger than the Empire and Top of the Rock although you don't get outside.We had bad weather when we were there unfortunately but still could see lots of the city. The ipad "magnifier" they offer is worth the money too.

Experience of a life time. This is the tallest building in New York City with 102 floors, once you are on top the view is spectacular, you are able to view the entire New York City in all angles, You are able to see the city of New Jersey across the river, you are also able to see the stature of Liberty across the river.

The View!!. This was the first time back downtown to visit in about 15 years and as we had gone to the world trade way back. While it is fairly expensive, I would recommend. Buy tickets in advance. The elevator ride up is very cool as you see the history on NYC and its growth. Once up at the top. the views are incredible!!! 360 views of city and far surrounding areas. We spent a couple of hours just looking around. The only thing I think they could have done better was the dining options.

Breathtaking . Absolutely amazing, a real must do for anybody hitting the sites of Manhattan. We did it on a Monday and the queues where very short and fast moving. Don't scrimp by not having the iPad guide thing at 15bucks, it's well worth it.
The fountains outside are absolutely wonderful, give yourself time to take it all in.
Only drinks but very nice!. Only had a cocktail but the wait staff was very nice and who can beat the view! Not a bad way to start out the afternoon!

Top of the World. Excellent views. Buy your ticket online for a Monday (it is cheaper).Book your time slot to enter before the sunset. This way you get to see the daytime view, sunset and the night view of Manhattan and about 20 miles around. Check the weather report so that you go when the top is not surrounded by clouds on a rainy day.Great for tourists. I live here so naturally it gets old for us NYers.Take a video camera or use your smartphone because the elevator and entrance video show is worth the price of admission.

Truly amazing views. An amazing and breathtaking experience from the elevator ride up, to the unveiling once you arrive. You can take all the time you like to see the spectacular views and there are local, knowledgeable guides to offer insights about the city's many venues. We purchased tickets in advance for the earliest time available on Saturday and were very glad we did as this is a very popular location for visitors. Terrific photo opps abound. The location has a very tasteful gift shop with lovely souvenirs and momentos. There are snacks and dining options available but we did not partake.
Awesome. We were anticipating an excellent view of the NYC skyline, but unfortunately the cloud cover prevented us from the view. The ride up on the elevator is fast and interesting, however.

Amazing. Beginning with an incredible elevator ride, which is an experience in itself, you will be in awe. The views are absolutely incredible. We went on a perfectly clear day. Take your time, take pics, enjoy lunch or drinks. Absolutely breathtaking!

Breath taking, as good or better that the twin Towers. I wanted to go back to the WTC to visit the observatory as I was a customer of the Twin Tower's restaurant. A sort of pilgrimage and homage to the victims.the view is astounding......to say the least and the restaurant is a real treat.

Spectacular view. We recently took a group of high school seniors to the observatory and all enjoyed it. The elevator ride and introduction video were almost as impressive as the view from the top. Friendly staff and a nice gift shop finished off the very impressive experience.

Definitely worth seeing. This attraction consists of taking a high-speed elevator to the top of the Freedom Tower. I felt that this was overall worth seeing as part of a New York sightseeing trip, or if you're a local and haven't been there. Tickets are purchased generally as a timed ticket. There are options that are more flexible but they cost much more. The trip begins with a bag check and metal detector. This is not unusual for any attractions in NYC at this point. It was no more cumbersome than any other that I've encountered, and certainly much quicker than airport security.The elevator is super cool. The walls are video screens that take you from before there was a New York, all the way through the different eras - it's like a time-lapse video of the building of NYC. I'd stay in that elevator all day. Catch it quick because it's not the same on the way down.The elevator is quick - I want to say it's under a minute. Stepping out, they do herd you into a block and try to rent you an ipad device which gives you more info on what you're looking at. I did rent one, as I have kids that very much enjoyed it. However, I'm not convinced that the rental was essential for the average person to enjoy the experience. It was only $15 though, which I didn't feel was unreasonable.Views are spectacular, and you can walk all the way around the entire perimeter of the building. The upper floor is dining (there's a snack bar/quick service style restaurant and a sit-down ($$$$) restaurant. I have to comment on the service here - it was truly excellent. Each and every employee there was courteous and went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met, even though we were just one family among a crowd. There are two areas that I'm less enthused by, and this is why I don't give it 5 stars:1) Cost: Wow is this expensive - our party of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) got just the very basic ticket, and it cost us $117. Ultimately it provided about 1 hour of entertainment, plus we ate lunch up there. By contrast, you get an entire day's entertainment at the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island for about half that cost. 2) In comparison: This building has in its favor its height (the tallest in the city/continent). The interior architecture in the observatory isn't interesting, and honestly I find the building itself just OK in terms of skyline interest. I'm not trying to bring nostalgia in here, but it is impossible to not compare it to the original twin towers, which I've also been to the top of. In that building, you had the additional awesome experience of seeing this equally tall building within what seemed like spitting distance. Here, you're basically an island and there is nothing nearby other than the empire state building for contrast. This isn't the fault of the architects, certainly, and we can't turn back time and get those buildings or the lives lost in them back. But I found this less impressive than the old buildings. I also much enjoy the Empire State Building a bit more for the interesting architecture, proximity to the Chrysler building, and the ability to see the Freedom tower from there...to me the Freedom Tower is more impressive to see than it is to see from, if that makes sense.Overall, though, a great experience. If I had to pick just one, I'd probably pick the empire state building. But absolutely worth it to do this one.

102 stories high...and a super fast elevator ride!. Great observatory.....$32.00 admission fee....you get to view the city in all directions....even a restaurant on the 102nd floor. Definitely a tourist attraction....not sure I'd say it is worth the fee of $32.00.

Simply stunning view of Manhattan and boroughs. My family and I visited the OWO at the end of March. I booked online, a few days before our trip to try and ensure the weather was clear on our visit. They also had a special offer for families. I went for an early morning visit to avoid the crowds. The views are truly breathtaking, you can see for miles. There are a number of tour guides on the observatory deck that will answer any questions you have. There is also an ipad option on the deck, it calculates which way you are standing and will tell you whats out the window. There is no time limit when you are up there.We thoroughly enjoyed the visit and would recommend.The only flaw in our trip was the security staff who were checking your bags etc at the bottom, they were very rude.Finally if you are down this area make sure you visit the new PATH (subway station) designed by Santiago Calatrava, it is beautiful.

Great views. Went here in April, the bar and restaurant are pretty cool with excellent views of Manhattan. Had drinks for a couple of hours and you felt like you were on top of the world.Wine was mid to high in price, but of good quality.One tip I would say is to have your phone on record when you go up and down in the lift as it is the coolest lift I ever went up or down in. You will be surprised and both journeys offer different views, so have your phone on for both journeys.

Interesting but not the best observation deck in NYC. Out of the three main observation decks in NYC -- One World Observatory, the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock -- this is not the best one (I prefer Top of the Rock). One World Observatory obviously boasts great views enabled by its height, but all floors are enclosed and therefore all views are obstructed by glass, which takes away from the impact and causes reflections in the photos. Also the visit starts on the 102nd floor with a very cool visual presentation but then you go DOWN two levels to the observation deck... The point of an observation deck is to go as high as you can. The coolest part of the visit is the elevator ride. Three walls of the elevator are video screens and as you climb up to the 102nd floor you also travel in time from the 1500s when NYC was founded to today. On the way down the elevator simulates a flyover of the downtown area, Willy Wonka-style. But if you're looking for are great views and great pictures, go to 30 Rockefeller Plaza.

worth the experience. The lift ride is something different, the views are what you would expect, but I cant help saying the views from The Empire State Building are far more impressive. Go for the experience, not the views.

Best View in the City. High Speed lifts take you high above the city where there is a 360 degree viewing indoor area with huge glass windows, luckily the day we went the weather was excellent and we could see from Coney Island in the South, way up to the Bronx and beyond in the North and across Jersey. You also get a different view of Ground Zero from above.
Amazing!!. If you are in New York must go up there!!! The view is magic. You can see all the city from the 104th floor. Look around when you go up with the lift!

Great view but that's it. The view, which is why you come here is great however everything else is just a sales pitch to get you to buy stuff. Literally spent about 5mins up there. Much better things to do and views from Empire State are far better

INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE. Definately visit One World Observatory. Purchase tickets early in the day as the queue grows very very fast.If you have a waiting time then pay respects at 9/11 Memorial and return to the Observatory.Totally effiicient staff, the introduction to your experience is so informative and like a disney World experience.Be prepared for the most incredible views of NYC and crowds so give yourself enough time to enjoy the whole of the city from this vantage point.

Breathtaking experience . A visit to One World Observatory begins with a super-fast and smooth elevator ride. Your initial view is breathtaking. The observation deck is spacious, no problems getting to the windows. We rented the iPad that identifies the cityscape; worth it but you only need one. Nice gift shop, we bought the photo ($20 for one $25 for two). Ticket line didn't seem long but we bought a 4-pack ($10 per ticket discount) and reserved our time in advance. We spent about 2 hours. We loved it.Allow time to walk around the 9/11 memorial. The 9/11 museum is wonderful as well.

Top of the World. An amazing construct with views that let you see Manhattan, Brooklyn, New Jersey and Staten Island from the highest building in the Western Hemosphere.. A lasting tribute the bravery and defiance of New Yorkers after 9/11.
Breathtaking. The entire experience was amazing. The only downside is the crowds. It's crowded, understandably so. Staff super friendly and courteous.

NICE SURPRISE. The WTC Observatory is the name of the observation floor. The elevator ride up is a 360 degree show made possible with flat screen monitors on the elevator walls. The ride down is similar. Well done and effective use of ride time. Upstairs you can walk around and view out all sides. Some shameless commerce such as tablet rentals for landmarks identification and photos of you and/or your group, at a cost. I found it a little ironic that the gift shop had so many non-American made items. For anyone who walked the observation deck of the old WTC, you will definitely miss not being able to feel the wind in your face...this observation area is totally inside. Nevertheless THE VIEWS ARE GREAT AND WORTHWHILE. The architecture, interior design and construction are all top notch. You have to see this place.

Must see, Must go!!. I wasn't so sure if it would be worth it. How I was wrong!!Splendid views at 360º. Very well organized, easy to access all windows. DO NOT pay $15 for tablet that points out details on scenery as you walk - use google maps on you mobile for free!

Breathtaking!. I'm so glad we got tickets to this. The elevator ride was so cool...wish it had been longer actually. The view was breathtaking!!! We took tons of photos.. I wouldn't suggest spending the $15 on one of their iPads with info about what you're seeing. My daughter and I didn't find it useful!!
One World - Pricey but worth it. This is not an inexpensive attraction, but well worth it. The view is spectacular, and the lectures are very informative. Bring binoculars to get even a closer view.

Great sunset view. I usually like to take in the city at night when it is all lit up but One World Observatory isn't opened in the evening so try to get their before sunset. The view of NYC at the golden hour was breathtaking.
A must see!. I was very excited to go there. I was on twin towers 20 year ago.. down ground zero 5 years ago.The view is really great and the atmophere all around is special.

Top of the world . Have to say this was one of the places in NYC I was looking forward to the most, and it does not disapoint, jaw dropping 360 degree views, the elevators are super fast, and the walls of the elevators tell the history of lower manhattan, we went at 4pm and there was no lines

Insane views and an amazing experience!. The entire experience of visiting the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere was incredible! The visual show on the way up the elevator and in the theatre was spectacular! I was not expecting such professionalism in the presentation of the 360 degree views of the city. They had the opportunity to do some cool visual effects, and they did it! Amazing work at this famous attraction! I would go back anyway and highly recommend this to everyone in the city!

Awesome view of New York and surrounding areas. Wow...where to start?We arrived via train at the new station (still being finished) and made our way to the ticket counter. A short five minute wait saw us have our tickets to the top. Downstairs to the entrance area where we walked amongst the bedrock that the foundations are based in.Another short wait and then it was a rapid trip to the 102nd floor with the sides of the lift showing video of New York's development through the ages.A brilliant surprise awaited us (I won't give it away as it was such a "Wow" moment) and then we were given a short talk on what to see and do whilst there.I paid $15 extra for an ipad tour guide(not really worth the money) and then we made our way down to the main observation area on the 100th floor.We had a perfect day for viewing and so spent the next hour or so constantly moving around taking photo after photo.At two different points, there were guides giving talks about the view and local history & places of interest (they were really informative, professional and fun).At times I had to wait to get close up to the window to take some pics as there were a lot of people around (be aware of reflections in your pics) although it didn't seem to be too busy a day.Bags, packs etc are all checked before you can enter the lifts to the top but the staff doing so were professional and polite whilst doing so.Cameras, mobile phones etc are all fine and there was free wifi available if required.There was quite a few seats available if needed as well as a well stocked souvenir store.To sum it all up...this was one of the highlights of my trip and I would recommend it to anyone thinking of doing it.

A bit crowded at times but definitely worth the trip.... Although like most popular new attractions, it can be a bit busy, it is definitely worth the trip. Beautiful views, with complete 360 degrees of vantage points from which to view Manhattan. Once you are up, there is a place to eat and drink but you will of course pay handsomely for the privilege. So beware the tourist trap here, but like I said, it's still worth the visit.

One World.... Absolutely Amazing. The view from here is just amazingMy tip, pull out your camera / phone, and video going up the elevator. What a trip in time, i wanted to pay again just for the elevator ride and the scenic history of New York
What a view!. Beautiful building! The ride up is quick. The observatory view is worth the line and money. Buying tickets online made it a much easier experience.
A MUST!!. I can not tell you how amazing this experience is.I was so glad I went to the top of this building and the view is forever . It is my very favourite New York experience .

Spectacular view. This was my first time visiting One World Observatory since it opened. I live in Staten Island & lived there on 9/11. I have been up to the top of the Twin Tower observation deck so initially this visit was emotional for me.I bought my ticket online & there are several options you can purchase. Tickets start at $32 & don't remember what the cost is for children. When I arrived the lines were not very long to buy tickets there but then I went on a weekday.There is a lot of security there. Getting into the Observatory is the same as going through security at the airport. Everyone had to take their belts off & cellphones had to be taken out of pocketbooks, backpackers, & pockets. Shoes did not have to be taken off.The elevator ride was very smooth & you faced the back of the elevator which showed different views & showed the height as you went up. I made the mistake of buying the Priority VIP flex ticket & therefore missed things on the other 2 floors. I spent a lot of time in the restaurant, which was expensive, but I had a great seat & view . I would recommend getting the IPad which points out different buildings & other points of interest. It was starting to get dark while I was still there & the view was just beautiful.I will definitely go back & buy the regular admission ticket & see the things that I missed. I would recommend to anyone visiting NY to go here of course weather & view permitting

Best "High" I Ever Had. Read all the reviews below - fantastic views of course. So here are the things not mentioned: 1 Think about going later when the lights are on. 2 I got in very quickly but I'd book ahead (I went on a whim)3. $12 for a sandwich. $5 for water. Eat down stairs. 4. Use the restrooms down stairs. They are small on high. (I did use the restrooms at the top- phew what a relief)5. Don't bother with the interactive Apple iPad things you get offered. The views should be savoured for real not surfed. Same with the posed photographs. 6. There is a water fountain up there. 7. You can buy loads of old rubbish in the shop. I wouldn't. I'm not sure this impressive building has that much awareness. If you bought a T Shirt people wouldn't 'get' it. 8. Make sure you stand close to a few people - boy, do they say stupid things like: 'shame they don't have TV' 9. Walk around counter (anti) clockwise. This means you can spot empty spots by Windows more quickly. Most people turn right when first entering the observation deck. 10. I've been to New York loads of times over the years. Back then I always said I'd keep the twin towers until 'next time' How wrong I was. Go.
