Mixed emotions. The marvel and fantastic views from atop of the tallest building in the western hemisphere. and the somber feeling of the saddest day in American history seeing the footprint of the Twin Towers far above them. All items here including admission are very pricey ($5 for a small bottle of water) wow.

I you have to pick one .... If you only want to spend money on one observatory you should definitely choose The Rockefeller Observation Desk. For me personally the One World Observatory was a nice experience and the view is nice but it simply too far away from all the other skyscrapers ... That is why I prefer The Rockefeller Observation Desk for two reasons: 1) You are in the middle of all other skyscrapers which makes the view complete; 2) The Rockefeller Center is not the highest building which means you will have do not only have to look down to have a great view! But if you can spend money during your stay it sure is a nice experience to go up to One World Observatory!
so cool. a very good full attraction technology with an incredible view from the top of new york, a lot of souvenir

Must Visit!. This is a must-visit place, just next to the 9/11 Museum. This has been recently opened and we were told that this is currently the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere! The Observatory deck gives you a fantastic view of the entire city - you can view all the landmarks like the Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building etc...from here.

The best views of NYC. Very high (104 floors) with stunning 360 degree views which are cleverly revealed as you watch a brief video about the 9/11 tragedy. The elevator ride is really interesting and shows a fast video play timeline of the new Tower being built. A wonderful and truly beautiful building which stands proudly next to the memorial fountains and museum.

Wow - What a view!!. Great experience! Right from the staff when you arrive to the view itself.I recommend going about an hour before sunset and staying to watch the city light up as the sun sets. It's quite an experience, I was impressed with the elevator (under one minute to do 102 floors) but I was not prepared for the view. It is definitely a must see. Different from the observation areas at 30 Rock and Empire State because it is indoors. Can take a few mins to get a window space due to the volume of people but they let you stay as long as you want so patience is key. So beautiful!

Bucket List Visit. Having been to the twin towers multiple times, the Freedom Tower became a must see. The Freedom Tower has the most spectacular views of the city and we were there on a clear day which was a bonus. The staff was very friendly and helpful, making the entire experience fantastic.

world class experience. Well done in all aspects! The "show" around going to the viewing platform is nice and the talks while up there are very nice but the view is amazing. World class thing to do!I have been up to the top of the Empire State Building and this is better!

mesmerizing. Finally made it to ground zero. looking down from the observatory at the footprints of the twin towers was emotional. On the ground they look like an enormous box made of granite and inscribed names, but from the top, The somberness and the efficiency of the tour was striking. It was very well done. Cost about $30 per person but everyone should do this visit at least once.

Awesome View - Classy Experience. Get whisked away, up 102 stories in 47 seconds by the silent elevator, after walking through the basement bedrock of the Freedom Tower. Once on top, you'll have a terrific 360 degree view of lower Manhattan and surrounds....Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Brooklyn Bridge, etc. They have also have lecturers, giving you information about what you're seeing, so plan to take some time on your visit. There's also a restaurant(expensive) and a bar(reasonable for a drink with a fabulous view) and, of course, a gift shop(ridiculously expensive). Save your money, have a drink, eat on the street, but don't miss this view. The building, and the park with the waterfall pools are beautiful. More to come. There's lots of ongoing construction in the area.

Must do. Definitely visit this when in New York. I advise for all to buy their tickets ahead of time and either go to this before or after the museum. We got lucky and went on a clear day. You get discount as a student. You will need at least 1.5 hrs so you can immerse yourself. Only down side for me, hard to take a pic with your face not dark and also the background in focus. It can get crowded, even on a weekday.

Very cool but a little pricey. Although the views are outstanding from here, I felt that it's an overpriced observation deck. For some reason I thought there would be more to it than just walking around and looking outside. If you wanted to know what you were seeing, you had to pay $15 more for their iPad to take around with you. However, I do have to say that it's a very ingenious program. It's very close to the 911 Museum and if you plan on staying in that area for a while, then I'd say try it but it's not a must do if you don't have the time or money.

Amazing!!. Wow what an experience!! We booked online before we arrived in New York so didn't have to purchase tickets, but there didn't seem to be a problem if you just turned up. We were whisked to the 102nd floor in less than one minute (having waited minimal time for an elevator) and that experience in itself was pretty amazing. Once there you are greeted and you get the opportunity to hire an ipad which will give you details of which building or attraction you will be looking at once you get the view (which is on the 100th floor). You then go down to floor 100 where you get a 360 degree view of New York with no time limit to enjoy the view and opportunities to take as many photos as you wish. I was amazed! I am not good with heights and felt a little dizzy but honestly didn't find it too much of a problem, probably because you are inside the building the whole time (which isn't the case with the Empire State Building). I found it better than the Empire State Building, although I would also recommend that one too, despite the very long queues there (the One World Observatory wasn't built last year when we went). This is an experience I would not have missed and highly recommended! Quite stunning and a terrific experience

Views for days but they don't come cheap. Smooth experience from start to finish. Full airport security procedures prior to entering the lobby area reminds you of the current climate but ensures a safe experience. The quick elevator ride presentation is almost as amazing as the views. This is a money making business so there are Ipads for rent to help identify what you are looking at and of course there is a gift shop on the top and photo opportunities with the so called " photographers" which didn't do a great job but that was the only negative. The live guides providing information were excellent.

Top of The World Ma!. The most spectacular views ever of Manhattan and the surrounding Boroughs of NY. A must visit and one of the best sight seeing things to do. Go pay tribute to the poor lost souls of 9/11...

holiday. Fantastic panoramic view over the whole city. The tablet that is supposed to give more information was not worth the extra $15. Think the views are better than the Empire State and Top of the Rock. Well worth a visit.

the view of a super hero. a lil bit pricey almost 40 usd but once you there you are there and ready to go! the view is amazing! pic a nice and sky blue day to do it otherwise you will be surrounded by white clouds

Amazing. the whole experience is first class from the moment you take your $32 ticket to when you leave, the staff are polite, café facilities are good BUT the most amazing part is the views you get when you are at the top, we visited late afternoon - early evening and had the most wonderful sunset view, the highlight of my weekend in New York, well worth a visit

WOW!!. Didnt book just got there early 0900 no queues went straight in got tickets and was away...this is so slick a presentation from the moment you step in the lift (i wont spoil it for you) you cant feel it move and then when the doors open and the blinds go up WOW!! i was here a few years ago when all this area was still in the recovery phase what a difference today ...super place. Quick tip hire one of the inter active tablets theyre well worth it.

Wonderful views, but that's about it. It was not too crowded when we went so the lines were not bad. The elevator ride up is fast and the time lapse animation was cleverly done. On top, the views are spectacular but there is not much else to do (unless you want to buy overpriced souvenirs). We stayed to watch sunset, which was very nice. Would be nice if they had better labels of the landmarks of each viewing window. But I guess they want to sell their cheezy iPad interactive tour guide programs.

Awesome view. Worth the time to see the amazing view from the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere! Even on a somewhat clear day before the rain on 4/9, you could see everything. Was snowing at that height but was rain on the street.

You can see forever!. We were lucky to visit on a weekday just prior to sunset. This is a great time to see NYC transition from day to night. There was a very short wait in line. The elevator ride to the top is educational and a good start to the visit. I recommend going the few extra dollars for the individual hand held table that explains what is in front of you. The staff is very helpful in locating the sights. We were way above all helicopters and most planes. A great experience for ages 7/8 and above. Thanks!

Perfect Day - Perfect View. There were 4 of us in our family visiting New York and the $99 special for 4 was a great deal. The sky was crystal clear and the views amazing. Visiting on a Wednesday at 5pm, we did not need to wait in line and had no problem getting all the photographs we wanted from every angle and direction. We thought the entire attraction was well designed and very user-friendly. We did not pay for the optional iPad, but for those unfamiliar with the area would find it fascinating, I'm sure.
Do not miss this when you visit new York. Beautiful place to visit well worth the $32 , Don't forget to have you camera ready once you are at the top
A very cool experience. The views at the top of the WTC are fantastic. The overall experience is expensive but a must do while in NY.
Excellent views.. Elevator ride was very unique -- can cause some motion sickness issues. Hard sell on photos -- but you can just walk around. It is pricey compared to other towers in other cities.

Amazing Views of NYC and Beyond. A little pricey, but I loved it. The views are amazing and I enjoyed the elevator ride up and down. I spent an hour taking in the views and people watching. I seemed like they limit the number of people so it does not get too crowded.

Amazing views. We visited on a clear sunny day and the views were absolutely amazing once you get through to the observatory. Initially you are stopped for a presentation to revive an iPad for $15 but this is optional and you can walk straight through. Amazing views of the twin towers footprint waterfalls and of out across the river. Simply amazing! Would recommend for anyone going to NY. The elevator ride up and down was also enjoyable with the interactive walls. Must see!

WOW!. You are SO high up and the view is pretty stunning. You can get the same view from the Empire State Building or 50 Rock. This is now the tallest building in NYC and still the view is pretty much the same. It was a nice way to spend the morning. Going up in the elevator was an experience in and of itself.

"Out of This World!". What a great view!!! There was no wait, so need to do VIP, just go on off-season. People were friendly, the ride up was spectacular and when they open "the curtains" to get a first gimpse of the view, it's simply breathtaking! I give the experience two-thumbs up!
Incredible View. Talk about being at the top of the world! I could see the entire city from the observation areas. This is an area I'd love to share pictures because the panorama is amazing!

Great view and a must see. Very lucky that we had such a clear day and views are awesome - on the lift going up, the time lapse presentation was very clever - the whole tour was very professional and not at all rushed - would recommend to all visiting and then on the way out spend time at the two commemorative pools for 9/11
Amazing view of a Manhattan. This was a fantastic experience, on a clear day you can see the Atlantic shorebreak. The entire experience was well organized, even standing in line was an experience.

Stunning views. We chose the VIP Weekday Flex option but didn't really need to have paid the extra as the queues on a Monday morning were pretty short. The views really are amazing, especially on a clear day. If you are not familiar with NYC it's a great way to orientate yourself. The 'experience' itself was well done. Pretty pricey overall though.
Beautiful view!. The views were phenomenal, especially on a clear day. It was very crowded (to be expected) but didn't detract from the experience. Definitely something you should do at least once.

Best views all the way around. Very well-thought out presentation and orderly, efficient lines. The presentation continues to run through my mind. Best views in Manhattan, simply amazing. Restrooms at the top and only about a 45 second ride to the top in an elevation with a video simulation of the ride up. You can certainly feel your ears pop as you're whisked to the top of the tallest building in the Western hemisphere! Do not miss. Period.

Highlight of our trip.. Stunning views from the top of the tower. The exhibit is very well laid out & the guides were pleasant & informative. The views over New York are breath-taking. A must see when visiting New York.

Disneylike experience. Great experience! You can purchase VIP tickets thru your hotel for a specific time and avoid the long ticket and entry line. Once in, you wait for the elevator in a special area with lots of photos. The elevator is a video experience of the evolution of NYC and in a blip, the towers disappear. Fascinating. Then you hear a presentation at the top and the wall lifts to show the view. Then you go to the observation deck to well, observe...I would not recommend the ipad rental because it would not keep calibration. A paper map would have been much better. We used our iphones to look up parts of the city even though we rented the useless ipads. Great experience!@!

Wonderful NEW landmark.... As a born and bred Manhattanite the reconstruction of the World Trade Center has been long and painful... Practically and emotionally... I vowed not to visit the site until it was completed. And when in Gods name would that be? Well... Recently some very special members of my family visited and wanted to go to One World Trade Center. Being the good host, I took them there. I couldn't have been more surprised and pleased. It was a spectacular experience. I'm not independently wealthy, but we even splurged and had appetizers and drinks in the restaurant... A bit pricey, but the food was good and our waiter/artist from Jersey City, Sagey, was charming. I think of the times I regretted not having gone to Windows on the World when it was there in the old days. I am grateful my visiting cousins compelled me to visit this wonderful new landmark.

Its more then just go to the top and have look. They view is great but its also informative and entertaining. Avoid the weekend, get there first thing Monday morning, we walked straight and straight up, no queue. Price is also good especially for NY
Amazing!. This really was the highlight of our trip. I definitely will be going back. The views are truly breathtaking. This should be a must see on a visit to NYC,

What a View!. It starts with a very well done elevator ride with graphics that make you not even realize you are taking one of the fastest elevator rides ever. Very well done. then there are spectacular views of NYC that are great. looking down on the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island you really get the sense of how high you are. Great spot to point out many things to your little ones.

Breath taking!. The Freedom Tower Observatory at WTC is a MUST!The views are simply breath taking. The technology is engaging and educational.I only wish we had allowed more time to linger on the observation floor.

Beautiful views, floor to ceiling windows!. Overall it was a positive experience. The ticket/line in the beginning was definitely not well planned. you ahve to go inside to get your ticket, then back outside tog et in line. I'd imagine this is no fun in the winter! once you get back inside and down the escalator it's pretty smooth sailing. they have lots of interesting things to see and interact with in the lines. They have a great presentation of your first views by playing a video and then raising the screens to see a grand view of the city. The observation deck was bright, clean and really pretty. And of course, the views were amazing!
Spectacular views of the city!!. If you can make it before sunset, that's the best time of day! Watching the sunset was amazing!! Very organized and not too sad... The elevator ride was incredible!!

Amazing Views!. If you are looking for a view of NY from the top of the world, then this is the activity for you! On a clear day the views are spectacular! You can see the Statue of Liberty, Elis Island, and each part of Manhattan. You can also see beyond the city and see the mountain range off in the distance. The Staff is knowledgeable and friendly and open to all questions even if you don't rent the iPad. The deck gets crowded quickly so I would recommend going as early as possible on a weekend or on a weekday. The tour is self guided so you can spend as much or as little time as you like, so it is suitable for all levels of interest.

Great View. This is worth doing based on the elevator ride alone, especially if you love history. The food at the top wasn't that great, it was okay though. I'm not a foodie so keep that in mind. I paid to have one of the iPads to tell me what I was looking at. I don't think the iPad was worth getting. It never stayed oriented so I could never really tell what I was looking at. But, it's a cool concept that may work better in the future. The people at the top were really nice and informative. This is more about the view and the city than what happened on 9/11 although, of course, that is a part of the experience. You will not need extra tissues though.
Not to be missed. Fantastic experience, very slick presentation. The views are amazing, best in Manhattan. Go at suset to get the full effect of the place. Certainly value for money.

Awesome!. The only downside was the heavy handed sales pitch on ipads for interaction. Close your ears to that and everything else is amazing! Fantastic sky deck, elevator ride and the sheer emotion that hits you.

Best views in NYC. After 9/11 disaster the scene has recovered with dignity and a sense of pride. I visited the WTC several times before both for business and pleasure. Nowadays it has recovered almost fully

Concierge's pick. Absolutely outstanding views and once in a lifetime opportunity! Especially liked the stories that were shown of the workers who had worked on this great building! American pride at its greatest!

Incredible. visited Saturday april 2nd...at 7pm so we could get sunset and the lights coming on throughout the city.no lines......straight through security and up elevator....all in less than 10 mins...incredible.....the lift ride up is spectacular....the roots of the city to the now...brilliant.Once up we got a really cool film on a huge screen which then lifted to show the view right up the island.......it was incredible....the whole viewing deck is a bit special and apart from fighting to get at the windows from people who wanted to take 100 photos it was special....I will be back one day

Great views of lower Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island.. The trip to the top is amazing in itself - you reach the 102nd floor in such a short time that you can't believe you have actually arrived. The elevator walls show a video depiction of the city from its founding through present time as you ascend, which is very cool. When you enter the viewing area, the shade are down and you are shown a short film of the city. Then the shades rise and you are treated to a stunning view of the city. We were there on a sunny day, and the views were great. You can't see Central Park from there - the buildings in the center of Manhattan block it from sight. But you can view the East River, Brooklyn Bridge, Manhattan Bridge, Hudson River, New Jersey, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Staten Island....great views from everywhere. One thing that somewhat detracts is the fact that there is no outdoor viewing, so all photos are taken through glass. Even though they work to keep the glass clean, there is almost always some kind of reflection to mar your photo. (Empire State Building has outdoor viewing).We paid extra for the expedited pass and my companions kept saying, "This is definitely the way to go!"
family fun in NY 2016. This was awesome. We have been in the twin towers in years past so this was a nice experience to share with our granddaughter after being in the museum.

Great experience, and given the location, a sobering one as well. Well worth a visit - as everyone else says the views are spectacular up there. Just be aware it is lower Manhattan you will see so the Statue, etc. and not Central Park. And the view looking straight down at the pools marking the footprints of the Twin Towers is very sobering. There is what presumably was intended as a glass floor but it just has a screen underneath it showing a view of the street so there is no sense of depth and is a bit of a non-event really.Special mention also for the lift up there, amazing, especially the ride back down again. The walls of the lift are all display screen and the journey back down is superb and made me want to spend all day just riding up and down in there!

Made a pilgrimage to see this. I loved the twin towers, so it was a pilgrimage to see One World Observatory. It is a wonderful building in its own right, and we loved the video on the way in and in the lift about the people involved in the build. Don't forget to visit the 9/11 memorial across the plaza. You can book tickets on-line and reserve a slot. We arrived about 10 on Thursday and walked straight in, glad to have saved the money, The other thing is you need to watch for the weather, so I say just go when the weather Is right.Gob-smacking views. We had coffee and a muffin and took it all in. If you don't know the City, the IPad rental is probably worth it.

Disappointment. This building was a big let down. When we first went in there was nobody to direct us so we ended in a place we did not belong. Once we got to the right place to enter it was not what I expected. All it is is you walk around big glass and look at the city. The Empire State Building was much more open and exciting.

New york resident and amazed by the view. I love the visit amazing view highly recomend also great elevator experience only one thing wasnt happy its covered all glass so if glass is dirty it appers on your camera also reflection of glass alters your photo for best photos go to top of the rock

A very different view to the NYC skyline. View here is very different to your typical NYC skyline view because you are quite far down town. It's a good unobstructed view however you do not see Central Park due to location and Empire State Building is in the distance. There is no outside area I'd say as your high up, really high up! But there is a good selection of places to eat.The lift journey is pretty cool tooWorth a visit but if you want the money shot I think Top of the Rock is your best destination
Great view . Goes without saying that NYC is one of the most spectacular cities particularly on a beautiful clear day. A bit too commercialised for me but I guess the USA specialises in that.

Go Now Before The Crowds Find Out. I have kept up on the developments of this tower (formerly Freedom Tower), and found out that it is now open to the public from my airport car driver. I used to go to the top of the Twin Towers and was familiar with the view, so I booked tickets immediately.The high speed elevator to the top is a great digital experience, showing the development of NYC over the centuries while you are effortlessly flying up 104 stories. It surrounds you, so the visual experience was gorgeous. There were absolutely no lines from entrance to the observatory. Once you get into the observatory, the 360 view of the city was spectacular. Again, I was used to the experience, so able to compare the experiences.At one corner of the view, you can see the two memorials and footprints of the old towers by looking straight down. You can also see Lady Liberty to the south, and the NYC skyline looking north. Even as a New Yorker, this view is amazing. Well done!

very cool - but don't rent the ipad. This building is absolutely stunning - and you will see amazing views of NYC from the top. I couldn't believe how far you really can see - granted, we went up the tower on a clear, beautiful day. I would have given this an "Excellent" rating, but it's pricey.

Stunning!. Once you get past the three or is it four lines, this is an amazing experience. There were some smelly people but once you get to the top, this is so breath taking! The building is gorgeous on the outside then you take a super fast and super cool elevator up (45 seconds to go up 102 floors) and the views from the top are the best I have seen on a clear day. I recommend making a reservation for dinner at One Dine (the food and drinks were both so yummy!) and watch the sunset so you get the day to night experience. Absolutely loved it, one of my favorite NY experiences.

Amazing views. The whole experience is fantastic, it starts already when you walk trough the fundaments of the building...once up there the views are amazing ! Have a drink at the bar and enjoy the city from high up

Interesting and beautiful. What a nice viewing floor. We enjoyed the elevator, too. Everything was very high tech. Having recently visited Burj Khalifa and the Tokyo Skytree I enjoyed One World Observatory the most.

Use Mastercard for VIP tickets. The observatory tickets are $35 per person, and $54 for VIP tickets that allow you to get past the lineups. The trick - pay with Mastercard, and get VIP tickets for $35. Mastercatd is a sponsor.

A Must Attraction for Anyone Visiting New York. My wife and I visited One World Observatory on the morning of April 17, 2017. Upon entering one must go through security, just like in an airport. After passing security, you go through a dimly lit area that leads to the elevators. This area contains some history of the World Trade Center. The elevators that take one to the Observatory are very fast, and they contain pictures of the New York area and list the elevation above ground as the elevator ascends. Upon reaching the Observatory, there are several tour guides available for questions and answer. The Observatory is strictly indoors, but the views of the New York City and New Jersey areas are superb and make for great picture taking. Actually, a photo enthusiast can spend an entire day taking pictures. There is a souvenir shop and restaurant available for a visitor's use. In summary, my wife and I view the World Observatory as a must attraction for anyone visiting New York.

Observatory Tour New York. This visit is wonderful value for money and not to be missedThe graphics are first class, the technology is informative and outstanding and staff knowledgeable and helpful.On a clear day the views are spectacular, recommend the IPad at $15 extra,if you are from out of town as we were

Fabulous experience. The observatory was very well organised and before we knew it we were in, through security and heading into the lifts. Once we were on the upper floors it was less crowded than I'd expected and we were able to walk round unrushed and to get up to the windows, with great views in all directions (25 mile visibility on the day we visited). We spent a couple of hours just watching the view change with the light.

Incredible!. Visited the Freedom Tower during our visit to New York.... In fact it was one of the reasons for returning to New York as it wasn't open during our last visit. We weren't disappointed! The initial journey in the lift to the 102nd floor was incredible and the first display (the New York movie) was breathtaking but won't say why as it would spoil it for future visitors! Spent quite some time just looking out at the view. We were very lucky as it was a very clear day. Definitely worth visiting but wouldn't bother with the iPad option as it was amazing enough just looking out across New York and beyond. Loved it! Would definitely go back!!

AMAZING VIEWS. We went at 6-8 so we could experience the views over New York when light and dark.We took plenty of photos in panoramic style. The views were breathtaking over the Hudson Brooklyn Bridge , Statue of Liberty.We visited this after the 911 Memorial well worth a visit.My daughters had never been we all fell in love with NYC.Will return again in a few years.K. N.L.

A must do. Freedom Tower is a must if you visit New York. It starts from the lift which has a display on the walls as you go up. At the top you have the option of having an ipad ,rented $15, but as you walk around this gives you highlights and information on what you are looking at, worth it. An amazing experience.

Unbelievable. Been up the Empire State building and the Rockefeller Building so we just had to go up One World Trade Center Observatory, the views as you can imagine are Amazing.We went into the restaurant and had a bite to eat and a few drinks and spent a few hours in there the food and drink are not that expensive.
Interesting place to visit. A lovely place to visit ,the memorial gardens are amazing,gets very busy so lots a crowds ! The museum is worth a visit but might be considered expensive tickets !

Beautiful and stunning views from its indoor observation platform. This is a must see building, both from the ground and of course, from its observation platform, which is an indoor 360d experience. Fantastically high up with great views looking back in to Manhattan and up the Hudson river. With a smart bar and restaurant at the top too - perfect to spend a good hour there.

Amazing experience with perfect clear sky. This was my first visit in an observatory this high. The elevators given an exciting presentation of the rising of this tower. After a short presentation when arriving at the 102th floor you walk to the observation deck with a breathtaking view.

This is a must . We went here on our trip and it does exactly what it says on the banner. See forever!!! Photo says it's all.
Amazing, worthwhile taking your time and make sure it's a clear day, if not it's pointless.
Brand new and well designed. We were there on a beautiful sunny day. Definitely worth the money. On top of the excellent 360 degree view, the elevator ride and the short show before are added bonus.

Excellent. Beautifully finished and a well arranged viewing platform. The designers have done an incredible job of making this a very immersive experience. The outlook is, as expected from the 100th floor, absolutely amazing with perfect city-scape views. Knowledgeable and entertaining staff and a cafe + restaurant to make more of a day out of it (although somewhat expensive). Highly recommend.

Great way to see new york.. A little pricy; large crowds (even with pre-paid tickets) with over the top theatrics and special effects. Nevertheless, the views were incredible and really gave a great perspective to NYC.
Brilliant. Slick & well organised . Really enjoyed our trip up to the observatory on 102/101&100 floors. Great views across Manhattan and the river. Went with kids aged 10&12 and they enjoyed it too.

Great views, but the queuing sucks. Once you make it up to the top the views are great, even better at dusk probably. The elevator ride, no matter how short, is a cool idea.But, the annoying queuing of 30-45 minutes in the "cellar" prior to the elevators take some of the fun off. I can't believe someone would queue another 30 mins at peak hours just to buy a ticket.

Amazing building.. Quite expensive considering essentially you are only paying to go to the top of a building. The staff were really nice though and very welcoming and enthusiastic compared to some of the other staff at the other observation decks. They don't force you to have a cheesy picture taken and just leave you in peace in general. There is quite a cool video in the elevator ride up to the top and an interesting introduction video you have to watch before you enter the observation deck, but it is only about one minute long and is actually pretty good! The observation deck is really big, there's plenty of windows to find a good spot to take pictures from despite the amount of visitors there. We went up on a clear day and the view was unbelievable in every direction, you can see literally the whole of the city in every direction and the city of New Jersey. They let you stay at the top for as long as you want and take as many pictures as you want, and there is even a restaurant and shop up there so ideal if you want to relax and enjoy the view with some food or drink. Probably the only observation deck I would pay again to go back up, as I would love to experience it at night. Another must visit.

Amazing Views. Strict security which is appreciated and understood. My son had his small 3" LED flashlight attached to his key chain confiscated. It was returned at the end of the tour. The views form the 102nd floor are amazing, even on a rainy day. The ride to the top is interesting and very fast. What I didn't like was the cruise ship type photo up selling. When you leave the elevator you are subjected to this Disny-ish presentation about New York, and then like at a crematorium, a curtain or blind falls away and you can see the NY views. Then you are herded through the photo line. Once you get through this, you are subjected to a sales pitch about "Ipad tour guides". after this, you are free to walk around, and as I have said previously have amazing 360 degree views.

A must do. Absolutely fantastic place. We booked online which was easy and made access easy without having to queue. Staff were efficient at dealing with visitors keeping queue times down. The whole experience was fabulous. A great ride to the top and amazing views of the city. A very humbling experience and one to make a must do.

Jaw dropping. This the best of the tall building observatories we've been on in various cities. The whole experience from the lifts to the views and the curtain raiser was superb.couldnt recommend this highly enough. We went on a cold wet day just after the rain had cleared, no queue.A must if you're visiting new York.

Glad to see the building done. We rolled in to this tour on a Monday morning. I wouldn't recommend this if you have to travel through rush hour in a taxi. We looked at the building crews video on the way in. Be ready for the video of Manhattan- through- time on the elevator walls. Interesting. Good views but a little impersonal with the glass. Ipads with info on all landmarks in the skyline are available. Small cafe available in the attraction. Good to see this building up and looming over the footprints of the former towers, Other buildings are in progress as well and things are finally looking up in this area.
Unbelievable. This place is amazing unrivalled veiws brilliant day out the staff were really helpful and really friendly. Thanks

Great Experience. We went on a very clear day and could see forever. The ride up and down in the elevator was excellent - would have liked to do that a few more times just to take in the visuals showing in the few seconds you are in it. There is a lot of space so no real over crowding once you got to the top and you could stay as long as you want. Excellent experience and I would definitely do it again.
Great if you like views from high places!. If you like fast elevators, panoramic views from high places, and crowds of people all vying for the best views, this is the perfect place for you.

Moving, so much to learn here. It is a show from the moment you get into the elevator. You're taken up 102 stories and there's a video of New York from 1500s to 2015 so you see the change as you go up. There is another short video show then the screen opens up to a breathtaking northward view of Manhattan. On this day, there was no wait in lines (school vacation, about 11 a.m.). There is a nice gift shop and a presentation as to the significance of the building and the World Trade Center area around. Unlike the Empire State Building, it is completely enclosed. A nice view of Brooklyn, NJ and Staten Island (and Statue of LIberty/Ellis Island). Also, you can also visit the Oculus, which is the strange looking white building next door, as well as walk around the block to visit the 9/11 Memorial. With two teens, they were engaged and truly enjoyed the couple of hours we spent there.

Great place to experience NY skyline. Best time to go is around 6:00 pm. That way you can experience the day time skyline as well as night time skyline. Get the ipad rental, Its great way to see all the locations.
Amazing views..... The best all round view of New York, brilliant staff full of information. We visited during the day .

wonderful views. We really liked our experience. It was a sunny morning and crowds were average on a weekday. You had to still push your way to the windows to get the best photos. Not much waiting time in lines for elevators. Observatory area very nicely arranged. Has some seating available.

Must see!. One of the best parts of the trip to NY. More than reasonable price you get blasted up 102 floors to the top observation deck to get a wonderful 360 degree view of the city! Closer to the Statue of Liberty so easier to see her, but still high and nice enough to almost see Central Park. Also a nice chance to say you had a meal at the top of the city.

Excellent alternative to ESB or the Rock. Maybe we were just lucky but we didn't pre-purchase and only had to wait about five minutes in the queue. Loved the elevator ride up to the Observation deck with the simulated trip through NYs history, and the views from the deck are simply astonishing. Clean, new, shiny and appropriate. Loved it.
Best experience in NYC. very good Show! Amazing views! Don't miss to use the tablet it is worth th 15$ especially if you can share with several People.

A HIGHlight. I visited the tower after receiving a coupon at the Century 21 department store saving me 20%. If you have a World Elite master card or certain other master cards you can also get priority access free. The regular adult fee is $32, but goes up to $37 from 6-7 PM. I happened to reach the ticket booth at 7. I still got to see daylight and then a gorgeous sunset over Jersey, and stayed until it was dark and the lights of the city blazed away. It's worth it to see it both daytime and nighttime if you can. There weren't too many people when I was there (I can imagine on a crowded day it would be intolerable) but there are enough annoying types to monopolize viewpoints or just use the windows for sitting (when there are plenty of benches) when others trying to take photographs. I actually gave up on a few choice perches because a couple of guys had basically staked their claim for an hour or because a group of bored-looking young'uns was sitting in a choice picture spot, texting and not even looking out the windows. Was wishing come of the very cheery and helpful workers would notice this and suggest they allow others in, but no such luck.Didn't try the food - bought a few souvenirs in the shop (typical - very much like the Space Needle or Willets Tower in Chicago, only with the Freedom Tower on the items instead). Still can't really figure out what the Skyport was supposed to do.The elevator is the fastest I've ever been on (an ear popping experience both coming and going) and while going up shows NYC from the XVI century on; going down, shows the skyline swirling around you.If you have to wait there are films of the construction crews to watch. Not having to wait, I can't comment on these.

Great place to get an overview of New York on a beautiful day!. We decided to book the tickets to go up One World Observatory based on a sunny day forecast. We loved it. I would recommend this for both New Yorkers and visitors alike. It is a great way to get a bird eye's view of the city. Now the focus is downtown. Though one could see Chrysler Building and Empire State Building clearly, one gets a very distant view of Central Park. I also recommend having lunch up here too. Where else can one dine with such a view as backdrop? Food was decent and service was friendly and professional. Really not that expensive considering the locale.

The views! . Wow! The views from the observatory are spectacular! Complete 360 of the skyline it's incredible to see. The whole experience from the lift to the video presentation was very well put together! Highly recommend!

One World view. The elevators up were fine. The view encompasses the entire surrounding skyline. You can rent ipads to locate landmarks. It is worth the price to see a 360 degree view of the New York skyline.

Best view in the city. This definitely is a "must see" for all tourists! On a clear day, you can see for miles. The information sessions are interesting, and the guides are extremely tourist-friendly. The highlight for our 7-year old grandson was being able to look from the 100th floor down onto the street by getting on a square that magnified what was going on. (Likely something like a periscope on a submarine.) We ate at One Dine, the sit-down restaurant on the 103rd floor, which was NOT a value. ($78 for three people at lunch, which included the tip.) The food was OK, the experience was nice, but this activity is definitely not a repeat for us.
What a fantastic experience . This is a fantastic experience that is truly great value and you can't stop wandering round looking at the views. This was the highlight of our NYC trip.

Amazing views. This is a beautiful building. Tours don't seem to be included in any of the passes and have to be booked in advance where you can chose a time. They do not let you in if you arrive early. The elevator experience is a great start to the experience. It's a cinematic timeline of the site on which it was built. The only problem was it went by so fast I would have liked to have seen it in pictures once we got out the elevator. There is a small film clip of New York life and a little teaser of the views before you get to the observation deck. The views are absolutely amazing! It is very relaxed and there is a cafe at the top. This was a great experience and on a clear day you can see what seems like forever. Definitely worth a visit.

Great experience. Visited the observation floor , quite an experience from the start , the lifts have full video screens showing the growth of Manhattan firm fields to sky scrapers .. The opening was good (won't spoil it ) . Would recommend the iPad viewers as they explained a lot and were great for identification of surroundings ... All in all a great experience .. Wonderful views
Amazing experience. Came with my friends for lunch. The staff were really personable and food was delicious. Lemon cheesecake to die for!
Well worth it. A fitting finale to our NYC visit. Definitely a highlight. We took the 7.15 slot - great having the day and night views.
Beautiful!. The elevator ride alone is with the trip! This is a must see! We spent a few hours at the top, the view is phenomenal. We also had dinner at ONE. Everything was perfect.

Amazing!. We had watched the video about this place, so we had an idea what to expect. It still was more amazing than we could have imagined! Absolutely beautiful! We rented the ipad since this was our first time in New York, but I'm not sure you need it. This is a do not miss while in New York!

Unique Experience. We decided to try and get tickets as a last minute treat before our flight home after a very rainy morning cleared to reveal beautiful sunshine. There were no queues so we bought tickets and excitedly stepped in to the elevator. Whilst being whisked up 102 floors in 48 seconds we were shown a history of construction as we ascended. We then watched a short film and had a wonderful surprise at the end of it, which I won't spoil for you! Ipads are available to hire and you can use them to pin point particular attractions and learn about them. Excellent informative attraction.

Stunning and slick. I will state the obvious, stunning 360 degree views. Both visits the line has been short with slick and efficient service by the staff . Being a new attraction you don't get the multiple lifts and queues of the empire state.

It is a great place to visit. I was expecting just a great view from the 100th floor observatory, but the visit was much more than that. The fun starts in the elevator and there's a lot of technology involved. Spare at least 3 hours to experience it all. Be aware that food and souvenirs are expensive up there.

Wow!. The views were stunning and it was well worth the money. The queues were not too long - we had booked in advance. We spent ages walking all round, picking out landmarks. The lift ride to the top was very well done - could have done with it moving more slowly so that we could take in all the information. The glass floor 'street view' is a bit of a joke, since it's only simulated. We would go back though and would recommend a visit.

Amazing views!. This was our third trip to the Ground Zero area, first time to the memorial, second time to the memorial museum and this time to the observatory. This was early on a Saturday morning so the line moved super fast. Time from tickets to the elevator was about 7 minutes. TSA style security, so be ready for that. The elevators though, those things are amazing. Every wall of each elevator is a massive LCD screen and I won't ruin what it does. The views though, wow. You can see probably 4 states from up there, not to mention everything and anything in NYC. Be sure to check out the presentations at each side, they include local events and information regarding the construction of the new WTC vs the old. Great experience.

Being at the top of the world by yourself isn't so bad.. In fact, it was perhaps the most awe-inspiring part of my recent trip to NYC. This trip has been a dream of mine for my whole life, so to realize it was absolutely amazing. This was perhaps the climax of the whole thing - especially when the projection theater screens rose and there in front of us was the entirety of the city. I loved every single meticulously planned theatrical aspect, and the servicepeople were exceptionally nice and willing to help at all times. Thank you for an experience I'll never forget!

Do not miss!. Ive been twice and both times were just as breathtaking and emotional.It si very well organized and when there is a line it moves swiftly.You can purchase your tickets ahead of time and bypass the queue.If it is a cloudy foggy day do not bother you need nice weather for picture taking.

BREATHTAKING. After visiting the 9/11 museum we had booked tickets for One World Observatory. What a magnificent building. Booked the priority line jumping tickets and it is money well spent. Into the elevators then UP about 1/4 mile into the sky in about 48 seconds. Led round to a sort of quick film show which is ok then the screen goes up and you get your first glimpse of the skyline. Words cant describe the views. Just WOW. The screen drops back down and you are lead to the observation deck to take the sights in at your own speed. If there is one very slight negative there is no outside viewing platforms so you sometimes get reflections on the photos but it doesn't spoil the adventure. Done ESB and TOTR so this gives a completely different outlook to the city. Well worth the entrance fee.

A must do when in NYC. We've luckily been up many tall towers (Dubai, Toronto etc.) but this fine building and excellent observation deck and secret reveal when you get up top (I wont spoil it) is among the best. The views of the memorial pits from the previous twin towers, the attached shopping mall and dining and the superb work done to make this building and those around it a fitting tribute is superb.

A different perspective of NYC. After visiting NYC many times over the past 16 years and seeing the twin towers and then the aftermath followed by the years of constructing this magnificent building it was like the icing on the cake to go up to the top. The views like any other in NYC are spectacular but because it is downtown you see a different side to it. It is quite expensive to get in and there were 4 of us so only reason I've not given top marks but there is plenty to see inside and out, as you make your way to the elevators there is the story behind the building, accounts from the construction workers etc which really reminded you about the emotion this building gives after everything that happened since 9/11. Once your up top there are people telling stories about NY, you can use ipads to help guide you to the views you are seeing, definately worth a visit.

Cool experience!. I actually arrived late for the time I had chosen on my reservation. That was not a problem at all (considering the slow time of the day). I went right in. Very efficient security system and a AWEsome experience. It's worth it. A must in NYC.

Such a unique experience!. This was about $30 per person and we just got our tickets at the front desk as we hadn't pre-booked. The experience itself was amazing! I don't want to waste it but the start of it gives you goosebumps and the views are incredible. Thats all i will say about this amazing experience but you MUST MUST MUST do it!!

AMAZING views, high tech experience. Wasn't sure what to expect but what a spectacular structure this is!! The elevator ride is educational in itself-I wish it went a bit slower so I could read all the info. Along the ride up, it shows the history of the area via film projected on the walls. When you reach the top, you are instructed how to use a 'pad' to highlight specific locations, by east, west, north and south views. Spend as much time as you want roaming the perimeter (it's completely enclosed so even those with 'high anxiety' will be fine) Great views and more information than you can absorb in one visit.

Not to be missed. We have been up both the Rock and Empire State buildings and wanted to see the city from a new perspective. We were not disappointed. We had previously booked our tickets online and paid for the priority admission line. This was well worth it and got through security quickly. Then into line for a very quick ride to the observatory. There are some surprises on the way up so will let you see these for yourself. The view from the 360 walk round observatory are spectacular. If you know the city then no need for the iPad guide but if you don't then good idea to get orientated. There are free talks by City Pulse which are well worth listening to.Would recommend this to anyone from first time visitors to return travellers.
Only good. Because is the only tower where cant get outsideAll is technologic but the price is hight and the Wi-Fi is not perfect

Wonderful View and Interesting Elevator Ride. We purchased the Priority tickets so that we could enter at a specific time. But if you have time to spare, forget the additional $20 and buy regularly-priced tickets. The elevator ride to the top was very interesting as you get a historical picture of NYC from the 1500s to the present. SKIP the presentation about the tablets helping you identify the various landmarks (unless you want help identifying such landmarks) and wonder around the observatory on your own. TIP: If visibility is near-zero and you have Priority tickets, change the time and date of your viewing.

First visit since last to WTC...a bittersweet experience and while the restaurant isn't Windows on the World.... Very much enjoyed the Observatory and restaurant for lunch. It was a bittersweet experience, but well worth it. Lovely day. Lovely view. Lots of fun.

Best views. The total experience is amazingThe ride to the top is part of the show, which builds until the unveiling of a world know sky lineA great place to spend a few hours, with top of the world muffins

Breathtaking. You know what you're going to get when you visit this attraction, and it doesn't disappoint.Very reasonably priced, and left to take in the views at your own leisure,(there is no time constraint). After passing through security you enter a video tunnel showing various stages of construction and workers giving their opinions on the building. Then you queue for the lift. There are four lift's so even though there may be a few waiting the wait is not too long.Once at the top you are greeted by another video wall showing a brief overview of life in New York, this then moves to reveal the view from the 102nd floor.From then on you are free to walk 360.deg. around the observatory at your own leisure. There is a restaurant and gift shop at the top and staff giving a bit of a talk about New York City.A visit you won't forget.

EXCELLENT THOUGH PRICEY. Even as a jaded life-long New Yorker I do recommend a trip to the observatory. The view -- of course. Aided (at extra cost) by an i-Pad that labels the sights at which you are looking. Staff is well-trained and helpful. Waiting area is extensive and well-done a la Disney. Elevator ride up and down is worth repeating. On the way up you see Manhattan through the years projected on all sides. On the way down, you see the view from each floor through which you descend. I only wish it weren't so expensive.

Awesome views - better than any other in NYC. This is a must do! I think the views are better than from any other building (including Empire State Building). They make it a great experience going up and going down. Worth every penny. I will go back every time I visit NYC.

Amazing View. Super cool place to visit. Great 365 degree view of the whole region. The experience starts in the lift as you can see the city going through time. Once you are at the top there is plenty of space to move around and you can take your time looking at the views. Pick a clear, sunny day and you will be amazed.

Great experience!. I loved my time here and would highly recommend it! My first visit to NYC was a year after 9/11 and my second was about five years later... To see the transition was amazing! The testimonials from the people who worked on this project and the attention to detail made this my favorite of all the attractions I visited! Job very well done! AND the views are outstanding :)

Enough With Trying To Sell Me Stuff Already!. This attraction is really well done, and there are aspects to it that depend somewhat on the effect of surprise, which I won't describe here, except to say they are well worth experiencing. The view is second to none. Unfortunately, the first thing you experience when you get to the top is they try to hawk these little tablet things to help you figure out what you are looking at, for an extra charge, of course. I'm not saying they shouldn't have them available to those who want to use them, but it really felt like a sales pitch the moment we got to the top. I would have enjoyed learning more about the building while I was there. I understand the bottom few floors are built as a bunker so that if there is ever another plane crash, the building won't completely collapse. I guess some would not enjoy hearing about that while standing near the top of the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere.

Amazing views. Expensive tickets but worth the trip. Elevator got us up and back down quickly. The views were amazing. They have a cafe up top where you can eat. The history of the making of the building was awesome. People are talking about the building and providing additional info on NYC. Great trip. Do not miss!
Top of the Modern World. This is pretty mind blowing to be fair.From the elevator ride to the actual viewing tower it is class.Bit of a long queue to get back down but overall a fab experience

Amazing views. We visited on a very clear day and had great views. I haven't visited any of the other viewing platforms in New York so can't compare them, but was very happy with this experience. You get a specific time to visit so it does not get too busy. The views are spectacular and I suppose the difference from the other platforms is that you get a view of the Statue of Liberty. We did take up the offer of the iPads ($15, on offer for 2). They were very helpful and identified the different buildings you viewed. The staff were friendly and helpful. We ate in the restaurant which was very good - could be a little on the pricey side.
views views and views. better than freedom tower because its not in close glassed box. here you can breath and see the all city go early lines go smooth.
Amazing!. Great view from the top to all Manhattan . It is a must to be there and take pictures! Just only sixty seconds you need to be on the top of the tallest building. 102 nd floor!

Amazing. Went here after visiting the 9/11 memorial and museum... We were advised it was zero visibility and if we still wanted to go up there would be no refund but hey this kind of opportunity only comes once in a life time so we went anyway... The views were amazing, even in "zero visibility" and the fact that we could see it snowing from the 102nd floor but on the ground it had become rain was surreal! Totally amazing feeling... Well apart from the building swaying!

Really good views and plenty of room to see from all sides. People say that the view from the Empire State Building is better as you are in the middle of Manhattan as opposed to at the lower end with One World Observatory. True, but having done both I can say that this one had a really big wow factor. It starts that the wait is far less, the elevator up with the movie inside making it look like you are outside is really cool, the big reveal when you wait to enter the top floor and then the top to bottom huge windows with the truly 365 degree views were amazing. And you are inside, not freezing or sweating away!Advantages of being in lower Manhattan: a closer look at the Staute of Liberty, Ellis Island and 911 Monument. You are so high you can see the ocean, all airports, bridges, parks etc. We ended up sitting there for a good hour, which is not a problem at all, and there is so much room at the windows that you can take as long as you like where you like without feeling you have to make room for someone else coming in after you.Worth every penny

Expensive but must do when in NYC. Get there early morning and buy the regular ticket. When you get to the top they will offer an IPAD to show exactly what buildings/landmarks to look at in 8 languages. This is an addition $15. I would recommend spending the money if your not familar with NY and NJ as it will tell the names of buildings, stadiums and landmarks with close ups.There are several presentations by the monitors in a circle. Make sure you get your moneys worth by attending a couple of the free programs.

Good but could be better. The way in via the PATH is a little confusing and you have to keep an eye out for the signs. You then have to go up an escalator, get your tickets, come down the same escalator and then go through security.The lift up is excellent. Could do without the iPad spiel, but what was most disappointing was the fact that the view is not 360, there are lots of viewing obstructions and worst of all the glass reflects a lot of your photos.Still an awesome experience but the view from the Empire State takes some beating.

Incredible 360 degree views. We went here after visiting the 9/11 memorial. The queues were not too bad and moved reasonably quickly. The lady on the ticket desk was not vey friendly and ignored us bar taking the cash. The journey to the 102 floor was informative and the lift experience was brilliant. You don't feel as if you are going up 102 floors. Once you step out the pre-film sets the scene before the reveal of the view. You then move down to floors 101 and 100 for the main views which are immense. Really clear day and you can see for miles. The journey back down in the lift is equally enthralling as the one going up. Highly recommended.
See Forever!!. This is an amazing experience. You will LOVE it. I suggest getting a scheduled tour ahead of time to avoid lines and crowding.

The Observing Deck. So when you first get there they take you to the elevator and you watch the city go through time on the surrounding walls of the elevator. There are 102 floors and your ears do pop and it doesn't feel right but it gets better. I would advise you to get a selfie stick if you are visiting New York because there are great photo opportunities here and at other places. Overall it was a absolutely great visit.

Best View in Manhattan. Free for military...just show your ID! Skip the Empire State Building and visit One World Center instead. Multimedia elevator experience "builds" Manhattan from the ground up as you ascend the tower. Fully enclosed and unobstructed 360* views of Tristate area. Beautiful at dusk and night. Amazing view of 9/11 memorial and great part of any trip to view the site. Highly recommended!

Phantastic View. We arrived shortly after opening and there were no queues at all! Staff was very friendly. We were offered interactive tablets to give us descriptions of the buildings that could be seen, good idea for people who have not been to New York City before. We stayed quite a while, you could sit down and savour the georgeous views. Also somebody told facts about Manhattan and its typical points of interest.To have just few people around us without all the usual shoving and poking was most relaxing. Prices at the souvenir stands reasonable. The ride in the elevator was just fantastic- with a animated 360' view!

Choose your day wisely.... It started to snow while I was visiting... Limiting visibility. Also quite the enterprise, with Apple viewing screens to help you with landmarks ($15) and pictures of yourself for sale. The ride up 102 floors was pretty cool and interactive!
Book ahead to avoid the queues. Exciting show when you get to the top. Great views of NYC. Be sure to book a timed ticket to avoid queuing.

Wow wow wow!. We booked tickets and time slot in advance which I would recommend (do a weather forecast and book on a sunny/clear day).Only a ten min wait to go through security. What an incredible experience! They have created such an incredible experience from the moment you enter and the journey in the lift is magical. The best 360 degree views of New York, breathtaking...

Great view of lower part of Manhattan. The One World Obversatory is a great visit on a rainy day. Staff warned us that we would have zero visibility, but luckily for us that was not the case. You have a 360 view of lower Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty. The elevator ride up is breathtaking, the multimedia show as well. The only thing I would have liked it to be able to go outside.

Spectacular views over the city. Really good, they show you a film in the lift (all four walls) of the history of Manhattan, then you file into a room with a film showing over NYC scenes. The screens lift to reveal the real thing and it's properly breathtaking. I've been up to the top of the Burj Khalifa but this one is much more amazing. How wouldn't it be with views of the Brooklyn Bridge, the Empire State Building etc..... and out to sea the Statue of Liberty and all the little boats buzzing about in the harbour. Tourist tat is expensive so are the hot dogs (and you'll get a much better one from a cart on the street) The staff are a bit overly cheery in that American way, but all in all a brilliant attraction

Absolutely incredible. I visited this building a couple weeks ago on my first trip to NYC with my 9 year old daughter, father and step-mom. The feeling of being in this building is indescribable. The hair on my arms stood on end the entire time and the whole experience is one you cannot miss out on if you visit NYC. The architecture and technology is amazing. A beautiful and clean building with wonderful staff members. My daughter was so interested in learning about 9/11 and was awestruck when we reached the top, as was I. You are able to rent an IPad for $15 to explain the views and information about the surrounding areas which was a huge help for my girl. The price is very expensive but it is so worth it!

Awesome view of NYC and surrounding area. I would recommend visiting the One World Observatory a little bit before Sunset for two reasons. One, the lines were almost non-existent. Drove past it earlier in the day and the line snaked around outside. Two, you can see the views during the daylight and then watch as the city transitions to night. Seeing NYC all lit up is a must see from that height.
Awesome. Super cool place to visit. Brilliantly done and what an incredible view. No pressure to 'move on' and plenty of time to dwell. Loved it and got some great photos
Awesome view. It was great to see the city from such a high altitude at night, very beautiful. The night was clear and scenario was breath taking.
views excellent. overwhelming view as blind went up. wonderful views. food reasonable in cafe or restaurant if want to be seated
Amazing view, really worth a visit. I'm not a lover of heights but I made the trip up to the top and i'm very glad I did. Views are amazing and you look down onto other sky Scrapers "Pretty Mad".

Amazing views. A wonderful experience. Once the lift takes off you are treated to an amazing show until you reach the top. Once there you can take your time looking at the views. You can have lunch/coffee there too. The security is so thorough and you feel very safe at all times. The only one downside was the woman who served us when we bought our entrance ticket. Her name was Petra and she did not look once at us while she served us, we looked at her all the time trying to catch her eye but she couldn't of cared less. She was too busy chatting to another sever. In fact she charged us more for one of our tickets which we didn't notice until we were through security. Petra definitely needs customer training or if she doesn't like the public put her in the back room. Apart from that one problem the rest of the visit was fantastic and well worth it.
Fabulous view. Fabulous view of New York. Best visit before and during the sunset. If you have to choose one observatory to see the city from the heights, this is the one!

Just WOW!!!. If you do one thing at Ground Zero, you have to do this! It's extremely well thought out & had you captured from the moment you walk in.The lifts are cleverly done with video views on all walls & ceiling of you coming out of the ground & travelling up. You are then presented with more cleverly done digitized views on a 3D wall before the wall lifts to show you the most breathtaking view of Manhattan! You are then invited into the viewing areas, no time limit given so you are able to absorb everything in your own time. You can hire an iPad that will tell you what you are seeing & is worth the $15 charge. There is a gift store, cafe & restaurant if you feel the need.Amazing place & breathtaking views, I would revisit in a heartbeat!

Fabulous!. We had booked to go into the museum at 3pm, but made our way down town early on a Sunday morning. The place was near deserted and the best time to come I think. We hadn't planned a visit here but decided to go and find out the wait times. Arriving early we could go straight in. Paid for tickets (no queue) and went straight to the security line which took the longest part of the visit. It's a small price to pay to make sure everyone is safe. With that bit done we headed for the elevator, which was an experience in itself, (I won't spoil it for you) and out to the observation floor. Although you can't go outside, which for the day we went was a bitterly cold wind, the views are amazing and great views of Liberty, Staten Island and more. You do need to angel your camera to avoid reflection back but you will not be disappointed. We sat for a while listening to the guide telling you about the area and history,originally from the the UK the lady was very good and entertaining to listen to. We spent around an hour up here and then back out into the cold.

Stunning views. Well presented attraction. Amazing views (on a clear day...).The difference between a brand new observatory like this and old ones like the Empire State and the Rock is stark. They have their art deco charm, whereas this is more like a modern theme park ride and breaks up the queuing with informative displays. Though there were no queues at Sunday 9am, nor at 5pm when we passed through another day.Both have their place. The older one have the advantage of being able to go outside for better photographs (no reflections off glass). But if I had to chose only one, this would be it.

First visti. We went at 11am on Wednesday 6 April, this week. 64 dollars me and my daughter.There wasn't a big queue as it was easy still, the cost of 64 dollars for two adults, Staff pointed the way to go, and once you go into the lift , you will be amazed at how quickly it takes you up, with a on screen story playing on the screen in the lift,. Once you come out of the lift you go into a viewing room where you stand and watch the screens giving you different aspects of New York, and then the surprise, which I won't spoil, it was just so awesome. Then you go in to the actual viewing bit you can walk around at your own pace,360 degrees views, you can pay for a mini iPad which gives you info on the sites etc, but we didn't as there are plenty of staff that can help or explain things to you.You get your photo taken with the attraction in the back drop, we bought our ones, for 25 dollars.We were lucky because the weather was clear and sunny, so we got the most amazing views of Manhattan.The views of the Statue of Libtery, and Ellis Island were good and clear ,This is truly a must if you go to New York, the experience will stay with us forever ,both me and my daughter agreed that was the best view ever , better than Empire State BUilding. We didn't try the cafe, or the gift shops.Amazing experience!

Gorgeous and Solemn . The entire experience from the park to the observatory was beautifully done. It is a chance to reflect on those who lost their lives and how the City rebuilt. The elevator rides up and down are amazing in terms of showing the history of NYC and the current landscape of the City. I could have stared for hours at the views from observatory. Nice job to those built this memorial.
Amazing!!. This is an absolute must whilst in New York. Amazing views and a great bar and restaurant! Entering the lift is a surprise - don't want to spoil the rest of the vist!

Great view. Great experience, the show starts already with the elevator ride and continues when up there. Great view from 100th floor. Definitely not cheap, but on clear days worth the money, already just for the elevator ride. It's a must see for New York trips.

Took the trip to the Top. I loved the view even on an overcast day. The entire event was Disney-like, with displays downstairs, and videos in the elevator on the way to the top, and even small talks and exhibits on the observation floor. They did try to get us to buy photos of us on top, as well as rent us iPads that were interactive

Very swish!. Very well executed from the elevator to the staff at the top who are there to tell you all about NYC. Plenty of space to move around, stunning views. Only 4/5 because Top Of The Rock still pips it for me (better views and you are outside)
Unbelievable. Don't have the words to describe this place. Great experience, emotional. I just loved it. To me sums up the city and the people.

Wow. The day we booked it was zero visibility and was able to revisit next day.Not a cloud in the sky and was able to see for miles.Fantastic view only down side restaurant and gift shop very very expensive $38 for a t shirt if priced better sure they would sell a lot more.
A unique experience...!!. One of the places that I will always remember, you can see the whole city from the top and you can admire its beauty! The Building is amazing...!!

outstanding views. Worth a visit, and try and visit the oculus transport terminal amazing design. I would not recommend the fifteen dollars to use the eye pads to zoom in on buildings unless you want to pick out some specific buildings from the air.

Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit but I advise you to book tickets to save time. However, the queues are massive even if you have tickets. There is a lot of confusion about which line you should be in and staff were not helpful. Be prepared to wait for at least 30 minutes before you even get past security. It is worth the wait and a must see when visiting New York.

Breathtaking. This was the absolute highlight of our first visit to New York. From the incredible elevator ride (watch the walls closely from the moment the doors close in order to see the city evolve around you over sixty seconds), to the stunning views of the city beneath you, this was a magical experience. The information tablets kept our children occupied, but to be honest just being able to see the city from such a unique perspective was enough in itself, and we happily spent an hour just looking. This experience is definitely worthwhile building a day around, especially if you link it with a bus tour of the city. Just outside, the memorial pools for the 9/11 victims offer a solemn and very thought-provoking element to the visit.

Amazing views!!!. I've been to the top of many buildings - ESB, The Rock, Willis Tower, CN Tower - but no view compares to this. We visited on a perfect cloudless day at approximately 5:30pm. Didn't plan on it, but it was so amazing, that we stayed for the sunset at 7:30 and watched the city lights come alive - the "Magic Hour". So worth it. I would not recommend renting the Ipad for $15. It really only highlights the famous spots, needs to be recalibrated all the time, and is frustrating to use. There were so many buildings that were not identified. Very disappointed. We had drinks at the bar - very expensive but worth the view! The elevator ride up and down is awesome - a video all around as you ascend and descend. Pretty sweet. Loved the visit.

Amazing views on a clear day!. This is definitely worth the price to do while on vacation and if the weather is clear. The views of Manhattan and the five boroughs are amazing. Plus the views of New Jersey aren't too bad either. ;-) they do have a restaurant on top but we did not go to that. You can plan on waiting in line to go up to the top for 15 to 20 minutes. Once at the top you can walk all around the observatory to take in the views. To save some money, you can bring a backpack and have water bottles and snacks inside.

My favourite outing. Really interesting lift ride up with video showing you the height and the development At the top it is enclosed but you can see for miles! We had lunch up at the top (with a few cocktails) you do not need to pre book the restaurant /bar. There is also a cheaper cafe

You can see for miles!. This is just an incredible building. We got out tickets via City SightSeeing buses. We had a very short wait to go up and the lifts are just incredible (I won't say why as it would spoil the fun!).Once you are up there the whole experience is so well done and on a sunny day you really can see for miles! Just watch out for the cost of having a snack up there. Four bacon, egg and cheese rolls plus juice was about $80! Worth it though to be eating looking out across NYC!

Amazing experience. This is not just a ride up to look around. It is an experience from the very beginning. You will learn about the building and a little history of what NYC was like overtime. The views are also incredible. It was well worth the expense. Do it on a sunny day.

Outstanding views. These are most defiantly some of the best views I have ever seen. We had a clear day so the views were the best. The whole experience was slick from start to finish. A must see for any trip to NYC.
great views!. Great views, we really enjoyed our visit with some out of town family! Very good organized agenda for all the appointments.

Amazing Views - Worth every penny. My cousin wanted me to go to One World Observatory with him. All he kept telling me about was this very cool elevator ride. I honestly didn't expect more than that and was kind of disappointed in how expensive the elevator ride was. Boy was I wrong. This was so much more than an elevator ride. I recommend this to anyone visiting NYC.

All of NYC. We had a great day... there wasn't a queue! We went straight in..the whole experience was better than expected.Because it wasn't busy we spent 2 hours up there, had a snack and a sit down.It was Wednesday 6th April 2pm.... sun was shining.

Amazing views and so much quicker than the empire/Rockefeller. Really great experience from start to finish and the fact that we actually were able to FaceTime/ Skype from the top made it even more enjoyable for people back home.

My favorite observatory in NY!. Having done the Empire State and the Top of the Rock, I didn't think it could get any better.... Well, it can! One World observatory is just magical. And it starts in the elevator! The experience is quite unique, as they show you a video of the construction of the building through the years as you go up, on the walls surrounding you. Can't quite explain it... But we were all impressed!The view itself is just astonishing!Quite pricey though: $32, or $37 when you go during pic hours (around sunset).We took the latter option cause it was great to see NY by day, NY during sunset, and NY by night, when lights start to illuminate the city. We stopped at the bar to have a glass of wine and enjoy the view.An experience I would definitely recommend! 5*****

Best site to visit in NYC. By far this is the best & most emotional site to visit while in Manhattan. You must be sure to by tickets in advance. If you can afford the extra money it is definitely worth the dollars to pick the time slot & be able to skip the long ticket lines. Be prepared to spend a few hours both in the observatory & then again in the museum. It is a learning experience for young & those of old enough to have witnessed & experienced the devastation of 9/11. IT IS A MUST VISIT WHILE IN NY.

Don't miss when in NYC. I was in town for business and took the weekend to visit the new 9/11 Memorial. It is really worth. The new tower is amazing and the views you can get from the observatory are breath taking. I was lucky enough to be there on a sunny day and chose to go up close to sunset.
