You can get different shades of orange/ yellow being reflected on the skyscrapers and after that the amazing lights from NYC. You can check out the bridges, Brooklyn, the river. The iPad program they rent is also worth.
I love this place . Last year we visited New York and didn't have time to visit. All I can say is wow. This place is awesome. The views are amazing and it looks great. This place is not to be missed!

Don't miss this!. If you only do one thing while in New York, make sure its a visit to the observatory. Words can't describe the breathtaking views of New York, its far superior to the Empire State or Top of The Rock. Tip: one of the guides advised us to exit into the new transportation hub they have built underground. It had only opened and wandering around we suddenly found ourselves in the new Westfield shopping centre across the street. The designer shops were a little out of our price range but there is a great foodcourt there with amazing views of the river and lovely walkway outside.

Amazing view, Long Lines. The views at the top are amazing, and it's easy to spend quite a bit of time at the top, looking at the city below and all around you. If you've never been before, its a must do on a trip to NYC. We visited in July. The city was hot, and the line outside for tickets was LONG. We bought online tickets via our cell phones standing outside and were able to bypass the line and go right in for the next tour, so I recommend ticketing in advance just to avoid any line going up. The elevator ride up is pretty interesting, as the elevator is lined with screens that show how the city grew from nothing into the metropolis you'll see at the top. That's just the first part of the "show" before it finally lets you see the skyline for yourself. If you love NYC, the whole thing might bring a tear to your eye, as it did my companion who had lived in the city for several years and only recently moved away for a new job. My only complaint is that we also faced a LONG line going back down when we were done. That one couldn't be avoided.Tickets are not cheap. They were $30 each for the two of us last July. I would go again myself, but only with someone who has never been there.
Breathtaking . This tour is amazing what a view of the city from the deck just walked round taking in all the parts of new York amazing view

Wow, Just Wow!. What an amazing experience, when that theatre screen is lifted and You see the New York skyline it's breathtaking and awe inspiring. The elevator up to the observatory is absolutely fantastic as well, Watching New York City being built right before Your very eyes is crazy. The gift shop is a little pricey but You just have to get a little reminder of how beautiful the City looks from the top. For $15 You can hire an iPad that uses augmented reality which shows You different parts of New York and gives You a helicopter like ride on screen as You fly over to Queens and other areas. If the weather isn't great then this is the best place to see the NYC Skyline as its indoors and You can see all of NYC.

Amazing View. A bit too much build up before you get to see the view. Although the view would be better if standing outdoors it is still an amazing panoramic view through glass on the 102nd floor. Crowded and claustrophobic though.

Great experience, great views. We did this on an overcast day however the views were not too bad at all.The experience starts with a 42 second elevator ride to the 102nd floor in which they show you a quick movie of the growth of New York, next they show you a short film and then lift the screen to show you the view all very good they then take you down a level and encourage you to rent an ipad to pin point specific buildings for an extra $15 which I thought was a little bit expensive considering the entrance price and all the gifts in the gift shop were very over priced for what they were.Overall I would recommend it but don't fall for all the extras as it can work out expensive

Don't miss it when in NYC. We made the Observatory a must-see on our spring break trip to New York City. A highlight was the elevator ride with the history of the city in pictures. Of course, the views are spectacular.

Fantastic and highly recommended!!!. This is a must do. I went with my husband,7 year old son and 11 year old niece. The view is unbelievable and must be experienced. We had lunch in the restaurant with the best view of New York you could ask for.
Brilliant! A must see!. You have to go to see the view from 102nd floor! Not to give anything away, it is phenomenal! Get your ticket as soon as you can, this has to be heart of your visit to NYC.

Amazing!. Probably my most favourite thing that I done out there, and I done a lot. Utterly amazing, 110% recommend doing this. Make sure it's a nice day though, as I'd imagine it being a waste of a time traveling up in cloudy/foggy weather.

A Great View -- if you don't mind being treated like cattle. The good news -- it's a great view in all directions. But it's pretty pricy and even when it wasn't very busy we felt like we were herded like cattle -- actually more like sources of revenue. We were herded off the elevator to an area where a woman tried to sell us pictures of ourselves (what?? -- no-one has smartphones with cameras?) and then to an area where a man tried to sell us on the rental of an iPad with some sort of "experience" on it. WE ARE HERE TO SEE THE VIEW !!Even when you are taking in the view there is someone selling something.And could someone explain why the ticket sales are on another floor from the line for the elevator?

Awesome. My first trip to New York, one of the highlights was this visit. The amazing lift! fabulous views over the city. The restaurant and cocktails were very good, although a bit expensive, but so worth it.

The best thing I've ever made. This was so great at all; I really enjoyed this experience, the building is so huge and you can see everything from the obervatory! The price is quite small, due to the view you get on NYC, NJ, and the Hudson as well !!

Stunning. This was just breathtaking. The elevator ride was like nothing I've ever seen. The technology and show they put on in the elevator is so neat. The views are just out of this world. You can see 8 bridges, statue of Liberty, Times Square, and so much more. How cool is it to be in the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere?! They really thought of the visitor and how to wow them. This is definitely worth and trip and is spectacular. My mouth dropped quite a few times. So cool! It's worth a visit even if you've already been to the top of the Rock and the Empire State Building. This had to be one of my favorite things to do in NYC.

It is worth the experience. We chose to take the tour at sunset. The sunset wasn't the greatest on this particular day, but the experience to be so high, especially at night, was outstanding. We paid extra to skip the line, which was also well worth the additional expense.

Prepare for a real surprise view - American Style. I had looked forward to this trip for 9 months and was not disappointed. After wandering around the Ground Zero Commenerative Park , water features and victims wall, which were tinged with a natural stillness and provided time for reflection we proceeded to the new Freedom Tower. This was American preparation and presentation at its very best and well worth making the trip. Well organised and superbly delivered. We purchased tickets at the best prices direct with the website. Very slick, efficient with the facility to self print tickets at home before you travel. This is not a cheap day out but the memories should last. The elevators to the top are rapid, and something that I had worried about as I have a bit of a phobia about lifts and enclosed spaces. However, it was unexpectedly pleasant and there was no real sensation of movement. I could hardly believe we had arrived, but the journeys both up and down were filled with distractions and visual information. There is a cafe and shop at the top and a leisurely opportunity to wander around the top 2 floors through 360 degrees and enjoy the long distance views. For me this was the highlight trip of our stay in New York.
Fantastic views. Go early in the morning if you can, or prebook the Express tickets, it's definitely worth it. The views are amazing. Beautiful. Enjoyed the experience.
A must do. A fantastic experience, as soon as you step into the lift it is just WOW all the way through. We went early to avoid the queues .

Great views. We bought the fast track entry ticket and were glad to miss the queues. However, once you get inside, it is a bit like a theme park and school trip rolled into one. Lots of people trying to sell you things like photos, iPad map of the view of the city to help orientate yourself. And people giving talks, really loudly! For our liking it was too busy (a few days after Easter, in the middle of the day, so lots of school kids). Also it was so warm. The views are outstanding, but don't expect any outstanding photos as you are behind glass (unlike the 86th floor of the Empire State) and get reflection from it. We'd also done a helicopter tour the previous day, and to be honest we didn't really need to go to the Observatory. But as it is the largest building in the Western Hemisphere, we thought we ought to, something to cross of the list!

The new "Must See & Do" in NYC. This is the new Observatory on the list in NYC but most advanced from a technology standpoint. I encourage you to rent the iPad especially for kids to learn and identify the buildings and neighborhoods they see.

Breathtaking!!. We had previously been to Empire State and Top of the Rock. This is just as good if not better! Because of the timed tickets the line is not as long. From the beginning, walking through the bedrock, the elevator (wow and cool!) To the show at the top this is a great production. The views are magnificent. We found a good deal for tickets on line, they are currently doing a $99 family 4 pack. I have been to the top of other attractions around the world and this is definately on par with them. You should go!
It´s worth the line and the money. If you want to get the full picture of New York don´t miss this. It´s Worth the line and the money. You will get a surprise riding up in the elevator.

Best attraction by far..and reasonably priced.. This was one of the most enjoyable venues we visited in NYC....right by Ground Zero, the tower is an affordable and amazing experience. I would suggest that you pre purchase them to avoid long lines and you will get a specific time frame to enter the tower. The elevator ride up and down is as thrilling as any ride at the fair. The elevator shoots up quickly and seeing NYC being built from the ground up is amazing. Surround sound makes the experience come alive. When you get to the top it is fully enclosed so you don't have to fight the wind like you do at the Empire State Building. Only down side is if you take pictures the camera angle sometimes reflects a glare on the pictures.Take time to sit down and enjoy the show and experience different parts of the city and the different places to explore...very informative. They do have a restaurant up on top and the food looked amazing and better than average.

Amazing. This was our first stop on a recent trip to NYC and we were amazed by the view. We would recommend spending the $15 for the added tablet experience as it provided great historical and cultural background on many of the landmarks you can see from the observatory. If you go in the afternoon, no need to buy the VIP pass. If you have a MC Elite card, you can buy a regular pass and then skip the line once you arrive.

Fab views, well worth it . We had a pre-booked time slot and unlike previous reviewer didn't think it was a problem to get there on time, we booked an early shot so it was the first thing we did in the day. Although the tickets were expensive we thought they were worth it. Your photos are taken on entry but there was no pressure to buy them at the end and you could say no if you didn't want them taken. The elevator visual display is great as is the unveiling of the view. I also liked the interview with the construction workers. The views were fabulous as it was a clear day, I would say 50+ miles. There was no pressure to walk round quickly and you could spend as long or as little as you like. The gift shop was nice with lots of choice but as with all these places overpriced. We didn't go to either the coffee shop or restaurant so unable to comment on them.

Amazing views of New York!. Had read a little about this experience before I went so thought I knew what to expect. I really did not! There is a walk through part after security which tells the tale of how the OWO came to be designed and the team of engineers who built it talk to you. You then take a lift up to the top Observatory floor 1250 feet up. A film is played and then the screen lifts. No amount of reviews will prepare you for what you then see. I literally cried in awe. The screen will,then drop again and you are taken through the next floor down (where there is a cafe) and given the opportunity to hire a tablet for $15 which shows you where all of the sights are and tells you a bit about the buildings. Then it is down to the next floor for the 360 degree observation and gift shop. The views were magnificent. Floor to ceiling windows so great view over Manhattan, New Jersy, Staten Island, Brooklyn etc. Manhattan becomes dwarf like in comparison!

Amazing Views. This was our first time visiting this tower. I splurged and bought the Priority Access passes for the family. I'd say these were totally worth the cost being able to skip all the lines. It's a little confusing figuring out where you are supposed to go so make sure to bring your printed at home tickets and show them to the employees. They will point where you should go and then you get to see the guards removing the stanchion blockades that help you fly through to the elevators.You really can't beat the view and the priority experience. As Ferris would say - "It is so choice. If you have the means, I highly recommend picking one up."

Excellent views. Actually weren't planning to do One World but as its the tallest we changed our minds when we got there. It is all a bit theme-park organised and trying to sell photos but once you get over that the views are fantastic. Don't expect fantastic photos as you are behind glass but you get such good views it's still worth it.
Fantastic view on beautiful day. Thought the whole experience was worth every penny. Greatest view I have seen of the city.vey well designed.would highly recommend

Very expensive for what you get.. The tickets were $60 each to get entrance to OWO without committing to a time slot. It's so hard to be punctual when you're sightseeing and don't know how long it'll take to get places that I do advise this option if you visit. Annoyingly, when we arrived there were no queues anywhere so it wasn't worth it for the 'fast track' option but there were a lot of people arriving as we left so you never know. Everything about the OWO was planned to get maximum dollars out of you. They take your photo as you arrive and try to sell it to you later - you have to walk through the, quite unimpressive, gift shop, and the coffee shop and restaurant are amazingly expensive. There are no seats at the coffee shop, only counters to lean on. If you want to relax and take in the view keep walking through all the points of sale and into the main viewing platform - there are benches at the back. Also be aware that you can politely refuse to get your picture taken at attractions without it creating any trouble and you can often bypass the queue that way. It was a great view but there are plenty of choices in New York for viewing the city so if you only have the time and budget for one, read lots of reviews and make an informed choice.

Great views - skip the fast pass . We visited this afternoon with our teen and baby. We skipped the fast pass and were glad we did. Only a 15 min wait on a spring break Sunday afternoon. The elevator was fantastic - our baby loved watching it. Views are really great - possibly the best of the three - but comparing to rock center and empire, we missed having an outside deck. Visibility was about 50 miles on a clear day. It was a nice quick, but pricy, afternoon activity.

Breathtaking views!. There is no better view of New York than that from OWO! If your budget will allow, get the VIP pass, an extra $20/person (base is approx $35/person). Use your MasterCard and they will also "fast pass" you through, saving you a little time.You will not only see the North, South, and West skyline (East is accessed via the Main observation deck), youmaynsee the Allegheny Mountains.

Breathtaking. Worth every penny. This was our favorite tourist attraction in NYC. The elevator ride going up to the observatory is amazing. It shows you different points in time of NCY from the past 515 years. Once up in the observatory, the views are amazing and you get a 365 view of NYC.

Well worth the investment of time/money. We spent about 1-1/2 hours at the observatory. Wonderful views and they have a docent presentation (free) every 20 minutes or so which enlightens you on various aspects of NYC (parks, neighborhoods, etc.) We went early in the morning and so the crowd was very manageable but when we left (around noonish) it was beginning to get very crowded.

Expect to spend some real time up here. ...and pay attention to the elevator walls both going up and going down. And ask questions of the volunteer staff--they have lots of good information. It's SO much better than your run-of-the-mill observation deck.

Unreal! A must!. Make reservations in advance for the flexible day pass. Notice the new pass terminal on the way there or back. Elevator is an experience in itself as is the intro once you arrive at the top. Skip the iPad rental---not worth it.One restaurant is wonderful--sit near the window and order the grilled chicken sandwich---the best!Plan to spend a couple of hours and watch the view change with the time of day and weather.Somewhat emotional and nostalgic as one remembers what was and what is now---a great feeling of NY pride and vision.

Great for the whole family. This was so Amazing! The whole ride up was great. I elevators were my favorite. I loved the view from a different angle. Different from the other observatory views. I will for sure go back.

Amazing views and experience . Amazing views, would definitely recommend. Went just at sunset and was amazing to see all the sites. Whole experience to get to the top is also very pleasant.Great the way you get an allocated slot to go up. Saves queuing for large amounts of time.
Breathtaking. No one could prepare you for what you will see or the atmosphere when you are there! The view's are amazing and the guides are so willing to chat and advise on any part of New York.

Expensive but worth it. Our family of 4 bought the 4/$99 online about a week before our trip. Friday at 4:00 we walked right in and boarded the elevator. Best elevator ride ever! You jettison up 100 floors while viewing the building of NYC. Once you arrive and get to walk the 360 degrees, the views are awesome. We had dinner (a bit pricey but it is NYC) while enjoying the gorgeous views. Another bucket list checked. This is much better than the Empire State Building.

View is spectacular. Chose between this and Empire State Building. Not disappointed, short lines, efficient elevetors and the view is stunning, plus you get to go to the top floor of the Western hemispheres highest building.

Go at Sunset. We had tickets for a Wednesday which was very rainy and foggy. When we got there we were advised there was no visibility and we go up or rebook. They rebooked us for the next Sunday at the time we wanted with no problem.The elevator rides up and down are amazing. If you go at Sunset you get the day and night views.

A bit pricey but worth it!. the observatory is awesome. From it you can see all of New York City, the bridges, the waterfront, even the Statue of Liberty on Ellis Island. There is also a very good electronic show that tells all about the city where a guide tells all about various aspects of NYC.

Must See in NYC. We visited the One World Observatory about a month after it first opened. I purchased our tickets online because I was concerned that there would be long lines; however, we arrived and found only a short wait. Still, having the tickets purchased in advance allowed us to enter very quickly.The building itself is beautiful, and all of the marble in the lobby is quite remarkable. The show really starts in the elevator. Screens on all of the walls show a depiction of the New York area developing throughout time. When you reach the top, you are moved into an area where you are shown a film about the construction of the tower. Upon the conclusion of the film, the walls move up to reveal the dramatic view of New York from over 100 stories up. You then get to spend as much time as you want walking around and viewing the city from all sides. This was an amazing way to see the city and learn about how the tower was constructed. It is also great to do this early in your trip because it will help orient you to the city.

Family visit. Great experience and we spent nearly 2 hours doing it. Very fast elevator ride. Although it was a bit rainy and so not really clear, it gave is a great first day experience of NYC. We hired the iPad for extra $15 which kept the kids entertained while we did the circuit around the observation deck.

Coolest elevator experience for ALL! And amazing views of city!. Everyone in your party would enjoy this attraction. I have major fear of heights so I was a bit concerned. However the elevator ride up is less than two minutes and a video is shown of NYCs progression over the years keeps you amused. The top has a café, souvenir shop and narrators. You can also rent interactive Ipads to navigate you around the city. The views are AMAZING and different than other rooftop views because you are seeing the city from one of the most southern points of the island allowing you to see all.

A smidgen above average. I spent between around 2 hours at this observatory on March 29th. It took approximately 1 hour of wait time before I was able to get to the elevators to head to the observatory. The elevator ride was enjoyable. The walls light up and are animated. The elevators are quick and before you know it you're already at the top. There's a short presentation and a sales pitch following the video. After the presentation you can take as much time as needed to walk around the observation deck. You have 360 degree views of the city. The views are amazing as it was a clear day. I spent around 45 minutes at the top of building. It took less than 5 minutes to head down the elevator and arrive at ground level.
Amazing. The lift ride to the observer level is an adventure in itself. The view from the top, coupled with the history of this place is quite impressing.

Breathtaking views. Having only ever visited the Empire Stare building's observation deck, I was blown away by the much more comprehensive view of New York from the financial district right up to Central Park and beyond as well as a 360 view of Brooklyn, the Statue of Liberty etc.The express lift to the top is exhilarating with the evolving landscape of New York through the years projected around you as you travel. The grand reveal at the top is simply breathtaking and we spent a few hours taking it all in and listening to the guides. I would strongly recommend this on a visit to New York for photo opportunities.

On a whim. I had not planned on going to the top of the Observatory but had my kids with me who had never been to NYC and decided to go for it. Was not surprised at the 32.00 ticket price (cheaper if you have four people...~25.00 each then). The lines moved quickly and they were well organized. I guess it seemed like the lines moved quickly because you went through a couple of presentations prior to getting tot he actual observatory. I could have done without those and just gotten to the top and have the price been a little cheaper. However, I guess it had its merits because I never felt crammed or rushed as it was paced properly. The ipad presentation/sales pitch right at the end was a little annoying but once we were at the views it was sooo nice. And quiet. Gorgeous views. The fast 45-second elevator ride had a cool video both ways...and up so high our ears popped! Great thing to see but would not need to do again.

Absolutely stunning. Of all the city-wide observation opportunities in NYC, this is probably the most spectacular. 360° views of all of Manhattan and its surroundings.A rental iPad loaded with an app which tracks what you are looking at and gives more information on all of the major sights in NYC is available for only $15, would definitely recommend this addition on your visit.However, the tickets are $32 for adults each and adults are anywhere from 13 and up. Not cheap for a family but truly a fantastic experience.Definitely recommended and probably the best observation deck avalible in the whole city.
fantastic views!. well organised, quickest lift up ever, fantastic views - bring your own drink up as $5 for a bottle of water at the top! Well worth a visit!

Worth every dollar!!. So glad we added this to our trip. We decided to pick this over Rockefeller observation or Empire State Building. The views were amazing. We bought our tickets at the door. The line moved quickly. I am sure as word gets out that the observation is open now, it will be better to buy them in advance. The staff is very informed and helpful- great customer service.

Well worth it!!. Chose this over the other two iconic observation decks. Definitely a modern experience with lots of wow factor. Paid extra for the iPads and that was cool and helpful for the non New Yorker, though a family will just need one. Make sure to catch the tour guides give their presentations for added color. We went on an overcast day. Could see lots but a sunny day would be unreal. My best advice....get a timed ticket to the early slot, and be there early....no lines or waiting. Much more enjoyable.

Breathtaking Views!. You can see all the way to New Jersey! The 360 degree views are amazing. We rented one of the I-pads that tells you of all the major sights in the city. It was a beautiful sunny day when we visited. It was incredible.

I know the cost can be a little high but... the views are amazing and out of this world and you can take as many pictures as you like and there was no rush to leave. $20 for a coffee and a cake is a little over the top but it did came with a view.

Breathtaking views of the city. If you want views of the city, Statue of Liberty, Ellis island, Brooklyn, jersey and so on then this is the place to go. The tallest building in the Western Hemisphere, stunning. Another New York must see - personally I would do this in the day and top of the rock by night for combined views of the cityscape.

Top of the world!. Excellent in every way!
Everything from ease of booking to making our way to the top in the speedy elevators was brilliant
Friendly and helpful staff, lovely restaurant with stunning views
Very highly recommended
Well done

World Trade Center:observation tower. Amazing 360 view of New York. Well worth the cost of the ticket $32. We spent quite a lot of time moving from window to window and because it was a clear day the views were fabulous. The lift with the images on all sides were entertaining on their own. Everything was very clean, all the staff very helpful and the view down to the memorial pool unforgettable.

So worth it! . This was just so cool! The views.... So amazing to look out and be ABOVE the helicopters flying around ! We had a pretty clear day, so we could see a very long way! You can rent iPads that you can hold up and scan the skyline and it tells you exactly what each building is. We didn't rent one because we had people with us who are from New York... So they could help us with identifying the landmarks , but that would probably be well with it !
Costly . Yes the view from the observatory is fabulous but it's a costly experience at $30. I think that it's really not value for money.

Absolutely amazing. This building was one of the main highlights of my stay in New York recently. Be sure to have your phone camera set to video mode when you get in the lift. Fantastic building and the views from the top are amazing.

Breathtaking is the absolute word to describe this visit, for more than one reason!!. Having previously visited The Empire State building, The Rockefeller Centre and The Burj Kalifa in Dubai and been very impressed with them all, we were expecting more of the same when we decided to visit the One world trade centre - we were wrong! We were simply stunned by the far reaching views that this incredible building provided, if you can run to the cost, buy use of the i-pad for the length of your visit, with a wealth of knowledge and information on the amazing views, to browse through at your own leisure a very clever tool well worth the money.Breathtaking is the absolute word to describe this visit, and of course when you look down upon the site of the 9/11 memorial from the 102nd floor, it gives you an emotional jolt as to why it's there and you cannot fail to be moved by the memory of all those who suffered that day.

What a view!. Amazing Views, loved the floor to ceiling 360 degrees views of NYC, loved theres a restaurant there, gift shop and plenty of interactive areas and guides to help you make the most of your visit. Loved that there were window seats and you werent rushed in your visit. Like all NYC attractions except airport style security and it is recommended to book in advance.

Amazing Views Just Like The Empire Building. What an experience ! almost on par with the Empire State Building !  The Observatory is on the 102nd floor has a 360 degree view of the city taking in all the famous landmarks including the Statue of Liberty . Brooklyn Bridge, Manhatten Bridge, Wiiliamsburg Bridge . There is a restaurant and souvenir shop too.  There are a couple of area where guides give talks on a particular area and are interesting if you haven't been to NYC .  Will definitely return in the future !

A must see if visiting NYC!. If you're visiting NYC, make the One World Observatory your first stop! The elevator is an experience in itself but the interactive iPad you can use gives you a great insight into other places you can visit in the city and the views are simply breathtaking!

Bucket list. A must do. We were early in the morning so it was pretty quite. Superb view and the rise in the elevator is spectacular. The ipad they rent you to read about monument is really basic. Not worth renting.

Amazing view. We had some spare time while in NYC so decided to see go to the trade center to see if there is anything for tourists. Was very surprised when we got to the top and saw the amazing view.
Amazing!. Even after visiting the Empire State Building, this place rocked our world! What a stunning view and what a building! Words could not describe the feeling we had while standing there!

Breathtaking. We scheduled our visit and booked tickets in advance. Knowing that we wanted to be able to watch the sunset and see the city come alive with lights, we scheduled our trip for just prior to sunset. We were not disappointed. You are able to purchase VIP tickets and bypass part of the line, but we had zero wait time being that our tickets were the last reservations for the night. We walked right in and got on elevator. I suggest not purchasing the VIP tickets as you bypass the elevator and that is part of the experience. Another strong suggestion is NOT to bother with the additional purchase of their iPads. They are a waste of money and really not needed. Bring your camera and enjoy breathtaking views of the entire city, the water and NJ. Please remember though that you aren't the only people there to enjoy the view though and give others a chance at the front of all of the areas. There are plenty for all to enjoy but we did encounter some people sitting on the window ledge (viewing area) either on their phones or texting but NOT taking in the view. Incredibly rude and frustrating.

Amazing view. The view is absolutely amazing- we didn't pay an extra $15 for the iPad which shows you what the buildings are and definitely regretted it, amazing view but unless you know NYC really well, you won't know what most buildings are.
Amazing views. While the tickets are pricy the amazing views over Manhattan, Brooklyn and New Jersey as well as towards Lady Liberty are rewarding.

Beautiful view and a must see when in NYC!!. the price of admission to One World Observatory is well worth it. Beautiful views!! I didn't feel rushed, and the observatory deck is very large. Just be sure to go on a clear day so the view isn't blocked by clouds.

Prepare your eyes.... Great Experience. Try to buy tickets on line, last 2 hours for me are the best ones to attend before closing, lines are shorter, and lights are on... night view is incredible from the tower, observatory closed great for any time of the year.

Cool, modern observatory. The elevator ride is definitely the best part. Very cool place, modern, chic with amazing views. Although it's all enclosed, not like Empire State or Top of the Rock where you're actually outside. Reminded me a little of an amusement park attraction. Overall a good experience.

Fantastic View. I've been to the top of the Empire State Building, 30 Rock and One World Trade and this was the best experience of the three. It's quite expensive, I think I paid something around $65 for a one day any time pass, but the entire experience was worth it. The line moved quite quickly (even through security, where you have to empty your pockets, etc.) and the elevator ride all the way to the 102nd floor took less an a minute. Obviously the 365 degree view at the top is extraordinary. I went just after sunset, so the photos were less than spectacular because of the lighting and the reflections off the glass, so I'd suggest a daytime visit if you're looking for the best photos.My gripe Is with the people who choose to sit at the window and take up space. It was very crowded when I was there (I suspect it's crowded all the time) and there were multitudes of ignorant people who felt the need to sit on the window sills and stare out. I understand that individuals have rights, but if you take up the same space as 3 or 4 people, you're being rude. This is something staff should police a bit, in my mind.
OWO WOW!. Great experience, the lift ride, up and down, is very surprising and worth the entrance fee on its own. The view at the top is amazing.

The views are AMAZING!. Wow! That is the best way to describe it. WOW! We decided to walk over this way from the Lower East side ( I know crazy but worth it) Even as I walked up, I got a weird sense of calm. For as many people that were trying to buy tickets and enter, it was pretty quiet. Weird right? The tickets came to $64 for the both of us. I do think that is a little expensive but I know that they have to pay for this somehow and it is a tourist attraction, but still. That does not even include the price to go the 9/11 museum. Anyone once you get your ticket, you go downstairs in which your ticket is scanned and you must go through a security screening that is just like as if you were going through airport security. I must say they were pretty thorough as this one gentleman almost had to do a strip search before they let him in. Once you are in, you are huddled along in the corridor in which you are able to see video interviews from people as well as see a few historic things within the building. You are then huddled along to the elevators that will take you up to the 100th floor. Once in the elevator, get a very interesting history lesson of the world trade center (leaving out 2001 of course) up until now. I must say that was a very nice experience to see all the changes that had occurred over the years. You step off and a tour guide explains a view things, and then teases you with a sneak peek of what you will viewing. OMG the view is breath taking. You can definitely see the entire city and then some. It is a total 360 over all of NY! I would love to be up here when the sun rises or even for sets as I can imagine just how gorgeous it is. All the pictures that are posted don't do the views justice (although they are quite good) to see and experience it person is something that you will never forget.Oh one other thing, when you leave and take the elevator back down, you get another history lesson on the way down. The elevator rides alone make for a very cool experience. This is one place everyone should visit at least once if they come and visit New York. The price is a little high, but end the end it is worth it.

Views great!. We arrived at 12 noon and no wait at all - zoomed right onto elevator. Views are remarkable. The only reason I gave 3 stars is that they charge you for these iPads that you can use to interpret the view. They do not have headphones so all the different languages on full blast volume can get quite loud. Still an amazing view!
Too extensive. A verry Impressionen view. The "Lift-show" is impressive and also The marveless view. But The Price ($ 32.- each adult) is much too high.

More than expected. It is not just the view. It is the experience. The elevator that gets you up make the visit more special. The ipads that, when pointed to the places, not only tell the names but also the history of each place add to the visit.

Tallest building in downtown Manhattan.. It's a little expensive $32, but worth going to see at least once in your life. It has panoramic views over New York and over to New Jersey. You can even see the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island from there. Another downfall is glass...if you are looking to take pictures...have a great camera.

Fantastic. This is a must, from the quest to the exit it all runs very smoothly, the lift is amazing going up and down, and the presentation at the beginning is amazing. The pads are a quite idea but do distract you from looking out, as you look at the pad to find the names of the buildings.

Amazing from top to bottom. We did everything in NY and pleased with everything but this place is life changing. Staff very helpful and friendly. Views are Stunning. You leave this place wishing you paid more than the $32 for entry. You will remember where you were when this happened and this is a great way to show respect. The reflecting pools below are free and very movingThis is a must see
Expensive but worth it!. Amazing views. Well organized. Had lunch in the lounge. It was wonderful, worth the price and the ability to just sit and look out.

Amazing! . The observation deck of One World Trade Center is fantastic. It was a little pricey, about $60 for 2 people, but it was worth every cent. The elevator up takes about a minute to get 102 floors and it has a really cool show as you go up. Once you are up there, the views of NYC are great. Huge bridges look small. People and cars look like ants. You are up so high!

Superb view!!. If you do one thing besides the Reflections Pools at the 911 Memorial, you must do the Observatory. Amazing Views, great staff and they even have a restaurant and bar for food and drink!

Absolutely a MUST SEE in NYC!. I'm fascinated with architecture and super tall buildings, but I can't imagine anyone not being blown away by the view from the top of this building as well as the beauty of the exterior. This building is so incredible. The elevators are so fast, (make sure you swallow at least 3-5 times on the quick trip up!) The experience is really interactive and unique. I don't want to give anything away about the specifics. Just go and see!I highly recommend going to the website and buying a "Day Flex Priority" ticket ($65). It costs more but if you believe time is money (or 2-4 hour waits kill your feet and are a waste of a day) this is worth every extra penny. Buying a day flex lets you walk right into the building and to a short priority, well-managed security line. We were at the observation deck within 15 minutes of walking onto the property at 1:00 on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.The views are unmatched in America and maybe the world because of the beautiful city at which you are taking in from so high above. We had beautiful blue skies on our visit. Do not go in fog/rain (waste of money.)I saw many things in the 5 days I was in New York and this was my favorite. A great memory I will want to relive soon!

Highly recommended. I've traveled to many cities and have always like to see the view from any observatory tower but this production was by far the best of any that I've been to in the past. The whole set up is great. The lift itself is great as are the different screens before the view is revealed. There is obviously plenty to see but there are also tourist stands that do presentations and tell you even more about the city than what you can just see. It is really well presented and worth the entry ticket

Go at the sunset. I had planned my visit at perfection, since it was a surprise for my husband's birthday. I wanted to go there at the sunset hour, so that we would have enjoyed a nicer view.Unfortunately, even though I followed all tips in their FAQs, to be there in line at least 15 minutes earlier the ticket time, they were late approximately 15-20 minutes on their schedule. This kind of ruined my susnset plan, and I've got quite upset about it.Besides that the place is amazing. The elevator up shows the evolution of the skyline of Manhattan from 1500s onward, and it is amazing. The elevator down also shows a current 3D bird's eye view of the surrounding and it is equally spectacular!Before getting into the obervatory deck, they display a short 2 minutes promotional video of NY in a small, narrow theatre with 3D composite screens, which is kind of touristic, but if you wait till the end you'll remain speechless.....

Worth it.. The views are great! The weather wasn't the best when I went but it wasn't totally socked it either. You have to hear a sales pitch for an iPad rental which is a time waster. It would have been nice if the windows were angled to minimize reflection so you have to be careful when you take pictures. It's also a bit difficult to get to because of construction. Smart phone directions apps are helpful.

Simply Amazing. Being 100 stories above New York City overwhelmed me and at first sight brought tears to my eyes. We went on a cloudy day and it was still stunning. I'm not sure if it was the day we went, but there were no lines and no waiting for us. The whole experience was great and memorable!
Great view. Long queues not well organised View is excellent but make sure weather good or you'll see nothing If you want to go high go to Empire State

Breathtaking Views. We were fortunate enough to have a clear, sunny day. The views are unbelievable, and, when available, rent one of the iPad's which will provide explanations of what buildings, parks, areas, etc. you are looking at. Very helpful.

It was ok.. Lotta hype as you might imagine, but after the long long wait-even having pre-purchased tickets for a time slot, it was short of spectacular. So much build up with the elevator ride, and then a short intro movie. But at the end of the day, it was your run of the mill observatory--maybe it would have been more exciting in the eve when you can see the city lights. One side was the empire state and midtown(which although beautiful, the empire state gets lots in the rest of the concrete jungle), then theres the jersey side which lets face it, theres nothing to see. Then looking south, an ok view of the statue of liberty/governors island--also just ok. The most beautiful is the eastbound view of the bridges/east river. All in all still enjoyable, but i like being able to step out like the empire state building observatory. nice little cafe/restaurant there at the top also--clearly pricy but hey, what choice do you have! Still a wonderful time, and a proud moment for new yorkers! Let freedom ring!
Overpriced. Way overpriced, especially the gift shop. $174.95 for a polo shirt. Did not like not being able to go outside for pictures like at the Empire State Building.

Amazing Views. We kind of went here by chance. We were in the area and decided if it wasn't to expensive that we would go. We walked straight in and there was basically no queue! (It was a Wednesday afternoon) We got our tickets and went down stairs and went through the security and off to the elevators. The whole experience and the set up was very cool. And the views were amazing. We went there late afternoon and we stayed to see the sunset which was spectacular. It was amazing being able to stand right up against the glass to take pictures. We didn't get the iPads and you don't really need them. It was a great thing to do and I am so glad that we decided to go. I would defiantly recommend going on a bright day to get the most of the views.

Great to do but better places to see the views. The build up and passion in the exhibit is great but for a viewing experience there are better places to go. Top of the Rock has the best view as it's open air, loads of room and gaps to take pics without reflection. Statue of Liberty the same but not as much room.The good things about this experience was the organisation and time to the observatory, we did go late (7pm) which may have made a difference but we were upstairs in 10mins.The problem we had was the glass reflected very badly in the dusk/night light so all pictures had the bright lights of the gift shop behind. Also another annoying issue was people sitting on the window sills of every available window as they waited for dusk and night meaning you had to stake 2 metres back and look over them. You couldn't really take pictures with them sitting there.Glad we've done it, ticked the box but wouldn't do again.For those who are interested as it doesn't really make it clear. You can show your tickets on your iphone/smart phone for scanning and we didn't need ID to show who we were. The tickets were in the name Guest.

Forever views!. The advertisement of the views that go on forever is pretty accurate. The video in the elevator is fantastic but too short to take in and with the elevator a bit crowded it is hard to appreciate it all. So make sure to be ready looking at the wall and pay attention not to miss anything. Once out the elevator, try to get in the front by the rail looking at the wall so that when the shutters go up you have the best view of the city. That first glimpse is very emotional and gave me chills! Afterwards you're led into the observatory where you can walk around at your own pace and take in the 360º views. Best to buy tickets in advance as they are timed entrances. But once you are up there, you can stay as long as you want. It's a must see if in New York!

Stunning view. The view from the Observatory was stunning. We marveled at the size of the city. It was an expensive trip to the top but I found a slight discount with MasterCard Monday. The elevator took you up so fast that you didn't even have time to clear your ears. The only thing I didn't like was it was very commercial. It looked like a Disney tour to start off. They wanted you to stop and have a picture made like cruise ships do. Then they herded you into another area to sell you a iPad tour. It's a beautiful sight in spite of all this. We had to go around twice to make sure we didn't miss anything. Be sure to buy tickets ahead of time to avoid standing in long lines. Also remember you will go through security just like an airport so don't carry the house in your bags.

WOW!. Other than some lines that can be avoided if you book in advance, this attraction as terrific. We got lucky because the day was crystal clear. Pass on the iPad they rent because it was really not worth the hype. Terrific 360 views!

Breathtaking views. Loved the modern feel of this attraction, especially the virtual reality elevator movies - too cool! I really enjoyed the presentation in the basement before you even get in the elevator explaining how the building was built and how meaningful it was to New Yorkers.

Best view in town. Its hard to argue with a view from the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere overlooking one of the worlds great cities. Well worth the price of admission. Good options for DIY or buy the gadgets experience. In the end the spectacular views trump everything ! ... must do once.

The View!!!!!. The View is amazing. I pads they provide are not needed and we found out that if are next to someone with one it's easily hear able. Save your money there. But for $32 a person it's worth it. Once on the 102nd floor you can stay as long as you want. Worth it

Must visit - awesome views!. As with Top of the Rock we decided to visit OWO in the morning and we pre booked tickets for 10am, we arrived and went straight through and up to the top no waiting. The elevator ride up shows you an amazing cinematic of New York being built up over the decades, and when you reach the top you get a little bit of history then the grand unveiling of the skyline. The view are fantastic all around although most people were round the north side. It was quiet for a good 20mins before getting busier so my advise is to go early. You can see everything from Brooklyn Bridge to Empire state building to State of Liberty. The trip down is quite cool, again a video ride.Having visited One World Observatory and Top of the Rock, I would visit both again but rate One World a little higher, its a bit more expensive but the views are unrivalled and its feels a bit more special, as in there's no doubt that the view is the main attraction!

Totally worth it - especially on a clear day. Totally worth it. We got the family four pack tickets ahead of time online and booked for as early in the day as we could make it (10.30am on a Tuesday). This way the lines were short and what there was we bypassed almost as fast as if we had bought FastPass or VIP tickets. Highly recommend the Explorer iPad guide. Our family shared 1 between 4 of us. I think we were up there for about 90 minutes total. The elevator ride is brilliant and none of us felt nauseous in the elevator or up on the Observatory Deck (usually at least one of us has this kind of trouble on this type of thing!)Staff were great. Views amazing, especially your first glimpse from up there when they do a special 'reveal'.

Surpassed expectations. It was supposed to rain on Good Friday, March 25, 2016, so we needed an activity close to the hotel. This wasn't originally on our NYC to-do list, but why not? It's a cool view of the city. What happened next was completely unexpected and the trip to One World became my favorite activity of the entire vacation. The elevator ride up, the show upon exiting the elevator and the elevator ride down are too cool to pass up. It's a must-see experience.
Great view, its super high. Great views, prepare for a lot of friendly distractions before enjoying the views of nyc. Once u arrived, the view is great. Try to pick a clear day!

If you go up a tall building in NYC go up this one. We booked fast track tickets but on the day we went there were no queues. The lift ride sets the tone for the rest of the experience. You don't really feel like you're moving. all though the simulation of Manhattan growing does have a weird effect as you go up. Once the view of the city is revealed you are left gob smacked. Absolutely stunning and its 360 degree. A totally amazing experience.

Amazing View. Were it not for the long, long lines the observation deck would get a full 5 rating. Yes, you can spend twice as much and avoid the line but the price is already very high for a regular ticket. There is a line for buying tickets, a line for getting in for your time slot, a line to go through security, a line to go up the elevator, a line to get through the iPad vista marketing, a line for the bathroom, a line to observe mid-town, and a line to go back down. The elevator ride might be the best part. Going up be ready to observe the walls which depict the history of the city. Going down is a bit more nauseous… Once you’re up there the views truly are awesome. Wish there was a way though to walk out over a glass overhang to be literally above the city. Definitely worth the wait and the cost.
Amazing views. Amazing views. Worth the $32 to see the view of the island. On a clear day you can see for miles. More seating would be ideal.

WOW!. This beautiful building is not only a symbol of peace and strength but also a sign of just how beautiful architecture these days and the city of New York is! I would recommend this visit to anyone its wonderful
super fun. loved all the videos and the elevator ride was amazing - worth the money to see the entire skyline - would definitely do it again

A Must See!!!. This is a amazing experience and a most see. Here is a little tip if you can afford to do it. Buy the express ticket for an extra $15 per person. You don't have to wait in line and you can go directly up to the top. It was well worth it since we only had a couple of days in NYC.

Another excitement in NYC. Another excitement in New York. People are impressed since the first time entering elevator. This experience was really new to us. At the observation deck view of NYC quite stunning. But all within limit of a glass window. Quite different from some other Observation deck in which visitors had a chance to feel the breeze outside. And the Skyportal was so unreal. Just like watching TV of the view down below but with different size scale from the real view. Size of vehicles in Skyportal were much larger compared with when we saw them directly from window. I just wished we could see them directly from the tempered glass floor like in CN Tower Toronto. It would give much more thrilling experience....

Way, WAAAAY up there!. Over 1300 feet above street leve...what more can be said? Incredible panoramic views of the most wonderful city on earth. The elevator takes you there in less than a minute and you don't even feel as if you are moving; Scenes of old Manhattan appear on the projection screen walls of the elevator and from a ground floor of lush greenery you begin to see forts, settlements, clipper ships etc. as you rise in height; as you near the top the now familiar skyline comes into view. Like a time capsule in 60 seconds....fabulous.

Stunning views. Lift experience is good plus interesting opening vista. not a lot of reading interpretation - one guy doing talk but voice was not very powerful. We just turned up around 17:00 on a sunny day - no lines whatsoever.

DONT MISS THIS!. If you only do one attraction in NYC make it this one! The views from the observation platforms are absolutely stunning and so much information on hand by enthusiastic guides. The super fast lift up is amazing in itself!! The whole of Manhattan and the bridges are spread out in front of you - superb.

That elevator, though!. Unlike Rockefeller and Empire, this is a fully enclosed observation deck. It is located on the 100th floor of One World Trade Center and has unparalleled views of New York City! This really is a view not to be missed!Call me weird, but as much as I enjoyed the view....I enjoyed the elevator ride up! The ride up shows a floor-to-ceiling-three-sided video time lapse of New York from its beginning until now. I wish I could have stayed on the elevator and rode it up and down a couple more times! You should definitely check this out. You can buy tickets online or directly from the ticket office at the entrance.

Underwhelmed . Not sure exactly what we expected, but were disappointed in the commercialism, i.e., pressure on renting ipads at a hefty price of $10, kitchy souvenirs and inability to take decent pics. The elevator ride was certainly interesting and the views, while very good, were not the best in the city. The price for this is steep and the lines can be amazingly long. Still, with all of this mediocrity, I'd recommend going at least once. Also, for an additional $20 one can purchase an express entry which simply bypasses the long standard ticket price line.....worth considering if time is limited.
One World Trade Center. Amazing! This memorial is something that everyone needs to experience. God bless the men and women who lost their lives on this tragic day.
Wonderful surrealistic view on NYC. Really magnificent view of NYC when it's not cloudy... from the 103rd floor / 540 meter high in the sky... ride with elevator in just 45 secs. Incredible!

Ease up on the sales pitch. The floor space of the attraction seems cluttered with souviner items. Worse is the sales pitch pressing people to rent an iPad. The iPad rental pitch was a total waste of time with no escape. After paying to enter the facility it was really a cheesy move to herd guests into a cattle call for the rental iPad items. The view was ok but all in all not that fascinating. Underwhelming.

Thrilling architecture and stunning views, but a money-making machine. We were very impressed with the beautiful architecture and stunning views from the new One World Tower. The views from the 102nd floor brought back good memories of a bygone era. The steep admission fee is worth it, but we felt blessed that we had tickets for the morning when lines were virtually non-existent; when we left, the security area was packed with people. What bothered us were the non-informative video before you get to the observation deck, and efforts to make additional money that slowed down the visit. Without shepherding people through these bottlenecks (commercial picture taking, ipod guide rental), the experience would have been more pleasant, and the awe would not have this aftertaste that this stunning place is supposed to be a money-making machine.

Out of this world!. This has to be hands down my favorite place to view New York City from above! This observatory is a thrill from the moment you enter the elevator to ride to the top. I will definitely return during the day as the night time view was spectacular.

More than a view.. They have really made this into an experience rather than just a view at the top. The ride in the elevator on the way up was probably my favorite part. You can google it. The view is amazing and the experience is worth doing at least once in your life.
NOT A BETTER VIEW. From the elevator ride up with the graphics to the stroll 360' views of The city and surrounding areas it was astounding. The I pads rented helped but are NOT essential.
Amazing!. This is a must see. It is an expensive elevator ride, but the views are unparalleled. There are guides standing by to answer questions, a cafe and gift shop.

Ok but the other towers are better. I have reviewed the other two observation decks at Rockafellar and Empire State. For me One World Trade Center observatory is the weakest.Now there was nothing wrong with the staff etc and it has some nice touches such as the camera/glass floor section. However for me the views are just not as good. Firstly it is all through glass so getting great pictures without glare or reflections are hard. Also the views are just not as varied. It is nice to be able to see Statue of Liberty so close and Brooklyn Bridge (best views of both these here) but apart from this there is very little else.You can see Empire state and look up the Hudson but you almost only have a 180 degree view as the other 180 degrees are out to see. I did not get such a wow factor here and I would not do it again.
Wow. This place is amazing,Views of NY are stunning,Lift takes just over 20 seconds and you are at the top,Take your own water as $5 is quite high for 500ml,Still you will love this place,

Amazing, just in awe. There was a very strange feeling here, for obvious reasons. It was breathtaking, stunning, sad, emotional, huge, awful. You couldn't help but feel all sorts of emotions. It's a must see.
Inspiring!. This is a must see! The feel and vibe is so inspiring and uplifting. The vies are amazing! Stay for a little while or linger for hours, either way you will enjoy this place!

Amazing. I visited this place during summer. The elevator ride was impressive, and then they take you to a room where they show a bunch of nice pictures and there is a surpruse at the end. The building is huge, it fits many people in there and the views are unique, a more extensive access to the river and the other side of Manhattan, not just the typical places. It is expensive, but worth it.

Have to do it !. Expensive and you feel a little pressured throughout with add one like the iPad (not really worth it) and the usual tourist photo souvenir. However, you have to do it whilst in NYC.The intro movie was FANTASTIC - won't spoil it for you - go see for yourself!!

Amazing Views and experience, better than Empire and Rockefeller!. What a fantastic experience, the views of New York City are amazing and there are a couple of points throughout the tour that are quite simply breath taking!, I will not elaborate any further, don't waste you time at the Empire or Rockefeller.

$32 better spent elsewhere. I really wish I spent my $32 to go to another observatory deck, like Top of the Rock. Despite having bought entrance tickets prior to arrival and for a specific time/date, the lines were HUGE! Way too many videos and extra nonsense shown before actually getting to the observatory deck which is completely enclosed. You do not go outside, it is all behind glass windows. There are great 360 views but the same could be said about other places where it's much less crowded and you actually get to go outside. I was very disappointed.
Great Views. Excellent staff, fantastic views. Would recommend this to everyone. Very well done. A lot of people but the queues moved quickly.
Amazing. The World Trade Center was an amazing experience. So glad my family and I had an opportunity experience this. This is a must see during your stay in New York City!

Great views. Great views of Manhatten, not too big lines the day we visited so it was pleasant crowds.We didnt have to wait in any lines for tickets or elevators.It was freezing cold outdoors the day we visited, so was nice to go up and be indoors looking out over the city.Had lunch with a great view at the cafe on top, and we got som e nice photos to bring back home.

Best views in NYC but... Better views of NYC and surrounding area than Top of the Rock and Empire State but they have commercialized the place to a sickening level. This building will always be tied to 9/11 but then charge $35 to get in then try to ram a photo purchase, an iPad rental (complete with Apple commercial), and a guy drumming up Citi bikes. A simple polo shirt made in a sweatshop for $129. It's a total ripoff and cheapens the experience. Elevator ride was impressive.

Hard to top this view!. Great views all over NYC, and an interesting ride both up and down in the (very fast) elevator. There is a choice of paying for a tablet that allows you to identify buildings and sites, and find out more information. This was useful, but didn't have all the information desired. This visit was still very much worth the admission price.

Great views over the city and beyond. Great views from 1,254 ft (382.2 m) at the top of the One World Tower - it's not the cheapest, but does allow for panoramic views around the city and beyond.The iPad to help discover place of interest is handy.The elevator up show an evolution of Manhattan and was really interesting, although it's the third fastest elevator in the world, so you're not in it long.Restaurant and shop at the top too.

Reach for the Sky. Fantastic experience! A must if your in New York. A bit of a wait for tickets so buy in advance if possible again a que system similar to airport where everything goes through security check. The lift experience is awesome! 102 floors up in 48 seconds!!! Your ears pop!! And you are entertained by cinema on three walls in elevator showing the ground from nothing building up to the New York sky line. Fantastic views from all around New York skyline a coffee and drinks available if you so wish or restaurant if your looking for dinner. Not cheap though! Would say a must after visiting ground zero. A fantastic tribute to all who lived and died on 9/11.

New York's tallest building. Wow!. It's best to book online to avoid the long line to buy tickets. It is expensive and there are several different options. The elevator ride is so fast it's hard to believe, & you don't really feel much acceleration. Once at the top you have the option of renting a special iPad that you point at the views as you walk all around. It then names the famous buildings & places & for you can click on some of the names & a virtual helicopter flight takes you to it with a voice giving a brief story. It cost me $15.00 in March 2016. It works well, but it's a bit of a gimmick & for me, not worth it. The views from the observation deck are worth it.You walk around staring through huge floor to ceiling windows at spectacular views of some of the most famous landmarks in the world. For me, the high ticket price was was forgotten. I spent about 2 hours slowly moving right around. Just fascinating & you can see all 5 boroughs of New York. If visibility is good, you can see the state of Connecticut & look across the Hudson River to New Jersey & Pennsylvania beyond that. If it's really good visibility you can even see the Catskills.This amazing view over New York puts everything into perspective & I highly recommend a visit.

Great Views!. Defiantly worth a visit! Views are amazing, we were lucky to have had a clear day so the views were fantastic. We payed a visit to the cafe. We ordered a flat bread pizza, it was tasty but the staff were a little miserable and there was certainly no speed in preparing the pizza.

A NYC Must. I won't provide any spoilers, but I think the elevator trips (up and down) alone were worth the price of admission. The views, of course, are one-of-a-kind. You're 100+ stories above the ground on what I consider a pretty sacred piece of real estate.We splurged for the $15 tablet rental that syncs with your view and points out buildings of interest, but were disappointed that it didn't seem to be able to answer many of our "what building is that? questions. Pass on the food and drink sales. Just soak in the views. Hopefully the weather will cooperate with your scheduled time.

Don't miss this. . Yes, you can go up something tall, look around and come back down again, but this trip is so much more than that. The drama starts in the elevators and continues with a 'reveal' at viewing level. And then there are the views of one of the worlds greatest cities. It's unique, not to be missed.

First time and one of the few things too new for me to know from growing up in NYC. I spent most of my life as a child in New York City so the typical tourist sites remind me of school trips. That is why I was very interested after booking her as I of course did not know it. Great elevator ride up with animation of the history of Manhattan Island. The first stop video is also well worth it and a real surprise is in store when it is ending. Tour itself very nice. Souveniers all way over priced as one would expect. Truly a fun couple of hours and nice to also visit the 9-11 Memorial which I did head downtown to visit a couple of years ago. The area is nearly complete I guess now and flows nicely. When we left Century 21 was giving gift cards with secret values but I stopped there beforehand and nabbed two Brioni ties for $109 each.
not worth the money. I understand that this may be one of the tallest buildings, etc. but to charge $35.00 for a view is insane! Once you get to the top there is nothing else, save your money!

Amazing views. Grandious entry with small movie in the high. Beautiful views to all around, Manhattan, Brooklyn, New Jersey, Statue od Liberty. You see all. Lifts are quick. Lot of people there but still you find your place at window to see and make your very own pictures.

What A View!. We were lucky enough to visit here on a clear sunny day. The views are just magnificent..Beware 2 beers in the restaurant inc tip were $30 but was worth it for the fantastic views. Even the lift was excellent showing how New York has changed over the years. Would definitely recommend.

Amazing Views!. Amazing views - breathtaking sights of the city from all angles. They had just launched a new sightseeing iPad tool which allowed you to hover over particular buildings out the window and click on each one to get the history and information about it. Very cool.The only thing I would say is that the food/cafe was terrible. We went early in the morning so didn't have access to the full dining/restaurant and the cafe had tables with no seats and was absolutely extortionate, with very little to choose from. However, it's a must see for views of NYC, statue of liberty and anything else that you might want to see!

Freedom tower: touching stories and amazing views. Visiting the Freedom Tower, as it is lovingly called by New Yorkers, is an awe-inspiring experience. As you enter the corridor leading you to the elevators, you hear the voices of those who built this tower and see great photos of them. The experience continues as you take the elevator up to the top. The history of the city flashes by you on the elevator walls in a breath-taking way. At the top you can rent inexpensively a tablet that allows you to point it at the scene of the city that you are witnessing and it identifies some of the most noteworthy buildings and places below. You can have lunch there while looking out at this incredible view. This is one of NYC's most remarkable sights and experiences. Take a camera with a good lens and plan to have lunch there in their dining room.

Terrorists , you will not win ! . I felt so proud of the spirit of NYC to build this wonderful building in defiance of terrorism . The queues are understandably long so book online in advance . The 60 second lift ride to the top is super and the raising of the blinds is awesome. You have 360 degree views and can obviously see everything in every direction . The snack bar and bar area offer a good selection of food and beverages and the gift/souvenir shop has a good range of stuff . There are very interesting talks given at the 2 information stations that explain in detail some history of the city .
Wonderful 360 degree view of NYC. Being in this place is like paradise and you could see even the statue of liberty in a sunny day and it's near all mass transit and its open everyday

Moving and amazing views of NYC. Very good worthwhile visit to this moving tribute to the victims of 9/11. Very good information by guides around the observatory and stunning views at an affordable price.

The High of my trip.. Starting with the great security and pleasant staff. The event starts in the interactive ride to the 102 floor on the fast lift.It is an exceptional view of New York only matched by the still missed World Trade Centre. The all round vista and presentations given by extremely knowledgeable staff were great. There is a pleasant though costly World Observatory shop and to have a coffee/snack while looking as far up the Hudson River as the George Washington Bridge and all the length of Manhattan. And the other way to Statten Island and the minescule Statue of Liberty really emphasises the height you are at and the amazing feat of engineering One World Observatory is. Finally enjopy your decent in another amazing journey.
Great lift!. Interesting interactive multi media experience. Great views of the city and beyond. There is a cafe and a restaurant at the top

Basically you get to see it all. Try and get a ticket a day before.. and get the sunset time you get best of both worlds... But please arrive early.. the line going up is long.. so if sunset is 7 pm, please go in by 6:30...

A new view of New York. We visited it last week and it was fantastic with new technologies (use of ipad) that help to enjoy the view. Little expensive and need to pay extra for the ipad that will help you to identify point of interest.

Amazing views!!!!. $32 is expensive but we decided to check our the new observatory. I usually like the Top of the Rock observatory when I take first time visitors around NYC. One World is more expensive but well worth the visit. If you can afford it you will not be disappointed!

Amazing views--don't miss this!. Wow, views are stunning! Highly recommend you not miss this when visiting. 360 degree views of a great city. If you are local, you will know what you are looking at. If you aren't, you can rent something to show you what you are seeing. Our party of 6 opted to not pay extra but, in hindsight, we probably should have. Still, outstanding!

Amazing Views. 104 floors up in the sky - what a view. Loved the video elevators. Beats the Empire State and The Top of the Rock - No contest. Floor to ceiling glass with unrestricted views. A little on the expensive side at $32 per adult, as are drinks at the bar.

Fantastic View. Sponsored by major corporations (Jet Blue and Master Card) this site has turned into a theme park ride. If you can get past all that aand enjoy the view; take your time and walk around multiple times ; it is well work the trip. Nice clear weather is critical for the best advantage.

Amazing Views from the highest attraction. I am scared of heights, but being on top of the One World Observatory wasnt too bad. You couldnt go out on a balcony, so I felt safe.We hired virtual ipads, which when positioned correctly, showed you what all the landmarks were.Amazing views from the top of this building.

Nice view from NYC. If you plan yo visit NYC I suggest to take this your as an alternative of city observatory. It is expensive but uou can replace this with the Empire State or viceversa.One World is nicely designed.

Great Views. Here's the place in the New York City to make you feel like you're on top of the world. We were very fortunate to get a clear day to look out on the city and surrounding area. The windows are tall and the view is unobstructed for all 360 degrees. A must see for tourist in NYC.

You Can See a Lot from Up Here...But Only with Their iPad. I get it: observation decks atop tall buildings give you a view unlike anywhere else. As the newest of the new, One World Observatory at the World Trade Center does a great job of building the experience. The elevator ride to the 102nd floor is unrivaled in my experience. Sure, others have glass elevators that allow you to see the city falling away from you, but OWO makes the trip to the top interesting by showing how the city has evolved from its humble beginnings as a quiet island--all on the LCD paneled walls of their Sky Pod Elevators. Once off the elevator, there's a short video presentation of NYC, at the end of which the wall rises and gives you a breathtaking view of the city. Again, great presentation.What I didn't care for at all is that-unlike other observation decks to which I've been-there are no markers on the floor or elsewhere that tell you what it is that you are seeing. I mean, this in New York City; sure, I can pick out the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building and the Woolworth Building (maybe). But what about the hundreds of other landmarks? Oh, right: there's the Statue of Liberty and (by association) Ellis Island, but without the $15 rental of the iPad (the One World Explorer)? That's about all you're going to recognize, kid. The iPad definitely made the visit more enjoyable; I can only imagine how dull the trip would've been without it. As for City Pulse (their interactive concierge): that was pretty good. The live Tour Ambassador rattles off impressive facts and figures about the city and its diverse neighborhoods. It's clear that a lot of thought (and money) went into every aspect of OWO. It's an unforgettable visit that begs to be experienced, and perhaps you will not share my scintilla of disappointment. Shoot, ;you may not have even noticed had I not mentioned it (sorry to spoil it for you).In short, I'd expect a grander experience from New York City. But, this being New York City, you get what you pay for, right?

Terrific views, escalator is great. Escalators added to the experience, nicely done. Views are out of this world, just make sure you switch your camera on in the first room! Ipads are a nice touch as well. Only minor comment is security/first level staff did not seem overly friendly but could have just been a bad day and it did not spoil the experience.

Way better than the Empire State building or Top of the Rock. Fantastic experience. None of the crowds assimilated with the other two landmarks. Straight to the top in a fantastic lift (elevator) - very fast and with some amazing images.Had a relaxing drink. Quite expensive but when you factor in the cost of getting there and you get to view the skyline whilst relaxing ( something you can't do at either of the other attractions ).Just wish there was an outdoor observation deck and then this would be perfect.

Top of the Rock is better!. an interesting experience. excellent views but all enclosed unlike 'Top of the Rock' where you can actually go outside. a bit poor when you do reach the top, the cafe doesn't have any chairs (to discourage you from staying too long) and the views are all through glass so you tend to get a lot of reflections in your photos. nice experience and good to remember what it is all about but prefer Top of the Rock.

Great views of the city. The line was not long when I visited and I was at the top of the tower within half an hour from the time I purchased the ticket. The ride up the elevator was quick. Once you exit the elevator on the 102 floor, you get in line for the observatory deck. While in line, they lift the curtains to give everyone a preview of the city from above. After the preview, everyone enters the round observatory deck and is able to walk around at the leisure and you can stay up there for as long as you like. There is a gift shop in the round observatory deck.

Amazing!. Went on a Monday and got same day tickets. Mid March around 2 PM and waited less than 30 minutes total before being at the observation deck. Very reasonable wait times. The views were amazing! The only downside is everything was glass enclosed and people really smudge all over it so when you take pictures you just have to watch for smudges and reflections to get clean shots. Other than that minor downside it was well worth it. It's also a tribute to the resiliency of the U.S. I'm proud to be a citizen of this great nation that turned a terrible act of cowardice into a national monument, a fan international symbol of American pride.

Amazing. 30 bucks each to go to the observatory is a small price to pay. Believe me it's well worth it. Monday morning at 11am no lines no queues. Paid our wedge and 60 secs later we are at the top. The reveal is spectacular and bloody clever. We walked around at will soaking up the views. We didn't pay the extra 15bucks for the hand held here you are thing, not totally necessary in my view.
