We did however buy the photos we stopped for at 30 bucks for the two shots. In my opinion a fair price and they where nice. Plus it's nice to have a picture together. Afterwards we did the pools from the old twin towers, they have done a good job, blending the old and the new. Tasteful which sometimes our American cousins don't always get right.

View from the top. Being a native New Yorker having been here on 9/11, it's pretty hard to describe the feeling having come here. My views may be different than that of a tourist. I actually found myself tearing up in the elevator on the way to the top, as I remembered the last time I went to Windows on the World. The memories are now somewhat bittersweet. We went on a Thursday night around 8pm and the line was surprisingly short. The views cannot be beat, with the SOL, ESB, Times Square, and all of Brooklyn, Queens and NJ on display. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area or staying close by.

"You Can See Forever!". The Empire State Building and Top of the Rock are both outstanding. However, the One World Observatory is exceptional. First of all, the elevator ride, alone, is worth the visit. Then there are a couple surprises when you get to the top. The views are amazing and the "guided tour" using an Ipad is pretty impressive, as well. Worth the $32 +/- to visit.

Best View In Town. Visited the One World Observatory on Friday, March 11, 2016. The visibility that day was 15-20 miles. It was spectacular. I've been to the top of the Rock and the Empire State Building and hands down this wins. It is worth $32 to be up there. I think being there on a week day helped with traffic flow. We only had to stand in line for about 4 minutes to get tickets and maybe waited one minute for the elevator.

A must . I have been to the memorial in the past but finally got to check out the observatory. The views are absolutely incredible. We loved that there was a bar and restaurant at the top level. Definitely a must see while in NYC

Some high point and some disappointments. I was looking forward to going to the top of this building but left a little disappointed. Yes it has height and significance but the world up there is blue and less than clear thanks to coloured glass and no chance of any exterior deck view. The principle vantage points are obscured by presentation stages. Then there is the mandatory wait while they try to rent you an ipad and take and sell you your souvenir photo. Perhaps the best thing of the whole adventure is the video during the elevator rides up and down. If you can go up to only one observation deck my vote is 30 Rock.

A Must!. If you do only one attraction in New York, let this be it. The building is spectacular, and the buildup as you exit the elevator is absolutely breathtaking. Once on the 360-degree observation floor, with panoramic windows all around, you can see the entirety of New York City--all its boroughs, the harbor, the Atlantic Ocean, New Jersey--from an unparalleled vantage. The grounds are beautiful, heartbreaking, and inspiring. Add on a visit to the 9/11 Memorial.

OH WOW!!! WOW!!!WOW!!!. Please if your in town put this at the top of things you wanna do!!Its a must do,from the moment you enter the front doors to when you leave its just the perfect experience.You'll encounter the long cues but they do seem to move so much quicker here.The ride in the elavator can only be described as awsome!!!it take about 15 seconds from the bottom to the 108 floor and the crazy thing?you dont real realise your moving.As the doors open your ushered along to a long corridor to watch a light show about the building,a bit like an experience at universal studios but for adults.Then what can be best described as the wow wow wow moment!!The light show screen lift!!to reveal the most mind blowing view that will live with you for a lifetime pictures! words!, pish they just dont do it justice that view!!While yout there stay for lunch or dinner! it really was to expensive.A word of caution though if you want a window seat with the view while you eat make sure you book once your at the top with the restaurant or you might be dissapointed like me.Now that view i genuinly dont know to say!!Well ill move on the trip down in that lift with the wall to wall TV screens your transported outside of the building to watch your decent and boy oh boy its just as quick without that feeling you get with older lifts?!!!My only advice would be if you only do one thing while in New York this would be it!!

Something to do after the memorial visit. Super fun to be in the highest building in the Western Hemisphere. Super cool elevator ride up and the view is breathtaking. Rent an iPad if you want to see to know exactly where different landmarks are.

Stunning views. Pre booked tickets but we're able to get in earlier. Great views and the iPads you can hire make it easier to identify the various points of interest. Beware though, the food and souvenirs are outrageously priced (and the coffeewas revolting)

The View is worth what it takes to get there. Spectacular display of architecture and ingenuity. View is spectacular. Well organized; long line but it moved fast. Some found it expensive. For us it was worth the $30 bucks per person.

Great View Poorly Organized for Handling Crowds. Wonderful view. Purchased our tickets and were told to go downstairs, no wait go outside and we'll let you back in. Get to the top and they are selling photos and offering to rent ipad. Prices are excessive, but the view is fantastic.

Spectacular view, but expensive. Great to have experienced the view from the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere, BUT... It is expensive, and if you get the standard admission, there is an extra charge of $15 for an interactive iPad. Having done both, I think the top of the Rock is a better deal and better views of Manhattan.

Futuristic, with nice views. This is a definite visit, they thought about every little detail to make the visit worth your money, from the elevator ride, where the walls are large LCD screens showing the view outside at different altitudes and at different times in history as it takes you up, when you leave the elevator, the staff lines you up against the wall and asks you to watch a demonstration on the wall in front of you about NY, there are column that move with the pictures, then at the end these column which make up the wall rises to the ceiling and you see the whole city around you, it was a nice surprise. The observatory itself takes the whole floor, you can circle around the floor and watch the city from all directions, the glass is clean and transparent. The views are not as good as those from the Empire State because it's much farther away from midtown but still it was worth the visit. You can stay as much as you want, there is a souvenir shop and a restaurant there. You can sit by the windows near the floor and enjoy some serenity while looking at the city. I'd rate the experience of visiting the building higher than the views itself.

Absolutely, Positively Cannot Miss This!!!. I have already written another review of this elsewhere. I don't want to say too much more or it will spoil your visit. Suffice it to say that this is a "must see". If you are pressed for time, then eliminate something else (Rockefeller, UN Plaza) but not miss this!

Great place to visit for an hour or two. I visited the Observatory, and thought it was great. I've been up the Rock before and that had more of a museum first, however the view at the top of this one was amazing. Wifi throughout so that you can tweet away to your hearts desire, and make people on Facebook jealous. Even the lift was really impressive - 100 floors in 40 odd seconds and with a really clever video playing.Cafe at the top for a drink and a bun, toilets at the top, good for kids and push chairs.

Brilliant. Brilliant, well worth going up. We did all the "touristy" things to do and this was one of them. Amazing views, only downside is you get reflection off the glass when taking pics as you are inside. Still worth doing. Staff are very friendly

Family visit to New York. Oh my god this was amazing,you took less than a minute to reach I think 104th floor. They played a film in the elevator and then you were on floor 104. The view was amazing we were there in the dark and waw what a sight. €32 for adults but we paid $30 for seniors a must visit when in New York .
Awesome! . Most amazing views ever! Could have stayed up there for days! The elevator ride up and down were awesome and left you wanting to do it all again!

Overrated but somehow remarkable experience for me. The 1 minute elevator ride showed visuals instad of the actual ascend view of the city.The activities are too mechanical that you tend to miss a lot of things that matter more. You get to follow the flow of activities within the designated areas. But the place could be enjoyed more if the activities matter like providing NYC history, comparing now and what it was before.

Awesome views of Manhattan. Highly recommended. The views are unparalleled. I think most people will really enjoy this activity. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because there is a silly guy giving a cheesy performance about NY trivia at the top. I thought it cheapened the experience a bit and was unnecessary "entertainment." He didn't bother anyone though and it is a choice whether or not to sit and listen to him. We rented the IPADS that are available that allow you to zero in on landmarks you see outside. We have mixed feelings about this. I found it to be totally unnecessary and another member of the family enjoyed it bc it clarified what some of the buildings seen outside were.

Takes your breath away. Be prepared to be blown away from the minute that you get into the super fast elevator to the end of the walk around the 360degree observation area. Brings the the scale of New York into clear perspective.Top tip: pay with Master card and you get a free upgrade to express pass. Cuts down the time to get up the tower - a lot!

The New view from the Top!. Presentation is absolutely amazing. Without ruining the experience, I must tell you that it was worth the $32 and is done so tastefully that I will never visit the Empire State Building again. The viewing platform is indoors and provides a 360 degree view of the city. Amazing! Spent almost two hours there and could have spent more time there if I didn't have other plans in the city.

Stunning. The views of New York City and the surrounding areas are unparalleled!! The views even started in the elevator! We were booked on the first tour of the day which was spectacular because we were the first elevator up and we had to deck to the ten of us for a good half hour before another group came! Highly recommend!!
absolutely amazing. Amazing 360 degree views of New York. Soft gentle music playing in the back ground, could have stayed there all day.

Amazing views but pretty expensive . Definitely worth doing while in New York, amazing amazing views from the 102 floor, full 360 degree view of Manhattan and surrounding boroughs. You don't realise quite how far it is to midtown until you see how far the Empire State Building is. Only thing is with its location you can't see any of Central Park which you can from the Empire State There's a surprise in the lift on the way up and down, won't give anything away. It is a bit expensive, $32 each is a bit much. The cafes up the top are a rip off too. $5 for a bottle of water, the exact same water you can get at ground level for $1 from any street vendor.

4 the view. 4 for the view. $32 entrance fee + $15 if you get a tablet.Worth to go to as a pilgrimage and to take unforgettable pictures but you can't help getting the feeling that you're in a touristic trap.

Amazing Views. Was planning on going to Top of the Rock this trip to NYC but glad I didn't and went to One World Observatory instead. Views are amazing, Stayed to watch the sunset and it was definitely worth the wait. This provides the best view of NYC and surrounding areas.

Great Views! Visit the Restaurant. The experience here is great. We have visited most major observatory floors and this one is well done. Interactive tour guides who are willing to answer any questions, plenty of space, the elevator ride is an experience in itself. I would pay the few extra dollars to get the iPad tour, as you simply point it and it tells you what you are looking at, instead of constantly having to wonder which building/bridge/landmark is which. Also, take the time to eat at the restaurant. The food was excellent (a bit expensive but that is to be expected as it is a tourist location) but the views cannot be beat and each table we saw had an unobstructed view.

Best of the 3 observatories. We did top of the rock, empire state and then the one world observatory and this was our favourite. It was the least crowded and we were there at a quiet time. We went up at 6pm on a Thursday and were the only people in the lift going up! As its indoor its nice as you can spend a good amount of time up there as there are rest rooms, a café, bar, shop etc.
Must see. One of the highest buildings in the world! You just cannot miss it. We felt that this visit was one of the best experiences in the city.
Amazing. you must go and visit. one of the most interesting place to visit in new york!the elevator is incredible fast. I recommend you rent the ipad tohelp you know what you are seeing.

An absolute must.. A truly unforgettable experience, to say the least. No visit to NYC would be complete now that the One World Observatory is open and in full operation. The 360 degree view over the city and well beyond is simply breathtaking; the space is large, clean, functional and never gives the impression of being overcrowded and cramped. Staff is polite and professional. The quick, non-stop elevator ride to the top of the building is a masterpiece in its own right: rising above the original Manhattan natural landscape and development through the ages. Genious. On the way down, another emotional ride as it really feels like descending from the outside of the tower. What I noticed and particularly appreciated is that there is no reference nor attachment to the sadly missed Twin Towers; not because they should be ignored but because, in a way, I felt that it could have been awkward. The atmosphere here is all about positivity, moving forward and simply enjoying one of the most amazing views in the whole world. The way to go! Amazing place.

Amazing views on a sunny day. This was an amazing experience from the elevator ride up to the one back down! We booked our tickets for 10am but arrived at about 9am and this was no problem at all. We went straight up no queues at all. We spent about an hour in the observation deck and the views were breathtaking. We got plenty of beautiful photographs. I definitely recommend to plan your visit for morning time to avoid crowds/queues as it makes the experience more enjoyable. One of our favourite experiences in NYC.
A Must Do in NYC!. Pay the extra to skip the line. It's so work the little bit extra. Plan to go in the evening to see the sunset. It's amazing!!!

Breathtaking views and a great place for lunch. We visited the WTC1 and the trip was worth every dollar the view where spectacular and we had lunch. The food was very good as was the service, a must visit

Great, don't go during the sunset.. The view is incredible and so is the reveal of the view. The price isn't cheap either but its beautiful. Went during sunset and the lights inside the building were creating a glare so I had to get close to the glass to see better. Reserve in advance so you don't have to wait. Just wish the observation deck was open to the air outside.

Entertaining, Awesome and Brilliant. After a bit of a hike from the subway I found One World Trade Center nestled among the other tall buildings. After paying $30 for the visit, we took in a very fast elevator on the way to floor 102. When you step out you are given a video presentation followed by a surprise. (You will have to go to find out). The views are awesome and there is a bar and a gift shop with very high prices, of course. I was lucky to have picked an hour before sunset. On a clear day this will be a brilliant experience. There was lots of room to lounge about and take pictures but I did not bother with the I-Pad experience available at extra charge.There are two presentations given on an innovative circular set of screens, that are very well done. I learned a lot about the Big Apple and surroundings during my couple of hours here. Mr Fontana is a great presenter and will answer any questions you have.This was definitely an entertaining visit although a bit sad when you consider the events of 2001. At the base of the tower you will see the reflecting pool and the nearly completed train station.On a clear day, One World Observatory is not to be missed. $30 well spent.
Best views over the town. I think one of the best locations to see the town. Interesting and also with lot of explanations and great time there.

Great 360 degree view. We visited in March 2016, and the weather was fairly clear. We planned to arrive near sunset to view the transition from day to night. Whilst the view really is stunning, in honesty, I prefer the Empire State Building because you have a much more immersive view of Manhattan, not to mention that you cannot see Central Park behind the Empire State Building from the vantage point. The transition from day to night is more spectacular from the Empire State because it's so much closer to Times Square, which really grabs your attention. Also, I think the Ipad hire is a bit gimmicky, but I'm sure it adds to the experience.It's definitely a worthwhile experience, especially when combined with the 9/11 Memorial and Museum.

Stopped in before 9/11 museum. Quickly went to the top before our 9/11 Museum tour. Since it was early, we were able to go quickly to the top. Once you get there they have to stall you with a short presentation that ends with the view - which was amazing of course. Then they close it and herd you out where the try to sell you a tablet tour for an extra $15! And let's not forget the mandatory picture! FINALLY, you are free to go to the unobscured Windows to see the lovely view. Nice, but I don't need to do it again, especially for that price!

Stunning Views. Awesome, don't miss this. Literally tower over the entire city. The entire experience was fun for the entire family. Get the IPAD and find out great facts. Also take time to listen to the speakers on the Uptown (north) and Downtown (south) corners of the viewing area. Great information about the City.

Amazing views. This observatory offers incredible panoramic views of NYC. We went on a somewhat cloudy day and were told visibility was 3-5 miles, but we could see so much, including the Statue of Liberty and skyline of Manhattan. For a price, you can rent an ipad that "sees" what you are looking at and provides background information on various sites. It is worth it to find out more about what you are seeing.
Worth the money. This was a fantastic way to see the city!! Loved the elevator ride up along with the presentation of the view of the city!!

Breath taking. Going on top of the One World Observatory Deck is a must. The 360 degree view is wonderful. Once up there you can rent a tablet which tells you all about the buildings, bridges and landmarks all around you - it is worth renting, 1 per family would be enough.

It is worth it.. I went here on a recommendation from another tourist. The views of NYC are great. The observation deck is so well set up, you can get a great view without fighting other tourists. The views are different to those from the Empire State and Top of the Rock. Worth the admission fee.

My visit to New York 2016 WTC Ground Zero . Me and my husband visited ground zero and meausem for our 10th wedding anniversary, iv always wanted to go and pay my respects to all those who lost their lives on that unfortunate morning 911.. what an experience it was I thought I knew what to expect, I was wrong it was the most important part of out 3 day visit in New York, so moving ,upsetting it felt like a very sad cold pressence, a silent cry a pressure on my shoulders all around me weather it was outside ground zero or inside the meuseam, the volunteer's were amazing so brave they are doing a great job .. after coming out of the meausem I learned one thing .. Everyone has a story so never stop listening Kiran and manak from peterborough UK

Unobstructed Views of the city. This building and tour are exceptional. Cost is $30.00 pp but the views and interactive i-pad ( additional $15.00 ) make this a top destination. the viewing platform is a 360 degree views of the city and it is amazing. The staff and presentation and very informative and the friendly. The trip in the elevator only takes less than a minute and will make your ears pop. So much better than viewing the city from the Empire building as you have to look through fencing - this building has large glass panels. Recommend this tour to all visitors of New York.

Amazing. Amazing views of the whole of New York. Definitely worth this visit. Great photo opportunities but would recommend holding off for a good day. Would be difficult to see much if it was cloudy.
Worth seeing. It was lovely to see the new building, and the views from the top was great, the staff were all helpful and pleasant. Worth a visit.

Beautiful Archectiture with Unmatched 360 degree Views. Very worth the $30 ticket. There is no better way to see NYC and everything that surrounds Manhattan Island - the bridges, the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, New Jersey, Brooklyn............ Plus lots of emotion for anyone who knows of 9/11.

Priority Admission is Overpriced. This attraction is accessed easily by public transportation. We opted for the subway from midtown. We reserved ahead for a timed entry beginning at sunset. Yes, the exterior of the building is impressive and can be an emotional experience. The new PATH station by Calatrava is now an exciting part of the Center. Unfortunately, for us, the remainder of our time spent at the Trade Center was forgettable. If you did not know where you were, you could as easily have been in an airplane flying over any city in the world. Everything appeared dwarfed and as a speck in the landscape (Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, etc.). For a real New York experience we felt Top of the Rock hit the mark.

The new Hotspot in Downtown. Don't miss it. The views are stunning. The moment, when the canvas after the video presentation lift up and you can see the skyline first time: unbelievable. A little disadvantage compared with Top of the Rocks or ESB: the reflections on the windows

Breathtaking views. So glad we finally got a chance to go up to the observatory having not been opened yet on our last 2 visits!We did not book tickets in advance but there was no que.The lifts where great really fast and the walls being screens showing the city growin around you was a great idea!The moment you see the view from the top is a wow monent! You really wont see views like it from anywhere else in the cityWe went up on a sunny clear sky day to make the most of our visit and we where not dissapointedWe purchased the hire of the ipad which is not needed but my partner really enjoyed it!The views are breathtaking!!It was a great experience and we will defos do it again if we return!

Great views - no view of Central Park though. The One World Observatory is a 360 degrees views of the City from a 102nd floor. You can see clearly NJ, Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan of course. You can see the Statue of Liberty and the ocean and overall really beautiful views of everything around. You cannot see Central Park though because other buildings are actually blocking the park's view, and you slightly can see the Empire State Building. However, this is a great observatory and a must-do experience in the city! The elevator ride itself was pretty fun as well because during our ascend the elevator walls have projected the history of how the city and all its buildings were constructed - it was really cool. You have a restaurant upstairs with all the view (It might be an expensive one.. and touristy..)There is an option to purchase a ticket with an additional $18 for a champagne glass - I wouldn't recommend to purchase the champagne because after half an hour of going around the observatory you pretty much want to go back down. Moreover, you can go grab drinks in any other bar around there and it would cost much less..

Breathtaking!. Every observation deck in New York has something different to offer and this is no different. The Skypods seem to defy logic with their speed and offer a great presentation of the city. I found the short film shown when disembarking the pod stunning (it gave me a lump in my throat, it was so unexpected). The deck itself offered plenty of room to appreciate the views. My only disappointment was the reflection from the glass when taking photos. Its nothing major and if you angle the camera well you can avoid it. Would definitely recommend!

Amazing!. It provides a great 360 perspective of NYC! You also get to see beyond the usual midtown view from top of the rock and empire state building. The theater was a great start. Rented the iPad and it helped me enjoy the experience more. The elevator was also really fast. A recommended new attraction in NYC!

Wow, views are amazing. Site is emotional but so worth it! The cost of the observatory is $32 per person. If you want to use the iPad, it is an additional $15. I didn't use the iPad,but the views were awesome (360 views of New York)

You Have to See It. We visited One World Observatory 3/14/2016 with a friend who lives in NYC. We took the subway from 23rd street to the end of the E line. We came out of the subway and looked straight up at the building. We walked to the north side of the building where all those who are going to visit the observatory must enter. Security is strict and it is as though you were going through TSA security at the airport. We entered the elevator and began a 47 second trip up to the top. You are given a short video of the beginning of NYC and its growth up to the present. This is displayed on the walls of the elevator. It is kind of cool! Upon arriving at the top, you enter the highest level of the observatory. There are three levels to the observatory. The restaurant is on the middle level The lowest level is the exploratory area where you can walk around 360 degrees and see all 5 boroughs of NYC. You can purchase a device that will tell you the names of all the important buildings in NYC. There are two presentations (both the same but on opposite sides of the area) given which explain many things about the city including people, buildings, architecture, restaurants, etc. There are docents all around who direct or explain all aspects of the observatory. A must see event if you are in NYC. We went on a rainy day, but the clouds were high enough so that our views were not cloudy. Also see my review of the restaurant.
Excellent views. Lucky to have clear blue skies for our visit. Lift to the top is interesting. $50 for an iPad to help spot features is excessive.

A time to reflect and remember!. Spend some time here to experience it. But do take a few minutes of silence to reflect and remember those we've lost in our hearts. Thank you One World for this beautiful waterfall and remarkable experience.

Beautiful views and an emotional experience. Wasn't sure if I wanted to visit here following the tragic events of 9/11 as I couldn't get those poor souls out of my mind. I'm pleased I did and it is an emotional sight when you peer down to what seem like two tiny black squares that are the ground zero memorials. How brave those people were and we will never forget them ❤️. The lift is great by the way...

Wow. Fantastic views, but this obviously depends on having good weather, which we did. Access was very efficient, with hardly any queuing at the time we went 11am. Lifts were so smooth and quite quirky with the video that plays on 3 of the 4 walls. Don't bother with the Ipad, its not needed and more of an unnecessary weight to carry around

Breathtaking!. The best view of NY without a doubt. It is worth every penny. The whole experience to the lobby, elevator, theatre....it is so amazing! Bucket list thing to do. Go by the end of the day so you can enjoy day and night views - PERFECT!

One World Wows!. This place is amazing from top to bottom. It's the fastest elevator ride I've ever taken to get to the top and when they open the panels and show you the edge of the world view - it is breath-taking and beautiful! We spent a couple of hours lingering here and I was emotional the whole time. Just go!

One World Observation deck. Just blown away!! What a view!! Been up loads of tall towers, But the views from this building are amazing, we had great weather on the day, check the weather otherwise you may be disappointed

Amazing experience. Windows on the World was my favourite view in NYC. I came here as a kind of pilgrimage to pay my respects to those who died there on 9/11. It was quite an emotional visit and I spent much time contemplating the views.

Really great experience. This is a 5 star attraction. As you ride the elevator is shows the time-line build up of NYC or and New Amsterdam. As you get to the top you see the building of One World Trade center... Once at the top you have a panoramic view of the city and NJ as well. Great experience worth every penny paid for admission.

Great Experience!. We went early and barely had to wait inline. When we were leaving it started to get much more crowded so I would recommend going around 9-10am. We also had a 25% off discount from a coupon in Dunkin Donuts. I would recommend bringing your own water bottles as things at the cafe are very pricey. Awesome experience to be able to see all of the city, NY and the boroughs. Elevator ride is also really neat!

Views. Fantastic 360 degree views from lower Manhattan are available from here. Choose a day with good, clear skies to make the most of your experience. It's totally enclosed so even ok for those with a fear of heights. Look out for the surprises in the elevator

Amazing technology. Awesome 360 degree view.Good shop, snack bar, although no seats unless you go to the restaurant part, which was a bit weird!Amazing technology within the super fast lift.Well,worth a visit.
Great experience BUT. Great experience but forget the 15 dollar Ipad location device and when you look at the bar and see it is empty and go in for the 2 Bloody Mary's they cost $23 dollars a PIECE.

Great views of downtown NYC. Visited this for the first time. The views are great and it gives you a different perspective to the Top of the Rock or Empire State Building.
We really enjoyed it, the only thing is it is all inside unlike the others which have outside viewing platforms which give you a real feeling for how high you are!

Terrific view of the city and beyond. We visited the One World Observatory on a recent Saturday morning. We fortunately beat the crowds and got into the building and to the observatory very quickly. I felt bad for those who paid premium prices for "priority" accommodation. We managed to escape the "mandatory" photo standing in front of a picture of the NY skyline.The view from the 100th floor is quite spectacular and unobstructed. They have available ($15) tablet devices that identify buildings and locations that are visible. We did not get one but did see quite a few people using them. The viewing room is large and handled the crowd size nicely at the time we visited (arrived at 9:15 AM). Unlike, the former World Trade Center, this view is entirely inside.We enjoyed our visit but having been to the former WTC observatory, the Empire State Building observatory and the one at Rockefeller Center, it wasn't all that spectacular. However, it is a much more modern arrangement than those other facilities. It is a worthwhile visit . . .

Must see attraction, very unique experience. I visited One World Observatory last week with my family and we very much enjoyed our experience. I had a read a few negative reviews that mentioned waiting hours in line, but a simple call ahead confirmed there was no wait to get to the top. We walked through a pretty long maze of queues and bypassed a few videos and signs that were intended to occupy those waiting on busier days and went straight to the elevator. The ride up the elevator was pretty cool, as all four walls are covered with video monitors and as you rise in height, the view travels through time with the various buildings that would be visible. When you make it to the top you watch a brief video and get your first glimpse of the view, which is quite honestly breathtaking. You then go to a demonstration of the interactive iPads they have available for rent that point out the various sights when held up to the window. To me, it was well worth the $15 to rent one out and it added a lot to the experience. You then go to the observatory which is very open and spacious. You can walk the perimeter to take in a 360 degree view and can even look down to see the reflecting pools where the former towers stood. It was a somewhat awe inspiring experience and I'm glad that my family had a chance to check it out.

Just WOW!. The $32 admission seems a little steep (should have done our research in advance) - but on reflection worth every cent! The experience starts in the elevator, a whoosh of a ride that lasts all of 48 seconds. On arrival on the deck you are given a short cinematic presentation, which concludes with your first glimpse of the views. The observation deck creates breathtaking aerial views (cheaper than the helicopter ride), and you can see the shape of Manhattan island. The elevator decent is a totally different experience (no spoiler alert here) - overall an experience well executed - in a word WOW!

View was amazing. 102 stories in 42 seconds was unreal. The view overlooking Manhattan was indescribable. You can see Central Park, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Empire State Building and so much more.
High.. Amazing how high we were high security but has to be done and was fine no ques but it was feb. nice cafe at top

Beautiful view. I don't know if we got lucky because it was a Monday miss morning but there were no lines. We bought the tickets online and I would recommend this to avoid another line. We also bought three tickets and got one free. The elevator ride was great because we were not crammed in. It is a little shakes and your ears pop. The elevator interior is a surround movie screen showing you the sights of New York over the years as buildings were built. It was surprisingly a very fast ride. If you are motion sensitive it will make you feel woozy for a little bit. Once your on the observatory there are 2 things...1 the obligatory group picture. And second an opportunity to rent an iPad device to tell you about the views you are watching. This was an additional fee. I think the price of $30 something a ticket should have included the device. Once your up and observing it is beautiful. We were lucky and ere was not a cloud in the sky and you could see for miles. You are not outdoors so weather will not impact you other than sight. Do allow yourself time when you go to visit the memorial sight and the fire department house...left untouched since the 9-11 events.

High Tech Point of View. In the quest to get an eyeful of NYC all in one go, I brought a friend here who was visiting from Belgium. The Entire thing was so well done that I was really blown away. You have to book timed tickets to avoid standing in a super long line forever but if you do you can skip right through the line and get straight to the tour. It starts with a virtual history of the building at the underground level. Then super high tech elevators soar you the top where you are taken deeper and deeper into the history of the building and all it has meant to NYC throughout the years. There is a grand surprise at the top and it is breathtaking when the full view is finally revealed. Once you enter the observation deck you can linger and snap photos for as long as you like. There are even more stories about NYC history with hired tour guides and story tellers at the top. It is truly a worthwhile place to bring anyone who is visiting and to see yourself as a native New Yorker too.

Truly amazing. First get the express pass, you walk right to the front of the line and you go right in. Pay close attention to the walls of the elevator once the doors close to up. The growth of the Manhattan skyline is amazing. Once you get up there, there is a short movie and then BOOM, they screen goes up and there is your first view fro the top. This is one of the true magical experiences in a city full of magic. I very much enjoyed going tot the top of the Empire State Building, but this view blows it out of the water. DO NOT MISS THIS! Go just before sunset and watch the lights of the city come to life 1000 feet below you. It was incredible!

Worth the no waiting on a Sunday at noon. We were fortunate to arrive this Sunday around noon and discover there was no line to visit the observatory. If you buy a family pass online, you can get 4 tickets for $99. It was well worth the money to take in a 360 degree view of the city from the top of the observation tower. We opted out of the standard photo op in front of the fake background and walked past the soft sell of the augmented reality tablet that describes the buildings on the horizon. Instead we just stared in awe at all of Manhattan as it unfolded below us. It truly is the best view of the city even if it is behind glass. Having been to the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building, this is in fact the best view of the city.
Worth every penny!. On a clear day, is the greatest treat anyone can have! 360 degrees of AWE!The elevator trip is already a treat!

If you time it right, you can enjoy a sensational sunset!. It wasn't planned, when we visited One World Trade, but it was definitely worth the wait. It is quite daunting being in the belly of the new building. Winding thru the line with hundreds of people, my claustrophobia flared up, honestly. Being there as a tourist, in a long line….meandering thru history and geology facts, could not distract me from the thought of a building collapsing on me. Making it up to the top was a relief. The staff are all delightful. Seriously some of the nicest, informative people around. Sitting on the edge, with the ability to took look straight down at street level, is an impressive architectural feat. Bravo with the design. Crowded to say the least. But find yourself a quiet corner, and contemplate history, the present and the future, whilst you stare at a sunset from a perspective you won't get to experience anywhere else.

the best part of my trip. could not fault this experience, the views are so incredible and you definitely get your moneys worth as they do information sessions whilst you are up there too. i would recommend going on a clear day.

Little dissapointing. We pre booked but this was not necesscary in Feb but probably would be later in the year.The ride to the top was very fast and the views spectacular.The restaurant was not open when we arrived,late morning,and the cafe was expensive,and offered standing only areas, which clearly discouraged a long stay.On the viewing levels lack of seating meant that people sat on the window ledges which obscured the views.Thought the majority of memorabilia on sale in the gift shop was expensive, however a must do in New York

Visit Top of the Rock Instead. For the price we paid, ($26 a person) we were disappointed. The view itself is unquestionably cool, but given the proximity of One World from the Manhattan skyline, it's hard to see anything without binoculars. The bird's eye views of Manhattan, Jersey, and Staten Island may be cool to some, but it's too difficult to make out anything to make it a worthwhile venture to me. The coolest part was the elevator ride up that shows a CGI time lapse of the Manhattan skyline, but even that isn't as mesmerizing as advertised. See if you can find a Youtube video of it and save your money.By comparison, The Rock is close enough to the rest of the skyline (in proximity and height) to be a more intimate and memorable experience. I'd recommend that instead.

Amazing. The whole one world observatory experience is beyond words a brilliant experience and shows how America has shown how strong they are in dire situations -they cam back bigger and stronger and all credit to them

amazing. if your visiting nyc this is a must, I've had the privilege of visiting the twin towers back in the nineties, won't say anymore to spoil the experience, but it will make your heart swell with compassion and pride.

Terrific ................... From the minute you get into the elevator that takes you to the 102nd floor (which itself takes no time at all), this is a great experience. Try and choose a clear day and get views to every direction. Headphone guidance is available for an additional fee, but we did not take. There are staff showing New York highlights when you reach the top. Restaurant poor in that there is no seating at all, and it must be awful when it is crowded. The usual overpriced gift shop :)

Avoid very sunny days. The views are really good however as you're behind glass avoid very sunny days as all you'll see is a lot of glare.Its a shame that they saw fit to block the views at the north and south corners with screens for videos especially as the noth corner has the best view up Manhatten and the Empire State Building.

Beautiful Day, Beautiful View. I had been very much looking forward to this experience as I never had the chance to go up to the top of the Twin Towers. Each time we returned to NYC we were able to see the progress on this building and finally it was open and we were able to go up to see the spectacular view. We have been to the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock other years and enjoyed all three for their different aspects of the city. We especially loved the video presentation of the history of NYC as we ascended the tower. I would have loved to do that several times to see it all again as it goes by so quickly. The short presentation at the top is also very spectacular before you actually see the view of the city. We were fortunate to have a glorious autumn day so the views were breathtaking. We enjoyed a visit to the gift shop and picked up a couple souvenirs before leaving - altogether spending about an hour and a half.My husband and I had standard admission tickets, pre booked online. We went on a Saturday. I would recommend a 9 am ticket as the queues are much shorter and when you do get to the top, there are not so many people. We were able to see all the views and get great photos before the crowds arrived. For this reason we visited the 9/11 Museum and OWO on two separate days - a 9 am timeslot was ideal for us for both.

Nice start ends in a mediocre experience . Right from the start you get amazed by the presentation in the elevator and the following show. But as soon as you got to the full view we got disappointed. The best spots have nearly no space. Especially because they built small presentation booths right in front of the windows. The catering is very expensive (5$ for a small bottle of water). The windows are standing in a bad angle so you always have reflections if you want to take pictures.
Amazing! . $32/person, and what a view! The lady standing next to me was in tears at the view! They have gone to great lengths to make this place so great!
Best View of the City!!!!. Do not waste your time or money on Top of the Rock or Empire State Building. This is the number one place to see the city!
Amazing. cool place to go, I recommend you to go here on your next visit to new york city. One question for you what is better? the observatory or the park below?
Much too expensive. A great experience but at a steep price too. Quality of souvenirs is very poor. The view is fantastic up there and definitely a must see.

Amazing views once we got up there. We felt like we were getting on a disney ride as we went through the lines and up the elevators and through the "get your picture taken" line and then "tease the view queue" and the "rent your tablet" line.However, once we got up to the observatory, we were able to relax and enjoy the most amazing view you could ever imagine. Having gone on an amazingly clear day made this a super special experience.

Fantastic experience. The One World Observatory is absoluty worth visiting. The elevator brings you in less than 60 seconds to 100th floor while watching a time lapse video of how New York was built up from the early settlements untill now.The 360 degree views are magnificent and information is presented in an innovative and attractive way. Don't miss it when visiting New York!
Breathtaking. Even being at ESP and TOTR were amazed by the view. Very helpful staff who let take another ride up to watch video in a lift with no problem at all. Worth every penny.

Spectacular. In my opinion, it is the best place to see the sites and the surrounding area of Manhattan Island.(Apart from Central Park)Views of the island, Brooklyn, surrounding areas, Statue of Liberty, plus more.

Amazing experiece with views of all of Manhattan. Brilliant experience. A building New Yorkers can be proud of. The whole experience from entering the building to the spectacular views was unforgettable. thanks
Amazing view. From the bottom to the top, the staff were amazing. First rate from the ticket booth to the shops. Very professionally run.
Cool and fun. Highly recommend to have lunch there with the view. The food was decent, and the service was very good.

if there is only one place to visit whilst in New York...this is it.. having just returned from New York I can honestly say this was the one place I would definately go back to. I visited many places and this was cheaper than the empire state building and Rocker fellers...but worth a lot more. the whole place is tastefully done. the lift is informative and fun - apart from your ears popping...you wouldn't know you had gone up 102 floors. I wont give too much away but everything is done magnificently. The views are outstanding. The service was top class. The lift is informative on the way back down.This is a must see
Best on a clear day. A speedy ascent to the 110floor with information along the way Excellent views but chose your day as mist sometimes covers the top of the building

Absolutely fantasic experience!. For me, the One World Observatory experience was a must. The views are just incredible. The lift to the top is a whole experience in itself, but I won;t spoil the surprise if you haven't already done it! There was no queue at all on my visit which was a bonus and it was a perfect blue sky to add to the wow factor. It is a shame that there is no outdoor area which I think people seemed to expect but still, it doesn't detract from visit.

Great Views - don't rent the iPad!. Visited here in March and the views were amazing. Easy to get to on the subway (single ride is $3) and just as grand as you would expect. Would recommend purchasing tickets before hand to make sure you get a good time slot. Luckily for us it was a cloud free, sunny day so could see for miles!Felt it was a little 'cheesy' at times in the elevator and trying to sell the use of an iPad for $15 to guide you around, when you can see for yourself most of the obvious buildings and there are a couple of remembers of staff pointing things out as you go round.

One World Observatory . Amazing building.. not too long to get to top. Best views in Manhattan. Gift shop a little overpriced. Restaurant /bar was great.. good food and fantastic views. Would definitely recommend. . The best part of my trip to NYC.
A Must (must) Do. I will not spoil this experience for you .. only to say, if you are in NYC you must visit One World Observatory - World Trade Center

Beautiful building, but .... Yes, it's a beautiful, brand new building, and yes, it's 104 stories tall, but the extreme downtown location doesn't make it the best high vantage point in New York City. The views are less breathtaking than can be found from the top of the Empire State Building or from the Top of the Rock, both closer to recognizable landmarks. Also, $32 is a bit pricey for one elevator ride up and one elevator ride down, not to mention that each group is ushered through cheesy, hard-sell attempts to push equally pricey aids to viewing.Frankly, I was pretty disappointed.

Amazing! A must see. I've been to Top of the Rock, Empire state building... and I must say One World observatory beats them both. The elevator ride, introduction and views are fantastic. We went for 10.30 am and there were no queues. And security was quick.

Athens best views around!. Looking up at One world from the ground I wasn't sure it's huge -so glad I decided to see the observatory - the views were spectacular I would recommend you take your camera - just make sure it's a clear day

Breathtaking. The best experience of our five night stay in New York. We visited on a perfectly clear day with visibility of at least 25 miles, so the whole of the city and beyond was on display. And what a sight!The ride up in the lift was a brilliant start, when the walls became screens showing the development of Manhattan over the years. Once outside the lift, the walls of the room gave us a look at New York city life, and when the screens lifted to reveal the view over the city it was a breath-taking moment. Had a few drinks in the bar until the sun was about to set when the buildings of the city, tinged with an orange glow, looked just stunning.Of course, it is a reminder of what happened on this site on that terrible day, but it is something that New York and America can be proud of.

overpriced and disneyfied. The new World Trade Center observation deck is a very mixed bag. The elevator ride up and down--as the walls magically morph through 400 years of history from New Amsterdam until today--is the high point. Unfortunately this imaginative introduction passes so quickly you can't fully appreciate it. Once you get to the top its pure hucksterism. First, you're forced to wait in front of another video presentation of hackneyed images of New York City life, at the end of which the screens roll up to reveal the real world outside (really cheesy), and then you're shepherded into a room and made to listen to a pitch by an eager young salesperson about the marvels of an iPad-like device that you can take with you to the observation area and which will mirror what you're seeing, allowing you to click on any building or other item you'd like more information about. It's a great idea! And it's only $15! The observation floor itself is pretty non-descript--the expected food outlets (most likely over-priced--I didn't check), and the window areas mostly filled with people taking selfies.$32 for this is absurd. It's especially galling for those of us who remember the original World Trade Center's low-key observation deck. There are other, better options for such views of Manhattan, although all of them are more and more about selling items and add-ons along the way.

Pretty views,neat elevator and cool interactive tech. I thought this place is neat and has pretty views...my sister-in-law and I went and to start out with we're not very "touristy" kinda gals -- we felt like such debbie-downers because we didn't think the views were neat as other people did! But we thought the views were kind of just average-typical of what you would expect an NYC view to look like. haha We felt like,"Did we miss something we don't know about?" hehe What we loved LOVED was the elevator that goes to the 102nd floor in just under 60 seconds and creates a virtual experience(see pic). Another cool thing was an interactive skyline where the staff members talk to guests about the city - and with just hand gestures - it brings up the different imagery. That whole experience was really fun and interesting.

Great views of the city. Be sure to have a video camera ready for the elevator ride up and down. There we very few people that day so we were able to ride up and down twice just to view the video. The iPad rental is ok, especially if you are very unfamiliar with the the city and the surrounding area.

Check the weather!. Been up One World Tower twice now! The day it opened the crowds were so massive the only way to book was online for a couple of days later (Sunday, our last day in NYC).Yep...it thunderstormed Saturday night and when we opened the curtains the following morning....cloudbase!!!! But having tickets, went up...but not much to see, as expected!!February 2016, looked at the forecast, and booked for an afternoon slot. Knew what to expect going in/up (VIDEO ready!!!!) and at the 'introduction wall'....the view!!!!!Video/talks...bar/cafe...souvenier shop...as much time as you like...and (video ready!)...lift down, to where you could purchase a photo the staff take of you before going up!Crowds weren't as mad as when it first opened!!!

Stunning Views (I think). I bought tickets to the Observatory on Monday afternoon, knowing that the forecast for Tuesday was for clear, sunny skies. Who the hell at Weather.com came up with that? It was raining lightly when we entered the Freedom Tower (One World), but after we stepped off the elevator and watched the brief video, we were faced with an observation deck that was so enshrouded with heavy rain clouds (and pelted with heavy rain/'sleet/snow) that our view was limited to the iPad screen ($15 each) that depicted what we would have seen if anything more than thirty feet from the observatory windows been visible. Add to that screaming school children, guides with bull horns and PA systems turned on HIGH!!!!!!! You get the picture.DO NOT EAT AT ONE DINE if you want to hear yourself think; casual conversation across the table is nearly impossible -- and will continue to be so -- until it is closed off from the noise below. The food and service were good, but did not make up for the noise.

Simply breathtaking!. Awesome elevator ride as the elevator walls become LED screens showing the evolution of the Manhattan skyline. Once on the Observation Deck, the views are spectacular. A bittersweet experience as one cannot help but to think that this view is what many victims saw right before their deaths on 9/11 and at the same time a feeling of pride and accomplishment for our country.
View with a Thrill. A little nostalgic and poignant having been to the top of the old WTC. Excellent viewing gallery - a must if visiting NYC especially for newbies to the city.

Top of the WORLD!!!. We were fortunate to visit it when it first opened to the public. It has gotten more crowded since. They issue timed tickets, but be ready to wait anyway. Enjoy the elevator ride. Don't be shy to wait for your spot once upstairs, to take awesome photos. Also, budget in the souvenir buys. The multi level observatory is well designed, and doesn't feel crowded. Don't forget to walk the great hall that connects the path station. Your dollars are well spent in this building.

Worthy of recognition..... We struggled to find the entrance to this installation. In the end we managed. Bearing in mind the site this is on, it can overwhelm you searingly and you simply cant help but be taken back. That said, it's new and a serious offering of architecture. The observation introduction is cheesy and unnecessary but once your through all the sheep dips - the view is truly breathtaking. Every word of awe possible should be used to describe this feeling of other worldly sensations. The shop left a sour taste, but hey, those guys clearly are used to dealing with tourists the same way....bluntly.Worth a visit if your in the area......

Waaoouuwww ! Fantastic views!. Really worth it ! Fantastic views ! The building has less "Charisma" than the previous twin-towers WTC but the inside is really Magic ! Could spend hours and hours at the top of this building to enjoy the different views of NYC (we had a perfect sunny day so the view was just ... Wwwaaaaooouuuuuuwwwww)

wonderful. save the best to last and this is by far the best now! We arrived at 5.15pm just in time for sunset, it was out of this world! Spend as long as you want up here, so well organised from the second you step into the elevator. I plan to return to NYC and I will definitely...World Trade Center now that it is finished was a must visit on this trip. This is a MUST for anyone visiting the big apple and well worth the price which is the same as the Empire State Building but I personally felt is was better value for money. Watch out as your ears will pop at some

Amazing view of the city!. My friends and I visited the One World Obseratory in August 2015. We had a fabulous time. The view over the city is absolutely breathtaking. If you plan your next trip to NYC, don't miss out on it!

Amazing!!!!. I took my Fiance on a date night here (always enjoying something different). To my amazment this date choice was on of my far best date nights. It was an amazing experience. We went for the evening tour and the city lights were just so stunning. I can't give anything away but definitely no experience can compare to this. It is breathe taking and very educational. I have lived in NYC all my life and sitting listening to some of the guides surprised me. They were informing aboout things I didn't even know about. Bucket List Qualified (Check)

Not for the Clustrophobic!. Hated the crowded elevator and being herded into an anteroom for a useless introduction, but all was forgiven once in the Observatory. The view is astonishing and the space accomodating.
Amazing. it was amazing - staff took great care of my elderly in laws - walked them to elevators and in front of waiting lines. We enjoyed the whole experience!

WOW WOW WOW. my advice is, save the best to last and this is by far the best now! We arrived at 5.15pm just in time for sunset, it was out of this world! Spend as long as you want up here, so well organised from the second you step into the elevator. I plan to return to NYC and I will definitely purchase tickets to visit OWO more than once next time! Restaurant at the top, cannot comment as we didn't use, lovely souvenir gift area! Cannot recommend a visit here highly enough.
The best view of the city. Make sure you have your camera is ready in the elevator .the 60 second ride there is video being displayed on the elevator walls. Great staff and amazing views

Breathtaking views, a "must do" when in NYC.. My family and I visited the twin towers back in August 2001 just before the 9/11 atrocities. We still have great memories standing atop of the South tower taking in the magnificent views, so visiting the One World Observatory - World Trade Center now that it is finished was a must visit on this trip.We didn’t pre-book but simply turned up on a lovely sunny morning for our visit, there was no queue at all so purchased our tickets and went straight in. After we had gone through the “airport style” security we were whizzed up to the observation deck at super-fast speed (serious ear popping stuff!!).On arrival you are taken to a theatre to watch a very interesting production, at this point I won’t mention anything else as it will spoil it for others. From there you go to the main observation floor to take in the magnificent views, you can hire an interactive tablet that gives real time information of the places/buildings of interest outside. There were also two staff talks on either side which were very interesting and were cleverly done.There are tour guides available to answer your questions of which I had a few. One thing that did surprise me, even though the new tower is 1776 feet tall, the observation floor is actually 100 feet LOWER than the original observation deck on the South tower. It would also have been nice to be able stand on the roof of the new tower as you could the old South tower. The problem we found taking photos is that you get “window reflection” plus some pillars also got in the way (the Shard in London is the same).The elevator ride back down is also an experience in itself, again I won’t spoil it for you. All-in-all a must visit when in NYC and I thought the $32 entrance fee was well worth it, just pick a bright sunny day (or clear evening) for your visit.

Fabulous views. My husband and I pre booked our tickets in advance and paid a little extra for the priority tickets. This meant we could skip the long queue at security for a fast track line through the checks. The lift ride up is amazing and the video show at the top is executed brilliantly - I won't ruin any surprises. Just have your camera ready. We spent a couple of hours taking pictures etc & timed our visit with sunset so we got some great photos!

Look Ma, I'm on top of the world. Words can only fail to describe this attraction besides being in complete awe of the views.This is a MUST for anyone visiting the big apple and well worth the price which is the same as the Empire State Building but I personally felt is was better value for money.Watch out as your ears will pop at some point in the lift (up and/or down).

Best View in NYC. I have done both the ESB and TOTR, but the One World Observatory wins for the most amazing views. Ticket line was very quiet, with friendly staff. We were guided through security, and then into the elevators, which had a wee interesting twist. On leaving the elevators we were then shown a short film. The view on a sunny Sat morning was outstanding, we could see for miles in every direction. I LOVED it and would definitely go back for the WOW factor and to "See Forever"

Incredible 360 degree view of NYC from a 100th floor. This new observatory brings you the opportunity to see one of the most amazing views of the city. It’s not cheap and you SHOULD review the forecast (the weather could destroy your plans).The elevator ride is also incredible... The elevator is an attraction itself.Do not miss this place!
Absolutely Amazing. One World Observatory was the surprise hit of our trip to NYC. The presentation was amazing, the views are amazing!! Just go.

Amazing views. Booked online in the UK.stunning views it was snowing when we were there,you really are on top of the world. Had a lovely cup of coffee walking around the observatory absolutely breath taking views an amazing experience. Spotlessly clean and good facilities.
long weekend in NYC. me and my family had a great time at this attraction.It had an exotic view of New york city.I had a great time at this place.The elevator was amazing.

Stunning. We booked o line before travelling and planned to visit the observatory after we had been to the 911 Memorial/Museum but the weather had other plans and the top of the tower was in the cloud and the staff said it was not worth going to the top and we could exchange our tickets for another day. We re-booked for the next morning and despite arriving before our time slot there was no problem getting in (9.30 am) and no queue.The whole experience was superb. I wont go into too much detail as I don't want to spoil it for others, but from entering the high speed elevator to getting to the observation deck is brilliantly done. The views from the top are awesome. We spent about 4 hours on the observation deck as there was no limit to how long you could stay. We hired an iPad/ tablet that highlights the landmarks below as you point it out of the window. There are also staff talks on various subjects about New York, with the cost of property quite an eye opener.There is a café/bar and shop on the upper floor of the observation deck.

The best of the three . If you come to New York you have to do this, we didn't even know it existed it was just a thought of wouldn't it be good to be at the top of there and after a quick Google search we were throwing on our boots and straight out of the door, this attraction is out of this world I mean there is Empire State high there is even Dubai high but this is wow I'm really high, you get though security and into a lift straight away no messing about, the lift is the coolest thing you will ever see but I won't spoil it, then your let to a theatre in were your in for another surprise, finally you get into the observatory and they will try and sell you an app on an iPad for $15 but I advise against it we got the ipad but within 15 minutes we were bored of it, it's clunky and needs work but other than that the view was amazing like nothing I have even seen before!!, the staff were all helpful they even guided us on how to get to the tour of the Statue of Liberty, they were constantly putting out information and you get free wifi in the building to, the cafe was very expensive as 2 sandwiches and 2 drinks cost us $40 but all else was amazing and it's a fantastic place to visit

Was ok. Was ok, nothing special. Too much distractions and up sell and some staff were rude which kinda ruined the experience. Won't be going again to this, will stick to only going top of the rocks and don't think I will be recommending this other than saying it's ok however better observatory lookout points available.

Surprisingly excellent. I somewhat baulked at the steep admission price but was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the experience. The views, of course, are extraordinary but the elevator rides and presentation by one of the staff lifted it into a really memorable experience.
What a view. Wonderful views from the top of the world trade centre. Try and get there early before the crowds and take a good camera.
visit the world trade center. the view was good but the cost was excessive. the lines were unpleasant and the TSA experience getting in was unnecessary and obnoxious

Awesome Views everyone will love. Awesome 360 view! Interesting background information. Elevator ride to the top was great. 102 floors. The observation deck is enclosed unlike the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building.

Amazing & not to be missed . . . ;-). When we visited the weather was not kind to us, visibility was very limited, but during our visit the weather changed & moved, so the views were constantly changing, despite the weather we truly enjoyed our visit, the building is amazing, both inside & outside & at night, when it stands tall all lit up, gorgeous . . .

New perspective on an old view. The views are amazing. elevator ride is fun with animated LED display of the building of NYC. The glare from the windows made for difficult photos so I recommend timing your trip wisely depending which direction you want a from
Ripoff central. . Buy this, buy that. Buy more. Buy 6 dollar water! Buy ludicrously overpriced food and souvenirs! There are great views, but it is way overpriced.

We loved it!. My 13-year-old daughter and me spent 3 hours at this observation deck on a clear day in early March. Absolutely loved the view. We ended up staying for so long because we got there at about 4 PM, then decided to stay longer to catch the sunset and then decided to stay to see (and photograph) the city at night, all lit up. It was beautiful! We found the "guides" to be professional and informative, with detailed answers to our every question about things we saw and the building itself. Highly recommended.

Breathtaking. This building has to be seen to be believed. From the moment you enter it is so surreal. The Lift alone has a presentation of the area whilst it takes you to the 104th floor! All I can say is the view from the top (on a good day) is breathtaking. I hired an Ipad for a deposit of $15 which was handy so you could tell what buildings you were looking at. There was also a café at the top - nice but very expensive. This is an experience that you will never forget.

Fantastic!!. Probably the most impressive view you could have over Manhattan ! The site is actually impressive and the way the visit is done is just very professional and make you impressed by the story of this building!The panoramic view is amazing!! You can t go to NY without paying a call to this fantastic tower!

Worth the spectacular view. Anyone who comes to New York should visit the One world observatory. It's worth the money paid. Spectacular 360 degrees view of NYC and NJ. I think best is to come about close to sunset to feel the views both in the day and at night.

Amazing building . As the building is new it's by far most impressive I personally think. Once up the top of the lift you watch a video with a surprise ending with is fabulous. can see 1 of the world trade centre footprints of the memorial other is bit close to building so difficult to see down. Interactive iPad is great as you point to where you are looking and it tell you info on what your looking at and for $15 between 3 that's not bad!!

Observatory and NO MUSEUM inc. in steep price.. Just for entrance to Observatory, per person is $32 + tax.Countdown elevator up to 100 floor to see scenic 360 degree. that's about it including a 3 minutes clips of videos of Manhattan. After getting much Grant it's a shame the Museum were not included in the price. Touristy like Disneyland hawking a i pad for walking around description of iconic buildings for extra $15.

You know you're going to.. If you can look past the tourist expenses every step of the way, this is actually a pretty awesome excursion. Sure, everyone is trying to sell you some garbage souvenir (the photo is greenscreened, btw.) and none of it is worth your money, the view really is worth the price of admission. The 47second elevator ride is actually too fast considering the fascinating display lining the walls. You want to spend more time seeing it and soaking it in, but you don't have the time. Go about a half hour before sunset and watch the transition from day to night over NYC as the lights come alive.

100 floors up - and the elevator up us spectacular !!!!. An amazing experience ! The ride up in the elevator is great as the walls come to life, it takes about a minute to ride up there. Once at the top the view is spectacular as the screens ride up to reveal the awesome sight ! Only downside to this is the money grabbing way they try to get you to buy photos etc, the audio tour system seemed brilliant until they mentioned at the end you had to pay an extra $15 if you wanted it, as there were a group of us it would gave been too expensive - shame. Oh yes and is it really necessary to charge €5 for a small bottle of water ? Nevertheless glad we went.

AMAZING . Absolutely amazing. Great view and tour guides are superb you can ask them anything and they are so willing to give information with great knowledge.. Words can not describe this it must be seen... Also it is reasonably priced and cafe has great pastrys and snacks
Great view. The most amazing view and the portal glass looking down on to the road was amazing the show they do before lifting the blinds is great

Not really worth the wait. We had a long wait to get to the top. It was a bit deceiving as the line snaked around and you could not see how long it was at points. While the view is good, it is also good from many other buildings and I could skip it.
Wow. Loved this place, so many things to look at, quite a somber place but very clean, the Americans have great respect for this building.

Great views. Wonderful views over the whole of Manhattan & the other boroughs from an observation deck at the top of One World Trade Center. The whole experience is amazing – you are whizzed from the bedrock up 100 floors in seconds and the lift journey itself is quite an experience.I don’t want to give too much away as it may spoil some of the “wow” moments. My advice would be: try not to read too much about it beforehand – just go and do it. Definitely worthwhile. For first time visitors to New York, make sure you get the tablets which allow you tap on all the famous landmarks to get history and information as you look at them.

WOWderful view but PRICEY food at the top.. This new experience felt a little like Disneyland in its attempt to please, yet the view did WOW us at the top of the cityscape. Very sleek, modern and clean. The restaurants prices...come on! $5 for a bottle of water. They really missed the chance to truly please here. I guess it costs extra to deliver the water to the 100th floor.

Great view. The Forever tower is a great way of seeing new York from high up. The organisation is great and better than at Top of the Rock , the lift experience and well done and then having an ipad as a tourguide is clever. Obviously coming from SA, where are currecy is worth nothing, the cost is high, but we loved it

A must do in NYC!. Great views of the city! Even the elevator ride is nice experience and the views are breathtaking. Definitely a must do attraction in NYC. Same price as for Empire state building and the rock - 32 dollars.

Beautiful Views. While it is a bit pricey (32/person), we had a great time going up to the top. We took our time and enjoyed all of the views. We did not buy the viewer and we still seemed to get great enjoyment just looking various things up on our phones. If you are doing it, you are going for the views and they are definitely fantastic. We took pictures from all angles.
Beautiful views . Absolutely amazing views of course when one is a hundred floors up. We went on a Thursday morning and had absolutely no wait at all. It's not the open air though.

Must visit BUT...... For the views this is a must visit but there are some cautionary notes:Don't waste your money on the iPad guide, you will spend much of your time recalibration get it. Avoid the cafe, even by NYC tourist attraction standards it is wildly overpriced ($5 for a standard bottle of Poland Spring for example)Naturally the staff are mostly rude and treat you with the contempt you rightly deserve for troubling them. But those views make up for it, so go and enjoy.

The sixth highest building in the world!. Great views from the top of WTC1. Ideally, you want to get there for a while before sunset so you catch the best of both worlds, daylight and darkness. The views are stunning and worth the trip.
night visit. go up at night for some breath taking views over the city that never sleeps. booked tickets before we went saves time

OMG, this is not to be missed. Make reservations and begin the journey! Riding the incredibly fast elevator goes from Manhattan when first settled to the present, in seconds. You step out and before you is an amazing recounting of the renewal after the horrible bombing and destruction, in a film. Then, you are surrounded by 360 degrees of sheer magnificence as you casually stroll the Observation area. Rent the IPad for more in depth understanding of what you see. Stand in the very center and see down to the street, hundreds of stories below! Sit, take it in, and rejoice in Americas resilience and determination to not be threatened. An experience you will NEVER forget!

" The New Must Do Attraction in New York". You really can see forever from the 102nd floor. It's breathtaking. At the top of the observatory there are guides who give you a 10 minute talk about New York, it's famous landmarks and the New Freedom Building. The staff at the Observatory are really welcoming and only to happy to help and answer any questions. We stayed at the top for over 2 hours just chilling out and enjoying the fantastic views. Book on line using a MasterCard for a visit on MasterCard Mondays and get 30% off ticket prices.

Unique. Experience a 360 degrees view from the 101 floor. The show starts in the elevator with that movie showing Manhattan evolution. No outside roof, but you CAN stick to the windows and get this weird vertigo feeling . At night with a clear view it is worth it , 34 $ as a reminder !

Breathtaking Views! Rude service in the bar and restaurant!. Breathtaking views and a beautiful tribute to 911. Looking down at the reflecting pools really stirs up those memories of that tragic day. The new tower shows how we have risen again & how resilient America & NYC is! A not to be missed stop! Spectacular view!Service not so much! FYI..the so called restaurant closes a full hour BEFORE the observatory! They are rude and very blunt when saying "We are closed."I entered the bar/lounge at 6:48pm and at first was told by the hostess,"We are closed. The restaurant is closed." So they close 10 minutes and one hour before they are Closed!I said I just wanted to go to the bar & they again said "we are closed & its last call." I said, really at 10 minutes to 7 you are giving last call?" So they let me in & informed me again it was last call!They include tip & gratuity automatically so my pint of beer was $13.98!Now they are yelling at my kids to not come & get me as they are officially CLOSED!Horrible customer service!!! Do not eat here it get a drink unless you wish to be treated like second class citizens!

One of the best Observatories!. I have to say I do like the fact that they sell tickets for a particular time. I believe it holds down the crowds. The presentation from the beginning to the end was wonderful. I would recommend this to anyone that goes to NYC!
bring your wallet. This is a pretty amazing attraction and you will pay heavily to see it. That being said, if you have the disposable income, why not spend it
NYC Getaway. This was our first time to the Observatory. We enjoyed magnificent views of Manhattan and interpretive information provided at the Observatory!

stunning views amazing effects. An amazing experience to be had.a must visit. Tip stand at front of the elevator when going up. no need for hire the i-pad. Downside taking pictures is through the glass. The whole experience we found was a WOW experience.

Breathtaking . A must if you are visiting NY.. this was spectacular as the views are incredible. The whole visit was good from the staff to the ease of access to the building. We booked tickets in advance which was a good idea. You have to see the views for yourself!

Unbelievable Experience ... A real NYC Gem!. This was a great day trip for us from Long Island and well worth the price ... spectacular views & definitely a must see! To top it all off we had a great dinner afterward a few blocks away at Sacco & Vanzetti Italian Bistro!

A must see - Go America!. After seeing the memorial, this was a great way to celebrate the American spirit of rebirth, revive and we shall move on. The line at 11:30am on a Saturday morning was a breeze. We purchased tickets and walked right on to the elevators downstairs. The elevator ride is quick, and shows a video on the walls as you ascend to the top. Little kids may have problems viewing the video if there are a lot of adults on the lift. Once at the top you are funneled into a room with blocky walls on one side. A short "yay America" video is displayed, and then the curtains rise to show the view from the top. A little hokey and over done, but hey...you did just pay $30.00 for an elevator ride.After a few (minutes or seconds) the curtains go back down and you are funneled over to the picture taking...we skipped this souvenir...and attempted to get over to the restaurant, which is a winding walk through the cafe and gifts.
