After our lunch we enjoyed the views from all sides of the observation level. It's a great place to visit for the young and old!!
Must see. We had to say that this was fabulous. Presentation excellent and views from the top were spectacular. Brilliant trip must see

Wow!. This is by any standards, a very high building...incredible 360deg views over the New York skyline. You overlook everything including the Empire State Building. It goes some way to repay the $32 entrance fee by shooting you up 104 floors in approximately 48 seconds as smooth as silk, whilst showing the construction New York in film snippets on the lift walls. Once there you can stand in the centre of the building on glass floor and look at the yellow cabs and all.The only thing that could be better for myself is that you don't get to walk outside and feel the height and the wind..... At the top of the Empire State Building you can.

nice experience but too commercialized. The beautiful tower that was built on the ruins of the twins, as a wonderful lookup point of all New York city. The visit is well organized and very efficient. But I couldn't escape from the feeling that the entrepreneurs, are first of all very interested in my wallet. It costs 32 US$ per person, but before getting into the observatory, you are faced to an aggresive marketing of a guide tablet, make pictures in an artificial background, as an expensive souvenir of your visit and other commercial sales. This is actually a memorandum and of the victims and as so, annoying

Breathtaking . There's no question that this is worth every penny of admission. It is a unique experience from the moment you walk towards the elevators on the ground floor. Even the walls of the elevator itself are part of the show, during the incredibly fast 60-second rise to the top. When the elevator opens you'll get another very short show in a small room...and then the wall goes up dramatically and you are left staring awe-struck at the most unbelievable view. It takes your breath away, honestly. The observation deck is a 2-3 floor area with floor to ceiling windows and a 360° view...bring the best camera you have, but even the worst will get you amazing shots. You can rent a tablet that you can use to point to anything you see outside and it will tell you what it is and give you a bit of info on it.

Spectacular views of one of the greatest cties on Earth. When visiting New York the One World Observatory is a must. At $32US per person it is not cheap, but is one of the best views you will ever see.One of the best experiences is the elevator ride up - as surround graphics on the elevator walls illustrate the history of New York island.There is a little of a corny suspense thing once you reach the top, but theatrics aside the view is amazing. It s a must see as you have uninterrupted panorama of the entire Manhattan Island and surrounds. We had a clear day and t was fabulous.The elevator ride down has the walls give the impression of a Willy Wonka elevator ride.All in all a must see when you visit fabulous New York.

AWESOME!!. This is one of the newest attractions in NYC< and is very well done. Be sure to rent the interactive guide, because it is incredible, and gives a virtual reality tour of things you will be looking at via an iPad. Great views. Is an inside activity so not getting blown around like at other observatories. Right next to the 9/11 memorial, so can do both at same time. Not far walk to Battery Park also.

Awesome!. Very friendly staff from the greeters at the door to the elevator guides to the restaurant staff. Lines were kept moving--no waiting. A beautifully designed experience to enjoy the 360 degree landscape of NYC, NJ and surrounding boroughs.

Go........to the top. If you do - take a video of their video when you exit the lift................definitely worth it. Well laid out, amazing views. A reminder of what happened 2001. Refreshments, tours, information, gifts - all available at the top.
Great experience!!. Worth every dollar, the presentations and the visuals were great, staff friendly and the views from all angles were amazing. Visited in the week and had no queues

Great Views. I purchased a VIP package. The VIP access at least in February is not worth it. The regular line was not bad but after the VIP access you get herded in the line with everyone else so there is no real VIP access. The elevator ride up and down is well done (a film is projected on the elevator walls-very cool). The views are amazing. FYI-there is no VIP access going down and the line going down was long on a slow day. They need to fix this. If you purchase VIP it should be up and down.

Must experience when in NYC. We went on a Sunday morning about 10:30, which was perfect. The lines were minimal but did grow quickly after we arrived. Go early and get your tickets online ahead of time. Strict security, as you would expect. We did this first and then went to the 9/11 Museum. Very powerful.

Very good.......BUT! . This is definitely somewhere you must visit whilst in NYC it is a beautiful building and the views are absolutely beautiful. This is NYC so as with all major attractions be prepared to stand in a queue - this didn't bother us at all. What lets this place down is people plonking their butts on the windowsills and not moving along. We went up about 5.30pm and literally was about 2m back from the windows as people just sat down and didn't move to let others get photos. In the end I asked a girl to move as her and her 5 friends were sitting for 15mins taking selfies uploading on social media and chit chatting. They want to manage this better, people shouldn't be allowed to do this. Also - all the money that was spent on this building I can't believe they didn't use non reflective glass in the observatory. As soon as it starts to get dark you see reflections of light from gift shop etc in your photos! I liked it - and it's worth a visit but sort out the windowsill hoggers!

Nothing short of Awesome. From the elevator ride up that serves as a multidimensional journey through time and space to the amazing views, it was a stellar experience. You have not experienced NYC without a tip to this observatory.

Great views, but poorly run. The views are fantastic, but they should do something about the people who just camp out at the windows. They pile all their bags and coats all along the window so no one can get up next to the glass to take pictures. The employees just look away.
Did my Anniversary. . I celebrate my 18th wedding anniversary. Did the tour and had sunset dinner at One restaurant. Everyone was very attentive to us. Excellent experience recommended to all.

Would have been 5 except for the sales pitch. I took my family and three kids ranging from 3 up to 10 on a Sunday morning around 11. There was no line to get in which was great but even if there was there were plenty of things to look at while waiting. My kids loved the elevator ride which shows you the building of New York through time as you go up. The reason I only rated it a four happened as soon as we got off the elevator. First they wanted to take your picture which you then pay for if you want a copy. We didn't get our photo taken so I'm not sure how much it is. Then they try to get you to cough up another $15 for an iPad with an explorer app on it that will give you information about the city. It looked awesome and of course my kids wanted it but I felt after spending $90 to get up here something like that should have been included or maybe $5. My family had a great time and the views of the city are amazing. There are 3 dining options in the observatory if you're hungry. It seemed like there were plenty of staff around to answer questions and they were friendly.

impressive views. the views you get are quite impressive, although you can't see central park from up there, and you can't go outside unfortunately - but you can take amazing pictures and get a feeling of how big Manhattan actually is
Not only the view...a great experience!. Yo can enjoy wonderful views but nothing as the way you get into the top...really unexpected! Totally recommended.

Truly amazing. 108 floors up this was truly amazing I don't like lifts and struggled a little as you can feel the pressure of going up so high . However it was well worth it. The views are out of this world . The observatory was packed . There was a restaurant bar shop etc there Would recommend and would visit again

Smooth tour. We visited on a Saturday morning and there was very little queuing. The lift has an amazing 360 video showing how NY has changed through the years and the total accent is only 47 secs. You're then herded in to a smallish room for what you would imagine to be a video but the reality is that there's a big unveiling of the view. Then you get to spend as long as you want on the 360 viewing gallery. One and only downer is that the viewing area is 2 floors lower than the lift stop which is disappointing. We've been up higher in dubai but this has an unrivalled view

See forever.... What an amazing experience. The view from the top is extraordinary and you can, see forever! Stunning 360° views of New York City taking in all the stunning buildings and architecture. We got there just after 9am on a Friday morning and didn't have to line up at all. We were at the top of the building in less than 10 minutes after buying our tickets. As we were leaving about an hour later the line was starting to grow so if you can make it there early then try to.
Pricey but worth the view. Go in the evening and stay to see New York City by night! Try to skip the sales pitches! The views in themselves are beautiful without the guides.

wonderful view. We purchase our tickets online prior to arriving and were a little earlier than our appointment which wasn't a problem. It wasn't overly crowded on a Saturday afternoon in winter. Had to go through security similar to airport; metal detector, put you phone, camera etc. in a separate box to go through scanner, take your coat off. Not overly intrusive though. The elevator ride was shockingly fast and had a cool surrounding screen showing how NY has changed in the last 400 years. Quick walk through with some history about the building and a great presentation of the observation deck. If you've done this I wouldn't also do the Empire State Building, at least not for the view. beautiful but the same and don't need to spending the money twice.

Great view, well done.. Okay- great view, especially at evening time. Tons of staff to answer questions and provide help. The view was awesome, but the crowds make getting to a window rough at times- big crowds.The line to get on the elevator took a while, but not a killer. The elevator oth ways shows a movie all around you. Nice, except on the way down the movie swirls around you- got some people nauseous even in a minute's ride. The biggest downside is the design of the three floors- who forgot bathrooms of adequate size? We got to the top after an almost 30 minute wait on line and through a quick movie, so a few people needed facilities.Walk into the men's room and two stalls and two urinals? What? A line out the door! Plan ahead there! Overall recommended, but it is a one and done for me.

View is incredible, some of the effects (on the way to the view) are interesting.. The view from the Observatory is great. Try to get there just before sunset so that you can see Manhattan by day, perhaps catch the sunset, then watch as buildings and streets light up one after the other

great view. it's an absolute must do in New York. You have a great view all over the city. But you need a bit patience, it's pretty crowded and if you want to take pictures, you have to wait a bit for a good spot
Amazing and Breathtaking View. It was a very memorable and tragic place. A must visit place to visit if you are in NYC. But have to be patient about the long line...

Amazing experience. It is absolutely worthy in a clear weather day; everything is well organized to prepare the experience of the wiew.Just a couple of remarkable comments:- the introduction trail to the elevator is not clear: people are popping out of the screen in a scattering way, and often repeat the same concept; the elevator trip up is really interesting, but a bit too fast.- it is too persistent the effort of the organization to sell extra services

A must see if you are in New York. After reading other reviews, I wanted to experience this for myself, with my wife. We had just visited the Museum which was incredibly emotional. This visit showed the American spirit and that of all New Yorkers (of which I am one).1) It will cost you about $ 32 US each and in my humble opinion so worth it! I have been to the top of the Empire State building and the Top of the Rock and this in my opinion is the best. I will give honorable mention to Top of the Rock as you can get outside with open views.2) The elevator ride brings you through a timeline beginning in the earliest times and show you the progression of a timeline as you go higher. It is simply awesome!! At the end of the elevator, you get out and they show you a video montage of NY. Then the walls open and you are blown away by the sudden and spectacular view of Manhattan!3) By all means, rent the ipad which is $15 US. It allows you to see and understand the 360 view of the city and beyond. Places are highlighted and you can touch those and fly to the spot where you will get a historical background of the place.4) There is food at the top. Deli sandwiches where you can stand at tables or sit down restaurant. We were going out to eat later so we did the standing. The restaurant look amazing. The prices for food were expensive, but hey your in NY:-)From your friendly New Yorker - visit the One World Observatory, you won't regret it!

Arrive an hour earlier than your booked time!!. I booked my ticket in advance for 30 minutes prior to sunset, figuring this would allow adequate time to catch the setting sun over New York. I then arrived 15 minutes prior to the time I booked, as the website recommended, only to wait in line for over an hour before I and my girlfriend were able to make it up to the top! The view was perfectly nice, but the line was unbearably long, extremely hot/stuffy and unorganized, and we watched people who'd paid 2x the price for quicker access cut right in front of us. We were then pushed out of the entry lobby into the 0 degree temperatures as we waited for our Uber, being told the lobby was only for those entering the building.

Great experience with nostalgic thoughts. I'm so very glad New York City built a new World Trade Center. The city's indomitable sprint is manifested in this wonderfully designed edifice. Although you can't hep but think of 9/11, this building is not abou the past but of the future. Nevertheless, there are staff everywhere on the observatory floor to answe questions, including a historian. They invite questions in an enthusiastic manner and are all quite competent. Views are spectacular though with an enclosed cueing area, you do have to contend with pillars. Nevertheless, the crowd moves wee enough that you have an unobstructed view of the city and New Jersey. We were fortunate to have been there when there wasn't a cloud in the sky; the views were simply awesome. We booked ahead of our visit for a timed entry and skipped a long line at the ticket booth. That was good. Signage outside directing the way to the entrance could be better and perhaps it will be in time. In all, the experience was well worth the trip.

Impressive and Fast Way to View City. Excellent view of the tri-state area. Very easy and fast to viewing area. The Empire State Building observation deck was closed during our visit, however, this provided a better, less windy way to view the city.

Worth it once. Took a quick trip through NYC and hadn't visited since the completion of the Freedom Tower. I'm a fan of getting a good view over any city I travel to and this one was pretty convenient. Pricing for any of the other observation decks in town is similar. The entire experience was well put together from the elevator displays to the quick intro to the deck layout. I could have done with the required iPad sales pitch though.
Great Views. This is a new experience and it has been done well great views well worth the money the lift is unique and so quick. the unveiling of the view is a nice touch

Simply Amazing!!!. This is one of the best views and tastefully done. Take the time to listen to the audio/video stories they are amazing and motivating as an American. Take note if they let you know that there is zero visibility they mean it, you will not see anything, if you get in for zero cost during this time it is worth a visit to the bar for a top of the World cocktail.
You can see forever. Amazing experience! The elevator ride, the 360 view, the history. This was an experience I will never forget and would recommend to anyone.
Awe Inspiring Vistas. Everything from the rid up the elevator to the slow reveal to the 360 degree views of all of Manhattan is awe inspiring. This is an unforgettable experience for all ages.

Really done right a must do in NYC. We were not sure we wanted to spend the extra for pre purchasing tickets . I'm glad we didn't because we did not have a set time for entry. It gave us the freedom to walk around lower Manhattan and over to the Seaport. Luckily there were no lines we walked up to purchase tickets for $30 after maybe a five minute wait. It was a perfectly clear day so the views were spectacular! Had a drink at bar but my husband didn't notice they added 18percent gratuity and tipped 20 percent on top so drinks were expensive. They should let you know. No music in background but it was in the bathroom, wish it was in the bar and dining room also. This really is an experience everyone should have!even if you were at the top of WTC this is a tribute to the men and women who lost their lives on 9/11.
Breathtaking view. Fantastic new place to see the Manhattan skyline. Really fast to the top and an amazing visual show in the lift and at the top before the big view 'reveal'. Loved it.

What a view!. What a great view of lower Manhattan! The kiosk where the have a speaker talk about areas of NY is a nice touch of education. Enjoyed a glass of wine and a moment of remembrance also. Worth the trip.

Amazing!!!. Unbelievable! Unforgettable! Nice toilets! Yes this place has it all. We were snowbound in January and found ourselves with 3 extra nights in the big apple. Due to the weather visitors were unable to get to the city so we walked straight in off the street with no queuing, yes, no queuing! Hold on to your hat as soon as you step in the elevator. I'm no going to tell you anymore as it would spoil the surprises but this is one heck of a trip and worth every penny. We started the day walking across the snow covered bridge from Brooklyn. Wonderful day.

See for miles - on a good day. I had pre booked tickets for this and the day we turned up there was zero visability so we were able to rebook. When you first go in you walk through 'bedrock' and go up some very fun (and VERY fast) elevators to see a story of New York. You then get to see the stunning views around you. A really great experience. The one down side is how reflective the windows are makes it difficult to take totally clear pics

Great eye views, not so much for photography.. Great looking 'modern building', and yes I enjoyed it, but being a keen amateur photographer I was disappointed there was no outside viewing, all inside behind glass.That glass can cause problems if you want a clean image, there seemed to be some kind of heated element within the glass that can spoil your images.On the plus side the cafe is reasonable with its pricing and that was a pleasant surprise in NYC.

Great Observation Deck. Ok, so it doesn't have the best views in Manhatten (in my opinion top of the rock does) but it does do it well, theres a moment where everybody gasps... I won't ruin the surprise, but it's definitely worth a trip up. The great thing about the tower is it doesn't bombard you with the 9/11 history and it leaves that to the museum, this is just a great observation deck in a great building.

Absolutely incredible!!. A must visit destination. Rebuilt world trade centre reaches new heights with the observatory. Breath-taking views of the NYC skyline as well as landscape from level 102 - though not from open deck. You can really see NYC from here forever..Fairly priced for the amazing views on offer.
Don't go at night. The view is quite nice, but not as good as Top Of The Rock. If you go at night you will only see the reflection because of all the windows. A shame, really.
Amazing views. The tour is well organized and short in duration. When I saw the view for the first time I was impressed. After the tour you wonder around on your own to enjoy the 360 degree views.
Wauuuuw. THE place to visit for an astonishing view on the city, some special effects are also worthwhile . If course I won't spoil your visit by....

More then just an observation deck.. A visit to the observation deck is far more then just looking out at the amazing views. There are a few surprises thrown in (that I wont give away) that make this a great experience. As expected the building is exceptionally modern and offers the best views of the city and surrounding area on a clear day. Will be doing this again when I return to New York.

Incredible!. This was a highlight of our trip to New York City. Very easy to buy timed tickets online and found a deal for a family of four for $99. No waiting in line and the elevator ride is fantastic - I only wish we could have done it twice to fully enjoy the movie that surrounds you as you're ascending. Once up, there's a fantastic movie presentation that ends with a big surprise (don't want to spoil it). And then the observation floor is unbelievable. It's all indoors too, so no cold wind. The views are amazing and this is definitely worth the stiff price tag. Only downer? The sales pitch they make you sit through before letting you go to the observatory. Tacky.

Beautiful views, highly recommended. You can purchase tickets online in advance which saves you from waiting in line. Unfortunately the day I picked (you need to specify day and time of your visit) was extremely foggy and I was informed that the there was zero visibility. Staff was very helpful and I was quickly able to have my ticket reissued for the following day by guest services. I went on my lunch break on a Wednesday and there were no line ups at all. Staff told me the busiest time of day is around sunset.The short elevator ride to floor 102 is impressive as it shows images of the changing landscape of NYC over the past couple hundred years. It takes a few minutes to get to the observation area as they want to take everyone's picture (to sell you later as a souvenir) and then try to rent you an IPad for $15 to assist in identifying what you are looking at down below. The view is spectacular, although entirely from inside glass so some reflections if you take pictures. Would definitely recommend visiting while in NYC.

Skip the Empire State Building. I've been to all 3 of the most famous observation decks in NYC. I rank One World Trade Center (Freedom Tower) first, followed by the Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) a close second. The views from both of these observation decks are magnificent, the staffs are friendly, the decks are very spacious, and the lineups for the elevators are well organized. In contrast, the Empire State Building is crowded, verging on chaotic, and, unless you play in the NBA, the views from the observation deck usually feature the heads and shoulders of strangers. The views from Freedom Tower and Top of the Rock are very different; the former featuring sweeping panoramas of Liberty Island, Staten Island and New Jersey as well as Manhattan. The Top of the Rock offers magnificent views of Central Park to the north and the towers of Manhattan to the south. If time allows, visit both; if time is tight, pick the one situated close to other sights you wish to visit. In either event, you won't be disappointed.
Very Cool. It's a bit pricey but the elevator ride up is one of the coolest things I've seen. It's interactive and the views are amazing. It's a great experience to do as a family.

Simply Amazing. I was going to college near NYC when 9/11 occured. This was my first trip back in over 10 years, so I wanted to see the observatory and I can only say that my expectations were far exceeded. I cannot put into words how amazing the view is and I strongly recommend going at night, the lights of the city in the evening are amazing. The memorial pools that are outside are an impressive, if sobering, experience as well. If you have just one night in NYC, this is where to spend it.
Great views. Great veiws we paid the extra for the Ipad and other loosing it's bearing often it really made the experience more enjoyable

WOW!!. A must see for any NYC visit. The trip to the top of the 102 storey building takes less than 60 seconds. the views from the top are superb on a clear day. The bar at One World does greta cocktails to round off the trip

Nice view of New York. This is the nicest view i have experienced in New York. A must do. I have been to the empire state building but find this has a better view. You should also have lunch at the view restaurant which serve surprisingly excellent food and wine.

Amazing view but........ When a view I SO spectacular why do you have to spend so much time sexing it up with pointless videos and exhibitions before you see the view. I don't need to see a video about New York when I get out of the lift on the 102nd floor, I want to see the view.The view is incredible though and the guides walking round the observation deck are incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. Cut the crap and show the view
Absolutely must do in NYC!. A truly unique and incredible experience. Don't miss it when in NYC. The views are stunning and with advance ticket purchase you can go right up without waiting in line.

Brilliant elevator ride. Brilliant elevator ride with film of how NY used to be from 1400 upto present day, 3rd fastest lift in the world, then another short video before the screen opens, lovely view of NY and Brooklyn bridge, drinks are very expensive up there, $6 for a Gatorade or similar!, deffo a must do

Breathtaking!. If you have to choose one building to go to the top, this is the one! Breathtaking view of Manhattan and surroundings (actually you can see up to 50 miles in a clear sky!)Great high-tech building and an amazing surprise upon arrival!

Best Observation Deck in the City!. This has got to be a must stop for anyone visiting the city. From the elevator ride with three walls of screens, to the entry presentation, to the 360 degree views, the experience is nothing short of amazing. Plan on spending time on the top and go just as the sun is setting - you can see forever!

Incredible Experience. The views are breathtaking and the ipad virutal experience is a great deal of fun! My son loved using the ipad to find his favorite NYC sites like Citifield. The start of the tour is amazing and everyone ooh-ed and aah-ed.

Amazing Views of the City. First off, it took less than a minute to get to the top in the elevator. Wow! Have your cell phone ready to capture the movie shown on the walls of the elevator on the way up and down. Views from the top are the best I have seen in the city and I have been to the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock. No comparison. Did not feel rushed and you are able to spend as much time as you want. Restaurant on the top is pretty good but a bit pricy and the view while eating is a once in lifetime experience. You can see forever!

A must see. So typically american, they take you on a tour/adventure, they milk the views you are going to see but once at the top they really are amazing. We had an amazing day weather wise so could see for miles!

Awe-some experience!. This experience was amazing from the time we were walking to the Tower from outside, through ending the visit with time at the Reflecting Pools afterward. Purchasing the tickets online was very easy, with plenty of time slots to reserve. We reserved a time of 5:15 pm, to be at the top in time to see everything, and also see the sunset, and the NY City twinkling lights at night. The timing was perfect. When we entered Global Welcome Center, as our tickets were scanned, our state of Missouri was highlighted on the huge global map, and "Missouri" stayed lit up for a few moments. Very cool. The walkway to the elevator, at the bedrock, with the personal stories of the people who built the Tower, was very moving. The elevator ride to the top was nothing short of amazing, as the walls of the elevator transformed into perfectly clear scenes of the time-lapse of NYC from 1500's through today. Upon exiting the elevator, there is a floor to ceiling, wall to wall screen of another amazing video of NYC, which seems like you're looking outside. At 2 minutes, this amazing screen raises up to reveal the windows that look out over NYC from the Observatory. A photo was taken of the 4 of us, which we didn't think we'd buy, but when we saw at as we were leaving, we couldn't pass it up. We went to the welcome desk where we were greeted by staff, and we rented the One World Explorer that gave interesting additional information about buildings we were looking at from the windows. We actually didn't use this very much. It was interesting, but there was plenty to see without it. The views were incredible from all of the 360 degree windows. The sunset was beautiful. Seeing the building lights and lines of red auto lights going up and down the NYC streets was breathtaking. We had a drink at the restaurant, enjoyed the view awhile longer, and left after 3 hours of taking our time and taking it all in. There was hardly anyone there as we were leaving, so we asked the elevator staff if we could ride the elevator back up and down to get the experience again, which we did. Truly amazing! We took some incredible photos looking up at the tower when we were leaving. We went to the Reflecting Pools, which are so powerful. There was a white rose and a red rose placed over a name - brought tears to my eyes. The Museum was closed for the night, but we could see in the huge windows, the huge iron trident from the Towers. Awe-inspiring. This was an experience we will never forget.

More Than the View. The view, of course is remarkable! I have never seen the view of the harbor and how the rivers come together and .... Well, you have to see it. However, the multi-media presentations really enhanced the experience and they did not distract from the ability to walk around. Watch them, walk away, ask questions. I think the fact that we were there in February really made it better. They are obviously geared to deal with the large crowds of summer and the nicer months. Our bonus. I expect to go back and will pay the extra to get the Ipod next time for $20. When you look anywhere it shows you what you are looking at and other details. It is a must if you have not been to NYC and want to understand the layout. Don't expect any written descriptions of what you are seeing.

Don't miss this on a clear day. We went up in the tower on a very clear, February day. You could see views of New York in all directions. It was the first day of our first time in New York and help give us a perspective of the layout of the city.

Wicked amazing!. Our view was not perfect because it was not the clearest of days but our visit to the new WTC was very powerful. It was my first time in NYC for a real visit and this was one of the important stops on the trip. The WTC Observatory had just opened this year and the presentation of the history of the 9/11 events and the rebuilding of the WTC are a very powerful story. I was really surprised at how such a large building could bring the individual stories of the loss of 9/11 to life. The people who created the tourist experience did an amazing job. While many hundreds of people were touring I didn't feel rushed or crowded but it was September and on a weekday. Overall it is a destination that cannot be missed. The memorial in the courtyard is as amazing as the Vietnam Memorial. I had a very similar feeling in NYC as I did when viewing the Vietnam Memorial some 25 years ago as a teen.

Amazing Views. What a feat. Get there early before it gets to crowed. The 360 views of NYC, New Jersey, Brooklyn etc. The cost for adult is $32 but well worth it. They have ambassadors everywhere, eager to answer questions of show you around. Also for $15 you can rent an ipad, which you can point to an area and it will highlight the famous landmarks and give you a brief description.

Go for the View, Tolerate the constant effort to sell you something.. It's likely to be along wait as you wind your way through the metal detectors and the seemingly endless "fake" bedrock to the elevators. You will then wait again as pitch an iPad rental to you, and then again as they make you watch a short video. Tolerate it. The view is spectacular. You will also find yourself in the middle of gift shop and what sounds like a carnival barker contest on the observatory level. Go once. Take it all in.
Amazing. One of the best sights in New York I would recommend this to all friend. The restaurant is fab and the view is out of the world

Amazing view! . We visited the observatory on a very clear and sunny day, the view was outstanding! We thoroughly enjoyed the elevator ride up to the top which told us the story of how New York has changed over the years! The best part was the wall of videos which opened up to reveal the view! My only complaint was the fact that they offered a tablet, which would have been so interesting to use but after showing you how good it was then told you it was available to hire for a charge! This is a shame as we had already paid for the attraction so didn't want to pay anymore money to hire one! We visited at 3:30pm and found there was no queues and not busy up the top either so we could sit in the window and just take the views in!

Amazing. Timed it so we were able to view both sunset and the full moon. It was my birthday and after the video, my husband son and I all dropped our jaws and said Wow! There was no line, Monday the 22nd of Feb at the 4:45 time slot.

Great view but not so nice experience. After a crowded line you will take an elevator animated by a simulated visual experience of New York City. It is impressive to think that in a matter of seconds you will reach floor 102. What follows is very unpleasant, and you feel in a forced Disneyland. Grandiose music in a darkish room, the curtains are unveiled and you get a sneak peak (less than 10 seconds) of the view. After the slogan yelled out in off voice, they close the curtains in a matter of seconds and thank you for your visit. Then they will force you to pose for the souvenir picture, and push you an Ipad for 15USD to map the city. They will invite you to continue consuming at the cafeteria.I asked the guides for information on the next steps, and they did not provide more information. So I thought that was it and was quite disappointed. But in the end you actually can go down to floor 100 where you can enjoy the gorgeous view. If you do not know New York well, the ipad thingy is not a bad idea and can be really useful. Overall, the visit is very much worth it, as a tourist and as a New York resident, but you have to bare with the showmania and the greedy nature of the visit. Once you pass beyond that, it is truly quite nice. I would make the experience more New York (less Epcot Center). The city speaks for itself, no need to add music and visuals. I would sell the ipad after the guests have enjoyed a bit of the view and realise it is quite handy. And mostly I would tweak the veil/curtain 30-second show and leave the curtains open (close them after the group has left). Cause otherwise it feels like an insult to your intelligence and to your wallet. The view helps to forget it but it takes a while to recover from the tourist-trap syndrome.One added star for the accessibility: We did it with a stroller, and there were only 3 steps we needed to overcome.If you buy online dont worry about printing the tickets, you can do that at the booth with your reservation number.

You mustn't miss this...... Brilliant. Sensitive reflections on 9/11 in the foundations followed by an imaginative lift ride which transports you through the ages of Manhattan. This is followed by a short video presentation which concludes with the 'screen' lifting to reveal the view for the first time - this actually drew applause from the group that we were with. Utterly spellbinding views - in terms of wow factor they are seriously not dissimilar to seeing the Grand Canyon for the first time. What I really appreciated is that you do not feel pressured to shuffle through and depart quickly - you could spend all day up there with nose pressed to the windows....

Amazing . Loved it, the speed of the elevator traveling all that way up is effortless and timeless! A short presentation then you get to take as long as you like exploring the 360 degree outlook onto New York There are people standing at each direction eg South, explaining what you can see You could hire these tablets for $15 and it told you where you were, it followed you around, good but we didn't pay for that The price in the food place is shocking , the only downfall

Do Not Miss This!. Fantastic view of the city (plan to go on a clear day with visibility). Nice gimmick: an iPad (rented, for an additional fee) that you hold up to the view and it names places of interest). The best, absolutely best part is the elevator ride up. As you fly up 100 floors, the view of New York changes, from farmland centuries ago, and gradually the houses, buildings, bridges are added. If I could have paused this, it would have taken me an hour to get to the top. Absolutely fascinating.

Best view of NYC!. The Empire State Building and Top of the Rock have great views, but this tops them both! We had sunset flex tickets with VIP access, well worth it! Inventive elevator ride, fun presentation then the VIEW! Amazing 360 degree views from 102 floors up. Friendly staff made it extra special. There is a restaurant, bar, snacks, and a gift shop. I would have preferred some nice music to the hired people who were giving loud presentations. Other than that, it's a fun time and fantastic view, especially at sunset!

Great view on a great day. The view from here is everything you would expect. The wait in line to go up is a little disney world-like which helps pass the time. Would recommend renting the ipad as it really does help you appreciate what you are viewing.
Stunning. $36 each in and it's stunning. All behind glass though. I preferred Rockefeller as you get to be outside but this was awesome too and I'm glad we did it.
Spectacular!. From the second you step into the elevator, you know this is going to be good! Please don't be worried about the elevator ride, they make it so you hardly notice. Very much recommended!
Amazing. Great value. The lift up is amazing, the views unbelievable and the whole experience is unforgettable. Very good.
Just amazing. After the quick ride up in the elevator you are given a quick video demonstration, at the end of the video the "wall" lifts away and you are truly wowed

See forevvvverrrrrrrrrr......... Having completed Empire state and the Rockefeller centre, on my latest visit to NYC I had to go for the New York trilogy and gosh its was wow!What I have to say is that the service provided here is first class, on the original day of a pre planned visit the cloud cover was that low that you couldn't even see the top of the World Trade and we were advised that the viewing floor was closed and offered a no quibble refund or rebooking at our preferred date and time, this we did with no hassle and returned 48 hours later.The experience is slick starting in the foundations of the World trade centre with interesting information, then a high speed lift going up 107 floors, you have an option for hiring a fully interactive tablet guide which is a optional extra (what I appreciated was they explained have they worked without forcing the item on to you top marks for that) to give you more information or you can just discover for yourself.The view is trying something giving views of downtown, Brooklyn and New Jersey that you can't get anywhere else.The efficiency and value of this venue really stand out for me, if your in NYC it's well worth visiting the highest building in the western hemisphere and see how far you can see!

Great Views!. Can't really beat the views. It's a little deceptive that you start out on 102 to be sold on rental an electronic viewer, then down to 101 where you can buy food/drink and then, finally, down to 100 for the actual observation deck. The best view to the north is blocked by a huge piece of electronics that, presumably, costs extra to use -- didn't bother to check. On a bright day, photos can be a little tough due to the reflections of the pillars and people behind you on the windows.

Beyond Fabulous - Not To Be Missed. My wife and I visited One World Observatory with another couple over the long President's Day weekend and on the day that we visited, the skies were crystal clear for as far as one could see. There simply aren't enough superlatives to describe the views. The cost is on the high side, but when one considers that all staff members are salaried so that they can be thoroughly vetted before working in the building, the cost doesn't seem as bad, especially when one considers the tight security that is apparent everywhere. The security is nearly identical to what we all experience at airports all over America. There are trained staff available on the floor of the observatory to answer questions about the building and anything/everything about what is in any particular view. The viewing level provides a complete 360 degree view. We easily spent about two hours taking pictures and just standing and staring at the views. Although there are lines to go to the top and again to return to the ground level, the procedures keep neither of the groups ever get tangled up and the lines move quite quickly and smoothly. For those who don't enjoy long elevator rides, the time on board is very brief; however, it was just long enough for my ears to pop three times each way. The experience is superb for all members of the family and is a "must do" when in New York City - we heartily recommend the One World Observatory at the World Trade Center.

Very well done. What's not to like about the tallest observatory in New York with fabulous views in good weather? But, it is done really well. In the elevator going up you are shown New York through time. At the top deck there is film of modern New York, and then the view is revealed. An amazing effect. We were fortunate in having a bright sunny day with views for miles. A must for visitors to New York.

Unbelievably well done from the moment you walk in on the ground floor. Took my 2+ yr old grandson who lives in Brooklyn. Chose early time on a Sunday, so there were no crowds. Grandson was a little timid with the revolving entry door and within seconds he was comforted by no fewer than 5 friendly staff members. An hour and a half later when we left they greeted him on a first name basis at the door. He also balked a bit on the escalator down from the top floor to the observatory deck and was instantly helped by a staff member. All the positive comments in the other reviews are so true (won't repeat them here). Wish I had been a little better prepared for the extraordinary elevator video history experience. So much to see going up and back down. Do some homework on NYC and NJ geography to get the full benefit of the experience. The quality of the facility and its audio/video apparatus is over the top. Be sure and stop to listen to the live video presentations. The presenters are very well informed and skilled in answering all sorts of questions. Grandson liked the Skyport the most. Without exception every staff member we encountered was friendly, courteous and helpful. While the views are memorable, I will also not forget how well we were treated. Finally, while the observatory is devoted to taking advantage of the views, it is impossible to overlook the tragedy that took place at that very site - don't miss the memorials.

well done. very beautiful but geared toward tourists. As New Yorkers we would have preferred that the ipads we rented give us the historical views of spots we focused on. That info is available as they are shown for split seconds during the amazing elevator ride up
Wow. Incredible. Views amazing. The lift up is worth the money alone. Not over crowded. Staff helpful. Very well set out.

Must see view. Its not the highest in the world however the one of most beautiful scenes that you would have come across. It opens almost daily, however try to go there by the evening to see the sun set.

Absolutely Breathtaking.... One World Observatory was absolutely breathtaking. From the moment I waked in from the ground entry excitement was building and boy are you rewarded when you get up to top. The views were spectacular in all directions and the day was the best you could have. The layout of the space was something I'll never forget and it's well worth every cent once your confronted by what I would call heaven. I take my hat off to the designers, staff and all involved with the creation of this observatory and those there the day I visited. I urge all who visit New York to visit One World Observatory to truly 'See Forever' and have have an experience which leaves you speechless!!!I LOVED this place and can't wait to come back very soon.

Amazing views of all of NYC. Truly amazing experience. We took he East River ferry from midtown down to Wall Street and walked across to the WTC site. The memorial site is amazing in its self, very tranquil and well respected.We were due into OWO at 3pm and turned up early per the instructions that arrived with the PDF tickets. Shame there is no offer of e-ticket to your phone.Anyway, there was no queue, just a simple security check and you're int to the elevator. What a way to start the whole experience. I won't spoil it but if you really want to know you can see it on youtube. 102 floors in 60 seconds, and you don't feel as if you're even moving. Once you alight you are presented with a video wall and then you move through to the observatory, but you must pass the obligatory 'upset' of an iPad virtual tour guide for $15!!!Once past this you move down a level into the observatory itself which is an open level with 360 degree views.

Speechless!. This was unreal! The view from the top 360 degrees on a clear day were mind blowing! It is pricey $32 but worth it ...the elevator ride was awesome showing some NYC history in the quick 7 second ride on the way up!
What A View?. I thought The Empire State was good, One World is something else.The lifts are virtual Panoramic and you get a great feeling as though you are part of the construction. The views

Well worth a visit. We hav been to New York several times and have been up the Empire State Building and to the Top of the Rock and I can say the One World Observatory is excellent. The whole experience is done with respect to the people who died or lost loved ones in the terrible Septembef 11th attacks. I won't spoil the preshow but wow. The whole experience is different to the other high up attractions and the talks give you lots of information about New York past and present.
Breathtaking views!. You fly up 102 floors in an elevator in less than 60 seconds. Then you see everything! Amazing views, great presentation about WTC and a convenient restaurant on the 101st floor.

Just shut up!!!!!. Why in the USA does someone always have a microphone?? The people giving talks were so loud. I don't want my picture taken and I don't always need a gift shop. On the plus side, the elevator ride is very inventive and finally the view. WOW what a view, but can't we be left in peace to enjoy it??
Amazing. Absolutely exceptional. Totally smooth and well organised travel up and the multi-media presentation was breathtaking. Lovely food and great coffee. Delighted with the whole experience.

Stunning views of New York City. If you want to get the best views of New York then the One World Observatory is the place to go. The adventure starts with the video wall giving you information about the people who helped construct the tower and what it means to them and to New York in general. This is down in the basement level, and gives a real sense of the bedrock of the structure itself. Follow this with the terrific lift journey showing you New York's creation, and allowing you to forget about the height you are climbing at a rapid speed, and before you know it you are up on the observatory level. The start of this part of the 'journey' is also well thought out, and gives a stunning introduction to the views - no spoilers here - you have to experience it to know what I mean. Next onto the only 'sales pitch' bit of the observatory, the offer to use individual iPads giving an interactive commentary of what you are seeing. No longer do you have to carry a black box and wear earphones, this is a fully interactive tour that shows you the views you are looking at, and gives interesting information about the key buildings you can see. And it is GREAT! definitely worth the $15 it cost us when visiting. Of course it goes without saying that the views were phenomenal, although we were incredibly lucky and had the clearest day's weather since it had opened. Not so sure what it would be like on a cloudy or rainy day. Finally, (and see separate review for this too), if you want to eat up there, and can afford a bit more than canteen food prices, then definitely book into the One-on-One restaurant. The food was amongst the best we had in NY (and we had some great food!), reasonably priced and you get to see the great views while you eat. We were lucky enough to be seated above where the guides were giving talks about NY, but as these were well worth listening and were very entertaining and informative we didn't mind. Can highly recommend to anyone who wants to visit NY and see the sites from up high.

Great building, shame we could not go up. Definitely worth a visit if open. Unfortunately the day we went visibility was love so the observation deck was closed. Quite expensive but I imagine would be worth it.

Astounding. Well worth visiting. We went here rather than the Empire State and we didn't regret it. The lift journey was an experience in itself. The views were breath taking. A bit expensive but definitely worth it.

Awesome. The entire experience was well thought out and conceived. My friend and I truly enjoyed the experience and the view. SPECTACULAR! The staff was very helpful and assisted everyone extremely well. Everyone there seemed to be enjoying the view and experience. Well worth your time as well as the 9/11 memorials and exhibits.

Spectacular experience. Picked our entry time using the website graph and we were in line less than 5 minutes. Arrived early and security staff suggested using the undergroud tunnel to browse the shopping center across the street which is connected to American Express lobby and Eleven Tears 911 Memorial - one of the most touching in the city. OWO has the most cordial and helpful staff of any place I've ever visited. Views are spectacular - be sure to rent iPad for identification of building and other attractions as you walk around the observatory. Live commentary on events in the city at one spot. On a clear day it can't be beat. Several aha! moments but I won't spoil your experience.

Top of the world. I went to the top of the building on 19th February 2016 with my wife and stepson..it was 1500hrs and it was the most incredible experience ever. Superb views. So well organised by staff with no queues. A fantastic time was had. Took so many photos from every conceivable angle. Great value too. Booked on line before leaving on my trip to New York. Everything went like clockwork......can't wait to visit again...
The best perspectives. great finish to the 911 tour. see the magic of Manhattan all around. Friendly staff at the top and good snacks also.

Wow!. We went on Sunday morning the weekend after Valentines Day - the quietest weekend in New York. We got tickets in advance online. No wait. Very well managed and brilliantly presented elevator ride up and unveiling of the view. Spectacular view. Better than Empire State according to our traveling companions who have done both. Bravo.

What did you do after 9/11. We visited previously just a few months before the World Trade Towers were 'bombed'. We were interested as to what USA would do with the mangled wreckage and were pleased with what we found. The site has been tastefully changed to represent what happened, who were culpable, and what direction we need to be going forward in. Well done.

Breathtaking views. This is a must do when visiting the city, the very speedy lifts takes you up to the 80th floor in seconds and then you change to another and you climb more floors to the observation level and the view hits you immediately, the panorama is breathtaking and a camera is a must to catch all those lovely images.
Definitely worth going here. Amazing views, cool building, even the elevator ride up is entertaining. Nice to visit on a clear sunny day.
It's massive !!!. It's not until you get up to it you realise just how big it is. Well worth a trip up to the top but expect long queues.
Awesome, just awesome . Well worth the money. Awesome views. 360 degree views. Go for sure when in New York city, so much history there and breath taking views.

Favorite part of our trip to NYC. Such a great experience. The elevator ride up is thrilling. The view is beautiful. The friendly staff was all very hospitable and classy. It seemed like we were being treated to a high class resort. Very clean and elegant looking. One lady told us this is a popular spot for marriage proposals. I can see how it would be considered romantic.

Bit Pricey but great views. We did not have to queue for very long and the views from the top were breath taking to save money pre book with the likes of Aviator and save about $10 if your in New York this is one that you must visit
Not to be missed. Wow! When you first see the view, it takes your breath away. My daughter and I filled up we were that blown away. Fabulous experience.

The elevator ride, oh my!. The observation deck is great and if you have to choose between this and any other building, go here. The views of the harbor are unparalleled. The elevator ride alone is worth the trip--watch the walls... (just take Dramamine for the ride back down!!). The view is better than the Empire State Building and the deck is less crowded, making the overall experience better. Go to the Empire State Building for the Art Deco architecture and the history but if all you want is a view, the One World Observatory is for you.

Magnificent views. Well, NYC is a lot about the Skyline right? And there is probably no better place to see it than from the observation deck. The price is about $30 for adults and the experience is very well organized with multiple ticket booths, efficient security control etc. The only thing preventing me to give a five star rating is the ambition to sell extra services when arriving the deck, such as rental of iPads for descriptions of which buildings can be seen, group photographs (the Disney-type, "let's take your picture and you can buy it on your way out"). Maybe it's just me, but I think that became a little too much. If you ignore the efforts to sell all the extras this is well worth a visit.

Thoughtful Presentation before a Wonderful View Unfolds. The price of $32 compares well with London's Shard and the elevator ride is particularly inspiring as a wrap-around digital display allows the city to grow and develop around you - with a fleeting and sad glimpse of the original towers too. The windows are wide enough to allow good photography and all sides of the city and neighbouring New Jersey can be seen beneath

AMAZING!! Must see for everyone!!. Going to One World Observatory was an experience I will never forget. Emotional.....tastefully done.....the views are INCREDIBLE!!!! The employees are so much fun! They are upbeat, nice, willing to help in any way! I will definitely go back next time I'm in the city!

Brilliant views. Same price as the other observatorys in New York (Empire State and Rockefeller - $32 for an adult). Very modern building and starts with a video from constructors workers and others who worked on the observatory's build which was interesting. The 40-something second elevator ride up to the top features a 3 wall screen inside which shows the development of New York City over time which was cool. When you get to the top another video introduces you to a taste of New York with a pretty special surprise at the end (which I won't spoil for anyone). The view all around the city are stunning, with some interactive bits at 2 ends. The only issue with the views is the glare from the windows which is only a problem when you take photos (especially at night). There's a cafe and bar/restaurant upstairs, again nice, modern, plenty on offer but quite expensive. If you want to eat at the restaurant, book well in advance with your ticket because it's very popular!Overall a great experience and one I'd do again.

Great views. Great views. Have your video camera ready on the elevator ride up. Really cool. I went on a Friday at 10:45 and the line was very short. No need for express pass you can get online. However I did see 10:30 was sold out. If I go again I think I will go see what the lines are to get tickets and use my phone to buy online if needed.

Amazing. Amazing views from the 102nd floor of the OWO above NYC. We went on a clear and saw for miles around, in all directions! Beautiful, stunning and scenic were the thoughts that entered my head as I took in the city that never sleeps. A must-see, must-do tick off of the bucket list!!

Fantastic and Amazing. While not cheap, family of four costs about one hundred US dollars and it is worth every penny. The ticketing line was fast and the elevator ride up was even faster. The elevator walls are lined with screens an as you go up you see the city change over time. It lasts about 60 secs and you have traveled up 1200 feet and 100 stories. The three floors of the observatory broken into different levels with a cafe and restaurant, gift shops and the 360 degree observatory. The views are amazing and the interactive ipad rental is great for kids. We had planned to stay only 30 mins we ended up staying for almost 2 hours.

A must go in NY. Since you get in it is a pretty amazing experience. Then the elevators are awesome. Up there the view is great but it is indoor so you have a glass that reflects and is kinda hard to take good pictures. In the other hand this is good because protects you from the weather.

Worth the wait!. We went at 4.30 on Valentine's day and were up at the top by 5.15 without the VIP pass. If you are short of time, pay the $22 extra or use your Mastercard to get express admission. Wonderful views and the cafe is reasonable. Best around 4-5pm so you can see the city before, during, and after sunset.

Expensive but worth it!. Whatever you do, don't rush through the first part, with the movie and the people talking. There are no chairs to sit in, and it is a hallway to move you from one place to the other, but this is really where you get the hear the story of the people who worked on and designed this place. You understand what it means to them to have worked on it, their own personal NY history and how proud they are of the work done. It was, for me, the best part. Sure the views were great, but understanding how it's very existence impacts the everyday of the people of the city is in fact outstanding.

Wow!. We arrived for our scheduled visit on Tuesday morning to find the observatory closed, but the staff were really helpful and we rebooked for an early evening trip the following day. The whole experience was spectacular. The staff were friendly and cheerful and even the security experience was pleasant with the staff engaging with you as you went through. The ride in the lift to the observation deck was great fun and although I groaned when we were led into an area for the introductory film/spiel - I just wanted to get out and see the view, it was actually one of the highlights of the visit. I'll not spoil it by saying why!The views from the top are incredible; we were lucky that it was not too busy and were able to spend a good hour or more just enjoying the city from every angle.We enjoyed the guides in the circular booths giving information about the city - well worth the five minutes or so to listen. We did learn that the reason the observatory was closed the day before was not only the visibility as we had been led to believe but the really strong winds which stopped the elevators from working. Having been blown along the pavements by them, we could understand this!!!The only disappointment - the restaurant kitchen was closed and we couldn't have dinner as I had hoped so probably worth checking ahead. The bar was open though however as I was travelling with a teenager, a visit was not an option.

My favourite tower. What a feeling being 102 floors above NYC and seeing city expand before your eyes. Mega fast lift and when you arrive a really nice bar to have a drink and see the city in all its glory. I really great memorial to what happened. Staff at the top very informative and amusing.. One draw back for pictures is everything being behind glass and sometimes glare but just seeing the city being so high is worth it..

We remember and life goes on. Very moving start to the tour - wont say anymore as to not spoil it for any one.go early and book we were there for 10 and by the time we left around 1130 it was getting busystunning views what can i say.

well done!. i live in NY but if you are a tourist and want to really get NY , you do two things first: Place the city in space and go to the top of the Freedom tower (one world trade center) and place the city in its historical context and you go to ellis island. After this, you can start visiting NY. the top of the Freedom tower is an great experience from the moment you step in the elevator till you get out of it on the way down. it is all enclosed contrarily to the old world trace center but it is extremely clear with windows from bottom to ceiling all around. I found the experience much better organized and friendly. at two opposite sites, there is a station where a guide will tell you all about NY from its history, to the ethnic group and food, to the main sights. You can ask what you want to hear about. It is also well done . It is not cheap at $35/person but it is well worth spending 2 hours up there. i loved it. and if you have kids they will love it. you can eat in a restaurant with a great view as well, accessible from the observatory. the food is good and the price while not expensive is not exorbitant. i would advice to come there early if you want a table. when you are finished (or before you go) stroll in the memorial garden at the food of the tower and enjoy the beauty of the tower itself.

A must do in nyc. Went early in the morning, so no waiting at all.Very efficient, friendly staff.Ticket price of $32 is the same as empire state and rockerfella. The elevators up are something else, what an experience !!Fairly overcast morning for us, but still spectacular views for miles around. I much preferred this to empire or rockerfella, which we had done the day before. A must do if visiting new york. 10/10

Fantastic. This has been well thought about in the design and the trip. From the moment you step into the lift, to walking round the 360 observatory and then your decent - it's breathtaking. I feel the ticket price is good value for what you experience.

Definitely worth a visit. Brilliant views - south to Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges and north to the Midtown skyline. Great to see boats going up and down the rivers, e.g. the Staten Island Ferry. I went in winter in the morning and was able to get good enough photos through the windows without reflections. If you only wanted to go up one tower, I would definitely suggest Top of the Rock, as you get better views (Central Park one way, Empire State and World Trade Centre the other way) and better photos because it is outside. However, I spent a couple of hours at the top as the views were still memorising and the benefit of it being inside is it is warm! There were very informative talks by members of staff. I was one of the first up with no queuing after buying a ticket at 9am. One of the security guards was incredibly rude though - I arrived to get my ticket at 8.30am as the website said tickets went on sale then. Despite that, they were not open and the security guard made me wait outside in the freezing cold.

Go on a clear day! Underwhelmed. . We were impressed and the lack of having to queue- but it was an overcast day.By far the most touristy place we went- felt like they just wanted to sell sell sell. Tickets for a lift to a view- another $15 for audio tour. Gifts/ cafe etc. Overrated for the price. I'd go to a high rooftop bar and at least spend the price of a ticket on a drink :) the lift is the best bit and lasts 30 seconds.
brilliant. defo worth a visit! do not hesitate in trying this trip.i did this on my own and i spent an hour and 15mins at the top, amazing views.

Worth The Trip. Having been to and dined at the former Windows Of The World, I have to say that this was a welcomed experience, worth the wait, and far more exciting, with the historical info and breathtaking views.The restaurant was outstanding with large portions, especially the ribeye and calamari.The design is beautiful and the staff is very well informed.

Stunning. Everything about this experience was faultless. I loved being up there. The view was incredible and is something that just can't be described, it's amazing. We had some cocktails up there and yes they're expensive. You won't get a view like it so why not!

A Must See Attraction with very high ticket price!. Views are amazing. (I remember the views from the observatory on the twin buildings before they were destroyed on 9/11). You have a great view of all lower-mid Manhattan, the harbor the islands, status of Liberty etc.Take this attraction even if they claim visibility is limited to only 3-5 miles. Inside there is a spot were you can listen to various 10 to 15 minutes pinpoint explanations , from volunteer guides, regarding a particular NY neighborhood . A visit to New York cannot be completed without being there. BUT they charge 32$ for entry only. AND they are not providing with this price any orientation map or placing any explanations to the main sights you see. If you want a very good modern explanation you need to spend another 15$ to rent a special tablet with an excellent application. Despite the high entry fee go there and prepare yourself with a map r other explanation or be ready to extra 15$. A couple should be ready to spend 80-90$ for a visit.

Excellent time with a teen and a 9 yr old. If you are asking whether this is worth the money and whether everyone in the family will enjoy it, the answer is YES. Bought tickets there at a spur of the moment. No wait but it was a Thursday. The views are amazing and for an extra $15 you can get an iPad that will tell you what you are looking at. We got it which helped the 9 yr old appreciate it more. Views are amazing which is an obvious statement. The staff very friendly. We decided to grab a couple of apps at the restaurant. The wings, potatoes and ribs were delish. The waiter overheard that it was my daughter's birthday and brought out a dessert on the house. Service was very good as well. All in all excellent adventure!

Well worth the wait!. Amazing presentation in a disneyesque style to an incredible view. Make sure you get a reservation for a time slot to minimize the wait. Check out the tunnels connecting the other trade center buildings.

Amazing Experience at the Top of NYC. This visit was my first time to One World Observatory, and I am very glad that I went with a friend (first time in the city for him). The overall experience was well done, from the elevator ride up to the top of One WTC, to the interactive activities throughout the observation floors. The initial presentation when you arrive up top was quite breathtaking, as were the views all around the observatory. We went at just before sunset, and watching the change over the city from day to night was just amazing. I'd definitely go back up if the opportunity arises!
Amazing. The view is simply spectacular. You can see the entire city from the observatory deck inside the Freedom Tower. The entire family loved it.

A Must See. The view is incredible. Was there on 2/13/16. Beautiful clear sunny cold day. I purchased my tickets online and printed and brought with me. Actually got a great discount thru Jet Blue. Loved walking through the 450 million year old bedrock that is the foundation. Awesome. Eat somewhere else prior or after.Prices at concession very high - $6 for a small bottle of water. However, the souvenirs were very reasonably priced. Got Men's XXL t-shirt for $35 - which is not expensive at all. And cute tote bags for $6. This goes well with the 9/11 Museum and Must See.

best view of the city. WOW what a view 360 and you can see everything really cool ipad app tells you what buildings you are looking at and has a zoom feature to fly you over to it tons of history telling by staff on observatory deck
Must do. You must go, hey did a very nice job. The elevator ride is quite amazing with a screen show and the views are nice. Go early before it gets crowded and book online to avoid the line.

It's got the Wow Factor. We visited the recently opened observatory. We were lucky and there were no queues. I would recommend booking in advance. I don't want to give too much away as it will spoil the surprise, but it was all very well organised and the staff were friendly and courteous. Not a typical trip in the elevator, races to the 104th floor in less than 60 seconds. All I can say, is that the views from the top are simply stunning especially if you go on a clear day like we did. You get a 360 degree view. It's not cheap but it's not extortionate and it's worth the price just for the view.

What a Valentine's Day. NYC broke a one hundred year record for a cold day for February 14 (Valentine's Day). The temperature was -01F and the wind chill (all day) was 20 below. We toughed it out, but it was very difficult to stand in ticket lines for nearly an hour.

Top of the World. Enjoyable experience. The have gone to a lot of trouble to make it a unique experience from the entrance to the lift and the welcome experience video at the top incredible and unique, The views are amazing however to take photographs is not easy as the reflection back makes it very difficult. The gift shop is really expensive. The trip down in the lift is well.....did you know lifts could fly....the illusions created are something amazing, pity it only lasts 60 seconds

The new best view of New York. From the new One World Observatory you get a great view over the city while you are still inside. Compared to the Empire State Building, you get a greater view of the statue of Liberty and Southern manhatten. However, you cannot see central park from Onw World Observatory.

Amazing.. One of the best things we did in our trip. The presentation at the start was stunning, especially the big reveal of Manhattan! The lifts up & down are brilliant and the views are just out of this world. Shame that they have put huge presentation stands by the best vantage points.

Impressive view of NYC. Impressive setup of the observatory in the new 1 WTC building that arose after 9/11/2001; setup the American way; well organized; high tech... Super great views over Manhattan in 360...

One World Observatory. Try to get to the building 20-30 minutes before the first tour of the day (09h00), to buy your ticket (the ticket office opens earlier) then wonder around the memorial site until your tour start time. Tour times are set in 15min time slots, I would recommend going up at 09h00 on the first day that you are in NYC then plot where you would like to visit on the following days, since you get a really good perspective of where the attractions are. Renting an iPad when you get up to the observatory, offers excellent information of the various sites. The trip up is very quick (less than 60 seconds) and in itself is an exhilarating experience.

Hit record the moment you enter the lift, if not before. What a trip. Views are like everywhere in New York. So to impress its how you get there, and the arrival. One world has it all. The rise and fall of the lift is exceptional, unless you get vertigo. The presentation continues after you arrive on the 102 floor as you exit the lift, keep the camera running. My only disappointment was the glass reflecting making photos once at the observatory level and the difficulty to see the memorial pools below.

Amazing and Emotional Visit. I only fo und out the day before my visit that you could actually go up the tower. I was happy just to view the memorial pools and plaza. To be able to see the work and result of the build was absolutely brilliant! Was emotional from the entrance to the end of visit. Felt united with the people of the city and the world..... Don't miss this experience if you have the opportunity to visit.

Top of the must do. An amazing journey to view the most spectacular view of New York City and surrounding area. Highly recommend obtaining tickets prior arrival to avoid the long lines. Once you enter, you pass thru security which is similar to the ones you go thru at the airport. You walk thru a corridor that looks what the rock bed of this area would like and you then reach the elevators area. The elevator ride is quite smooth and fast in it gives you a journey of what Manhattan was thru different time eras. Once you reach the top the introduction to the area is amazing with quite a punch! The observatory is ample with lots of room to walk around and see all the different sections of the area using as a guide the cardinal points. You can spend hours just looking at all the point of interests and just looking at the traffic on the water as well as on land. There are 3 venues to have food as well. Did not purchase the iPad option. Ride down was smooth as well and done with little or no wait while I was there. Needless to say the view is stunning!
Great visit. A perfect place for a crystal clear, frigid day. What a beautiful view. So moving, especially paired with a visit to the 9/11 memorial.
Highlight of our trip to NYC. Views were amazing.The lovely man who did a talk about the surrounding area and the building was very enthusiastic and helpful.Definitely the highlight of our trip.
Best view in the city. My favorite part was the elevator ride, fabulous. The wait in line wasn't so great, but they kept it moving. I would suggest buying the fast pass, so you skip the line.

Breath taking Views. The experience starts with an incredible elevator ride through time. I almost wish the ride up to the top was slower so you can really appropriate what you are seeing on the ride. We were lucky to have a perfectly clear day to visit this must see NYC attraction. On a clear day you can see forever. When you get to the top you will be offered an option to rent an Ipad that you can hold up to window you are looking out and it will tell you what you are seeing. you can then click on the screen and it will zoom in to offer more information about the place on the screen. The price is $15. While the option is nice the price is to high for this adder to the already pricey trip to the top.

Stunning views; big crowds . Went to this attraction on a really cold day in the city, so the crowds indoors were huge. It was very busy, with long lines to the lifts despite timed tickets. Once up at the top (despite the crowds) the views were stunning. Worth the cash. We grabbed an iPad information pack aswell, worth the 15$Another long line to get back down.

Stunning views; big crowds . Went to this attraction on a really cold day in the city, so the crowds indoors were huge. It was very busy, with long lines to the lifts despite timed tickets. Once up at the top (despite the crowds) the views were stunning. Worth the cash. We grabbed an iPad information pack aswell, worth the 15$Another long line to get back down.

One Heck of a View!. I grew up in lower Manhattan so the Twin Towers were a part of my everyday vista. I just had to walk to a window or out on the street and I'd be able to see the Towers. I'd often shop and meet friends there too. After 9/11 the world was a different place...Then my sister calls me to let me know that she has reserved a table for us at One World for my birthday. As part of the process you must also purchase a ticket to the Observatory. I'm excited and a bit nervous to go. After so many years on that same hallowed ground...Now I must say, that I think its not really ok to make people pay an additional fee just to get upstairs to have a rather expensive dinner. Since this isn't a review of the restaurant I'll just say, the food was ok. The service was really quite good.The views however were...spectacular!! Everything from the short history lessons you get when you enter to the elevator ride were all pretty fantastic. If you can, I do recommend on a clear day/night - stay and see the sunset and the lights of the city go up at night. It's breathtaking and inspiring.

Views of a City that never sleeps!. This is without a doubt the highest view in the city, sadly, the windows let the views down as they're coated with a layer of grime from the cities pollution. The layout is a little odd, wherein you ascend to 102 then come down to the observatory on 101. The views are stunning nevertheless, be aware the elevator ascends and descends with some speed, and can make you feel dizzy.

ONE WORLD OBSERVATORY - A ONE IN A LIFETIME EXPERIENCE. The view from the top of One World Center is amazing, aided (for a fee) by an interactive tablet which identifies major buildings and locations for you. Access was quick, the elevator ride thrilling, and the view a special treat. TIMED ADMISSION obtained over the internet will avoid crowds.

Incredible views, getting to the observation deck is unncessecarily tedious.. The price of admission can be costly. Discounts are sometimes available for advance purchases. Check on the official site or with your hotel concierge. Even if discounts are not available, purchasing tickets in advance will save time.Visitors enter through the doors facing West Street, and then head down escalators to the lower level. From there you are directed to one of two queues for the security checkpoint - think airport level security minus photo ID check.
