Very modern and fast to the top !. Super afternoon here , arrived an hour early with timed tickets but it wasnt that busy so no issue going in early, Its motto is See Forever and this is certainly the case, all through glass though unlike the other 2 main ones in NYC

Breathtaking - A Surreal Experience. This was an amazing experience. The production and presentation is very well down but I don't want to give away any secrets or surprises. I recommend the added rental of the visual aid which allow you to focus in on and learn about the sites you are seeing. The views are incredible - almost unbelievable. We toured with a friend who was afraid of heights but under the conditions, there were no issues and she enjoyed it very much. We went in the early morning to start our day and we spent a good hour and a half at the top. I enjoy the open air feel at the Top of the Rock but this is in a category of its own. It should be on all NYC To Do lists!

Great security, fast elevators to 101st floor, DON'T MISS IT. When you get to the top on the 101st floor the views are fantastic, 360 degrees, all glass, with interesting helpful narrators, on all sides, security is tight ,makes you feel safe, would not have missed it , go early to avoid the crowds,

Absolutely stunning. We booked in advance, along with a table for lunch in the restaurant. It was quiet when we went, which was great, but unsurprising as there were signs showing visibility as nil, and they weren't wrong. The cloud base was low, but as if by magic started to clear. At one point all we could see was the Empire State and Rockefeller Center emerging from the clouds -- magical. By the time we left visibility was clear enough for great views all round. The restaurant was brilliant, with lovely food, excellent wines and brilliant service. We loved it. All told a brilliant experience, and far better value than other high rise buildings in NYC. I haven't even mentioned the elevator ride to the top. That was a brilliantly produced montage of the area's development over the years. Pay attention because it's over all too soon !
Windows onto NYC. So exited to have come to see the observation deck, we were lucky there were not many people due to the snow storm weekend. Don't miss this!

A brilliant experience. The trip to the top, the historical teaching in the elevator AND during the brief presentation at the top, and then the spacious observatory were all stunning. A nice surprise after the presentation at the top... I'll leave it at that. I preferred this observation to the Empire State Building. The staff were friendly and interested in interacting with visitors. The views of the city and beyond were top-rate.Must-do attraction at least once when in the downtown area.
Great view. Amazing 360 view of entire island- Manhattan and surroundings, rivers, good access, nice experience also with the elevator, a nice experience.

"On a Clear Day . . .". Ever since the observatory opened this past year, I've wanted to take this trip to the top of New York (actually, the penthouse at 432 Park Avenue surpasses it, but this is a bit more affordable for most of us). First, you have to be on the far west side of the building to gain entrance, and nowhere could we find signage that indicated where to enter. It was a pleasant surprise to see that we could finally walk right around the Twin Towers memorial without needing tickets and reservations - as was required for the past few years since that opened. Our next pleasant surprise was finding that we were upgraded to "priority" admission with my MasterCard. On a Sunday afternoon, however, the lines were relatively short so the difference was minimal. When you board the elevator, don't forget to turn around and face the wall, which is a set of video screens on three sides that depict the progress of NYC in a countdown from its founding to the present day - as you take the trip to the top in less than a minute. There is a yearly countdown in the upper right hand corner. Once out of the elevator, you are herded in to a small room with a LARGE video presentation that shows NYC life for about two minutes. Then, the screen rises and you get your first view of the city before it comes down again. The next "stop" is a chance to have your party's photo taken (you can buy it or not later on back downstairs) against a green screen view of the city. If you want a memento of your trip, be my guest. There is a small refreshment are/bar on the upper level, but the main viewing point is a 360° panorama a few steps below. It is breathtaking and sometimes a little disconcerting - particularly when you walk over a section that shows views directly down below. Otherwise, take your time at seeing all that's out there in the city and beyond. They do rent small iPad like devices that give you views and information of what you're looking at, but if you are at all familiar with New York, you should be able to pick out the familiar sights below, whether it's the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island to the south or uptown to the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building and being able to see the Brooklyn and Williamsburg bridges right below you to the east. You could spend $32 in worse ways.

Breathtaking views. I came to the One World Observatory a couple days after all the heavy snow had fallen in January 2016. The whole process was very smooth from getting the tickets to going up in the elevator. The elevator was a cool experience as the walls would show you a video on how the city and how the city's sky line has changed over the years. As you're getting closer to the top of the building you can feel your ears starting to pop as you go up to high! Once you get to the top, they take you into a room and show you a short video on some large screens. Once the video had ended, the screens lifted up and showed you your first view from the highest point in the western hemisphere. This was absolutely breathtaking. After you stood there with your mouth open for 2 minutes, they then took you into another room and from there you was able to walk around the tower to experience the Manhattan sky line in 360°.All the staff there were friendly and they has little kiosks telling you about what was going on in New York at the moment.This is a definite must see!

Best view in the entire city . Simply amazing. I've been to the Rockefeller Center and the Empire State but they can't be compared to this astonishing building. That 360 degrees observatory is just WOW. We went late in the afternoon so we were during sunset, speechless.

A "must do" in NYC.. IMO this is a must do if visiting Manhattan. The views from the observatory are amazing. From Statue of Liberty to Empire State building from the other side of the observatory windows. We booked a specific time and walked straight in, no waiting but there are also other options.

Amazing view on a clear night!. The view from the top is worth the price. The elevator ride up is very fluid and very smooth. You don't see the city in the elevator so if your afraid of heights no need to freak out too soon.
Stunning views. The excitement starts in the lift! This observation uses modern technology and projection to its advantage. The views are spectacular on a clear day. well worth a visit.

Slick presentation. The crowds have diminished and that makes this a better experience . The presentation is slick and cleverly done. A fantastic clear day and plenty of easy access to the Windows. Only thing I did not like was the extra charge for the iPad map.

Love lower Manhattan. We stay in the financial district when we're in NYC. Endless exploration and great jump point to points around the island. One World was terrifically anticipated and didn't disappoint on a cloudy Feb morning. It seems you really CAN see forever: all the other boroughs, Lady Liberty to Yankee Stadium. Don't bother with the $15 bonus iPad, distracts from what's right in front of you and there are smart, engaging New Yorkers to guide you if you want to identify more landmarks. A Monday morning was blissfully free of our fellow NYC fans.

Excellent!. Lift was fast but not scary, reveal of the view was well presented in advance of allowing you to wander around the observatory. Great views as you would expect and iPads available to help with understanding what you are looking at. Cafe available for tea, coffee and snacks - all good - plus a restaurant which look nice but we didn't go in. All good value for money.

Emotional and Exciting. This is actually my second time here! I absolutely love it. To me it's a very emotional place just knowing what happened there, but it is also an amazing place to see some of the testimonies of the people that worked on such a beautiful building. The small movie presentation represents that NY lives and goes on no matter what happened. A must see!

A outstanding view. Recently opened and a great place to visit after you have done the 9/11 memorials as it lifts your spirits from the moving exhibits that you have just seen. Great views of the down town area and beyond, by far the best view and clearest of the three viewing opportunities in NYC. Plenty of information and informative talks on what you are viewing. The only criticism is that the entrance is no clearly signposted as you walk to it from the memorial, it's around the left hand side. The consierge at the main entrance must get fed up of pointing people in the right direction

The best view of downtown manhatton. we bought prepaid tickets which gave you a time slot for entrance which saved a lot of time waiting to get in . once inside you are not restricted to the time you can spend inside . an emotional video is played about the building of the the new tower and then once at the top the views speak for themselves . There is a good restaurant and bar also which is nice to sit and relax with a drink.
Great Dinner!. Dinner was great and the venue is amazing!! Everything was perfect. I extremely recommend to have dinner at the Observatory, it will add a special flavor to your visit! Enjoy!

Absolutely a must see.. I went to New York to visit the new Freedom Tower. I have been up in the former World Trade Center and I expected the same type of thing. Wrong. This one is stunning. Absolitoey spectacular view of the city. Even the elevators were incredible. I never saw such a thing. The staff was very friendly. There is a bar at the top but it's very small and gets crowded.

Stunning views of a great city!. We were there the last weekend in January - GREAT crystal clear day and no crowds! The view will take your breath away. I've been to Top of the Rock and Empire State building but I this this view is the best as you can see all of Manhattan!!

Terrified of heights , but definitely worth it for the view . I am terrified of heights and never thought I would ever go up the One World Observatory , however I did , and it was well worth it . The views are amazing and the staff all made me feel at ease . It's the best view of NY and beyond !

Breath taking. I opted to skip the lines and paid extra (and online) for the VIP experience. It was really just a "fast pass" to avoid lines as I didn't have much time that day. After an ear popping quick elevator ride, there is an interesting and exciting 'unveiling' of the display via movie/video.There is quite a bit of pressure to buy a hand held multi-media guide with their rental iPads. I skipped this - but it seemed popular. Hard to get photos due to the thick windows and in my case beautiful sun streaming through. Best picture was of the 9/11 Memorial at the base of the observation tower.

Outstanding. From the humbling and solemn 9/11 memorial, into the Freedom Tower and then zoomed up 101 floors to the observation level. The views on a clear day which we luckily experienced are breathtaking and you can actually see the curvature of the earth! Well worth the cost of a ticket.

Great view but too salesy. The view was amazing although it's all behind glass so if you're taking photographs it's impossible to get a good shot without reflections and smears from the windows. I didn't like the rudeness of the security staff there's no need for it, we didn't get that from the 9/11 museum. I also disliked the salesy aspect trying to rent you the iPads etc also there was a really loud woman trying to sell you a steak dinner package at the viewing area, when you've already paid a lot for the ticket it takes the mick.

Wonderful Experience. The new observatory at the World Trade Center is a great experience. The ride up on the elevator which does a video through time is amazing. Once you are up top the views are the best ever. They also have live presentations about the city and people who are licensed guides who will answer questions. We didn't find the rental screen that gives information about what you are seeing to be that helpful; not $15 worth. Plan a 1/2 day. It's much more than the ESB or Top of the Rock. Go on a sunny day.

Fun Time. This is by far the most amazing experience ever. You would be crazy not to experience this. Once you see the view you wont be able to find words to describe how you feel. All of the employees are also very nice.
Cool spot, awesome views.. Amazing views. Love the tagline "see forever". Ticket prices are a little pricey, but this is something that you need to do at least once when you're in NYC.

Amazing. What an amazing experience and breath taking views. Tried to imagine standing that high in the sky what those poor people who lost their lives must of been feeling knowing that didn't know how they were going to get down from there. Feel slightly guilty to say how good it was as I know why it was built.

One world at your feet ☺️. Absolute amazing views and by far the best new attraction in New York. When you travel up in the elevator it takes you year by year and height if everything around New York. It's a must if you do visit New York.

Terrific views - no doubt!. Once you get through the mouse maze they put you through, yes, the views are wonderful! Pick the clearest, sunny day to go. Just a little haze limits the viewing. I'm sure it's beautiful at night, too. I don't know if you can request a less-populated elevator up, but I would try if I went again. We were in - just 2 people - and then they added a group of 10-12 adults. The whole video experience was lost. Why bother?

Amazing views . We chose to do this tour as we had heard some amazing views 360. We welcomed with a a good reception. I loved the elevator trip. 104 floors in less than a minute and boy can you feel it. Good viewing whilst this was happening a brief history into the New York skyline. We arrived on the floor walked through the doors and welcomed with a massive screen. The video starts with some brief history and then the screens move to the amazing view of the New York. Walk to the Observation deck with a sales ploy to hire a iPad with 360 view video with explanation of the building within that view. Was too expensive to hire so missed that. Walked to the deck and WOW what a view. Loved it. Just one thing. We had a coffee in the cafe there was just tables no chairs. So maybe look at that. Would recommend to anyone. Loved it.
Worth the cost. The view was fantastic and the whole experience was well done. The guides were very helpful with questions and seemed happy and excited to tell us more about the city.

Magnificent views. My wife and I visited this building on the last day of our short break in NYC. Don't pay any extra for express entry, certainly not this time of year as there were no queues.It is a lot of money for a view but you are on holiday and it is a magnificent vista up there.The sting in the tail was asking you for extra money ($15) to hire an I pad so you could pinpoint attractions with it. Not obligatory but I don't think it would have been unreasonable to include this facility with your entrance fee.
Amazing views. Well worth a visit if you're ok with heights, you take a lift upto floor 102 in an ear popping 47 seconds for 360 degree views

Great Experience !. Incredible sights with a 360 degrees view of NY. The access is very well organized. The elevators take only 60 seconds to get you to the top and they include an amazing screen show that simulates you are in an outside elevator that shows you the rise but in an a time machine. We took the afternoon tour and were lucky to enjoy a clear view and a great sun set. We would go again at night, we are sure the sights must be breath taking.

Took my breath away!. Fifth trip in my lifetime to New York. Changes to the skyline every year it seems! The experience started with the elevator trip, ears popping and the moving imagery on the walls of the elevator, plus seeing people's faces as we go up! Such a buzz for me. Well organised I thought as you are moved towards a barrier when you leave the elevator, commentary all the time building up the big reveal! Won't spoil it but my husband and I looked at each other with tears in our eyes!! took my breathe away. You have to do this.

Emotional and and transformative.. This is a must on everyone's NYC to do list as One World Observatory takes its place among American landmarks. The exhibits are phenomenal, thoughtful, and so brimming with national pride and spirit.

Disappointing and irritating. You pay a lot of money for the ticket. You want to see if you can still catch some daylight. But there are long corridors. And a film. And the obligatory picture in front of a green screen, for which they will ask way too much money.Then you finally get there and the very best spots to look north and south are blocked by this circular apparatus that they use for presentations.This is way worse than the old WTC observation deck. A shame.

Wow, Wow, Wow. Best of the three. Myself and my wife were lucky enough to visit all three key observatory viewing building (Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre and this one and I must say that although the Empire State Building is a must if you are visiting New York, the One World Observatory was the best experience. Even going up in the lift was amazing. "SPOILER ALERT" as the whole lift acts as a visual showing you New York as fields and building being built until you reach present time, all within 45 seconds (approx) by which time you have reached the top.You then come face to face with another image led wall showing you what New York is famous for together with it roots and every day life, before the wall lifts exposing the fabulous view.360 degree views of New York but all inside at an ambient temperature...The only down side I can think of was fingerprints on the glass - never makes a nice photo.

Best view of NYC. Excellent choice for NYC visitors, although a little pricy. The absolute fastest elevator you will ever get in but other than my ear pressure, was like riding in a Cadillac. The view is spectacular and 360 degrees. A very nice history lesson is also provided during the wait time to get on the elevator.

Stunning views. We went on a Friday right before the blizzard at noon. It was a cold day but sunny which afforded grwat views. No wait, however we did have pre paid tickets we walked straight in and onto elevator. We did not get an iPad I could see where you might want one if you wanted to identify certain landmarks. Overall I would reccomend the ability to walk the 360 around the top was a great way to view the city. My wife and two teenagers enjoyed the trip.

Incredible!!. Incredible veiws. Has to be second to none. Elevator ride shows an amazing cronocalogical account of ny as it was developed over the years. Really fascinating. Could have spent more time watching this. Be perpared, every time you turn they were trying to sell you something but overall it did not take away fr our experience.

Amazing view and very new. You can get yor tickets at the first floor and there was no line. Comparing to Empire syTe building, it was so quite and clean. They open inly 2 floors for visitors and there is a small cafe. Thing is there is nothing to do except looking at the view 360 degrees.

Wow. We visited here on the sunset ticket, got in there at 4 so got the daytime views as well and stayed there for a couple of hours so got the great sunset and night views when all the lights are on, the ride up in the elevator is great so be ready to video it if you can, I missed this but they do show a different one on the way down so got that. We went into the restaurant and sat at the bar and had a few drinks and ordered some snacks to eat, food was delicious and wasn't too badly priced. The views are amazing and I would definitely recommend this.

One World Observatory. Took the trip downtown on my most recent visit to NYC.One world about the One World Observatory....Incredible. Had the privilege of visiting the twin towers back in 2000, that was amazing, but this is even more incredible, not just for the amazing views, but for what it stands for. Great and super helpful staff. Cost $32. Fantastic value, an absolute must for anyone visiting NYC.

Outside view only. We only visited the outside and did not go inside the building. It was a beautiful structure walking from Battery Park to the building, especially as the sun was setting. We got lots of beautiful pictures. We then went to both memorial sites.

Amazing View. Built to replace the World Trade Center Twin Towers, this new one has an observatory where you can see almost entire Manhattan. Also you can have a special lunch or dinner in the observatory's restaurant.

Spectacular views. The long queues in the sun to buy tickets and enter the building move quickly. The show in the elevator ride up one hundred floors is part of the experience. After getting out of the lift, you don't have to stay where they herd everyone to sell the iPad guide, you can proceed straight to the observation windows. The views are pretty spectacular across Manhattan. There is a cafe, bar and gift shop at the top.

Fantastic way to see the entire city!. We've done Top of the Rock and Empire State and I really love the history of both. But, neither of them compare to the view from the top of One World Observatory. The view of the city is stunning and the presentation from the time you pass through security all the way till you exit the elevator at the end of your visit is very well done and thoughtful. I think they have done an excellent job creating what will be another piece of NYC history and its vitality. Would highly recommend. Our ten year old absolutely loved it. Don't know about the crowds as we were there over the weekend of the recent blizzard, so it was pretty minimal.

it's very emotional. the view is unique.. I can tell that the story they made of it is probably a bit too much. A lot of emphasis for the history, the rocks etc, which seems too much "las vegas" it's a new tower, great view and experience. Not the history of the "torre di Pisa"

Beautiful view!. The view is incredible, really 360 degrees. I would recommend that you buy your tickets there, because if you purchase online you don't know about the weather and if it's cloudy you can barely ser anything. We purchased our tickets there and there was no line at all.

Amazing experience. We nearly missed out on One World when they decided to close it for a private event even though we had timed tickets. Fortunately we were able to go the next day but nearly didn't when we were the other end of Manhattan an hour before access. I am so glad we went I would almost say nothing so I don't spoil the experience, my advice if you go in winter is go after 3pm then if the weather is not good you have the view of the city as it lights up which is amazing. we had drinks in the bar and the food looked good in the dinning room and wasn't crazy prices. Go and have a look and see what you think I don't think you will be disappointed.

Amazing views and great bar!. I recently visited the One World Observatory and wow what an experience! Last time I went to New York and went to the top of one of the Twin Towers and I thought nothing I would never experience anything similar again but this came extremely close! The views were amazing, if you visit New York this is a must see, the ride up in the elevator is great and when you get to the top the views are just spectacular and there is also a lovely bar/restaurant which serves great food and drink. Will definitely be visiting again when I return to New York.
amazing views of NYC. The entire experience of this from you step into the elevator till you walk out the door is spectacular!!!

Impressive. After going through security you take the ride up and the history of New York passes by on the video wall of the elevator. View is very impressive and you can see 360 degrees of New York on top of the world. Tickets ($32) are too expensive.

Amazing!!. This was our first attraction of our trip and it was a brilliant way to begin our trip. We went early evening and there was no queues which was brilliant. There was a short show which you watch and when its over the screens lift up to reveal the view which is amazing and very unexpected. You then go to the observation deck which you can walk right round exploring all parts of the city. Definitely worth a visit here!!

All the beauty of NYC right here. For both tourists & people who live in the tri state would say it's a must do. The views are incredible being at the top of NYC. The views were so great it was hard to ever want to leave the building. Had visited the original Twin Towers very often & brought me great joy to have this built to enjoy for New Yorkers & all people. Take the time to go there & enjoy it'll be a great joy & experience on any NYC visit or trip

Fantastic view of the Manhattan area. Definitely worth every penny that you are going to spend on it. Unlike Top of the Rock and Empire State Bldg, One World is newer and offers much more than the other 2 observatories. This building is much higher than the rest of the buildings surrounding it, so the views are unobscured and you can really see as far as the weather is clear. Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, lower Manhattan, Hudson river, New Jersey and even parts of Brooklyn can be admired from all sides of the observatory. And not forgetting the Midtown/ Times Square area which is also a fantastic view. This observatory is also bigger and able to accommodate more people at the top. Open space for photos or viewing should be easily available too. Be ready to be charmed by the introductory video which starts from the elevator. I am impressed by the videos. Be ready for a little surprise after the host introduces the place when you step out of the elevator.

Gorgeous!. I thought this is totally worth the expense! The views are not to be found anywhere else! While you do wait on lines, go thru security, wait etc... it is a well run attraction and super impressive!!!Try to go on a clear bright day for best viewing... obviously. Bring your camera!!!!!
Don't miss it!. I was not expecting such a great experience - WAY better than the Empire State's! DO NOT MISS IT! I recommend it as THE PLACE to go in NYC!

Views amazing. If you are in New York I would say this is a must. The ride up in the elevator is brilliant, the video in the lift distracts from how quickly you are going. The opening video they show you as you step out and then reveal the view is stunning. What I didnt like and why it got a four star rating is the fact that this attraction is not cheap and then they try and get you to hire an iPad for a silly amount of money so you can point out the sights as there is no signage or anything. I think this is penny pinching and unnecassarily, for the price you pay it should be included. The little show the guides do is interesting and informative, some good New York tips are given so it is worth a listen. The views from the top are amazing, they give you a different view than Rockefeller and the Empire State Building. It is worth a trip up.
Great views. Cool show is organized before you get the observatory and without long queues. But WTC building beautiful especially in the night and from far.

Totally Absolutely Stunning. Do not miss this adventure. I'm scared of heights, was totally devastated by the atrocities of 9/11 yet I felt a total calm whilst here. Loved every minute even thought I took this trip on my own. The elevator ride to the top floor is just the first thrill... Don't miss this and take your cameras and videos... Not to be missed but make sure it's a nice day, don't go otherwise!

An okay experience. We went up this and the views are lovely and you get a good view of downtown Manhattan. We didn't book and got straight in, but it was a quiet time.If you had to pick one of the high buildings to go up however, this would not be my pick (I'd go Rockefeller)What annoyed my the most was that when you got to the top, you were stopped, for a compulsory 2 min video (one of those larger than life ones), and then when you got out of this, you got a 5 min "sell" on why you should hire an ipad to explain the buildings you can see (as they don't have any signage up). I thought this was rude, they should put up a few signs and pics. The elevator up showed a video of the building going up which was interested, but on the way down the whole elevator showed a video that spun around which made me feel ill. I ended up closing my eyes to stop watching it.So now I can tick this off my list, but I won't race back or necessarily send others.

Lovely experience. Very touching experience glad I've done it the 3D lift was amazing and views stunning I had tickets brought online however couldn't go because of the blizzard but they honoured the tickets for any time for the rest of the month and sent me an emailThe waiting time wasn't long at all and a taxi from midtown there was around $18

Breath taking view. We went for a surprise for my girlfriend's birthday. Was truly amazing as a New Yorker to see the city from that vantage point. My only complaint is with the scheduling the day we went. We were not notified when purchasing the tickets that the venue would be closing early and we would only have a limited amount of time to see everything. We felt rushed and that left a bad taste in our mouths. If we had been notified in advance, I would have gladly chosen a different day to avoid the rush they put on us once we arrived at the top.

On Top of the World. A little pricey, but still a "must do" for both visitor and New Yorker as well. A very cool elevator ride up and down, wide open floor to ceiling views in every direction, an excellent short intro to the observation area, and plenty of room at the top. SHOULD have had an area with a real plexiglass floor so you can thrill yourself. The restaurant and the gift shop are vastly overpriced for the very common offerings that they have. Eat elsewhere, and buy your gifts elsewhere. If the Observatory wants to earn that revenue, then they should charge appropriately.

Must see whilst in NYC. This was a last minute decision to visit the observatory purely because I didn't know you could and I'm so glad I did, for me, it was the best thing during my stay and we did all the usual things. Just the lift up to the 102nd floor is worth it and without spoiling anything, what you see when you first get up there, takes your breath away. Unlike the Top of the Rock or Empire State Building, you're not able to go outside but the views are excellent and obviously, it's a much more modern building so the viewing decks have been designed with the public in mind. There's even a small bar up there, definitely worth a visit
Views will blow your mind!!!. Absolutely - must visit! Mind blowing views of NYC - even choppers are flying lower... Unforgettable elevators! :)

Stunning. The experience after security is breathtaking. From the underground voices exhibit to the elevator ride to the top which shows you the development of NYC from the 1700's!!! The views are specatacular and the ability to have a 360 degree viewing makes it amazing to see in any direction you please.

Just astonishing!. Wonderful view over Nyc the best you can get! The lift to the 102nd floor is ultra fast just few seconds and the view after the presentation leaves you breathless. Definitely raccomended!

Worth every cent!. This is a must do when visiting NYC. I paid for my ticket and was up in the sky only a few minutes later. There is some unashamed up selling but other than that the views are breathtaking and you could spend an hour there easily marveling at the city and surroundings. Don't hesitate, just do it!

amazing view. This view beats the Top of the Rock for sure! I just wish there was an open air view instead of having full glass windows which can get pretty grimy and smudgy in some spots due to high traffic. the little intro at the beginning was great too, love the element of surprise! the elevator ride was very cool as well. You can truly see forever from this building!

Brilliant. . Luckily the weather was excellent on the day of our visit. The snow storm meant that the tickets were valid for the next day and as such the queue seemed to go on forever. That being said the line moved very quickly and within ten mins we were in. I found the way the experience was structured was ideal leaving you as much time as required at each stage. The elevator was amazing with the 4D video. Worth every penny.

Worth the price of admission. My husband and I visited in September. We purchased admission tickets in advance and avoided the lines. The ride up the elevator is fast and you get a glimpse of what NYC looked like in the past. Once up top, the view is priceless.

Great views, poor queues!!!!. First off I must say the views are great and give you a different view of the city from the Empire State and Rockefeller , not better, just different.Now we're it let it the experience down for me and the reason for 3 stars is the queues, we purchased a time slot before we got to NYC , and arrived 15 mins before it. We got shepherded into one of 3 queues and then we waited. Our time slot passed and we were still waiting, know one was informing us of what was going on, then eventually an hour later we were let into the building!!! This was very annoying as we had other things arranged for that afternoon and couldn't spend as much time as we would of liked at the top of the observatory.

Awe inspiring view of New York City. So the admission price is steep, $32.00 per adult, and it is expensive to eat in the restaurant. But the 360 degrees panoramic view is breathtaking once you get to the top. It is an additional fee of $15.00 to rent a tablet but we thought it was worth it because it zooms in on many New York attractions with information and history on each one, like with the Statue of Liberty. The elevators that take you up to the top floor,102, takes less that 2 minutes to get you there, and the walls become a movie, taking the passengers through a visual of the NYC sky line form the 16th century to today.

amazing!. This is a must for anyone visiting NYC - i almost didnt do it as I havea fear of enclosed spaces and the elevator idea of 102 floors terrified me but I did it anyway! You are up in 47 seconds! You dont even know you are in an elevator as they have it designed like you are watching a movie of NYC - theres air blowing inside them - we were there at a relatively quiet time so no waiting around or queuing - the presentation at the top was amazing - then the observatory - they have a lovely cafe at the top too and you can spend as long as you wish looking out over NYC - they will take your picture before you go in and you have the option to buy them on the way out which we did as they were great quality and a nice keepsake with the nyc skyline in the background ... entry was 33 dollars per person - worth it. A definite must do! I will do it again when I visit NYC again.

Amazing views.. Manhattans newest view point.We visited at 6 pm and it was very quiet so you got to walk around minus the crowds.I also prefer the skyline at night,but visiting at twilight on a clear day would be fantastic.You have 360 view of the city.i could really pitch it against the Rock or Empire State as they are all different but I would definitely vist again.There is a bar,cafe and restaurant but you need to book the restaurant and the observatory separate which I think is a bit of a carry on.I don't think it's open particularly late either.We had a couple of cocktails ,which came to around $60 with service,pricey but you paying for the view.

Spectacular 360 NYC view!!. This is an amazing place to visit. The building is really beautiful and the experience is very good from beginning to the tour end. At the entrance they have the lines organized to be form if you have already bought your entrance or you haven't. Payment line advances at good speed. One Whatchout: if you bring kids, they don't pay but you do need to request a ticket for them to enter. Yet if you forget they have a counter downstairs that helps you to get without needing to go back to the main cashier. After paying, you form to get the security check and to get in line for entering into the elevator. One tip: have your camera ready to record inside the elevator, they have a very nice experience ready for you! (I won't spoil the surprise) Once up: the 360 views are just amazing! We had the opportunity to be at sunset time, and was great to see NYC from the top at this precise moment, we got very nice pictures, had a romantic moment and got the chance to see NYC at night too.Going down... also have your camera ready!
Awesome view. Very interesting place. The view is unique, I do recommend the IPad guide for a better understanding of all the point of interest of the city.

Best view in town.. This beats the Empire State Building observatory. There, there isn't a single spot you can stand and take in all of Manhattan; not so here. The views are spectacular, and I have to say while I initially was rolling my eyes at the pre-observatory presentation, in the end I thought they actually did quite a good job setting the scene and preparing you for what you were about to see. Building up the experience is a great way to make it seem all that more spectacular. However, if I were to return I'd appreciate the option to bypass the little movie and iPad experience sales pitch and just go straight to the observatory.Once on the observatory level itself, I found the layout very good. Plenty of space for people to gape, take pictures, and move around. Also plenty of space for sitting along the windows, which was a relief for my mom. The elevator rides up and down were also thrilling, although if you get motion sickness you'll want to close your eyes.Biggest complaint: expensive. But hey: it's New York! Do this only after you've visited the 9/11 Memorial and Museum.

Worth waiting for .... We had a wonderful experience at the One World Observatory, MUCH nicer space than the beloved World Trade Center Observatory. Spacious, airy WITH an inexpensive cafeteria, and not palpably crowded. Bring the kids ... on a sunny day, you'll have a very good view of Ellis Island, Liberty Island and the Statue of Liberty itself. Definitely weather-dependent, though, so plan your trip so you can visit Lower Manhattan and the 911 Memorial and the Observatory on the clearest day of your trip.

Absolutely beautiful. The view of the city and four states surrounding it is fantastic - a must when visiting NY. And the elevator ride up (and down) are an attraction in themselves! Visit during quiet hours so you have the elevator to yourself - and hold on. :)

Freedom Tower-Wow!. I booked this in advance as expected it to be busy and glad I did as we went when it was only open a couple of weeks. Well worth the money and the experience is superb. The lift flight up was smooth and none of the usual effects that you get with other buildings. The time lapse lift experience was very good. The views from the observation deck were stunning. Well worth a visit when doing the museum and memorial.
World trade centre. We didn't go in but walked around this huge building. It's so eye wateringly high. It was a bit of an odd day out.
awesome view. The elevator was very fun and interesting way of showing the evolution of NY food was okay... dessert to die for!!!!

Say Cheese!. "See Forever" is their slogan, and on a clear day it seems you do!I went on perfectly clear weekday in January. Walked right up to the ticket booth, paid $32, walked right into the elevator and up I went. 102 floors. When you get to the top, the first thing you will encounter is a pitch to rent a tablet device. The device recreates the New York skyline. You can tap a building, landmark, etc., on the device and you will learn more about what you are viewing out the window.The device is $15 to rent. This is your only chance to rent it. You will go back down two floors after you pass this rental station and won't have a chance to reconsider your decision. If you want to learn something, rent it. If you just want to look at the view, don't.I didn't rent one, and wished I did. If there was a second chance, I would have rented one. After just paying $32, $15 more was a bit off-putting. But, I think it will enhance your experience. It would have mine.Head down the escalator and say "cheese", because they are going to take your picture and try to sell it to you later when you leave. You find yourself standing in a line, and you're not sure why. It's because they are restricting the flow of people and requiring everyone alone, or in their group, to stand in front of a wall with the NY skyline, where they will take your picture. Then they will hand you a piece of paper with a barcode. The barcode will identify your picture for viewing and possible purchase later.So, if you think you might want to purchase a nice souvenir photo, while you are waiting in this line, make yourself picture ready. I was carrying a heavy winter coat, with hat hair. Do you think I bought the picture? No! Didn't even stop to look.If they informed me what was going to happen, gave me a chance to look in a mirror, set down my coat, perhaps things might have been different. Not only did they not prepare you for having your picture taken, they never said anything about what was happening. It was left to your deduction. You, however, have been informed.

Great view - inspiring!. Since this is the replacement for the WTC towers, it's definitely a statement to the vigilance of the American people. Some of it really smacks of "show business", but the observation deck is worth it.

A Truly Emotional Experience!. The Observatory at One World Trade Center is a must see for anyone visiting New York City. What has been done with an area destroyed by one of the worst events in the history of the world is truly amazing. I visited as the Center opened at 9am and there weren't many people in line. Several people have talked about priority access but that must be for weekends and other crowed times. On a weekday in the morning, there don't appear to be too many people.Walk into the new One World Trade Center from the PATH transit crossing and you will see the newly designed entrance to the building. You can tell there has been a lot of thought put into the building design and attraction presentation. The ride up is wonderful and there's nothing really to spoil. You can see videos of the ride up on Youtube. However the only real way to experience it is live!There is a $30 cost to visit the Observatory and yes they will try to take your picture and sell you packages at the end. You can avoid that by simply avoiding the pictures and walking left instead of right as you're approaching the photographer.The views are truly amazing from what is deemed as the Tallest Building in the Western Hemisphere. I would like to visit at different times of the day as the sun rising from the East is not the best lighting for the view towards Central Park. Late afternoon would be the best for that.There is also a cafe and restaurant at the top that would make for a great place to sit, relax and enjoy a meal in the sky.

Fantastic building - over priced.. This was one thing that had me excited on my return trip to NYC. A fantastic building that stands as a monument to the city and a reason for all to be proud. Having done the Rockefeller and Empire State, I was looking forward to checking this out.The good - the building, the elevator ride (wow!). The view.The not so good - Unlike the other two observatories you are viewing from inside the building not outside. This takes away so much from observatories in my opinion. The price!!!! Ouch. It's like a maze in there.It is all very polished and run like a business. Lacks any kind of fun or wow factor. I love what the building stands for and would recommend it for the view, but other observatories in town, (in my opinion) offer a far better value for money experience with equally as impressive views.

Awesome lookout point, awful organisation. The view from above is wonderful,of course. If you want to take images of Manhattan, come at noon or later. You can lend tablets (multilingual) with good explanation of the panorama, on the observation deck.I really don't know, whether you should reserve a time ticket before, or not. Nevertheless: There are three to four different large queues outside the entrance. But even with your time ticket, there is no warranty to get admission just about in your time interval. The doormen granted the admission for the different queues in a randomized way, apparently. In general, I really acknowledge the American way to organise queues, but in this case, it was rather choatic.It took a delay of more than an hour (Queues, security check, watching a boring film and an impressive elevator "race") to come to the "highlight of the show."

Definitely a must do. New York is without a doubt my most favorite place that I have been to. A friend over there recommended we do the world trade center when we were there and it was amazing. The views are breathtaking and you can literally see all over New York including all 5 boroughs. We went in the evening and got to see the views in daylight, dusk and night. I would go so far into saying that I will do this again the next time I`m in the city well worth it.

What a view. We visited the One World Observatory on our trip to New York and thoroughly enjoyed the views. Definitely a must when your in New York.This building is remarkable, standing at the foot of it the top disappeared into the skyline. Once in the observatory the views are amazing although the glass windows take away the outside feel, this is where I prefer the Top of the Rock. We visited just before sunset and took some amazing photos. There is a tourist shop which is quite pricey and also a bar which we didn't visit which I believe is the same. It's a 'must' to do when sightseeing.

Wonderful!. Had 3 teenage boys visit, one of whom had never been to NY and I wanted to do something "touristy" Having lived in NY most of my life I thought I would like to do something I have not done yet. So off I went with 4 teenagers (my daughter joined us). We get there on a blustery Friday in January and we were almost the only ones there. I had bought tickets on line (highly recommend) so we were able to bypass the ticket booth and go directly to the elevator. One walks through a tunnel of bedrock to show us what Manhattan is made of then onto the elevator. It travels to the 102 floors in under 60 seconds and on your way up there is a video depicting how NYC was built up from the 1800's to today - very well done. Once uptop (feeling a tad woozy) they usher you in with a surprise that I will not spoil. After trying to push photos and ipads on us (no need, they have people upstairs who will answer all your questions) we went to the observation floor - WOW. Incredible views all around. I could have stayed up there for hours. Even for a jaded NY I would highly recommend. And the teenagers loved it as well!!! It is truly awe inspiring. Not sure how it would be when crowded but they do timed entry so perhaps that limits the number of people. All I can say is go (perhaps earlier in the day).
It was very thrilling. Very interesting. Few more seating arrangements would have been helpful. Provision of telescope too are required
Fun View of CIty. Excellent views of Manhattan. It was cool to see harbor and Statue of Liberty. Elevator ride up was pretty cool.

Awe inspiring . We visited this on our recent visit to New York. The views are amazing and on the day we went were some of the best we have seen. The restaurant is not cheap but when you consider it is at the highest place in the Western Hemisphere well worth the price.
Best place to visit. This was the highlight of our New York holiday. The view is just staggering and gives you a full 360 panoramic of Manhatten. Do not visit NY and pass up on this opportunity

Probably not so much fun when crowded. Very professionally done, a bit expensive, but that is the way of the world it seems, great views, obviously, very knowledgeable staff, a nice eatery and, a gift shop. I would definitely recommend it, especially if the visibility was as we had, about ten miles.

Make this One your choice. As a frequent visitor to NYC, I've had the opportunity to view the city from many of the tallest buildings. If you're trying to pick between Empire State Building, Top of the Rock or One World, I would definitely recommend One World. Besides being the newest and flashiest, the views are simply unparalleled. There is also just something special about this building and what it stands for. We went just after opening on a Sunday morning, and there were no lines or crowds. Excellent overall experience.

Amazing and breath taking!!. This was the most amazing part of our trip to New York! Right from going up in the lifts! The view was amazing and visiting at the quiet time of the year is a must! No crowds and great views of all of New York, Statue of Liberty and New Jersey

Pretty good view. I have been to all the various high points in NYC: Top of the rock, Empire and this one. I think top of the rock is unique since you are out side and you have a better view of the central park. However I think I might prefer this to empire state. I would recommend going there around the time the sun is about to set so you can see the day and night view at the same time since they are quite different.

STUNNING 360 VIEWS FROM 100 FLOORS UP. This was by far the best view of Manhattan that you will get from a sky scraper. Although the glass makes it difficult to take selfies, the views alone should make up for this! There are views across each direction and with the iPad rental for $15 you can find out more about each building/area.

Triumphant. This whole experience is so well thought out and wonderful. It's like a Disney attraction. I was a little skeptical going in, $32 seemed a bit excessive. But, honestly, it was worth it. I've been to the Empire State Building, but this is so much better. The elevator ride alone is an incredible experience. There is a sales pitch to convince you rent an ipad which will help you figure out what you are seeing. It would be cool if you want to spend the money, but I declined. The cafe and gift shops are way overpriced, but that's to be expected. We spent almost an hour at the top taking pictures and just soaking it all in. They have guides at a couple of spots talking about the city. It reminded me how much I really do love New York. When you consider the tragedy that led to the construction of this magnificent building, the only adjective that seems truly fitting to describe it is triumphant.One tip, take advantage of their MasterCard Monday deal and save 20% on admission.

Amazing views of the city. I visited the WTC many years ago and I wasn't sure about visiting the new one, it's hard because it's inevitable to remember all the 911 events. However this new building is very beautiful and the views of the city are breathtaking.
Best View in NY. We have been on the One World Obs. and a few days later on Top of the Rock. But first has definitely the most beautiful view and is worth every penny!

Great 3 hours, well worth the $32 price tag. A must do in my opinion. Superb views and an elevator ride that I will never forget. We went when it was quiet on a cold winters day. Lift was an experience it its self. with superb graphical display on the 48 second (yes thats all) ride to the top, remember to switch on your phone video camera. Once up there views are amazing and we watched the sun go down and the lights come on, a special day indeed.

A view from 100 floor. It was the second time in NY and I decide to visit One despite Empire State, it is higher than empire, a different view from downtown, but I didn't like that I could not go outside it is all covered with glass.

Great view, made in a bit of an attraction which is fair for the entrance fee you pay. On top of New York .. It almost looks small fro up here.. staring straight down in to then memorials and overlooking Staten Island, Coney Island, Yersey.. you can see it all from up here.. all the famous landmarks seem just a few steps away.. They've made it great with the elevator ride up, all the information and then a spectacular 'first' peek at the view. Take your time here and try and go early :-)

Emotional but excellent.. By nature I'm not emotional but 9/11 was my "Kennedy" moment. We saw it unfold in real time from the beginning; we're not Americans but the images are still gin clear after 15 1/2 years. We didn't do this just for the view ( truly excellent) but just to pay some silent respect.What you will love is fighter plane rate of climb the "elevator" achieves without inducing G LOC or anything else. You start in the bowels by fake bedrock and a bit of a history lesson but most people went swiftly for the lifts. It's well organised at the top and very clean. there's a café ( didn't use) and a good educational section for a an entertaining talk.What is nice is that you can rent a tablet for about $15 dollars with augmented reality. Once its been calibrated, wherever you point the tablet at outside you get a mirror view with tags for literally hundreds of places of interest.Highly recommended

Best views in New York!!!. Forget top of the rock and ESB one world for me was the best by far and a must do in New York...... My only down side was the women on security who I found rude and miserable.... However it didn't spoil my experience....

Give it a miss on a cloudy day! :'). On a cold and rainy day in New York we had to pick an indoor activity and we hopped on over here for a nosey (just after we collected our marriage license at the City Clerks Office nearby, weeee!) and we weren't disappointed. Going into the tower was a bit daunting initially and I wasn't too into the idea of going all the way up to the Observation Deck but curiosity took over eventually. We got talking to the doormen at the entrance by the ticket booth and they were so friendly, a nice welcome to the tower for sure. Infact, all of the staff were lovely, very warm and welcoming - they also seemed to emit a huge pride in New York City. We loved the "big reveal" at the end of the digital image show which was absolutely hilarious when the screen went up to reveal...a cloudy white mass of nothingness! The staff were like "there's usually a view....*awkward silence*" and it was so funny!Regardless of the clouds ruining our view (literally, our photographs are of windows looking out onto a blank white wall) the information within the observation deck is fascinating and we really enjoyed hanging around up there waiting for the clouds to pass, which they eventually did. While we were waiting we had a coffee in the café - one of the nicest coffee's I've EVER had, but there being no seats at the tables was disappointing, especially as someone who spent half her time in New York hunting for a place to rest my poor feet!The elevator up to the deck itself is so amazing - felt very Doctor Who at one point (which probably wasn't the intention) but worth the entrance fee alone. All in all, a great visit and a cool way to spend a couple hours on a rainy day.

On top of the Western World. 4th Jan, we trekked to the what will probably become a pilgrimage for the western world post 9/11. Situated on 102nd floor is the main observatory deck, cafe, restaurant and bar. The entry in is an experience in itself and the elevators are super fast with screens each side giving you a graphical idea of how high up you are going. On that note, all the tech stuff and display works has been well thought out and the experience is exhilarating!We ended up at the bar for drinks and had the best views as we kicked back and relaxed taking it all slowly in. The staff are very professional, polite and friendly. They pride their mixology and we ordered stuff that was not common in NY, but they took the challenge to make it as we asked. Was great fun challenging them and having a few laughs!

Awesome views. One world observatory is good from the minute you go up in the lift cannot say to much without giving things away, but the lift its sounds strange was the most interesting I have ever been in, obviously the views from the top are amazing and you can see for miles.It wasn't to busy so we got to have a good look over Manhattan and there was no fighting over the windows to get the best view.Overall very enjoyable morning out.

One word: WOW! . I pre-booked a time slot for this attraction and I added an extra on top of my general admission ticket! The Freedom Tower is in a league of its own, it really is! Everything about the building is out of this world and when I reached the top of the building there was low visibility... BUT... the fog lifted and what a view!!! Absolutely amazing 360 degree views of Manhattan! I would most definitely recommend this attraction to anyone going to NYC or even if you live in NYC! Definitely worth the money!

See Forever once again!. OWT observatory is beautiful. It costs the same price as the bottom level of the Empire State Building but is SO MUCH BETTER! The views are spectacular and the space is open and airy even though it is indoors. The elevator with its immersive media walls is worth the price of admission IMO. The restaurant and cafe are way overpriced, but you can bring your own drinks and snacks - it is well worth it to get a drink and kick back to the amazing views at the bar however.

Great time - lots to see. I can't say enough about the whole thing! From the elevator ride to all the wonderful folks who work there. They were all so informative and incredibly helpful. I can only say one negative thing (and it's just as much my fault). When I bought our tickets, I also bought the commemorative pin. I did not get my pin (but I also forgot to ask about it).Other than that, I can honestly say that we had a wonderful experience. I recommend that everyone should see this!

Absolutely worth a visit!. Book your ticket online, get there at your chosen time and the next thing you're standing in the elevator going up. From that point you will not be disappointed because the view is amazing and it's a must for all Manhattan visitors!

Take your kids!. Yes, it is well worth going. And getting the tickets in advance.For you who have been to the earlier World Trade Center before Set 11th, or recently to the Empire State, this one is MUCH better.Get your "video" from your phone read before entering the elevators!!! It is an AMAZING experience!!Go, and if you have kids (from + 6 y.o.), they will love it!

What a view!. Came here first thing and the morning, and there wasn't a wait. The views were spectacular, I could not believe how great it was. We purchased the interactive iPad and I would highly recommend. It shows you which building is which, and was very informative.
Tip: food and drink are ridiculously expensive when you get to the top.

Iconic tower with impressive views. The "Freedom Tower" is a must visit while in NYC. The views from the totally enclosed 360 degree observation area are amazing. The building is unbelievable from it's height to the super fast elevators. I highly recommend a visit to this location as it is a part of history. It is inspiring and a symbol of America.

Very impressive!. We visited Sunday morning on the 20th Dec 2015, We did buy a Citywide Pass book which promised us priority entrance, and, although we did queue for about 20 minutes, it was quicker than the "no ticket line". Being a Sunday, I presumed it would be easier to travel to than a week day, with it being in the financial district. The subway and the streets certainly weren't packed.We were instantly struck by the height of this building - words can not express the "wow" factor!On a bright clear day you can see the whole of NYC from the observatory.The observatory has a podium which you can sit in front of and listen to someone tell you the history of NYC, the stats. about the islands, the future plans for NYC and what you're actually looking at out of the huge floor to ceiling windows. The food in the restaurant looked very nice but the wait for a table is long. We just decided to sit at the bar, admire the views and have a "cocktail". It may be possible to make a prior reservation but I can't confirm that.An absolute must visit in NY.

Like a God looking down at life. This is a must do people, such a experience to take part in, a all round view of the city that doesn't sleep, merchandise was a bit pricey but it was the same at any point of interest, looking down felt like a God looking down at mortals, looking up at the building felt like the building went on to touch the heavens.

On The Top of The Western Hemisphere. Even though the weather was rainy and cloudy upon arrival, it turned to be a fantastic experience to visit the One World Observatory. The rocket elevator is simply amazing, just like the presentation and the view from the top. The view was cloudy first, but cleared up in a few minutes, providing a superb 360° view of New York. The only disappointing experience was the tablet guide: for a 32 USD entrance fee it should have been included, and the positioning wasn't good, it cheated about 15°.
Very Good. We visited here one evening after dark. Its a defo must see. Make sure to book in advance online. Food is expensive up top so eat before you go in..
amazing !!. well worth a visit as you can see for miles and miles ......we had a sunny day and it was brilliant !

A must see when in NYC!. I've been wanting to visit this building from the moment I saw it being constructed in NYC. I made a trip to NYC this past weekend and made a visit to this beautiful building. We had our tickets purchased in advance to initial entry into the line was very easy. Luckily for us, there was no line on the Sunday afternoon when we visited. I was very impressed by the organization of the whole visit from start to finish. All the employees were very friendly as well which was nice. You can tell this building is state of the art based on the technology used throughout the entire tour. The view itself from the observatory was amazing. It had an effect to it that I hadn't experienced before in other observatories I've visited in NYC and other larger cities. The downside to our visit to the observatory was that it was a mostly cloudy day which kept you from seeing as far into the distance. Facing towards the city, we could hardly see the Empire State building. That just means I'll need to pay another visit when back in NYC and I will not complain about that. I highly recommend paying the One World Observatory a visit while in NYC!

Take photos of New York City in 360 for 32$. As residents of New York City area, I think the price is slightly high. You would found other attractions in the city for lower prices. But the view from the 102 floor is worth.Take your camera and visit center at sunset or sunrise.It is necessary to invest much more technologies in fact that have already exist.Lacks open balcony such as in the Empire State Building or in a CN Tower in Toronto.
AWESOME!!!. awesome elevator ride, awesome views, very pricey though, great informative talk, can get woozy with the height and lightning fast elevator ride

Best part of our NYC trip.. My son (15) has been waiting to get to OWO since he saw it being constructed 3 years ago. For him, it was like a dream come true. We purchased our tickets a week in advance for a 9:45 am visit. I would recommend booking for early morning, so the crowds a fewer. From the quick, exciting elevator ride to the view, it was amazing. The staff were friendly and accommodating.

Amazing view of the greatest City in the World. Saturday morning arrival - earlier than our tickets to One World - we were easily able to change our ticket to the earlier time so that we could see other places after our viewing. All employees were great - the crowd (though small at that time) were handled professionally and swiftly. But, the view spoke for itself - a must for anyone visiting NYC

Impressive. A must see in NYC. The elevator ride up and down is amazing. It was the best part of the visit. Awesome animation! The view is amazing and we totally enjoyed the time up there. Book the tix in advance and the waiting time won't be too long! We waited maybe 15min for security search and up we went! The $32,- is worth it!

Amazing views of NYC. My wife and I absolutely loved the One World Observatory. On a previous trip to New York we went to the Empire State Building Observatory and wanted to get another vantage of the city. The line to get into the building was very long and outside (read: cold) even though you select a time to enter the line. The observatory is amazingly well done, from the one-minute elevator ride to the movie you watch before going to the observatory. The views were outstanding. It was very crowded when we went (on a Saturday morning) so you had to fight to get access to the windows. You could see clearly in every direction. I would definitely recommend One World Observatory to all visitors to NYC; definitely worth the $32.Tip: Be sure to use the bathroom before getting in line. It took about 30 minutes to wait in line, go through security, go up the elevator, and view the (mandatory) pre-observatory movie before you could easily get to a bathroom. Across the street in Brookfield Place there are public-accessible restrooms. It's also a good warm place to wait for your time to go up.

A Must See for those wanting to experience NYC from 1000 feet above ground. Excellent way to see the view in all directions. The elevator ride up to the 102nd floor is smooth, extremely fast, and entertaining with a video show on all 4 walls including history and showing how high you are at that second. The view is spectacular in all directions. Extras include an iPad tour that gives you information of what you are seeing (costs $15 on top of ticket for elevator $32(price as of January 2016)).

A must!. It is absolutely one of the best attractions in NYC nowadays, is interesting, educative, fun and you can get to go with kids, which was my biggest concern with my 18 month boy. He loved it as much as we did, the views are amazing and everything is organized, fluent and neat. I would recommend going during the days so one can really enjoy all the surroundings in detail. Awesome!

Would have been amazing on a clear day! . Coming upto our penultimate day in NYC we had to visit the One World poor weather or not. The animation before the views are revealed leave you completely fixed so you don't expect the screens to lift to reveal the skylines. Definitely a better experience than Top of The Rock and would have been incredible on a clear day! Definitely worth a visit!
BIRDS EYE VIEW. A great way to take in the views on a clear day. We went in earlier to check but it would have been possible to have gone up almost immediately.

Impressive. Our family was in NYC for the Christmas holidays and this was one of my favorite locations. This is an amazing place starting with the elevator ride which is an awesome digital experience of its own. The views are stunning and the available technology enhances the visit. It was a terrific place.

Amazing. Totally recommend a visit. There was no queues when we went, straight through ticket office and up to the 102nd floor! I have been up the Empire State and out of the two I would recommend this one. The Windows are floor to ceiling so you get a better view. There is a lot of room to walk round and the 360degree views are out of this world!

At 100th floor above Manhattan.... A 360 view of Manhattan from 100th floor can only be good or what? I heard people talking about the ticket being a total rip off, and yes 30 USD per person is a lot, in addition to 15-20 salespeople all around you trying to get you to buy extra stuff, made you feel like hunted prey. A very good thing was that there was a film during the elevator ride, so you did not feel the extreme speed going up and down

This could have been so much more.. I'll start with the two good things - the view and the restaurant which was pricey but the food was enjoyable. The negatives - no signage in the observatory to help you identify what you are looking at. If you want that info, you need to rent an ipad for $15 (on top of the $30+ you spent to get there). Most disappointing to me is that you will never know why that building was built where it is, and why it is an important symbol of American perseverance. This building is in sacred space but there is no mention at all of 911 or the redevelopment of the land thereafter. The view and food saved my rating from being one star. The developers should be ashamed of themselves for leaving this piece of the story out of the observatory.

Go! Even if afraid of heights. I am terrified of heights. 20 plus years ago I spent a half hour holding onto a gift shop counter at the Empire State Building until the rest of my party was done and ready to go back down. So when I was invited to a private function (one that I would not miss for anything) at One World Observatory I thought "how am I going to do this"? I can tell you the way it is designed - from the elevator up to the wide corridors - I felt very comfortable being up there. I cant speak of the lines or crowds as it is not something I had to deal with but I can tell you that the views are spectacular and the staff from security downstairs, to elevator operators and folks upstairs were friendly.

Our Birthday visit to One World Observatory. I decided to purchase 3 tickets as a surprise to start off a wonderful Birthday celebration on Saturday January 16th.Upon arriving we walked right through security as there were few visitors that evening. We were very impressed with the entrance and staging area. The elevator ride was superbly combined with video graphics and a very quickly reached the 102nd floor. The short video presentation worked well and then the view was outstanding.Once we walked the entire deck we decided to complement the evening with a few drinks at the bar. Having been a patron of The Greatest Bar on Earth we were disappointed with the design. Once our drinks arrived I asked to look at the menu so we could order a few small plates to share. Unfortunately it was quite limited and consisted of pub style appetizers, which do not blend with a nice glass of wine.I would strongly recommend that the concession manager and team rethink and expand the choices on the menu as this was quite disappointing and diminished the end of our visit.

Fantastic experience. It was amazing to go up to the 102 floor in 50 seconds enjoying the history of Manhattan growth inside the elevator. The 360 views on the top of the building is absolutely unforgettable

Great staff. The day we originally scheduled our visit was rainy and cloudy.When we arrived, they immediately asked if we would like to change our visit to another day. We did and the views were amazing.

Amazing!. They are in the details! The experience is amazing!!! I've been in a lot of observatories around the globe but this one is the best!!!!! Plus, you have discounts If you but the ticket online with mastercard on mondays or If you buy something at century 21.... Oh! And in my case i've got a gift card from century 21 when the experience finished and.... It had 25 dolars!

Better than the Empire States. Having been to both the Empire States and One World Observatory, I'd say that the view from One World Observatory is way stunning as you get a better view of Statue of Liberty and also the Empire States from a near distance. We went without any pre-purchased tickets or reservations and managed to get up within 30 mins (weekday). Food and snacks are available up there, albeit expensive. Be there during sunset, so you'll get to see both day and night view of the beautiful skyline.

Great way to spend the afternoon. We got there about 1:30 (we had pre-timed tickets $30.00)and the crowds weren't too bad. Every aspect of the Observatory was cool, from the bedrock lined entrance to the amazing 'preshow'. Plenty of room to move around and plenty of vistas. I agree with Tracy - the Apple device was a waste of money (15.00). We had lunch while we were there. It was expensive, but then you're paying for the view. All the tables had open views. Appeitzers ran about $15.00, entrees averaged $25-30. The food was good and I'm glad we stayed so we could relax and spend time taking in the views, but for the three of us the bill was $162.00 - gratuity was added.

Beautiful views.. A must visit if you are Downtown and have time to spare.One piece of advise, the lines are insane and very frustrating so if you can afford if, buy a priority pass. We waited in line for about 20 minutes then gave in and decided to buy the priority tickets. We were up the top about 10 minutes later. It is pricey but worth it in my opinion.Otherwise, the views are beautiful and obviously unobstructed. Well worth the visit!

Slick and stunning. Went quite early on a winter's day, so hardly anybody queuing - bonus! There's the usual airport-style security to get through, but after that it's a leisurely stroll to the amazing elevator ride - there was just the two of us in the elevator so had a great view of the high-definition video screens that show New York being built around you as you ascend to the top (less than a minute). Be warned - this experience could be a bit scary for those with a fear of heights! As will the ride back down, which appears to propel you out the side of the tower in to a helicopter-style ride to the ground - have a look on YouTube for videos.Once up top there is a brief video introduction before the screens lift to show the immense view. There is a vast viewing area, with souvenir shopping and dining available. The floor to ceiling windows give an amazing view all around. Personally I preferred the view from the Empire State Building, and the open-air deck there. It's fully enclosed at One World Trade Center, which makes photos a bit more difficult.

Nice new observation deck with some bells and whistles. If you've already been to the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock, this is the new place to try. I'd skip the Ipad. We did it and it was fine, but not really necessary. We ate at the bakery too. Note for bakery items or snacks, only a standing area to eat. DS loved this and thought of it as the highlight or our quick mini trip. We had timed tickets, but FYI for a January Friday afternoon visit this would not have been necessary.

Good view but not the best in my opinion. We planned to visit on 23 December but when we arrived there was zero visibility due to mist. The staff were fantastic and we rearranged for the next day in a couple of minutes with the minimum of fuss for Christmas Eve when the visibility was much better.The views are great and the staff on the observation deck are informative and friendly but the reflective glass is annoying when trying to get that special picture. If I'm honest I still prefer being outside in the elements on the Empire State or Top of the Rock but this building is a great achievement so must be visited. As many have said before the lifts are great :-)

Beautiful views!. Lovely view 360 but often there was a glare from the glass. Lovely informative tour speakers at every corner with interactive screens. A little pricey also the gift shop is privately owned which I thought that some of the proceeds would go to the families of 911. Nice to see but I enjoyed the memorial pools down below so much more.
Top Of The World. I could spend days up there. It reminds me how advanced the human race has become in past 100 years . You can see a small curve of the earth on horizon

On Top of the World. This is New York's newest tourist attraction which draws hordes of tourists to see the breathtaking sights. Expect to wait in line for an hour or so but the audiovisual two minute elevator ride to the 100th floor is worth the wait which traces the evolution of the city from rural village to the booming metropolis it is today. Once exiting the elevator, there is the dazzling view of the city to the north where the Empire State Building in the distance as well as the Lower East Side is seen. To the east, south and west are the views of Brooklyn, Governor's lsland, the Statue of Liberty and New Jersey.

What a View. An expensive but effective way to get an over view of Mahattan. Don't bother with the Apple device they offer as the number of buildings described is limited. Great to watch the sun go down and the city light up.

Hard to believe you're not in a plane. Plus:- Stunning views (although behind windows)- Presentation with surprise once you reach the 102nd floor (no spoilers here ;-)- Nice animation in the elevator- Time slot tickets available online, so you don't have to wait in line that longMinus:- Could do without the New York-presentations on the top level (and ignored them)- The bar in the restaurant has a view on New Jersey and only the (expensive) restaurant on Manhattan

Amazing views. This was a last minute trip but so so worth it. Some 20years ago I was lucky enough to go up the original 'Twin Towers' - this is fantastic. The lift on the way up is incredible as it shows you how New York has built up over the last 100 years - we loved it.The views from the top are amazing we loved every minute - would highly recommend

A must!. The place is fantastic! The views, the knowledge of a structure built to overcome such a tragedy, and people enjoying visiting and remembering but still holding hope in future. It was a incredible experience, my kids loved it! Mostly my 2 year old who was amazed by the tiny cars!!!The ipad is very functional and interactive if you like to learn new things. Food service was good for breakfast. I would recommend buying the tickets online to avoid the wait, as we did!Beautiful outside and inside!
Awesome . Been a couple of times. I think it's incredible. The view is absolutely amazing and the elevator ride is cool as well. Highly recommend the vip tickets as you bypass the lines.

Absolutely incredible. The views are as amazing as you would expect especially uptown. But the trip up in the lift was a real surprise but the trip down was great fun. Get there just before the sun goes down so you can see the city lights up. It was well worth the money.
