Absolutely breath taking!. This experience presents the story of how this building came into existence. And the way they show you the view from the top. ....well I won't ruin it. Go see it. ..you won't be disappointed.

On a Clear Day. We were blessed with a clear day in the heart of winter. We bought the 10.30am visit. There was already a long line when we arrived but the crowd control was excellent.The elevator ride up the 102 storeys took barely 50 seconds. On the ride up, there is a quick history presentarion. On arrival there was a big screen presentation and at the end of it Viola! The screens were lifted and we beheld the awesome skyline. The clear blue skies allowed us to see beyond Jersey City.There is also an interesting talk on the iconic buildings of NYC, very well presented. A walk around the Observatory will allow a 360° view of the city.And of course, every tourist would want to identify the Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building....Going down the elevator was just as interesting. Scenic views were projected. We spent about one and a half hours.A pleasant experience indeed
Great experience. Take the time to see the view but to also take in the atmosphere. In the hub bub of NY this is like a sanctuary in some ways - definitely shows respect for what happened.

wahoo effect!. Amazing experience from the lift ( unbelievable experience) to the view all around the Observatory. We book the restaurant too and it was a 5 stars dinner for all of us. I would suggest to stop and have a meal at the One Restaurant with the amazing view of Manhattan from the table.

Ok but not as good as Top of the Rock, and very expensive!. We visited in December, in comparison with Top of the Rock this attraction isn't worth the money it charges, especially as the view is from indoors through glass and there is no opportunity to go outside (unlike TOTR). If you don't have time to visit both, I'd spend your money on TOTR, it's cheaper and the view is much better. Overall, interesting to visit but I wouldn't go again at that price.

OMG! You need to go and "see forever".. This was an amazing experience. Expected it to be like going to the observation deck at the Empire State Building, but it was so much better. The views are amazing!

Amazing view!. We bought our timed ticket online to make sure that we would be there to look at the sunset but that day had zero visibility, they let us pick another day, We came back on a nice day. The elevator ride was incredibly fast, then a video presentation with a little pleasant surprise. There is no time limit for your stay up there, we ended up staying for more than 2 hours, watching both the day and night of Manhattan and Jersey City skyline, one word to describe: Awesome! There were restrooms and limited seats, even electrical outlets. It is best to enter from the Path train station where they have an exit for One World Observatory so you don't have to wait in line for 2 security checkpoints
Freedom Tower amazing.. What a view. All New York in a 360 view of all the city underneath. Breathtaking, worth visiting especially at night.

Surprisingly impressive experience - totally worth it. Whoever designed this experience nailed it: not only the view is breathtaking and maybe the best in NYC, the whole experience, exhibits, testimonies, and visual aids, including the surprisingly good iPad tour, are really, really well done. It was an unplanned visit - and one that ended being a highlight of our trip. Worth it!

One World - definitely worth the trip. We bought the no time limit pass to the top and simply went up when we had finished touring the memorial museum. The elevator rides up and down are simply breath-taking. In fact, we were so impressed, we did the ride twice, simply to get a better view of all areas. The restaurant at the top is wonderful. We had a table so we ordered an appetizer and some wine, and were able to sit there and watch the changing sky from late afternoon to early evening to dark. It was beautiful. Definitely worth the price, and the cost of sharing an appetizer and some wine. It was one of the highlights of our trip!

Amazing & incredible view from the new World Trade Center!. The visit of the "One World Observatory" is definitive worth it. The Elevator takes you very fast in the 102 floor. After a short Image film you can see the unbelievable view all over New York!

The World in the Window. We bought our timed-entry tickets in advance online, which worked really well and I recommend. The elevator ride up is a show in itself, but only lasts less than a minute. Once to the top, we had lunch at their snack bar - the sandwich was good. Tables are available to stand at to eat. The views from the windows are spectacular. There were staff people to answer questions as well as a couple of interactive digital displays that trained staff would use to give more information about the city and New York area. Benches are available for resting along the walls. We stayed as long as we wanted. I hope to visit again.

Good Tour - Get One Ipad Tour. It helps to have the ipad tour but I got one for each of the 4 of us and it could have easily been shared between us - not a ton of additional info but some interesting things on it. When the guides on the floor start talking definitely get comfortable as it will be an hour before they are done. We eventually started to wander away - though what they were saying was interesting and worthwhile - I wish I had known to pace myself. It also meant that there was no one on the floor to answer any questions as both docents were talking on opposite sides of the floor. I think they should stagger them and have a roving person to answer questions that you don't want to interrupt the speaker who has his routine with. The elevator ride up was special - with the history or a changing city. If you have younger kids you may not want to stay more than an hour there, but if you are interested in history and learning about architecture, then 2 - 2.5 hours is more the time frame.

Spectacular Views. We visited One World Observatory on Sept. 30, 2015. The view from every angle was just spectacular. its difficult to leave once you are up there. We had lunch at the restaurant at the top - the burgers were great and the staff were very friendly. This is a must see attraction for all visitors to New York.

Highly impressive experience. They did this right, making it into an experience. Don't rush through the exhibits before you go up. Also, watch the screens in the elevators going up and down (try to get into a more empty elevator for best experience).

Great view of the city. You take the elevator up hundred stories in sixty seconds. You get 360 view of the area-NJ, Brooklyn, NYC, Statue of Liberty...While you are their there is two station where they show you things about NYC. No rush n nice gift shop.

The best view of NYC. This new building was a great attraction to visit in NYC. Def a must see. The elevator ride to the top is a surround video with the elevation along with the year and what the city looked like all around during that year. It was basically a time lapse video of the total life of Manhattan from colonial times to the present. You could walk around the entire top floor and look out at the city. The Empire State Building the 30 Rock uptown were dwarfed in comparison. The elevator ride down virtually flies you out about the reflecting pools of the memorial at the site of the orig WTC and ends with it going back into the building as the ride comes to an end. An unforgettable experience.

friendly staff, nice views, no waiting time. i chose to go on tuesday at 1p.m. there was no waiting and people were really nice. you can get 360 degree view and for me it was better than empire state building. but i highly recommend on going on good sunny days. sky portal? where u can see cars going by on digital TV installed on ground was a bit dissapointing, but it didnt affect my overall experience. highly recommend to go there at least once

Terrific at top but disorganised at the bottom . Having arrived 15mins ahead of time, the lack of organisation at the bottom outside was a real shame.Staff handing out conflicting information, no sense of organisation between themselves, people wandering around confused.Wouldn't take much to hold meeting point flags up for designated times etc.Wasn't very confident in this attractions ability to deliver a great experience but once in the elevator and at the top, it's a real treat. Just need to get the meeting points arranged better.

Incredible!. is an amazing observatory!!I think is not a matter of comparison between which one is the best NYC observatory but i have to say that if had to decide, you can not lose the opportunty of this one in particular.Simply Awesome

Amazing Views. We tried to plan our visit for a nice sunny day, however, mother nature did not cooperate. It was cloudy, but even so, the views all around were still spectacular. I will be back when the weather is more cooperative. However, I am not in the least bit sorry I went.Ordering tickets on line in advance gives you a head start and you avoid long lines. The elevator up is an attraction in itself. It speeds you the top in no time and you hardly feel any movement. I asked how fast the elevators go and was told between 23 - 25 miles per hour. On the way up you are presented with a glorious panorama of the city as you reach higher and higher.The views out the floor to ceiling windows are amazing from all directions. If you are a NY resident, it is fun to pick out the various landmarks from high up. I could even spot my apartment building in Brooklyn.Along with the Empire State Building, this is a not to be missed part of any visit to NY, even for those of us who live here.

One World Trade Center. Another eye in the sky observatory in NYC. This one has a bit of a twist though.The place is very good. It is a completely different experience from the Empire State Building or the Rockefeller and that alone makes it worth a visit.It costs $32 for and adult ticket and you deifnitely must do it.The journey up in the lift is exciting as you see NYC being built up aorund you. You then get to see another short video before the amazing views are unveiled before your eyes.The only reason I have not given this 5/5 is that I like the idea of being outside on the observatory. As you are kept inside any photos you take will be through glass which obviously can lead to unwanted reflections. As well as this when we went up it was freezing cold outside as it was winter, the sun was still shining though and as you are so high up in a glass covered building it was effectively a big greenhouse. I can only imagine how uncomfortabley hot it gets here in summer.However all of that being said if you visit NYC you should definitely go up here - just personally I prefer the rockefeller and the empire state.A little mention - they do try and sell certain tickets that will allow you to catch the sunrise/sunset. What we have found to be useful is if you have a look in advance when the sun will rise/set on the day you are planning to go and then book a ticket for a little bit before this you can then stay long enough to see daylight, sunset and a bit of the evening as well all from one visit.Also like anywhere else try to book your tickets online before you get there.

A must. Having the opportunity to visit this area brought back all of the emotion I felt at the time it happened. The atmosphere was respectfully quite around those who were there to pay their personal respects to the people they knew who died in 9/11.

See for miles. Get your tickets before you go (on-line) and don't be put off by the price. There are queues but priority tickets bypass them. The lift to the 102nd floor is amazing, as is the brief visual presentation when you get out. As for the 360º views, breathtaking. Snack food and bar are on the 100 floor.We were also very lucky/privileged to go up at night on New Years Eve. The views were even better with all the lights on and you could see way out over New York & New Jersey. See how small the Statue of Liberty is from the Observatory. Put this on your must do list when you plan a trip to the Big Apple.

Amazing. Being very claustrophobic I was a bit nervous when they packed (and I do mean packed) you into a "glass" elevator - but the scenes projected on the walls helped make you not realize how fast and high you were moving...We were there on a clear day, views were amazing.
Unique experience . Nice place very educational and got to see shops around the world that does business with Taiwan. Shows how open minded and great people are in Taiwan, I love this place

Awesome!!!!. It's really amazing! Even the ride in the elevator was great. Make sure to face the back of the elevator. Then there's a "presentation"after the elevator ride that's really cool. I stayed to watch it again.

Spectacular view, everything else terrible. The view from One World is fabulous.Everything they did to add to it made it worse.The queues would embarrass LAX.How can I be obliged to book a time and then still be standing outside a full hour later?The mandatory sales pitch for the guide tablet was annoying. The annoying people don't some kind of supposedly informational presentation was irritating especially since I was trying to recover from the pain the queue had caused my arthritis and needed some peace.My 13 year old was finished looking out before I had recovered from standing in the queue and the various time wasting presentations.The elevators were cool but on the way down the unexpected spinning effect showed surprisingly little sensitivity for people with vertigo and similar issues. My wife needed considerable time to recover from the ride down.

Left me speechless!!. If you're in New York for even a day, this is something you cannot miss! I am amazed at how the Freedom Tower turned out to be, so beautiful! And let's not get started on the view, I was left speechless with the whole presentation and observation deck. If it wasn't for the dinner reservations we had, I would have stayed there for hours. It's worth the price definitely!

Magical Experience. The new One World Observatory is really a great place to spend a few hours as alocal or a visitor.The base price for Adults is 32 USD it certainly is not cheap but the 360 degree view is so breathtaking it is still worth your time and money.You can book online and the line moves quickly so unless you need to save a few minutes you would be wise to stick with a basic ticket.You will not regret it........ yes you will feel like a tourist but your soul will soar....it is magical up there.

Excellent!. At first glance this seems like a pricey attraction to visit, but it is well worth your time and money. Purchase your tickets ahead of time, and go as early in the day as you can. It was not too crowded in the morning, though it had picked up quite a bit by the time we left. The views from the top are amazing.

Great views, but... This place is amazing. The views, the designs, the elegance, the elevator.. everything is nice and modern. The only thing that bothered me is that it took us approximately 2 hours to get to the top, even though we had an appointment. We were out in the cold and dying to go to the restroom and guess what... the restrooms were not available until all the way up! We begged each worker to let us in the restrooms and they all kept saying "right after this section ask to another employee" and that's how it was for a while until 2 hours later, my whole party and most of the people around us were eager to go.

Amazing view. Was not expecting the elevator show on the ascent but it was amazing. Worth the price of admission. We passed on the iPad upgrade but in hindsight, should have grabbed one for the additional $15 - looked like fun to use and informative.
Amazing Views. A must do In NY. 102 floors high ... One can see a lot from up there, from midtown to downtown. Suggest to,purchase tickets in advance to avoid lines.

Great experience. Fantastic views of NYC from the observatory. Queues to get in are very long though so expect to wait or buy priority ticket online don't forget to take your camera and there is free wifi you can use. When we were due to go it was very foggy with zero visibility so they changed our tickets for the following day

Disappointed. Sadly we did not enjoy this attraction. The lift experience was not good and this view was shared by everyone in the lift. You can hire an I pad which you use at the viewing windows and is supposed to give you the relevant information. I found this did not work corectlly and at this point decided enough was enough left. Sadly would not recommend unless you have nothing else to see.

Nice Views, Worth a Visit. Very well put together. Once at the top, amazing views of the city and the volunteers are all available to answer any questions you may have. This is a must see if you are visiting NYC.

Great view but the system s bad. We have been there on a beautiful winter day, views are just amazing. However it's extremely expensive ($32). You have to wait in line outside, inside again to get to the elevators, that would be ok, however in therory you have a entry time on the ticket, its in particular tuff with a young kid in a stroller. The elevator ride is quite cool, however once you are on top deck, you have to wait again in several lines where they try to sell you random stuff (Photo, tablet....), again there is no way out and after another round of waiting you get finally to the observatory deck, the view is amazing!Strange is that they have been building huge screens that are blocking some of the best views, I have no idea why. Everything is more than overpriced, and it's quite crowded. The view is different compared to the Empire state building or top of the rock, however in my options choose them over the trade center if you are short on time.

Great view but the system s bad. We have been there on a beautiful winter day, views are just amazing. However it's extremely expensive ($32). You have to wait in line outside, inside again to get to the elevators, that would be ok, however in therory you have a entry time on the ticket, its in particular tuff with a young kid in a stroller. The elevator ride is quite cool, however once you are on top deck, you have to wait again in several lines where they try to sell you random stuff (Photo, tablet....), again there is no way out and after another round of waiting you get finally to the observatory deck, the view is amazing!Strange is that they have been building huge screens that are blocking some of the best views, I have no idea why. Everything is more than overpriced, and it's quite crowded. The view is different compared to the Empire state building or top of the rock, however in my options choose them over the trade center if you are short on time.

Beautiful building & views but wanted more. I had a 16 hour layover in Newark on my way home from living out of the country for two years, so I hit the town to visit and this was my first stop. I was really excited when I came in and they had stories of the people who were on the building team, then the elevator ride up was fun with the video too. When I got to the observation deck I was then disappointed. I had just visited the Petronas Towers the week before and at the top there was tons of information about the building, a replica and more. This is strictly to remember and the views which the views, even at night did not disappoint. The actual building is pretty amazing too and it's worth seeing for sure. It's definitely a must visit because of the meaning but it's good to have some expectations.

Breathtaking!. I visited the One World Observatory in early January, having bought my tickets online previously. I had to print them off which was slightly inconvenient (although I was lucky enough to be staying with a friend who had a printer!). I'd recommend e-tickets or being able to pick tickets up, rather than having to print them off. We arrived at our allocated time and went straight up in the most amazing lift/elevator I have ever been in! The speed is incredible - our ears popped! The view once upstairs is absolutely breathtaking and the 'reveal' is jaw-dropping. I am uncomfortable with heights but luckily the space around the windows is very deep so I was able to gradually move away from the wall towards the windows! We rented the iPad but at $15, I'm not sure it was really worth it as the view is so amazing and a lot of the sights are probably quite well-known already. I was with my 6 year old nephew and he loved the view (and the iPad coincidentally so it might be a good child entertainment option if you want to spend longer admiring the view than they have patience for!). It was expensive but it was completely and utterly worth it - you literally feel on top of the world!

Well-organised site, but book before you leave!. You must book this before you leave on your trip or you'll never get in!We were warned that there was zero visibility on the 30th December and were offered refunds or swap days. Glad we didn't take them because by the time we got up there, some cloud lifted and we could see, especially over the Hudson to New Jersey & Statue of Liberty and down to the memorial pools below.We didn't queue for very long given the crowds - it was efficiently organised with heavy security.We noticed that there was no reference anywhere to the original Tower 1 (North Tower) & this building is definitely a symbol of American resilience and power, rather than a commemorative symbol, which more or less surrounds it with the museum & pools.

Do this and visit the 9/11 museam nearby. Go on a clear day as the view is spectacular in all directions! Best to have prebooked tickets as entry is timed and tickets lines can be long. The elevator ride to the 102nd floor is quick & entertaining by digitally giving the impression of riding a glass elevator. Spend the extra money and use one of the amazing iPad like tour tools. Recalibrate its GPS at the compass points in the observatory floor. It is VERY helpful in orienting your views and telling you what you're looking at. Also some items are named in color and one touch on their title initiates a brief video history of the item.

Spectacular view + entertainment in Elevator!. The view from here is even more spectacular than from Empire and Rockefeller. AND the film entertainment in elevator both up and down and when arriving the Observatory Deck is fantastic!

Great view!. I visited the One World Observatory in mid Jan. 2016 and enjoyed the time there. We had already visited the World Trade museum and memorial on previous visits so this was something new. It is a bit expensive but it is Manhattan so to be expected. We spend about 1.5 hours there since it was a fairly clear day. There weren't any lineups so we didn't have to wait to go up but I'm not sure if that is typical.

Beautiful view. This observatory cost 32 dollars. Walked straight in. The elevator ride to the top was a quick pictorial history of NYC. Very good.2 minute film of NYC iconic visions. The observation tower gives a different perspective compared to Top of the Rock. Great views of lower Manhattan, the Brooklyn and Statue of Liberty.Totally enclosed...so it is not cold but the photos don't turn out as well.Worth going to.If I only had one observation tower to see though ...Top of the Rock would get my vote.
Dizzy Heights. Very informative, great views from a different city viewpoint.A bit pricey at $32.00 p/pGot to go if in the city....

Freedom Tower is amazing-what a tribute. From the time you enter the building it's a wonderful experience. The skypod elevator was my favorite with the show of how NY was built. The reverse trip is just as good, but when they reveal the view it's spectacular. We were on the top of the Trade Centers 2 months before they fell and remember that vividly but this is just as wonderful and a fitting tribute to those that perished on that day and to those that survived and will go on no matter what. Well Done

A must . Great views of the city & Statue of Liberty
No queues & not to busy when we went
Great to see it in day light then through sunset & when it's dark
Highly recommend

Beautiful view of the city with no stress. We booked our tickets online on the One World Obervatory website the day before. We printed out our tickets and arrived around 15:30 on a Wednesday. There was hardly any queue and we went straight in. There was an informative 4 minutes film that we were shown before entering the observatory which I enjoyed. Great view from the building. Also nice that we got to see the city during daytime and nighttime, since the sunset was around 17:00. The staff we encountered were very nice and helpful and we got the directions we needed while walking through the building, so we never felt lost. On our departure we received a gift card that we could use at Century 21 which is a big department store close buy. We both got 20$! I would recommend going to One World Observatory. It's the tallest building in town, but after my experience also the building with less queues. There was a souvenirs store there with a good selection and not to pricey and also a little cafeteria where one could rest with ether food or drinks while having the perfect views.
While above it all. Best view . An amazing start off to understand NYC. Around the time when it's still light to see the city at day time and at night .

Beautiful, Artful, Tragic, Emotional.... I worked in NYC for 10 yrs & watched the original towers burn and fall (left 8 years ago). Not knowing what to expect I opted for the observation deck and museum. No lines at 9am to worry about, a handful of people. The elevator ride up was amazing (102 floors in a minute). Total up and down time about 1 hour. The museum is a person experience that I feel I would not want to share with a guide or other distractions. Immerse yourself in the events that shaped the new world we live in. I would allocate 3 hours for the museum & 2 hours for the observatory & outside memorial pools. Bring your water & camera, tissues supplied...
Breath Taking View. This has to be the best view of NYC. The view is spectacular! The best time to visit during the winter, is after the 3:00 pm so you can see the city by day and night.

Lower Manhattan's best view. The trip to the top was designed with visitors in mind. Once you wind your way inside and down to the basement where the elevators will rocket you to the top of the building, the elevator ride to the 101st floor takes less than a minute. The ride up is a bit like a video game - you don't look outside, but instead have electronic media visuals on all 4 walls of the cabin. The "big reveal" of the view from the top is pretty dramatic. Can't beat the view from this side of Manhattan. Well organized. A very 21st-century tourist destination. My tween absolutely loved it.
Too Busy!. The views are spectacular but it was too crowded to enjoy the views. The best part was the elevator. The fast lane ticket is worth it to avoid the lane in the entrance.

Endless waiting in several lines. It isn't enough that you wait to get in. Then you wait in security check, elevator line, then to theater to watch mandatory video, then to listen presentation and then when leaving - again in elevator line. They have made place too complex. It should be possible to bypass the mandatory videos and lessons - if person is just wanting to see the view from the tower.

tourist trap but views obviously are great. worth the time and money if you dont have to wait in lines by going on a weekday or weekend without perfect weather. the whole process from when you get off the elevator till you get to the actual floor was annoying. the 15$ ipad rental pitch was annoying/a scam (use google maps on your phone) , the sky portal was stupid / a scam and having to walk through the restaurant was annoying

Stunning gaze into New York but too commercial. It is very well organized and modern. On the downsize, I'd say that I didn't enjoy the smell of food interfering with the view and the entire experience. Also, I think in a bed weather days, they should offer you a return ticket.

Top Of the World. We went to WTC as both of us had been to the Empire State Building and fancied a change. The WTC is actually the tallest building in NYC by some 300ft. The views were amazing, real 360 panoramic and the best bit... no queuing at all! Its worth the visit just for the escalator ride.
What a view!. It's expensive: $32 per person, and can be a long wait, the the view and experience of going to the top of the center is memorable.

Amazing. Visited on the first day the observatory was opened. Excellent views - so high! The videos played on in the lift/elevator on the way up and down added to the excitement of the visit. Food available at the top - although slightly overpriced (to be expected at a touristy place).

Brilliant experience. My family and some friends visited the observatory last week and had a brilliant couple of hours. The detail and level of high tech gadgets they have gone to is outstanding. The signage to find the observatory wasn't brilliant, however once we found where we had to go, the staff were helpful, polite and thorough when it came to the security checks. The lift up to the observatory was so fast it made a couple of our party feel slightly odd and sick, I was fine but could see how the sensation can cause this so be aware... you are then introduced to an incredible interactive screen before the big unveiling of the outstanding views from the deck.There is a nice coffee shop and a good sized gift shop on offer.

Amazing views, see 360 views of NYC in all it's glory. Fantastic views and highly recommend to see the NYC in all it's glory. Reason I didn't rate excellent is there is too much unnecessary lead-up before you actually get to the viewing deck. They turn you around in so many circles with "important announcements" that are merely an attempt to up-sell audio tours. The food area required you to stand and eat and once you had food you couldn't easily get a drink from the bar.
Mind blowing views!. Great views, should be on your to do list.Well organised and slick operation. Modern and interactive, really enjoyed our visit on a crystal clear blue sky day.

brilliant views. Make sure you pre book this ,if not you could be waiting for 2 hours!!.You get great views of the city ,and the lift ride is just incredible.If your in NYC you have to do this ,you'll not be disappointed
Its a must. Not much to say but every visitor to NY should come in and experience this. Once on top, you can see for a very long way. Lots of emotions in this building. Stop in.

Worth a visit . We went the day before and the queue was about an hour long to get tickets, so we booked online that evening for the following day so we didnt have to queue at all. It was a clear day so we had an amazing view. Quite well done, ipad for $15 extra but this is not essential, there is someone at the top to answer any questions and she gives a good slide show. You can spend as long as you want looking around at the top. I would recommend going early we booked for 9.30 and it wasnt over crowded but did get busier as we left.

So crowded that you can't see much through the throngs of people. Even with timed tickets, we had to wait in line. You are corralled from line to line. I wasn't impressed with the videos (except the one you watch when you go up in the elevator, but you can see that on youtube.) I expected plenty of space to walk around and enjoy the views but that was not the case! Everyone is jammed up in front of the windows and the only good view you see is the tip of Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty when you first enter the viewing area.

Great Views. This has to be the best view of NYC. We loved it up here. We bought our tickets online and went on a Monday morning and didn't have to wait at all. Worth the $32 entry. We also rented the $15 explorer tablet. It gave some information on major points and helped us orient ourselves. It got a bit dizzying and annoying to look at after a while though, so we just asked the view. If you can nab one of the guides/speakers on the observation deck, you're better off. They are very knowledgable and it's free. Ben explained everything to us that we asked about in detail!

Breathtaking Views of NYC. On our last day in New York (6th January) we decided to visit OWO, we had already been to the 9/11 Memorial, Museum and Tribute Center in the week.We got to OWO at 9am just as it opened, there wasn't a queue at all, walked straight in pay for our tickets $32, then go downstairs to security.There's a walkway through of old rock and granite to the lift.The lift is amazing, has animated footage of starting from one year to the present of New York changing over the years from nothing but a field to what it is today.Once upstairs on the 102nd Floor you go through to another room where you watch a video and they the screens lift up and you get to see New York from the 102nd Floor for the first time, Breathtaking!You'll then make your way down to the 100th floor where the Observatory is actually on, the lady will offer you an iPad to take which you can point at certains places and will tell you information about that part of the city.There is also a resturant there aswell, where you can get a cake or coffee.A 360 enclosed room with views of the whole of New York City, Statue of Liberty, Emprire State Building and plenty more.Personally i think its the best Observatory Tower in New York itself and it is a fitting replacement to the Twin Towers.The Lift down is just as good as the lift up, The Gift Shop is abit pricey on certain items, but you're only there once.Highly Recommended

Amazing View!. The place is very amazing. To go to the top we took the lift and it was very fast (200th floor in 50 sec.).We visited the observatory in the evening and you can admire the lights of city. I suggest this place because it gives to you nice emotions.

Breathtaking. If you come to the city to see the sights, you should put One World on the list. With panoramic views from the observation deck you will not be disappointed. The lift to the top starts your tour with a modern day electronic trip through time. Step out of the lift & the trip continues until all is revealed. I won't say more on this as for some that will be the best part. Take your time moving around the observation deck & if you are new to the city, you can access skyline information through GPS IPad information available at a small cost.You can buy tickets each day by lining up but this can take a while. You will then need to come back at your allocated time. Buying express VIP tickets can move you up the queue & make access easier but in each case I would suggest buying before you go. You only need to be there 15 minutes before your scheduled time so this could mean you have more time to visit the surrounding memorials & less time, potentially, spent standing in the cold.Overall a great addition to things to do in New York

Disappointed.... Checked it out tonight. I would have given it one more star EXCEPT that Top of the Rock observation deck is 100% more interesting and has better views of New York City.Best way I can describe one World Observation is anti-septic...totally indoors, some views are purposely blocked so you follow their logic as to how you see things.Other than your ears popping in the elevator, there is really no real experience of being 100 stories high...it could all be TV screens and you never would know the difference. They corral you at the start of your visit with a camera, and at the end try to sell you the pic, and again, purely antiseptic, the picture shows nothing of your visit, it is a fake background.I suspect the vast majority of reviewers here have never been to Top of the Rock. It is three levels, glass walls with gaps for camera lenses, and you are outdoors some 85 stories high...a vastly better experience.

Fitting replacement. My only criticism was that I couldn't see any rest rooms from when I entered up until getting to the top after queuing to be searched in the way in . Lifts are very fast and ears pop Worth the entry fee. Souvenirs are very pricey

Well done!. We got to NYC on a foggy rainy day. Fortunately the next evening was clear and we decided to go up. The lines moved quickly, the staff was friendly and helpful and the view was spectacular. I agree that the desk to sell things could have been placed in the middle instead of up against the windows. Wish also the windows in the observation deck were tilted in so you could get better pictures without glare. That really could have been thought out better, but hey, how many of us are professional photographers? Overall the experience was well done.

Must see it at least once.. Our group of four purchased front of the line tickets, $54 ea, worth every penny. The crowd was huge, lines were long. The observatory is beautiful and a must to see. My daughter, age 20, became motion sick at the top. She said she could feel the building move. We headed back down for fresh air because you can't get any at the top. I enjoyed the Empire State Building more because you can go outside at the top of it. This activity could be enjoyed by all age groups.

Stunning Sunset over Statue of Liberty. Definitely worth a visit!It takes approximately 80 sec. to get up with the elevator (102nd). The elevator is animated and shows the historical development of NYC on a time axis, amazing!The observatory deck is pretty crowded, so we took time to take pictures and enjoy the view. We went up half an hour/an hour before sunset so we could see NYC by day and by night and also watch the sun going down over New Jersey and the Statue of Liberty.Unfortunately, the deck is indoors only, but the view is fantastic.When we were there, there were not a lot people lining up, so we were in pretty quickly.

What a view!. This was a great choice - cheaper than Empire State Building, with magnificent view and really nice show while being in a lift, btw it takes only 52 seconds to rise 102 floors! The only setback is that you can't see Central Park from this place, but it was probably the only thing we missed. Excellent!

Amazing!. We went and toured the One World Observatory and glad we did. The line to enter was a bit long despite having purchased an advance ticket/time. The elevator ride was pretty cool in that it was fast and neat to see the land transformation while riding up. The view from the top is awesome and the crowds up top can be cumber-sum in that many tended to block the windows and linger too long. Of course that may not happen the next time we go. Pretty neat thing to do and recommended all my friends go up and take the views in.

One World (911 memorial). Family members thought Observation deck good but thought their would be more to it. Also, thought preordered tickets to be very expensive for what they got. Maybe the price should have included the 911 museum as well.

A MUST IN NYC!!!. So there I am staring up at the top of this 102 story building almost feeling a sense of vertigo as it just keeps going up to the sky. I don't love heights but decided to put that aside as this was an experience we needed to have.I have to say that the heights were never an issue, we loved being on the observation deck and never for 1 second did we feel scared, so if you are like me, don't let it hold you back from an experience that is truly special!We don't want to ruin it for you, so we won't say too much, let's just say, it's magic, and it will leave you with several moments of pure and utter WOW!!!!!
Astounding views. This is worth an experience. views from 102 floor were mesmerizing. the elevator experience was also wonderful.

Worth to get there. If you need to decide between going there or not, my choice would be Yes again. 32USD to get up is worth. There is surprise after you go up by (modern technology looking) elevator to the cinema (or how should I call it) that you will not expect for sure. And then you can enjoy 360 view of NYC and NJ.

RIP-OFF!!!. Of course, the view is beautiful. And the elevator ride is terrific! But please.......at $32 admission, why would I then have to rent an IPAD at the top for $15 MORE to know what I am looking at?!? Surely, a few signs would have been appropriate!

Great Experience even with Zero Visibility. I went at the end of December just a couple days before New Years and it was a zero visibility day. We were discouraged from going up, but as I live overseas and was due to depart early the next day, we went anyway. The queues to go up were not bad, the lift experience was very cool going up and back down as you see an interactive journey, many staff tell you about the building and surrounding elements on observatory level, and much more. I will definitely make a trip back and go up when visibility is clear.

Something not to do when it's cloudy !!!. Regardless of the forecast...Our schedule was compressed and we were forced to visit the World Observatory during a visually impacted day...Something I would have NEVER DONE given our schedule permitted! I'm sure it is BEAUTIFUL, the view of NYC and NJ...but the fact the building observation authority would not issue us a refund was somewhat CRAZY ! The rules and regulations are all in the name of PROFIT making. So it would behoove you to observe and pray for good weather when making a trip up to One World Observatory! Just saying...
Stunning Views!. A must do on your NYC trip. You travel up 102 stories (1,776 feet) in under 60 seconds! The views from the top are incredible and you have to see first hand!

worth visiting. We paid the extra for a day flex ticket and it was worth it to avoid the line getting in. Unfortunately when you decide to leave, the flex ticket does not allow you an expedited exit and despite the fact that they try to move the lines quickly you still end up in the exit line for a half hour or more. The view is beautiful and a different perspective than the Empire state building and the Top of the Rock. We went up at 3pm and saw the city in daylight and by the time we left we were able to see the city start to become lit up at 5pm. The view is worth the lines.

Better Buy Tickets in Advance. We visited on opening week and it was jammed! What an extraordinary addition to New York. It is humbling to remember why the observatory has been built! It is well organized and most entertaining. From the moment you walk onto the property, you know you are in for a thrill. The staff is exceptional and patient with the tourists new to this attraction. What a great day we spent. It was a clear day and the views were Over The Top!

Is it really worth seeing?. Growing up in New York I may be a little bias but I would have hoped that the designers of this building would have considered some of the nuances of the original World Trade Center. Exterior wise this building is beautiful and well done but the interior styling is lacking. My wife and I loved to watch the sunset from the top of New York. We decided to go to the One World Observatory while we were in New York for the US Open. Our journey began with waiting on line for the elevator, than we waited on line to view a short movie, than we waited on line to be sold an iPad viewer, than we waited on line to reach the actual observatory and than we waited on line to eat a snack. If you enjoy waiting on lines this place is for you. The elevator experience was very well done and neat to see however the observatory level was very disappointing. The windows are angled in such a way that you really have a tough time taking pictures. The building owners obstructed the best view such as looking north at 5th avenue. They decided to put a desk directly in front of this window to sell photos and other items to the tourists. Another disappointment was the lack of any seating at this level. My wife who recently had a knee replacement had nowhere to sit just for a minute while enjoying the view. All in all I would recommend saving your money to see another venue or museum.

great experience. getting to the elevator and taking it up to the Observatory is one of the best experiences I have ever made! I was in the WTC as a child and was a little scared how it would be like, but it is incredibly well done and fascinating. The view over the city is great, I'm sure it is really spectacular in the dark.

Freedom Tower. This attraction was definitely one of the highlights of my life. The 360 degree views of the entire city were incredible. I visited with my cousin from Germany who was here for the first time, and she was so happy with the visit. It is a must see if you are visiting New York.
On A Clear Day!. Can't share would be a massive spoiler. Not to be missed though lots of info given about the construction process which is done in a very clever way.

Amazing views. We visited on a lovely bright sunny morning in December and you could see for miles we couldn't have picked a better day!I felt it wasn't too busy and we didn't have to wait to see out of the floor to ceiling windows and we got some great photos.
the highest. it is the highest view and the most complete among the other options/observatories like the Empire State and Top of the Rock

A must see. We visited this attraction in December, my first time but my partners second time. I was nervous about the lift and the height but believe me there was nothing to worry about. The information and technology just in the lift is fantastic. I loved looking out onto the city from the 102 floors up and it did not phase me as I do not like heights. Got some great pictures/cam shots from the building. Definitely worth a visit and great value for money.

Stop reading TripAdvisor reviews and GO!!. I'm running out of adjectives for New York. Totally totally breathtaking, even the lift is an event!The bar at the top isn't as expensive as what you might think either, so grab yourself a table and get yourself a glass of Prosecco and savour the beauty of the moment.

very impressive, but too many people. the visit and the organisation was very impressive, but we have been there during christmas holidays ant there were too many people on the deck. it is difficult to take pictures. I wanted to sit down for a coffe, but there was no unocupied place in the cafeteria.
Gr8 day m8. me and ma pal brandon waite went here, he fell and slipped on a jobby was a great day though. Definitely recommend taking a jobby off the top of it.

Queue, queue, queue. We visited this attraction on New Year's Day, and although we had booked tickets for 3.15 we weren't let into the queue until 3.45. We then queued to get into the building, queued to go through security, queued to get into the lift in a dark and dingy stone corridor that felt you were visiting Jurassic Park more than anything. We then queued to get into the screening room before actually seeing anything, the curtain then lifts and you get a 30 second glance of the view before being trundled through to another room to be sold an iPad 'experience' for $15, and then go down to the actual observatory. It all felt like a money making scheme with the amount of gift shop tat and restaurant. When we were in the observatory, it was hard to actually look at the view as so many people were sat on the window ledges because there wasn't anywhere else to sit. We left the attraction after being inside for about 20 minutes - I'd recommend Rockafella over this in a heartbeat which is SO MUCH BETTER. On the whole, this 'experience' was the most disappointing thing we did in NYC.

Best viewing deck in NYC. We pre brought fast track tickets for 4pm but we didn't need to. We have noticed that January maybe isn't as busy as other months though!!!! When we got to the 100th floor the sun was setting over the city which created brilliant views all around. I would recommend pre buying tickets as the ticket queue out side which was set up was huge!

Birthday. Having done both the Empire State Building and Top of The Rock I can safely say the view from the top of the One World Observatory is the best view in the city. It offers a 360degree view and it blows you away. You could sit there for hours just watching the world below you go past. I say and looked out towards the Statue of Liberty (where we had also been that day) and she looked so small but looking past her out towards the mouth of the river watching ferries and a cruise liner was wonderful. You can get a meal in the restaurant but I believe you need to book for that and even if that's all you want to do you still have to pay the $30 something dollars each just to get up to it. However you can also get a tea/coffee and cake if it's something smaller you require. The staff are friendly and helpful and it is well worth the money and a fitting tribute to NY City!

Check the weather!. There is no denying this is an incredible building and the 'we fight back' subliminal message is great! The whole building is just stunning and the elevator ride up is pretty remarkable.  We booked our tickets in advance, we had checked the weather and it was foggy for the day we booked it but the cloud was supposed to clear by 10am. We booked for 14.30 and unfortunately the fog hadn't lifted (perk of going in December!). We were warned about 'zero visibility' but the queue to change tickets was the same queue as buying tickets and we didn't have time to waste queuing and then come back another day. So we just went for it and the whole queue system was so unorganised it was quite stressful! When we got up there, the view was literally 'zero visability', all we could see was cloud but we had been warned! We decided to get something to eat and wait for the cloud to lift as you can spend as long as you like there. There is a cafe area and the food was nice, however slightly overpriced seen as there weren't even any seats to eat it at! There were tables but no chairs, it was bizarre! If you go down a level, there are benches to sit on so we took our food down!  Later on, the cloud lifted and we could see quite a bit. I can imagine how amazing it would be on a clear day and would definitely go back for the full experience! Highly recommend it if you're going to New York!

Window to the World. Wow - we purchased our tickets on line for a 1pm entrance . The entry process was very organized and we were looking at the great views by 1:10. All the employees we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Once you enter the observation area you have all the time you want to peer out each window in awe of the views.
Just WOW. What an amazing place! Such a good visit here. We all really enjoyed it.From the moment you walk in the lift you are entertained. Really worth a visit.

Zero visibility.... we went there after christmas in 2015 but there was zero visibility, they offered us to change tickets to another date but we went up... that was a bad choice because the only thing we could see was nothing..

Sunset visit. prebooked tickets online with timed entry and glad we did as queues very long, the elevator ride to the top is a experience in itself as in being very fast and with a 360 degree show of the growth of New York, once at top your ushered into a theatre to watch a presentation then the screen disappears to reveal the sights of Manhatten. You then have free access around the observatory to view from all sides, (finding a space at a window is a waiting game), but the views are awesome watching New York change from day to night, This is the place to go for a great uninterupted view of New York, forget going up Empire State and Top of the rock as this observatory puts them to shame

The new sight in town!. Yes, recently opened and already overcrowded but adefinitely worth a visit. Buy your ticket in advance online and plan enough time - although you are usually getting a ticket for a specific time you still have to wait up to 1 hour to get in...i.e. we purchased tickets for 3:30 and entered the building at 4:30. If you can afford get a prority pass to skip the lines. Unlike Empire State Building the observatory is not outside but inside, meaning that you will have glass (and eventually reflection) between you and the sights.

Lump in my throat. From the start of the tour, you walk through a series of short videos that tell the story of the building and those that have built it. Very moving and appropriate. The elevator experience is cool, fast and electronic display screens showing the historic building up of NYC. When you get off the elevator you go through a brief presentation followed by a "surprise." Nope... not going to give it away, but it's worth it.Once you get to the observatory deck, take the time to appreciate the 365 degree views.My recommendation... pay a little extra for the interactive iPad they offer you at the top of the tower. One per family is more than fine... but you learn a lot and the experience becomes more than just a nice view.I'll admit... you do get a lump in your throat when you hear the stories of the building, the energy that went into it... combined with breathtaking views.

Beautiful View. It is a beautiful view from the top and the elevator jets you to the top super fast which is like a ride in itself. Kinda pricy but we had to go. Pictures don't come out very good because you are not outside there is so much glare off the glass.

Buy priority tickets in advance. For $49.60 each you should buy priority tickets on the internet before you go. This makes you beat the queues, and the queue is very long. This is the tallest building in the Western hemisphere, so you have to do it really. The views are just astonishing. You should combine this with trips up the Empire State Building and the Rockefeller Centre, in fact Rockefeller was in some ways better because you get to see Central Park too. But, with One World you have to spend half hour at the 9/11 memorial pools. Also, the queue for the 9/11 museum is verrrrrrry long so plan for that.

Great view - Express / VIP is the only way to go. Don't wait in lines - you have better thing to do in life - Spring for the Express / Timed Entry tickets - you wont be disappointed. OWO - has taken cue from Disney and made the ride to the top an amassment - the elevators have floor to ceiling LCD screen that provide informative and interesting information on the way up and down. When you reach the elevator level - you are ushered in to an observation area with blinds over the windows - and after a short speech - the big revile of Manhattan which last less than a minute. Which is a bad thing - because this the last good view you will have of Manhattan at night because on the actual observation level two floor below - the gift shop lights glare off the windows clouding and obscuring the view. So between the gift shop lights and the forehead and finger smudges you can view the lights of New York City. In all honesty the Empire State Building View is better - simply because it's outdoor, with no glass, no reflections. And it's in the center of NYC with the city around it.What is breath taking about the OWO is looking down into the memorial fountains of the original WTC building footprints - you can almost feel them still there.Don't miss it - Don't miss the 9/11 museum below.

Fantastic !. A fantastic, sightseeing must !Pre booked tickets arrived early and were allowed in as no queues.Great presentation in the Sky Pod.A brilliant surprise after the video presentation very well thought of whoever thought of that idea, genius !Would have been great to have seating in cafe area, service very slow too but did not spoil overall experience.We had a lovely sunny day so views over the area were spectacular.Great day out. Thanks OWO !

Must see in New York. The views from the top of the tower are unbeatable and breathtaking. The ticketing process and security are kind of confusing because there are just so many people but we were able to buy tickets and enter the tower immediately. The elevator rides up and down are so much fun because they are so fast. When you get to the top they try to sell you a ton of stuff but we didn't buy any of that and just found a place near the window to sit and enjoy the view.

Zero Visibility. We were well aware of the zero visibility notice when we went after Christmas. But, we had traveled far to NYC and figured we'd just go anyway. The elevator ride was really amazing. The screens on the walls show the progression of NYC. It would be best if you could go on multiple times and look at the different walls each time to see all angles of the city. I would definitely try to do that next time. The visibility was, in fact, zero when we got to the observation desk. Pure white. You couldn't see a thing. Again, it was expected. But, they do offer iPads that show the complete view and that was amazing! Definitely DON'T go during foggy or cloudy days. But if you do spend the money, appreciate the elevator ride.

Sad, but awesome. I really enjoyed the trip to the One World Observatory. It is a lot different and much more high-tech than the previous observatory at the WTC. Elevator ride up was fantastic. The panels showing the evolution of the area was great and informative. Once out of the elevator, the panels drop away and the view is revealed. Spectacular. I also really liked the video as you wait for the elevator. Workers who rebuilt the Trade Center are featured and it's very nice to see their passion and their hard work. I would like to see occupancy rates of the new tower...seems pretty vacant. We ordered tix in advance and we were glad we did. We stood in the cold for under 5 minutes. Others were in long lines outside. I would try to go as early in the day as possible. We went at 1430 and it was mobbed. My 12 year old LOVED the whole experience.

Awesome experience..top of the world. There's was a long wait for a pretty quick visit. While the 360 degree view is amazing, the entire experience took a huge chunk out of our day. I suggest you plan ahead, arrive early, and prepare to wait.
Son and husband. They said this is a must well worth the money ,it's very informative and excellent value for money .people won't be disappointed

Beautiful view - but great delays are not acceptable. We had booked to enter at a pre determined time slot, but as we showed up on time we were asked to come back about 1 1/2 hour later. This is of-course completely un acceptable. The process of entering the building was not very well organised, in fact rather chaotic. Furthermore it seems that too many tickets are sold, making the observation deck unpleasantly crowded and it seems like security concerns are not taken seriously. The lines for exiting were very long as well.This is a beautiful attraction in NYC which is well worth a visit, for the excellent view and the unique experience, but improvements are needed in the management of this place.

EVEN WHEN CLOUDY. We booked tickets and were told there is no view as low cloud. Offered to change but we were leaving that day. Went up and was still a great trip. There is many very modern displays and it is very interesting. for $15 you can hire a interactive ipad that shows the view as you move the screen up- so kinda saw it anyway!

Not to be missed. We arrived at One World Observatory on a beautiful clear sunny day. After viewing the pool which is amazing, we took the elevator up the 102 floor for the most beautiful views, 360 degrees of New York City and the view of New Jersey .. Anyone visiting NYC should not for any reason miss this world trade center attraction. It is awe inspiring.

Observatory was a worthwhile experience. Lines not bad, wait outside will be challenging when it's cold, lift to the top was very well done using tv monitors to give you a view of the history of Manhattan, theatre introduction at the top was well put together. Definitely worth a trip.

Disappointing. We visited with pre-arranged timed tickets & the arrival process was mismanaged bedlam. Staff were clearly besides themselves with the volume of people & we were allowed in over 30 minutes later than our time - no one was getting in to their time. Ruined the whole plan for daytime to dusk viewing. I'd also prearranged the iPad - waste of money. Would not hold direction. Prices in general make me think the building will be paid for in 3 months! A nice ambient drink at the bar? No. No seating unless eating. And, as others have said, what's with people 'camping' in the Windows? Look & move on or back, people! Staff should not allow sitting in the Windows... There was much to take the shine off. Highlight was definitely the lift up & down & the first presentation surprise.

Amazing Ride and Views. I came to NY many years ago and went to the Windows of the World Observatory and restaurant in the old World Trade Center Towers. This is every bit as excellent as that was. From the beauty of the outside reflecting the sky, to the video in the elevator of the rise of NYC, to the views. This is not to be missed!

inbelievable view to NYC. best time to going is before sunset, you doenst need to wait so many time like to Empire State (4 hour...horrible!!!), all is new, and if you can tolerate some "presentation in american dreams" - because for US people all must be "amazing" -), you can admire inbelievable view to New York ...like a birds -))

Amazing views, awful coffee. The views are everything you would expect - just amazing. But the restaurant was a real disappointment. I ordered a latte, with a double shot. The coffee that arrived was not a latte (I have no idea how they made it, but it was unlike any latte I had ever had before - the milk did not seem to be properly steamed), and I was charged $6, plus an additional $6 for the extra shot. By far the most expensive coffee I have ever bought, and one of the worst. The manager could not justify how they could charge $12 for a coffee, but just said that those were the set prices, and they could not be changed. I expected much more from the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere!

Christmas visit. This personally for me was the best "observation tower" over the Empire State Building and the Top of the rock.You overall experience feels a lot easier to deal with queues weren't too bad though we had pre booked tickets only standard ones but you don't queue half as long as those who buy on the door.Views are brilliant with the Statue of Liberty visible on one side to the Empire State Building on the other. You also get a good view of the world trade centre memorials. Definitely worth the trip although it's away from the likes of Times Square it's only 10-15 mins in a taxi.

AMAZING!!!!. We visited OWO within the first month of it opening. The whole experience was amazing and certainly gave me goosebumps. The 360 views of the city are truly breath taking and especially being able to look down onto the North and South pools from above. This attraction provides fantastic photo opportunities.

Spectacular Views of NYC. We went to One World Observatory on our recent trip to New York and we were both extremely impressed with the views. I'd recommend getting there early to avoid queuing. We got there shortly after 9am and there was a small queue but by the time we were leaving it was considerably longer.The entire experience is very enjoyable and the staff there were very good.

Great views of NYC. I'd visited the observatory in the Twin Towers. This is much better and larger. iPads are available for rent that then show you what you are looking toward. Many helpful staff members were around. There are two restaurants and a gift shop should you be so inclined.The elevator ride is AMAZING. Super fast with a wonderful video playing on the walls of NYC through time..wish I could have slowed it down!
Best observation deck in NYC. This was well worth the long lines to buy tickets and to start the tour. Best observation deck in NYC.
Xmas in New York . Views were terrific. U need 2 get the I pad 2 get the best experience. If possible u need 2 get there early to avoid the queues.

Fantastic. Booked and visited as part of day on the water taxi, short delays due to heavy nos on day but quickly up on top, what a view and experience for young and old, this is from a person who cannot climb a ladder without suffering vertigo.

A must for the most spectacular view of NYC. Between Top of the Rock, the Empire State Building and the One Trade Centre/One World Observatory, this is most definitely the best. They all have their own merits, but this one was the best and most spectacular. Also pay with a Mastercard on the door and get free VIP tickets :)

Definitely a Must See for NYC Visitors. This was our first time visiting the One World Observatory. We have visited NYC on several occasions. On our last trip, the tower was still under construction. We were so impressed with the building itself, but also the "orchestration" of the Observatory tour was so well done. We had very little wait time and the staff was helpful and ran the movement of people exceptionally well. The views of the city were absolutely breathtaking. This was well worth the money spent and I will make this stop on all future visits to the city. Very well done!

This a an incredible experience. This was an exciting experience to go into this time capsule elevator that takes you up within 60 seconds to 102 nd floor of the new one World Trade Center. The elevator ride itself is incredible with the 3d video on the way up and shows you how Manhattan was built. Once you get to the top you get a 360 view of Manhattan and its surroundings. There is also a restaurant that you can eat at and enjoy the view. The ride down the elevator makes you feel like you are outside of the building flying down in a parachute. I highly recommend this experience!

Brilliant views-shame they are all behind glass. Fantastic experience-we just walked up and got tickets on the day without any queues-mid week mid December.Some days we were in the city it would have been very poor views due to the cloud level.Dramatic lift and views but it could get very crowded.

Mind blowing views. I will keep this short and sweet. The One World Observatory - World Trade Center was amazing.... the views were mind blowing and as the sun went down it was incredible! The lift ride was GREAT (and I won't give anything away about that). My only disappointment was the slight trouble of getting in. With our given time on our printed tickets it was all a little kayotic with the times running 30-40 minutes late. Im sure these teething problems will be ironed out in due time.

Bit pricey but worth it. We timed our visit to coincide with sunset on a clear blue sky day in November and the views were spectacular. only issue was so many other people had the same idea and it was crowded. to see the sun setting over new jersey and the lights come on in the city is special . It is a bit of a risk since we had to book our tickets in advance and if had ben a rainy overcast day , it would have been a waste of money . but we were lucky this time

Amazing views of NYC!. The views were amazing! The elevator ride up & down was exciting. The introductory video presentation took my breath away. All of the staff were super helpful & nicely answered any of our questions.
Top Views of Manhattan. Awesome viewing experience of Manhattan Is. The 360 views are unmatched & provide for great photos. Show we move on.

The best view of New York City. Everyone must see it before leaving New York. I booked the standard ticket on line, the access was fast and the tour is very well organized. The elevator is rounded by screen walls showing you the evolution of the city while you are going up (it should slower). The view is awesome and moved me to tears thinking I was exactly where the twin towers were. However, the price $32 per person should be cheaper.
Wonderful View. The view are just wonderful from the 102 floor. and the elevator ride up and down are special. Everyone should enjoy their time there

takes forever to see forever. -we bought the tickets for the 4pm tour but didn't get to the top until 5:15pm-we were treated like cattle-we waited approximately 30 minutes to exit-there were so many people in the OWO that we couldn't take unobstructed photos-we had multiple problems with our child's stroller (and the employees were not helpful or courteous)-huge line to use the restroom-once upstairs we could hardly move because there were so many people-the crowds made us feel claustrophobic -this is not the experience we expected to have (we've been atop the empire state building and the top of the rock and they are much much better)-total waste of $128. we all felt like we'd been robbed. -we will discourage our friends from visiting
A Highlight of our trip!. This was our whole family's favorite attraction! I won't spoil it, but the elevator ride & view reveal was worth every penny! Be sure to book your reservation in advance!

GREAT VIEW - POOR CAMERA SHOTS. Great presentation and views, but trying to get good photos - forget it....Too many people at one time and the glazing on the windows reflects every light and person inside. Trying to get good evening pictures without exit signs very hard. Also pretty expensive. Stick to TOP OF THE ROCK....The building is amazing...

Same price as competititors, infinitely better.. I've done the Empire State and Rockefeller Centre on previous trips to NYC and they provide great views, but this offers far more for your 30 dollars. The lift graphics are great and the cinematics at the height of the tower are brilliant. Only issue is you aren't fully outside, but still by far the best view of the city.

A sight to see. The new World Trade Centre building is a sight to see, it is spectacular and a real tribute to the people of New York.The whole area including the memorial water features is a very moving experience.

One World Observatory. Very disappointing. Drove 2 hours to get to NY.Purchased tickets online for a birthday gift for an assigned time of 4pm so we can see the sunset. We arrive 20 minutes early (3:40pm)and were told to come back at 5pm because they were running late. My niece was very disappointed because it was completely dark out and couldn't see anything but the city lights. She got a DSL camera for Christmas and wanted to use it for what was supposed to be a great view. PLEASE WARN PEOPLE OF POSSIBLY RUNNING LATE. Overpriced, the admission, gift shop and restaurant.

Worth toes. The building is amazing! But it makes you feel dark at the same time - I am assuming it is because of the story behind - I liked the view from the top better than the view on top of the Empire State Building.

Great visit - but plan ahead. Great way to see the City. Very well run bu nice, friendly folks. A bit expensive. 1. Go early 2. Buy tickets online the night before after checking the weather. 3. Don't go unless clear weather. 4. Be prepared to stand outside. 5. Don't bother with the iPad rentals.

Bad organization, good view. Must improve. They ask to print the tickets, why don't promove the electronic tickets also the wallet options?They ask to be at least 15 minute before to your scheduled time but did not have a waiting area in side the building to wait. You must wait outside the building with the winter weather.They was behind the schedule but not all security-scaning line were open.They promove the builiding is based in a real rock but the area is covered with fake stones.Long lines to wait for the Elevators but they was sent empty.In the lobby of the elevators they don't prepare waiting areas acording the capacity of each elevators. They wait the elevator is in the floor to start to count how many people fit in it, and an employee need to ask to remove the backpacks and fold the strolers, why they don't use videos in monitors with this information and also announced to prepare your camera?Do you pay extra for a fast line to go up but this doesn't work to going down !!!!!!Definetly they need to improve their system if they sold the ticket by an appointment, why they are behind the schedule if they know exactly how many tickets are sold?Bad organization, good view. They must improve.Tips: buy your tickets through the website, the line for the box office is very long.Have you camera ready in the elevator and at the arrival in the 102 floor, nice things happen in both areas.
Amazing experience. This is a must see of New York. It was efficient and moving - very well organized. We had a priority time, which was well worth it. A truly amazing experience.

Not worth the money or hassle. Having done Top of the Rock (which is great) and the Empire State Building I thought on this trip we would try The Observatory. We had timed tickets on the 2nd Jan 2016 for 5:45pm and arrived 15mins ahead of schedule as requested. Firstly there were people everywhere with absolutely no order to the mass, there were two members of staff controlling crowds of two to three hundred. We were finally ushered into queue lines at 5:45pm. We did not enter the building until 6:40pm. So had stood outside in the freezing cold unable to use the bathroom or buy water for one hour and ten minutes with zero apology from the staff. It was so cold I almost gave up waiting.By the time we entered we had sore backs and feet and were numb. We then faced another 15mins queue for security and another 15mins queue through an interactive walkway for the lifts. So after being told to arrive at 5:30pm for our 5:45pm slot we finally reached the lift at 7:10pm, which to be honest is outrageous.Do not bring children or the elderly to this event. There were far too many people with tickets per time slot and the queue could not be processed efficiently as a result. There is no shelter from the cold, the sunshine or the rain. The view was amazing but it's New York, you knew it would be but the viewing platform was crowded with people pushing and shoving to even get close to a window so it was hard to appreciate everything anyway. Unless you can go at a really quiet time I would definitely give this attraction a miss, it was chaos and if there was anyway to complain to them directly I would.

Top Of The World. Booked tickets July 2015 for our visit to New York late December.Really looked forward to this one.Got down there 9am but visibility from above zero.So rearranged for next day same time.Avoided any queue and we were 2nd people to reach the Observatory.Staff very helpful and able to hire an iPad which pointed out all of the main buildings in New York and gave a brief history of each building.I thought I would be prepared for the visit but honestly words cannot explain the feelings I felt when presented with the view.What a testemant to the people who worked on the construction and development of this amazing structure.I would definatly recommend the tour but if you pre book do it for the earliest part of your trip to New York just in case the weathers not good and you need to rearrange.

Awesome view of the city. this is highest point in new york city and what a view. it's not like empire because this is closed in by glass. no wind and no cold or hot. in December when i went lines were quite long.

Best view of New York city. Had a reservation time which meant only about a 15 minute wait time from door to elevator. Get your block time reserved a day ahead of time or risk waiting in line for hours to get ticket. Best view of the city by far. Been to the top of the other building and nothing compares. Great view of the 9/11 memorial below. They have restrooms and food vending at top. A must see when visiting New York.

One World observatory review. We went in Dec 15 quite early in the morning so there were no real queues , we bought the tickets online before we travelled. The lifts are amazing and you go up 102 floors in probably less than a minute , amazing views and it is a much see attraction in NYC , only drawback is the restaurant / bar which is very expensive $12.95 for a glass of beer which if you want to take into the restaurant has to be in a plastic cup , food was $25 for 2 bacon & egg baps with 1 cup of coffee. The gift shop had some great items but again overpriced but they have a captive audience.

Amazing experience!! Skip ESB and do this + Rockefeller instead!. I didn't really know what to expect with this. Another building to look out at New York...nothing new...but it was so much more. The whole experience was incredible. Firstly, we heard that on the same day, people were waiting 4 hours to get into ESB (oh my gosh!) and 8 hours on NYD. We booked tickets online the day before and we had little to no waiting. We were in and out within an hour and didn't feel rushed at all.It is a quieter time of year so I can imagine this gets busier but for us it was perfect. I would advise checking the weather beforehand as no point doing in a cloudy day. You have 360 views of the boroughs and you can pay $15 for an iPad that pin points specific buildings and provides more info. We didn't do this but they looked good.As others have said, the elevator is brilliant. I won't say too much as I don't want to spoil it but I hate heights and suffer with anxiety when going in lifts and initially getting to the top of tall buildings, but I didn't really have a chance to think about it!I would definitely recommend this for a wider NYC view and Rockefeller for a closer view of manhattan. Don't bother wasting time with ESB. You see nothing different and you will waste half a day waiting to get in.

Amazing Views. The One World Observatory was a great excursion while visiting New York. The elevator ride up and short show at the top were excellent multimedia presentations about the history of the New York skyline and the new Freedom Tower. The only caution I have is that several members of my family mentioned that they had momentary vertigo because of the speed of the elevator ascent. Otherwise, it was a great vantage point to see New York. Incidentally, I thought that the Top of the Rock was a better vantage point to see midtown landmarks. If you like to experience the open air, you may want to visit the Top of the Rock or Empire State Building. The One World Observatory is indoors and glare on the Windows may be a problem for picture taking especially if visiting at night. People are more likely to sit or rest at the Windows as they have an elevated vent at the window. It detracted from taking pictures as I had to work around those taking a break or standing on the vent to get a selfie.

Amazing city views. Bought flexi day tickets which got us straight to the front of the queue. The lift up was awesome and the experience at the top is great, the views are amazing, well worth the trip

Spetacular view when you finally get to see it.. Having purchased tickets online, which is the way to go, it seemed to be organized chaos to find out what line to go on. There should be more staff on hand and better signage. The elevator ride was entertaining, but again, when you disembark, we are shuffled to a room to watch a short , unnecessary video on how great NYC is. Then out to the observatory when again, no signage and some crowding due to renting of ipads which could be done elsewhere.
