Impressive view and nice lift ride. You lift through time while you get to the observation deck in less than a minute. Another short video will also introduce you to the viewing deck where you can walk 360' at 2 floors level.

fantastic views. Visited in Sept 15, cost about $30. about a 5 minute wait to the lift, The view from the top are magnificent as you can see all around Manhattan. The viewing area as plenty of space and there are informative talks about the surrounding areas with shops so you can buy stuff.For me it is one of the best value places to visit for the city views and not to be missed.

Good views but Rockefeller might just be better. This was quite expensive at $30 or so each. You don't get to go outside onto a deck area. It is all enclosed. Views are excellent as you would imagine and it is a different view to that of Empire and Rockefeller as you are further downtown. There is quite an amount of US propaganda at the top (best country, city, building etc. in the world) but you get this trash everywhere. Make sure the day is clear or you are wasting money!

Amazing views; beautiful presentation. From the elevator ride up to the sweeping views that awaited us, our tour was fantastic. The building and observatory are gorgeous and easy to navigate. I would easily recommend this over the Empire State Building or The Top of the Rock.

Spectacular views from the One world trade center. The views from the world trade center surpasses the other observation points in New York. If I had to pick one place to see the view, this would be it. Enjoyed having a drink in the bar area, staff was friendly and very helpful.

Great view, great elevator ride and great ground floor video presentation !. If the weather is clear put this on your day's agenda. The ground floor videos of people who built the new tower are very well done. The elevator ride has a historical video showing how NYC has grown the last 200+ years. The viewing floor gives great 360 degree views and there are NYC guides giving informal presentations while you are there. It is worth the $32 ticket price and waiting for your timed entry.

To the Top and Back!. This was probably the biggest disappointment of our trip. Our reservations and the only time we could visit was on a rainy day.By the time we reached the top floor, it was so cloudy/foggy we couldn't see an inch beyond the windows. If it were sunny, I know this would have been one of the highlights of our trip. The elevator ride is an absolute MUST! In fact, went down and it it back up, would have done it again, but it was time to leave. The ride starts out in the 1500's and brings you out into the present. The city changes right before your eyes. Small but nice gift shop. Areas where there is a local telling you about the city and giving out helpful information. The Cafe is a stand u and eat venue. Prices are a bit high, but you expect it. Next to the stand up restaurant is a sit down restaurant. Prices are high, but what else would you expect when you sit down to this awesome view. Yes, I would go back just to see this awesome sight.

A Must Do. Don't know what to say that has not already been said, Awesome doesn't even come close to describing the view. This building is an engineering marvel the and the view is 360°. You don't even know or feel your in an elevator taking you up 102 floors its so fast. A restaurant and a small shopping gallery is also at the top. You can spend a good hour taking in the views.

On Top of the World. This is a can't miss, especially if you haven't done it before. I didn't want to wait in line, so I bought our tickets with my smartphone and had an hour to walk around the memorial. It was a quick, smooth ride up the 105 flights. The first landmark you see is Lady Liberty herself. The view is quite breathtaking. We went at sunset, so our pictures had the spectrum of colors. We walked around, but it was very crowded on Sunday, smelled like seafood and garlic from the restaurant, and a female announcer/tour-guide was talking too loudly into her microphone. So, after half an hour, we found the hidden exit line and made our way back to ground level. I am glad I experienced it, but I would not return unless I take a first-time traveler to New York.
Disneyesque, in a good way. Well structured and well organized experience allows full enjoyment. The speed of the elevators is breathtaking, as is the experience.

A experience to remember.. My husband & I visited the tower in August of this year. I was expecting along line and a great view. Wrong. I had ordered the tickets on line and picked them up at will call. That pushed us to the front of the line.From the time we stepped in the elevator until we walked out onto the observation deck, I was surprised. I had purposely not read a lot about what to expect. I wanted to experience it on my own. Glad I did. So worth the trip. In fact, we did it a second time in August when we visited the city again. This time we had friends who had never been. Just as wonderful the second time.

Way better than expected !. I was really surprised at how much I enjoyed visiting here. The building is awesome in both size and design and the view is breathtaking. The staff was very professional and friendly. If your coming to New York City, you need to put this on your list of places to visit.

Magnificent view but with intrusive and manipulative crowd management.. The experience could be great if they organizers would just get rid of the obnoxious 'Greatest Show on Earth' music and the 'Tony the Tiger 'voice that tells you what to do and where to walk. My visit to the site was the first since I saw the remains of the twin towers in smoldering ruins and I expected the atmosphere to be rather quiet, respectful and subdued. Instead, it was loud, intrusive and manipulative. From the moment we entered the elevator, the swelling music started. The imaginative video of the changing Ny landscape through the centuries was impressive, but it did not need a soundtrack. Upon arrival, we had to wait on the exit platform while we again got the loud stirring music and flashing lights, I guess to evoke breathlessness of the moment as the curtains finally lifted and we could see the view (which requires no such build-up). But wait, we could not remain in front of that view--we had to move on, two escalators down, to another level to appreciate the view. There, upon arrival, visitors are directed to a space without being told that it is for a photo that they should then buy as a souvenir (I didn't want one, thank you). Escaping the photo op, the crowds can walk around freely, take their own photos and look at the city and suburbs from every direction. The only intrusive element is a public presentation given every half-hour or so in which the speaker talks about some of the more famous landmarks and also the new buildings, complete with multi-million dollar prices for certain apartments and the celebrity inhabitants. Is that really necessary? There are rentable iPads that provide lots of that information and everyone else does not have to listen. One could install maps on the floor or raised panels identifying the buildings in each direction so all would have access freely to the information, but the presentations are a bit overpowering. I left quicker than expected to see the Calatrava memorial and walk around the beautiful memorial garden with the two sunken waterfalls, enjoying only the noise of the city as I remembered the immense tragedy and loss of life that had taken place here on a day that scarred us all forever.

Do Not Miss Doing This. Seriously, it goes 102' in 47 seconds to the top and you don't even feel like your on an elevator. We walked right up, got tickets, went in, rode up, saw the view, had food and drink in the casual dining restaurant (food was good) and took in the view. It really is a fantastic view from up there even on a cloudy day. The whole elevator experience is worth the ride. We did not pay for the "express" boarding and got right on. Might not be like that other days so you may want to buy tickets ahead of time for the 9/11 Museum and the Top of the World observatory.

Must visit. You cannot get a better view of the city and surrounding areas. The two presenters that we saw were excellent and informative. The visuals during the elevator ride were a terrific surprise. The only negative was the long wait out in the cold when we had timed tickets. Luckily it wasn't freezing or raining. In spite of that I'd definitely include this venue on any NYC tour. I'd go again.

Heavenly views. Celebrate the city that never sleeps with Manhattan's most electrifying view. Although the first look out may be terrifying considering the tragic history surrounding this address, you must overcome uour fear and take in this view.
Amazing. I have not experienced any thing like this it was amazing and emotional would recommend any body to see this

Amazing!. Breath taking experience, you will not regret going up to the observatory. If you buy your tickets online, you can skip the regular line, you can even get them on your phone. When you enter you will get searched, which was not so bad. The line moved pretty quickly and we were on our way. You'll get led to the elevator that takes you to the observatory, it's really fast. While you're in there a video will play on the back panel of the elevator showing a timeline of manhattan. When you get to the observatory you will be shown a feel good video about NYC which is very entertaining. It concludes with the opening of a shade that reveals the view outside. After this you are free to roam around the whole floor for as long as you'd like. They also have a gift shop and cafe up there. Overall it's truly amazing, definitely something to do if you're in the city.
Must visit in New York!. Incredible view and experience. You get to feel the history behind it and experience the greatest view all over new york

Thrilling. The view stunning, the ride up to 102nd floor great, the service at security just marvellous. We entered the building at 1600h and found ourselves on top at 1630h just great. I suggest buying the expedeited entry.

Up up and up and up.... Even though I have a fear of heights, the set-up is of such nature, that even if you cling to the back wall or just hang onto the railings, you will still catch a view. The lift ride up's animation is terrific, all staff are friendly and the amount of facts accessible through their iPads and even live "rings" are enough to keep you wandering for hours.Well done, New York, well done.

Amazing Views. First time in New York City, and the observatory was on my list! The views were amazing, it did not seem overcrowded and they have a wonderful restaurant. Need reservations, for everything, just was easier for me, pre booked ticket on line, super easy.
Thanks goving. Visited here over the thanks giving weekend. Best views of Manhattan and we were lucky as it was such a clear day which was great for pics.

surreal views. I think the views are incredible and the food is excellent at the One World restaurant (you need to reserve ahead, I used opentable), it made for a memorable afternoon for my birthday celebrations.

So glad we went!. We didn't purchase tickets ahead of time because for the price we didn't want to go on a cloudy day. We went via subway on a Saturday around 10 and the weather was perfect, no wait which was nice. For the price it was worth it, the kids took great pictures, we could see the entire city and then some. The souvenir shop was crazy expensive for what they offered but overall it was a great experience for the whole family.

Well worth doing. have done the Burg in Dubai and this is so much better and much cheaper ( Burg was just a massive rip off ) ..book using a mastercard for tickets on a Monday to save money and avoid a bit of queuing .. watch out for prices...US 5.50 for a self service diet coke !! however i did find out that you can have refills for free / so buy one plastic glass and share !!! will save you loads /overall an enjoyable well run attraction ..and the lifts are amazing !! 102 floors and soooooooooooo fast and great videos inside the lift....
Unbelievable panorama and much better than expected.. We already visited Top of the Roch and Empire State building, but this is absolutely unbeatable. The view is 360° from the 100th floor.

Incredible Building. This building is an engineering marvel. The video that plays in the lift on the way up is amazing, and I can't even describe how I felt when I first saw the city - this was an absolutely breathtaking experience. We went at night and the views were just spectacular.

If you need to look around. I miss the old world trade centers as the twin towers were so interesting in their simplicity as compared to the empire state building. In fact one could readily get into the empire state building quickly when the trade center is open as their were no lines. My first skyscraper was the empire state building and I could walk to the top. See both.

Amazing views. The ride up was cool, they did a great job on the entry experience as well. Once inside it's a 360 enclosed view. There are 2 restaurants and a gift shop. I went at night time to see the are lit up. The views are amazing, my only issue is the glass. Trying to take pictures can prove to be difficult with all the reflections from inside. Was still a great experience and worth the time if you are visiting the area.
Beautiful views and outstanding building. We went to the 9-11 Memorial and then to the One World Observatory. It was the perfect way to conclude an emotional day. Very uplifting.

Amazing view - parents with strollers beware..... Rather confusing to buy tickets, line up out the front, buy your ticket, then rejoin another line outside before your time to go up. Prior to going up we asked if we could take a stroller in which we were advised we could. Once we were in the line for the lift we were told to fold it up. ( our baby jogger is a 2 piece stroller so not that easy) We then had to carry the stroller up the lift, into the theatre, thru a speech, down an escalator before we could open it up. Painful huh!!!! Parents had babies sleeping and had to wake the babies up (never wake a sleeping baby I'm told) Once at the top the stroller could be used, and then in the lift back down - the same one we were advised to fold it up in. I don't have a issue if strollers can't be taken, however knowing this prior to doing the tour would have been handy, or a stroller storage area could be handy. Once on top the view is amazing, you can see everything. The Lift ride up was a memorable moment with flash backs from New York before it became the concrete jungle.Would recommend, however next time strollerless..
Breathtaking views. This is a must see if you go to New York, very impressive. The lift ride alone was great with the screens playing taking you though time as you ascend.

Great Views from the observatory. This was my first visit to New York and had to see the view from the observatory. we found that if you don't have a pre-booked ticket you have to wait for 15-20 minutes after buying the ticket as all tickets have times on them. You can rent a tablet which shows you what you are looking at and a bit of background about it. There are the N,S,E,W on the floor so that you can align your device with what you are seeing. Staff give talks about the observatory and what you are seeing around the viewing area. Close by is the 9/11 memorial and museum and I would take half a day to visit both buildings. We did the Empire State Building and observatory on the same day so that we could see all the views, but that was because we had a limited time and it takes a while to go downtown on the bus.

WOW. This has to be the most amazing building in the world. $54 for expedited entry is well worth it so as not to queue. Amazing views and the "see forever" motto is definitely true. Very moving experience when you think back to what happened on 9/11. Having seen the progress of the trade centre site since 9/11 to what it is now, is truly amazing.

Awesome Experience!. Most of the observation decks in NYC run about $32 per person, my husband and chose One WTC, why because the simple fact that this building symbolizing freedom and that we will not be silenced or afraid! We as Americans will prevail. The cost was so worth it and I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting the NYC area. You will not be disappointed.
Wow!. Fantastic views over New York City and New Jersey. We were lucky enough to visit on a beautiful clear sunny day and could see absolutely everything.

Amazing views!. A must to experience whilst in New York. The elevator ride is extremely quick and once at the top you are rewarded with stunning views. The iPad option is a great addition and worth the 15 Dollars.

Phenominal. This is the building which replaced the former World Trade Center destroyed in Sep 2001. This building is 1776 feet tall and the top floor observatory gives you a beautiful view of the entire city of New York and beyond. Definitely worth a visit.

Holiday Trip. Unbelievable! Looking up at the tower is dizzying. They did a great job of making the elevator ride exciting. The views are amazing. We had a drink at the restaurant and something to eat. The trip is not cheap, bring your wallet, when we paid for our meal they had added the tip to the bill, when we spoke to someone about this they said it's their policy. I think I should be able to pay whatever tip I want. Overall a wonderful time.

Stunning views. Well worth a visit, the views of New York from the 100th floor are breathtaking. Arrived without a ticket and went up within 15 - 20 minutes. The lift up was great too, showing New York throughout history.Recommended

A very high vantage point to see all of Manhattan plus surrounding area.. At 102 stories high, it is the highest point in Manhattan. Very nice experience with food and beverage facilities. Uses 2 floors of the tower and they have people able to explain, help take your pictures and souvenirs. Bathroom available as well.

Sell, sell, sell, buy buy buy. VERY commercial. Want you to spend more money on a iPad viewer and pictures in front of a green screen. Staff friendly, visitors rude. Who ever decided to put the HVAC equipment at the base of the windows for people to use as seats and then sit in the same spot and not let anyone else near the window should have known better.

Everyone should experience it at least once.. The elevator ride up was neat because it took through time as you went up. The view was what you imagine the view from an observatory would be. They have (for additional money) an application that can explain what you're looking at in the city. It also gives you background information about the site. There's a restaurant with a bar at the top and a cafe, all of which a on the pricey side.

Total Ripoff!. My wife and I visited on a Saturday afternoon and were extremely disappointed and felt ripped off. Like other NYC attractions there were long lines, high costs, and many sales pitches. However, compared to other attractions, the upsells here are designed to prevent and impede you. For example, the cheesy group picture and interactive tablet pitches are forced upon you after the elevator ride (at two different spots) and you are prevented from bypassing them by the staff. And want a view from the highest level? Be prepared to fork over more money at an overpriced restaurant.Also, while the views of the city are nice, the functionality of how they are accessed is terrible. First, there is no outside deck as compared to other skyscrapers meaning any pictures will be through windows that are smudgy or full of glare. Second, the best/straight ahead views are roped off and are reserved for staff presentations called "City Pulse". Third, there was a structure blocking direct access to the windows that visitors used as a bench. Therefore, most of the windows had people sitting in front of them and you had to reach over them to take pictures or ask them to move. Fourth, the windows were not designed to maximize views and have poles every 5 feet, so it is nearly impossible to get an unobstructed view without putting your camera inches from the glass. I understand the building is an office building, but the space could have been used much better to be transformed into an observatory.If your goal is to take a picture of your group with the NYC skyline, especially the Empire State Building in background, be prepared to be disappointed. It is the equivalent of taking a picture from a window seat of an airplane while landing. Sure the views are nice, but calling this an observatory is a stretch. Having been to the original WTC observation deck, others in NYC, other cities, and other countries, this was by far the worst I have experienced. Yes, the elevator ride was unique, but a time lapse of the development of Manhattan has been done countless times by History Channel, Discovery Channel, etc.Another piece of advice... Paying extra for a "flex time" or "expedited entry" is another rip off. Nobody ever checked what time we had purchased for (and people around us had times all throughout the day) and an expedited ticket only allows you to cut the security line. On the day we were there, the security line was very crowded (to the end of the ropes) and still took less than 10 minutes.Needless to say, even though we visited on a clear day, my wife and I did not enjoy our experience and felt that it was instead a slick money making scheme. We won't be back and have advised friends and relatives to visit other look-outs in the city instead. Such a shame considering what this could be.

Amazing views of new york.. I loved the new one world observatory. If you are going to do one observatory in New York make it this one. found it much better and quieter than the empire state building.

"The Worlds Most famous Arena". This is the tag line at the Madison Square Garden. Nothing much to see from outside, unless you have time to watch you watch the programs. In that case, please check out the program details.

Better than Rockefeller - finally. For years I believed, that the view from Rockefeller over Manhatten was the best in Town. And I was right. But since the One World Observatory opened, there is a new way to experience New York from the birds eye perspective. It's an adventure. Try it out and you will know, what I mean.

Great experince of you are not afraid of heights..... Who doesn't know where you were on 9/11; the story of heroes and heroins trying to rescue people, ending op losing their one when the both buidlings came down?Today we were at the memorial and the new tower, at the observatory. It was awesome to see New York in day light, turning to night (from appr 16:00 pm to 17:30 am. Worthwhile to say the least. A must do.The large amount of security measures are a bit tiresome but very usefull when you forgot to take your wallet when going through the Xray entrance..... as i did. The security manager and his people did a great job. Kept their ease and nerves (where I was really nervous losing a lot of money) and we did manage to get things back. Thanks people!

Stunning views of Manhattan and surroundings. One of the newest top attractions in the city, the One World Observatory is definitely a must see! We've been there on the second day it was opened to the public! Make sure you get your tickets beforehand online to avoid massive lines.

It's a long way up!. Purchased tickets on the day, went up on a Saturday in December queues weren't too bad. Once we got to the lift up we were pleasantly surprised at the graphics shown in the lift. Once we got to the top it's a cracking view and all in all good value for what is an expensive city to do things in.

Just had to do it. Yes it can be expensive taking an entire family up but if you're taking a trip to NYC and planning to spend any time doing the sights and enjoying the food just prepare ahead of time to spend the money to enjoy the sights you may never get an opportunity to see again. My only other trip to NYC was pre 9/11 and on the day I visited the towers the observation deck was closed for a private party ... at the time I thought nothing of it thinking one day I'd return and see it then ... instead everything changed that one tragic day and when I returned with my family there was NO WAY we weren't going up. Perhaps the most difficult thing to figure out is when to go up ... we had a mixture of weather days while in town and went up on a fairly clear day. However at the time we went up the fall sun was already pretty low on the horizon and it took away from the view towards the Statue of Liberty and made taking photos in that direction equally trying (at least with my basic iPhone 5s camera). Of course if you're going to see this tower you'll probably check out the 9/11 memorial too and that is so nicely done ... we did it afterwards frankly because my youngest is already not that fond of heights and I didn't want her thinking too much about what happened that day while up at the observatory. On a side note ... if you haven't seen the documentary Man on a Wire or the movie The Walk I'd highly recommend seeing at least one before you go see the observatory ... then while up in the observatory imagine what it would be like to step off onto a wire to walk away from the tower ... then once you're back on the ground go see the memorial and position yourself in the area where you'd have to travel from one tower to the next all on just a wire at the height you were just up at.

Mind Blowing. Just got back to the UK after a week in New York. Did all the tourist stuff as well as the not so tourist. This however was the highlight for me. One of the very few things in life to leave me speechless and a little emotional. We planned to do the Empire State and the Top Of The Rock as well as this. We did the Empire State the night before this and glad we did as it was great to see the city at night, all lit up. However we couldn't see the point of going up the Rock after this so didn't bother. You will read on other reviews about the elevator ride, and it really was enjoyable and very clever. When you get to the top, you then get to watch a short film on a big wall. What happened at the end of the film left me gobsmacked as I wasn't expecting it. Awe inspiring. I had a GoPro camera attached to my head and my only regret is that I had turned it off before the elevator ride back down, as this was just as enjoyable.It was a beautiful day when we went up and the 360 views of the city were incredible. It was 10am and no lines at all, went straight in and straight up. I didn't spend the extra 15 dollars on the tablets at the top as I couldn't see the point, so can't really comment. If you are visiting New York then this is a real must see.

Be sure to see this with the Memorial. Better view that Empire State Building...because you get to see the ESB! Also closer view of Statue of Liberty. See this in the day, then go to Top of the Rock at night.

Holiday Weekend Tour 2015. I met some friends in the city for our annual Holiday Tour and we pre purchased tickets for the observatory. I have lived in the city for 5 years and this was one of the best "tourist" attraction I have ever taken any guest to. We went around 3:15 and saw the city by daylight, had reservations at the restaurant where we were served by an awesome Russian waiter(sorry can't remember your name as the drinks were so good lol), great small plates and then were able to see the city lights by night as well. Everything was clean and well organized and we purchased the pictures for mementos...this is a high recommend!
Terrific views. The views were spectacular. Each floor has many things to see and learn about. The food was Okay but the view at the top worth it.

Literally on top of the world!. Visited New York a few years back and saw this building being built so was looking forward to coming back and seeing the finished product. And I wasn't disappointed. The view from the observation deck on the 102nd floor was incredible, absolutely mind blowing. Looking uptown and seeing the Empire State in the distance is a sight to behold. A must do attraction in NYC and great to combine with the 9/11 Museum and memorial pools.

Magnificent. Fantastic viewing from top even though we had fog rolling in, an amazing building, the lift ride to the top is awesome, some 1000 feet in under a minute, the lift car video wall is truly brilliant both going up and coming down, a must see in new York, book tickets on line might save you a bit of hassle when you go there.

Good experience. The view in my opinion was the best of this experience. The elevator rides were a good distraction but all the presentations around it unneccessary. I did find the sentence "the ever changing skyline" very inappropriate in this setting.We bought timed tickets online and did not wait long. (Arrive 15 min before your time approx.) we went at 14:00 on a clear day. Good light, not crazy busy and therefore good photo opportunities and amazing views.

Must See. The elevator ride is worth the price of admission. It is stunning to see the evolution of the city from the 1600's to the present as you ride up. This is a great way to view the skyline and of course is a wonderful memorial to the victims of 9/11. Very inspiring and thoughtful.

Awesome. There is nothing that could've prepared me for this. I have been to other sleek tall buildings but nightingale compares to this. I went with my better half for the all day VIP queue (line) jumping ticket and iPad. It Washington The best choice as it allows you to spend the day walking (from SoHo in our case, stopping for coffee and pictures whenever we wanted- without time pressures) also it helps you plan for the best weather. Went up 1 hour before dusk and must've stayed for 2 hours taking a huge collection of pics. The lift and initial video are incomparable - I refuse to give spoilers here- 3 words of advice : don't miss it.

First time. We went one day but were turned away due to low visibility. Went back the next day and the entire visit was truly spectacular. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting New York for people of any age.

Great Observatory. I had the chance to be in the Twin Towers Observatory and this one brings nice memories. I recommend you buy tickets online to avoid the long line to buy them in place. The elevator takes you 102 floors high in a few seconds. The first short movie is nice with a great surprise at the end. You can rent a tablet for $15 with cool and interactive information. The views are great. Strongly recommend it.

Fantastic View - Top of the World. The views from the top are amazing. We bought the VIP tickets and they were well worth the price! We were shuffled to the front of all lines. We stopped for a glass of champagne and some nibbles too, pricey, but well worth it!!!

Stunning views. This is a very modern take on the classic skyscraper viewing experience. The elevator ride up has been converted into a mini movie experience that is very enjoyable. The viewing gallery itself is laid out well and offers amazing views over the NY area. The hi tec gadget they sell you to use ($15) is unreliable so don't bother. Like all NY activities the experience is expensive for a family of 5 but it was memorable.

Same view as when your plane is about to land in a city. With full respect to the height of building and amazing lift which takes you to 102 floor in 40 seconds, I did not found anything exceptional.Obviously you are very high in the sky but all you see a concrete city under construction/maintenance from top.I think other building like empire state and top of the rock gives a better view because you are at the level of top floors of most of the buildings of NYC.i do respect most of the people rating tis venue as 5 stars and may be the day i visited was little cloudy as i was not able to see times square/empirestate very clearly . There is a see through glass on top floor, but to my disappointment is was a digital display mimicking a see through glass.I actually liked the world trade center fountains (free access to public) more than the paid access to observatory.

Superb and fitting vista of NYC. What a buzz! I visited the World Trade Centre 16 years ago and was delighted to be back at the new build, One World Trade Centre, to visit the newly opened Observatory. It's well worth the visit to take in all that the 'Big Apple' has to offer.Everything has been well thought out and is a fitting tribute to the lives that were lost in the devastation there.The elevator ride is a thrill in itself both up to the 103rd floor and back down again! The views of the city and out to the Statue of Liberty are breathtaking and well worth the visit! This, surely, has to been on EVERYONE'S 'to do' list! Don't miss it!

Very unique experience. Visited as a family of 3 on not so sunny (but yet clear ) day - Friday, Dec 18, 2015There was no line up whatsoever (10.30 am) neither to buy tickets (3 min) nor to get inside (6 min), so we DID not buy tickets in advance, and STANDARD $32 admission tickets were just fine.You may want to use discount code DECCTM to get full price tickets with FREE collectible pin when you buy tickets online in advance (offer valid until Feb 26, 2016)or get a flyer at your hotel lobby (or airport) to redeem at the box office when buying on the spot.One has to pass security check on your way in - put belts, jackets, computers, phones, cameras, etc. on a scanning belt (except shoes)Walls of the elevator on your way up to floor 102 ARE big screens itself, so keep your cameras on! Time up 46-47 sec, at 48 mph.Interactive portable pads (called One World Explorers) (the ones that gives you a short description of selected buildings you would see in each direction from the observatory) are being offered at $15 USD before entering the observation floor. We took one - NOT much of a value, as it features just a handful number of buildings, but choice is yours.Sky portal (look down the streets view) is quite entertaining for a little one as it actually a real-time high-definition footage!Don't forget to claim your pin at the gift shop before going down!Needless to say on you way down elevator's walls are projector screens as well so don't turn your cameras off just yet!Note: One World Explorer operates in 7 languages.

Expensive waste of time..... Rip off. Very disappointing. For $US32 you would expect much more and definitely not try to rent you a tablet for an additional $US14. To top it off you don't even get a chair in the cafeteria to sit on - standing tables only. The Empire State Building is better value and more interesting, even if it is 20 floors shorter. They know how to tell a story. The view is still mindblowing. Also much more romantic. I would suspect One World would also have a good story to tell but they don't even try. The elevator ride in One World is very creative and good fun though. Ascent and descent are even different.

Spectacular view and well executed delivery. A beautiful building and amazing view of everything! A very uplifting experience to do after the very poignant visit to the 9/11 Memorial Museum. Get tickets in advance and you can bypass the long lines. Most amazing elevator ride ever!

Show-stopping views, a full 360 degrees. Better than the Empire State and just ahead of Top of the Rock ( Rockerfeller Centre).Very efficient timed ticket arrangements, advisable to book on line in advance.Fabulous advance show, which you would miss if you take the express option. I cannot say more as it spoil your surprises.Compared with Rock you are indoors, and you see less of Central Park but more of the Statue of Liberty and shoreline.Food and shops available at the 100th floor. Stay as long as you like, great value.

Fantastic Experience. We pre booked this one - which is definitely a good idea!Really smooth experience from start to finish.The lifts (elevators) are incredible, both faster than my comprehension but also with a fantastic video playing out on the walls.There are a couple of nice surprises when you get to the top and it goes without saying the views are superb!Simply brilliant.

Great experience ....go there, don't miss it!. We nearly didn't bother going as we had been delayed getting into New York, it was our first evening but we were so pleased that we made the effort. The whole experience from the slightly cinematic lift ride to the enthusiasm of all the staff to the absolutely amazing views (even at night) was just incredible! Tablet viewing and photos obviously cost more but hey, we are only going once!

Amazing Experiance. Visited on Monday 7th December, which was beautiful clear and sunny day.I can definitely recommend this experience, the views are awesome and if you are lucky enough to be there, as we were, on a clear day at sunset, the view of the sunset over the statue of liberty is incredible. This is something I will never forget.

WOW- Breathtaking!. We booked tickets in advance to go up One World Trade Centre on my son's 16th birthday. This was a spectacular attraction. It was a beautiful day and we could see for miles.We didnt bother visiting Empire State after we'd been here.If you only had to visit one place in New York, then dont miss this.

Truly sad. I came here because I thought that it'd be nice to witness what the city has made in order to remember the victims from that horrible attack. However, I was overwhelmingly surprised to see that all they care about is business. It's not the entrance price I'm talking about. Is the whole idea once you're inside. They force you to rent a tablet to have a "better" experience and all. AWFUL!

Fantastic views.....a bit too much Disney. In conjunction with a visit to the 9/11 museum this is a place you have to go to when in New York.The lift ride shows the evolution of Manhattan up to current times.Again once at the top there were a number of presentations which were a bit Disney like.Also the flow pushed you straight into the restaurant if you were not careful.I made use of a pad which showed what was in view when looking out of the windows.At $15 a bit rich on reflection.However there was a great 365 panoramic view at the top and we were lucky to be up there on a beautifully clear day.Well worth a visit and you can spend as long as you like there.Would have been rated excellent just think a bit expensive.

well worth it. Went there to have a look at ground zero and originally didn't plan to go up. But ended up doing as only $30. The view was great and i am so glad we went up. Only downside is the very confusiong queing system outside, still room for improvement there.

Excellent experience. When we arrived we were advised that the visibility was zero. In the short time it took us to get to the top the visibility had improved dramatically. We had some brilliant views. It wasn't overcrowded. There was plenty of opportunity to take photos and the cost was reasonable.

Very good views. Great views from the other end of manhattan. We went around 3.30pm and was minimal queues in the general admission line, however we paid for the fast track ticket so no queues at all through security. Small queue whilst waiting to get into the elevator and again when coming out. When you arrive at the top you have to watch a video which at first you think is unnecessary (just let me see the view!!!!) but at the end of the video the screens raise up revealing the manhattan skyline which is awesome. Essential to do whilst in NYC
World Trade Centre. A very emotional place to visit and perhaps pay respect to those that died on this site. The views are breathtaking, as is the ride to the top. Amazing building.

Breathtaking . Every person must go to see this. It is exquisite and the views are just amazing. It's just remarkable the construction that they did on this building and how beautiful it is. We spent quite a long time there admiring the best city in the World. It can bring tears to your eyes to remember the old buildings, but it brings tears of joy that this new building is one of renewed faith and passion for this great city.

Highly Recommend the Flex pass for an amazing experience instead of just waiting in lines.. The day I chose to this, I found out that all of the tickets during the time I needed were completely sold out. I then ended up buying the Flex pass that would let me in at any time and we didn't have to wait in ANY lines. (The lines are VERY long)From front door to 101st floor it took us approximately 3 minutes. The elevator ride up is not eerie or creepy (I'm claustrophobic) it has video monitors on the walls and it shows the build up of NYC over 100+ years.When you step off the elevator and go to their viewing room for a little New York city talk, from there it's just amazing. After their video and talk you are free to roam around and take in the 360 view of NYC. This should be a must do on a trip here.
Loved it!. We went on a clear day and the view was amazing. Can't recommend it enough! It wasn't very busy either as it's still a relatively new landmark.
Spectacular!. OMG! I can't believe I procrastinated on going here... I mean... A high rise is high rise... Right? Wrong! The location of this building makes it special.
Breathtaking views. One World Observatory is breathtaking. It is so awesome, one cannot explain. Put it on your list if Visiting NYC. All ages will enjoy.
Excellent recovery from tragic event.. Very somber and reflective of the tragic events of that day... so very sad, but the memorial is very fitting and view amazing.
AWESOME!. In an effort to give back and remember, we went to the new One World Observatory and had an amazing experience. New York is awesome.

Mezmerizing. Overall, the experience was incredible. Even the elevator ride up was spectacular as they showed the evolution of the Manhattan landscape over the last several hundred years. Of course the view was unbelievable!!!! I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting New York. I would have given an "excellent" rating but the cost of $32 is absurdly expensive. It seems pretty greedy to me. And when you get to the observation deck, they continue to market and sell other products to make even more money. The locator device should have been included in the $32 but instead they charge an additional $15 for it. Even though it's expensive, it is worth it.

A great experience!. In August 2015, my brother, mother, her partner and I went to New York. There were a lot of sites and landmarks to go to and see, one of them was One World Observatory. Although I was not looking forward to going there, it was really good. As it was built in 2012-2013, there are a lot of big screens and modern technology in the building. For example, when you walk in, there is an enormous screen with a video talking about the collapse of the Twin Towers. Also, in the lift (or elevator as they call it) that takes you to the 102nd floor, the walls are screens. The screens show the New York skyline changing through the years. One World Observatory was built in memory of 9/11 and the Twin Towers collapsing. There is a 360 degree view of New York City where you can see all of the famous buildings such as The Empire State building and The Chrysler building. Also guides are in the observatory telling you about these famous landmarks that you can see. In my opinion, the view was fantastic. I took many photos and will treasure them forever. However, what I did not like about One World Observatory was that there was a lot of security. I understand that there needs to be security because of the terrorist attack that happened there however it did take a long time. To further enhance your experience, you can hire a tablet (like the ones that you get onboard the London Eye but portable) which is very advanced. For example, when you turn the tablet, it shows you what it is pointing at in terms of New York City (e.g. if you are pointing it north of the observatory, you would see the the Empire State building and things in that area). You can also tap on the landmarks to see what they are and to get information about them. It looked really fun to use when the workers showed us and I wanted to get one it however it was $15 to rent which was quite expensive. On the other hand, you could just look in front of you and see the view! One World is great for everyone to visit as it will give them an experience they will never forget. Tourists can see the fantastic view of New York from the highest building in the city. Also they can be educated on 9/11 as One World is a 9/11 memorial after all. If you are going though, allow at least an hour to see the view and browse the merchandise in the shop available. Also, take a camera with lots of storage on it! Jay Mittal, age 12

A must visit place. Had a great experience visiting the top of the World Trade Centre. We were treated wonderfully by all the staff who were very helpful and friendly, being in a wheelchair did not stop me from seeing the views from the top or going around the gift shopHighly recommended place to visit and thank you to all the staff who made us so welcome

Top of the world. We did this amazing ride to the 102nd floor in seconds, it was a real thrill and when we got off we were led to a digital view of New York City then they lifted the screen and there it was the skyline of New York. Words can not express the feeling of seeing this for the first time. Highly recommend this ride to the top.

Amazing building, Amazing views!!!!. What a structure, it looks amazing from the outside and the views from the observation deck are incredible, we were lucky to have a very clear day so you could see for milesOne of the highlights is the time-lapsed CGI video in the lift going up, get you phone or camera on video mode!

You can see for miles!. Make sure you go on a day with good visibility. We were able to change our tickets to the next day when we had bought tickets for a day that turned out rainy and overcast. It was great to see a 360 degree view of the city and the bay.
Amazing . Loved visiting this place. In my opinion miles better than the Empire State. Lines were long but moved quickly. The views are out of this world.
Wow so tall. This is so tall, the views stretch for miles. They also have a glass floor which you can look down in the street. A cafe/restaurant inside to make the most of the view.

Well Worth Your Time!. Experience seeing the sky line of New York from the top down! Several interactive displays along with superb views of the city! This observatory grabs its guests' attention from the first step on the elevator until the return trip to the ground floor. I recommend buying tickets ahead of time or on your Smartphone before getting in line in order to bypass the long lines outside of the building. Lines were almost two hours long on a weekday in October.

Amazing. One World Trade Centre sends the message that we are back and bigger and better. Such a beautiful building and an interesting introduction when you start the tour. I won't give it away but I'd be surprised if almost everyone doesn't gasp in awe! There is a cafe available at the top and the views are amazing. 360* views and you can take your time.

AMAZING!!!!!!!!! must do!!!. Its a little pricey, over 30 bucks for adults BUT IT IS AWESOME!!!! From the historical story elevator ride to th initial view from the top, the place is fantastic!!!!! A must do in NYS!! They are still figuring a few things out- there was no seating anywhere until early this month and the windows create significant glare when photographing. All else awesome!!! fast elevator and very clean and well managed. Very limited wait in lines. Observation deck is enormous so easy to find views!!

Fantastic experience.. From start to finish our visit to OWO was amazing and wonderful. We got the Flex Pass so went about sundown. The entire staff was efficient, helpful and very friendly.The views were unbelievable. To see what's risen from the ashes of 9/11 is inspirational and a testament to the American spirit.Highly recommend this experience.
Amazing view. Beautiful building from the outside. Lifts were amazing and quick. The view is amazing, we got a great day so the view was very clear. A must visit for sure.
WTC Tower. Great experience for me and my 2 sons (12 and 9). We had absolutely no waiting and it was not crowded at all. We did this on a Thursday around 1 pm after 9/11 memorial and lunch.

Fantastic Experience. I had been looking forward to this visit for many years and it was a thrilling and exciting experience. Observation floor is spectacular and the view outstanding. Worth every penny. Would recommend combining with a visit to the 9/11 Museum, which is what we did, for a truly moving experience.

Amazing views. This is a great attraction for all ages. The elevator ride alone is worth the admission price. The views from the top are amazing! Night time gives you unparalleled access to the NYC skyline.
Breathtaking. An unforgettable expieriance i would recomend to everyone who visits New York , just make sure its a clear day for your visit.

Great views and more.... At $32 it is a very pricey but worth it. Fine views but the experience in the lift and at the first stage of the tour as you wait to get to the view is very special (won't give the surprise away).

Great Views but Sobering. Pros: 360 degree views of NYC, Helpful employees who will answer questions and point out landmarks, Gained insight of being in a high rise when 911 occurred and the choices the victims faced.Cons: Expensive.Great experience and views but The Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) offers views of Central Park. Therefore, it is necessary to visit both attractions.

spectacular views, but the windows have a slight green tinge. I've been several times on top of the Empire State Building and Top Of The Rock, so I had to see how the view from the One World Observatory was holding up against the other two. I visited on a clear sunny day in November. Everything was very well organized and going up in the super fast elevators with a virtual projection of the history of the city was a blast. And yes, the views are spectacular, but... you are behind glass, with the inevitable reflections and smears from many hands and noses, whereas on the other two you are standing in the open air. But the biggest disappointment was that the windows have a slightly green tinge, which is fairly normal for reinforced glass, but it means that your pictures all end up looking too green! For someone like me who loves taking pictures with a decent camera, this was not good. It meant spending a good deal of time at home adjusting the colors in a photo editor. You can even see the green tinge on the picture here on Tripadvisor. Besides, I still think the view from the Empire State Building is still superior as you feel more surrounded by the city and it is the only one from which you have a perfect view of the most beautiful building in Manhattan - the Chrysler Building. Top Of The Rock is also very good as you can see Central Park, but don't bother going up there when it's dark, as the park is also dark at night. So if you only have time or money to do one of the three, go for the good old ESB!

Great views. Great views from the 100th floor, although it's all inside and the windows aren't sparkly clean so be careful of your photos!We arrived early and bought tickets on the day, no queues and more or less straight up. Watch out for the obligatory photo, but u can avoid it and the sales pitch for a tablet guide.Compared to Empire State Building it is much more civilised and relaxed with plenty of space.The talks they put on might be interesting but we only listened for 5 minutes.The glass walk way isn't impressive so don't rush for it.If you only do this tall building you won't be disappointed.

WTC 1 vs Empire State Building - which one is worth your money?. One World Observatory on top of the new World Trade Center building could be so much more if they had a little less. A little less used car salesmanship to upsell, a little less Hollywood hype and a little less carnival mid-way on the actual observation deck. Like other reviewers, I do have to say that the views from WTC were amazing (a solid 5) and the elevator rides up and down were outstanding (another solid 5) but the problems occur when you get off the elevator. You are immediately herded like sheep through a series of high pressure upselling events (photos, electronic viewers, etc.) where they make you stop and listen to sales pitches to find out you actually have to go "down" two floors to the observatory. Be the rude visitor and push thru the crowd and the carnival "barkers" if you don't want to wait for these events. Skip the 101st floor altogether unless your hungry (it's a food court) and go down to the 100th floor. Here is where "less" carnival midway should be incorporated. As I mentioned the views are outstanding but the entire time you are on the floor two speakers are playing NYC trivia games on opposite sides of the building. It is distracting especially if, like us, you did the 9-11 Museum first and were still in the somber mood from that experience. On the other side is the Empire State Building (86th floor). Yes it isn't as high but the views are still great. They also have the same series of upselling opportunities (photos, gift shop, etc.) but they do it while you are waiting in line and allow you to respectfully decline and continue on if you don't desire to partake. When you get to the top, there is no pressure to do anything but enjoy the views. Also there is something special about being able to go outside and feel the wind blowing as you look over the edge. So for the money I vote Empire State Building 86th floor (the basic WTC and Empire State Building 86th floor are about the same price).

Amazing views!. One World Trade is a very modern and sophisticated building. The layout was impressive and the views amazing. I didn't care for the sales pitch in a room for the ipad for $15.00. This should be an option. I was impressed with the elevator rise up and the short film. The views are amazing. We visited on a hazy day so skies weren't clear but i could only imagine if they were. Cost was very reasonable and security was on point. Overall a great experience. Make sure you attend on a clear day and purchase your tickets online as it will definitely save you time.

beautiful views. The views at the WTC were fantastic! We bought the advance purchase ticket where we didn't have to wait in the long lines. Once you took the elevator up, it brings you to a small room to see a mini movie of the city and the changing skyline, then you're ushered into a bigger room where you can purchase narrated tours. i did not choose this option. We went to the observation deck and in two different corners were employees explaning various facts of the city based on the portion you were viewing. I will say, the views during sunset were AWESOME!You really only need about 45 minutes. The restaurant was PACKED, but sadly, I found the food to be overpriced (expected) and underwhelming.

Awesome views of Manhattan. Excellent value for money it was either 23 or 33 dollars, can't remember. Once in the observatory there is no pressure to leave and the photo opportunities are awesome. Beat the lines by booking your ticket online and just walking in. You can also purchase tickets in the building but you may have to queue.

Great Views of The City!. Considering the location, this observatory did a great job of mentioning the history but talked a lot about focusing on the good and giving New Yorkers a pinnacle of hope! I think this was extremely well done and the first glance of the view gives you chills! There are view finders available for another $15 which I've never purchased as a local but would be great for out of towners to explain what they're looking at! There's a casual grab and go cafe and seated restaurant also

You can see for miles. Been watching this beautiful building as its risen into the sky and was excited to finally get to go inside . The concourse its self is amazing. We had no queue on the Friday morning we visited. The view was even more breathtaking than I imagined as the weather was great! Could have sat there and looked out all day at that view.

Amazing!. We booked in advance and received a discount using promo code MasterCard Monday.Large queues which are all under control by the staff, you need to be there 15 mins before but will probably wait a while. Then you go downstairs and queue again but once you're in the lift the experience begins!Then you have the video to begin with which is quite overwhelming.Amazing views and although do many people up there, there is always space for good pics. Definitely recommend it, maybe first think in the morning would be a better time as went at 12:15pm.Enjoy!

360 degree view of the city. Make sure you take the time to visit the views are fantastic. You see NYC from a different perspective and it's great fun to look down on the city. Book in advance to avoid the queues and you won't be disappointed.

Ipad review. They offer an Ipad for rent ($15) that is used as a compass to identify landmarks. My husband is very technical and we experienced numerous troubles getting it to work properly. They have people walking around to assist but we still had issues and just gave up. Don't waste your money.

Nice day vs Foggy Day :(. I've been here twice now. Once when clear out and once when foggy. I felt bad that my family spent a lot of money to pre order the tickets, and you could only see very little. They were still excited to be up there, but it was not like experiencing it on a clear day. The elevator ride up is a quick 1 minute! you go 23 mph getting to the top. If you have vertigo (like me) this is testy. Food and drinks at the top are expensive as expected.
Fabulous views of Manhattan. Great views of Manhattan. Visited just before dusk so got to see the city in the light and dark. Amazing views.

Absolutely breathtaking views. It's a somewhat emotional building, listening to the stories of the contractors who worked on building One World Trade. I didn't know anyone who was lost in 9/11, but I definitely found myself tearing up when listening to the recorded stories of the contractors prior to going up.When we reached the top it was absolutely breathtaking. I'd timed my ticket with just before sunset (you should definitely prebook) and this enabled me to see from daylight, through sunset and into dusk as the lights came on across the city. The views over Liberty and Ellis Islands is just outstanding. It was busy being sunset and sometimes had to wait to get a decent spot to get some of those must-have photos. Some great views back up to midtown as well as across Brooklyn and New Jersey.

Must see. You need to go to say been there done that. Elevator ride was insane. 60 seconds from bottom to the top. Ears will feel pressure the whole ride. If you are sensitive to that then you have been warned. You can see so many views from the top.
Amazing!. We loved everything about One World Observatory, from the elevator up, to the surprise view, sunset view and dinner! Highly recommend, worth the money!

Worth the trip just to ride in the elevators!. Take the tour and enjoy the ride to the top. Elevators go 100 floors in 11 seconds! And you'd hardly notice it while riding. We liked the map at the turnstiles that showed where incoming visitors had come from instantaneously as they checked in and enjoyed wandering the circle at the top, finding points of interest on our own. Visitors can rent a guided audio tour in several languages that helps find the names of places in the view. The personnel assisting visitors were passionate about helping and sharing. Good oral presentations by speakers who know what they're talking about. Nice mix of technology and interpersonal talents informing visitors. And just enjoy wandering in the clouds!

Phenomenal Experience Well Worth the Money. My family visited one world observatory this past weekend and despite initial discussions about whether or not we wanted to spend the $100 for the three of us to visit, we decided that it was an opportunity we could not pass up.Simply put, the experience was worth every penny they charge, they ride up is like an amusement park ride and the production value of even waiting in line for the elevator is excellent with video boards and testimonials from the laborers that constructed the new tower.Once you are up at the top the views are better than you could ever imagine and everything was done high end. The atmosphere is beautiful and it appears that no corners were cut.My families biggest take away is how well they do at hiring their staff at OWO. Everyone from the ticket taker to the guides are some of the nicest people we encountered our entire visit to the city. There appears to be a conscious effort to hire quality people with excellent attitudes.We ate lunch at the restaurant at the top of the observatory and enjoyed magnificent views of the entire city. The menu was expensive but I would estimate about a 10% mark up over standard NYC prices. The quality of food was excellent and the views and atmosphere more than offset the premium. (Cocktails were not as great a value as the food, I would guess a 20-25% mark up from standard NY prices).My entire family could not have been more pleased with the experience, I will definitely be headed back again solo sometime so I can spend more time exploring the nuances of the attraction.Highly recommend - PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS ON-LINE AHEAD OF TIME. We breezed through security and did not wait in any line for more than a few minutes. We also went at 11AM and the observatory got much busier as the afternoon went on.
Impresive place!. You can never get tired of looking around when you're on the top of the city, no matter what direction you look at!
What a view...... as you would expect the views are amazing, certainly makes you feet odd looking out and down. The lift is incredible, 102 floors in 43 seconds. Worth a visit.
Too much graphics. It may be the highest, but there was too much video and graphics for me.I preferred the Empire State - more history and access to the outside is what it's all about.
Views!!!. Incredible views of the city and beyond. Presentations by the staff were very nice and they were very helpful after answering questions.
Amaziiiiing. This was one of the most memorable observation decks I have ever been to in the world. My favourite was the graphic video in the elevator showing the evolution of the city

Excellent views. This place is really well designed with special entertainment whilst you're in the lift! The view at the top is amazing, completely different than the Empire State or the Rockefeller building. Really worth it ;)

Fantastic views. We saw this being built on our last trip to New York and it was one of the new things we wanted to do this time. We didn't book tickets in advance as we didn't know what the weather would be like But on our second day the weather was absolutely gorgeous so we went online and booked two tickets. We didn't need to print them out but just show them on our phones to gain entry. The journey both up and down was very smooth an organised. You need to go through security which you need to do in a lot of places so it was very organised and thorough. The views you see are fantastic right over to the statue of liberty and uptown to the Empire state building. We spent quite a while up here just taking it in. We didn't stay until sunset or night time though (we visited at about 1pm) so the day time views were great.
Worth a visit. Iconic building on the site of the original WTC. Spectacular lookiing building and the views are marvellous.

Amazing views . Best part about the whole trip was the elevator up to the observatory. Virtual video of the city throughout the years. You then get to watch a presentation before a reveal of the city view. Breath taking!!

Great views. I had heard fantastic reviews of the One World Observatory & was very excited to see it. Everything was well organized and we got to the top quickly (via repurchased tickets). There was a lot of space and windows for viewing, but the sun shines in very bright & the glass has a very bad glare. I thought we would be able to look down and see the memorial but b/c of the glare, it wasn't possible. The elevator ride was very cool, though! Overall, I'm glad I went, but if you haven't seen some of the other towers/views, I might take that over this.

Most Surreal Experience. My husband and I decided to book this attraction at the last minute and we are beyond happy that we did! Make sure you book an earlier time because after 10:30 the line is very long. If this is your first time visiting the observatory make sure you do the full experience, don't opt for the VIP. The video before you walk into the observatory brought me to tears; I felt so lucky to have visited this building in the wake of 9/11. Once in the observatory, the views were breathtaking!!!! You have to see it to believe it! I would pay $32 any day to relive that experience!!!

It was not blowing my mind. It was nice to visit and it was alittle confusing because they do at the beginning try to get you to use the ipad and you really dont know whats going on until you are cornered for it. I walked pass that because I saw no need for it. Sounds like you had to pay for it. The next step is they lead you right in to taking pictures and we didnt need that either. We just wanted to see the sites and some reason was not that spectacular as we were hoping. No information on the building of the building or anything. Just look out the window. Take pictures and just relax there. Dont buy food there. I bought Grill cheese sandwiches and it cost me over $40 to with drinks. outragious. As well as they charge you for a tip. You have to select the required tip to give them. It is not an option to not give a tip. Especially if you get your own food. Double outrageous. We were there for only about 45mins. The best place to really go is the 911 museum just outside near the foot prints. If you experienced that that day, there is no holding back tears. It is filled with everything of that day. That I highly recommend.

Breathtaking. This was the best $32 spent during this years visit to New York. From the moment you step inside the building until you descend back down in the lift it just takes your breath away. The moment the screen goes up to reveal the view is amazing. I will definitely be returning for another look. Out of the buildings (Rockerfeller, Empire State) this is the best by far.

Good when we went. Having been to the Empire State Building a few years go, I was looking forward to this. Got there at 7pm expecting a wait, but there was none. The elevator ride up was cool. Got up to the top and was swamped by employees. Watched the cheesy movie and then the view. That was ok, but herded us out quickly. Had to sit for a sales pitch, WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THAT. If I pay $32 per person to go up, I do not want to sit for a 5 minute sales pitch on how to spend more money. The view was nice, but not as good as Empire State Building. Glass walls reflect everything, and fortunitly it wasnt busy but hearing from others it is hard to get a view on a busy day. The information kiosk people was a nice touch. Overall, I feel like this was a good idea gone commercialized. Everywhere they wanted you to buy more stuff. Was fine for the first time, but wont be coming back. Rather do the Empire or Rock instead.
Wonderful service . Stephanie in the restaurant at One World is fantastic even on a cloudy day. So appreciative of great customer service.

IT WAS AWESOME!. It was a fabulous view of NYC--I don't usually get this far downtown when I'm in New York, but it was well worth the taxi ride and the wait in line. It was a little bit hazy on Saturday morning, December 12, 2015, but the view was ":forever" as you advertise. I only wish we could have stayed longer and eaten lunch there, but the observation deck closed at 1:00 pm Then we went to Trinity Church, Wall Street, and uptown to see the Christmas decorations at Rockefeller Center and Saks Fifth Avenue. The crowds were unbelievable!

360 degree view. The elevator ride to the 102 floor is amazing. The progression of NYC is a wonderful show to the top in less than a minute. Once you get to the top you have an amazing 360 degree view of Manhattan and surrounding areas. This was truely a wonderful experience.

Incredible. Period.. You MUST do this when visiting NYC. We weren't sure if it was going to be worth the $30+ to see it, but you have no idea how much you get for that price. It is far more than just a view. They have turned this into a full experience and it is incredible. Go around sunset so you can see the sunset over the Statue of Liberty and then watch the city come to life under your feet. The views of New York City at night are jaw dropping. Also went to the restaurant and it was very good. MUST do this. You'll be happy you did.

Spectacular View of Manhattan. We visited the "Freedom Tower" with great expectations which were fulfilled. The waiting time to gain entrance is not lengthy, bearing in mind that one has to go through a thorough security check. What amazed us was the fact that the security check is carried out once you are actually in the building. Surely this should be done before entry?The elevator ride to floor 102 is super quick and once you reach this level and exit you experience a virtual tour of what you will see in a short while.The 360 degree view is spectacular, with Manhattan, the other boroughs of New York and New Jersey spread out below. We were fortunate that the weather was clear and we could genuinely "see forever". In fact the curvature of the earth is visible in the distance. There is an eatery and gift shop for the convenience of visitors.A worthwhile visit which can be followed up by a visit to the World Trade Center Museum and Memorial.

The search for more money?. We were excited - we were going to visit "ground Zero" - a terrible yet fascinating and significant part of today's American History and culture. I visited the Towers when they stood tall and proud, Windows of the World restaurant - Excellent Food with a wonderful view. I also visited after the tragedy of 9/11 the devastation and sadness was horrific. Now I was on my way once again to see the Memorial and the new -Freedom Tower.The memorial, the pools, the grounds are fantastic. Dignified, solemn and memorable. After some reflection and silence, off we went to see One World Observatory.I opted for the upgrade to express entry which for about 60% more than general admission allows you to enter a special line which cuts down significantly on the wait to get to the top of the building where the observation deck is located. The elevator ride is fast - very fast and on the way to floor 102 the walls show a video representation of how times have changed - from around the 1500's to present day NYC. Impressive but very fast. Arriving at the 102 floor you are greeted by a sales presentation about how to rent, for a fee, an iPad that will "..significantly improve your viewing experience." After the sales presentation (You are still not able to see out the observatory windows), you are shuffled into another area where your photo will be taken to again improve your experience and provide a memory of the visit. This photo can be viewed - and purchased - upon leaving the observatory. You are then released to the gift shop where of course you can purchase items for remembrance etc. ( i remember when the gift shop was at t he exit - now it is at the beginning) Then you are free to see the very excellent views of New York and surrounding areas.All this searching for more money was done in the most courteous and professorial manner - no pushiness, no strong arm - all in good fun - jolly ho! , yet for me? well it was a bit too much. Too crass, too glitzy. Just -- Over Done. I give the view, the staff and the planning four to five stars. I give the experience over all much less.Of course the view was spectacular - how could it not be? Tallest building in the USA, 360 degree view of a fantastic exhilarating city and surrounding cities and a photo op at every turn. By all means do not miss this - just be ready for the $earch.

Final piece of History. This building was last piece of the World Trade Centre experience to visit and what a way to finish. Didn't find the tickets expensive and easy to get. The building is a work of art and those people who were involved should very proud of themselves as they have done what it stands for proud, and I am not even American. The whole experience from the lifts which are so fast your ears pop, are fantastic when the walls tell the story of Manhattan the way up. The views we out of this world especially on a clear day. We had a drink at the bar and what view to have when doing so. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It is a very worth while experience along with the museum. Would highly recommend both to any one visiting NYC.

Overly Commercialized, Best Views Blocked. The whole experience was overly commercialized. I don't want to sit through a 5-minute presentation about the iPad app. I don't want to be presented with a fake picture of the observatory in front of a green screen. I don't want to wait in line at the top of the tower just to sit through a presentation building up to a 'big reveal'. I don't want to exit through the gift shop. I want to just go up the tower to see the views, which were amazing.Also, you blocked off the best views of upper Manhattan with your circle of TV screens that nobody was allowed to walk behind. Why?
Fastest Elevator Ride.. The ride up and the reveal were amazing. However, the reflection from the interior lights at night made it impossible to get good pictures of the city.

Wonderful!. Visited the Observatory and totally enjoyed the experience. The building and the imaging is really awesome. We spent at least an hour on top - just marveling at the views. The elevator ride is so interesting; wish I could have taken it several more times. We did not eat at the restaurant but did purchase a few items from the shop. Highly recommend taking the ride to the top!
Spectacular. What a great ride. The elevator is extremely fast and high tech. The View is amazing. Not cheap but a must see.

The best view of New York City skyline!. This is a "must-see" for anyone visiting New York City. The view on the walls inside the elevator going up and down are awesome. The view from the observation level is hard to believe. You don't have to go outside to enjoy the view, like you do on the Empire State building. The large windows give an awesome panoramic view of New York and New Jersey. This is well worth the cost, but make sure you get your tickets on line in advance. They sell out quickly and are not usually available at the tower. Make sure you get there at least 15 minutes before your scheduled time. If you are late, you probably won't be able to get in.
Fantastic Views !. I previously visited WTC before 9/11 ad the views from there were amazing. One World Observatory is equally good

Impressive staging. Nice views of Manhattan. Not sure whether I prefer the 'outside' experience you get at the Empire State or not but either way the staging was impressive. Predictable upsell at the top for $15.00 for an interactive IPAD loaner for your visit pointing out the points of interest which I felt was unnecessary given the cost of your visit already hence the loss of one star.the elevator ride up and down was good and a surprising addition.

fantastic. Went on Monday 30th November, loved it, views were breathtaking, staff friendly and the Christmas Trees in the foyer were fantastic, the lift experience was the best I have ever seen. Security was quick, seating was available once you were in the viewing area, audio was very good

Amazing Views. Even if you've done the Rockefeller Center or the Empire State Building this observatory is well worth visiting. Being at the opposite end of Manhattan it has a different vantage on the city and its surroundings. The observatory is set up very well in that getting in and out is very efficient and there is lots of space available at the top. The elevator ride itself, which shows a history of Manhattan, is worth the price of the ticket itself. Highly recommended.

Stunning 360 degree views, not cheap but well worth the price. I loved this , the views of Manhattan , New Jersey , Brooklyn , Queens and the rest are amazing , this whole experience is so well planned that large crowds of people move seamlessly through . If I have a tip at all , it is to get there early and share it with fewer people . That's good advice for all NYC tourist honeypot sites . Shorter queues mean a better experience.

A fabulous view on a perfect day. We had just left the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, immediately adjacent to One World Trade Center, and were feeling emotionally drained. We had bought on-line flex tickets to the One World Observatory which let us skip all the lines--there are at least 3 of them--from the ground floor entrance to the Observatory at the top. Good planning because we were not ready to handle the waiting. We zipped from the ground floor to the top in less than a minute, with great visuals projected on the sides of the elevator. On reaching the Observatory entrance, suddenly the walls lifted to reveal a wonderful view. And then we had all the time we wanted to have a meal or wonder around the Observatory, enjoying a view which has become even more spectacular than it was 14+ years ago when the twin towers were still there.
AMAZING VIEWS!!. Went up the freedom tower on my visit to NYC a couple of weeks ago. Excellent views of the city, a must when you are in NY. You can look down on ground zero from the towers.

Amazing. Going to the top is totally worth the money and I don't think they charge too much. Amazing, wonderful views and you can see forever just like they say. The only bad part is the food, don't plan on eating at what they call a restaurant online as there are no chairs and it is the worst, most expensive food I have had in a very long time.

Amazing view of the city but a bit expensive. We went early at around 9:30 and I highly recommend going early. There was almost no wait to purchase tickets and go up. At the observatory it was really a great experience. I recommend it to anyone especially if you are a thrill seeker like me and love heights. Lean on the glass to get a great rush of adrenaline and look down on everything in the city. Go before 10:00 to avoid waits, we left at around noon and it was absolutely full of people waiting in line.

Almost excellent!. This is a very well done attraction from the elevator ride to the amazing view and it gives you impressive bragging rights as well. A few negatives are that the price is a little high. As seniors my wife and I had to pay $30.00 apiece for the standard non VIP minimum price. They give you the opportunity to pay way more (as high as $85.00) if you are not willing to stand in line and consider yourself rich enough.
