Another negative is that all the windows are angled in such a way as to cause the overhead ceiling lights to reflect off the windows onto the photos you take of the majestic views. I mentioned this to one of the guides and he said many people were complaining about that. But on balance, we had a good experience and recommend people do the attraction. Again, the bragging rights are priceless.

Observation Deck. We went to see ground zero and bought tickets at the observation deck and thought we were buying tickets for the whole experience. Very disappointed. Very expensive elevator ride to see a view of the city. Then they want to sell you an I pad tour so you know what you are seeing. Upon exiting I said did we miss the museum and they said no another price down the street is the I think the experience is very misleading and they should have signage as many people felt the same way that they were expecting the whole experience So watch out and know what you are buying. The free look at the sites were very touching.

Disappointed. I will probably be the only traveler who says we wasted our time seeing One World. My photographer husband had determined sunset to be at 4:45, so we had tickets to enter at 4 p.m. We were in line by 3:30. However, due to the crowd, security, and the desire by One World to sell you a souvenir photo and rent you an IPad, we were not at the top until a bit after 5 p.m. Yes, we were in line that long. The view at the top is great, but it didn't "wow" us. Maybe it's because we've been at the top of the Empire State Building, the Eiffel Tower, the Hancock building, etc. If you, too, have traveled to the "top" at other venues, you might also feel that this view is a bit mundane.

I had mistaken this for the 911 Museum but it was worth the $32 mistake. See all of New York and save travel time!. I was with two friends and one from Thailand. We paid $32 thinking it was the 911 Memorial Museum which is $24 but priceless!!!!! My Thai friend wanted to see so many tourist sites in one day. When we got to the top of the building she was satisfied!!! We saw everything! This observatory was magnificent!!! But if you have to make a choice between the 911 Museum go to the 911 Museum but make sure you have plenty of time to pause, read, listen and reflect. But the observatory is awesome. High End restaurant, snacks, great gift shop. This experience was a rush!

Commercialized and very underwhelming. Except the view which is magnificent. Very commercial...they have their own agenda and God help you if you have a question......you can wander for days looking for anyone who can give young correct answer. They mixed up the bridges, no one knew to tell me about alphabet city.....really??? For 32 dollars....keep your money, and spare yourself a bad case of vertigo from the awful elevators!!!
Amazing view. Booked the tickets online. When we arrived this worked in our favour as there was no waiting time for us. Things were very organized. The view is beautiful and amazing.

top of the world. Awesome and well worth the price. from the moment you get into the lift, up to the viewing platform, the pre- viewing video with the surprise rise of the screen to a view of Manhattan is delightful. The viewing deck has a 360 view of the city and it is breathtakingly beautiful... great to do at sunset

Cheesy and poor service. Arrived 15 minutes early as stated on tickets. Waited around for those 15 minutes before being allowed inside. Once inside and in the second line, we were informed that the observation deck was closing at 100 .. we had 1215 tickets that equated to actually getting into the very crowded observation deck (after a total of waiting in six lines to actually get up to the top) at 1245. 15 minutes, we paid for 15 minutes of time before being forced out. There was no mention of the early closing time when we booked the tickets ... What a complete ripoff!!The view is beautiful, everything else about the cheesy elevator ride, artificial bedrock and multiple pushy attempts to get you to spend more money is disgraceful.Save your $. Visit the rock for the views and the respectful, poignant 9/11 museum , but skip this.

Very, very high.. Having been to the top of the original towers I felt obliged to go up the new one. Enjoyed it and had perfect blue sky to see the view. Did not like the graphics in the lift up and down but purely a personal opinion as I am not good with heights. I am sure others would love them.
Great view of the city. Recommend getting the tablet with detailed explanation on buildings, bridges and neghborhoods, better go on a clear sky day
Worth visiting. Worth a visit but compared to the Empire State and Rockefeller all views are from behind glass so not so good for photographs as there is often a reflection.

One World Observatory, New York. When you reach the top of One World Freedom Tower you will be dazzled. The view is breathtaking. Everything is very controlled and organized and I felt safe. I recommend purchasing a ticket prior to your visit due to possible long lines. The flex pass is very convenient if you don't want to commit to a specific time but costs more.

A Must for a Sunny Day. After visiting the 911 Museum, we went up the World Trade Center Observatory. Had been up the original observation deck so had to do this one too. Haunting to look down at the 2 pools of water which marked the footprint of the 2 collapsed towers. They looked so small. Also interesting view of St. Paul's Chapel, one of the few places after Sep 11 where there was a viewing stand to observe the ruins of the World Trade Center. Wish they had better markers for the main sites seen from each window. They charge for the use of iPad type equipment that will narrate what you are looking at. Not sure it is worth it.

Amazing view, great bagels up top and friendly staff. My husband and I loved our experience. I had a delicious bagel overlooking the statue of liberty! We rented the ipads to get the full experience, I thought it was well worth it.

A "must visit" place in New York City. This is an attraction you should visit, both for the view and for the history. Best advice, order tickets in advanced and skip the long line. It is very organized from you enter to you leave the attraction. The elevator to the top shows the development of Manhattan. When on top, the view is fantastic on a clear day.

Your on top of the world and yes, you can see forever and everywhere.. If visiting the financial district, you must bite the bullet and pay the fee to enter and to go to the top. I would not pre order tickets because if the weather is questionable, then its a bust, except for the experience. There is a restaurant on top, but is pricey. We stood in line for about 20 minutes to get tickets, but the line moved well on this particular late Friday morning. Once you are through security, its like a theme park attraction as you progress to the elevator. That's all I am going to say. When the elevator stops and you see a brief slide show, be prepared to be surprised.

Amazing views of the city!. Its rather pricey as it is literally an elevator ride up to 2 floors that you can walk between - on one a restaurant and the next the souvenir shop.The panoramic view however is spectacular and makes this place very special.

I have to say it really disappointing.. I visited NYC before, and tried 2 observatory already (The Empire State building and The Rockefeller building). However, they cannot compare to the freedom tower. I and my friend visit on December 10, 2015, at 4.00 PM so we can get a view of the day and sun set, too bad it's cloudy but still it quite acceptable.They said there will be 3 levels, the first one when you arrive, you will be queueing up waiting for the movie. After the movie end, the screen will rise and show you the view, yes it's really amazing, except you will be told to move forward right away. Not to mention that you have to look through a glass window, which will reflect your surrounding any time you try to take a picture.When you arrive in the next room, they try to convince you for the tablet . Lucky for me that I already read some review so we skip that part. Then you go 1 level down, seriously?, to the mezzanine. You will see one level below, if I remember correctly, they called The discovery level. On the mezzanine they exclude one part to be a dining area. I didn't try that because we have another schedule. I will skip this one.After that we go down to the discovery level. The one where you will have most of the view, except it obstruct by a glass window, again. To me the name of this tower is quite mislead, freedom tower? How can you call it freedom when you need to be inside and cannot go outside. I read that in this level, there will be a sky portal where you can see downstair. And I found it, with totally disappointment. It's not a clear glass you can look through. It's a monitor to project records from the camera around the tower and when we arrive, they were not working!I have to ask the staff if there anything wrong and it take around 20 to get it work and when it work I really disappointed. Let's say when the sky portal work, the sun is already set and we got a night view. If you want to play the view from that camera, at least consider playing the movie from the same time. We got a daytime feed in the night. Seriously? We left shorty after that, compare to the Rockefeller I visit the day before, this is a real mess. Maybe I should go there during the daytime, maybe I should select a sunny day to go to the observatory. i don't know, but I won't recommend that to my friends. It doesn't worth $32 you've spent.

Good but pay extra for the fast pass. Regular ticket will put you in a line that goes on forever. The upgrade price gets you in at the time you reserved. If you can afford to vacation in NYC then dont be cheap when you get there... Like empire state it is worth at least one visit. The view is awesome. But I did not care for the "required sales meeting" upon arrival at the top. Wasn't sure if I was looking at the view or buying a timeshare. Yes there are other people there who will get in your way. The view is intended for you to look, not take professional quality photos with your prepaid cell phone. Loosen up, go with the flow, and enjoy. If you are gonna be a big cry baby then bye Felicia!

Amazing views. After going through security and taking the 30 second lift ride, you arrive at a the observatory where there is a little presentation, then the shutters open and you see the views of New York city. There a 3 levels of the observatory where there is 360 degree views of Manhattan, Brooklyn and New Jersey. I really enjoyed the views and would highly recommend the observatory.

Great view of the city. Went with the express pass so no wait whatsoever, worth the extra $$ in my opinion. Rented one of the iPads, had to recalibrate a couple of times but was great for identifying buildings and staying oriented.
Amazing View. Visited One World Observatory and worth visiting that. Breathtaking and amazing views. One must not skip this obsevatory.

A Must See. Such a great experience and wonderful way to see the city and surrounding area. Make sure you do the ipad rentals - so worth it. And make sure you pay attention to the malls in the elevator as you ride to the top. We bought tickets ahead of time online and it was super easy getting in and thru security. This was a favorite of our trip!

Cool to do... once. One of the most fun things on the 'tour' is the video timeline that is shown on the electronic screen walls of the elevator as you ascend to the top of the building, so try to be in an elevator that's not too crowded and position yourself to be able to watch. The iPad rental thing hard sell at the top is a complete waste of money. It is supposed to tell you all the places you are looking at when you point it out the window, but it only has a limited number of buildings programmed in. There is no external component at all, so even on the most gorgeous day you can't go outside, you are always confined indoors. I'd probably not do it again but I'm glad I did it once.

Breathtaking. Let me start with the elevator ride up, it took only a few seconds to get to the top. As for walking through the exhibits it was very emotional. The 360 view of the city from the observatory was simply breathtaking. Visiting the World Trade Center is a must in u are in NYC .
Amazing. It really has the best views in the city, you've got to see it, from the moment you're in the elevator, brilliant!! The bar & restaurant is great too

Awesome!. We had weekday flex tickets which gave you VIP access, from the lift ride up you know its going to be a great experience.Stunning views from the observation deck can highly recommend a visit.

The best views of New York.. I was very emotional visiting here. I found it hard to imagine the horror of 9/11. Saying that it is a lovely memorial to 9/11, and the views are spectacular. The view from the top after the video imaging is mind blowing. Lovely approachable staff. Very professional security conscious staff. An absolute must.

LOVE IT!!!. The theme is "See Forever" and you really can see forever. The whole presentation from beginning to end is fantastic. I would encourage anyone that is visiting NY to go to One World Observatory. The trip up to the top in the video elevator reminded me of the elevator in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Book. After arriving at the Observatory, there is so much to keep you occupied. There is a restaurant, a gift area, and guides to explain what you are seeing. It is a wonderful place to visit. I have told all my friends to visit if they are going to NY.
One World Observatory. A great trip to the top. The elevator as a moving timeline, which was very cool. Take time to have a beer or a glass of wine at the restaurant at the top and enjoy the views.
Must see. This is a must see stop when in NYC. It isn't a memorial to 9/11, it's more about the history of the city and its people. It really is amazing!
Well worth a visit. I visited the One World Observatory on my recent visit to NYC. The views are spectacular - this is a well worth going to see if you are in this part of the Citi.

amazing. we visited one world observatory while in NYC. the views are absolutely amazing. we visited it by night and it was fantastic. there is a sign before you enter the lift telling you if you are nervous to close your eyes and face the wall, which was a little alarming, but don't take any notice, it was a perfect ride to the top. and it is so worth it. highly recommend it. the photos are 30 dollars for 2 and you get one by night and one by day. we bought them to have and we are glad that we did. but that's up to the individual visiting.

You can see forever!. The last day of our stay in Dubai. An excellent way to review our visit; able to see each point of interest in relation to this amazing city which never sleeps! Manhattan spread out before us, Hudson and East Rivers, Times Square,Empire State Building, Central Park.......and as night falls the lights come on! We enjoyed a meal in One World Dine, a thoroughly enjoyable experience!!

Highly recommend. Amazing. The way the entire building is set out, from the entrance to the 360 viewing deck is incredible. Staff always around to help, iPads which locate buildings as you are scanning the city are amazing and well worth the $15 price tag. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a truly amazing experience in New York City.

A magnificent structure; most often referred to as The Freedom Tower. This was our first visit to the tower. It is located where the Twin towers once stood. There is a fountain of sorts at the exact location of one of the towers. In the area there is also The 9/11 museum and not too far away is the church where a lot of activity took place on that day. The church is a DO NOT MISS site...a lot of information is available with photos etc. To visit the tower from Grand Central is an easy ride downtown on the #4 subway. I would suggest purchasing tickets on line in case there are long lines at the tower. Tickets are expensive $32 per adult, $30 for Seniors....I had high expectations from all I had read about the tower. As you enter the hallway you see scenes from the building of the tower but often you are missing what is being said because you are walking. The tower was basically an expensive elevator ride up to the 103rd floor to view the harbor and the city. It is an inside elevator with a superimposed photo of the outdoors....Once at the top you can walk around the entire area and have great views. There is a sit down restaurant which you might need reservations for. There is also a snack area serving pretzels, brownies, cake etc and a bit further on you can get a drink, yogurt, slice of pizza etc. There were 3 of us and we had a pretzel, a brownie and a pastry and 2 waters for @ $40. Nothing is inexpensive here.

Great experience. Sadly, our trip was spoiled by the weather on the day that we had booked to attend, having to book in advance was a little annoying, if I had not pre-booked, we would have gone on a different day. That aside, the lift to the observatory and back down are FANTASTIC! So great we did it twice.
Amazing View. Reasonably priced, great venue for a relaxing drink and meal. The presentation and view is amazing. Totally worth it.

A fantastic view. This tour was the highlight of our visit. The view was fantastic. We learned about the city, its history and the people. The attendants are knowledgeable and can answer any question.

worth the money. what a great experience, 360 views of all 5 burros and NJ, get the IPad rental for added reference. you can add the 911 memorial to completer the day. the observation tower will take 1 or 2 hrs. the memorial can take 3+ hrs depending on how much you want to read. if you have left over time walk to Wall Street and take a picture of the bull's testicles.
Amazing experience. Unforgettable views if you get a good weather. New York is beautiful from here. You have to see it....

A must for out of town visitors . Well worth the price of admission. Spectacular views. We didn't use the iPad to pinpoint buildings, but would recommend it if you're coming without a friend who lives here. Will definitely be back!

Simply a 'must do' attraction when visiting New York. 102 floors in a few seconds in an animated lift for a view over an iconic landscape - who could ask for more. The views are simply stunning. We bought the iPad "One World Experience" for $15. To be honest not really worth it.The bar/restaurant up there is a great place to relax after your viewing - the staff are great and the drinks are reallyWe booked las minute online for this while we were in NY after visiting the ground zero memorial (another place you mist visit). You need paper tickets (no mobile tickets) so we needed to find a printer - just in case you do the same. Also weekdays early are less busy.

Up to the sky............ You must go up to experience the view and the sheer quality of this building. Just amazing as is the treatment visitors get before you see the view. Super speed lifts to be enjoyed.....A great building that has come out of an awful event.

Amazing!. When you enter the World Trade Centre you walk along a corridor with a video playing which shows the experiences of the people who contributed to the construction of the tower. It is well worth stopping and listening to this as it shows how emotionally involved the people of New York were to the build, especially those who lost loved ones in 9/11.It takes just 47 seconds to go up 104 floors of World Trade Centre tower and as you ascend the walls depict elements of the build and views you would see at each stage of the build. Extremely effective.When you exit the lift you are made to stand looking at a wall of videos then the wall opens and you see the views for the first time...staggering! You then walk through to the viewing deck and the views over New York are truly amazing.It is well worth pre-booking this attraction.

Bad manners on security check staff and poor CS. My wife has a prostheses because of a hip replacement. She does not speak english very well. The guy was really disgusting, and told her to shut up. Later I went to make a complain to the customer service and they didn't even asked me my name...

Well worth a visit. The elevator takes 47 seconds to transport you to the 101st fllor. Don't miss the history lesson on the way up. The view from the Observatory is fabulous but will depend on the weather conditions on the day. We were lucky, good visibility. We hired an ipad for $15, the theory being that it would help you identify what you are looking at and tell you a hit more about it. Don't know if we were just a bit thick but would recommend you save your 15 bucks and just enjoy the views.

Amazing view on the whole city. The views are absolutely breathtaking. Even the elevator on the way up was exciting, due to a very nicely done show about the history of NYC. We had the luck, to visit on a sunny day without any clouds, so we could see for miles and miles. It lacks a bit of the thrills of the old observatory on the old twin towers, where you had the chance to get outside on the roof. Here you have to stay indoors, but the amazing views make up for that.

Very impressive setup and great view of New York and surroundings. A bit expensive ticket. Nevertheless fast entrance despite of big queues. Nice entry room, impressive elevator (with video walls that drive you into time and height), great view.

Beautiful building & observatory. I was very much affected by the events of 9/11, living in Australia but loving the USA like my own country. It was wonderful to visit the 911 memorial pools & to see the new building standing where the twin towers once were. My only disappointment was the commercialism of it all. I didnt want to smile while I was there. I wanted to remember the victims. I didnt want to be ushered along to take a photo. I wanted some solace whilst viewing the city from atop. My personal view only.

Must see and do! . I have to admit - after experiencing the 9/11 Museum it was a little unnerving going up into the new tower, but we rallied our courage and it was well worth it! The ride is so smooth and fast--you hardly have time to think about how high you're going. You step out to see a little presentation and then they raise up the wall to show you the incredible view. They try to sell you iPads to pinpoint locations for $15. My husband loved using his iPad, but my friends didn't work well. We loved the presenter from Jersey (hope she makes it big someday)! We ate in the One Restaurant and had a wonderful waitress and amazing window table. The food was really good! I wondered how this could rival The Empire State Building (which I love) but it is a great experience!

Awesome experience!. This was an amazingly organized, welcoming, and captivating experience! My friends and I visited in December 2015 and had a great time from the moment we arrived at the Freedom Tower! We enjoyed the welcoming and informative staff to the trip to the 102nd floor where the indoor observatory deck provided an captivating 360 view of the NYC shoreline. I would definitely return with my family in the future.

Stunning Views.. Very well organised attraction. There are iPads you can hire that will pinpoint all the different landmarks for you, but you don't need them on a clear day as everything is visible to you. There is a short video presentation before you go on to the viewing area and the end of it is so cool it will take your breath away.

World Trade Center sunset and night time visit. We visited the WTC observatory choosing the sunset pass (no waiting in line) which allowed us to view the skyline at sunset (there was a winter smog inversion) and then see the city change to night time. Pretty cool, and worth the price to not stand in line, but pricey as Gen Admin tic's were $32 and these were $59 each. The line looked like you may be standing there for a while, 1-2 hours. Views of the city are great, and just being down in that area is wonderful to see what's been done with buildings, pools, etc . . .Warning: lots of construction going on.

Ms west. Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous! A must if you are in New York, I did purchase the vip ticket at 54 dollars, but this meant I didn't have to wait in line, went straight up, which suited me. The lift ride is a big thumbs up, along with the see forever theatre, we went in December, at around 3.30, so we saw day, sunset and night views, didn't bother hiring the iPad for 15 dollars, didn't see the need, it all self explanatory.

Unbelievable experience!. We decided to visit this attraction because of the wonderful weather and temperatures. Oh my, how amazing the elevator ride was....the pictures, the information, the views and just the fact of where we were and what had transpired...You will not regret visiting this amazing place. Ask questions and take it all in....beautiful!!!!
Oh Wow! What a view!. Don't miss this. The entire experience has been well planned and breath taking! Make sure you visit. Don't bother getting the iPad though.

It's expensive, but worth it!. It's expensive - over $90 for three of us - but the views are amazing, as are the presentations. You have to hand it to the Americans - they know how to put on a good show.

So well done!. The whole experience of going here is so well organized, interesting and worth every penny and worth every minute. I've been a few times now and never get tired of seeing the views and the presentation of the short movie before going on into the observation area. Well well done!

Very nice visit to New WTC. A must place to visit when downtown Manhattan. Combine it with a visit to WTC museum. Very cool "video-show" inside the elevators on the way up (and down from) to the observatory deck, and then an as well spectacular show outside elevator - prior to opening the curtains.... hard to describe, must experience it!

One World. Superb experience, professionally operated. No touts outside trying to sell you tickets. From start to finish very enjoyable, visited Ground Zero Park at base of One World, a humbling and calming experience reading the names of victims of 911. Once in the building it was through security which was quick , straight into a very fast lift, though no idea of the speed you are ascending, step out to a quick video presentation, blinds open and there is NYC, down a few steps to Observatory Deck and able to walk right around building. Stunning views of NYC and miles around, very much recommended.

One Word - SPECTACULAR. OK so its the newest Observatory for New York's skyline, but it's undoubtedly the best. Very well thought through and breathtaking in its presentationMake sure you pay the extra $15 for the interactive iPad once you're about to enter the observatory deck- as you'll be able to take your own time. Oh and you'll need only one iPad per 'party'Dwell a little while afterwards in the bar-not mile high prices but a little longer for a priceless view

Fantastic view. Not only is the view as fantastic as you would expect,and you don’t have to book even though they say you do. What is astounding is the photo wall effect in the lift up to the 100th floor. When you get to the top you have to grit your teeth through the US type Schmaltz, but the view is worth it.

Breathtaking landmark. An historic, beautiful, sad, patriotic, proud landmark that all American's should see and pay homage to. The architecture and the views are just phenomenal. Go to the top, grab a libation at the bar and sit on the edge and just look out onto the world, the statue of liberty and the footprints of the WTC. Never forget.

Awesome... !!. This building takes your breath away. Whether its from a distance, staring up at it from the ground, or the moment the screens go up and you're stood 100 storeys up, looking out over the Hudson, it is the perfect tribute to 911. The panoramic views are simply amazing. Wow. While you're up there, try a couple of the fantastic cocktails at the One World Restaurant. It would be rude not to !

Best views of Manhatten and surrounding boroughs!. We didn't prebook but got there at 9am so got in by paying on the door ( when we came out the lines were long so you probably want to pre-book!). Totally amazing views (and nice reveal at the top of the escalators!) on a clear day. Like any tourist spot they do try to get you to spend more money on stuff like group photos, and a tablet device to act as a map of what you are looking at. We just wanted to take our own pics so by passed all that stuff. Nice little store selling souvenirs. I have done Empire state, Top of the rock and now this and this definitely has the best views! I recomment!

Amazing and well done!. Quite simply, a must-visit if in NYC. Much better views than Top of The Rock or Empire State Building. 32 dollars per person, quick moving lines, and a quick elevator to the top. Absolutely spectacular views!! Not much else to say. GO visit!!
Great views. Great views but quite expensive (well this is New York). In October there were no lines at all. Worth visiting once

Great Experence at One World Oberservatory. This was a wonderful experience. Very well organized. There were lines but since your ticket was for a specific time the lines were short (compared to the Empire State Building for example). The elevators were large and provided a really fantastic 360 degree surround movie as you ascend 102 floors to the observatory. The observation area was very spacious with floor to ceiling windows and it goes all the way around the building so you can look in all directions. There are shops and restroom on that level. If you want to hang out for awhile there is a snack bar and a full service sit down restaurant on the floor above - the restaurant had great service, the food was good (soup, salads, a few entrees, and a full bar) the prices were a bit high but so is the restaurant (We had tomato soup $10, steak salad $26). I want to go back and have dinner at sunset!

Good use of time. This is well worth making the time to see. Go to OneWorldObservatory.com and buy the least expensive tickets with a specific timed entry. The walk to the elevator is very informative and you want to have your wits about you as the elevator goes up (which only takes a minute) because the elevator walls give you a multi-century time travel picture of Manhattan over the centuries. The views at the top are wonderful. You can see North, South, east and West very well. There is also food and a gift shop at the top also. You can remain at the top of the Freedom Tower for as long as you would like. We stayed about a half hour. Don't miss the two reflection pool memorials at ground level before or afterwards.

This is a must do if you are in New York. I am not a fan of heights but even I must say this is a great experience, the ride in the elevator is brilliant and different. The view are spectacular. There was a ipad you could hire for an extra $15 to enhance your experience but we didn't do that so we couldn't say if it was worth it or not. Once on the observation deck you are not hurried out so enjoy the views. Coffee shop and souvenir shop also on the observation deck.

Great at sunset!. Went just before sunset and stayed til after the city lit up at night. Definitely best time to go is 3:30 or 3:45 in the winter. All the views you want in about an hour to hour and a half. It's a little on the pricey side at 32 per adult, so get your money's worth! The elevator is probably the coolest thing on there. If you can, put your back against the elevator doors and watch the walls.

Breathtaking. We got up early to go this one, arriving at around 9.30am, which meant there were minimal queues and only small crowds. I would definitely recommend going early.The views, as expected, were breathtaking! The onsite cafe was a nice surprise as we were too early for the full restaurant, however be prepared to pay! A coffee was $6 and a small hotdog the same price, so for three of us we paid $36 for a snack. We then took our food to the tables, only to find no chairs as this is a 'standing only' venue. Our 70 year old mum (who had spent the previous 2 days touring New York sights) found this a struggle.The coffee was very weak and tasteless and the hot dogs nothing special. Despite this, this is still deservedly a 5* venue due to the overall experience.

A must see on any trip to New York.. A wonderful attraction. A wonderful development on what is such a sad location. But they pay tribute to the fallen towers and victims wonderfully with the two pools. Take a moment there. Tickets bought online and printed out, without any fuss or queueing we were at the elevators. Wow and what a trip that is. Amazing that something that is usually as mundane as a lift can be so exciting. At the top, the introduction to the view is pretty awesome. FairPlay to them, they know how to impress. Onto the viewing level proper, it was just breathtaking. Totally worth the entrance fee. We even stopped off for a drink. A drink with the best view in the world: NYC at the start of sunset. A must see on any trip to New York.

Takes your breath away!. Myself and 5 family members went to NYC for the weekend and this was an amazing experience for us all. The tickets are extremely affordable. The adventure started in the elevator and did not disappoint all the way through. An absolute must see when visiting NYC.

One of NYC's greatest view spots. The whole atmosphere outside and inside the building is very futuristic with modern materials and technologies. The elevator's displays are awesome as well as a historic presentation of NYC skyline that takes place right before you get to the observatory. Once you're up, you may enjoy a 360 degree view of the city's skyline. However you have to be a little patient because it gets crowded especially at rush hours but it's nothing to really complain about.
Dont miss it. If you can only make it to one observatory in NY, i'd make it this one. It's a very powerful experience and as a New Yorker, i highly recommend it.

The 360degree view is anazing. Pricey but so worth it. It's a beautiful venue, well run, modern, even Disney-esque in its operation. Do it. And do it early in the day before crowds build. Plus there is the museum and the memorial pools that make the day a solemn remembrance as well as a visual thrill

Nice tour... good view of NYC... A fun tour..... you start by passing through metal detectors and a discussion about the bedrock that NYC is built on and the engineering of the Freedom tower. You are led to elevators which have computer monitors which do a progressive timeline of New York City (how it looked in the 1700s, 1800s, etc). Then you are shown a rather nice two-minute reveal video. They offer (for rent) ipads which will help you identify landmarks. The observation area is fully roundabout and there is a cafeteria and gift shop. The tower itself is not as impressive as the twin towers were.... it needs a friend and it has that sort of blue-grafitti-proof-steel-look that makes it look like a subway station.

Quicker just turning up than pre-book. yes the views are amazing, but for me, feeling the wind on your face and not looking through glass at totr and esb give them the edge, an open section similar to either of the before mentioned would be amazing, maybe It can't be done at this height I don't know. The thing that really was a pain was the queuing, had pre-booked a ticket for 1.45 arrived at 1.25 and was told to come back in 5 mins, in the meantime people who didn't buy there ticket 4 months ago can buy a ticket and walk straight in, when I asked if we could possibly start to que was told no! So eventually we are allowed to que and get in. To que again for security search ( I don't mind this it's essential these days ) we pass security to que again for elevator , eventually we get up top, to que again as soon as get out elevator to watch long wall video thing, we get through that to join another que to have your photo took!! A total pain!! My dad was there and his words were, " they want to cut out the fancy computers and let people see the view, that's why people come not to see some fancy gadgets"

Much better than most observatorys in New York. I had viewed the Empire State Building and it was okay..this is way better- very well done!The price is the same as the other tours- you can take the E train or a 15 dollar taxi ride from around 52nd street.

Spend your time at World Trade Center museum. I felt like we were cattle being herdedI would not do againDo not plan to eat there.3 pages of alcoholic beverages and one page of food.No real menu.Very disappointedThe museum beside it was time better spent
Worth a visit. Definitely in the to do list when visiting New York. Great views of New York, would go again but at night to get a different view of New York.

Beautiful building and a great tour. I won't ruin the surprise at the top, but that, and the elevator ride up were my two favorite parts of the experience. The building is beautiful and offered great views of the city.

Not as good as Top of the Rock.. The fundamental issue here is that the World Trade Center is one of the most important pieces of the NYC skyline. So to look out at Manhattan FROM the World Trade Center can be a mixed bag. While it is cool being at the tallest point in the city, a lot can be said for NOT being at the tallest point, but rather still having taller buildings above you. It really adds to the awe-inspiring view. That said, if you can't make it to Top of the Rock, this is still a great view. You really can't go wrong when you're gazing out at Manhattan!

Amazing architecture and technology. I was blown away by the full video wall inside the elevators on the way up. By far the coolest graphics and animation I have ever seen. The full experience here and views are amazing. I do highly recommend making reservations and if you do the VIP entrance it's great. No wait at all. We went first thing in the morning. When we got to the top we were all of 10 people up there. When we left there were probably 100 - 200. I recommend not missing this opportunity.

Amazing views though not outside like Empire State or Rockefeller Plaza. Terrific elevator with video that takes you from early Manhattan to various stages of development right up to the completion of the 1776 foot spire. Fairly crowded, but great views on a clear day. It is worth the small fee to purchase the device that shows specifically what you are seeing from each vantage point.

Important NCY memorial.. Besides its being of historical significance because of recent events. the building affords a good vies of the city; however the view from the Empire State Building is more interesting.

Bad weather and customer service. We had pre-booked tickets in order to also book a table at One Dine. The day we arrived there were a thick fog and zero visibility from the observation deck. This was our only chance to try out the restaurant during our stay, and to rebook the table we would have to stay for another week.. Obviously not an option. We did enter the observation deck knowing we would not be able to see anything only to enjoy the food. Due to the weather there were hardly any people at all in the building. The elevator is really cool and gives you a quick history lesson in how New York was populated. At the top we were greeted by a salesman telling us that do to the zero visibility they now had a special offer on renting iPads. That way people at least got to see pictures of the view since the windows where closed by fog. We actually thought they would rent these out free, but no - the "special offer" was that you got two iPads for 15 $ instead of 15 $ each... Not exactly a good offer since the general admission costs 32 $ itself.. We got a bit irritated and said no thanks. We went around the deck seeing nothing before we entered the restaurant. The restaurant was great though. Food was good. Prices ok. The waiter was really nice and apologized for the bad weather, but tried to make the best of it for the three groups of people in the restaurant. After the meal he did advise us to talk to customer relations as we got back down. Normally there were helpful and rebooked tickets for people experiencing the same visibility as we did. When we got back down, after spending dollars at tickets, food, souvenirs and pictures, we went to the customer service desk - which was empty. After a while a small hipster arrived. We explained that we had been advised to talk to them because of the weather, and told him we went up because of the restaurant. We then asked if we could reschedule our tickets for the observatory to actually get to see the view as well. He just waived us away and told us that as long as the tickets was scanned we had no rights for new tickets. He was not even interested in hearing us out. We know it's our fault that we used the tickets despite knowing about the weather. But customer service is still customer service. If you can't do anything - that's ok. But this one was just rude.We left right away swearing to never get back. We had the same bad weather conditions at topof the rock the day before, but they re-booked the tickets with no questions asked. We went to Top Of the Rock the next day and got some excellent views.

Can we please ride the Elevator again!. Good idea to purchase your tickets in advance. Lines are long but it is worth the wait. No need to be afraid of heights. The ride to the top is like being at the movies standing up. Job well done America!
Oh the views. Fantastic views of Manhattan and surrounding areas,Elevator ride up is fast and very different, Great time was very enjoyable, Will go back again
One word...GO!. What a fantastic experience. This is run very well from top to bottom ;) and all of the staff were very warm, friendly, and professional.

What a view. A must see when you are visiting. This is taking New York towards another level. What a view, 360 degrees round and you can see the city and his surroundings. We had great weather and then you can see really far. So go and enjoy the view.

absolutely amazing. to see NY from this perspective is awesome. The whole set up is well organized from the time you check in out front. i recommend buying tickets in advance, the place was packed, seemed like a long wait if you didn't have tickets. the elevator ride to the top was amazing. take as long as you want once your up there. souvenirs are very pricey but to be expected. Well worth the money.

Wow. Fabulous views definitely worth a visit. We face timed the children to experience the views. We booked on-line before hand so we were straight through once we had done security. If you want to look at specific locations to find a place there are ipad available. The trip in the lift shows how the landscape of new york has changed over time. It was escalators only to the observatory deck the staff were very helpful and friendly and took me through the back way as I stupidly can't go down escalators. Well done on such a fantastic building.

Presentation is the key. As one who had been up the original WTC , it was important that the new Freedom tower gave people the chance to enjoy the unique vistas of New York from a great height. I felt it can be improved. The ultimate sensation of standing uncovered on top of a tall building has been lost . The observation decks are covered, so people are jostling for the best " selfies." The legacy of the first towers is brief , and much of the space is occupied by pricey souvenirs and dining.

Fun with young kids. We had been following the progress of the building as it was built, and my son was very excited to visit it once the observatory opened. We happened to book our tickets for a day that was very cloudy/rainy. When we got there, the staff warned us there was 0% visibility and offered to move our tickets to another day, We decided to go up anyway, and I'm glad we did! The clouds cleared up almost right away, and it wasn't crowded at all due to the clouds. My son got to really run around and explore. No wait at the restaurant either- though we weren't impressed with that (not at all geared towards children/families, though the views are amazing). Gift shop was overpriced- we found better souvenirs at one of the many nearby gift shops. We opted to purchase the photo they took as well- good way to remember the day. All in all a fun day, and I'm glad we went. Wouldn't go back simply because you see all you need to in one visit.
Amazing !. Nothing live any other obersbatory I've been too. This attraction will amaze you. Worth every dollar it cost. Stunning views

Worth the trip JUST for the elevator ride!!!!. The elevator ride (about a minute) was amazing and I would go again just for that. Pay close attention to the elevator walls. You will see a recreation of a vista before the city was populated and then watch through the years as development occurs. I wish you could buy a video of this because it was fascinating - but goes so quickly. I was totally unprepared for it. Then you arrive at the top - see a short film - and then move to the promenade where you can walk around as much as you want. We were there at night and there is nothing so beautiful as the city lit up. Wonderful time for all. Tickets were $29.99. We waited in line for tickets and picked a time to come back. It was a really cold, windy day so crowds were thin.

Wow!! What a view. Along with exceptional views a great experience all round - the lift is amazing - the presentation was great - use of tablet was very helpful although this is an additional charge - one not to miss!!
Disapointing. Too expensive to visit. Only views of NY through the window. Overcrowded and difficult to access. People are not nice.I would rather go to "Top of thr Rock"

Great "show", nice views. I felt like I was in Disneyland! It was so much fun, we really enjoyed it. The view is great - the observatory is huge so it wasn´t crowded. Go before sunset and wait till it gets dark.
IT IS GONE NOW. It was by far the best.It is gone.If this is the new place.I was up there during construction.On the spheres.It is cool.Though I would have put TWO TOWERS back Up.Not one.

On top of the world, again!. Almost 20 years to the day that we went up the Twin Towers we made the ascent to the top of the Freedom Tower on november 24th. So lucky to have a brilliant clear sunshine day so we could see for miles. Everything at the World Trade site is outstanding, the memorial pools are so touching and the new "wings" sculpture looks very striking. Plenty of space to see all the landmarks though the interactive tablets should be provided as a guide free, as they are at The Shard in London, on a smaller scale. Beautiful building and a beautiful view

Must visit site in nyc. Order fast track tickets online and you'll be up there in 5 minutes or less. Worth the extra money because the regular lines are ridiculous. Make sure you go on a clear day so you can see for miles. Next time I'm trying the restaurant although it reminds me of windows on the world which is sad.

Interesting but not really worth it. Went there in the night. Great lift video and introduction!! View is nice but not that impressive, maybe because not outdoor area… in general it's good but not that good. One tip, buy the slot you wanna go ahead to avoid the queue and waiting in vain.

super views, if a little pricey. Great views of a great city and nice to see Manhattan from this perspective once again- a lot of the usual tourist stuff is also available, which is not everyones cup of tea, from cheesy photos to useful ipad tours...buy carefully what you really need.Good coffee from the restaurant. At the end of the day and if you only have time to do one tower in NYC, stick with Empire State, it is more special. The poignant part is understanding why we have this tower in the first place...

Touching. Visiting here is to pay homage to those who lost their lives during the 911 attacks. Here relatives of those who died visit and reflect. It can be quite emotional. The structure itself is beautiful. You must book online jun advance.

Rising Above!. This is proof of the resilience of the United States. A tribute to the steadfast & strong people who can not be defeated or held down by evil, but will rise up again, proud & strong! The iPads are helpful for viewing the sights from the observation deck. You can tap on a landmark & it will play a video pertaining to that specific location. A beautiful building, inside & out! Skip the restaurant at the top. Over rated & over priced for the meal that we had. Enjoy the views instead!

Stunning Views. I had been to NYC countless times but first time at the new observatory and I was immensely impressed. The 360 degree views were breathtaking and even the elevator rides up and down were amazing. This is the best way to see NYC from above. Only negative is the finger prints on the glass and the glare can hinder photos a bit.

Plan this a first stop. We saw long lines on Friday afternoon and wisely decided not to wait, returning Saturday morning instead. We arrived at 9:30 am and did not need to wait outside. You will wait in lines once inside, but things moved reasonably well. We did get one of the iPads others commented on and I am glad we did, but it is not necessary.

Magnificent. Wow, so exciting. The view was fantastic and the presentation was also very interesting.Be prepared for a surprising elevator ride to the top! (Nothing to be afraid of, but surprising and interesting).

An awesome visit. My wife and I from the U.K. on a return visit to N.Y. wanted to visit the One World Trade Center. To get the best from the visit we surfed the time of sundown on the day we wanted to visit to enable us to see the views in daylight followed by Manhattan at night. We booked the slot on the Internet swiftly and efficiently. This proved to be a great decision and we were delighted, however we had not planned for the bonus. This was a most magnificent sunset.Having seen all the sights we decided to finish the visit with a glass of wine in the comfortable bar/restaurant and were treated to a second bonus. This was having a window seat becoming vacant as we arrived. We sat there in comfort taking in the views for another hour, finishing off what was a truly awesome experience.

Nice attraction even if a bit limited. Having visited the Empire State last time in New York this was a much anticipated visit, especially as we had seen the Tower while it was under construction. It's very easy to find and the cab from mid-town cost us about $20. The queue was efficiently managed although we did have to stand outside in the drizzle for 10-15 minutes. Security check was thorough but not particularly intrusive. The lift the viewing area is incredibly smooth and the prep video helps to build the sense of anticipation. The day we toured was cloudy and patrons were advised of limited views with the offer of re-booking (no refunds!). The cloud did clear and the evening views across the city were spectacular. The staff presentations were very informative and there were very helpful staff on hand to answer individual questions. We rented a tablet ($15) to enhance the viewing information and this is well worth the money. The viewing area while busy was not crowded and there was no need on this occasion to jostle for a viewing space. Perhaps on a better weather day this might not have been the case. The only downside was the intransigence of staff at the souvenir area where they refused to exchange a gift which had been previously purchased as the original receipts were not present but the goods still had the original tags attached. All-in-all well worth a visit for the views of the city.
WOW!. A must. Get a ticket early. What a great view of the city. I'm afraid of heights so wasn't sure if I wanted to do this. It isn't scary, it's beautiful! Go!!!

Very cool!. Great views, the downside is that is not open and you look through the glass... But it is New York so it is beautiful anyhow.. It is new, modern and interesting! When you enter, it shows your country on the map. Worth the visit!
Money. Amazing view from the top, but getting there consists of a handful of money opportunities which annoyed me enormously, ruining the experience. The elevator ride is pretty spectacular too.....
Don't miss it!. From the elevator ride up, to views of a lifetime, this is a must-do event in NYC. Don't miss it, friends!

A Time Travel Experience Worth the Time. We visit NYC once a year or so. This was new and we decided to see what all the advertising was about. Our time in line was minimized because we purchased our tickets on line. Highly recommended way to do this. Enjoyed the time sequence video in the elevators. Amazing how much has happened in such a historically short tie frame. Plenty of views and descriptions to make the trip to the top enjoyable. Good food and shopping opportunities

view of new york. I enjoyed the views. I felt they charged to much for this view. Oh well this is overpriced new york. All the food options were also pricey. $ !0.00 for a grilled cheese sandwich. ouch!

INCREDIBLE VIEWS - Better than Top of the Rock and Empire State Building. We took our boys (ages 13 and 11) to the One World Observatory at sunset. The views are amazing - much better than Top of the Rock and Empire State Building (which we also did). If you only pick one to visit, do this one. The ride to the top is 43 seconds, and they project images of the city from the early days to modern day images/photos during the quick elevator trip up. Then you watch a short video when you arrive before you see the incredible 360 degree views. You can see the entire city, from the Statue of Liberty to Central Park. They also rent Ipads which you can point out the window, and the Ipad tells you what building you are looking at (with history on the building). This is worth the money!!
Amazing Views. Wow, amazing views of New York City. Elevator to the top is so fast and smooth. Best to visit on a clear day.

Amazing !!. A truly amazing experience ! It was a bright clear day for our visit which made the views fantastic. I recommend paying the extra for priority tickets. Bring your camera. It's a must visit when going to New York. Allow a few hours for your visit. I will never forget the visit to the One World Observatory.

Amazing . If you go to New York a visit here has to be top of the list. It was amazing. From stepping into the lift to the amazing view from the top. It's truly breathtaking and no amount of words can describe just how wow it is. A must see indeed.

What a disappointment!. Reasonable wait to get up. Odd elevator ride with video walls, not good for the seasick!Disappointing viewing level! All views obscured by massive window millions....very clumsy and unimpressive engineering...

MUST DO!. An unforgettable experience and an outstanding tribute to all of those impacted by the events of 9/11. I recommend buying tickets in advance, but be prepared to wait in line regardless of being a ticket holder. Prepare for the weather, we waited outside for approximately 45 minutes. Well worth the wait!

Amazing Place to Visit. The lift takes 60 seconds to arrive at the 100th floor !When you reach the viewing area you could not fail to be amazed at the views of New York and the surrounding area. The tower is 1776 ft to the top of the mast. It is a tribute to the people who died after the World Trade Centre twin towers were attacked. The two memorials at ground zero are also a tribute and it is very moving to see all of the names of the victims engraved on the memorials.

Fantastic, highlight of the trip. Wow, you have to see it to believe it!Obtaining the tickets and queing for the experience was a little chaotic to say the least BUT once you get to the top it's breath taking. Definately treat yourself to a drink in the bar, the views are breathtaking, staff very good.

This is a must.. Have visited numerous attractions in New York and this experience is one of the best we have had. The whole experience from start to finish is highly recommended and ensure you stop and have a drink in the bar.

Trying to please too many and pleasing too few. Yes, the view is fantastic if you can get close enough to the windows. The wait in line in the cold for a couple of seniors was awful...45 minutes late. The best part was the bar where one could sit...also has a view if you don't mind paying $16 for a glass of wine. The bartenders were awesome.

Worth Visiting. The views are amazing. We purchased the open vip pass so we can get open arrival time and express lines. We also visited the 911 museum. These two visits along with the memorial pools made for complete experience...

Awesome Views on a Clear Day - worth the lines!. It was cold and windy in the lines outside. However once inside, it was nicer. The lines were long even inside. First for tickets, then security and then the elevators. Hint: If you are short of time, buy the fast track tickets.The elevators are fast and interesting. Keep your video camera ready on the way up.Plan for about two hours. There is a cafeteria on top, so you can eat and linger for longer. Go early or late. Rush is from 11 to 3. You can buy timed tickets on line.

Disappointing. Having been to NYC in 2013 and done a lot of the tourist attractions then we were really looking forward to a trip up the One World Observatory this time, having seen it being built back in 2013The ticket price is very expensive at $32 per adult but I was hopeful the money would be well spent... Unfortunately I was very wrong. There is very little about the tower and history of the trade centre in the downstairs museum (I guess this is covered by the 9/11 memorial museum which we didn't get chance to visit) which was disappointing. The whole experience is very commercialised, guests are made to listen to a pitch for screen rentals to help you look out of the window! ($15!) before being allowed onto the viewing platform and the gift shop is right in the middle of the viewing area.The initial wow factor as the windows open up on arrival soon disappears on the viewing platform. As mentioned by a few other reviewers, it is almost impossible to get any decent pictures of the view, with dirty windows, number of people sitting on the window ledgers and a really bad reflection of the whole interior of the observatory. Certainly not worth wasting precious hours visiting here, when there's the top of the Rock and Empire State building with magnificent views over Manhattan or a trip to Brooklyn for a picture of the Manhattan skylineOnly plus side was the free water fountain

The best view - EVER. This is an absolute must when visiting the city. The lift up shows Manhattan and surrounding areas over time and then when you get to the top, the manner which they reveal the view is absolutely amazing.

Surprisingly serene. So I'm not usually wowed by tall buildings, surely one is much like another? We visited One World on a whim and were lucky enough to walk straight in, Saturday mornings must not agree with New Yorkers? Cannot believe how fast the lift travelled as we hardly felt it move. The whole experience was tastefully done, it wasn't crowded and we didn't feel herded like in some attractions. The staff were all very helpful and polite. The bar was full of diners but staff made space for us and found seats so we could enjoy a cocktail and wow what good cocktails with a view aswell! Would recommend, especially with a cocktail.

GREAT view of entire downtown Manhattan (360 degrees). THIS is a new, epic, and fantastic attraction... with lots of history and nostalgic, and uplifting messages for a better world, better future. LOTS of technological gizmos, attractive views, great modern look. Highly recommend for all NYC travelers!!

Sad and moving. We recently visited The freedom Tower in New York On our previous visits it was being built but we had still visited the eerie siteThe presence you felt all around was obviously sad and regret but am still glad we experienced itTo have traveled up 102 floors in a matter of minutes was absurd. Very smooth but left me feeling it all very clinical. The views were amazing and the whole set up very routine , but unlike The Empire State Building it doesn't have the atmosphere or history and Art Deco Obviously it is built in memory to all the people who died in the tragedy which gives you feelings but of sadness and regret When down by the memorial fountains it does make you catch your berth especially reading all the names of the dead including many unborn children Still a must but mixed feelings experienced

An Amazing Journey. From start to finish, this was a great experience right from the journey in the lift.You have to experience the full journey.Though scared of heights normally, I found this not be a problem.Once on the observation level, thankfully a clear day, the views were tremendous.On a sombre note, as one who had previously visited the top of the original Twin WTC one year prior to the tragedy, this journey was also one of quiet remembrance in honour of the many.Pinching myself of being so fortunate to experience this journey, I sat with my wife for a Cappuccino at the top and glanced around in awe.Not normally a person to purchase photos taken by 'the company', on this occasion I did albeit I would have preferred a background relating the height rather than the building in the background along with the rest of the skyline.

very bad to photograph / reflective windows. The reclections in the windows in the evening are unworthy of discussion, there is also too much light inside . It is impossible to make good pictures. Another visitor, who had seen the view from one of the old Twin Towers was exorbitantly disappointed.

Incredible!. We visited One World Observatory POST 9/11 memorial, for me that should be the way to do any visit to the WTC area. You need to truly appreciate and understand what happened there prior to experiencing what was built in its place.This visit itself was superb from beginning to end, security was painless but necessary, few queues or they were designed in a way that you didn't feel it. I loved that there was an area paying homage to the builders, sometimes forgotten.The views were spectacular, unrivalled. Being a hobby photographer I would have appreciated breaks in the glass like the Empire State and Top of the Rock, as getting decent photographs through glass is difficult. The glass often dirty and covered in hand marks!The only downsides,a visual iPad guide is available and they wanted a non refundable charge to use it, other buildings offer a free Audio guide at least or interactive telescopes (shard) considering the ticket price, I feel this should be factored in. A cafe which was lacking in choice and its staff who reacted very slowly to prepare drinks.Overall...Well worth the visit
best views of the city. Such an amazing view. On a clear day you can see three states. Plenty of opportunities to take photos of the best views of the city.

Must do in NYC! . Wow! This is a must do in NYC! Plan ahead because it's busy on a clear day. The lines were long. The elevator ride to the top is great. It shows a short film of how the city has grown over the past 100 years. It was very cool! Once at the top the views are awesome. You can see for miles and miles. Plus you can have a glass of wine or dinner in the restaurant. Can't wait to go back.

Sunset Visit is Worth It. We visited in the summer and were met with hazy views and many shades of gray. Returning in late November, we booked in advance for sunset time. If you can afford it, we found it worth it to skip to the front of the line and we were on the elevator in minutes. The elevator is very entertaining in itself and that is where things start to go "disney-ish". Once out of the elevator you are forced to watch a boring, movie-like montage on the wall. A Disney strategy I assume, in order to allow more people to empty out of the actual viewing areas. After the movie, you are shepherded to another area where a few guides tried to tell us we had to stand in a circle around them for their "presentation." Knowing we were minutes from sunset and knowing that you DO NOT have to stay and listen, we flew downstairs are were able to just see the sun drop down in a flash of red. We stayed until the lights went on everywhere and it was magical.NOTE: The biggest complaint I have is that there is NO SEATING anywhere outside of the restaurant. As a result, extremely rude people plant themselves on the air vent that unfortunately lines the windows, so when you try to get close for a photo and to admire the view, there are people sitting and perusing their iPhones, completely ignoring that your child is trying to see around them. The fault lies more with the planning--adding a few benches would help the situation. I guess it's intentional and they are trying to get more people up and out and don't want loiterers.

Top of One World, Top Notch Tour. Amazing...was there during Tuesday before Thanksgiving so more people in town. I expected to take a while but I purchased the express pass and felt like I was a VIP. Stepped to the front of the line and was at the top in a matter of minutes from when we arrived. I felt the security was a bit lax but the customer service was great. The elevator ride was wonderful and the opening of the shades for the reveal took my breathe away. I rented the IPAD tour and ended up not using it, it was cumbersome and I kept having to recalculate it. I enjoyed a glass of bubbly at the end and just enjoyed taking it all in and celebrating a milestone birthday.
Bachelorette Trip. this was outstanding!!! it was worth the ticket price and then some. try to go on a clear day! we went on an overcast day and it was still fabulous! the views are stunning!
The best view In the City. Well worth the queuing - this gives you a stunning 360 degree view of New York and is highly recommended

Feeling on Top of the World. Purchased Priority tickets which meant us not having to queue and it was worth it. Staff pleasant and talk overs were very informative. Views stunning and even though you may visit several sky high attractions each view is different and worthwhile. OWO simple the best xxx
Amazing Views. Long lines to go through security, but expected. The movie during the elevator ride was spectacular and once in the observation floor the views didn't disappoint.
Well done!. Maybe it's not so "romantic" like the Empire State building, but it's a very good place to spend one hour of your visit in NYC. It wheather is good the view is dramatic.

Had to be here to witness America's Spirit of resilience!. Having been at the building upon his completion last November, I had to return to visit the observatory to praise the spirit that has built this country and especially this magnificent city! The presentation upon arriving at the 104th floor is divinely made, and the two floors that offer 360° views are exquisite! Definitely a MOST VISIT on your next trip to NYC!

Great view. I enjoyed the spectacular view! Having a 360 degree view is amazing especially on a beautiful day! I was surprised at how many money making attempts you have to navigate through. The crowds can make it a challenge to actually see out of the windows. We purchased tickets ahead of time and they said it would take 90 minutes. After 30 minutes, we had seen all there was to see. Spending money for 90 minutes sounds better than for only 30 minutes. I enjoyed seeing it but I probably wouldn't go back again.

Staffing needs some attention. This was one of our first attractions on our visit and our enthusiasm for the city was very much knocked back into touch after our visit here! Firstly, the building itself is beautiful and the views are fantastic, only the windows make photography a little disappointing. Secondly, on arrival at the tower we asked about whether we could use our city pass and were told it wasn't part of it. No bother - we passed a group of 3 or 4 staff who seemed much more interested in their own conversation than customers, to get half was down the queue and he shouted back by one of them to join a different queue. This young lady looked at us as if we were something she stepped on. So, in the right queue we went, got to the counted to be greeted by the Christmas grinch herself. We asked politely for 2 adult tickets, got no eye context, no smile, no conversation....she then proceeded to bark the price at us in her delightful manner. The price was $64. I placed our first $50 on the counter and was fishing out our other $20 bill, when the grinch barked at us 'I SAID 64 DOLLARS!'. We then had our change and our tickets thrown through the counter at us, with not so much as a thank you. Coming from someone who works in customer services, I was absolutely disgusted by the service we received here and will likely tell others of our experience here.

Poor security ?. Fantastic views and wouldn't miss that when visiting NYC. Was stunned by poor security though. Person manning x ray machine was texting on her phone and chatting to colleagues with her back to the monitor . Most staff were Rude and lacked any focus sadly APART from the staff doing presentation on the actual observation deck. A real sour note after what could and should be a real wow experience

Really well-run and great views. Considering how long it takes to get up the Empire State with its monumental queues, One World Trade was a breeze. Redeemed our pre-booked ticket, next to no queuing, straight through.Impressive display on the walls of the lift on the way up (and down), and the views are obviously great from NYC's tallest building. The grand reveal at the top is pretty breathtaking too, even for someone usually not taken by that sort of thing.Focus tends not to be on 9/11 here but of course the memorial is great to see while you're in the area too.

Loved the "movie" during the elevator ride. Very long line to get through security. And the exhibits you walk through when you first enter didn't interest my kids at all, they just rushed right by. But the elevator ride was interesting - it showed pictures of NYC as it developed through the centuries until the modern day. My advice is don't go on a cloudy day - it's obviously hard to see. Despite the clouds, we were able to get somewhat of a view, and thought it was a worthwhile experience.

Spectacular Views. They offer an iPad device with which to identify the buildings you are looking at. Some of the locations have a "button" to press for detailed information of the site. On a clear day you can see forever....

You won't be disappointed . We booked our tickets prior to our visit to the One World Trade Centre. We live in England and purchased them from the website about 3 months before we visited. The tickets where printable and immediately available.We arrived at the OWT and it was cloudy. Obviously there was nothing we could do about this. We went inside after spending a few moments at the 9/11 memorial. Once inside as we already had our tickets we went down the escalator heading to security. I do think there could be more signs telling you where to go as it was a tad confusing when we got down stairs. We where scanned and pointed to the lifts.The lifts...... are amazing. Make sure you have your camera ready. Once up to floor 102 your guided to the theatre. You stand and watch a short video of the history and then you need to be recording this bit. You will be speachless, that's all I'm saying just be prepared.After this small section your free to wander around the observation deck. It's amazing. A 360° view of the amazing city. We where lucky as it was a clear night by thetimewe had reached thetop. And one of the best sun sets we have ever seen. It was spectacular. You can wander around taking pictures till your hearts content. They have a sky view circle in the middle of the floor, personally I wasn't sure what this was about so I didn't stay on it much. The shop was good for little souvenirs. All round excellent experience. It's just sad to think that this amazing experience has resulted from one of the most tragic events in our life time. In memory of everyone who was affected by the events of 9/11. RIP xxxx

Spectacular views once you finally get to see them.. The views are spectacular, as you would expect from the top of a building this high. It's a bit of a chore getting up to the top as you have first to queue to buy a ticket, then queue again to get in (the tickets are timed). Once inside the building you are herded around Disney Style. The lift/elevator is terrific but you may lose the will to live enduring the 'experience' before you finally make it to the top.

Not the wonderful ambiance of Windows on the World. We had "reservations" for 4:45pm. We stood in line with 4 adults and 4 children for 1 1/2 hours outside. We asked for a refund when we realized the length of the wait and were told there were no refunds. For the 8 of us we had paid $240 so we waited. Once inside the ride up was great. But when we got to the observation area it was so commercialized with souvenirs and rentals of ipads and kiosks etc. it was a real turn off. We remembered the wonderful ambiance of Windows and the World from the original World Trade Center.For the life of me I cant figure out why they bother with "reservations". Granted, it was a busy day, but if you have reservations you should be prepared for the number of people who have reserved a spot. We planned on watching the sunset, but it was long gone by the time we got to the observatory. What if we had had show tickets for the evening? Someone needs to work on the crowd flow.

Great views. We went to the observatory during daylight hours on a clear day and could see for miles. The views are fantastic, though taking photographs isn't that easy as you need to find bits of the glass where there aren't dirty marks, grease etc. The staff didn't seem that friendly and were actually quite rude when we arrived. They often seemed to be standing about in groups chatting amongst themselves instead of welcoming visitors and guiding them through the exhibit, into the lifts etc. The 'City Pulse' exhibits within the observation deck were interesting for tourists and the staff members here seemed more enthusiastic and spoke well about the different parts of city life and culture guided by the audience. There is one hour free wifi available to visitors. There are food outlets and a shop, but as expected these were charging exorbitant prices. All in all, i'd recommend a visit for the fabulous views.

A must-see in NY. We were very much impressed by the awesome view. Definitely a must-see. We had bought the tickets in the internet beforehand which was great. We didn't have to wait a minute. Unfortunately, we had picked a rainy day. It still was great!

Beautiful. Honestly, I liked the views from the Empire State Building better, but One World is still a must see. If you are going to the 911 memorial then add the museum and One World to the list. If you want to really top off the day/evening have dinner at the top of One World.

Not Worth the Money. I don't know who's great idea it was to not make sure there's no glare on the windows, but you basically cannot get a decent picture outside without having reflections of people or glare. Also, there's a step that goes all the way around the windows that people park themselves on forever facing inside - not looking out at the view - so you basically have to lean over people to get a view out of the windows. I'm not impressed. The Top of the Rock and Empire State Building are about a thousand times better.

Meh...just meh.... For those who remember Windows on the World, this "attraction" will never be even a mediocre resemblance to the Original WTC. Frankly, the overpriced elevator ride, obstructed views and half baked presentations are an insult to locals (let alone visitors) "Hey while you're here take a ferry ride to staten island, ride the subway, its cheap only 2.75"...ReallyIf this place wasn't such a blatant money grab for those who were lucky to win the concession bid it would be laughable...35 bucks for a t-shirt!!! This place should be known as W T F, not WTC.HINT to those even thinking about going to this place...save your money, take a helicopter ride over Manhattan instead.

A truly beautiful place with a tragic history. This magnificent place, everyone knows where this one comes from, a tragic past. However, my wife and I had made it a point to take a trip to lower Manhattan, and just...see it. What we found was truly beyond our imaginations. The sheer size of this place mind blowing, but the observation tower inside? You can't believe your eyes! This wraps around the entire 102nd floor and offers unparalleled views of New York in it's entirety! How the building was built, the ride up in the elevator, all of it was fascinating as each piece of it, is a piece of history. The deck itself, shows you unobstructed views in panoramic beauty and there are different stations of displays to explain what your seeing. Also, if you'd like to take home a souvenir you can drop into the gift shop too. It's something I think everyone would enjoy seeing, and the pictures you can take, truly stupendous!

Great views but very commercial. Process to get into the building efficient and staff knowledgeable and friendly. The initial entry after clearing security was fake bedrock and tacky. Great idea, but they should just have had some real bedrock and not make it look like some cheap amusement park attraction. Ride up (and down) in the elevator well done. Once at the top you have to endure a hard sell where they keep you captive in a room and try to convince you to rent iPads which will tell you what you are looking at in the city below when you point them at it. You probably can just walk past it, but they make it look like it is an official part of the tour, and then you realize they are selling you and it is offensive. Right after that one they then line you up for some photo they will try to sell you when you get back to ground level. By then we figured out the hard sell and just told them no and walked past without getting our pictures taken. The observation deck is well done and the views magnificent. There is a "Sky Portal" that is supposed allow you to experience standing on a glass floor and look down to the street below, but it is fake - it is just a video of the street below projected onto a glass circle. Sort of the same amusement park approach. Given the history of the building and the site, with 9/11, etc., it seems like they could have had some exhibit somewhere that addressed all that to some extent. And it really needs to lose the hard sell and Disneyland feel.

Great views, but not a great experience. The views are great, but:1) Long wait: We had reserved tickets for 3:30 pm on Black Friday. Yes it was a holiday weekend, but after arriving at 3:00 pm, we didn't get up to the viewing platform until after 4:30 pm. Too long to wait in my opinion2) Too crowded: I presumed that given the specific time on the ticket that they throttle the number of people up at any one time. Apparently not.
