Great experience and amazing view.... Great experience and amazing view...just don't buy a coffee up there as they charge you $6 which is a bit overpriced even if you consider the location and the $30+ admission fee, however the views are breath-taking and worth a visit if you are in NYC!

Amazing views at One World Trade Center.. My husband David and I really enjoyed this attraction. You get 360 degree views of NYC!!! There was a guy providing an information booth about sites and attraction in NYC. He was terrific! Had a lot of valuable information that really helped us . Only wish there was an outside observatory.

indeed great but still a replacement. worth a visit to see the view , not like the old towers but still an architecture to admire, the observatory is very nice and simple - why is there a reason for a store up there? the building lobby could have been more interesting- book tickets online ahead to skip the long qeues

Top of NYC. We decided to go to the top of the One World Building instead of the Empire State Building because time was limited. I am so glad this was our choice. First the elevator ride is an experience in its self, watching Manhattan grow thru the years to the present was awesome. The views are exceptional. Take advantage of the staff to ask any questions. We did not buy tickets in advance and the wait time was minimal, the lines move quite fast. A must do!!!!

Well Worth A Visit. Amazing views and a fantastic experience. I'd been planning to visit The Observatory as soon as it opened, since coming to NYC in 2012 and it didn't disappoint. From the lift ride up, to hearing from the people who were involved in the building of this great place, and then the stunning panoramic views of Lower Manhattan. This is a must do attraction.

Great Views ~ Incompetent Staff. Spectacular views.Amazing lift.Over-priced entry.Unnecessary queueing once inside ~ due to staff incompetence.Hard sell of I-pad commentary for 15$ on top of the 35$ entryThen immediately accosted by official photographers who wanted more $Incredibly poor signage to leave the observation deck ~ some might conclude bordering on the unsafe.Need to have staff better trained and less of the patronising Disney approach!

An icon in the skyline. Did not enter the actual building but worth visiting to see and photograph the tallest building in NYC. Being not far from Wall Street, the NYSE etc. this is worth adding to your schedule if visiting NYC
What a view!. the most amazing view of NYC and surrounding areas.....the rich history of the World Trade Center. We consider this a "must do" for anyone going to NYC.

Absolutely a must to visit !. This very modern building is an incredible replacement although about 6 stories less than the originals, as they didn't want history to repeat ! It provided an amazing wow factor after the video depicting the erection of the tower. All is professionally done for this tourism site. A must to visit and differs to Empire State Building.

WTC Museum Tour - really insightful!. Off we went to revisit the TV screens for us on 9/11...the in person visit now was amazing as to detail and moving both in the storytelling side and the humanity of the time....then and now. What we thought then and what we see today. Tour definitely work the reservation and prompt arrival at the Museum for your tour time! Audio earphones allow ambient noise to be muted while focusing on the 45-50 minute tour guide walk. You're seventy feet below street level under the pools of one and two....building size becomes so unbelievable. Two other mini museums while below worth a visit. At times emotions can be too much so you sit and breath for awhile and continue. You must continue....lest we forget.
The ultimate NYC view. Other than the commercial side of this, the fancy promotion and trying to get you to spend more money, this is one of the greatest, if not the greatest views in America.

Breathtaking views of NYC. Brilliant view out over NYC, you can see for miles. On previous visits to the city, I've been up the Empire State and Top of the Rock so it was great to get a different perspective from downtown. Even the lift up is an experience. We booked in advance in our hotel via mobile and had a specific time slot to visit just before 1pm. Hardly any queues and the security process was quick and efficient. We went walked through the bedrock and got into the lifts up in no time. We paid for an iPad guide when we got to the top. I'd really recommend this, the guide wasn't very expensive but really added to the experience. You position the map, it then moves as you turn and shows the points of interest. It does a helicopter fly over to the location so you can get a bit more information and a closer look. We combined this with a visit to the 9/11 memorial which made the trip up the tower much more meaningful especially when you look back down at the memorial pools below. The only downside was it was busy and it was difficult to get to the windows past all the people taking pictures. Not unusual for a tourist hotspot.
Breathtaking . One very simple and short review...... Views are spectacular...... Buy your tickets before you go......but please do go!!!it's amazing :-D

Fantastic experience. Loved the experience and this must be the quickest lift in the world. Great views of Manhattan and the rivers from an awesome building. Film show is brilliant and the iPad that describes all the landmarks is worth the money but just buy one per party and share it out. Well worth a visit.

OWO in Sept. One of the observatory in NY. I can compare with Top of The Rock.. Interactive lift is amazing! Very nice view of Statue of Liberty, great guides describing the area around. If you like new, hightech, modern technology, you will love it. If you want to see NY from Midtown, go to Top of The Rock with the view of Central park, if you like Lower Manhattan and Wall Street, go to OWO!
Up 104 floors in 28 minutes. The new Tower One at the World Trade centre has an observatory that will blow your mind. You must visit it. But please, don't forget to pay your respects at ground zero

Mixed Emotions. This is the 4th time I've been to New York but the 1st time I've visited the One World Observatory, I've always gone to the Empire State Building instead. Unfortunately I wasn't that impressed with the view from the top, don't get me wrong it is a beautiful building but because it at the bottom of Manhattan you don't have a great all round view the way you do with the Empire State which is pretty much bang smack in the middle of the island. There's very strong security checks (understandably) and quite a long tour and information session to get through before you actually get to the top. The lift journey up is impressive as it shows Manhattan being built up over the years but I wont visit the top again, I'll stick to the Empire State.

Great views of New York City, very high-tech elevators. I won't spoil the surprise but this attraction is very imaginative and well thought out. You ascend to the top in what must been one of the most expensive, high-tech elevators ever built, if you visit you'll see what I mean. Great views over Manhattan, Brooklyn and New Jersey and the gift shop has souvenirs that are reasonably priced. Tickets prices are a lot less than Empire State but both observation decks are worth visiting in my opinion if you have the time
Wow!. The elevators take you to the top of One World Trade Center. The panoramic view from 100+ floors is simply spectacular. This is another must do in NYC.

You must go. how could you not go?Book your time slot to save waiting in the ticket line. The lift is brilliant and the view from the top is great 360 view. It's a good place to spot landmarks. Unfortunately it does get crowded. Most photos come out clear although the sun can make them reflect off the glass.
Amazing View. An incredible view and a little educational as well. We had a few appetizers at the bar. A little pricey, but actually pretty good - especially the roasted brussels sprouts.

You can see forever.. We were very lucky with the weather as we had a timed slot of 10.30a.m. Two hours earlier the top half of the building was not visible in the clouds. Entry through security was fast and we were soon on a journey through the bedrock on which the building stands to the amazing lifts (elevators). I won't spoil the surprise, you will just have to go yourself. On the 102nd floor there are information areas, restaurants, restrooms and a good shop. On a clear day you see over 50 miles but at that height the weather will always be an issue but you can change your booking at the box office if the weather is poor.

one world observatory. a full and breath taking experience. from the lift up 102 floors to the excellent restaurant and bar area to take in the full scope of the views all so special. leaving around 8pm to see the pools and names all lit up was a wonderful end to the day
Had to visit . See forever trip visit to One World Observatory was worth the money and time. Breath taking view completed the trip to New York City. Take the trip to see our world!!

Clean, bright, amazing view!. We were told while in line that there was zero visibility and that they would issue tickets for another time. Most of us still went up anyway. After walking around for awhile the sun began to burn away most of the fog and provided a great view of the city below and view beyond. The live presentations were mostly promoting other things to do in NY. The restaurant and gift shop prices were outrageous. I did feel I was mostly on my own without much input from anyone.
Wow what a building. What an impressive building. Its great to see it there towering above ground zero. Worth a visit, be great to see a Two World Trade Center.

Wow........ This building is amazing, that it was born from such a tragedy makes it all the more special.We visited the area having pre booked our tickets intending to spend most of the day exploring.Entrance was smooth and easy at the allotted time and then the lift rocketed us to the 102nd floor, the lift is an adventure in itself with awesome treats both up and down!!On arrival at the top after a short display the view begins and an incredible view it is too. A different perspective from either the Empire State or Rockefeller Tower but a huge 360 panorama. An iPad is available to hire which will help to pick out various landmarks and was well worth the $15Overall this was a great few hours spent getting to know New YorkAnd don't forget to visit the 9/11 Memorial Museum down below and have a walk around Battery Park whilst you are there.

360 Degree Views - Spectacular. On a clear day you can see forever, and that was the case. From the elevator ride, to the sky lobby and then the views! Guides provide NYC history which is very informative. They charge a steep price and then try to get you to 'rent' the iPad for $15 additional. Charging over $30 for admission and then the iPad cost, it's the reason they don't deserve an excellent review.

a must see. Well organised & didn't have to queue for long. The elevator ride to the observation level was fab and the reveal of the view awesome. Definitely worth a visit. The memorial pools lovely too.
Wow!. Fabulous view, brilliant wow factor. Worth not leaving this until the last day as visibility can be low/none, and if so they will honour bookings on later days when it is fine.

WOW what a view!!. YOU CANNOT MISS THAT VIEW! first of all i recommend to purchase tickets via internet (with time of arrival) - that's the way to save some time on Que. the elevator ride to the top is amazing (showing a short film about NY), and off cores, the view from the top floor is absolutely breath taking.

A "must visit" place in New York. If there is one place in New York you must visit , this has to be it. very well organised, I bought my timed ticket online. Airport style security at the entrance lobby. Very good introduction to the history of Manhattan before you go to the elevators. The ride up the observation deck is brilliant, watching the virtual reality development of New York from the swamps to the present day. If you get chance video the floor numbers display, it changes that fast going up. The view from the observation gallery takes your breath away, a all-round view of New York and the Hudson river heading into the distance. Worth every penny to visit here. I got the downtown bus to get here, it pulls up quite near to the entrance, the immediate area is blocked off for obvious reasons. While you are in this area Wall Street is only a short walk away. Will visit again.

Great views, easy visit. I was a little apprehensive because I didn't make an advanced reservation, being unsure of when I'd get there. However, it only took me about 10 minutes from getting into line to getting to the top (using MasterCard, which gives you priority access). I had a beautiful lunch at the top, and it wasn't outrageously expensive, either. The staff were very pleasant, not acting as if it was your privilege to be served.

Spectacular from any angle. This is an impressive building at any angle. A beautiful shining tribute in the skyline. You can't miss this when you see the New York Skyline and you have such a great view of the whole city from the top. I wouldn't want to be a window washer though.

Top of the city. Just the elevator ride is worth the visit. The views are incredible and the guys that makes the N side and S side presentations are excellent in what they do.Although is a bit expensive for an hour attraction you don't get better views that there.

Photographing a really tall building. Here's how to do it. Even if you don't go to the observation deck, you probably want a picture. Best place is from the north tower waterfall. Choose the corner looking directly at OWTC. Set your iPhone to pano. Switch the start pano arrow from left to right. Point your iPhone at the spire and slowly move downwards until you capture the pool and memorial banister right in front of you. You may need to try several times to keep the building straight in the center. Best time of day is noonish to get most light on the pool, so the dark colors and illuminated strongly.
WOW. My first visit to this wonderful building. The views are awesome!! I loved everything about my visit.

A must do in NYC! . Views were spectacular even on overcast, rainy day. Very well thought out & planned observatory. Even the elevator ride was amazing. The staff was amazing too. Very much enjoyed this experience.
amazing vistas. get a premium ticket and on line and walk directly in! quite a ride up and down and an amazing view. A must do.

To Die For View!. Expensive but you can't go wrong. You have to see it. We had a day flex pass to go anytime of the day we wanted. You have to do this in advance and you bypass every line there is. The Pope was in town on the day we were scheduled to go but were told in advance we could visit between 2-7. We chose sunset to get the view and it was perfect. Give yourself plenty of time to take the elevator up and be there in time to see it all. Gets crowded at the windows to get your pictures but worth it. Breathtaking. So moving to see the memorial pools from the top.

Phenomenal. What an incredible building - the views from the observatory are amazing - far better than the Empire Sate - America must be very proud of it. The lift to the top is an experience and the theatre element is beyond words - This is a must.We booked VIP tickets which enabled us to jump the queue.

In Tribute to those who lost their lives here.. This building is an amazing piece of architecture and a tribute to the many people who lost their lives here on 9/11. It can be seen from many NYC locations. It is truly beautiful.

amazing view. amazing, shouldn't miss it.great view but really expensivethe height is really enormous they have a restaurant and a coffee shop but at the coffee area not enough chairs and tables for the visitors so some people must stand to drink their coffee and eat the Croissant - it's not comfy with small kids and that's a bad point for them.

Nice and Friendly People. The weather was overcast, so you really couldn't see the city, except for a few breaks in the clouds. However, the staff was very friendly and the tone was very upbeat despite the weather. If you go see the 911 Memorial before seeing One World Observatory, your experience will be that much more meaningful. Also, it's worth noting that I hate elevators, but the "in-flight movie" (as I call it) was awesome!

No better way to see the entire city!. We have visited the observation decks of the Empire State Building and the Top of The Rock a number of times but have never had the viewing experience we enjoyed a week ago at the new One World Trade Center. The waiting time was very reasonable, the admission price surprisingly low, the spaciousness of the observation area and the location of a restaurant and lounge adjacent to the viewing area made this a great adventure for us! It was a moving experience to look down and see the footprint pools of the memorial and to reflect without feeling rushed or crowded. We will certainly visit, again.

See Forever... But Avoid The Bar!!. The views from the top are absolutely breath taking and are a must see when in New York. We came here on the day of my daughters 21st and bought tickets about 15mins before our time slot on our phones in order to avoid lines upon arrival. All the staff were lovely to my daughter however when we were in the bar at the top of the trade center although my husband ordered the drinks the bar man refused to serve us although my daughter was wearing a 21 badge. I understand they need ID, however he was disgustingly rude and blunt and we didn't deserve to be spoken to in such a way. However, the day was amazing but just go up to the observation desk, see the fantastic views and avoid the bar!!!

Disappointed. This looked like a great thing to do but I found it too commercial. The staff overhyped the views, pushed renting an iPad and posing for pictures. The vistas to the south are great but the rest of Manhattan is, in my opinion, better seen from mid-town.

Loved the ride in the lift. This was my favourite high building. The ride up in the lift is amazing. I suffer with motion sickness, but I couldn't close my eyes, it is brilliant 102 floors in 1 minute, you're up the top before you're body gets a chance to feel ill.The whole World Trade Center, Tribute and museum I loved.As with all the other tall buildings an awesome view.

Stunning view. We went to the observation deck as it was part of my birthday gift and what a moving thought provoking experience. The views are truly breath taking and the staff were friendly and so helpful.
Must visit. Although it wasn't my most favorite view of the city from the top it is a beautiful buildng. The elevator was amazing, 3D time lapse of the entire construction of One World Trade Center.

Breathtaking views. New York, NY, is by far the most photogenic city in the world. Like a living organism, this great city has an unending repertoire of amazing poses, each one offering a new breathtaking view to its visitor. This is what you feel as you climb up to One World Observatory and take a 360 degree walk to observe the city. The way up is itself a fantastic trip as the walls of the fast elevator are projected with an animation about the settling of the Island of Manhattan. As you get to the top, a short documentary with present day life scenes is projected on drawn curtains which, at the end of the movie, are opened to present the real thing. Then the visitor is free to go round and choose its favorite view. Mine is the one facing East, the Brooklin and the three bridges. Strongly recommended.

Wow.....definite place to visit. One World Observatory is located on top the One World Trade Center. hands down,this is one place that every visitor to New York city must visit.The 360 degree view of the city from Observatory located on floor 100 is just breathtaking and something you do not want to miss. The ride up on the elevator to the tallest building (102 floor) in western hemisphere in less than 60 seconds and than witnessing the story of the city through ages as you go up will be something that you remember for a long time. Dining/food is on 101 floor (but expensive) and there is also a gift shop.You can buy tickets either online or at the site. We bought PRIORITY ticket online which allowed us to expedited VIP entry. It was a 4th of july weekend so the extra cost was worth it.I recommend Standard admission ticket purchase online.Have fun......
Emotional. The experience for me was very emotional, but well worth the visit, the new tower is impressive, likewise both pools and still work going on around the site.

Breathtaking. This would be the highlight of our trip to New York. We took the 6.30 elevator to the top. The ride was too quick to appreciate photos on NY from early days to present. At the top there is a whole wall which is a theatre screen. When the movie finished it vanishes and a big blind goes up to reveal NY city. A big cheer and clap, got a big lump in my throat and brought tears to my eyes. Wonderful. The views are awesome

Breathtaking views of Manhattan. If you are looking to view the beauty of Manhattan and don't mind spending 30+ dollars then One World Observatory is the place to go. First of all you will be inside the tallest building of USA. Tip for the visitor, always select the evening time when the sun has not set yet but will set in an hour. You got to see both day and night views! Watch the opening video carefully, there is a surprise waiting for you. I still get goosebumps!

The Freedom Tower. We went up to the observation platform and yes, the view is worth five stars but what you have to go through to get there is minus two stars, hence the 3 star rating. We were going to eat dinner at the restaurant but you have to get there at 5:30 or earlier to do that, as the building must be cleared out by 8:30??The Empire State Building stays open until 2:00 A.M.!! Not a satisfactory situation!

Beware of going on a cloudy day.. Slick multimedia presentation, but if you went as we did when the clouds were moving in you might be in for a real disappointment. After about five minutes of marginal viewing visibility approached zero. As it was, when we came down they had pretty well shut down the operation, with a limited visibility warning. Would have been a nice gesture if they had handed out free passes for a return visit. We really did feel cheated.

A Memorial and a Tribute. We recently were in NYC during the 9/11 annual memorial event.It reinforced our faith in NYC and America. We watched a moslem woman lay flowers and an Amish choir sing. We saw firefighters from the time offering tribute. There was a really cute NY cop with a bomb sniffing dog chatting up the ladies. The most impressive sight, however, was the magnificent architecture that has risen in the area to replace the original buildings. Well worth a visit at any time.
One spectacular sight. The finished building is such an awesome sight. It can be seen from almost everywhere down town. We loved our time in NY
A must do i think!. 102 floors in 1 minute. Oh my! Unbelievable!. This is a stunning building with a fantastic view from the top.
Amazing. Great experience. Ride up is absolutely amazing. Very well thought. Even if you are afraid of heights it is so quick that you don't feel it.
Wow! The View!. The view from the 102nd floor is amazing! The observation deck provides a 360 degree panorama of the city, the rivers, the bridges, and beyond. Definitely a must-see.
Visit it.. Visit it, go on the Freedom Tower, then the two memorials, astonishing, I was amazed what a great place thew have transformed from the ruins.

Beautiful Building. We visited One World Trade Center before it was open to the public and construction was ongoing. We could actually watch the construction from our hotel room windows. It is a striking building and I am looking forward to visiting when it is open.

See forever! Or 20 miles. This is a great observation point for all of new York's boroughs and New Jersey. We went on an overcast day, so visibility was only about 20-30 miles clear, but it meant absolutely no lines. It is the tallest observation deck in Manhattan, but I believe Rockefeller centre is better as you get to go outside & there's no glass reflecting in your photos. There's lots of space at the top to wander around and see the 360 degree views. You can hire an interactive tour guide viewfinder for $15, these are great if you don't know a lot about the city, way better than the audio tours at Empire State. The elevator ride up was fun, takes you through a visual history on New York. Staff were very helpful here also. Recommend this to anyone visiting Manhattan.

Wonderful Experience and great lunch. Our first trip to the World Trade since the sad demise if the last buildings but it didn't disappoint. From the elevator ride to the 360 degree view, everything was wonderful. The staff were super helpful and everything was well laid out and awesome. We had lunch in the bar and although prices were quite high it was worth it for the lovely food and wonderful views. We would definitely do this again.

The top of the World, WTC One that is!. Great experience. The growth of NYC is shown on the walls of the elevator on the ride up--an amazing experience. Not to mention going 102 floor in less than a minute. And once at the top, the views are remarkable. Be sure to book your tickets online, or on your phone to avoid the wait. You can even do it same day.

Neat Experience . This was my husband's highlight of our trip, the modern architecture & technology, & the incredible views made for a really great experience. We bought tickets online & luckily it was a clear day, we could see for miles. Looking down at the Memorial Pools & remembering why this building is here tugs at your heart, but it reminds you just how resilient Americans, especially New Yorkers, are. Definitely glad we gave it a visit.

One World Observatory. It's a great looking building from the bottom. Going up to the observatory was easy, well organised, the views over Manhattan and New Jersey fantastic. As it is typical for these attractions everything was aimed to get you to spend money, get a photo, buy an app etc, but it's was a fantastic experience.
Nice to see freedom tower. Nice to see freedom tower...replacing one of the twin towers...whenever the sun shines on it the shadow shines on the memorial site. Lovely architecture.

Disappointing visit due to overcrowding and dirty windows. We were ecited to be going here but disappointed afterwards. Far to many people are allowed through at one time. Compulsory video was a drag. But worst was to come with the observation area packed with people hoging the windows doing selfies. The windows were filthy so not good for photos anyway.
Glass. Good design, stands our proudly in Manhattan skyline. Did not get a chance to explore inside though.

Amazing views. We didn't book this however I would certainly recommend booking in advance to avoid the long queues. It is very well organised and a lift takes you straight to the top. You can then spend however long you wish walking around looking at the views. It's amazing and certainly better than any other for the views. The cafe is also reasonably priced for a refreshment whilst taking in the views.

Great elevator ride!!!!. This is the fastest elevator in the world. You ascend 105 stories in seconds and you never feel it. The organization to get up and down is very New York - chaotic. When you arrive the view is spectacular but there are so many spectacular views in NY that I'm not sure the price is worth the effort. Oh and did I mention the security to go up. I lost track but I think we were checked 3 times. Totally ridiculous. The security in NY at attractions is very annoying and mostly unnecessary. You are never sure what they will want you to do.

Too Much of a Hard Press of a Disrespectful Sideshow. The only reason why I chose a rating of three was the spectacular views. No question about it. The views of the City and its environs are stunning. But the entire experience was brought down, and brought down hard by the hard press marketing that is done "Disney" style by the energetic twenty somethings that seem to be everywhere. From the time you buy your ticket, you're being told how wonderful the cafe is. Then when you step off the elevator you are greeted by one of them with a camera for "Trade Center Imaging" where you can pick up your photo after your visit. It's more like stepping off Space Mountain than visiting a landmark that was created out of a sobering respect for all who lost their lives there. In fact, when you get off the elevator, you are dropped off on the level with the cafe where they try to have you rent an iPad for $15 (after already spending $30 for admission) that will identify the buildings you can see from far above. The original Trade Center observatory had all the descriptions of the view for free below each window. Were it not for the views, I would not recommend anyone wasting money on this disrespectful sideshow. I know someone in management will probably respond to this review with some canned response that they are sorry that the Observatory did not meet my expectations. Let me respond directly by saying that my expectations are irrelevant. Given the importance of this site, a more tasteful presentation would have been a good idea.

Fun!. Our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 older teens) enjoyed the experience. $32 each, Buy your tickets online & avoid the lines. Go to the entrance door on the right side in the front of the building and they will scan the tickets off your cell phone. Escalators take you down and then a very entertaining elevator ride takes you up to the observatory. The restaurant was nice. The food is alright, expensive. $100+ for 4. Take your time & enjoy the views. Clean restrooms & gift store upstairs by observatory.
Amazing building. Awe inspiring design and just a mammoth structure. Well worth a visit to this area, combine it with the 9/11 memorial

Beautiful to the eyes, soothing to the soul!. If you're visiting the city, DO NOT miss this! It is a magnificent view and a beautiful tribute to 9/11. It is an epitome of the country and its people's strength. I walk past it almost everyday, but still look at it awestruck every time!P.S.: It's the tallest building in the entire western hemisphere!

Amazing views. Fantastic! The views are amazing and the technology here is something else. Spent a couple of hours here, my grandson loved it. Only bad thing was the staff in the cafe, at least look like you want to be there! Poor miserable service from them, but loved the rest of it

A very sad/quiet place to visit. It is beautiful in its very sad way. A quiet place to sit and walk around. The gift shop has some wonderful coffee table books and the museum there is really something. The water feature is beautiful and so touching because the water flows down and into a deep hole- just like all the poor souls that vanished that day. This is a very American thing to visit.

Fabulous!. Of course, this building represents America's resolve not to be defeated by terrorism. Going up into the tower was an incredible experience. The least expensive ticket was $32 for an adult, but it was worth every penny. One starts, one level below street level, in the bedrock. Read the projections on the rocks to understand this area, and the amount of steel needed to complete this project. From there, one listens to the stories of the people who helped raise this building....all so moving. The elevators then take you to the top of the building, with a projection on the back wall of the elevator. The projection shows a fascinating view of New York from the early 1600s to the present day, and also shows your elevation as you ascend. Once on the main floor, you are shown street views of various neighborhoods in the city which then opens up to the skyline of Manhattan. Just incredible. Unfortunately, this is followed up by the sales pitch for a photo opportunity, and a self-guide so you can understand what you are viewing. Food is available at 3 locations.... the bakery, the sandwich shop or at the sit down restaurant. A sit down meal of a cheeseburger and fries with a coke is about $32 with the 18% tip included. Get to the tower before noon, to avoid most crowds. At least two hours to enjoy it all.

Beautiful views but too much reflection on the windows. I really liked the visit to the top and the views are spectacular, to say the least.One thing I would like to comment upon: lots of people would like to take beautiful pictures from up there, they will bring their Nikons or Canons with them hoping for the perfect time and perfect photo. Well, if you'll do that after sunset, probably all your pictures will have an Exit sign reflected on them or some other light that is switched on as soon as dark comes. So it would be just awesome if you could turn off some of those lights. I understand you need the Exit signs on (that many?), but I don't see the reason for most of the other lights. Most of my pictures have reflexions of some kind and, although the experience was spectacular, what's left of it, not so much.

Great Experience. Booked tickets on line & it was painless. Elevator ride up was fun. View was spectacular. Only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because our lunch at the top was so loud. The view speaks for itself & does not need LOUD announcers on the floor below us. Get rid of them!

See it and experience America. This is a must for all American and visitors alike. When you first enter into the elevators on your rocket ride to the top you are looking a series of hollow grahams and you reach the top, after enter the common area and the curtain goes up you are just beside yourself. I will not give to much information as this must be your own experience and reflection and a line on your bucket list. The only down side is the dysfunctional lines prior to entrance.

order online and save time. great views at the top and a quick ride!! Get your tickets online and you don't have to wait in line!! I saw many people spend hours when done online will save you a halfday

We must not forget. Very moving experience. So beautifully and respectfully done. Easy to follow,one exhibit to another. We are seniors and could not stand on the line for the film. Unfortunately we spoke with the personnel but no accommodations could be made. But this in no way impacted on our positive experience at the memorial. We used the audio guides.

Amazing. This place reminds all of us why America is great. The view is priceless. From a tourist's view, it's difficult to take pictures compared to the Rockefeller Center because of the glass enclosure. But the ending to the introductory video took my breath away.

Nothing spectacular. Though the symbolic representation ( America's Resilience) cannot be undermined in any way, this tower's design is nothing extraordinary esp. when you compare it with some other iconic towers in NYC.Worth a look nevertheless.

Absolutely stunning view. This is one of the coolest attractions in NYC. The price was not bad considering, I would definitely get the iPads, only $15 to rent for the visit and you get a lot more information on landmarks in and around the city. They have a lot of staff wandering around to answer questions, the view is breathtaking, I liked it better than the Empire State Building! Really great day out. 2 x bottles of water and 2 x muffins was $30.00 which is ridiculous but then what do you expect!

Amazing views. Came here at the weekend, the weather was perfect. We could see for miles, the observatory was very impressive and the 360 degree views were amazing. The lift up was very good too, showing how the skyline has changed through the years. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Cool ride up and down. Amazing video during the elevator ride! Went at night and the city never sleeps, definitely very pretty with all the lights. There was a special event that night and the observatory was closed early. We were still able to spend 1hr looking around.

Priority Access, worth every cent. Having been up the Empire State we were not sure whether One World would be worth the cost. 60 seconds after entering the lift that question was answered in the positive. The ride up only takes 60 seconds but they are actioned packed'The experience once up top is not just the stunning view (don't forget your camera), it's a complete package that includes the 911 memorial and stories of the first responders and aftermath.Before booking we looked up the time for sunset and booked Priority Access tickets for 45 minutes prior (6:30 pm on September 25th).The slogan says "you can see forever", well maybe not forever but nearly.One full circuit in full daylight led to the next circuit in half light and the third in sufficient darkness for the lights of NYC and Jersey to take make for some stunning photos.The result was 3 rather differing images.Is it better or worse than the Empire State - no. it is different. Empire State provides a better view of uptown.You can't actually see the park from One World. I am very glad to have done both.

Spectacular. One World Observatory is on the top of the New World Trade Center. The ride up in the elevator provided a unique filmed panoramic view of NYC as it grew for its earliest days to the present. Once in the observatory you can see 360 degrees from the 102nd floor. If you are not very familiar with the city, rent a "ipad" for $15 and it will identify the various structures as you pan it out. You can buy tickets online in advance. If you know the day and time you can be there the cost is lower than if you just know the day. You can also buy tickets at the door if you are willing to wait in line. I found the experience well worth the time. Coming from New Jersey we took the train to Newark station and the the PATH train to the World Trade Center.
great views. Fast elevator, great views. Theatrical presentation. Went at 9:15 AM on a Sunday, very little crowd.

Breathtaking views. One World Tower offers something for everyone. The architecture is quite unique. The history lessons are informative and thoughtfully included. The elevator to the top is the smoothest I've ever been in. Our visit was well worth the money.

Most exciting part of our NYC visit. My husband and I visited One World after a trip over to Ellis Island. The entire visit to the building was exciting, modern and fabulous. The trip up (and down) in the elevator was exciting and technology was really fun. Next stop (I'm trying not to give away the big reveals) was awesome and then you are at the top with 360 degree views. It was a little cloudy that day so we were not able to "see forever" but it was great. We had lunch at the sit down restaurant as we were exhausted from all our walking that day. We sat down and had a glass of the house wine and then a delicious salmon salad with heirloom tomatoes. Service was very good and we felt relaxed and pampered. DON'T miss this experience. Also the workers were the best anywhere. Each was personable and knowledgeable. Lots of fun. Pricey but we felt it was worth it. Puts the Empire State Building to shame.
Fantastic View. A must do while in New York. A fantastic view of New York. Go early to avoid the crowds. The trip in the elevator is quite fascinating.
Just fabulous. Fabulous. Amazing views. Stunning. Given as long as you like. What an experience. Even the elevator worth the ride. Recommended.

New perspective to see WTC. This tour lived up to our expectations and I recommend it to anyone visiting New York City .Be amazed by the elevator ride up in the tower, and be ready to say, Oh Wow! Look at that! as you take in the amazing sights of New York City!

That's fine , really nice. but I dio prefer the wiew from Empire State.The reason is that you are always inside , in ESB you can breath the air.Anyway the place is amazing , people working there very very very kind and polite.Best thing you can book the visit at the hour you want and you do not need to make a queue.Mind you , look at the sun set hour and you go earlier.In that way you can enjoy both views.I had a tichet for 7.30 and they let me go in earlier because I was there at 7PM.

could be the best view in NYC. What can you say, it is high, it is VERY high ! This gives you a very nice view of NYC but also a large part of New Jersey. Even the elevator ride up to the observation deck is an exciting experience and the surprise when you are on the top is great (won;t spoil the fun by telling you what it is). It takes a while for you to take everything you see in and to find all the landmark buildings, but it is a lot of fun to do so.

A Bucket List Must. Having been at the top of the Twin Towers only 4 months before their destruction, it was on my bucket list to visit One World Trade Center. The building is absolutely stunning and the view from the top breathtaking. I didn't wait in line due to a promotion from MasterCard; however, this attraction would be worth a wait in line. Pick a clear, sunny day to be sure you have the opportunity to "See Forever". A not-to-be missed attraction for all citizens and visitors of the U.S.

First Class. 5 stars for theatre. From the moment you go through security, you're never left wanting, top class entertainment. Even though it was a cloudy day, the view was pretty spectacular. As a statement of freedom, solidarity, unity and Liberty, it couldn't really have been done better.
One world Trade Center. very exciting place to visit traffic is horrible but we got a hotel with in walking distance to everything
Energy of the ONE. Energy surrounding this attraction is ONE for all to see. The State of New York has really paid tribute to those who lives were lost... a MUST SEE for all

Disneyesque trip to the finest view. One World Tower and Observation Deck is brand new and a must do for the view at least once in your life. As with its predecessor ( gulp) the views are spectacular and unobstructed. The latest technology is in place - there is an ipad app so you can select the building from a map and learn more about it. I recommend making a reservation and purchasing your ticket online ahead of time. For those who show up without a reservation the wait is long and winding - just like a visit to a top Disney ride. Its a bit hokey with the picture taking befire you enter the observatory - but am obvious source of revenue. Small gift shop for souveniers - I would skip the $12 pin as it is small and cheesy looking. ( The pin was an add-on to the price of my ticket when I booked online). Unless you like overpaying for snacks and drinks I would avoid the bar area. Just whoosh up in the speedy elevator to the top and relish the view.

The view!!. Highly recommended! It is fantastic at the top of the observatory, would suggest getting one of the iPads that is offered, as this allows you to point it up out of the windows and click on buildings and sites in the distance and it flys you over to them and tells you about them, which is very cool and I've never seen anywhere else offer it before.

Breathtaking!. A truly beautiful experience. Even before the 9/11 attacks I was always fascinated by the World Trade Centre Twin Towers. Sadly I never got to visit them. One WTC is truly an amazing experience, but do book ahead online for the entire experience, which includes the use of an iPad that navigates around all points of the compass, explaining what you're looking at. The day I booked for online was regrettably very foggy and drizzly but no less entertaining, thanks to the iPad and the human guides.I went up again the following night (11th Sept) not long before closing and got to see the city as dusk fell, along with the Tribute In Light.I cannot recommend this attraction highly enough.

Standing Tall. This amazing construction is the epitome of design and a symbol of strength in the face of adversity. Rising tall above the surrounding skyscrapers, it is one of 7 buildings destroyed during 9/11. A must see to appreciate the aftermath of destruction arising out of hatred. The former name "Freedom Tower" is more than appropriate for this wonderful structure.

Amazing view. Went to the one world trade center aka freedom tower. The cost was $36, we purchased the tickets on line and registered for a specific time. This located right next to the 9/11 memorial museum. The north and south pools that are where the towers were is a beautiful memorial with all those that lost their lives on 9/11. You can locate specific people online. The observation deck is a beautiful 360 degree view of NYC and beyond. You can rent an interactive iPad for $15 that explains what things are and some information about the locations. We went with a 3 year old and my 86 year old grandma and they both enjoyed themselves. We had planned on dining in one of the restaurants but one of the employees shared it was quite expensive.
Don't miss that place . The view is really nice but I like the most the videos in the elevator on the ride up. They are truly amazing. Totally worth 32$ fee.

An amazing view, a true sight to behold!. Okay, let me start with this and get the obvious part out of the way. Yes, I totally agree that the price of admission is absurd and it is rather hard to justify spending $32 just to get a view of the city. However, having said that, this is truly a once and done type of thing, call it a bucket list attraction. We arrived at 6:45 pm as we had dinner reservations at One restaurant at 7:30 pm so we paid the $32 fee and got two things out of that fee, "admission" to the restaurant and the observation deck. The staff was very friendly and were very welcoming from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. There is a security check in line which moves right along, very similar to airport security. The elevator ride to the 103 floor was 47 seconds and a cool experience in and of itself. The 360 degree walk around view from the top floors were simply amazing. It is something that most people in NYS won't get to do, much less people from all around the world. We enjoyed our stay on the observation deck and found the crowds to be light and the staff helpful. There are some touristy things that they will try to push on you, simply smile and say "no." They will try to take your picture and sell you the photos as well as sell you an I Pod tour for $15, neither are necessary. Be advised, the observation deck closes at 8:00 pm, kind of early I thought. Overall, a very positive experience and one well worth doing. Bring your cash though, entry and everything being sold is highly priced.

Something to See!!!. Beautiful views from any angle! We did the express, so we did not wait in any lines going up. Going down, make sure you find the lines for the express or you will be waiting for a while to take the elevators back down. Please note you will be going through security. Also, the restaurant does not allow you to stand at the bar and have a drink. Either you sit at the bar or get a table, there is no overcrowding there, they will not allow it.

Beautiful rebuild and new energy. All the area is almost fully rebuild. An amazing reborn and recycled energy all around.A lot of new attractions can be found at the East side / Chelsea / West Village / Battery Park. New access. New views. New sites to enjoy.

Beautiful views. You don't even know you are in an elevator that is how smooth and fast the ride up is. Your ears will pop when you go up and when you come down. The video you watch while you are going up in the elevator is interesting. The views are absolutely beautiful and on a clear day you can see far. The reason for a four star rating is because of the price. I think it is really too high. One of those places that you only need to go once.

Sad but you must visit. Very interesting but sad place. Would highly recommend a visit.
Lots of information on the construction of the new buildings also.

Amazing. The waiting time was not long, well worth it. The views were simply amazing. The number of people allowed up at one time was limited so it never became too crowed. Staff was exceedingly pleasant and helpful.

A new "Must Do" for a visit to Manhattan. The One World Observatory is a must visit item for any trip to New York City! The waiting time on a weekday was thankfully short, the staff helpful and friendly and the process was very convenient. The elevator trip to the 102nd floor was a treat in its own right, with video screens on each side showing a panoramic view of Manhattan island from its initial settlement to the present day, while displaying the elevator car's current height above sea level. The viewing space is impressively large and I crowded and the views are breathtaking in all directions! There are knowledgeable guides always available to point out things of interest and to answer visitors questions. My wife and I stopped at the restaurant in the hub of the observation area for a drink and a snack, and found it to be comfortable, the service prompt and the menu items fresh and tasty. At $32@ ticket, spending an hour taking in breathtaking views in all directions is a "must do" activity for a visit to Manhattan!

Spectacular . I went with my friends in July. I have to say the view from the top was pretty amazing! I will be stopping by here every time I go to NYC. They have food and drinks and a fun gift shop that I couldn't help but enjoy!
Incredible!. This building is beautiful and the views are spectacular! It is a "must see". Purchasing the fast pass was worth the extra money.

Fabulous experience. A not to be missed experience but very over priced. Admission and a sandwich for two cost over $100. The ride to the 102nd floor is very entertaining and fast and the views breathtaking from the observation windows. Definately a must see while in NY.

Nice view and experience. Great views of New York, try to pre book online avoiding cues. Comparing to other high rise buildings is a good standard. Nice tongo with family, empire state building is the classical choice and as well amazing, up to you what you prefer, top modern or classical design. Worth considering the rockefeller center.

Really an eyecatcher. It is a nice building to see. Really an eyecatcher. It wasn't open yet while we were visiting New York but the people who worked in the building were very friendly. We visited New York during the winter and that day it was very cold. They let us in to warm up a bit again so we could ask some questions about the building and be warm enough to go out exploring the city.

NYV visit. The one world trade centre signifies the strength of the west to take a terrible situation and flourish from it. Very modern, very tall, highly recommend visiting this area just to see the scale of the building in comparison to the other buildings around.

Great experience. For $30 this is the best tour! I must say this and the 9/11 memorial was the best in NYC The skyline of NYC is amazing and this tour is worth every penny. The 3 D elevator rise to the top and the quick video is great Just have your cameras ready!!!

Stunning Views. Elevator ride up is smooth and the incredible speed is not noticeable. Going down has ear pressure changes like descent on an airplane. Fantastic views of 360 degrees from the viewing floor. Get tickets on-line and print ahead of time to avoid the typical lines.

Spectacular!. Unbelievable! Potentially my favorite spot during our trip. It was worth the $32 adult admission price to ride to the top. The views are incredible! We enjoyed a drink at the bar on top, though it was a bit pricey with automatic gratuity added. The gift shop area was nice with a wide price range. We planned our trip to be there at sunset...great idea!
Definitly a must see in NewYork. If your going to 911 monument ,then you should see world trade centre and everything there,so much to see and do there,

Fantastic building. This is an awesome place the views from the observation deck is fabulous the staff were very helpful the elevator up to the top had surround tv,s which showed the history of how new york was built.if you are a little apprehensive about heights the tv,s take your mind off the accent

Not the Twin Towers but will do.. The only negative aspect of the observatory is that it is fully enclosed in glass, which guarantees that you will get the reflections from the windows in your pictures, therefore ruining them for the most part. Otherwise it is a great place to visit.
New WTC looks very nice.. New WTC sky scrapers look really nice. The public transportation station has a great design too. A short visit to 9/11 Memorial is a must.

Beautiful views.. The only reason why I do not give it 5 stars is because I used to visit the Twin Towers and they were a 10 in my book. This is a wonderful experience, the ride up in the elevator is fantastic and the views from the top are excellent, however it is not possible to take any decent pictures because the entire observation area is enclosed in glass and the angle of the windows guarantees that you are taking pictures of the reflections on the glass. bummer.

Meal with a view. Fabulous experience with views of the whole of Manhattan and beyond. We went up just before twilight and so experienced that along with amazing views when the city lights came on.We were in the city on a special occasion and so also chose to eat in the restaurant. Definitely an experience we won't forget and we'd definitely recommend it! Food and service are both excellent, and the view tops it all off!

Great Views, Disapointing Experience. Of course, standing at 1,250 feet above street level, you will experience beautiful views of Manhattan and surrounding areas of the city, New Jersey and beyond. However, its not quite as good as it could be. There are two elements that I found disappointing; #1. There is no outside observation deck. When asked why, I was given the lame excuse that we were much too high to safely go outside. Really? I can recall the beautiful vistas from the spacious outdoor deck of the original World Trade Tower #2. Sadly, everything at the new One World Observatory is enclosed in glass, making it exceptionally difficult to shoot pictures without significant glare, even with a polarizing filter. There is no sense of really being "there", standing outside at 1,250 feet. #2. There is a feeling of too much commercialism. I'm not talking about the obligatory souvenir shop, its there with plenty of "things" to buy, but there are also these two large circular Kiosks on either side of the observatory floor, each with a carnival barker, seemingly stuck in hyper-animated mode shouting into a microphone about Pizza, Bagels and every other kind of NYC kitsch. I may be wrong, but I found this element of the observatory to be totally unnecessary, annoying and amateurish. The view is great, but the experience doesn't lend itself to lingering a while and looking at the city below. On the contrary, one lap around the observatory floor, I was ready to descend. A pity really.

Best views of nyc!. Going top is very pricey but its worth it once you see the view from up there! I have been to all the ny towers but this was just something.. The iPad is a very clever and interactive way to discover the city as well!

Worth every penny! Just do it!. Went on a partly cloudy Saturday afternoon. This is not like the Empire State Building where you ride the elevator up, get out, look around and go down. One WTC IS AN EXPERIENCE! I won't go into details because I don't want to spoil the surprise that awaits you. Go! The T-Shirts in the gift shop are a bit tacky but you don't have to buy them.

One World. I had just finished the Steven Siller tunnel to towers race and thought it would be a good idea to check out the One World observatory. It is a nice view in a well constructed and outfitted place with helpful and pleasant people working there. It is not worth the $30 for the elevator ride, which is by far the best part of the excursion. If you have never seen NYC from high up do this. But for the average NY'er don't waste the $30. Spend it in the 9/11 museum.

Amazing views, great experience. The observatory at One World Trade Center is amazing. The experience starts even before getting into the elevator, and the videos on the ride up as well as the intro to the observatory are beautiful. The views from the top are simply mesmerizing.

Amazing and amazingly disheartened. Impressive but yet unimpressed. Impressive with the unsurpassing views 360 degree views of the city and its surroundings. The views are simply astounding and breathtaking. The short intro before allowing you into the observatory was second to none! WOW! The stateliness of the building is by far amazing! However, highly unimpressed and almost dismayed/disgusted at the marketing and "anything to make a big buck" sales gimmicks inside. The extortion on capitalizing on the REASON that building is there in the first place was disgusting to me. Before you can even get into the building, you have to deal with sales pitches...iPads to view and name places in the city, pictures taken, cards for a variable discount that can only be displayed once you make a purchase if your card has a discount on it, and the pay more for expedited fares so as not to stand in line. I opted to do this as my daughter was on a tight time frame over the weekend with college visits and there was no way we could guarantee entrance in time to make the next appointment. We paid double the price to guarantee "expedited" entrance at anytime on Sat....and still stood in a line for the elevator and had to go through all the money making schemes along the way. If you MUST have an open ended time, then I guess you'll have to pay the exorbitant fees to have an open time on one weekend day ($60) or even more for the entire weekend ($90) vs the standard ticket of about $40. It was $130 for my daughter and I to ride to the top and view the city without standing in line on a Saturday Flex pass. Other than the views and architect of the building (from the design to the elevators to its massiveness), the rest is like entering an amusement park with the lines and the sales gimmicks. The restaurant which was beyond ridiculous pricing...$14 for a plate of brussel sprouts, $24 for a hamburger no side and $20 for a glass of wine. I eat in fine/nice establishments regularly but found this extreme by all measures. Yes the food was plated well but there was nothing overly special about it to price so high for a small portion other than the view, which we already paid for. The building is not the Twin Towers nor was it ever designed to be so. It was designed to by a symbol of what happened and that we will prevail, not to replace or take away from what was. I appreciate that greatly. The Twin Towers and their magnitude will ALWAYS be remembered in their greatness and nothing can replace or take away from that or what happened. So all in all, although the view on top is amazing beyond words and worth seeing at least once at the cheapest entry if you have time to wait in line as well as upstairs to get a view....the windows do tend to be crowded around and you wait a while to get a window view and get a picture, People tend to sit along the window with their children and you can't get up to the windows. I would suggest perhaps benches along the wall for people to sit on to rest and not in the windows to provide an opportunity for all visiting to see and enjoy at leisure. I would also suggest eliminating all the sales stuff. You are truly taking away from what the real reason of the building is...and where does all the money go from the pictures and iPad rentals? Into the 911 Memorial upkeep or into pockets?

Great views. nice to go up and have 360 degree views from the south of Manhattan. We pre booked before we left the UK and the weather was not the best but still had some great views. The bar is great for a drink before you go down they have everything you could want to drink and no time limit when we were there.

Wonderful panorama but expensive. Great to go to this new attraction which has replaced the World Trade Centre. We booked in advance having been warned about the queues and we had very limited time available. As it turned out in mid July there were no queues so we overpaid.The very rapid elevator is a sight in itself with views across Manhatten through the ages.On top the views are of course spectacular but it is highly commercialised with gifts etc.

Enjoy the lift. The tickets for this venue are timed and dated so ensure you are free at the appointed time. We visited 18th September 15.We bought our tickets as part of a package so avoided the queues at the Trade Centre itself. One inside access was very speedy and the lifts are a experience in themselves.The views from the observatory are spectacular, a very good trip.

Killer views. New York city has it great viewpoints but this one could be the best. As you rise to the 102nd floor, the elevator windows show views of New York from the 1500's to present day as the city rises. The view looking uptown towards Central Park really shows the massive size of the building in mid-town compared to the rest around it. It's best to get online and get the tickets for the date and time you want rather than waiting in line. I must do experience in New York

Birds eye view. Incredible experience, 101 floors in 42 seconds. Lovely views to New Jersey, Brooklyn & of course Manhattan.Food & Drink at the top of the world. You can rent tablets which you aim in the direction you are looking & it gives details of many of the sights. TIP; Book in Advance.

Nice view, but poor design. Personally, I'd go for the top of the rock, it's a better view and you can take better photos.One World is promoting these iPads with software installed called "explorer", you rent one and it tells you the buildings you're looking at, the same thing the top of the rock app does free of charge for you.

Worth it!!. We were visiting ground zero last afternoon and our friends took us to this place. I had no idea that this was an important tourist attraction. We saw the long queues and realized this is something worth. It's a bit pricey though.After the security check you are guided into a video and it was awesome. The lift with beautiful video taking from primitive times to the current NYC was amazing and of course the views from top were breathtaking. We will come here again.

Breathtaking. Stunning place to visit, amazing views and experience should not be missed. The whole area has been regenerated beautifully and there is more to come. Advice though book online before going. Much easier!

A new definative NYC experience. Although a bit pricey, this is a must see attraction. Obviously this is not just another skyscraper!! Incredible views and a very unique elevator ride. Buy your tickets in advance to save the line. We bought the all day, anytime passes (even more expensive) and showed up just before sunset when a pile of people were queued up waiting to get in, but were whisked into a special screening area and straight up. Kind of like the front of the line Disney passes and so worth it if time is money!
Brilliantly Done. This has the "Wow" factor, not only do you have great views the introduction to the observatory is very well done.
Awesome experience!. Starting from the amazing elevator ride to the top and then short intro about New York with a breath taking views from the observatory... Simply great!

This has the "wow" factor. Views of New York always have the "wow" factor but this has been done in a very unique way and interesting too as they have included information from those who built this amazing building.

Top of the rock rock's. Waited on an endless line. It costs 32$ for the flight up and if visited by a family of 5 it is not worth the cost. Better to see Top of the Rock since it is not as high and gives a better view. It's like seeing the city from an airplane. Too high up.
Fantastic visit. I booked online for a 6:30pm visit, mid September and got to see the day turn to night. Lots of space to move and the views were great.

First time trip to NYC for two of my sisters-in-law. Visiting this place now is even more memorable, if you had been there years earlier when two World Trade Center buildings were standing. The Memorial Pool is a beautiful tribute to those who lost their lives. There is still construction going on. We did not have time to get in line to be able to visit the 9/11 Museum that has been built in that area. It is definitely a place to go and see.

Awesome Visuals. A must see to honour those who helped to build it in memory of the lives lost. Good background on how it was built. Line-ups are long and it's tiring waiting in those line-ups. Next time I would pay the extra to get expedited to the front of the line.

Great View. This is something you have to do in NY, however, it is very commercialized. I am amazed at how it felt like they were trying to get you to buy something at every turn after you spent $ on a ticket (that was not cheap either). When you go to NY, there are a lot of tourist attractions where each one has a gift shop to purchase additional items. In One World, there are many other ways they try to get you to spend your money. I came for the view but was not impressed by the 'add-ons'. But the experience is worth it. They are not pushy, I was just expecting a nice view.
Just Wow!. Fantastic view of New York. I think it is best to go up there just before sunset. Great film of the history of Manhattan in the elevator.

Amazing building!. We took a ride to this one afternoon and was amazed at the beauty of the architecture. One thing I would recommend is getting a ferry to Staten Island and seeing just how much taller this building is at a distance. A true symbol in a city.
Great views. Food at the top restaurant was excellent. Very attentive staff and servers. Was fun for a one time visit.

Buy the ticket online before you make that line!!!. It was my first time in New York and I wasn't sure if I wanted to spend the $32 on an observatory...but believe me it is SO worth it! Incredible view, just absolutely breathtaking. I will definitely go up there every time I go back.

One of the best views . This is highest observatory deck in new York. You get 360 degree view of New York, all famous buildings, Jersey city and all five borrows. Take evening slot so that you can see new York in day time, sunset and in night lights. Check sunset time of that date. Only minus points, it's very costly, I used Monday Mastercard deal. It's very crowded, you need to struggle to get part of any window.

One world Trade Centre Tower: do it at Sunset!. We did this tour at about 6.30pm, close to sunset. That way we were able to watch the sunset and the city lights come on. The price was reasonable compared to other towers we have been on, such as the Eiffel Tower and the Mao Tower in Shanghai). It was about $27 US each. We were not hurried and had a drink at the bar while the sun set! It was necessary to book and we went straight in. A must do in NYC.

Simply on top !!. Breathtaking view from tallest building in New york. When you ascend in lift, lift walls carry images from 600 years back and as lift goes upward, skyline of NY progressively changed. When lift reaches top, it coincides with current NY skyline. I took ipad aZpplication as well. Not very useful. You have the best NY skyline view from this building.

Amazing job!. We bought our ticket online. We could have paid more for a VIP ticket with fast lane.... But we didn't buy it. Once at the tower we got inside very fast and really, no need to spend the extra money for the fast lane. And we went in June, after the school were closed. So it was basically in full tourist season. The elevator ride was so cool. All the walls were like a television screen and they really put up a show. Once on top, you have to wait for a short documentary on the history of NYC.... And then, the surprise happens. Can't write it down cause it would spoil the surprise. Let me tell you, it was so cool!Then you finally walk to the observatory. Even though I knew there were a lot of people, it didn't feel crowded cause the whole floor is for the viewing and the windows are big and tall. You get a full 360* view of Manhattan. The only downside is I have been on the Empire and the top of the rock and in those building you are actually out on the balcony. This building is all enclosed so I don't really have the real "feeling"... Just a view... I loved it, but my favorite is still the top of the rock.

Amazing visit. The folks who planned the observation deck experience got it right. It's tasteful and emotional. Doesn't gloss over what happened on 9/11 but taps into visitors' complex feelings. From the elevator ride, with views of Manhattan projected on the walls, to the revealing of the real skyline, every moment was perfect.

Amazing visit. The folks who planned the observation deck experience got it right. It's tasteful and emotional. Doesn't gloss over what happened on 9/11 but taps into visitors' complex feelings. From the elevator ride, with views of Manhattan projected on the walls, to the revealing of the real skyline, every moment was perfect.

A new 'must see' in NYC. I'm so glad I visited One World Observatory and highly recommend it to every visitor to NYC and Ground Zero. I purchased my ticket in advance on line and arrived about 30 minutes early. You cannot get in line until 15 minutes before the time on your ticket. Thankfully it was a nice day so I sat on the bench near the entrance. I had my ticket checked four times before boarding the elevator. Seems a bit excessive as the line simply keeps moving from one location to another. Most employees were incredibly kind and friendly but a couple of them at the screening area were rude and surly----must have been TSA trained! The elevator ride to the top took less than a minute with a fascinating video display of lower Manhattan from primitive times til today. Views at the top are stunning. I found the hawking of photos and guides a bit off putting but typical of key tourist locations these days. As I said, a definite must see in NYC!

controversial .... there are a lot of people who do not like it ... some love it ... the task to replace the twin towers is for obvious reasons a tricky one ... i think it is actually a pretty goid solution

Great for First Time Visitors. If this is your first visit to New York, you'll enjoy this. The elevator ride is very cool. A tablet (extra charge) enables you to look at landmarks, identify them and get a brief explanation.If you've been to New York before, this is pricey (can think of better NYC experiences for the money). The stop and go to regulate traffic requires patience; the stops to sell tablets and photos was just annoying. If the ticket included the tablet this would be worthwhile for all. The souvenir prices were ridiculous ($35 for caps and T-shirts).

Observatory. Nice views, too expensive though. An additional turnoff was all the additional marketing. Ipad rentals for $15, goes right through a snack bar and gift shop, and they take your picture on entering like a cruise ship.

Mixed visit. Observation deck is absolutely beautiful from the 45 second elevator "experience" going to the 102 floor to the short video you see after. I have gone twice, once at sunset and once at 11:00 at night. Seems as of late the operation hours have changed and the deck now closes at 8pm, as it used to be 12am. Not sure when or why the time changed. Went this past Wednesday and at 630pm was told no tickets were available for the remainder of the evening. Upon that news I went to the online ticket sight and saw tickets were available until 7:30 pm so I went right to the gentleman who told me there we're no tickets and asked why they were available to buy and he stumbled all over his words and tried backtracking. I was extremely disappointed that the workers lied and we're turning families away making it appear that they just wanted to ensure they got to go home on time. This to me was a huge change from my previous visit when we saw the deck was open until midnight so we walked right up and bought tickets. The other disappointment was how rude some of the visitors were sitting in the window sills charging their phones and refusing to get up for the experience of the 100's of other visitors. There is no staff to be found to keep the crowds moving to ensure the $32 entry fee is worth while which is a huge disappointment. I think EVERYONE has been forgotten that this is sacred ground especially for myself who lost a loved one on 9-11. It has become a tourist nightmare with selfie sticks galore. There need to be some minor changes to ensure that the experience remains to be amazing as the architects dreamed it would be.

World Class!. I have been lucky enough to go to the top of quiet a few buildings during my time holidaying in various places but I can honestly say this is the best experience of heading up high I've ever had.Yes its pricey but this is a classy act - done in typical American showy fashion!Given what happened on the this site on 9/11 it has a feel of a phoenix rising from the ashes - and does not disappoint...the views are jaw dropping.It don't want to spoil it too much so all I will say is head here before 9.30am and leave around 1.30 to do it properly (avoiding the queues)!

The Freedom Tower - Captivating!. The ride both up and down in the lift is an experience in itself, but the views from the top as breathtaking. Add to this the history of what has gone before in this location, and you can't help but be impressed and inspired by this iconic construction. Another 'must-do' when you visit New York.
Great symbol and excellent modern architecture.. Impressive symbol of democracy and resiliance and an opportunity to add your appreciation of feedom by being there.

Great views. We had booked online our visit date and time before we left Australia so am sure this saved some queuing time.Although saying that we did seem to spend a lot of time queuing up...outside the building and then another line to go through security, then a queue for the elevator, then you go into a holding area to watch a film/visual display. Then you are directed to an area where they try to rent you an iPad for $15 to view information on the sites. But it's all about the view really and we were lucky we had a clear day, so could see heaps. Amazed us though the number of people sitting down with the backs against the windows...you have to squeeze past them or around them to get close to the window.Lots of reflection on cameras so need to put your camera up against the window to reduce this.Then another queue to get back down the elevator.The lift rides up and down are very good...even though they are short - I think it was just over 40 seconds for 102 floors!! The visuals inside the lift on the way up and down are excellent.

One World Trade!!!!!. A must on our list of places to see in NYC. Take the time online to book your time and date to go up to the observatory. We chose the 9am time (the first time of that day) and the day was beautiful, sunny sky, great for picture taking. The elevator ride is 60 seconds up to 102nd story observatory. There are some wonderful surprises that I don't want to ruin by telling them here. Just know this will be a very memorable elevatory ride. Well worth the very reasonable price.

amazing views, 9/11 remembrance 14 yrs later. It has been 14 yrs almost to the day since I have been back to Ground Zero. Amazing transformation. Powerful Towers 1 and 2 memorials. One World Center is an experience. Views of the entire city lie you have not seen before. A must see in NYC. Take #1 train south or E train south and short walk to Tower. OR for those willing to walk , strol down 5th avenue to Ann Street adn make a right. 1 hr walk.

Wonderful views with great surprise.. To get to the viewing platforms of One World Trade Centre,you enter a lift, the reaches the platform in just sixty seconds. Your also treated to a presentation about the making of New York City. The views from one world trade centre are like no other available in New York. The presentation of the view are breath taking. This is truly not to be missed.

Great view and awesome experience!. This was the best of the tall building experiences in New York. The elevator going up shows an awesome video and the view is a surprise as well. There is a cafe and souvenir store at the top as well for entertaining children.
Absolutely cool building. I haven't gone inside yet, waiting for next year. However whether you see this building up close, mid-range, or from far away it always leaves an impression.

Great experience... . Visited this month with friends. Upon arrival at the building the queue was quite long however one of the attendants told us to look at buying our tickets online..... We did, and managed to book the next timeslot so from arrival to being in the elevator was no more than 30 mins. Excellent. The view is tremendous as you would expect. Great platform to gaze uptown but you get equally great views of Brooklyn, Queens, NJ and out across the bay towards Staten Island. Plenty of room to move about and a couple of interactive platforms to use if you wish. The ride skywards is impressive - great digital storyboard showing the development of NYC while you get whizzed upwards. Don't want to give too much away however the 'reveal' at the top is breathtaking - it's honestly breathtaking as I didn't see it coming & was genuinely blown away. Great experience & ideal way to see a new vista of the city. Great value for money - standard ticket was less than £25.

Ok, but too commercial and overproduced for my liking.. Great views, sure. The fastest elevator I have ever been in, up to the 102nd floor, with a cool animated CGI history of Manhattan over the centuries. But otherwise just a bit too Disneyland and commercial. The Rockefeller is probably a better bet.

The view is spectacular!. There is no comparison when it comes to the view. However, for the price you pay ($38 for adult and $30 for seniors) I think, it's a little too much. You can only be in the observatory unless you pay more to see more. It doesn't take more than 1 1/2 hours to tour the whole observatory, unless you decide to eat while you're there (which is also very expensive). I think they should have more discounts for students and seniors. My mom went and so excited to see it. When we got up there, she couldn't even enjoy the view because she was already tired of walking from the train station, to the line to go in , line to go in the elevator, line to see a 7 seconds show. She just sat at one of the steps and relaxed.

To the top!. We paid for tickets on line saved over an hour of waiting in line! Food in grab and go was delicious had vegie sandwich and my friend had the Mulberry street toasted. Yum! The views we're beautiful we did not rent the tablet I would suggest paying the $15 .00 if you want to know the landmarks.
S P E C T A C U L A R!!!!!!!!!. The Best place in New York City, the view is spectacular, the elevator ride is so cool!!!Highly recommended.
