OMG!!. Please don't miss this if you're in NYC - amazing views ...AMAZING!!!! We didn't have to queue outside - although there were queues for the lifts etc - but don't let that put you off - totally worth it!!!

Spectacular View. From the elevator ride to the top, the spectacular 360 view and the use of IPad to get locations, history and details. This excursion was awesome. Friendly and helpful staff, large facility and ease of ordering tickets to buying at window. A must see!
A Very Emotional Experience. The park, North and South Pools, and the Museum were very emotional experiences individually, and collectively. The visit to the site was beyond description.

amazing. I thought this was a brilliant experience and the whole journey to the top is a story which is great, you have a show before you go to the screening area up a few more floors which was a great surprise and once you're up to the observatory floor it does take your breath away.very happy I went here and would suggest making the time to go!
WOW. WoW what fantastic views. and you can have a bite to eat or a drink in the bar but at busy times you may need to queue. book before hand for quick access with hardly any queueing

Amazing views from the top. Amazing experience starts even before you reach the top ... The 3D, virtual reality elevators , then the presentation before you actually get to see the NY in 360 degrees, is just stunning .Fortunately it was a lovely clear day with slight clouds just to add beauty to the overall scene .... NY skyline , the bridges, both rivers , statue of liberty at a distance ... oh what a scene really ..... And just check if you really need to buy more expensive express entry ticket... For a normal low cost entry line was much less than for an express entry, just check .....

So much fun! Buy tickets online!. What a great place to visit in NYC! But make sure you buy tickets online so you don't need to wait in the long line to go to the top. Fantastic views of the city and beyond!
Incredible . NYC really went above and beyond with this project. You can feel it in every detail that they had something to prove. You'll miss out if you skip over this.

Stunning views, remarkable building. Well worth the visit to the top. We enjoyed cocktails at the bar in the observation deck. Did not have to wait in line very long to get tickets then board the elevators to the top. This is a must for all Manhattan travelers.

Symbol of American Spirit. There's nothing like the original, but this soaring replacement for the twin towers is a thing of beauty and a symbol of the indomitable American spirit. I watched it go up, panel by panel, and am now so satisfied to see it finally completed.
MEMORABLE EXPERIENCE!. One World Observatory is a must see destination while in NYC. The ride to the top is amazing and once you arrive, a big surprise awaits you. The view is SPECTACULAR!

Nice views, big crowds. I bought priority tickets online to avoid waiting on long lines and was glad I did, although it was costly. Okay, incredible views following an incredibly fast elevator ride. Since there are so many visitors, we were moved from one viewing place to the next en masse, and then lectured, while standing, encouraged to rent ipads for more info (not worth it to native NYers) and then pushed along. Crowded shopping and lunching. (Maybe there are hours that are less crowded than others.) Overall, a rather alienating experience, which mimics, in my view, the creation of the edifice and its predecessors.

great attraction. Absolutely brilliant would advise getting a pre booked ticket as it minimizes the queues.The lift itself is an experience and the wee show at the beginning is not to be missed. I would advise going up about an hour before sunset so you get both daylight and the night sky.If you have pre booked and the weather s poor the staff are very helpfull and will rearrange. probably the best attraction in New York enjoy

A space for reflection.. Nobody should forget this horrific tragedy and like most visitors, we went to pay our respects at this memorial to the victims (RIP). The etched names on the memorial bring reality to the grief and sorrow brought about at that time and surely lingers on for the relatives of the dead. The nearby Catholic churches of Saints Peter and Joseph are both oases of peace and tranquility commemorating this awful event in US and World history.

Breathtaking!!. Everything about this is amazing (maybe apart from the price)The elevator ride is so cool!!And the way they unveil your first view at the top honestly gave me goosebumps and still does typing about it. The views are breathtaking. If you're coming/in New York make sure you tick this off your list!

Views !!! . Great views ! We went just before sunset and stayed till dark , the night sky is breathtaking , we went to the bar on the top floor. Very exspencive but what choice do you have ? I'm not complaining about the cost , just a warning ,

Great place, great views but extreme lack of help with those that can't stand for long. We had a great visit to this marvellous building but my one big complaint is that there is a lot of standing and waiting even though you have to book a time slot. There wasn't one notice about help with those who need assistance! When you reach the 102nd floor you can't even get a chair to have a coffee in the cafe!! I can understand that they need people to move along but there should be some seats after queuing up for so long and waiting. It is a shame that this new high tech building isn't designed or catered for for those who are less mobile. I was very disappointed at this. In the Empire State there is a sign as you go in for those that need assistance.

The New World Trade Center. Originally built between 1966-1987 the New York World Trade Center contained a the commercial complex plus complex shopping malls and the world famous twin towers;the complex has been completely destroyed on September 11 1993 by a terrible terrorist attack.Now the buioding has been reconstructed topped by the memorial museum, the survivor tree, commerce center, and new towers.The view from the top of towers is pahntastic; on the ground in front of the towersare decorated by gigantic wateralls surrounded by a wall with engraved names of the victims of the attack. The survival tree, left over from the attack reminds and reflects the continuation of life.The memorial museum should be alson included when visiting the world trade center exploring facts of the very fatal and brutal attack The World Trade Center shall be inclouded when sightseeing New York for both American citizen or visitors from overseas.e ,

a great place to go and see and also say a prayer.. this is a nice place to visit but 9/11 still is strong in the area.It is a place to reflect and say a small prayer for those who passed away here. Hate is a bad word but the all passed due to people who hate the world that does not think the way they do. Too bad that hate can do this to the minds of bad people. the area is very nice and the places to visit are good to go to. Just say that prayer so we do not forget. It is hard to give a great review to something as great but also as bad as this place.

Well done, NYC!. I worked in lower Manhattan on 9/11. I have since moved from the city and haven't been to that part of the city for over 6 years. I am beyond impressed at the new tower. The elevator ride is impressive and it must be pressurized, as I didn't have any ear popping issues that always plagued me in the old WTC. I love the video that plays as you ride up. The presentation, from the minute you buy your ticket and enter to the ride back down, is just spectacular. The people working there are friendly and helpful. The one part that I wasn't wild about was the hard sell for the iPad "tour guide." They make you stand in a group and listen to the presentation before you go to the observatory. They would do better to sell those on the observatory floor. The ride down is as spectacular as the ride up, with another really cool video. Kudos to NYC for building this tower and creating the beautiful reflecting pools and park area so people can come to enjoy, but also reflect on that day. I highly recommend this tour.

Amazing views! Super quick elevator . Visited here after on previous trips to New York having done both top of the Rock and Empire State Building. One world trade centre really is an impressive building, standing so tall and proud. We didn't pre book tickets but didn't have to wait long for our turn to ride in the lift. We may have just been lucky.Lift is super quick and interesting. Views from the top were amazing, looking down on these massive skyscrapers and helicopters is pretty amazing! It was a clear day so could see for miles. Walked around the 360 twice to get a good look at everything.Definitely think it worth doing, great views of New York and lady liberty. It is worth noting that there is no outdoor viewing deck though unlike the other options.

Aspiring and inspiring spire.. Handsome building that has restored dignity to the gaping hole that was Ground Zero. Such a graceful piece of architecture and engineeringcwith its reflecting mirror glass and elegant antenna.Best seen early in the morning or at dusk so that the surface can reflect pink-tinged clouds and sky.

Impressive memorial to 9/11. The beautiful memorial is a very, very sad experience but the design of the park is lovely. The scale is larger than I thought. There is a oak tree that was preserved and it holds a special place in the park. The building (Freedom tower) is beautiful and stately and stands so proudly nearby.

View the Big Apple skyline. This is The Place to visit if you want to see everything as far as the eye can see. Only make sure the weather is favourable !! We visited on our last day in N Y and the weather closed in, limiting how much and how far we could see. Notwithstanding a superb attraction with interactive sessions to learn all about the history and development of New York. Slightly pricey but on balance worth the cost. A welcome addition to attractions in the city.

Extremely moving. This was a must see on our trip. We visited as part of a city tour and our guide was really informative, telling us about the reconstruction of the new buildings and also the memorial site.Standing at the memorial is strangely peaceful, helped by the noise of the waterfalls in the reflection pools, which wwe were told was purposely created to drown out the noise of the city and allow for quiet contemplation.We didn't have time to visit the museum which was a shame, but it's definitely on the to do list for next time.
Brilliant . The best attraction in New York City. The lifts ..the theatre ..everything was brilliant well worth the money. Staff really helpful aswel

Be sure to go in the right order.. We went to the World Trade Center bombing museum as well as the freedom Tower observation deck in the same day always go in that order. Visiting the 9/11 museum can reach, type two periods be careful and be sure to have somebody there along for support. After reviewing that tragic day be sure to take the tower and only in that order is it exemplifies how he recovered from the attack. Elevator right it's worth the $52 you pay for admission in itself

see forever is the phrase, and it's true. awesome experience going up to the top! the elevator rides by themselves were worth the trip, not to mention what happens at the top before you get to the observation decks. will be going back there again soon!

Stunning!. All of the people involved with the construction of One World Trade Center did everything right. It is a beautiful tribute in each and every way. It is spectacular and breathtaking...and reflective. The view is incredible; you can literally see forever!

A wonderful view of New York. The new world tower is a great viewing point. The elevator is very fast. You should book on line in advance for best speed of entrance. The views are 360 degrees.Definitely worth going.
Awe-inspiring trip to 911 Memorial and One World Trade Center. Visited at night with Free Tours by Foot... breathtaking and awe-inspiring. This is a MUST DO while in NYC.

One not to miss.... WOW... Needles to say there are great views on this 102 storey building but the lift / escalator is a highlight. Have your phone on record while going up and down as it is worth recording. The viewing tower is excellent though the pillars get in the way sometimes and some selfish people sit at the windows not allowing others to take in the views or for photos.It was about $20 to enter but then you are asked for another $15 to get a viewing pad once you get to the top..??All in all well worth it and a must while in NYC.

puyk1960. Amazing,the atmosphere around the site is fabulous,you purchase tickets for a time slot during the day,when you enter you ride a lift to the top,this in itself is good,then the top wow.This is a must do when in New York the views are unreal and you spend a long time looking at New York from the top of the world.A must

Views, views, views. Went with my family which ranged from an 86 year old to a 3 year old. The observatory is great for all ages in between that. A bit pricey in my opinion. $32 per adult. Amazing 360 views if New York City and beyond!! But if you expect more than that be prepared thats what you get. We did pay $15 for the informational Ipad which was worth the money. The North and South pools right outside are such a beautiful memorial for those that lost their lives on 9-11. You can definitely fit this visit in with other activities around NYC.

Expensive but worth it!. VERY COOL. It's not just an observation deck...it's a show! Starting with the high tech elevator ride up then a way cool show when you exit the elevator (it does begin to feel a little 6-Flags-ish the way they herd you from one place to another) but I was still far to distracted by all the bells and whistles to worry about that (or even think of it till much later). I thought it was expensive for an observation deck, $40. But it really is a freakin' show and to me...well worth it. What pissed me off was that once they had us up there, then they still tried to sell more...more...more...Look at the cool iPad map, rent it for $15...get your picture for only $35...how about a banana from the "deli", only $5! I am not kidding. It's only 100 stories down to the next closest banana...So I paid the man his $5. Still didn't change the fact that I was up 100 freaking stories in the NEW WORLD TRADE TOWER. Take that Mother Fu@ker! I LOVED IT

No1 World Trade center. Having done the Empire State and Rocker fella center I was a bit wary of it.How ever I got down early purchased ticket and walked straight in and up.Well What a very professionally run attraction. Really good once up at the Observatory you are left alone for as long as you like to take in the site of Manhattan and beyond. Plenty of staff for questions who are more than willing to share their experience of New York. really good and very informative.

Take me to the TOP. Totally worth the price of admission! There is a video presentation prior to getting on the elevators. My first thought was this is going to be boring. Surprise! It was amazing! The elevator ride up is something you must experience! Once at the observatory, we were lucky and had clear fantstic views all the way around. Both the north and south tower memorials can be seen clearly, as well as New Jersey! We spent about 45 minutes looking out over the city and beyond and took some great pictures.

Never to be forgotten. Beautiful Memorial very moving. Loads of people with tears in there eyes. Very very sad.. Original World Trade Centre will never be forgotten. Glad I went to the top of the Original Buildings..

New York at its best. The view of the city and the neighboring boroughs are amazing from the top. The overall setup, the well planned shows and a brief 3 min history on various parts of the city blows your mind. Its an experience - live it!

So well done!!!!. We live a few blocks from the tower and have watched it being built. We took a morning off from work to visit the Observatory and it was fantastic! The mid-week morning was not crowded and we enjoyed coffee overlooking... everything! The iPad offer is worth the money so you can learn new fun facts about the City and surrounding area. The vibe is very upbeat and optimistic. This is a must do!

stunning. this is not a normal visit to a building and see the view from the observatory, this visit is truly amazing from the first moment you start the visit the emotion begins, is like you are in the rock bottom of the world trade center, the elevators are a time machine, the intro in the floor 102 takes your breath away. simply stunning

A must!. The building is amazing and once inside, the trip to the top is quick and incredibly worthwhile. Panoramic views for miles and miles (we had a crystal clear day) complemented by purchased iPads ($15 and worth it) which had commentary and funky 'fly to's' highlighting key points of interest. We could have bought tickets with a time slot but ended up just going off the cuffs the queue looked long but we were in within 30 minutes. I'd suggest get your tickets with a time slot though. We could have spent hours up there. A true testament to the resilience of the human spirit and having been up the original World Trade Centre I'm so glad that we can do something similar again now.

Great view but poor experience. The view is worth the price, but the exectution is really poor. It's sad that it took 15 years to build this to be honest. Let me just walk you through the experience.We got there just as the sun was setting and hoped to see the city under both light and darkness. The staff on the ground were great and hurried us through to the elevators. Here's where it started to go wrong.Rather than just take you straight to the observation deck so we could watch the sun set, you are herded into a holding stable and forced to watch a video. The screencollapses and you have a view of the city for 5 seconds before they close it and herd you to another holding stable to try to sell you some iPad with a long speech.You are finally let down to the observation deck where the lighting is so bad there are huge glares on the window, making taking a good photo challenging to say the least. We missed the sunset because of all their sales speeches and were really disappointed. They have some huge and bright TV screens which ruin the zen and some stupid screen you can stand on.They really could have done a better job and also made it more peaceful environment to respect those that died in the previous towers. Sad really that it's so commercialized.

1 WTC is worth the visit. We visited this memorial to find breathtaking views of the city. It is similar to Burj Khalifa in Dubai with an elevator that rises to floor 100+ in 60 seconds. Show up early to avoid the long lines...

Well worth a trip to the top. The view is something but the way you are transported to the viewing platform & the actual way the 360" view is presented is first class.PS worth hiring one of the IPad's to pick out all the NYC icons

Top view. The ride on the elevator with the animation is really well choreographed. The movie screening ending with opening the windows shutters and showing the view over New York is amazing. Pity that everything is behind glass. The view from Top of the World on the old 2WTC was better.
AMAZING!!!. Amazing experience!!! Wonderful view of NYC from the 102 floor of the Freedom Tower!! Totally worth the price (32 $).You have the possibility to have an ipad as guide!

Thrilling Views fro the 102nd floor!. It was amazing! The skies were clear and blue. We rode the elevator to the 102nd floor in less than a minute. We walked around 360 degrees for incredible views of NYC.What can I say? You just HAVE to go there and see for yourself! And save it for a beautiful day. allow at least an hour, but probably more.

Impressive . What a wonderful way to see the skyline of New York and New Jersey. We pre purchased our tickets and therefore it was an easy transition through the lines. A fabulous way to enjoy the magnitude of the area. There is lots to do with the surrounding mermorials to remind us why this new tower exists. Worth the time.

Experience. While a bit overproduced I'm glad I had the opportunity to experience this. The view from the top is amazing and I was surprised that after 45 minutes of being herded like cattle that we were allowed to stay as long as we wanted.

Missable and drenched in frothy salesiness. In seven days of sightseeing and attractions in the city, this is the only one we reckon we could have lived without. The view is nice enough, but the salesiness of the staff plus the saccharine patriotism that the whole "experience" is drenched in take the gloss away from it.It's also worth mentioning that the glass reflects pretty badly, so photography doesn't work great. And there's nowhere to sit down, which means that people deciding to take a breather end up sitting on the ledge, hogging the view for others.Overall this is desperately missable. Top of the Rock is stacks better, but then so is pretty much anything else you can do in NYC in the the space of an hour or two.

An Architectural Masterpiece. An architectural masterpiece this is the tallest building in the western hemisphere. It is a tribute to the resilience of the American people and their refusal to be intimidated by the events of 9/11. The views from the observation area encompassing the top 3 stories of the building are unsurpassed. A must see venue.

Most Beautiful Sunset I've Ever Seen. We booked a 6:30 PM reservation on 09/17/15, so we could experience the sights in the daylight and after dark. This was an even better decision than I could have imagined. I had seen the video from the elevators online, and I had some idea of what to expect, having been in other skyscrapers. I also expected a few tears to well up as I looked at my former apartment building and remembered the events of 9/11. I did not expect such an awe-inspiring sunset. There was near silence on the New Jersey side of the building, as we watched a powerful red globe disappear in the distance at a pace difficult to capture on film. I've seen plenty of gorgeous sunsets over the Grand Canyon and many mountain ranges, but this was extraordinary. One hundred floors in the sky, the bustling city looks like a big puzzle we can't quite understand. Then, the sun breathes us in, warms us, and reminds us what it is to be humans in community.If you're looking for the lights and spectacle of Times Square, this isn't it. But if you want to experience a full range of thoughts and emotions, this might fit the bill.

Great addition to the NY Skyline!. Beautiful addition to the already remarkable New York skyline. It representation and meaning of its build is enough to give you chills. Was not able to attend the 9/11 ceremonies due to extreme congestion, but was privileged to see this building from afar.

Was expecting more. As a big fan of the original World Trade Center observatory, I had high hopes for the new space. I wouldn't exactly say those hopes were dashed, but the new observatory certainly didn't live up to my expectations.You begin your visit in the basement where videos of construction workers tell the story of 1WTC's rise. Is it weird that they barely allude to 9/11? Yes.Then you snake through the building's bedrock foundations, which looked fake. I asked: they are fake. However, any disappointment you may feel is alleviated by the INCREDIBLE elevator ride up to the top floor. The video of Manhattan's rise from wooded village to city of skyscrapers is amazing. It's a shame they only let you ride it once.Then, you watch a dorky video on the 102nd before finally being allowed to explore. The views are fantastic. Everything else? Meh. Overpriced merchandise in the gift shop, dumb interactive displays about NYC, boring food. Sure, you're there for the views not the food, but for $32 a ticket, I was surprised how run-of-the-mill everything was. I was not surprised that the over-eager staff treated everything like it was SOOOOO amazing, as if they had to convince everyone that it wasn't a waste of time.Tl;Dr: come for the view and the super cool ride to the top. Don't expect much more.

One World Observatory - worth the visit!. The was one of the highlights of our trip. We had tickets to go to the top, One World Observatory and we were wowed! The lift up is also a brilliant attraction in it's own right. The views are spectacular, we were lucky we had a lovely day for it. Would do it again next visit if we are lucky enough to come bac.
solemn, but breathtaking. very solemn memorial,. However, it is strikingly beautiful and a gorgeous reminder of the 9/11 tragedy. Must visit during any visit to NYC.

Amazing. From the minute we got in, the staff, the facilities, the place.. Amazing. Can't wait to get back for another visit! The elevator, the views, loved it all :)Bought tickets on line prior to going, by passed all the queues :) viator

LOVED EVERY MINUTE. I was fortunate enough to have visited the World Trade Towers and go up to the observatory back in 1986 with my highschool tour. Loved it. Heartbroken on 9/11 and had gone back in 2005 on the 10th of September...the subways were finally up and running down there and I had pizza from at a place that had re-opened for the first time since the tradgedy. They were literally steps from the original towers. So fastforward to now - the Freedom Tower is up, the One World Observatory open and I loved every minute of it. Yes, it's $32 U.S. per person, but depending on your feelings about the whole event and the rebuilding of the site, it's well worth it even with a crappy Cdn. dollar.

Wow. Wow. Wow. What a building!!!. Just back from a week long holiday in NYC, bought the tickets for OWO in advance, as a surprise present for my partner. We visited the One World Observatory after visiting the 9/11 Memorial and Museum on the same day, firstly, I would recommend doing those attractions in that order on the same day; Memorial Museum and then One World. You get a real sense of an uplifting creation from a city hit so hard by something so devastating. We have been telling all of our friends and family since returning home that they HAVE to visit the observatory, my partner has had no qualms with admitting how emotional he got at a certain surprise reveal! Granted the weather was amazing the day we visited, but the views are incredible regardless, you can stay there for as long as you'd like gazing down at the city and the staff are so friendly, polite and helpful. We felt like, out of all the "observatory attractions" in NYC, this one, is one where you just keep walking round and around to see something new or just wander knowing you're looking at the best view in the world. I purchased the basic $29.39 ticket and it is worth the money ten times over, cannot recommend this enough! It can be a little busy up there, but there are waves of people coming through and in between those waves are moments where its actually quite peaceful up there! Cant recommend this highly enough... DO IT!!

A great memorial.. We went to this beautiful place the day before the 14th anniversary, the atmosphere is calm and meaningful. It is a tribute to all who lost their lives and also to the city of New York that it has picked itself up and carried on. Our tour guide told us that since that terrible day people in New York have found a new energy and seem to be more inspired to go forward.

Outstanding. what a building. No long queue, only $32, one lift to the top in less than 60 seconds to the most amazing views. You have to do this even if you are afraid of heights because you do not get that horrible feeling.
VERY TALL. Its near the old World Trade Centres - didn't go in but you can walk around the base of it. It made me so giddy looking up at it!
views, views, views. best view on the entire Manhattan and new-York area.We had an one day flex pass and had no lines at all to reach the top.

Breath taking views!. Phenomenal views so worth the trip. The elevator ride on the way up was incredible and the reveal up Manhattan following viewing the screens was breath taking!!Best views NY has to offer, better than Empire and Top of the Rock.....except Top of the Rock offer the best central park views

The most spectacular views of NY. I never visited the Twin Towers so never saw the view they offered. This new building to mark their memory is amazing. The LED lift on the way up to the observation deck is an experience in itself.The most breath taking moment comes as you leave the lift and being to watch the video on the wall in front, which reveals itself to be a screen that lifts at the end to give you the best view up Manhattan. There is a restaurant there but it didn't open until 11am which I found crazy as there was a number of people that looked like they would have liked to grab breakfast with a view, us included.Definitely worth a visit. Highly recommended.

Breathtaking . I had purchased a ticket, or so I thought, to the observation deck. When I arrived at One World Trade Center I asked a gentleman named Al if I needed to get a ticket with my voucher. Al was eager to help me, and when he looked at my printed voucher he told me that he had never seen one like it. So Al got Christine involved and she told me the same thing. Then Christine got a nice gentleman named William to escort me to guest services where Ed assisted me. Ed did everything possible to try and verify my voucher but was ultimately unsuccessfully. I was very impressed with everyone who assisted me. Well, needless to say, I had to buy a ticket right there. I am so impressed with the staff, but I was blown away at my observation experience. From the moment you step into the elevator, you are inundated with sensory overload; I mean that in a good way. The 100 floor ride takes about 40 seconds and all the while images appear on the 3 walls. When you exit the elevator, an entire wall is displaying a movie of the views you will be experiencing. Afterwards you make your way to the next level which has a cafe and fairly fancy restaurant and bar. The top level has 360 degree views that are absolutely breathtaking. So don't miss this attraction when you are in New York.

It's great to be back downtown again!. The top of the WTC was always one of my favorite NY spots. It was a very emotional time to return and visit One World. The name alone says so much. The elevator is fabulous. You get a view of what NY looked like from the ice age to today. How quickly the world changes in less than a minute. The presentation was very emotional seeing NYC and then they opened the curtain to downtown NY in all its glory. The cheers and applause were amazing. The 360 view is wonderful and on a clear day you can see for +25 - 30 miles. It's nice to see the view again!

Disappointing. The 360 degree views from the observatory floor are truly breathtaking but, as with the (infinitely superior) ESB and Top of the Rock, it is pricey for what it is (i.e. a ride in an elevator and a chance to then wander, unguided, around a viewing floor). The venue offers an "explore NYC" app preloaded on to rentable iPads, which is intended to help you find out more about the city and all that you are seeing as you look out from the viewing floor, however, this comes at an additional cost and there's an annoying sales push on it as you enter the observatory floor. That said, I didn't see anyone actually take it up.....possibly because it will set you back an additional $15 per person over and above the entrance fee you've already paid just to get to the observatory in the first place! I must say, the app did look rather clever but, as I didn't rent it either, I couldn't say whether it is worth either the time or the additional expense.The exhibit as you first enter the site at basement level seems to have been installed in an effort to make visitors feel they are getting more bang for their buck than just a viewing opportunity, but there's really very little to it; it lacks substance and is really not that interesting. You can easily skip through it without lingering and rest assured that you're missing nothing of any great interest. The graphics of an evolving NYC as you ascend in the lift are pretty clever though. I also didn't "get" the point of the Sky Portal. This appears to be a video feed under part of the observatory floor showing footage of the street below. Essentially though, you are standing on a tv screen which is mounted under the floor - not on an actual glass floor. Sorry, but I see no point to this at all. It's just bizarre.... It's no CN Tower.I prebooked my tickets online in advance for a (reasonably) early morning slot. That turned out to have been a good idea (infact, I think it's their recommendation too) as I got in on time without having to wait at all, whereas the line for entry on spec was huge & slow by the time I came to be leaving.All in all, this will no doubt be / become one of the "must-visit" sights in NYC - not least because of its location and novelty. Personally, that is why I felt I should go but something about it somehow just left me a little disappointed at the end. Don't get me wrong, the views are incredible, but if you've already viewed NYC from above / been up to the viewing deck of the ESB and / or The Top Of The Rock (both of which offer outdoor viewing, (which this does not) and are very much better in my opinion), this experience will tick a box but won't do anything more.

"Must do".....but only because it's there. Disappointing.. The 360 degree views from the observatory floor are truly breathtaking but, as with the (infinitely superior) ESB and Top of the Rock, it is pricey for what it is (i.e. a ride in an elevator and a chance to then wander, unguided, around a viewing floor). The venue offers an "explore NYC" app preloaded on to rentable iPads, which is intended to help you find out more about the city and all that you are seeing as you look out from the viewing floor; you'll find there is a bit of a sales push on this as you enter the observatory floor, but I didn't see anyone actually take it up. This is possibly because it will set you back an additional $15 per person over and above the entrance fee you've already paid just to get to the observatory in the first place! I must say, the app did look rather clever but, as I didn't rent it either, I couldn't say whether it is worth either the time or the additional expense. The exhibit as you first enter the site at basement level seems to have been installed in an effort to make visitors feel they are getting more bang for their buck than just a viewing opportunity, but there's really very little to it; it lacks substance and is really not that interesting. You can easily skip through it without lingering and rest assured that you're missing nothing of any great interest. The graphics of an evolving NYC as you ascend in the lift are pretty clever though. I didn't really get the point of the Sky Portal; it's a video feed under the floor, rather than an actual glass floor so you're effectively standing on a tv screen showing picture of the street below, rather than on a glass floor directly over the street below. Sorry, but what actually is the point of that? It's no CN Tower.I pre-booked my tickets online in advance for a (reasonably) early morning slot. That turned out to have been a good idea (infact, I think it's their recommendation too) as I got in on time without having to wait at all, whereas the line for entry on spec was huge & slow by the time I came to be leaving.All in all, this will no doubt be / become one of the "must-visit" sights in NYC - not least because of its location and novelty. Indeed, it was for those reasons that I felt I had to go but something about it somehow just left me a little disappointed at the end. Don't get me wrong, the views are incredible, but if you've already viewed NYC from above / been up to the viewing deck of the ESB and / or The Top Of The Rock (both of which offer outdoor viewing, which this does not, and are better, in my opinion), the OWTO experience will tick a box but won't do very much more.

What a view!!. Fantastic place to visit. Very well organised and the fastest lift I have ever been in. The views are fantastic. We went up in the evening so we could watch the sun go down and enjoy the view in the dark...wow.

On top of the world. We booked tickets prior to our weekend in the city. It was incredible. The staff at the location were helpful and friendly. The VIEW was amazing. An elevator ride like none other.

Well worth a visit. We took the elevator to the top and enjoyed the video show during our short ride. We had a great lunch at the restaurant with very friendly staff and delicious food. Of course, the views of the city can't be beat.
A remarkable achievement. A must to see and remember all those who lost their lives in 9/11 and how America has rebuilt and shown the terrorists that they cannot win!

Worth the trip to the city in itself.. Make sure to book ahead and get there early or pay for the VIP/express pass as this is well worth it instead of waiting for 1 hour in line. The view is beautiful as is the building itself.
A must to visit. A must to visit> Very well organised. A must for travellers to remember the travesty which affected the world.

Magificent, uplifting, emotional ...... I used to work in the original WTC up to 2001 so for me this was a very emotional trip down memory lane and I am very glad I went along to OWO.The security to get in is well organised, polite and quick, the high-speed elevator with it's IMAX images is incredible, the moment the blinds are raised in the theatre to show you NYC in all its glory is jaw dropping. I spent close on 2 hours just looking out over the city with a big smile on my face and a tear in my eye remembering my time in the old complex. I never believed that the new building would be as good as the old one but I was mistaken, it is magnificent and a credit to all those who designed and built it. I thoroughly recommend any visitor to NYC takes a few hours to go and see the city from 100+ floors up !

Ride to The roof of the city....... An unbelievably fast elevator takes you literally to the top of New York City, the elevator ride itself is new and revealing, I won't give away the secret! The observation floor/deck is amazing with a 360 degree walk round view. If you visit the Big Apple this is a must but MAKE SURE you book in advance, not to be missed.
Marvelous. It's stunning the view from the rooftop. I have no words to describe the feeling you have while you're looking to big apple from the owtc. The price worths it!

Unbelievable feeling. I wasn't fussed on doing this as I thought the views would be similar to Rockefeller and Empire State, and at $32 I wondered if it was worth I. Well, I can tell you it was the best thing we did! The views are incredible and it was a very emotional experience. I would highly recommend to anybody!

World trade centre. So glad we done this went early in the morning bought out tickets $32 each and went straight up to the top what a view 100 time better than Empire State the lift experience both going up and down is magic the glass floor on the top that you can walk on and look right down I'd brilliant (not real but feels it )

On top of the City!!. We booked in advance online for tickets to the one world observatory, and i'm glad we did as the lines were long for the ticket booths as it was labour weekend!It was very much worth the wait as the views are amazing you really can see everything in NYC.The elevators are a cool touch so prepare your cameras as the video on the rise is very cool (and on the way down also)The theater section on arrival at the top is a brilliant touch too as i didn't expect what was going to happen. After a short introduction to a tablet you can hire you are on the deck, its a large space with views all around everywhere including Manhattan and its 5 boroughs.If your gonna visit the NYC building and have limited time i would do the one world and the top of the rock leaving the empire state out unless you have a lot of time.

Great view, but a bit of a let down. The view from the observatory was wonderful, yes. And before entering the One World building, visiting the memorial from the original towers was a moving experience, which was free and separate from the One World Observatory visit. But going up into this tower felt like a crowd control, Disney-like experience without the fun. It started with a fake cave area with plastic walls and dim lights that were supposed to represent the rock that the building is set in. Then on the way up to the observatory, the group was constantly stopped to give a presentation or a sales pitch. And of course, the observatory is indoors, so you are behind glass the entire time. Compared with the Empire State Building, in which you can basically just wait in line and go right up, and have the open air views, this was so frustrating. I finally just walked right past the obligatory photo taking because I had quite enough of their tourist requirements. Maybe this is a must-see in NYC, but be prepared to be handled by their well-trained handlers.

Lovely. Beautiful building to look at. Freedom Tower gave me a feeling of hope ! I had no inclination to enter the building but more just to look at the size of it and admire the citizens of NYC and their bravery.

Good New York experience. Very slick operation caters very well with a large number of visitors, the experience begins as soon as you enter the high speed elevator. Great views from the deck, well worth the money
Photo Op. The existing buildings are impressive and looking from the side of the reflection pool is a wonderful photo op. When they finally finish the area it will look great.

The curve of the earth. You rise to the top in less than a minute, while "viewing" a brief history of the site from hundreds of years ago. You can walk around the glassed-in area as long as you like, and rent a tablet that gives information about the sites you see (though I didn't do this as I am a former New Yorker). BEWARE - VERY expensive snacks and water at the top.

A good view of Downtown. The hottest attraction in NYC at the moment.It is definitely tall and it's meant to give you the "wow" factor. It did not do it for me but I can understand why people like it.After paying 32$, you will go in a fast lift that will take you in 42 seconds (if I remember correctly) up in the sky. There is plenty of space for everybody to enjoy the view. The windows are top to botttom and you have a 360 degrees view. You must go on a clear sky day or in the night (when it's more expensive but you will enjoy the spctacle of lights).I definitely had a good view of Downtown and Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty and a bit of New Jersey but no Uptown or Central Park. Overall not bad.

Amazing views-a must-see in NYC. This building is incredible. There are 360 degree views of NYC at the top, and there are also staff members giving talks about the city (history of the subway, good food, etc.). The views are so good (and so high) that a friend of mine thought they were from a plane. We bought tickets online ahead of time, and we were glad that we did because it saved us a lot of time waiting in the ticket line. Tickets for adults are $32 each. It is also very accessible by subway and taxi. I get motion sickness, so I would close your eyes when in the elevator because there is a video. I would combine a visit to the Observatory with a visit to the pools where the Twin Towers once stood. This whole area is a great tribute to 9-11.

Our favorite in NYC!!!. This was my family's favorite thing during our vacation to NYC. The elevator ride is amazing with all the photos of the different eras . It was an indescribable experience with amazing views!

wonderful,breath taking. At the top of the building you can see the wonderful city of new York, they have a very good presentation of 09/11.It was sad but the view was really wonderful, the building itself is very fabulous architecturally. this is a must see attraction in New York. Everything was well organized. Overall my family loved this place.

Fantastic!. I've never been to the old WTC observatory so I can't compare.The view is astonishing, right on top of NYC downtown!You will see the statue of liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, the Empire State, Chrysler and both sides of the island.The elevator has a wonderful video when climbing up and another even better when going down.There are two circles with screens that employees use to help you explore the big apple.Tip, best light is at 3 PM.Enjoy your tour!
One World Trade Center. It was a wonderful view from the observatory.It was a very moving experience to visit One World Trade Center.

Really well done, and obviously, wonderful views!. We have been coming to NY for many years - we remember visiting the old World Trade Center and have been watching One World Trade Center going up with interest. So we had to go up here this year! We went up on a clear sunny day and were very impressed with the whole experience. The elevator ride gives a visual history of Manhattan from before the island was inhabited to the present day - as you ride up you see Manhattan growing. On your right the south tower of the old World Trade Center briefly appears and disappears. It gives a sense of the history of the island / New York and also the ephemerality of buildings and historical events. There's a short film with images of New York when you come out of the elevator. I'm not quite sure what the purpose of this is, but it was fine. The observatory itself is great. They try to sell you a kind of iPad guide to New York which we bypassed, in favour of just wandering round looking at the view. We arrived at about 5pm (on a Thursday) and there was no line at all. We stayed for sunset and a view of the city at night, passing time in the bar (expensive, but you can't beat the view, and we had a table by the window). We had a great time. Also, every single member of staff we met was friendly and helpful, from the guys who checked the tickets, the security guard, everyone in the observatory, the waitress... You can buy a ticket in advance online to save time, either print-at-home or on a mobile device.

More than just an observatory. This experience was absolutely breathtaking!! I've been to a lot of observatories: the CN Tower in Toronto, the John Hancock building in Boston, etc. When I think of an observatory, I think of a place where you ride the elevator to the top, look around, and take pictures. This was so much more than that. There was a lot of history to learn, and some amazing videos about the construction of the new tower after 9/11. The elevator ride was smooth and so fast. We went 102 floors in the time it normally takes to go just a few floors in most buildings. The video as the elevator rose up showed Manhattan changing over time, from when it was first discovered and used for farm lands, to the present. Upon arrival to the first floor, there was a huge, skyline shaped screen that showed all the exciting things happening in the city at any given time, and when that was over, the screen lifted up in sections, revealing the spectacular view. I thought I might cry! Then we got to finally do the traditional walk around, look out, and take pictures sort of thing. However, there was also an interactive show where a "concierge" took you, virtually, to different tourist attractions around the city so you could get recommendations of things to do at any given moment. He also taught us a bunch of history and interesting facts about these attractions that I never knew, so it was really interesting. The ticket price was $32, which at first had me hemming and hawing, but it really was well worth it!

Amazingly Moving Experience - Fantastic Architecture. To walk the site, to see the pools surrounded by the names of those lost is an unforgettable experience. Tours of the grounds were sold out. The museum looked spectacular and the ride up the freedom tower is also available. Definitely worth the visit - might be better not on the weekend?
Worth the price. The elevator ride is unique! As you ride up you watch a show of the buildings of the boroughs of Manhattan being built. The views are fantastic

You must go up the Freedom Tower.. Breathtaking. Phenomenal. A MUST! We last saw this still being built in 2013. We had to go! Make sure you have your camera at the ready with plenty of memory! We had a beautiful clear day and could see for miles. Stunning!
Window on NYC. This is the window on NYC, amazing views and really useful interactive iPad apps(paid) that describe all the sites and the history. A must for any NYC visit.
amazing. Amazing sight how they managed to put this up so qUickly? Also very sad to see all the names on the mEmpirical.

Wow. This is a must-do attraction in New York! The views were absolutely incredible, you can't believe how high up you are, and are able to see for miles in all directions. The elevator up to the top is also a fun experience, and takes less than a minute!
Breathtaking!. We were so impressed by the replacement structure and fountains. It's truly a sacred site and is a must see in NYC.

good observatory. We got in on 9:45 on monday, perfect weather, no lines, and mastercard discount. I think the presentation before opening the window shades were a nice touch, and the observatory it self had a good view, something to do once when in new york city.

Great view. First time visit with three adults. Visited World Trade Center historical area in 2014, but the new building was not open. Well worth the visit to the World Trade Center site, the building, and floors 102-100. Tips: get tickets on line - I used cell phone in the morning; go late on the afternoon - we arrived after 2 PM.

Looks really cool, but we didn't plan ahead!. We were able to see this building from the exterior, but there were not tickets available for passage when we were there. I've seen photos from the inside and would've loved to have that opportunity! Plan ahead, book through oneworld.com and you'll be all set. It costs about $32/adult to secure a ticket.

Good view of the city but lack innovation . Obviously has great views of the city. But pictures often had glare from the glass and photosensitive of people were backlit. The elevator ride itself was the highlight of the experience. But they missed out on the restaurant and creating a memorable experience.
Amazing!!!!!. The view it's incredible, they have a restaurant and souvenir shop on the top of the building I really like it and I recommend the trip

Great view, but only indoor experience. Great View of NY, but no open space, just indoor walk with glass front. Taking pictures is quite difficult due to reflections in the windows :(A bit too much of "Disney" before entering the observation area

Keep The Visitors Moving!. The elevator ride and views were spectacular. Unfortunately views were consistently blocked by individuals who were sitting on the sills or standing right in front of the windows eating and/or engaging in social conversations totally oblivious to others around them. There were too many people allowed in the viewing area, and having to wait for the professional photographer was annoying. We walked right passed. We are happy we did it, but hope these kinks can be worked out.

Top of the Free World. As a life-long New Yorker, I can easily be skeptical about visiting here with the potential for extreme commercialism. However, it is well worth the time and money as you will get a once in a lifetime, 360 degree view of all New York has to offer. Plan on an hour walking the full circumference to take it all in. If you have extra time, walk over to Brookfield Place and visit the two Food Halls and see the marina and river view from ground level. To return, rather than crossing busy West Street, take the escalators in the Winter Garden down into the PATH terminal to view the underground white marble walkway and "bathtub," part of the engineering that keeps seawater from flooding in. At the other end, you will exit the temporary PATH terminal and be back on Vesey Street.

Best NYC View. This is not just an observation tower, it's an experience - you'll see. Even the ride up is one of a kind, and how the city is presented - is a testament to the men and women who gave their time and talents to this new World Class Monument. If possible, hang around for the sunset over Jersey, then look north to the twinkling lights of midtown. Night pictures are a little tricky, watch for reflections behind you, and the multi-pane glass may require a little post production editing. Day pix, no problem, and use your panorama feature that most cameras today have. The one negative, there are no real benches to relax on, just the small and low casings below the windows where people park themselves, making access close to the window, a little difficult. But it all works out, maybe management has plans for better seating. And if you know the weather will be good when you plan to go, buy your tix on line. You'll save time by not standing in the cue and feel like a celebrity as you go to the front of the line. Staff is super friendly too, well worth the relatively high ticket price.

Wow, what a view! . I was so fortunate to be able to visit on a crystal clear bluebird sky day! The views were spectacular and it made be so proud to be a New Yorker! The elevator ride is spectacular! Make sure to buy your tickets in advance!
Beautiful Building. What a beautiful building. We saw it from the ground only and did not get to go inside, but it is well worth the visit. Take the Staten Island Ferry and see it form the boat.

Worth a Visit. We went up the one World Tower having bought a Priority ticket for early in the morning. The Priority ticket was not much of an advantage and I would not do that again.The lift ride and the presentation at the the top were very good and a great intro to the observatory. If you were hoping to get great photo's from the top you will be disappointed. The large windows are bad for reflections. I was surprised that they did not have anti reflective glass.Also as we chose to go early it meant that the rising low sun (Sept) was not good for photography. Its a toss up with low sun or extra smog later in the day.We enjoyed the experience and chose this over the other view options and were not disappointed .

Awesome View. My husband went in the One World Trade Center, I was scared it was open aired, so I did not. He was very impressed!, He even enjoyed the elevator ride, as they have a video playing as you go up. The View was Awesome! He wished I would have went up, and so do I now.

A beautiful and moving tribute. A very moving tribute. Very well done and organized. The fountains in the shadows of the former Twin Towers foundations and the Memorial Museum were also very beautiful.
I must visit. Provides the best skyline view in the city and has a fantastic tribute to the history and to those who helped build the tower.

Spectacular evening!. Spent the most amazing evening at One World Observatory two nights ago. I knew I'd feel really sad being there, but the tour was conducted in such a classy and beautiful way, that I was able to appreciate the beauty of it all in a very respectful way. It was something I will never forget, and the views at sunset were breathtaking. Well done.

Magnificent Replacement. A very impressive building which is beside the site of ground zero. Another tower is at present being built next door. The two memorial fountains on the site of the twin towers are likewise impressive. The names of those who died are engrave around the edge of each memorial. Security guards make sure that the sites are respected at all times. The building is as imposing as the original twin towers

Must do in NYC. Totally worth the trip to the top, especially on a clear day. It is a spectacular view! We recommend having lunch at the top. A little pricey but the food is surprisingly good! Very good experience.
Best viewing experience. The whole viewing experience is fantastic, not just because of the amazing views, but the way the whole thing is managed and staged. well worth the entrance fee.

One World Observatory. For our tastes, there was too much "Disneyesque" background with the piped in music and not enough core value. There were 2 stages called the City Pulse where a staff member did a pre-programmed presentation on the city within a large circular display. These were placed directly in front of the north and south vantage points blocking off the section of windows that were the most likely to be the views folks wanted to see (straight up Manhattan) and directly south to the tip and the Statue of Liberty. For our money, the Empire State Building left this one in the dust with historical information on its construction, audio tours that really did a very good job of explaining what you were seeing plus you could actually be outdoors to take photos without the worry of angled glass or reflections. If you do go, go when it first opens before the lines get long and there are 100 people with selfie sticks clogging up your views of the city while they take photos of themselves checking each photo before deciding to take it again, and again, and again....

Just Out of this World!!!. My family and I purchased our tickets at the location. All the employees were extremely efficient. My 8 year old son is so fascinated w/elevators. He was mesmerized throughout this ride to the tippity top. It was a sure (29 seconds) breeze up, with incredible views and sounds to the 102 floor. We enjoyed having lunch at One Mix. Karen was our truly phenomenal waitress there. She catered to our every needs. My OWO Burger was so very tasty. It was a tad pricey due to it being a touristy place, and should be expected. Afterwards, enjoyed shopping in the OWO Store. In the end, there is absolutely no other place better to visit for a true NYC Experience. Oh what a feeling!!!

Long may it stand. After 911, it was very hard visiting this area and not seeing the two towers that have long been part of the New York Skyline. However, I took my family to visit the WTC. The new tower is a very nice looking building and great representation of the people of New York. I did not have time to enter the building, but I did love the exterior. However, just being in that area made me sad so if you're planning to visit that and the 911 museum, you might want to bring some tissues.

You can see for miles and miles. The water features to commemorate the lives lost on 9/11 take your breath away. Then as you start the OWO tour the sound bites are beautiful. The lift experience is genius. Then heading to the views of the city are stunning. Well worth a visit.

A great view and a great place.. Awesome views, very friendly and welcoming staff. Interesting gift choices in the store, overall a special place to visit. The line to leave appeared to be very long but from the end of the long line to the street was only 15 minutes. Our only disappointment was not being able to see the artwork on display in the lobby. It was featured on tv shows but not available for the public to view.
NYC visit. Only had the chance to see this building from the round, but it is incredible. The designers have done well to create a unique and stylish building.

Fabulous!!!. I am shocked at some of the poor reviews- I loved this. Highlight of my trip and wouldn't hesitate to go back. People complain there is no outside viewing platform - did they not look up first? We went first thing in th morning- no queues and no need for priority pass. We found all the staff helpful and polite. We took the $15 I pad and found it really helpful at identifying buildings and good value. Cocktails in One Dine were great too. Didn't want to leave.......
Amazing. Seeing I am scared of heights, all I can say is WOW,totally breathtaking views 360 degree vista. No matter what money you pay the views are awesome. A definite must to do in New York.

Informative and wonderful views. This is a slick new operation and very impressive from the moment you step in the elevator which has amazing digital presentation of life through the ages in NY The video at the top is amazing and I won't add a spoiler. We took the computer guides but not sure they were worth the money

Great Views and Awesome Elevator Ride. The Willy Wonka elevator ride alone is worth the visit. The elevator is one giant video screen that shows a video of the area on the way up and on the way down. On the way down, it feels like you are in the glass elevator floating around. It is truly incredible. The views are awesome once at the observation deck. However, for photos, I am partial to the Empire State Building because there are no window reflections. However, this is a must do attraction.
line vs view. The line up to get in is massive and time consuming but the view is outstanding and worth it. It's right beside the memorial so a good place to stop and reflect
Magnificent. A don't miss if you visit New York, 4th highest building in the world, magnificent views of New York especially if you are lucky enough to go on a clear, sunny day.

Top Spot!. Go for an early visit and hope for a clear day because the views up and down Manhattan are truly spectacular. Good value but don't expect much in the way of food although coffee and snacks are available at the top. Excellent iPad views are worth the extra.

This is the one !!!. What a view an experience you won't forget in a hurry, fastest lift to top and don't forget to put your video on going up or down the lift you will be surprised , food and drink available at the top I believe you have to purchase a ticket and booking time to qualify to have a meal up there, but snacks available and a great shop for momento's of your day .

Unrivalled views from a great height!. Amazing! the trip to the observatory is well worth it for unrivalled views! we ate in the restaurant and the food is good but the drinks cost you!The lift up is something else!Worth paying for the VIP tickets to avoid the que!!
Great lift. didnt have to queue for long before we got in have your camera ready for the lift its amazing your at the top in no time views amazing

Must see. Can't help but have great views from so high up and one is able to walk 360 degrees around the top to see all of Manhattan, New Jersey, Statue of Liberty. Well organized event but buy timed tickets online before arriving.Reflecting pools / memorial of Twin Towers makes one sad and angry for the senseless act of terrorism.

Amazing views. Even if you've already been up the Empire State or rockafella Center you should make the trip here as the views back up Manhattan are breathtaking. When we went which was 12 noon on a Wednesday it was surprising quiet with no queues and entry straight away. Lovely friendly service well worth a visit.

Wow another view to see NYC!!!. This place not just a observation desk!!its always a historical place!!and bottoms to the top you see and feel this history and power of this city!!and they a lot of entertainment on top such as restaurant with amazing view,bar with friendly staff!!

Worth every penny !. I already visited NYC several times and thus have some experience in the activities there. I was a bit sceptic when a friend asked me to go to Oneworld Observetory, because I imagined it to be "just another tall buildung" you got up an look around. But it really was an experience, they created something diffenrent to the other observatories you visit in NYC. It is not only the views (those are great as well) but rather the experience around it. I don't want to spoil... you have to visit it yourself, you won't regret it. I went there for the first time slot at 9 a.m. and had to wait only seconds.

A must in NYC!. The observatory gives you an uniqur look over NYC and is definetly worth the price. The testemonials in the lobby and the elevator ride is cool, but it pales to the opening of the blinds and the observatory in itself. Big plus for the interactove ipad-tours. The café food was good, although a bit pricey. Friendly and attentive staff. Would suggest to go when it opens before it gets too crowded.
Best Lift Ride!. The ride in the lift is absolutely brilliant, only for that it's worth the visit! Beautiful views even if they are through a window so not great for taking photos.

Spectacular!. On a clear day you can certainly see forever! This building is beautiful inside and out. The view is absolutely breathtaking!!! I would say get a ticket in advance....got mine the morning I left....it saves waiting on the ticket-buyers line. The line runs smoothly and is very organized. Everyone goes through a metal detector so you can bring anything you want with you. The elevator from ground floor to 102 Floor takes 60 seconds which you don't even feel because you're watching a video of New York from the 1600s to the present. At the top you watch another video about New York and then the screen opens to the actual view. Make sure you go on a clear day because if not the view wouldn't be as good and you'd waste your money. ($32.-18-64) There are 3 viewing floors and you can get up very close to the windows. Well worth it and a great tribute to all who died in 9/11!

It Really Feels Like You Can Reach Out to Embrace the World.. What a fantastic place to visit.From the moment you enter and start your assent the experience just carries you along.You are at the top almost before you realise you are moving.Even the lift is really special.And when those doors open and you are given a presentation and when the screen lifts be prepared to be blown away!WOW!!What a building and what a memory.Fabulous.Lunch at the top is highly recommended.
We will Never Forget. Gorgeous building that is a testimony to survival and determination. As you look skyward, you are awestruck by the buildings shape.
Fantastic views. I would advise anyone to prebook a timed ticket. Then no need to queue that way and you are quickly in the super speedy lift. 360 degree views across New York, not to be missed
Beautiful Building . You can't help but see the One World Trade Center from everywhere you go in lower Manhattan. It's a beautiful building.

Amazing Views. A visit to One World is a must, Fantastic 360 degree views, it was a bit misty when we went up but it didn't make the experience any less, the elevator ride up is unbelievably quick. Would defiantly recommend.

Best views of NYC. Make this place a must visit on your stop here. Great views of the city. Make sure you book online beforehand & skip all the queus. You get to go on 3 different levels & their is a gift shop & restaurant also.

A good way to end your holiday in new York. Pre book your timed tickets for a Monday if you have a Mastercard as it gives you 20% discount.Its certainly worth going up this tallest building as the views are incredible. There is the opportunity to rent an iPad to guide you round - ended up being more of a nuisance as we just wanted to look and take photos.As well as this being the new One World Trade Center it is also known as the Freedom Tower and the One World Observatory. A little confusing to the tourist. Tip: buy the books that the street sellers are trying to sell you as you can not get these inside and they are interesting.

Great for tourists and New Yorkers!. We bought our tickets in advance and went early so we did not wait in any lines that I normally see forming at the entrance. Highly recommend doing that. The whole experience was very cool...even the elevator ride! The views of New York and Jersey from the top are incredible. Proof of how well we can rebuild while also paying respect to what once was.

Great view. Amazing view over the downtown and surrounding borroughs, we were able to see even the beaches by the ocean. During the ride up, there is projection on the history of the city and how it changed in time, it's really cool. But as with the Top of the Rock, be sure to come as soon as possible, the tickets are timed and you don't want to wait for a long time.

Pass 3 hours in 30mn. Stay the hole day up there if you like! Though the day has to be perfectly clear to see the round of earth that you can grasp from there. Appart from the view, surely impresive, you got the cinema-like lift, which distracts you with the whole story of building New York City, bringing you more than 100 floors up without you even noticing it. And appart from the attractive restaurant, you'll pay 32 dollars your ticket... And you'll surely stay longer than you thought. You can easily advice to those who prefer to wait for you downstairs, to meet them back out of any other cinema.

Top of the World. We have been up many towers and buildings in many cities and this has to be one of the best experiences. Not only because it is so high and the views are amazing but because it was so well run making it very easy. We stood in line for 5 minutes to buy tickets then went straight through security and to the Sky Pod elevators (have your video ready). Through to a quick movie presentation with an impressive ending. You are then through to observatory. To top it all off we enjoyed a cocktail in the bar while waiting for the bad weather to pass.

Wow, blown away by this exhibit!. Unreal experience, especially the 3D animated film in the elevator up 102 floors in 60 seconds, didn't even know it was moving! NYC did a fantastic job on the observatory tour and the bar/restaurant at the top was fantastic! Gotta do it!

Out of this world. Booked up online very little wait to enter, ride up in lift very entertaining showing development of nyc over time got to floor 102 in less than a minute ,another short video with good sound then screen rises to reveal view ,fantastic ,do your self a favour and visit ,you will not be dissappointed

Great views from the observatory. We were not originally planning to visit the One WTC Observatory but found ourselves walking by it at a time that there was a very short line, so we decided to do it. It's expensive but worth doing once. The views from the top are amazing (360-degree views of the city), but it is very crowded and it's hard to get in to take photos from some windows. Also, some of the windows are not perfectly clean, although it may be unreasonable to expect them to clean them constantly with such crowds. Still, we are glad we visited, and we did get some great photos. They take your photo on the way in and then give you a chance to buy it. We didn't bother because the backdrop is fake--better to take your own photos against the actual views, if you can get a clear space to do so.
needs a whole day. very intense.... i really liked it quite a lot really nothing like it. i would give it a whole day to really experience

One world. Highlight of trip for me what a magnificent view,elevator ride was out of this world,the viewing deck and if you are brave enough the viewing portal in the floor.We pre booked which I suggest is a good idea cos it gets busy.Restaurent and shop at top.No visit to NYC complete without visit here
Beautiful. Although I did not go inside, the building is beautiful from up close and from afar. It lights up the skyline on a cruise of the harbor as well. A must see!

If Carling did Views of New York ................. Oh ....... the view. Nothing more needs to be said. Pick a clear day (obviously) .. The place itself is fantastic, the lift up there, the bar and restaurant, even the shop and staff. 360 degree view. Also go as it gets dark, just fantastic and great for photographers.

The Best View in New York. Beats ESB and The Rock for its aspect although updown is limited due to the skyscrapers around the ESB!!! Everwhere else is superb. After entering take a photo of the world map and note the number of visitors from your country. Fast elevator. Do not take any further photos until the staff finally release you to wonder. Every you have seen you will see again. Good shop on top. Link with the (9/11 Memorial ) Tip - look up as you descend in the elevator to appreciate its speed.
Wow. Just wow. Oh My God. What a visit. Outstanding views. If you visit New York you must visit here. Just a totally fantastic experience .

Its a must for sightseers.. The best view in NY by far. Very well done. Take photos of the world map as you enter. Do not take any more until the staff finally let you free. Views of the harbour, Brooklyn, and mid Manhattan are stunning. No view of Uptown passed the E.S.B.e as the buildings block the view. Go to The Rock for these.

Multimedia Elevator and Spectacular Views Make This a Must Do. Don't be put off by the price. Do it! As you are heading from the memorial pull out your phone and make a Timed Reservation on the website for about 15 minutes from the time you hit the submit button. Then walk to the front of the line and get right in. No hassles, no worries, no problems.The experience is wonderful. The story of the trade center is told by the people who built it as you make your way to the elevators that will take you over 100 floors in just under 1 minute!The elevators are fully multimedia enabled. The walls are screens that depict Manhattan from the earliest days right up to the present in a sequence that builds and changes over time as you rise to the top floor. Very well done.You'll see a short video upon your arrival explaining more about the building and what you're about to see. You'll then have the opportunity to get a virtual guide tablet. If you're not familiar with NYC, get it.Then you are down to the viewing platform area (2 stories high) which gives you a full view of the city and 4 or 5 different States on a clear day. Just beautiful.Net-Net: Must see and do if you are in NYC. If you have to pick between this and the Empire State Building, pick this.

Awe inspiring building. This is a building that everyone should see as it is the replacement for the twins that we lost. The new observatory at the top gives a new perspective on viewing the Big Apple

Amazing place. One World Trade Observatory is an site in New York City that must not be missed.It overlooks the memorial sit which in itself is a awe inspiring and soul searching site.The observatory gives you a view of the city that you have never had before. From the ground floor ride in the elevator to the 360 degree views of the entire island is just jaw dropping.The whole process flows smoothly. I would recommend buying your ticket before hand and get the priority pass. Well worth the money. Also, I would recommend finding out the time of the sunset and planning your trip to the top to get the most amazing photos.But try to get to a West facing window early as they will fill up quickly.

Commercial but stunning. It goes without saying that One World Trade Center has one of the best vantage points in New York City. The view is stunning, and you don't need to hear anything else if that's all you're looking for. It is the tallest building on the continent, and for that alone the cost is justifiable.1WTC is marvelous inside and out, and no doubt that it can be best experienced when going to the top. The glass and marble give the place an eccentric and modern look that's hard to not appreciate. The elevator is really a highlight of the whole experience, as it takes under a minute from the visitor center near the ground to reach the observatory, a mind-blowing feat in concept alone. It's just too bad that it doesn't have windows!My biggest complaint about the whole thing is how commercialized it is. The attempt to further inflate the already steep $32 a person to merely go to the top by adding priority lines and photo ops is a little too in-your-face at times, and it dampens the raw authenticity of being able to peer out the windows at the city below. In addition, the pre-show after leaving the elevator (slight spoiler alert) has a dramatic, and admittedly epic, conclusion, but it feels somehow corny and out of place when compared to the city's other skyscraper observatories.If you are willing to shell out the money to go to One World Observatory, you will enjoy it. It is not the best observatory in NYC in terms of experience, but the view is something you probably won't want to miss anyway. Just leave this one until after you've had your fill of the ESB and Top of the Rock.

One World Observatory - fabulous!. We loved the "infinity" perspective ....looking up from the benches at the bottom, before we took the high speed elevator to the observatory. The tour was exceptionally well organized and allowed plenty of time for 360 view of the city and surrounding areas. Took lots of photos through the thick glass. There is a snack shop and gift shop available, restrooms and entertaining guides pointing out highlights of the city.

Very Proud to See the Resilience of New York!. Very moving to be in the tallest building in the western hemisphere and look down at the 9/11 Memorial. The only reason I put "very good" is the crowds up in the observatory were just too massive and the sales pitches too much! The bar was very expensive as NYC finds so many ways to tax EVERYTHING!

Recommended as the first thing you do when visiting Manhattan.. I have lived in NYC since 1981 and been to the observation of the former WTC Tower. The new one is more like the Chicago Sears/Willis Towers as there is no longer an outdoor, open air section. The entire observation deck is enclosed in glass. The view is spectacular, as usual. The elevator to the top is much improved as compared to the old one, in speed, comfort (you do not feel any G force), and entertainment values. There is a panoramic video display that shows Manhattan as a wilderness flat land when you are on the 1st floor, and time lapses into the concrete jungle of today as you reach the top floors. The video even showed the rise of the old WTC Towers, and their disappearance from the Manhattan landscape. If you want to spend more than the $32 for the elevator ride (by the way, Empire State Building, which is NOT worth your time, is $30!), you can rent a tablet that will tell you interesting histories of any landmark you focus its camera on. This is recommended as the first thing you do when you visit Manhattan.
Worth the ride UP!. Very zany and done with education and history in mind...great viewing, lots of helpers...did not eat or shop
9/11 Weekend. This was one of the most emotional and moving sites to visit in NYC. The new design is awesome. Great tributes to our fallen. Loved this place.

Only seen from the outside but wonderful.. As the heading suggests, we saw this from the outside only (top deck of a bus, Brooklyn Bridge, harbour cruise and most vantage points in New York)A stunning structure which makes a real statement to the mindless cowards that caused it to be built.'New York stands firm'

Complete 360 degree views !!. Complete view of the whole island strip of New York. Stunning viewing experience from the top of the building. We can see Jersey City, Coney Island, staten island, brooklyn, queens, manhattan strip....

Magnificent Outstanding View. Outstanding unbelievable really beautiful 360 view of Manhatan and much more!
