However as we were there about an hour, this did clear slightly. Having visited the twin towers, this was a really emotional experience. The journey in the lift was really interesting and I would have liked to have spent longer doing that, but also the mini exhibitions once at the viewing gallery were excellent. A big difference between the twin towers and the freedom tower was that you are inside at all times. This does feel safer, although it does obscure your pictures. The footprints of the twin towers, must be seen and give you the opportunity to pay your respects to all those lost during 9/11. Altogether this is excellent value for money, but I would have really appreciated having my printed ticket (purchased in advance) for a proper ticket to be kept as a souvenir. A must do in New York.
Solemn & Respectful. A wonderful memorial to the fallen. Fountains & surrounds a great tribute.Am proud that the fallen be honoured this way.Must see

Pride of New York. If you come to New York, you should visit the new World Trade Center and also go up to the One World Observatory. I would give you a tip to get the VIP without paying extra. We didn't book in advance. My husband went to the ticket counter and never think that he will pay for VIP to cut the line but he used the Citi World Master card. They told him that he is the VIP and get few dollars off from regular price. Once he came out, we shown our VIP ticket and we skip the line to the top. So cool!!! The view is New York City as we have seen all the time but to be here to support the new World Trade Center is our pride as New Yorkers.

Great tribute building. I like the architecture of this building that seems to touch the sky just above the 9/11 memorial. Aside from the 360 view over NYC, Brooklyn, Ellis Island, statue of liberty, you can enjoy amazing visual effects and several explanations on interactive screens or huge animated walls. The highlight is the elevator, on the way up and down the walls get animated by views from the city; not for the faint hearted! You can rent an interactive tablet describing the view for 50usd ! We booked our tickets online .

Did not meet expectations. Great views from observation deck after being fleeced for a coffee and a pastry without any seating. Arrived 10.15 after booking on line which was not necessary as there was no queue. The lift ride was very cleverly done although for some it may make them feel uneasy whereas the Burj Khalifa in Dubai (Tallest Building in the World) you do not realise you are moving until you look at the floor numbers Whizzing up to floor 124. On a sunny day your photographs are ruined by the reflection on the glass and if you photograph items below you get the reflection of the silver grills at the base of the windows. No outside viewing area better off at Empire State Building or Rockefeller Centre.
Seen from all over the city. A magnificent structure that can be seen from all over the city and a beautiful part of the skyline from outside the city.

Just Do It. They have done a great job to make it a memorable experience. The price ($32) may seem steep but it's comparable to Rock Center or the Empire State. I'd like to take the elevator ride again. Those 48 seconds passed by too quickly! The prices at the gift shop were horrendous but I didn't feel the need to buy anything. Highly recommended visit.
Great View. Expensive, but very interesting and more to see and explained as expected. Be on time, not too early, never to late...

New attraction in New York at highest point. We have taken decision to visit the same on Holiday/ Sunday to avoid the rush and long waiting time.We did on line booking for fixed time.One should either visit the observatory before or after New York city tour to identify the location and land marks.The glass platform from where you see cars going is the best experience.the view is excellent from all angles. 360 degree view is one of the finest from the tower.The show/short film before the entry to observatory is mind boggling.Love to spend min an hour

Fantastic views. It was a clear day so we could see for miles.Fantastic lifts well organised nice restaurant and bar at the top with 360degree viewing platform. Would be disappointing on a dull or misty day.

A somber moment with spectacular views. The architecture of 1 World Trade Center is stunning rising out of all the debris. We alloted half day to see the ground level memorials and to take the ride to the top. The presentation is tasteful with a few take-your-breath-away surprises along the way. It was worth the effort for this once in a lifetime visit for us.

Must see but the fastest way is to.... The presentation is wonderful. Kind of reminded me of walking through the lines to get on a ride at universal studios. The one big problem of course is the long lines. We eliminated that by buying tickets online for 7pm. The line was actually a little slower during that mealtime AND you get to see daytime and night time (at least right now)If we had to do it again we would have done 6:30.

Great views, but value for money?. We'd pre-booked our tickets, but I'm not really sure why - there were people turning-up to buy who went in at the same time as us, and people with VIP tickets who paid a lot more to jump two spaces in the line (glad we didn't do VIP!). It takes maybe 15 minutes to get in and there are no restrooms until you've done so, so be warned :) The elevators up and down and quite incredible for the foresight someone had on making the journey interesting, although as you're standing right next to the walls its a not quite as amazing I'm sure as if you wever in the centre of the evelator alone. Once up there's a 360 degree view of Manhattan, and I'm sure much much further on a nice day (ours was cloudy so you could see maybe 5-10 miles). The $15 for the ipad augmented reality device seemed a rip-off and should be inlcuded in the already hefty entrance price! It was certainly worthwhile doing and a "should do" if you're in New York City.
New York visit. espetacular view! worth it!...from the entrace to the top the experience of this observatory it´s amazing!...it´s easier if you book an hour in the website and print the ticket!

Nice to be part of history. This is the new WTC tower and it is an interesting place to visit. Not open for that long and still very popular when we went, this meant a bit of queuing to get in. However once in it was an express ride to the observatory and after a brief talk we were left to spend as long as we liked admiring NYC from its tallest building. Breath taking views all around. We had a light meal in the cafe part of the restaurant just to be able to say we had. My one criticism of this area is there aren't many places to sit. More tables than stood or chairs, which is a bit odd. A worthwhile experience though and highly recommended

Great architecture with very subtle and kind tribute all round. "Whilst we don't forget our past, we look at the future with hope" - or something along those lines, was written in one of the walls around the site. A very touching tribute to those lost in 2001, without being too insistent on the reasons why - which is nice. If you want to go up to the top of WTC it'd take about 1 hr if you haven't pre-booked the time slot online, tickets $32; or get express ticket for $54 (but still have the 20 min queue). The visit itself once you are at the top, it takes you around 20 minutes to do a lap with the 360 degrees view of NY. We were lucky it was a crystal clear day and we could see 60+ miles away, around 2pm. Manhattan et all, very spectacular and always entertaining.Looking down from the WTC to where the old twin towers used to be is quite a feeling, if you had the chance to go up them before 2001 - which I did in 1991. The fountains they have put in their memory are quite special too. Not many, or any, US flags but just dark colours and water flowing and all the names... enough to remember. I couldn't help but look up in the air and wonder what people in the towers must have felt when those planes came their way... RIP.I'll probably go back again one day next time I am back.

So so View of The City. Little disappointed. Way too much shepherding and corralling by staff in and out of lifts and go this way go that way and so on. Given the history of why this place is here can understand lots of staff. But big sell on hiring a viewing guide and so on. Tacky merchandise.Think there are better more authentic places to enjoy an elevate view of the city and beyond
Views from Observatory are Superb. Visiting One World Trade and the 911 Museum are overwhelming, given all the souls lost here. The views from the observatory are superb.

Sadly commercial. We were lucky no pre booking, queued for less than ten minutes and we were on our way to the top. Well thought out extras to view on the upward journey but the wait to be taken for another $15 dollars for a tablet guide was embarassing and slightly cheeky. The devices were good in theory but people used them at full volume after being encouraged to share. So trying to sit or stand quietly taking in the amazing views with a bit of contemplation of why we were there ( after all there is a memorial directly below after all) and there was the noise of these iratating machines and also the extra infomation being yelled out from the stands either side of the viewpoint ... not necessary. The shop was also on the same floor space so a crowded bottle neck when there needed to be more space really. We had been caught out with our plans and needed something to eat, food completely over priced $24 for a cheese toastie and chicken panini. Nothing special and you couldn't even sit down to eat. It is amazing but for the best overall experience The rock or Empire state building definitely.
another landmark. A wonderful new monument to say goodbye to the twin towers. It is very obvious from lots of aspects.

Fourth tallest building & fastest elevator in the world - recommended!. We visited One World on Monday 31 August at 9am, it was at opening time so it wasn't too busy and we went straight downstairs to the elevators without any delay (we had bought tickets online in advance). I won't spoil the experience for others but the elevator ride was an experience in itself & so fast! Once up to the viewing deck we were ushered into a narrow area for a short show which was brilliant and really well done. After that we were free to observe the view, and what a fabulous view it is! There are so many amazing views from rooftops all across manhattan, but this vantage point is unique being right at the bottom of Manhattan Island. I would really recommend this to everyone, it's a must do. The elevator ride down was very fast another surprise experience too. We had a coffee & pastry in the cafe, on the viewing deck this was very expensive and there was no seating just standing tables which I really didn't like so I would suggest you avoid this.
Great views . We visited on a clear day and loved the views. It was quite crowded and the price is quite high but we were still glad to have visited.

A must!. They have done an amazing job building this and the whole area is vibrant, but very intense naturally. A place to visit and remember those who lost their lives. The fountains with their names around us a beautiful touch.

Awesome . Are you in NYC it's a must to visit the Observatory and overlooking Manhattan. Fantastic overview and rent the IPad for further details.Remember to make an reservation several day's before. Standard tickets are okay.

Long Queues. If you are short of time in NY (especially during school holidays) you probably should avoid any of the viewing towers unless that is what you came for. 4hr waiting time both days we were there

Amazing, must-see views!. The experience begins with the elevator ride, where you watch a transformation of NYC from a forest of trees to a land of skyscrapers. It goes quickly, so I'd recommend not wasting time trying to record it on your phone and just enjoying that part of the experience while it lasts.Of course the views are incredible! 360 degrees - there's nothing you can't see. I purchased the expedited/flex pass and found it was worth the extra money. We bypassed a large line for tickets, then a large line for the elevators, and went straight to the top the moment we entered the building.

An unexpectedly good treat on our last day. As my guide book was published in 2014, this didn't get a mention. We decided to do it on our last day, having done the Top of the Rock but not the Empire State (though I had done that on a previous trip), and it turned out to be one of the highlights of the trip. Maybe we were lucky with our timing, but we hadn't booked, we turned up around 1200 and only had to wait about 5 minutes to buy standard tickets that allowed us to go straight in. As others have said, the lift is great. But once you arrive at the top, there is plenty of room and lots of space. You are not outside, but there is plenty of room, lots of window space, and it's so much less hectic than either Top of the Rock or the Empire State. Being lower Manhattan, there are good views of the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Greenwich/Soho etc, as well as being able to see a long way into New Jersey and Long Island (I admit a nerdy enjoyment from being able to spot, and watch planes taking off and landing at all three airports!) Also enjoyed looking down on the helicopters. Recommended.

Wow, freedom tower. Wow, just wow. My daughter didn't want to come up so my husband stayed with her. Me and my little boy went up, and we loved it. It's done very well and is a definite tourist attraction and a must do for those visiting New York. Views are spectacular

Great views. This is a well thought out attraction that tries to offer something different to it's competition: ESB and TOTR. The elevator ride up is good, I really enjoyed the time lapse video but would have been better if fewer people were in the elevator for a full view.Then you watch a video that basically shows highlights of New York. When the video ends the screen lifts and you get your first glimpse of the skyline - a nice touch!This is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere and yes the view is breathtaking. However, it feels a little bit cheapened by the things that try to set it apart - the view of the street below was a nice idea in theory but doesn't add anything. Queues were well managed and it was spacious on the viewing platform, but would have benefitted from an outside area for a more authentic experience.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking in many ways. A must see. New York is a fantastic place, and this new building and the presentation of the views was fantastic!

A must when visiting NYC. Just amazing a must for any visitors. Combine it with a visit to the museum, the lift to the viewing floor is amazing, its supposed to be one of the fastest lifts in the world, your ears pop on way up. Pre book tickets as you get through quest much quicker. Amazing views up top. There is a café and bar up top plus gift shop but its expensive.You have to go through a airport type security scan on entering world trade centre so drink up prior to entering.

Great View, Tough to take photos. The view is obviously great, but the whole experience is a dull mess. There are two attractions that need to be replaced already. Some guy is talking about NYC and spinning a wheel and a very dumb sky view where you nothing. THe fake photos are just a waste of time and the extra $15 for an IPAD is a cash grab. It is also difficult to take photos with the glare, plus all you see at night are lights. Put the camera right up to the window for best shots, but $34 is a bit steep for this attraction, but then again, you probably need to go.
You must do this!. $32 per person to visit the top of the Trade Center. What a view! Also visited the 9/11 Memorial-very moving.

Amazing view. I really enjoyed the museum you walk through that shows how they built the Trade Center and what is underground at that level. Then we took the elevator up to the observation level. Neat ride as they showed the NY skyline throughout history. At the observation level there were people trying to get you to rent something that would tell you about the part of the skyline you are looking at, but that is not really neccessary unless you are there for a history lesson. We were just there to amaze at the view. We arrived at dusk and got to see the city light up. We sat there hours just looking out at the fantastic view.

I'm still reeling. I'm still reeling. I am lucky that I had been up the twin towers, so this was a moving experience for me. The views are simply unbelievable...you just have to go...seriously you have to.

Impressive view from the top. Just my husband went up this building while my daughters and I had some retail therapy. He was very impressed with the speed of entry and of course the views from the top. He went late afternoon and stayed for the sunset so got three views of the city for his $32. The trip up was spectacular with lots of info on the way

Corny Theatrics - Avoid. The 101 floor view is enough without all of the video intro, curtains reveals and blocked windows, as well as the upsell to a $15 iPad tour guide. It was really gross and over the top - the whole experience. If you want to see the view, then visit. But be prepared for vomit worthy, over the top theme park ride style garbage and over use of technology. Top of the Rock is lower of course but in terms of overall experience is 10000x better.

Best elevator ride ever!. Recommend buying the fast pass option in order to by pass the lines of visitors. Great views from the top, but my favorite was the elevator ride which turned the walls into video screens and depicts the development of Manhattan since the settlements up to the construction of One World Trade Center (aka the Freedom Tower). Look quick and you'll see the Twin Towers appear and then disappear. The observation floor offers floor to ceiling windows for great views.

Very good, but expensive. Previously been up the Empire State and Rock, but really wanted to do this one as it was brand new, and the highest. Really good with a few surprises, but expensive at over 120 bucks for a family of four. Once we'd also shelled out $15 for an iPad viewer to zoom in on the sights and over $50 for four pastries and drinks, the whole experience wasn't worth almost $200. Overall, would go for the Empire State, which is cheaper and you get to go outside.

Excellent views. Really enjoyed our morning in the Trade Center. We went early in the morning and would advise others to do the same to beat the queues. Views were amazing of the Empire state building, Manhattan skyline, the bridges and a distant statue of liberty. They had a nice bakery to enjoy a cuppa after the views, only criticism was no seats were provided just tall tables. I am guessing they dont want people to make themselves comfortable up there. Would definitely recommend anyone visiting lower Manhattan to make a point of doing this. Worth the money.
Definitely worth it. The whole experience was excellent. Ticket purchasing online. Quick entry. Elevator ride was amazing. My son loved the iPad 'tour guide'.

Must go! . If you are afraid of heights I would still go anyway. I am scared of being up high and I still would go again. The elevator ride up there is a little scary it made me loose my bearings but so worth it! The views are amazing. Make sure to check the weather though. When we went there was no visibility so we exchanged our tickets for a different day and were so glad we did!! There are iPads you can use to zoom anywhere in the city. Very neat however a little over priced.

The view is, as you'd expect, amazing. Fantastic views, of course, but the most pleasant surprise was the very cool elevators that give you a virtual trip through time on your way up and down. Only complaint really is the crowd can be a bit much, and they try and force you to take one of those stupid bluescreen pictures on the way in.

Life time experience. highlight of our visit to new york was the visit to One world observatory. This iconic building constructed near the original twin towers is the tallest building in the western hemisphere. It has 101 floors. The tickets are available on online (though priced high @ 32 dollars per adult). The best time is to visit in the evening hours.The whole visit is well organised including the security check.The presentation is well done.Most impressive is the option of taking a ipad (of course costs few dollars) which is very useful to listen to the details of every iconic building in new york when viewed fro the observatory @ 101st floor.The souvenir shop is of course very expensive.Over all a great expereince.
Would like to stay over night. One of the best attractions in New York. Views are fantastic. It could be so wonderfull to have the opportunity to be there during the night and see sun rise.
Amazing Ride to the Top!. The opening video was interesting and the ride to the top was fast and fun. Great views and a helpful staff pointing out some places of interest.

Best views in NYC !. Forget the Empire State Building and Rockefeller - the best views in New York are from the One World Trade Center !The whole entry process was very organised - pay by card at the handheld stations outside or by cash inside the lobby. The times for entry are staggered so as to keep the flow of people at a nice level. You enter the lifts as a group - and the lift itself is an excellent start to the experience. Super-fast and a great deal of thought has gone into the design. (no spoilers) On leaving the lift the group enter an area showing scenes of NYC on a large screen .... with a nice twist at the end (again no spoilers)The views from the observations platforms are STUNNING ! There is little more to be said about it ! We chose to have a drink in the bar - seated at the 'side bar' with incredible views. Its so cool to see Helicopters below you and Planes feeling 'not far' above you. We stayed for a couple of glasses of wine enjoying the views, and daughter enjoying the free wifi :)We did do the Rockefeller another day and, whilst it does allow you to see Central Park from there and there is opportunity to go outside which is nice - for me the only place to go is the One World Trade Center !

Worth seeing but no seats spoiled it!. We visited the One World Trade Center Observatory after we visited the 9/11 Memorial Museum. We had a timed entry which you can't change but beats the queues so worth booking on line before arrival.The start of the tour taking you into the elevator to ascend is great and the elevator experience is outstanding (seeing NYC being built over the last few hundred years) and the See Forever theatre presentation is also well done. The views from the observatory floors are breath-taking and you can rent an iPad to show you more detail and history of each site you can see on the 360 degree observatory.The reason why I scored 4 rather than 5 stars is that the cafe at the observatory is very expensive & you have to stand at tables & there is nowhere to sit. Bearing in mind sight-seeing can take a lot out of your feet & energy levels, a seat to have a coffee would have been very welcomed! The ride down in the elevator is equally enthralling.Worth a visit and a nice way to look at the future of the area after all that has happened in the past.

Great view at NYC price level. we booked online in the morning for 6:15pm to be there for the sunset.There was no queue we could have even gone up earlier.The view is great, but when the sun settled there were too many people so that we had to que to get close to the windows. It is a pity that some of the best view over NYC is blocked by some of their activity centers.To cost is rather high but that is NY style, with 3 grown up kids it is quite an investment, but worth it.The elevator ride is just great - try it.

Worth a visit. You can book tickets in advance, but we didn't. It was mid August and we only had to wait in line for twenty minutes, so unless you know EXACTLY when you are going to be there, no need to book in advance. (Advance tickets are for 15-minute slots). Quite a bit of security (understandable) but well done and all very friendly staff. Very clever lift going up......showing the site over the years and how it has changed.....but almost goes a bit too fast. There is a lot of touristy stuff at the top and they make you go through the shop and cafe to get to anywhere....but I guess that is par for the course. The views themselves are amazing and you get a wonderful 360 degree view of Manhattan Island and everything around it. It is all enclosed - guess health and safety won't allow anything open air - so not like the Emoire State.......but the fab thing is that because of where it is, you can look all the way up the Island. Would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting as a tourist. Not too expensive either.

Stunning views await you. We had pre-paid tickets which saved queuing on the day. The trip was timed and the access to the observatory floors was well managed and efficient without long lines to stand in. We went through an airport style security screening and then we were whisked up to the observation floors in a multi-media style express lift. You are shown a short video in the lobby of the observation floors. Then the screens lift to offer you the first breath taking views of the Manhattan skyline. You walk through to the 360 degree viewing floor where you are free to walk around taking in the view and taking photographs/videos. An iPad style tablet device can be hired to inform you what you are looking at with augmented reality style graphics. Simply hold the tablet up in line with your viewpoint to see exactly what is in your line of sight. There is also a cafe/restaurant available but sadly the cafe part does not have any seating - its all stand up tables. This is ok for the able bodied but anyone who needs to sit down due to any disability will struggle. Restrooms and a gift shop are also available. The viewing experience is totally indoors and therefore the view is through glass, unlike the Empire State building where the viewing platform is outdoors. The experience is excellent and the views amazing (subject to weather conditions of course). The descent is also fun in the multi-media lift cars that display video images on their internal walls to enhance the trip down the WTC Tower 1.

So worth it . Went a little after sunset. No wait in line. Lots of things to do inside, more than the observatory. Ride from the basement to the 102nd floor took 47 seconds. I would recommend going in the day for a different view. They do offer day/night tickets.
Big Change. I lived in NYC before 9/11 and after. The One World Trade Center has been transformed and without the twin towers, the NY skyline is just not the same....

Nearly perfect . After having visited Empire State and Top of the Rock in daylight this time we visited One World at night. We were lucky crowds were light. The organisation was slick though we should have concentrated on the views rather than allowing ourselves to be distracted by the technology. The views are magnificent. However if you like to take memories with you in the form of photographs it is a real pity the designers did not put more thought into managing the reflections caused by the glass in the viewing area. All photos are spoiled by excessing reflections. Next time we will reverse our decisions and visit One World in daylight and the other two at night.
expected more. Ok for the view, but not spectacular as a site. I would never pay the ticket again. Funny the helicopter simulator.

you can see forever. Simply the best attraction in NYC, it was absolutely amazing.
The views are breathtaking, the entire journey and experience is truly uplifting.
Breathtaking.. This structure is amazing, even taller than the Twin Trade Towers. Very historical area now, fab design and visible from many parts of the city. Dont miss it.

If you are in Manhattan do not miss this attraction!!. This is the best attraction with a view. It is breathtaking - from the elevator ride to the short film & then the view. It is totally worth the entry fee ( which is very reasonable). It is so worth a visit

Amazing views of NYC!. This was a brilliant experience and would definitely recommend visiting here. It costs about $32 each, for the cheapest ticket, and for this you must book a time slot on-line in advance of arriving.Once through security, you're taken to an elevator. This takes you up to the top very quickly but you don't notice the speed as you're looking at the videos around you of New York being built through the years. It's a great idea. When you come out you're on the 102nd floor. The way you get to see you're first glimpse of the view is brilliant and took us by surprise!You're then eventually taken to the observatory with 360 degree views of New York City and it really is an unbelievable view. Having done the Empire State and the Rockefeller it was really nice to look at Manhattan from a different viewpoint. There is no time limit whilst you're up there and you can walk around and take photos as much as you like before heading back to the elevators. Taking photos though can prove to be a bit tricky due to the reflections off the glass windows and people smearing hand prints all over them through out the day. The best time to go up in my opinion is early evening as you'll then get daytime, sunset and night time views of New York City!

Possibly the best place to visit in NYC. What to say about this place, first and foremost what a tower the history and location are so viable.The Experince of this tower from start to finish in my opinion is 10/10, a lot of thought went it to every part of the Experince.Even at the top when u get to enjoy the 360 view each view tells a 1000 stories.If in NYC visiting or as a local make time for this it will take ur breath away
No Better Way to See All of New York!. What a view! The trip up will make your ears pop! 365% Views! Nice bar at the top to sit and have a view of the city while having a beer.

A must see!. Beautiful architecture! First time back since 9/11 - a bit emotional experience, but we'll worth it. You have to buy tickets online, the lines are very long; so come ready in comfortable shoes

Stunning views. One World Trade Center is a fitting way to tell the world that we will not be broken. We rise from ashes. We have hope. The elevator is fast and modern and they have ipads which allow you to identify the landmarks around you. I also had a great glass of wine at the restaurant.

A welcome return to 1WTC. Before August 2015, we were last at 1 WTC weeks before 9/11 and I wanted to go back to pay my respects.The work done at Ground Zero is spectacular and is a must see for anyone visiting New York.The journey starts with a short walk through a mock up of Manhattan bedrock, the foundation for all New York skyscrapers and eventually you end up at a bank of lifts, ready to take you skyward to the observation deck.You get marshalled into the lift and advised to face the back wall, the back wall and those to the left and right are full size HD screens. At the bottom you see a picture of New York when the early settlers took hold and as you rise, so does the time scale and the view.There are 102 floors to the top and the start to finish journey is less than 60 seeconds.As the doors open at the top you are faced with a large screen that tells the WTC story - at the end of the film the screen rises and reveals a 360 degree view of Manhattan. At the top you can hire ipads with apps that points out places of interest where you look down - interactive.There is a food area by the observation deck and stools that you sit on, eat and enjoy the view - it looked a bit pricey, but was good of quality.Overall, you cant go to NYC and not go here, you cant help imagine what it was like to be at that height on that fatefull day and remember those that died.

Lest we forget. Starting with the elevator ride the visit gets more and more interesting .while you remember the horror of the day the towers were brought down it makes you think YES this wonderful building says America won't give in to people who commit atrocities. A wonderful tribute to the people who died . On a lighter note the views are spectacular.

Breathtaking views. This is certainly worth seeing. The lift takes you upto the 101st floor at 25mph. When the screens lift to show Manhattan it is simply breathtaking and emotional to think the reason you are there. Superb views of New York and surrounding areas

it is a must see building. Very interesting and nice design.. Once there you get a patriotic feeling and you don't want to leave the site. prepare to spend 2 to 3 hours there and get your tickets on line! enjoy
Superb Tribute. This is an awesome tribute to those who lost their lives on that infamous day in our history. It should definitely be on your to do list when visiting New York.

On a clear day.... The Observatory on the 101st floor is a must. On a clear day, as the song says, you can see forever! Certainly feels like it. But the best part is the entry and elevator ride - keep your eyes open!
architecture from the future. you can just don't stay a look this building for hours , please go during daylight and check all it's sides for night you can see it from everywhere, perfect building

A must Do in NYC. Tallest building in Western hemisphere. Beautiful views. We visited at night. There was no line. Pre show wasn't that great. Elevator ride is fun. Staff was good. Views were awesome. Observation deck has glass panel.It is costlier than Empire State and Top of the Rock, but worth it. Ticket has timed entry to avoid line.Definitely a must do for NYC visitor.
Peaceful. Very fitting tribute to those who lost their lives, tranquil and moving. When the 'dove' is finished it will be stunning and bring hope.

Breath taking views. We visited the top of one world a week after it opened. It was a rainy day when we got on the elevator, and less than two minutes later, the sun came out. Spectacular views of the Greatest City on Earth. Also, the Cafe was helpful since I was traveling with a group of 8.

INCREDIBLE! . Woah! I can't get over how good this place was. The use of technology is amazing, I won't say more than that as I'd spoil it for you! Just make sure you visit. Would suggest arriving early in the morning as we arrived by 10am to no queues, straight on in!

Make time for this place. Such great detail into the events and people the passed. Best part was the Irish Bar a block away (sorry, I forget the name) they have great pictures of that moment. It was a nice break between the whole time we spent there.
Stunning Reminder That We Will Prevail. There are no words for the powerful emotions you feel when viewing this building. It is the crown jewel of the New York skyline.
Baseball Trip. Great views of the city. The elevator ride is something not to miss. Had the pleasure of watching the ticker tape parade for the Women's World Cup Soccer Team.

Not worth the price. My husband and I visited the observatory after countless outstanding reviews from our friends. I liked the elevator ride. That is really cool but other than that if you have already visited any other observatory earlier, it is similar. Nothing spectacular about it. Infact if you visit the place at/ after sunset and try to click pictures of the city below, the reflection of the restaurant appears in the glass walls of the observatory so you will not achieve much. For me photography from observatories are the highlights of my visit and this was not achieved, hence the average rating.The cost is also steep. In addition to it, they sell you an Ipad tour option for $15 which you can skip easily

100% worth it!. The views are amazing!! 360 degree view and loved every single bit of it. Even that there is not an outdoor space like in the Top of The Rock or the Empire State, is still pretty spectacular. Pro Tip: Get your tickets online and skip the lines. Do not miss the little presentation right after you exit the elevator.

Great views of the NYC skyline. What better way to spend your day in one of the greatest cities in the world than to see it's glory from above. One World Observatory provides breathtaking 360 degree views of the New Jersey harbor and the New York City skyline. Their video presentations are really cool, especially the elevator ride that shows the evolution of New York City in under a minute.However, it is somewhat difficult to get close to the glass and get a nice full view because people were sitting beside the windows. Also smudges on the windows so they need some cleaning. I thought their Sky Portal was a see-though glass where you could see the streets below, but it's just a zoomed-in footage with no excitement at all. I don't understand the point of CityPulse. Recommended for the spectacular views.

Top of the town. Loved the 47 second elevator ride up/down surrounded by video footage. And the way they 'unwrap' the view is pure showmanship. It's pricey, but once you're in, they don't rush you. Enjoy it, it's breathtaking.
Great. Better than expected!! Amazing view. The timed tickets were a good move. Heard the food was sub par so we followed up our experience with lunch across the street at Brookfield Place.

A great experience, but glad I didn't have to stand in the queue!. I opted to buy the more expensive ticket for my visit which was the Day Flex ticket and I was glad I had done when I arrived to see a huge queue at the entrance. With this ticket I was able to go straight to the front of the queue and also clear security via the VIP access lanes rather than standing in another long queue to go through the standard security lanes and I was in an elevator heading up the observation deck in around 15 minutes of arriving.Even the elevator ride was an attraction in itself, speeding to the observation deck in around 1 minute and with a visual display going on across 3 walls of the elevator to keep you entertained on the journey up. I was lucky and visited on a sunny and clear day and the views were amazing, with great views all across the city and for miles beyond. The only thing which was a disappointment was the photographs I took, which due to the windows and the sun shining on the observation deck had the reflections of myself and the other people around me in the pictures. So I was majorly disappointed with the photos once I looked at them afterwards and felt a later visit to the Empire State Building which has a fence rather than glass window observation deck gave much better quality of photo.
Breathtaking 360 degree view of the city.. Can get crowded, with long wait times. Exhilarating elevator ride up and down. The restaurant bar serves a good burger.

Amazing . On our 2nd visit to New York we decided to visit the one world observatory & I'm so glad we did. We prebooked online and this saved a big queue. There is a queue for timed customers and we turned up at on our booked time and we went straight up. The escalator up is fascinating as well as the screen you see before manhattan is presented to you. Well worth the money at $32. I wouldn't of paid anymore for the express pass (I did consider) before we went however this would have been waisted money as we went right up. Best views over the city and you can see for miles on a clear day. So glad we did it

Why the glass?. Ok, the building is great, the view is amazing. The reason for the "Average" is the GLASS! You cant take pictures from the view because you, your camera and all the people will be reflecting in the glass. =( The Rockefeller center is open I was expecting something similar.

Awesome views. Thought I may have to queue for a bit but in pretty quick. It is pricey but worth it, the elevator trip is so unique and the presentation excellent.
The views are something else, 360 views of the city, now the tallest building in the city .
On the downside skip the food, expensive and quite drab.

Amazing.... Well it is a very very high tower offering bird eye views of NYC. We did not really have to wait to get up so that was cool - not exactly cheap - especially if you want to buy ANYTHING on top ... (35$ t-shirt etc) - but all in all a very nice experience that I would certainly recommend.

WTC Observation deck. It's open, it's busy and it's worth it. It costs about $35 per person, but you get an incredible elevator ride and an amazing view, The E train got us there and back quite easily. Watch out for the peddlers, they are not too pushy, but you can't avoid them. We snuck in through the back way by the Port Authority. There's an amazing empty hallway there that leads right past all the lines if you already have a ticket. Food is nice looking at the small cafe, but it was expensive. Nice picture was taken but it cost $30 for a hard copy with an internet post, $20 for the picture only. Lots of international visitors there, I heard at least 4 languages I couldn't figure out and several I could. They have an IPAD for rent that has about 7 languages and english that shows what you are looking at. All in all, a great experience.

Great but go while you're fresh. Agree with the comments about being like Disney, but in a good way - they keep you entertained and moving the whole time. The elevator ride was amazing; we wished we could have gone up and down again! The views are definitely spectacular but the negatives were:1) The iPad experience wasn't worth it. It's not interactive or realtime so very limited. You could probably find an app that's better.2) There is not one single place to sit unless you want to go to the bar where a cocktail costs $20. NOT ONE. We were tired from having visited the museum and the memorial and just wanted to rest and take in the views, but no way to do so. Even where they sell food at a concession there were no seats!

Awesome. What a spectacular view on such a clear day. From the moment you entered the elevator until you exited! We used priority booking and our senior discount as well. This is not to be missed. We went right in and didn't need to wait in line. Gift shop was very expensive. $24.95 for a size 4 t-shirt. Of course we wouldn't buy it. The view was spectacular. Also they have iPad's to use for $15 which tells you what you are viewing. I'm sure there is some kind of an app for that which is prob free. Also while you're there the 9-11 memorial shouldn't be missed. That museum charges admission but we didn't go due to time constraints. Enjoy!
Fabulous view. If you're in NYC, you have to go there. The bar and restaurant are very nice, but the drinks are VERY expensive.
A must. Well worth a visit. Very sobering but you realize how big the towers actually are. Nice gardens and waterfall. Free to get in.
One World Trade Center. Overpriced and overcrowded, with no outdoor observation deck. Good views IF you can get close to the windows, but forget good nighttime photos. Souveniers are WAY expensive.

Wonderful experience!. We enjoyed every minute of this visit. We purchased advanced tickets, but didn't gain much because there was no line at 10:00 in the morning. The elevator ride up was excellent. There was a lot of interaction with the staff and everyone was very helpful and friendly. We chose to pay for the iPad and although it lost direction at times, we were glad we had it. The views were spectacular. The view of the 911 Memorial was sobering.

Spectacular views of NYC. Having been to the observation deck of the former World Trade Center we wanted to see this. We booked timed tickets on line and had an easy entry to the site.It is spectacular and then some! The views are breath taking. It is worth hiring the "tablet guide" because this provides a walking, talking guide as you go round. As with every other " spectacular" there are the obligatory photos superimposed on the building but you are not forced to purchase them!

American Pride.. Remembering the death and destruction of 9/11, viewing One World Trade Center can be a moving experience. I wish for you the bluest of sky, a perfect background for so much more than a building.

You CAN See 4Ever - AMAZING. We purchased the Flex Day tickets online. These tickets allow you to go any time during that particular day. It also includes priority/VIP which allows you to skip the lines. I would highly recommend going with priority.As for the actual experience .... truly amazing. It starts in the elevator and just gets better from there. If you haven't been there .... you really, really should go.

Best Experience and View the City has to offer!!!. This is simply the best view! I have been to the top of the rock and Empire. All of these are great, but this is by far the best!!! You simply got to go and see for yourself.

Wow!. Amazing from the outside and even more so from the top. A snap decision to visit was impossible. You must book at least a day in advance. We thought the queues were for the top but no , just for tickets. We booked an e ticket on line and chose the VIP route. Great option , you just get fast tracked to the top. Worth the extra money when you are on the trip of a lifetime and only have days to holiday.The elevator is amazing. The views outstanding.An architectural piece of wizardry and beauty.

Beautiful building. Beautiful building hovering over the site of the Twin Towers. This was my daughter's favorite building in all of New York City. I think she has tons of pictures from almost any angle.
One World - one view. Great panoramic views of Manhattan - especially Down Town. This followed on from a great time at the 911 Tribute Centre.
Remember the Fallen. Emotionally engaged in the whole concept of all of the names who perished in the Twin Towers crash. A must see.

Worth the visit.... Well, we had booked tickets to One World Trade Centre in advance, prior to our NYC trip. We had mixed feelings about going up the Tower but we are so glad that we did. The lifts start the experience with an amazing 'show' on their walls depicting Manhattan growing out of the bedrock - it has to be seen to be appreciated! Then when you step out of the lifts and you listen to a short talk and watch a fab film about NYC - wait for the surprise - I won't spoil it!!The views are breathtaking and you do feel the building swaying gently! There is plenty of space for everyone to appreciate the views and have pictures taken. There is a cafe/ bar but we didn't eat/drink here. The shop is full of the usual gifts with t-shirts, pencils, cups etc on offer.The views are brilliant and it is definitely worth going up the tower - it is huge!!!

Just --- wow.... I used to go to the top of the Twin Towers and I had forgotten the gorgeous views. When we saw the views for the first time from the Freedom Tower, I started crying. Couldn't help myself. The views are beautiful even on a rainy day or the last time, on a gorgeous day.
Great elevator ride and amazing views!. our friends reserved before going, so no waiting in line. be sure to be ready for the elevator, it is a wonderful ride up and down.

Nice to be back. It's nice to see the city from above again. Elevator ride is a nice edition with the video. One thing missing the last towers had is the outside view point. Lot of good photos but glass reflections.

Fit This Into Your Schedule. The trip up to the top really set the tone for this multi-media experience. The elevator cab walls are projection screens that start with the prehistoric land mass at the first floor and progress through time as you fly up the shaft to current day views. In addition to views and photo opportunities, there are fairly slick presentation stations set up around the viewing level that give lessons on what you're seeing. It's a really special place. We were there early in the morning and didn't have a wait at all, so keep that in mind if possible.
Awesome. This is one of the most awesome tourist attractions you must see in NYC. It is moving and spectacular. By your tickets online to avoid waiting in line.
very pretty. if you have time go, it is a beautiful building, the memorial and museum are located there, it truly is a must while in NYC

A must see in NYC.... This is a must see while visiting NYC. The views are phenomenal. A short video at the top, then opens to the most breathtaking view of the NYC...180 degrees as you walk around the indoor observation area. This tour was well worth the money and time.

AMAZING!!! . From start to finish this is amazing!!Has to be the best part of our holiday here in Manhattan....the views are breathtaking and to be one of the newest things to see in New York it was lovely to tell people we had done this, so many people have done the high sights here, but not this so I'm soooo happy we chose this over the other famous building for seeing the city up in the sky!!!This is a must on your to do list!! It will not disappoint you I promise!!
Awesome experience. A must see.. This was a beautiful site and my favorite part of the entire trip. The building is so beautiful and the presentation was awesome.

Experience was ok . The experience was good, the views are nice and you get a perspective of the city and the surrounding areas. My only issue was that there is no recycling there. It doesn't make any sense since the whole city does a good job in recycling and its a new building, so outside of that overall my family had a great time
So impressive takes your breath away. Words can not explain how impressive this was!!!!The view from the top takes your breath away. Can not recommend high enough

Best view of NYC and surrounding areas by a long shot!!. The experience starts when you approach the absolutely stunning One Trade Center building, if you are fan of modern buildings you are gonna love this one, is just stunning.
After that comes the magical experience of climbing to the observatory and see the NYC area from the sky, is just an experience that you cannot miss while visiting the city.
Very moving. The Americans have done a really good job with this whole World Trade Center site. The museum is very moving and very thought provoking.
Great views. Really good experience, great views. Advice is to book tickets online before you turn up as you don't have to queue then.
Not outstanding. While its a very impressive building, it doesn't exactly reflect the most amazing architecture. Some elements are beautiful for sure, but not something overly outstanding

Highest view of New York!. What a view!! We booked for the morning slot at 10.30 and so glad we did as during the afternoon it gets a little hazy over the city. The elevator ride is impressive with its digital screening during the ascent. The presentation of the "first view" is very well done too, which will impress you straight away. To then wander around the observation decks giving you the 360 view of Manhattan will be equally as impressive.It does get very busy so be prepared to wait a while for your elevator ride!They have a cafeteria too but NO seats!!? Only "lean on" high tables which we found a little odd. Book online to save the long, long, long sidewalk queues!

Worth the wait. Just going through the two pools to get to the entrance brought tears to my eyes. Very touching. The building is the tallest on the northern hemisphere so it definitely is overwhelming. The observation deck is not open-air like many others and the windows are slightly smudgy so if you'd like to take nice photos you have to hold the camera higher above your head.
Fantastic. Beautiful tower, the surrounding area is extremely clean and is a wonderful place to remember the people that were lost in the 9/11 attacks.

See Forever. They could not find a better title for the new Observatory on the top of the One World Trade Center: See Forever!!! What a magnificent view!!!!!!!!! It is impossible to describe it......you have to get in!!!!

Very moving ! Views are amazing !. We got there early in the morning went rt upWe didn't have to wait at all ! Elevator ride was fast and might be scary for some people .... It's way up there !!!!On clear day you can see forever up there ! I do hope the $$$ they are making is going to some good cause Because it will make millions The 15$$ device didn't always work ... Cute idea but Just another gotcha at the top after you have already paid to get in !

The new must see site in NYC. A definite must see in NYC. The ride up on the elevator is really fun. The video screens show the development of NYC from the earliest days until the present. Before you know it you are at the top. After one more film, the entire city opens up below you. Even on a cloudy day it is worth the trip. If you can go during the week, you will get up in a pretty reasonable amount of time. The priority ticket does move you along quite a bit faster than the crowd. The observatory itself is very large, much bigger than the Empire State, and a little larger than the Willis (Sears) Tower in Chicago. The views are spectacular. There is a little restaurant on top, but we opted to head back down to the financial district (Wall Street) just a few blocks away for lunch. Overall, well worth the price of the ticket.

Get your ticket online!. This was a cool experience. You can really see the city from different point of views. We got our tickets online and got there a bit late... It ended up being fantastic as we did not wait at all. When they realized we were late, they just got us through very quickly. Staff is very polite and nice. Be aware that you will pass security as when you board a plane (no need though to take out your shoes). The other tip is that they gather you at the top and try to sell their iPad which apparently helps you to understand what you are looking at. Skip that part and just go straight to the observatory deck.

What a View!. This is a class act, if you forgive them for trying to sell you something every other step. It begins with a quick elevator ride up 100 floors, where you watch a mirage of the NY cityscape transforming from early to present years. A short video at the top then opens you to the most fantastic view of the NYC area...180 degrees as you walk around the indoor observation area. A bit pricey to enter, but I think it well worth it for the views all around. Also make sure you spend some time at the memorial site, where the locations of the original towers are now waterfalls...very moving and soothing at the same itme.

World Trade Center Memorial and Museum - get the tour. The World Trade Center Memorial Tour was very worth the price and the time. I Highly Recommend it. Then spend 2-4 hours in the museum on your own, but see the videos, and speak to the docents that rally add.
MEMORIES. A Place that you must see , stunning view of New York , few hours will be enough to see most of it , it is hard to keep your eyes dry with the memories of the 9/11 .

Great staff and views, but Disney like production.. The positive is that every single staff person was extremely polite and nice. Well organized from lining up to getting in the elevator. Spectacular views, of course. The negative; a very Disney like experience, hokey and artificial from the mini movie to the extremely loud guy on a microphone giving neighborhood history, to the store. The previous world Trade Center was a classy place to quietly enjoy the beautiful views of the city.

Memorial Complex. Definitely worth the time to visit this complex! It was tastefully and humbly done. Allow plenty of time in visiting this memorial. Taking the elevator to the top of the tower is definitely worth the seeing the view alone.

Beautiful building, memorial, be mindful.. Very cool new building, great place to visit if you lost a loved one, just make sure not to be loud and respect those that are visiting the surrounding area as many go to pay their respects to loved one they lost. Its not pleasant when you see a group of people laughing and cracking jokes next to a family or an individual that is breaking down and crying.

Amazing views.. Having visited the Empire State and Top of the Rock we decided to visit One World to complete the set so to speak. We were not disappointed the views are absolutely amazing. Well worth a visit.

OK view of the city - not great for photos, service is not great. The building and elevator ride are great & the unveiling of the observatory view is spectacular - however - there are a few points that let this attraction down.- access - elevator access between observatory floors seems to be an after thought - not great for those in a wheel chair or with a stroller- food - we ate at the bar and the food was terrible (and expensive although we acknowledged this before sitting down). We ordered wings, ribs & truffle fries - the wings and ribs were cold (likely sitting waiting for an order as they arrived very quickly) - being sold to - prior to entering the observatory you are given a "pitch" about purchasing access to a tablet that uses augmented reality to give you info on NYC. The tablet looked great - however - I felt like I was being sold a time share.- view - the view is amazing & it is great to look back on NYC toward the Empire state building, Chrysler building etc. However, the reflective nature of the observatory makes taking photos difficult (but on the upside it allows you to enjoy the view without worrying about photos). The observatory at the Top of the Rock is much better - great to be able to go outside and get a view above glass/ screens

New and glitzy. Very slick and almost Disney-like in its approach. Yes, you get the best views but you miss out on the fresh air that you get at the Top of the Rock and ESB (but you might be happy about that!).We went early afternoon and the windows already looked like they could do with a clean after numerous little hands and noses had been pressed against them and not over impressed with the artificial see through floor although some people were making a big deal about it. But, you pay for the views and they do deliver, amazing!

What a view!. We went with friends to visit the top of One World Trade center and it was really worth it. The view is fantastic and it puts things into perspective. Be sure to be there on time because tickets are timed, and there can be long queues. There is a process that needs to be followed, bags checked, lines for the elevator etc. so it's better to plan for a longer visit than expected.

Waw Waw waw. This is a MUST do in NY. The view are just incredible and the entertainment is perfect. The lift is one of the raster of the World. You cannot miss this. Consider 2 hours on site all included. Prices is 32 USD if I remember well.

You must get the One World Explorer!. What an awesome experience! This is great for tourists and New Yorkers alike. A great New York experience. You must get the One World Explorer to go with the experience. You get to see so much more with the IPad, and I learned so much about my hometown.

Perfect view of NYC. This is the best place to see the Manhattan, NYC and New Jersey. Perfect 360 panoramic view. The one World Observatory can handle a lot of people at the same time comparing to Empire State Building.

Amazing!. Amazing time, it was quite pricey and I was sceptical it could live up to the cost, but it totally did. An amazing place that starts with lots of stories about the constriction, then a film and a big surprise as the city is revealed.We went early morning for a new york bagel at the top, this turned out to be a great idea because it was nice and quiet and now line to get in. An hour later an it was a bit too full for my liking so I would suggests going early.

Amazing view and show. The journey to the 102nd floor itself was really nice. You don't just get there - the lift is high def screens that mimic the view outside as you're rising through the levels. And when you get there you get quite the story of the building and a nice surprise at the end :) We thoroughly enjoyed it! Recommendation: go there at the right time - right at sunset. That way you get to see the view by day, an amazing sunset, plus NY by night.

Do it!. Good value with prices - Adult $32, Senior $30, Child $26 - best to book a time online before you arrive.What an incredible experience! Whizz to the 102nd floor in 48 seconds in a silent lift with incredible 'virtual reality' scenes of NYC growing since its roots in 1624...at the top - staggering views of NYC through 360 degrees...just amazing...TIP - don't bother with the additional ipad that gives you additional information - we just found it an annoying distraction

Must do. Highly recommended. Terrific views of the city and beyond from the 102nd floor.Went mid afternoon with about a 20 minute queue. Won't spoil it for those that haven't been but great (and quick!) ride to the top.
Tower of Freedom. A very well designed monument. The architecture is amazing. It is a place to visit to reflect on the history of the place.

Early birds avoid the queues.. Amazing experience but get there early to avoid the queues. Entry is by specific times. Beware the various attempts to sell you various things at the top. The views are incomparable.

BREATHTAKING !!. Excellent, definately worth a visit will not be disapointed,the views go on forever, we booked our tickets online before the holiday so we only had to queue to get in, and not to purchase tickets in a seperate queue

Great city views. Having previously been to the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building I was unsure if there was much point doing this observation deck as well but it was totally worth it. Seeing the city from a different point of view was great, it has all been done very well.

Reservation Canceled by One World, Chaos. Beautiful building and spectacular views! But, the experience was ruined. I purchased my timed, reserved tickets 2 weeks in advance. The day before the scheduled reservation I received an email from One World (that I happened to see pop up on my phone - I was already on vacation and enjoying other parts of the city) that stated "due to a private event, my reservation would need to be rescheduled for another time". Why would they allow a private event to be scheduled during the same time other people had already reserved tickets resulting in forfeits (no refunds were offered) and the inconvenience of rescheduling? Luckily, I had planned on spending most of the day in that area so as the email instructed I went to One World to pick another time - it said anytime before 9pm. So we arrive around 2pm and are told we need to get in line to buy tickets even though we already had tickets that they canceled. After about 45min in line we make it to the ticket counter and are then told the next available time was 830pm. We had no other choice but to accept the new tickets. As the ticket counter worker handed us our new tickets she said, "you are only allowed to make changes this one time". We were in disbelief at that point haha. We ended up using those 5 hours to get lost in lower Manhattan and see what we could and had a good time. Once we got up to the observation deck that night the views were amazing, but I was also trying to take great photos with my cool new camera which was nearly impossible because of the interior light glare on the windows. Ugh. Next time we will be going to Top of the Rock instead.

A must visit for the views. Fantastic views over Manhattan, New Jersey, Brooklyn and anything around.I couldn't get out of my head the tragic events that happened in order for me to be standing at the top of this amazing looking building, but the views are truly spectacular.I'd advise again buying food/drink inside as it's extremely expensive, however this didn't detract from the overall experience. I'd highly recommend a stop at this attraction once you've visited the north and south memorial pools below.

"See Forever". We were thinking about going up Rockefellar because we heard the views there were better than the Empire State's. Then we saw this and decided to try it out because it's only $2 more than Rockefellar ($32 vs $30) and it was new and taller. You get taken up to the 102 floor in less than a minute. As you ride the elevator up, there are screens that show you how NYC changed from the 1800s till now. The views are amazing. The only thing that sucks is you need to take photos through the class panes so sometimes there's a glare but either than that it's beautiful. Can't see Central park from it though but everything else is visible.
Amazing. Amazing! The elevator ride is crazy, i do not like elavators but this was a breeze and its 102 floors. The views were incredible.

Excellent View from as nice new building. It's a little pricey but hey someone has to pay for such a nice building! The view is spectacular, they do put you through a bit to get to the view. The elevator ride is cool with full floor to ceiling video showing the buildings. Once you get to the top you watch a quick video and then get a sneak peek of the view as the screen lifts to reveal the view. But then they force you to wait in line for a green screen picture - they really need to allow people to walk around that and not torture them to wait for it even If you don't want the picture. That said it's a great view and you can walk 360 around the observation level to see everywhere. Tip, afternoon sun prevents you from getting good pictures of the statue of library probably morning is a better time for that.

A different glimpses of the NEW YORK!!!. As the ratting states... Excellent!!! The view is amazing but the good and newer part is the presentation of the place. It's new n fresh with some nice surprises... overall the place n view is amazing if visited on a clear sky day at the time of sunset.
Out of this World. The observation deck on the 120 floor is an absolute must. Book ahead. The most amazing views in all Manhattan.

Great views. I purchased a 3pm ticket in advance. It was a bit disorganised outside waiting to get in. Once inside it didn't take too long to get up to the observatory. The views were fantastic but it was a bit too busy to enjoy it properly. Some people just sat at the windows chatting and blocking the view even though they could see that people were trying to get in to take photos. It was worth the visit for the views. Not perfect but very good.

Incredible views. One World Trade is a beautiful building. There was a huge line in the morning so we returned late afternoon. A wonderful presentation during the elevator ride up. You can rent a portable device for $15 to help you get your bearings. We enjoyed the City Pulse talks, the host made it fun. The views are incredible, of course.

Bird's Eye View of New York City. One World Observatory was a unique experience, beginning with the wild ride on the elevator up 103 floors in 45 seconds. Talk about ears popping (going up and down)! During that elevator ride, pictures change on the walls depicting how New York City has changed over the past several hundred years. It was quite an experience! The observation deck is on the 104th floor, with glass windows all around. The views are spectacular! The only problems were the crowds of people, competing for prime locations near the windows to take pictures and the hand prints on the windows from visitors, blurring the view. Also, it was a little hazy outside when we were there, so it was not possible to get clear pictures. One other problem was the large crowds of people who parked themselves on the ledges around the glass windows and were not always cooperative about letting others get close enough to take pictures. A suggestion would be to not allow people to sit on the ledges and to require that they keep moving rather than staying in one place for long periods of time. We paid $30 per person to go up to the Observation Deck, and that was a reduced rate. Be prepared to experience large crowds of people, and all that goes along with that scenario.

Stunning Views. We pre booked our trip prior to travelling and we're glad we did because the queues for on the day tickets were very long. To be honest the pre amble and the hard sell for use of IPads to see what you were looking at was a bit too "Disney" for my liking. The views however once you get to the observatory are stunning and worth the price of admission. I still prefer to look at my views from the outside!

The area around the Memorial is very interesting and worth visiting. The views of this area and insights offered by the various tour guides are worthy of some time even if you do not go into the memorial. We had passes but did not go in the last two times we have visited the area - perhaps next time.
Great views. The elevator ride takes you through time. The views are fantastic. We purchased tickets for anytime during a particular day and that allowed us to by-pass all of the lines.
A must in NY, the brand new observatory of One World. Amazing views of the city, brand new attraction to visit. well organized and easy to get to.a couple of hours we'll be enough to enjoy the visit.
Amazing place. Stunning building! definitely worth a visit along with the Ground Zero Memorial. Very emotion provoking and a great experience.

Incredible views - best in NYC?. Wasn't sure what to expect other than another view of Manhattan but this is amazing and will probably be the No 1 tourist attraction in NYC before too long. Can't recommend enough

1 World Trade Center Observatory - Fantastic. This place is just incredible. The views are stunning - and if you are a tourist - this is a must do!We also had a bit of lunch with our kids and the flatbread pizza was lovely - quite big at about $12. Will not be everyones cup of tea, but decent enough. Don't expect gourmet, as you have to eat standing up at tables unless you go into the One Restaurant, which is their A La Carte - and a bit more posh!We got the $15 tablet add on, which was OK but definitely not essential. Loads of people didn't bother. If you go to New York, take some time out to go here - it was one of the highlights of our trip!
Amazing Building and a Fitting Replacement. Beautiful building, perfectly designed, striking and a very fitting replacement (if you can call it that?) for the towers which were destoyed.

Well done modern attraction. It was a pleasure to visit this attraction. It was very easy buying the tickets online. There were plenty of staff members guiding visitors through the entire facility. I visited during a popular vacation time and the lines always moved and there was little wait time. The entire experience was modern, clean and interesting. I was wowed throughout my entire visit. I would advise not to get the fast pass, not necessary. The city from that height is fascinating and beautiful.

Beyond. We went up here in Augustus 27 the, don't want to spiil it for any one else, but this is a must, £$ 32.00 to get in, you will be searched and scanned, but just go and enjoy, defy, look on to the world, at least 70 miles on a clear day, for me, daytime besy

Top ten on the tourist list. This WTC feels so much bigger than our previous towers. Gazing up from the base, it's more enormous than expected. I advise buying priority tickets to avoid lines. Don't eat at One, just have a drink at the bar and look uptown. The $15 tablet is also a waste of money if you're a NYer and can easily identify landmarks. A must see for visitors, incredible views. But frankly, for me, just a sad monolith signifying greed and wealth with no concern for real people.

The top of New York.. The new observatory is a beautiful attraction to do. It is an attraction because during the building they construct the observatory, elevators ect. for it. But that doesn't mean that it is done beautiful. All the attention that is given to this is showing when you go up in the elevator, see the film at the top etc. And at last the view, beautiful. You can see 360 degrees round, yes only through glass. But yes you are on the highest building of the US. We can only recommend it.
Skyline redefined. The block is still undergoing its transformation but the building is Beautiful and the entrance to One World is well appointed and inviting.
Wonderful . I have a walking tour company and I enjoyed owo. I recommend owo to all my customers. It was my third time at owo and I was able to enjoy it more!!

Simply fantastic . This is by far the best building I've ever visited the whole thing is excellently run. The manner in which you walk through the building is a journey on how it was made. The lift (elevator) gives an amazing view in itself but not what you'd expect. It's amazing all round experience which had been excellently executed. I would highly encourage you to take a visit.

meh!. We had decided to visit Rockerfeller Centre and "top of the rock" instead of one world observatory, but as we were on the Staten Island Ferry which is close by - we decided to visit one world observatory as well. This review covers and compares both.One World Observatory is certainly an experience. Long hot wait Lift mildly entertaining. Ridiculous "pre-show" Then great views through plate glass. It was a bit too busy and dare i say "too" high?! We found the experience at the rock much better getting out in the fresh air - and closer to buildings on midtown.Overall we're glad we visited one world observatory - but top of the rock was just better in every way - Shorter lines, nicer building inside - friendlier staff - nicer viewing platforms, and ability to get out in the fresh air.

A very memorable experience. The negatives first:(1) Over priced souvenirs and snacks and (2) overselling of extras- pics/ iPad tour etc etcNow onto the positives: the $30 something dollar ticket is more than sufficient. Lines moved quickly and were reasonably well organized, presumably the difficulties referred to in earlier reviews are clearly being ironed out. Lift ride is spectacular and the twist at the start of the tour up top will remain with me for a long time. You can spend as long as you like up top and the views are simply stunning in the extreme. It's like looking down at a map!!! Poignant too thinking of what the tower replaced and the poor people who perished. Well well worth a visit.

Spectacular views. I was very excited to visit the newest tower in town and it didn't disappoint. The lifts are awesome, 102 floors in less than 60 seconds and the whole presentation is of the attraction is very slick. The views from the top are just breathtaking. Well worth a visit.

Forget Top of the Rock og Empire State Building!. Freedom Tower is definitely a far better option. Spectacular 360 'view! Moreover, a very professional and thorough guide / display program! Definite highlight in every way!

WTC - Energized Vibrant & Postive. Wow, what a comeback! The World Trade Center complex far exceeds expectations. World Trade Center encompasses several buildings built at the site of the former World Trade Center Buildings destroyed in the 9/11 attacks. With One World Trade Center and inside the One World Trade Center lift to the Observatory level, now Two World Trade Center, the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, the World Trade Center has a positive, energetic vibe with the rebuilding at the same site. With tree lined sidewalks, fountains and art, this is a beautiful area in Lower Manhattan. If you're planning the visit the Observatory level at One World Trade Center or the 9/11 Memorial & Museum, buy your tickets before your visit to avoid lines. Or, if you want to ensure good weather and great views from the One World Trade Center Observatory level, wait and buy same-day tickets early in the morning after you know the weather will be good. Easy to navigate to the World Trade Center complex via the subway hub or taxi, this area still has a lot of continuing construction. However, NYC is ready for visitors, including those with mobility concerns. We found restaurants, street corner food truck vendors (a NYC staple for a quick bite to eat), and coffee shops. The World Trade Center complex is vibrant, safe and the spirit of this area is energizing. Very highly recommended.

Amazing views!. This was the first time we had been to NY since the Freedom tower had been built. It is an impressive looking building and the memorial 'Reflecting Absence' at the base of the tower is really moving. Quite an emotional experience. We visited the observation deck which is in on floor 101. The lift journey up to the observation floor and back down was amazingly quick and the short film show on arrival was very good. The views from the top are amazing although it would be a nice touch to provide binoculars around the floor so you could get a closer look at some of the buildings. This is a must see while in New York.
Amazing views at night!. The videos going up to the observatory (and down) are amazing. Went at night and the views are incredible. Not for those who are afraid of heights though!
Fantastic view of New York. We went on a sunny day and the views were spectacular. It is worth buying a drink despite the high price as you get to sit and look out in comfort.

A must when in NY.. Excellent experience at 1WTC. Amazed to find that, despite going up at sunset, there were little to no queues having bought out tickets in advanced. The whole experience from start to finish was excellent; even the lifts- normally a low point- showed the historical development of the city which was fascinating.Having visited both 1WTC and The Empire State Building, I would definitely visit 1WTC again. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly and, although it wasn't the cheapest activity, where are you going to ever see views like it?

Beautiful & Majestic !!. 1 World Trade Center is Majestic ! Though The Twin Towers are missed,but the new Trade center & all the buildings around the 9/11 Memorial are a sight to see with their sky blue facade !!

A must!. An incredible building and a fabulous trip to the top. The 'wow' moment after you get out of the lift is a real mouth-opener.I would recommend pre-booking online and take your own water!!! £5 for a bottle that you can buy for £1 on the street is a little bit much really. The only minus point of what was a fantastic visit though

A view from the top. The whole experience is fascinating. From the moment you enter the building and going through security up the elevator and then the presentation after which the veil is lifted and the views are just spectacular. The whole observation deck is well laid out and you can get your 360 degree views. We got there before sunset and it is a great view to see the city transform from day to night. The only point of criticism would be that people tend to sit in the windows so sometimes hard to get a good shot also because of the many finger smudges on the windows. Definitely a worthwhile place to visit.

I wouldnt leave NYC without going there. The elevator trip alone is worth the money. It is not a memorial to September 9th, so expect nothing but fun.Try to get tickets for the first tours in the morning. The place gets pretty crowded after an hour or so.

Incredible experience. Mrs AnotherEnglishman was worried about the elevator. 102 floors in 60seconds. In fact it is so smooth, with distracting projected images, that it was over before she had chance to panic. The view from the top is amazing, it speaks for itself but is not allowed to because of a desire to explain everything with presentations. Ignore these, just enjoy the view.
