Visit the reflecting pools afterwards; these are subtle and respectful memorials to the victims of 9/11.

My new favorite attraction to visit. This was an excellent site to visit. The view of the city is amazing. The elevator ride includes an panoramic animation of the city from pre-history to now and is stunning. The staff was especially friendly and informative. Many thanks to Emma G. for her insight and time.

Best view from top of the world. First visit to this place feeling sorry for what happened but feeling proud to see New WTC. We visited the observation center, amazing displace, explantion and short film on making this.One would like to see for longer period the 360 view
WTC. i have visited many site touristic in the world and this is one of the most amazing please everybody must visit when you are in New York. I really loved it

A new skyline of NYC. I've been to the old WTC & Empire State Bldg, so I was waiting for this one to open. Finally visited right after Memorial week with friends. I booked the tickets online in advance and highly recommend to do so. It saves lots of time for waiting outside. Our group had about 8-9 people, got there on time and got in the check-in area right away. The elevator is pretty fast and looks cool with the information on the wall. I love the new design on the top floor and how they provide information to visitors which is very useful. However, I wish they had the opening section as Empire State Bldg that we could go out to see the city and take pictures without any obstacles. Other than that, it is very amazing to visit the place.

Just ok, high price and lots of people. The views were great, but for $34 dollars or so I would have hoped the staff was friendlier. I understand how busy they are, but they were not polite and very unwilling to answer questions.

Best high level dining in Western Hemisphere. Recently opened and we chose to visit and then eat at One Dine. The observatory gives a whole new perspective on the Manhattan skyline. The fixed price menu at One Dine was fantastic.

Superb vistas, lame upselling. Definitely a 4.5. The view is incredible and worth the price of admission. But boy did I not like the upselling. The first twenty minutes are really just trying to herd you through a gauntlet of retail opportunities (magic iPad! Family photos!) and some unnecessary digital distractions.The HD wall of screens montages were superfluous and the city pulse thing made no sense. But the view is worth it. Spend an hour or more once you're finally in the observatory.

Elevator ride showing growth of NY is worth the trip alone.. An incredible view and perspective on the world's greatest city. Highly recommended for people interested in Brooklyn - bring your own binoculars.
One World Trade Center. A magnificent structure that symbolizes the freedom that all citizens of the United States enjoy. Anticipating the completion of the rest of the buildings.

One World Observatory in N.Y. City. If you are going to N.Y. City, definitely make time to go to the One World Observatory. We called ahead and got tickets which was perfect -- no waiting in lines. Great place to get a view of N.Y. City skyline and take some spectacular photos. Also the 911 Memorial is right next door to it so you can visit there as well.

Breathtaking. We visited the One World Observatory on the first day of our trip and it truly took our breath away. I've visited both the Empire State Observatory and Top of the Rock before, and I'd say this runs the latter close whilst absolutely obliterating the Empire State. The price is reasonable and the elevator ride up might just be the best part, showing you how the NYC skyline has changed over the years. From there, you are moved into a theatre where the best part of the entire experience occurs, which I won't spoil. Afterwards, the observatory is really fantastic and even though you can't go outside (no open-air space like at the Rockefeller) it is nonetheless an truly immersive experience. Highly recommended.

Worth it. I went around 6:30 PM on a Wednesday evening. It was great. No lines and a great presentation when you get up there. Plus the elevator ride is something in itself. Fastest and coolest elevator I've ever been in. A must see. Grab a drink at the bar before heading back down.

Amazing building and views . This has to be one of the best views of NY, we bought our tickets in advance, getting in and up to the top is a breeze usual photo and gift sales but no real hard pressure sales. The views from the top and the experience of the guides are first rate, this is worth a visit if you going to Manhatan.

Awsome experience and incredible views! A MUST DO!. In my opinion, this is THE place to go if you want to see views of New York from above. It truely is amazing. Not only are the views great, but overall the experience itself is just fantastic. From the beginning you are emersed in a story of how the building was constructed and the views of the people involved and what it means to them. The journey to the top is also good, with LED screens showing a timelapse view of the outside from where you are. When you get to the top there is another short video followed by the main event, a 360 degree view of the city from 100 floors up which is just breathtaking! It is also really spacious with lots of room to move around. The LED screens in the elevator also show a different virtual view as you go back down. For the same price as the Empire State, you get a lot more and there is much less queing!The only downside for me was that although it wasn't very busy at the time, we were rather crammed into the elevators and video experience and this means you couldn't really see half of what were on the screens. I would be happy have waited 5 minutes longer to have less people in the elevator and video.Although I would definitely say to do both the One World and Empire State (we did One World in the day and ES at night), if you only have the time or budget for one, I would recommend the One Word Observatory. The price is the same but the views are better, the overall experience is better, there is more space to move around and we found the queue time at all points to be much less.A MUST DO!!
What a view. From the second you enter the lift you will be amazed. The history of the N.Y. skyline in 40 seconds followed by done of the most amazing views you will ever see

Great views. Worth booking online to nominate a time to arrive. Airport style security, flooded by amazing lift ride with great multi-media presentation. Well worth spending a couple of hours here early in trip to get ideas for places you may like to visit after. Get an iPad guide to help identify landmarks you can see.

Fabulous experience. We booked online and arrived well before our appointed time for the anticipated queue, which wasn't too bad. The building had only been open to the public for 2 weeks at this stage so they were still sorting out the queuing system. It needed more signage-which I hope they have installed by now. The lift ride was amazing and for anyone fearful of heights, there was such an interesting media display in the lift and just after to distract you! We spent a good hour or so here wandering around a couple of times and ate at the cafe as we'd missed breakfast for the early queue. There were some characters doing talks on interesting parts of NY to visit. I'd wished we had put this visit in earlier in our trip as it piqued my interest about other parts of the city but we were leaving the next day!
Fun visit. There is a great view once you get past the introductions to it. Sometimes hard to get into spot since people stay in areas for long periods.

Amazing view . This is a must when in NYC. We bought ticket on site, it took us 10mn to be in the elevator. The ride up to the observatory is fun (will not spoil it). The view is astonishing but plan to spend some time up there as you might have to "queue" to access the windows, people tend to find the perfect spot for their selfies... Moreover being in this NY area is always a special moment considering what happened.

Amazing views!!!. Most amazing experience that would be hard to put into words. Book an early ticket (9-10 am) and don't waste your money on the express line pass unless your going on the weekend or have very limited time. Plan at least an hour to fully experience the magnitude of the views.

Priority Tickets to the Observatory, amazing view of New York City.. I bought a priority ticket online to the Observatory because I figured there were going to be a lot of people and I didn't want to to wait too long. Last Saturday morning at 10:45, there weren't too many. There's a lane specially for Priority Ticketholders but you need to inform them you have one. I probably skipped in front of about 50 people and got to go up to the top within 5 minutes. You can spend about 30-45 minutes to look through each window. They have an iPad that, when you hold it up, can tell you where everything is. There were some people who gave tips as to what's going on that weekend. It was all very organized. The last time I saw that view, it was at the Windows on the World Restaurant, located on Building One/North Tower of the World Trade Center before 9/11. I thought I was never going to see that view again and I'm really glad that I got to see it again.

Awesome views on top of the city. We visited One World Observatory on 8/25 around 5pm. It was my son's 12th birthday. We bought tickets online and did not have to wait at all. The elevator is hugely efficient and you go up very quickly. There is a short video and then the screen rises and there is a beautiful view right in front of you. There was plenty of room for everyone to look and take photos. We had 3 kids with us and everyone enjoyed it.

Observation Tower is a must. Make sure you reserve your tickets on line. We did 6:30 pm and it was perfect. We took our own bottles of water which is better than paying the high price up there. They have it set up very organized so much better than Empire State Building where you are in lines forever!!
Up very very high, 360. There is a Disney -like experience involved with getting your turn on the elevators, but once up there, just WOW! If you are in Manhatten, this is not to be missed.

Sunset cocktails. Get there around 6 pm (August) and go straight to the bar for an unforgettable evening. The restaurant/bar area is well managed and the staff are all helpful and friendly. Menu limited, but not crazy expensive, and there is a very good selection of beers as well as everything else you'd expect at an NYC bar. We spent 3 hours and 200 dollars, we'll be back.

great view. it´s a nice experience and great view. it has no outdoor view, everything is inside the building. Empire State Building keeps on being my favorite. The videos in the elevator and presentations showed before arrive to the view floor make it worth.
nice and beaultiful. beautiful in day and night.. the fist and the tallest skycrapper you see from NJ or anywhere in NY as well..

High life!!. If you suffer from vertigo then this is not for you. All I can say is WOW. Everything from entering the building to leaving was EXCELLENT. The views are magnificent, and you also have video demos with guides who really know their stuff. Food places were busy so never tried. Allow 3 hours for a decent visit.

An incredible experience from start to end - must do!!. The staff were polite and fun, the queue was quick, the elevator ride was one i will never forget and the view from the top was, well, incredible.For the money you are getting a whole different experience compared to The Rock or Empire State (although i love doing those too).Just go!

Great 360 degree views of NYC. Great views from the 100th-102nd floors of this tower even for someone who is not great with heights! Floor to ceiling windows in the observatory give a great panaromic view of NYC. This was probably my favourite place for these views ahead of the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock, if you can live with taking pictures through the windows. Didn't think much of the cafe area - not the greatest of selections (although we were visiting at 6pm).

Well worth a visit. The views were amazing, but people just seemed to sit around all of the windows having a chat rather than looking at and taking in the views, which made this difficult for others to actually get near to the windows. We were there for the sunset which was a nice time to go as you get to see the view in daylight, during sunset and then night time. The elevator ride was interesting too (I won't ruin it for others) but it plays tricks with your mind, very clever!Unless you don't mind the cost, don't buy food or drink up there as it is extremely expensive!

At night.... We went up The Empire State building in the Day, so decided to do One World at night. Amazing!! The view is spectacular! The elevator ride is an experience in itself. Make sure your camera is set on video.

Go early to this observatory!!. We booked the One World Observatory for MasterCard Monday. If you have that credit card, I highly recommend you take advantage of the Monday discount for as long as they have it. And book an early time! Like all popular sites in NYC, arriving early means that you can avoid the huge crowds. We went up at 10am and it became crowded by 11am. The observatory is spectacular!! The views were breath taking. Everyone should experience the elevator ride. We are also glad that we rented the iPad to help us navigate the skyline. However, taking pictures from behind the glass walls is rather pointless. If you want great shots of NYC from high up, I would suggest you go to the Top of the Rock where you can take them outside instead.
Freedom tower ovservatory. Nice to have that view back again. A little pricey, but hey, it's NYC. Lines move efficiently. Miss the outdoor deck of the twins :(

Wow..amazing views. I visited the observatory at the new world trade tower at the request of a friend. I hadn't really had a desire to go to be honest. I've lived in jersey all my life and am a frequent visitor to NYC. My son attended school at PACE and I have family who have called NYC home for many years. The tragedy of 9/11 hit very close and watching the new tower go up and the memorial being built was a constant reminder of that time for me. It always made me upset so I wasn't sure how I would be visiting. I was absolutely stunned. The views from the tower observatory are breathtaking. Floor to ceiling plate glass windows allow you to see a 360 degree view without a problem. You realize that you truly are standing in the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. Tickets are timed and sold in 15 minutes intervals. They have you line up based on your time and have it down to a science. You can buy tickets online in advance but they have you take a screen shot of your tickets on your phone because you tend to lose service when you go downstairs to start the tour. I would recommend buying in your mobile rather than waiting in line there. We actually didn't have tickets when we arrived but rather than wait on line I simply bought them on my mobile right there and got on line. Not sure how the tickets sell during busier times but we had no problem getting tickets right then and there. It was still crowded but they can accommodate fairly large crowds. They do try to sell you an upgrade for $15 which is an iPad that is integrated to the views so you can tell what you are looking at and get more info. This is probably a nice enhancements for those unfamiliar with the area. For me it was fun to point out all the sights seen from so high up. They have a restaurant and a gift shop inside as well as a live person talking about NYC tourist sights to give people some additional insight. I thought they did an awesome job and I would highly recommend a day trip to include the tower, the 9/11 memorial and a ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty/ Ellis Island. Would be a fun filled day of touring. TriBeCa also has some awesome restaurants.. Just saying..
Amazing!. This is a must see. The views are pronominal! The memorial is beautiful. You need to schedule your time because it is appointment only and very busy due to its recent opening.

Beautiful tower. The way the tower look viewed from the street is very impressing. If you want to go to the top the best thing to do is book the hour you want to go because the queues are always long. Incredible view from the top. The only bad thing in my opinion is that there should be an outdoor place to enjoy the view while breathing the air.

Gorgeous views of the city and beyond. Like other reviewers, there are mixed feelings because of what this beautiful building replaced. But we must all move on, and the new WTC does it in style. We took out of towners - and I heard many languages spoken while we were at the top - but even a native New Yorker can enjoy the unique and breathtaking views of our city. It's fun to pick out your favorite places from up high. It's also interesting to see where the WTC shadow falls. Spectacular view of Brooklyn too. I suggest going around a second time to see anything you missed. My only wish is that the elevator ride up was slower. The timescape views of the city are extremely interesting to this history buff, but go by way too quickly - virtually no time to absorb it.

Impressed!. Loved the whole experience. I was impressed with the movie at the beginning and just stayed for a second round. You can see the whole Manhattan and cause of the past events it is a very emotional place. Recommend it to everyone!

Unforgettable Elevator Ride, Spectacular Views, and Terrific Tauran!. My friends and I recently went to the Freedom Tower or One World Observatory. We booked a 9:30am time. We were glad we did because there was little wait time, and it was not crowded then. The elevator ride up lasted less than a minute and surrounded us with an unforgettable time-lapse video of Manhattan’s history from 1500 to present time. The views of New York City and the surrounding area were absolutely spectacular there! Plenty of friendly staff members were available to answer questions and share stories of the city too. My personal favorite was a young lady named Tauren who did a wonderful audience participation presentation within a multi-screen ring of HD video monitors with gesture recognition technology. She was enthusiastic and fun! Thanks, Tauren, for adding so much to our fantastic visit at One World Observatory.

Amazing view.... Visited the observatory with friends from the UK who, like me, had gone up the Empire State Building in the past. To see this engineering marvel rise from the ashes to how it stands today was a special privilege. The views from 360' are spectacular and one can even see the ellipse of the earth if the day is clear. It would be sad if the policies aren't changed when tickets are purchased in advance as suggested for a rainy, dreary day. The view wouldn't be worth it. Another small low point is the photos taken of all who visit and then have the opportunity to purchase. Unfortunately, the snaps aren't allowed to be previewed beforehand and we weren't so keen on our group shot, but did purchase as a memento of the occasion. The staff members chosen to work the elevators or various spots of interest are great at their jobs for a facility only open three short months!Best wishes for continued success but anfewmchanges might be necessary, ie. The photos....
Awesome site. Awesome building. Can be seem from miles away and from many different neighborhoods. Awe inspiring and worth a visit (at least from the outside).

Some awe-inspiring details head this experience!. The elevator ride itself was worth some of the admission and the presentation you witness prior to being 'released' onto the observation deck left me in tears. Kudos to those folks that created these special touches!! The view is, of course, spectacular! Lots to do and no rush to circle around and leave. It's nice to be inside out of the elements and with plenty of walking and standing space, as opposed to the Empire State Building. Although we did not use this service, you can rent an i-pad that will instruct you on what you're viewing if you're not familiar with the New York City area. I saw many folks using these. This was very memorable experience and I recommend it!!

Nice view but a huge sell-out. + view + elevator screens - touristy photos - - covered skyline. Express entry pass: Its worth spending 10 bugs more it will only take you 10 minutes to get in.+ The elevators and Theatre: Great idea to show the history of Manhattan.+ The view: It is 1776 ft high, it must be a great view. (But you pay for it so it's not a real plus point.) - Time to wait: There is no possibility to get around those horrible touristy pictures in front of a green screen, even though you don't want it. During that wait and another 5 minute wait, where they are trying to sell you an IPad that has an augmented reality screen for another 10 USD, you can't even see the skyline, because all the windows are covered. People should either decide to buy the IPad at the ground or be allowed to skip it.- Information Desks: shooting photos with the magnificent north view is barely possible, because they put some sort of information screen with people talking about New York, that will basically make it impossible to catch the best view of the skyline.

Book VIP pass if feel need to go. Long line after long line even if you book ahead; book the VIP pass to skip all the lines on the way up if you must go. Still a long time to leave even with VIP pass. Nice view of the city, but I will not return. It has only been open for 3 months, so maybe they will get things working more smoothly or less people will be interested. Only appeared to have 3 of 5 elevators working when I went in the late afternoon on a Thu.

Awesome view, wish there was an outside like ESB and TOTR.. After you get through the RUDE security line (had better treatment by airports' TSA), there's a Cool elevator ride, Great intro in the sort of stand up theater, and Amazing 360 view - would recommend bringing binoculars! Thought sky portal to the streets was a bit cheesy (its a video of traffic...) The whole experience took us about 40 mins.For $32, having an outside observatory would have been the ultimate!

AMAZING Experience! A must for the whole family!. At first I was a little hesitant coming here because of the price, having a family of 8 was a little pricey, but I am so glad that didn't stop me! It was worth every single penny!! We ended up purchasing tickets on line to avoid the long lines and reserve our time slot (which I highly recommend to purchase online). The line to go through security was pretty quick. The ride on the elevator was one of the highlights, my kids (8 and 11) enjoyed the pretty amazing video being played around the elevator explaining the history of the building...the rest of tour...I will have you guys experience :) But overall the views are just spectacular...I was in AWE! Highly recommended for the whole family, something my kids will be talking about for the rest of their lives :)

An awesome, emotional and inspiring place to visit. You must go to the top of this magnificent monolith. There is a major "sharp intake of breath" moment that awaits you at the summit. Go there, see it for yourself & treasure the memory!

A view to Remember...... A poignant visit, bearing in mind I went to the roof top of one of the Twin Towers way back in the 80's....Without giving the game away...the 'welcome' at the top was a great surprise!Great views as you can expect.....with thought of what happened there always in the back of your mind....Well worth a visit....even if you have spent mort of the week at the top of buildings!

amazing!. this is an amazing building with a wonderful memorial, that is dedicated to the people who have lost their lives. the building is very impressive and amazing! the observatory is incredible and gives amazing views over the whole of new york!

So Well Done. 360 degree view of the entire area. The observatory covers the 100th floor and is designed so one can see everywhere north, south, east or west. Yes, on a clear day you can ..... One of the great shots is of Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. Then there is the Brooklyn Bridge and Midtown Bridge. The Empire State Building to the north along with other famous buildings like the Chrysler Building are all within eyeshot.

Beautiful Building. Absolutely an extremely beautiful structure. The style is brilliant and it's 102 floors tower above any neighboring buildings with style and grace. Take the time to walk around it and absorb the wonderful area it sits within. In my opinion, it is perfect for this historic part of the city.

Stunning view, when you survive the marketing around. The view is amazing when the weather is good. The lines were not bad at all so do not be afraid of going there without prior reservation (unles you are large group).Before you can actually see the view, you need to go through several multimedia shows (the one in the elevator is actually quite nice), then a marketing presentation trying to convince you to "upgrade your experience" with an ipad (skip that one and go straight away) and then finally you need to go through an overpriced restaurant (all this with windows covered probably to avoid people observing there) before you actually end up in the observatory itself.But the view is worth it.

Great wide open views. The ride up to the top was too quick to really take in the experience they were trying to present but it was still great. Once off the elevator there is a quick presentation on a video wall with then rises to reveal the actual view. If you are familiar with the view from the original WTC it was obscured by the narrow windows and structural girders. Now there are wide open views of the city and surrounding areas. I dislike the placement of the gift shop in the midst of the sightseeing experience and there is no open air experience like the one the original offered. The price is high ($32) and if you wanted to enjoy a meal or cocktail on a whim you would still have to pay the sightseeing fee of 32.00.

Excellent experience. Bought tickets online on forehand, and had no waiting.Great surprising experience in the elevator going up, perfectly done.Nice set up of preparatory story before you can enjoy the view.Greatly recommended !!
Bittersweet. Have not been to the top of this one yet. Remember clearly sitting on the observation deck with my mom on the original one. Spent my day on the ground this time, but want to go up.

Amazing Views but disappointing experience. First the good parts: Once you get to the windows, the views are amazing. And the elevator ride is cool with great video presentation. However, But with all the marketting hype and salesmanship, other things were disappointing. Buying tickets from a mobile phone was difficult as app or website was not well suited for mobile use. Once purchased, it says it offers mobile delivery of tickets but that doesnt happen, you have to take a screen shot of the bar code of each ticket - it s not clear how to get to further bar codes for more than one ticket and you better be able to display bar codes when you get to the entry point or else they send you to Guest Services then back to end of line. Bummer. They should know, most tourists dont have access to a printer on vacation.. Also, disapointing was all there hype about the great video presentations - they sucked and they dont let you walk past them to avoid wasting time. The other disappointing hype was "three floors of 360 degree views" that was a lie. The architects and interior designers who designed this space were idiots - its terribly poorly designed. The elevator lets you off on 102nd floor which has 80% of windows blocked off from your view and 10% hidden behind the earlier mentioned sucky presentation screen which they open for all of 30 seconds before forcing you to leave the room and goto the 101st floor. This level has 60% of the windows blocked by restaurants, balconies, kitchen equipment and other obstacles - few if any areas close enough to the windows to get a good view. The 100th floor is the only level where you can really get up close to the glass to get a good view or a good picture. However, with so many people crowded to one level, people just camp out and sit in the best spots for hours. and still 10% of windows blocked by advertising displays. This could be fixed by them building raised floor areas toward the interior so you can see over the heads of those who hog the windows in the front. Or if they let visitors near the windows on the 101 and 102 floors it wouldnt be so bad. Again, overall, a good view and a decent value for $32 but they hype this as a world class tourism experience and I dont think its world class at all. The Empire State Building is a better experience.

Proud to see the rebuild of one the fallen towers. While visiting the 9/11 memorial pools, I viewed the next door One World Trade Center. I think it was a great decision to rebuild, and the finished building stands tall, strong, and proud. I only hope and trust the second building will be just as stately. I cannot miss the twin towers in countless movies made before 9/11, and the missing twins are noticeably absent in the skyline, but now with One World Trade Center standing tall and complete, the pride of the NYC skyline is back in the sky. Only one question I have is why the building was not created higher to beat the height of Dubai and other tall skyscrapers ?

Tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. One World Trade Center - the closer you get, the more impressive it looks. The glass exterior and design make it stand out in the downtown skyline. Truly an amazing view

I LOVE THIS BUILDING!. Wow this was quite a view. The elevator ride alone was soo impressive that people were clapping, cheering and exclaiming "WOW!!" at the end. It was a super fast elevator ride that showed the skyline evolving from way back in the day till present day. We went up at night and it was a stunning view but I think the daytime view would have been better. The area around the tower wasn't really lit up like downtown Manhattan (so basically not the night views you get from the Empire State Building). The worst part of trying to get a picture at night is the glass reflects the interior building lighting and no matter what you do it ends up in the picture. Overall I love what this building stands for. To me it symbolizes growth and the way of the future. It shows that we will overcome the 9/11 tragedy and rise up for a bigger/better future.
Great views but pricey. Great views of the city from the vantage point of the observatory but the admission price is a bit steep. Book in advance to avoid the long line ups.

Love it---but---we call it the FREEDOM TOWER. I love the Freedom tower--what it represents---the beautiful shape---the observation level---and you must take time and have lunch on the 102nd floor ( you'll always remember it )

A beautiful tribute. One World Trade Center is a beautiful new tribute to the city. Beautiful on the outside with amazing views of the city from it's observation deck. The elevator is incredibly fast utilizing the interior as a projection screen where a small clip is show during the ride up. Some of the highest and best views of the city. Purchase tickets on line or you will stand in a ridiculously long line!!!

OWO- Outstanding- tallest Building in Northern Hemisphear. It was breath taking, I was speechless, the view from the observatory deck was unbelievable, some one can only experience by visiting there.Staff were very supportive, please take all your shooting gears, camera, camcorder etc.if you in NYC- you can not miss this.

Needs to be more informative. Employees were all very friendly and helpful. View was gorgeous. $30 for a ticket is expensive. I was surprised that there was not helpful brochures or plaques telling you where famous landmarks were. You could rent an ipad for $15 and that would tell you what you were looking at, but it seems a bit tacky to require an additional charge after guests have already paid so much to get in. Please consider having a free app or paper brochures to help guests locate places.
Freedom tower. Pricey for what you get especially if you have a big group but still worthwhile to check it out at least once. Pretty cool how they set it up and the evelvator ride was a nice touch.

One World Trade Center--Truly Magnificent!. A truly unique and remarkable feat of engineering and innovation! While it did take more than a few years for this building to materialize, I must say the results are truly amazing! It’s obvious that substantial time, effort, and forethought went into the design, construction and operation of this awe-inspiring facility! In the end, the City of New York produced a fitting tribute to honor the past and set the standard for future achievements.

Visit . We had a great experience. The only bit of feedback I have is the amount of times we were invited to buy extras eg the virtual tour, photo and people outside with their brochures. I virtual tour guy was surprised I walked away, the photo lady was asking me to view my pic when I didn't want to, and as for the people outside - I didn't like their approach whatsoever. Other than that, a very appropriate tribute to such a tragic event.

Good views but not as good as ESB. The views are good at the top but can be obscured by the frames around the windows and when taking photos glare from the glass, therefore not as good at the main deck at the ESB where you can go outside to get your pictures. You feel like you are on top of everything here looking down at the landscape as opposed to looking across at the landscape, some people felt weird going near the edge up to the window because the glass is floor to ceiling so you almost feel like you are walking off a ledge (some people obviously didn't like this and so would not go right up to the windows) All in all a worthwhile trip and the memorial outside is also worth a visit.

The best views.. Amazing views over Manhattan and the Hudson. Quite emotional really but very well done and planned out. The lift up and the screen show at the top is incredible and you are in for a surprise at the end of the screen show.
Great experience. It is not easy psychologically to be in this place. But it's a great reminder to terrorists that they will not get anything. And normal people always win.

Wonderful !. The view was breathtaking and I loved the amount of information we had about the building itself. It made a huge impression on me. I'm going to come back there! Such a beautiful place to be !:)

The New Symbol of Hope. The One World Trade Center Buiding is now the new showcase building at the New York Financial District or Wall Street. The uniquely shaped building towers over all other buildings at Battery Park and nearby Wall Street. You can visit the observatory on the top floor for a fee, of course.

This was a thrilling experience! I'm from the suburbs, and still found it to be awesome.. I've already told friends and family that this is a MUST SEE experience! The docents were all both friendly and knowledgeable, and using the iPod was well worth $15.00.I lost 3 different people on 9/11 and found the memorial area to be moving and most appropriate; however, this structure is nothing less than amazing! I loved it and will take others there again.

Top O' the U.S.. Great experience to visit the new tower in the wake of the Twin Towers. The elevator ride up was incredible and make sure you take out your camera for the ride up the elevator as it is a virtual rendition of the New York area over the years. Such breathtaking views from up above and you can see the Twin Tower pools when you look down. Just an incredible experience all around.

Brookfield Place for Lunch. We discovered beautiful murals in the one world trade center.We also enjoyed lunch in the Brookfield Place. A great variety to select. Great views. Very clean. After lunch you can stroll along the harbor.

A great observatory but the prices are steep. This is a great observatory, one of the best in the world with 360 degree view, but the price is a little on the steep side. As much as I feel bad for the 9/11 victims and appreciate the people who defend our country, I find that $32 per entry is a very steep price to just go up a 100 floors and look around, though the elevator ride is very thrilling!

Great View, Wish for more 100 Year Ride video Avaliable. First- purchase the ticket with an appointment- well worth it! There was a crazy line but we walked up with our timed ticket and went right in!Second- I was really looking forward to the 100 year Elevator ride. Unfortunately you only get to see the 47 seconds of the wall you are facing. That is why I only give this a 3 rating. On the elevator you see NYC over a period of 100 years, this video should be available somewhere else on the tour as you can only ride the elevator one time and I would have liked to see the other walls (views of NYC in the other directions). Third- The view at the top- spectacular! We did rent the IPad to help identify what we are looking at but it is difficult to navigate/sync as you are standing and around other people, there is no place sit and stabilize. Not sure it was worth the $20 to rent. Gift shop will break the bank. Don't rush, enjoy the view.
Great building. What a beautiful building. The observation deck is now open so I would recommend to everyone if they time to go to visit.
Grandkids vacation in NYC. Great view, fantastic elevator ride. The wait was worth the trip up. Very organized.Very emotional Grandchildren enjoyed this.

NIce Views. Considering what it cost, I was disappointed. I was expecting a lot more from the video and I had thought the elevator ride would have real views of the city. Once you got to the observatory, it seemed that it was sell, sell, sell. If you didn't buy the iPad tour ($20), there were no signs to tell you what you were looking at. They need to ban selfie sticks- one walking around looking at the sights shouldn't have to worry about running into these long sticks.
If you liked Empire State and Top of the Rock, You will love this one better. perfect view, with huge windows, and no worries about the weather , nice air conditioning good gift shop

Wow. This made our 4th visit to New York complete. We have seen this building grow. Like all the big buildings there's a security check but doesn't take long. A super fast lift to the top to a wall presentation to which at the end slides up to reveal an awesome view. 360 view of New York in a safe enclosed observatory, which I felt happier in not being too great with heights. Then once finished and returned to ground level if you turn left on leaving the building can walk around the memorial waterfalls. A must go too.

Trade Center. You could spend a couple of days walking through and seeing and understanding what actually happened in New York. Being out of state you only seen what happened on the news. Walking through the trade center you seen everything that went on and the devastation that New York really went through.

A stunning view of the city!. Although a bit pricey, I definitely thought a trip to the observatory was well worth it. The view of the city is simply stunning. I can only imagine how amazing it must be at sunset/night. The observatory definitely has the "wow factor". They have some AMAZING displays and use a lot of cool technology. We only spent about 1-1 1/2 hours at the observatory, there isn't too much to do and see
one world top of New york. One of the best place to good.Buy your ticket in advance and get the flex ticket,so you don't wait in the queue.It is worth every penny

Great views . We visited the One World building after looking at the 9/11 pools and the museum. It right next door. The building is very impressive from below and we also got great views of it from our tour/ferry to the Statue of Liberty. I had purchased a 5pm time slot to go up and I was happy that I did as it was chaos outside.(friends went a week later on a Friday afternoon and there wasn't anyone around) We did visit soon after its first opening and at peak school holidays so it was to be expected. We went in and quickly went to a lift which had a very interesting video around the building of Manhattan and the building. All in 60 seconds. The views were amazing up top and we got some great photos awesome views of Liberty and the other way Empire State. Well worth the visit for around $30 per person.

Keep it down a but. Nothing wrong with the basis of the observatory. One level -1 there's a nice video showing the people that helped build it. The elevator ride with the big screens is great. Upstairs though, they try twice to lead the whole group of people into a commercial "trap" to make you buy a picture or an iPad to look around. That's too much to make people do when they've already paid a good amount for a ticket.
One World Trade Center in Place of Two. One trade center is fourth tallest skyscraper in world. This building is great example of Modern Architecture hiding behind history in itself. Worth visiting.

Must Do. We knew we wanted a skyscraper experience and decided on One World over Top of the Rock and Empire State because of 60-second elevator to the top time, newness of the building, and location at tip of island so we could see the river almost all the way around the observation deck. We were not disappointed.I had read a lot about madness of trying to get tickets at Empire State, and was therefore delighted when mere seconds after I arrived at the foot of One World and beheld the steady crowd of people approaching to get in line, a staff person asked if we would like to pay by credit card instead of waiting to go pay inside at main cash. We said yes, and 30 seconds later were being ushered into the line about to enter the building and go downstairs to the elevators. The Elevator experience is AWESOME, stand where you can see the walls and have your camcorder ready to go. Spectacularly creative display and singularly powerful history lesson (also on the way down). We chose not to rent the iPad that identified landmarks and didn't feel we missed anything. At first we were going to purchase the photo that they make everyone pose for on entry, but the line to pay was too long so we opted out.Loved One World, don't regret a single penny spent on this family experience.

An emotional return to a new beginning. The new Freedom Tower and 911 museum are a must visit while in New York. Having lived in New York during 911, this visit back was very emotional. They have done an amazing job with the architecture and design of the buildings and memorials.

WELL WORTH A VISIT. Superb views. Upstairs a bit disappointing with cheap souvenirs shop and cafeteria. Nothing to be compared with "Windows on the world" in the now destroyed towers.Bokk in advance to skip the queue.
On My Bucket List. No words to describe it. A must see again for everyone. This was on my bucket list. Did not have enough time to spend here allow for this.

The BEST birds eye views!. This was one AMAZING place. The building is simply beautiful from the outside. Then you go inside and you can tell they put a lot of thought into this building. You ride the escalator one floor down and the show begins there. There is a HUGE screen that shows how many people have visited the observatory since it's open and how may country have been represented in that number. One the day we visited it had been almost 700,000 people that visited since opening. It also shows how many had been there that day. It was on 98 because we were the first group to go up for the day. The elevator show was great! Then you get upstairs and are just WOWED. I won't give it all away but this is a must see place for anyone visiting or living in NY.

nice and tall. this building was build instead of the 2 building to avoid the mistakes of the 2 building , that lead to the collapse , but people still dont want to rent the offices there , it is the tallest builing in manhatten now and you can pay a fees to go up see all manhatten ,
A view to behold. You simply have to go up One World on a trip to Manhattan. My tip is to buy your ticket in advance and pay the extra for a priority ticket to skip the queues.
Amazing view, fantastic reveal. Fantastic attraction - the moment the view of Manhattan is revealed is very special, truly breath-taking
a mut. the freedom tower is a thing to remember, see it from a far, or see it up close but remember what it stands for !
Higher than ever in NY - a must see. Great NY view. Lot of extra stuff from bottom (foundations, tribute to workers)to elevator (NY story) to top (NY buzz, restaurant, street glass).

Wow factor!. We booked tickets online for 10am and that was just right - it started to get a bit crowded after 11am.A heartfelt insight into the construction of OWTC on the lower levels, then BOOM get in the lift - no spoiler here, but get your mobile set to video and record it. 47s to floor 102 then BOOM, another wow.The views are spectacular!The only negative point would be for there to be have some anti reflective coating to be added to the windows.I did feel a tinge of sadness whilst here looking down to the memorial garden - in my opinion, a moment of reflection from up that high is the least one could do.

A Must Do Event.... Going to the top of One World Trade is a must do event in NYC. Like the Eiffel Tower in Paris - - you have to do this and you will be glad you did. Buy your tickets in advance either at the site if you want the original ticket as a keepsake, or on-line. The cost of $32 is well worth it. You will not be disappointed..

Amazing views and the lift ride is worth the admission fee alone !. The lift ride is amazing here,Both up and down.The views over the city are a wow moment,The staff are extremely friendly also.You must visit here while in NYC

Amazing views and the lift ride is worth the admission fee alone !. I came here and had priority entrance for 10.30am,There were 10 people in the que so not sure if this is really needed.The lift ride up and down is amazing,I liked it as much as the view.Out of the big 3 this is 2nd just behind TOTR,You must come here when in NYC.

The view IS great, but..... On a clear August day the view from the One World Observatory was magnificent - we could see for miles in all directions .After entering and being directed downstairs we were processed through the security checkpoint. Some people had evidently never done that before. We then found ourselves in faux surroundings made to look like 450 million years ago, bed rock Manhattan.An elevator zoomed us 102 floors in less than a minute. They offer a wonderful surround movie which took us from the past to the present. Too bad we could not really enjoy it, since our noses were pressed against the elevator wall.We were then directed along the rail of a screening room where we saw another multimedia show of Manhattan. We were on an end - center is the place to see best.We were then directed to stand and wait for yet another presentation, which we skipped.Here is the problem with the observatory: there is no panoramic view. Window mullions every 5 feet prevent a wide view. Also the angles prevent good shots of the Empire State Bldg and midtown. The view down to the 9/11 Memorial is so steep one pool was out of our view.There are also two live presentation areas that further block the view and create noise and congestion.So I'm glad I went to the tallest building in North America. I won't go back.
Best part of NYC. All that I can say is that it was amazing. A must-see if you visit NYC. The observatory left us speechless. Our entire visit to the 911 memorial will never be forgotten.

Amazing views - choose your day to visit carefully. One WTC is a triumph in so many ways and an incredibly poignant place to visit straight after the 9/11 tower sites. The view is stunning but depends of course on the weather so I would not book up weeks in advance. We turned up on a clear day in mid July and queued for little more than ten minutes before getting our tickets. There's no point spending loads of money without the guarantee of a good view.The lift up is amazing and rockets up through over a hundred floors at 23mph. The walls of the lift are screens showing a history of New York with a very brief reference to 9/11. Personally I found the speed of the lift and the thought of the distance it was covering quite unnerving and I felt quite wobbly on exiting at the top not least because you don't immediately get the distraction of the amazing view. As for the view - well it lives up to the billing and with a crane of the neck you can see the 9/11 Memorial far down below and looking tiny. Utterly thought-provoking. Totally moving. Collywobbles aside I would definitely go again,

Great views and elevator nearly worth admission price alone. We booked the priority tickets and would definitely recommend as queues were long. We combined with Liberty Island trip to see Manhattan from 2 unique perspectives

"Observatory Of one World Center". Views cannot be beat! Even more comprehensive than Empire State Building! Same Price, $32.00 to go up to the observatory! Restaurant up there too! 360 degree views Abound! Perfect way to spend the day!

Must visit to honor and remembrance!. I visited this place in memory of the lives lost and to show my solidarity of non-violence and values for the human kind nevertheless wherever you may come from! I would recommend this place if you are in NYC to spend some quiet time and prayers!
WTC Visit. Wow what can you say. An experience not to be missed. Also good value for money bearing in mind to situation and what you get out of it.
Must go to. Emotional stories of the building as you enter the tour area. Fabulous screen show in the lift on both the journey up and down. The best views of New York and for miles around!

Do visit the new One World Trade Center when you are in Manhattan. I did not pay to go up the tower but it's worth going to the (new) One World Trade Center. There is a museum (entrance fee required) nearby

Amazing Views. Very commercialised but great to see it thriving. As me and my Husband visited the twin towers on our first time visit, the building site on our second and now One World Observatory which made the manorial polls very poignant.

Not the best experience.... Don't get me wrong, it was a very well done observatory, but there was something that felt very weird about paying $35 to get to the top given the history of the area. People were pushing to the get to the glass and rushing you to get out of the way. It wasn't my favorite view of the city, and there's no outdoor portion, which was a bit disappointing to me.

Great view destroyed by noise and sales pitches. Of course the view itself is great, as you'd expect. Though since the observatory is indoor the view is distracted by lots of glare and reflections in the windows.The experience is ruined by lots of irrelevant "multimedia" timewasters and sales pitches. Once you get through security, you just want to go up and enjoy the view, but you are forced through irrelevant presentations and sales pitches, so you're looking at about 30 minutes waste of time, before you are actually able to see and enjoy the view. But even at the observatory deck the experience is destroyed by several loud tourist information presentations.If you'd rather enjoy the view of Manhattan peacefully and quietly, without glare, reflections og sales pitches, I highly recommend Top of the Rock at Rockefeller instead.

Awesome - American Marketing & Presentation at its Finest. Just go do this. Buy the ticket online. Have a beer across the street in the Marina outside before and than take the fun elevator up to see the best city in the world from above!

You can see for miles way above the clouds. Worth every penny. Amazing views. The gift shop and main restaurant are a bit pricey but they do have a cafe and that's pretty reasonable. Go on a sunny day... time it just right, go while it's still daylight and right before the sunsets. You will not be disappointed. And yet, I was there on a cloudy rainy day and still the views were amazing. Will definitely go back. Probably in the fall/early winter... the colors of fall must be amazing.

New must-do for NYC. Buy advance priority tickets and save yourself a lot of time, although you will still queue. The views are spectacular, but the way they have designed this attraction - right from the lifts you take up to your first experience when the lift doors open - make this more than just another bird's-eye view.And there's a lot more to do than just look at the view and fight your way to the glass to take your photos. The New York guides who give insights, significant and insignificant, into Big Apple lifestyle and history at the clever audio-visual station are fascinating and are well worth spending some time with.Tip: even with advance purchase priority tickets, it's worth arriving early to get to the head of the queue for your allocated time.

Amazing Views of an Amazing City. Before you even get to the observation level you get to take a lift the takes 60 seconds to go 102 stories. I suggest you take a video in the lift as you get a story across time. You will then go into a theatre to watch a brief 1-2 minute movie of NYC. I would also suggest getting your video ready because at the end of the movie the screen rises to show the NYC skyline. It makes a great video. After that you go to the observation deck and the views in all directions are stunning. A great way to see for as far as the eye can see. A must do in NYC.
Great Experience. The world trade center memorial is a wonderful place to visit. Luckily the day I went there was not much of a crowd.

Wonderful Views - put this on your itinerary!. I booked this for a day in August on the day it opened for bookings in May. We waited in line for a short time which was lucky as it was in the boiling hot sun. The elevator trip was very imaginative as others have described, giving a history of New York on screen walls of the carriage. It was so quick and smooth. The short talk is followed by an impactful reveal of the view. You can pay for "interactive" iPads to tell you what is what but they are not truly interactive, ie they do not follow where you point exactly (as they were purported to do) and they only contain limited information about a few selected sites. Maybe they are working on this?As a tourist, I wanted to know about far more than was offered. There are talks from guides and you can ask them to pick out different aspects to talk about and they talk to a whole group about that subject such as Wall Street. I think this information would have been better presented in a truly interactive way by personal phones etc. The gift shop was full of expensive stuff and not much in the way of a postcard! The cafe was disappointingly limited in its offering and we struggled to find something light for lunch. The toilets were odd, multisex and confusing to visitors. They missed a trick here, compared to eg The Shard in London where they are a feature with clear glass floor to ceiling!We stayed up there for a couple of hours, it really was worth the $32 each. It is an unforgettable view and a testament to man's achievements to view a whole city like that. Anyone who is bored of the view must be bored of life!

A look back at the tragic past, and a bright future, all in one!. Buying tickets was quick and easy. The line was manageable. Ample time to visit, take pictures and study the architectural details and renovations/rebuilding post 9/11. Monument to how well the city picked itself up after a global tragedy. Impressive new tower.

Out of this World!!. Amazing experience! Very organized! Building is gorgeous! Fastest elevator ride in the world is the most entertaining. When the walls go up....WOW factor 10x. Still long the twins next door... Beautifully done!!

Breathtaking!. Simply breathtaking. What a feeling of pride and power this place gives you!Time your visit 1hr before sunset.... to watch sun sink into the horizon and see the shadows of the buildings on the buildings is unforgettable!

Extremly disapointing, no outside platform, never ending push to spend money (despite high entrance fee). no external access on the top like Rockfeller or Empire StateVery difficult to take good pictures due to reflection and lot of peopleDo you want the ipad experience?mdo you want to take the souvenir photo? Do you want,...... High entrance fees (almost 150usd for a family)

Amazing!. Unfortunately the day we had booked our tickets for was pouring with rain and zero visibility but it was absolutely no problem in changing our ticket for the following day which was a glorious sunny one! The views were fantastic and a wonderful unforgettable experience.

Very busy, get a priority ticket!. The views are great. Biggest issues were the crowds, but it is NY. It can be hard to get good pics because you have to take them from the other side of a window. Hopefully one day they'll add an outdoor observation. Also make sure you get a priority if you don't want to wait in line! I'm glad I went up, not sure if I would go up again though.

Superb. I bought my tickets online when I made my reservation for dinner. I had a 6.30pm time, there was no lines and I went straight to the top. The views were breathtaking. I wasn't rushed and was able to take my time. The gift shop was good but found that the prices where quite high.Dinner at the ONE restaurant was amazing. Yes it was $84 but it was a 4 course meal. You did get to choose what you wanted. I found the portion sizes for me where perfect. The staff were very helpful and polite. I would definitely go for dinner again. I do not think you should have to pay to go up to the observatory if you are having dinner though.

You just have to do this.. Awesome. Really well organised visit, the ride up and down in the elevator is spectacular, then the film presentation is very well done, then when the walls lift and you are presented with a view of Manhattan that is beyond compare it really takes your breath away. The observation deck is superb and the photo opportunities are endless. The only way to better the views you get from this building would be to go up in a helicopter. This is worth every cent.

A Forever View. We purchased our tickets the same day, not in advance on line and had no wait. The whole process was very organized. Staff was extremely helpful. The view was amazing. My only regret was that being so high up, you could not see some of the details of the buildings and landmarks. At ESB observatory, you are also able to be outside and the view seems a bit more real, versus through a window. We waited until mid day to go when the clouds had cleared.
Wonderful experience. Amazing views from the top of the Freedom Tower. Just an overall wonderful experience. The two new ponds that are in place of the twin towers are absolutely incredible!

Top of the World. Buying tickets online in advance is a must. The elevator ride up is amazing. We felt like we could see forever! Every time we visit NYC we include a 9-11 memory. How can we forget??? I get emotional every time we visit. And this view just topped it. Remember those who gave the ultimate sacrifice.

Terrific views on a clear day, but money being made on the misery of the victims. I am probably in the minority here, but I have a big problem with money being made on the misery of the 9/11 victims. It is true that the views from the observatory are great on a clear day, but a look at the type of merchandise on sale at the gift shop is truly nauseating. This is true of the gift shop items on sale at the 9/11 museum as well. The best part of this attraction is the elevator ride up during which a visual history of Manhattan island is recreated on the elevator walls.

Beautiful Building and Awesome Views. The building itself is very impressive and beautiful and the views at the top are awesome. We reserved tickets on-line the night before and had only a small wait when we arrived. We went in the morning when it was less crowded. We have been to both the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Center Observations so we decided that we needed to try this one. We're glad we went and did enjoy it a lot however I would say the views are better from both the other two sites.

Unbelievable view. This is a must if you want a great view of the city! We went at 7:00 pm so we could see during the day and also see the evening lights. There was no line and it was a quick ride up. Loved the experience right after the elevator ride! Very cool. The focus here is on the city and the observation deck and not the events of 9/11. If you are looking for that, go to the 9/11 museum and memorial. It's $32 pp, a little more than the others (Top of the Rock or Empire State), but worth it.
Solemn. It was easy to get to by subway. We were aware that we were 'on' the victims, which made it solemn. The tour guides were annoying as we were trying to reflect.

Top of the World. The views from the observation desk are amazing, I got a chill down my spine looking down to the plunge pools where the twin towers used to be but the best bit about this visit is the elevator ride up and down, I will not spoil it but it was worth the entrance fee just for this. The way you are introduced to the view is very clever also. This a must on any NYC Itinerary.

Low Value for the Money. Kind of expensive for what it is, $30 a person to ride to the top of a very tall building, granted with history and such. The elevator ride was the best part, showing the history of NYC on the LCD walls.

Awesome!. This experience is wonderful. One should take their time and walk slowly around several times to catch it all and experience the views. It can be very educational but the city itself is just incredibly beautiful, LIKE A WORK OF ART. i felt proud to be an American and proud to be a New Yorker as well.D0 not eat IN THE EATERIES up on top. There is no place for senior citizens, elderly or handicapped to eat unless you go into their restaurant WHICH HAS A MINIMAL MENU AT AVERAGE 22PP AND 18% SERVICE CHARGE/GRATUITY PLUS TAX.THEY SHOULD HAVE A PLACE TO SIT AND EAT WITH CHILDREN TO BAG IT OR EAT LESS COSTLY WHILE SITTING. ,CAFETERIA STYLE WOULD BE HELPFUL ESPECIALLY for LARGE FAMILIESsee the 9/11 memorial and bow your head. it is right there as is the 9/11 museum.

Don't miss it - wear comfortable shoes.. While this monument to our resiliency is impressive, the experience of visiting the observation deck can be frustrating if not viewed from an adventuresome perspective. Do not expect to get anywhere fast. Crowds and people-handling techniques make the process longer than you would expect. While waiting, there are no places to sit and rest or wait for the line to move ahead. Plan to spend a long time on your feet. The restaurant at the observation level is a great place to relax, have a drink, and enjoy the view in style.
Amazing view of the city!. From the moment you step in till you leave it's cool! Everything is pretty organized. When you get in you can stay as much as you want.Just wish they had glass floor!

so so experience...... The entry and elevator ride was exiting but on top it was very disappointing. Somehow nothing was extraordinary or eye catching except the view and even that does not feel as exciting as it was from the World Trade Center observation deck. You must need to come up with more creative ideas to make it a special trip.

MUST SEE!!!. All I can say Is WOW!!!!! The whole experience, from beginning to end is just AMAZING!!! Crazy views of NYC. We went to the bar at the top.... Very nice place to sit and have a cocktail and take in the view...BUT...crazy expensive and the service was terrible. We went on a Tuesday-mid day in July and only waited in line for about 5 minutes to buy tickets. It was perfect.

One World Trade Center not to miss!. Well what can I say, its a beautiful tribute to all the people who lost their lives at the World Trade Center.The 360 degree view of Manhattan and the surrounding islands is a much see. Loved it every bit.
Stunning views and slick presentation. At the south end of Manhattan you can look up town with the sun at your back the views are stunning.
Tower of glass. Wish they kept the name Freedom Tower. I still call it that. Can't do much there but liked the design and significance of the height

Amazing! Have your video rolling on your iPhone in the elevator up and down!. We couldn't wait to visit 1WTC. It opened May 29th and we were there on Tuesday, August 4th. It was everything we expected and MORE! We bought "DAY FLEX" tickets (which do cost more) but we weren't sure when we would land there and wanted to have the flexibility. When we did get there, we went to the front of the line and were escourted down the stairs and straight to the elevators. Awesome! Make sure to have your iPhone video rolling when you are going up the elevator and also coming back down in the end. There is so much going on- on those elevator rides! Make sure to capture it. Also, have your video going when they take you into an orientation room (at the beginning) and then all the walls GO UP RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU and you see the AMAZING NEW YORK VIEW!!! We did not eat at the restaurants as we had heard the food was just ok and quite expensive. Walked around and took in the views. There are certain places you can stand to get excellent photos without the glass reflections showing up in them. We found them. There is also a gift shop up there for momentos. Really liked our visit here. So worth it!

we were rushed. we were rush!!!there was an event going on this past weekend up in the observatory and they did email us and told me our 9pm tickets were gonna be changed ~ because of a special event.we were giving the option of 8:45pm... I asked the woman on the phone if it would take me long to see ad enjoy the observatory. she asked if i plan to eat or have drinks upstairs. i said yes but it would take longI nev got to have y drinks or have a snackonly because we got started later than 8.45 pmits a shame ~ I rented the iPad n still didn't get to enjoy it because b4 i knew it they were asking for the ipad back

Views are superb, but the experience could have been better.. We visited the observatory with two children, ages three and seven. We went early in the morning which is definitely the best time to go ss there were absolutely no lines. We bought general admission tickets the day before and got in very quickly. If you are going in the morning, there is no reason to buy the more expensive VIP tickets. Waste of money!You have to go through the usual security and so on. The elevator ride is really interesting as is the initial welcome to the observatory deck. From there, unfortunately, the experience is dampened by sales pitches. First, there is a sales pitch to buy iPad information tablets. Again, no need if you have Google maps and you can easily map out what everything is in a few moments. Then, they ask you to take a photo which can be purchased at the end. You are being shuffled around so that you don't quite know what is happening. It is quite annoying. Then you walk by the restaurant and then finally get to go to the observation deck. Some of the best views are obscured by carnival like salesman trying to sell you other tours around New York City. Also, the sky deck is supposed to show you how everything looks down below as if if you were to look straight down, is actually just a video feed, or even perhaps a loop, of the city and street view down below. I thought this was going to be similar to the CN Tower in Toronto where you actually stand on Lucite/plexiglass and see down to the street below. I must admit I found it surprising given that this was just completed that they could have incorporated this feature!Overall, the views are amazing and a poignant reminder of what occurred on this hallowed ground. Still quite worth visiting despite these negatives.

WOW!. WOW! WOW! WOW! Okay, you go way, high up and see amazing views, however the most amazing things about this place are the elevator rides and the way you are introduced to the observatory once you get up there. On the way up every wall of the elevator turns into a multimedia presentation that begins with Manhattan before buildings, then grows and builds before your eyes as the elevator reaches the top at an amazing speed. Except for the ear popping you can barely tell you're moving. Once you reach the top your are herded into a long narrow hall with a black wall in front of you. Okay....spoiler alert. Stop reading if you want to be surprised when you go there. Once everyone is in the room another multimedia presentation is shown on the wall of places around New York City. it's very impressive. Then the walls go black and begin to raise in sections revealing an unbelievable view of New York City and beyond! The observatory has souvenirs (naturally) and a restaurant. On the way down you get another multimedia presentation in the elevator showing NYC in the near future when all the new buildings are built (I think, because i was taking pictures of it when it was running). Once at the observatory you have the option of renting an ipad that you could use to figure out what buildings you are looking at. I had to try it even though I knew most of the famous structures. However, I turned it back in after a few minutes, because it got in the way of my picture taking. It cost $15 to rent. Before you go you need to get tickets online, though I guess you can get tickets at the site, though you may be limited to when you can go up. Even if you get tickets ahead of time you will still be waiting in line for awhile. However, you can pay a little more and get a ticket that will put you in the front of the line at the chosen time, or pay even more money for the flex pass that allows you to jump in the front of the line at any time during that day. The flex pass cost $64. Of course, be prepared to go through lots of security. One more thing, if you are waiting in the long line you will get to see a presentation about the building of the tower while you are moving along in the line.

Well worth the price!. We bought our tickets online about one week before we visited. We had to wait in line to get in for about 15 minutes, which wasn't bad at all. The elevator ride up is fantastic, I won't spoil the surprise but it was our favorite part of the observatory. Once we got to the top, we had plenty of time to take in the views, then we had a drink at the bar with an amazing view of the city. We really enjoyed the entire experience.

Great elevator ride and top view from above, priority tickets are golden timesaver. I did not have exact time plan, so I could not buy ticket in advance, The line for tickets was really loooong. After a few minutes one employe came and asked, if anybody wants to buy priority tickets. I said yes, and it was best decision ever. I came directly to the ticket cashier and in 5 minutes I was in the allready in an elevator. There the fun part begins, the ride itself and video support are amazing. On the top the views are incredible and you also have one hour of free wifi (no GSM signal, too high above the ground). I took a lot of pictures and it was definitely worth every dollar. So suggestion to all visitors, buy priority tickets. It saves you time, this is worth a lot more than the price difference. Top new attraction in NYC

Congestion: Too many people per visitor slot.. Yes, the views are great from up there!However, too many bookings per slot results in a huge crowd at the top. Waited in a queue for half an hour to get an elevator down again. This was anew evening slot just after sunset.
will take you by surprise!. this is a good place to visit. the ticket is $32.dont get scared by the lines/. they move quite fast. the initial movie is spectacular and pay attention towards the end.

Great views as expected. Pre-booked tickets which in hindsight was a bit daft. Day before it was pouring down so views would have been non-existent. Luckily the day of our ascent the weather was great and the views spectacular, the lesson here is don't pre-book, just turn up early on a good day and pay at the gate.

THIS IS IT. If you only do one sight in NYC here it is.. This is it! America standing proud at 1776 feet (it's also an important date in U.S. History).The views, the sights, see New York the State and the City. Wow !!! forget the other skyscrapers, if you only do one - THIS IS IT. It's for everyone, the whole family.

New York from the top!. The experience is worth every penny. It starts in the foundations, where several LCD panels show testimonials from engineers and construction workers. The lift provides you the impression you are experiencing a time travel. And the view, well it is New York. We scheduled a visitation one hour before sunset, and the scene was indescribable.

A place to remember what is to be proud of America.... Excellent the visit there: from the elevator excellent presentation about the buildup story of NY, to the view, the cafeteria, the store and the options on the top... A sad remembrance of the visit to the Twin Towers.How proud you feel there!TIP: Pay a little extra and avoid the lines with an express pass.

Absolutely breathtaking views!. The views from the observatory were breathtaking! I've been up many buildings with observatories (Empire State, Willis in Chicago, the Shard in London etc) and this was by far the best experience. The elevator ride was entertaining and extremely fun and the following video presentation was amazing. The views across to Liberty Island, Brooklyn bridge and over the city seeing the Empire State Building were incredible and I cannot recommend doing this enough! Absolutely loved it!

Too much standing!. The view was fantastic! The experience was not. Had to stand in line outside in the blazing sun to gain entrance. Once inside, no instructions on where to go. Made our way to a basement firetrap of a tour, just to stand in another line for the elevator. Got to the 102nd floor for a 2 minute video while STILL STANDING. Got a glimpse of the view just to be shuffled out and told to go down 2 flights to the 100th floor where you could enjoy the view. NO PLACE TO SIT DOWN still! View was great, but so tired of standing I couldn't enjoy it. Needs benches and seating area for the presentation.
A great family orientated experience. Loved the view, very efficient process getting in and up. Used iPad kids loved it to explain view. Only criticism gift shop ridiculously expensive.
An awemazing sight. When I saw the World Trade Center, it took my breath away. Its astonishing design, meaning, and elegance made me feel like we’ve stood tall despite terrorism.

Great views from the observation deck of 1WTC. We bought tickets online beforehand for a visit to One World Trade Centre. No long queuing and at our designated visit time of 10am were allowed in, through bag check and up over 100 stories - the lift is so quiet and fast, my ears "popped". Yes, once you get up to the top, there is a short presentation on hiring the iPads but up front they say it is not compulsory so we just walked on and down the escalators to the observation deck. There was no high pressured sales and the staff were without fail efficient and friendly.Plenty of room to view from all around behind glass windows. The views are amazing, even with the slightly hazy weather we had. We were up there for just over an hour. It was getting busier by the time we left at just after 11am.We combined this with a visit to the 9/11 memorial museum and I am so glad we did the tower first as we hadn't realised how much there was to see in the museum. We ended up spending most of the day in the WTC area. 10am 1WTC, 11.30am walking around the 9/11 Memorial pools and garden, 12.30pm - 4pm in the museum (and we would have stayed longer if we hadn't had a later commitment).

Worth the view, but be prepared for long lines and long waits even with timed tickets. Bought tickets ahead of time for the One World Observatory. The view is unbelievable, but it was very commercial -- more of a DisneyWorld type experience rather than a somber occasion. Had to wait in several lines -- was exhausting.

warning to those of limited mobility. This amazing experience was ruined for us as one of our group was of limited mobility, and there was nowhere for him to sit.We had assumed we could sit in the cafe, but there are no chairs, you stand at tall tables.When we desperately asked for a seat we were told to write and complain, no one was interested.We could see a chair in a closed off space but they wouldn't let us use it.I was pretty disgusted and we couldn't get out fast enough. It would appear that if you are in a wheelchair your needs are catered for,but those like my husband who has MS, or even the elderly are left to struggle.

We had a great visit even though it was a bit overcast.. The trip up on the elevator with the "movie" of the NYC timeline was fascinating. Too bad the elevator can't go slower in order to enjoy this movie.We liked the fact that we were told before hand that it was really overcast at the top and we were offered the opportunity to re-book. We still enjoyed the view at the top.The only negative is that the tickets are a bit pricey. Being more than the Nine Eleven Museum doesn't seem to make sense.

you need to!!. I have seen the world trade center for a while as a local new yorker, but I finally made the trip to go see the freedom tower in person. all i have to say is that for those of you who haven't seen it... you need to!!

A Place to Reflect and Relax. After returning from a day at Governors Island my friend and I walked up to One World Trade. Looking up at this building while walking up West Street is an experience in itself. We arrived and walked around viewing the reflecting pools and sat for awhile to enjoy the peaceful respectful atmosphere. It is beautiful here and a great place to just sit and relax
Marvellous work of architecture. the building looks as though it's merging into the sky! I was awed! Amazed! Mesmerised! Blends well into the nyc skyline!!

If you run out of time to get here, don't worry. The building is quite beautiful, we bought our tickets in advance, there was some confusion about where to wait if you had a ticket, that could be though that our line was there before the attraction opened - so there wasn't guidance from the very beginning. The lift ride up and down is amazing.The views are good - we went on a pretty hazy day so some parts aren't very clear. In some parts it's really hard to get a good photo of the view - the way the windows are means there's lots of glare. I'm not sure if this would change depending on the time of the day. The best view (north) is blocked by a pole and a presentation screen. This would be the perfect shot of the Empire State Building and all of Midtown. The cafe prices are crazy CRAZY! I'm hoping that some of the price point is donated to FDNY? A bottle of water is $5 (slab of 24 from Duane Reade is $7) a 'latte' is $6 (literally a nespresso pod coffee) and a sandwich was $12.
