Plus tax. The gift shop is just ok. You go through thorough security on the way in - I'm not sure if you can take your own water and food in. The view is good from the point of view of a different persepective of the city, however if you only had 1 week in NYC and were pushed for time, don't feel like you've missed a lot if you don't have time to go up.
Scarper where. Bent back nay lie down to get a grand view. excellent property to own in best part of Manhattan. go to see it and believe yourself

A huge tower in the heart of the financial district. This is a phenomenal landmark in beautiful surroundings. It is very popular with tourists and there are lots of friendly officers around to protect you and give helpful advice. The tower has a great viewing gallery and lots to do so it is a must do if you are in manhattan.

An emotional, incredible experience. Visiting the One World Observatory at One World Trade Center was a pretty emotional experience for me. The last time I stood so high in that same space was on the observation deck of one of the Twin Towers. I couldn’t help but be drawn back to my previous visit as well as remembering when, about 12 years later, I saw on television the despicable acts of terrorism that brought those towers down. And so it was ‘wondrous strange’ to be standing in that space again, and to again hear the languages from all over the world spoken by my fellow visitors. I was proud for the city of New York as well as for all Americans that we’d been able to build such a magnificent structure to replace ‘our’ towers. And the view is incredible; better than any other ‘observation’ view anywhere. And since the city and all the surroundings are laid out before you, there is lots and lots to see. Now they even rent iPads with a great program explaining all of the sights. I was also very impressed with the professional but friendly demeanor of the staff. I told one of them I didn’t remember New Yorkers being this friendly and she said, ‘Yeah, I guess we’ve gotten soft since you were here last.’ I had to tell her with a smile, ‘Not soft, just friendly’ … and she laughed. New Yorkers are still tough as diamonds in the rough, but now I guess with the polish of a much lower crime rate and the general prosperity of the city, they’re letting more of their sparkle show. Going up in the One World Observatory was definitely a big highlight of my trip to New York. I could have stayed for hours, but hey, I had to get over to Katz’s for lunch.

Reflecting Pools. f you can only visit one landmark while in NYC then the World Trade Center Memorial is a must. It is a beautiful memorial to all those who lost their lives in our most tragic history.

Very disappointed!!. We were so excited when we purchased tickets to get to the top of the new World Trade Center. But when we actually went to use our tickets, we felt more like cattle being walked to the slaughterhouse. We was so commercialized that we couldn't personalize our experience. Additionally, after standing in line for 30 minutes past our time of entry, we were rushed through the observatory, and could not even get around the whole floor. We were cut off and told it was off limits, because of a "private event". We were very disappointed and we complained when we got to the bottom of the building. We are told they would contact us; which they never did. The money paid is NOT worth getting in the observatory in our opinion.

Fantastic views. We got to go up to the observation the day after the tower opened. Glad I pre booked as there were no tickets left by the time we got there. The queuing system worked so well, you have to arrive 15 mins prior to the time on your ticket. I couldn't quite believe this was enough time and arrived 45 mins early and was politely turned away.We went back 15 mins before and got straight into the search area, metal detectors, bag searches etc. Then there's some info screens and the wait for the elevator, which again was quick and painless. I won't got onto describe the ride or the 'show' at the top, as wouldn't want to spoil the surprise. Don't worry there plenty of time to take pictures and enjoy the view.Needless to say the views are amazing and there is a place to get food and drink at the top. We gave it a miss and went for food when we got down, fearing high prices at the top of NYC's highest building!

Brilliant experience. Although this lacks the nostalgia of the Empire State it is a State of the art experience. We had priority pass but the queues didn't seem too horrendous like the Top of the Rock and Empire State. Queue hopping is fun though. The elevator experience was well planned but with so many people crammed in you couldn't really see it to full effect. Mind you you would need to go in it at least 10 times to see all of it - panoramic and so you can only see one bit at a time.It does feel rather futuristic in the way you go from room to room with smiling guides following scripts and guiding you through the experience. The observation decks are on 2 levels and as others have said there is no feeling of crowding - except in lifts.The cafe is actually quite reasonably priced so we did stand and view the scene with a cup of tea and a muffin (both priced the same) no seating in the area - just tablesThere is of course a gift shop with the usual 'made else wear' items.All views are through glass but they were generally finger print free so pictures weren't too bad. Late morning visit made it tricky to do aerial view of memorial fountains as shadows cast over them.My partner found it all far too commercial and touristy - he had been up one of the twin towers and is a fan of the Empire State.iPads are utilised to offer descriptions of sites you can see which was good ( extra fee but you can share) you matched picture to skyline and clicked on name of building for a short history. There were also people telling you about the city and places to go and things to see - including advice about best cheesecake shop - juniors in Times Square - excellent advice btw!

Top of One World Trade Center. Visited One World Trade Center. They need some signs to tell you where to go and what to do. There are about 3 different roped lines with no explanations. When we couldn't figure out the lines of even how to get into the building to get tickets-turns out that was one of the long lines, we ordered the tickets on our phone. Simple process!When we returned in about 3 hours for our tour you got in one of the lines and went in when it was your time. We went down a flight of steps, through security, and then through some winding hallways to the elevators to the top. The experience to the top and even at the top was very Disney like. The elevator ride has videos of New York City through the years. It was pretty cool. When you go to the top you were put in another staging area to watch a film. I don't really remember what the film was about but the effect at the end was amazing. The screen looked like a cityscape and it opened up to the real view. Well done. Next you went to another regrouping area and were asked to rent an iPad that would help you identify buildings while you looked out to the city. We didn't get one, they were $15, but they did look like they were well done. Not sure if you couldn't just get an app that did the same thing, but I did see a lot of people with them.The view from the top was good. Different view than the Empire State building or Top of the Rock.Would I go again...probably not, but it was nice.
stunning. didn't have the chance to go up as it opened one week after i left, however from outside and from the street this building is just impressive and very well designed. worth seeing

Fantastic view of the Manhattan sky line. An amazing view of the skyline from the bottom of manhattan island. Well organised with waiting time kept to a minimum, although given the volume of people you can expect to wait about 30 mins before getting to the top.
Amazing view looking down on the Ground Zero memorial site.

Impressive and touching - a new MUST of the city. The building, the elevator is impressive. The view is amazing. The memory of the original towers is touching. Plan and book in advance, then you can avoid long queue. The top observatory is crowded and unorganized. If you stop for a second at one bottom corner and look up - you will see it like two towers.... just to remember.

Top of the City. This is a must see - only had to wait 15 minutes outside before starting the journey to the top of the city. Best to get tickets on line prior to your visit. high tec elevator ride and a first introduction at the top that you won't forget. Can be expensive if you spring for the gift shop and the interactive tablet plus the Photo ,The 360 degree view of the city is the highlight. Someting that every visitor to the city should do.

GREAT!. Great new attraction in NYC. Best part was the ride up the elevators - perfection! Lines were not bad - recommend but it was a hot day and most of the waiting is done outside - get VIP tickets for no wait at all. Great views on top floor and food was good (no chairs to sit and eat but not an issue for us). Compared to Emipre State Building:Less crowded but I like the quality of pics better at ESB. The main pic we wanted was of the city with Central Park but this was blocked by an attraction (cool attraction) but it needs to be somewhere else.

As spectacular as expected. One World Observatory offers a really stunning view and that's what every visitor should expect. Nothing more, nothing less.Unfortunately it does not offer an open air viewing deck, unlike the Empire State Building or the Rockefeller Center but the perspective is different, too. Overall it is quite a nice experience - and it might be even a bit of an emotional one for all those who had the opportunity to go to the top of the Twin Towers...Also, enjoy the ride in the lift - it's a pleasant one!
Jaw dropping views. Loved this, the surprise element as you first go in is really emotional. Champagne by the glass in the bar made it extra special

Great panorama. We bought timed tickets only so we didn't have to wait long time on the line. Everything went very smooth and enjoyable. The staff was very friendly. U gotta catch the sunset and the city view at night. It s breathtaking experience. The cafe is pricey but good as well. Overall is great experience

Amazing View. They have done really an excellent job overall. It starts with buying your time slot and coming 15 minutes earlier, I had to stay in line for less than the 15 minutes, the staff was very friendly and helpful. They have great educational information on the Manhattan schist etc, the elevator is amazing as well showing the land before anything was constructed to today. Arriving at the top a great surprise effects awaits you. On the deck itself they have both where a guide will provide touristic information and fun facts about New York. Really really great experience I loved it.

It's a tall building and you can see a lot from the top.. It was kind of fun but there's not a lot to it. You ride up a really fast elevator and that is pretty much the coolest part of the experience. Then you look out of the building all the way around for half an hour or so, and then you've done it. Worth doing once for sure.

Absolutely fantatsic, a "Must-Do". Absolutely stunning view, a must-do for anyone visiting New York. The huge observation area can probably accommodate around a 1000 people with ease, and huge floor-to-ceiling windows (over multiple levels) ensures a panoramic view. Even the elevator ride up to the observation deck was superb, with an excellent presentation. Would very highly recommend. Very little queuing (unlike the Empire State) and a much better view.

Amazing !!!. It was a wonderfull expirence, the view its incredible !!! When enter the elevator, try not to be so close to the walls, they are kind of panoramic an you will see much better.
Try to get your tickets with time scheduled in advance so you don't waste time in line for so long.

An emotional visit. Incredible visit to a beautiful building. Having grown up working two blocks from the twin towers, this new building is stunning. A ride up the elevators to the observation deck, you are shown a history timeline of how the cityscape has changed over the last century. Very moving

Great views. One should book a time before you go. When you get to the tower you still have to wait to get up but at least then you don't have to come back later and line up again as you would if you buy tickets on site.The price is fairly steep but in relation to everything else for tourists in NYC it's about average.So suck it up and go but try to go when it is sunny and clear.The elevator ride is imply ear popping. It is a spectacular building and when the other towers go up this property will be one of the most fantastic sites in the world.

Much cooler than the Empire State building. A few years ago I went up the Empire State and I loved the experience and the view fro m there. The One world was even better. It opened in May 2015 so everyhing is brand new. One of the best things were the elevator rides! I dont want to spoil anything but they included an animated video on the walls in the elevator while going up to the 103rd floor or down again. The best elevator ride ever! The view is amazing and we could see almost everything we wanted from the top. Central Park wasnt visible because of other high buildings and that was a slight disappointment. The staff was friendly and polite. The gift shop up there was okey but had nothing we wanted to buy, it was also pretty expensive. The admission was 32 USD per adult, and I recommend booking online in advance. Otherwise it would have meant a 2 hours wait (at least for the people who arrived when we were there). Take some time and visit the 9/11 memorial just next to the One world when you are here.

Awesome ride to the top of NYC. Great experience to NY most recent attraction. The day was overcast so no long wait times. I will not give you any spoilers but the ride up is just fantastic a very well done. Once on the top floor, get ready to be amazed once more, before you get to experience NYC from atop. Magical.

Great start but then a little bit of letdown. Enjoyed the trip to a certain extent. Loved how fast the elevators took you up to the top. Liked the initial presentation, however after that, it was very ordinary. Would have loved an open air observatory but this one is too enclosed to feel anything. I would say Empire State is still a better experience than this one.

Plan enought time to see the museum. This was more than we could take in in 3 hours, it is just an unbelievable collection of memorabilia and at times heart rending. You come away with a great sense of awe for the first responders that risked their life to save everyone.

Book Online along with the 911 Museum. We would not have known about this had my husband's coworker not told us. You should book this in conjunction with a 911 Museum visit. (online ahead of time) The views from the top are incredible and the 60 second trip to the top and down again are fun surprises, as well. We booked a 9:45 am ticket here then an 11:30 am ticket at the 911 museum - worked out perfectly for us!
The One World Trade Center is absolutely amazing. is absolutely amazing from the lobby, the elevator, the observatory all levels of it, the presentation, the shop etc.

Stick to Rockefeller for you NYC selfie.. If you are in NYC for a week, One World Observatory is worth doing. This might come as a surprise but the lift ride to the top and the All American Reveal of the view are the highlights. The view itself is vast but you will struggle to get a good selfie and the best viewing areas are bizarrely blocked by huge TV's with men hard selling other NYC sights (yes really). We visited on the Grand Opening Day of One World so this added to the excitement but having also done The Top of The Rock, I would recommend that as the best view if you are only going to do one "viewing day".

A new angle to see NYC from above!. Very modern building. We really liked to hear and see the story behind the construction and all. It is almost like a Disney ride with many steps, stories and entertainment before you reach the top. At the top it is all closed, which, in my opinion lets it down a bit. However, we loved that there are some people explaining what you see and the view of those huge pools beneath. Would really recommend getting tickets online because we had to cue for over 40 minutes. With the online ticket there is to line at all!

Amazing Views! . The view from the One World Observatory was absolutely amazing! It is an unobstructed 360 degree of the New York Skyline where you can see for miles! My only issue was how the building itself did not do enough to honor victims from 9/11. It was a little bit upsetting to me!

One World Observatory. As a native New Yorker, I found the views to be spectacular, but it cost way too much to see them ($32.00pp). I was planning on spending time in the Bar/Restaurant, but when I saw the setup, I was very disappointed and didn't bother. It cannot be compared to what Windows on the World was which is what I expected.

Freedom Tower. Was easy to get into with pre-booked tickets and was such an experience once up there, views are excellent and there is plenty of space for people to walk around and look, didn't feel cramped or over crowded like the Empire State Building is.

Breathtaking View of NYC. One World Observatory was better than I had anticpated. The line was not bad at all. The elevator was cool with the visuals going up. But the coolest part was the movie you see at the 102 Floor that shows you all over NYC and opens to a Fantastic View.

Elevator ride was fantastic. Loved this experience! The elevator goes to the top in 60 seconds showing you how the city has changed in the the past century. It was amazing and took my mind off of how high I was going. Once at the top, the 360 degree view was so cool. The drinks were incredibly expensive though, a small bottle of ok was 5 dollars.....but my chocolate crossiant was great.

I'm not a fan of skyscrapers, but this is really an impressive building to see both land observatory.. I'm not a fan of skyscrapers, but this is really an impressive building to see both land observatory.

Another observatory after empire state. Its located at the next block after 9/11 memorial pools. Its a talllll building with a observatory on top.. You have to stand in a long queue for tickets and get over there. If you love photos you can get good pictures from your camera.

One World Observatory. Unfortunately the day we went it was raining so the disability was 0. The nice thing was they gave us the option to exchange our tickets for another day, but we were only in the city for the day. We hung around looking out at the city for several hours and visibility did get better. It was amazing and hopefully the next time we get to go the weather will be better.

New favorite spot in NYC. As a native New Yorker it's hard to impress me with a new attraction, but one world is completely different. If you're visiting New York City, or live here, and want to see amazing views and good vibes, visit one world. It created such a reassuring feeling. The design of the building makes it completely uplifting, never sad. Make sure you buy your tickets and get there a little before your reservation time. Just make sure you take plenty of pictures and you're prepared for one of the most spectacular experiences on the island. Definitely a must see for anyone.

One World Oberservation - 360 degree View of NYC. Excellent experience. Especially liked the ride up in the elevator displaying the city through time. Also enjoyed our lunch in the restaurant looking out over the city. 360 degree view at 1200 feet was amazing. Get your tickets online before arriving.

One world trade centre- a place you must visit.. Definitely worth a visit for $32 which I booked before I left the UK. I booked on at 10 am and the queues were quite small. It took seconds to get to the observation deck and amazing views 360 degrees around. Very touching when you think where you are just meters away from the original towers. So new and efficient. There's a cafe, a shop and rest rooms. A must for any trip to NYC.

A little disappointing. Having done the one world observatory , ESB and TOFR on our recent family holiday to New York, we all felt that the one world observatory left you a bit lacking in the experience. As the one world observatory it is totally enclosed you don't get to feel the "wind in your hair" sensation that you get with an open observation deck such as the ESB and TOFR.We also experienced the same issue with handprints on the glass and struggled with the reflections in our photos.We didn't have any problems with queues but we got there for 9:30 in the morning.Also the price of drinks and snacks in the cafe were very expensive , I expected to pay a bit more but no where near what we paid.

Nice view...worth the trip. Bad organization...disorganized greeting staff...confusion plus!!. Worth the trip and cost. Be prepared for the confusion at the gate..no organization! Once inside,everything went well until we decided to eat in the dining room...looked more like a cafeteria. Noisy, expensive, poor service and lousy food. Waited 30 minutes to get a COLD grilled chicken sandwich - $26.!!! Received a credit for the sandwich. Would NOT recommend eating there.

Chilling to see the deep sadness with the walls of this building. On the other hand it showed what these families endure. Was one of the main places we wanted to visit to see the museum. Our daughter who was 2 at the time of this wanted to see this.
I Love New York Even More!. Very impressive. Just makes you proud to be an American. Our spirit may have been bent by 911 but our resilience proves that it wasn't broken.

Trip to the top-Just OK. The museum & memorial are a must see when visiting NYC. So well done... However, visitng the top was just ok. Went with a group of 7 and after the hours it took to get to the top, everyone in our group was done after 10 minutes only to find the wait to ride the elevator back down was an hour! Much prefer the Empire State Building!

What a view!. This place does the tourist attraction right! We had tickets for 1:15 visit. We arrived about 30 minutes early and had to stand and wait, but were inside by 1:18 so they were right on schedule. It was not overly crowded in the observatory. They managed the visit very well and the views were worth any amount of wait we experienced. OUTSTANDING!

Must see in NYC. Great views of lower Manhattan, hudson bay, harbor, etc. Must do for visitors to NYC. Recommend the priority admission to skip the long lines. We purchased the weekend flex guest ticket which allowed us to visit at any time during the weekend. The elevator ride to the top was awesome followed by an awesome presentation at the top (short video). We also purchased the ipad app that allows you to point to an attraction and hear the "very short" commentary. I would not recommend this.

Breath taking visit. Awesome experience, stunning views from the viewing gallery , fantastic entrance to the viewing gallery to add to the whole theatre of the visit . Amazing movie graphics in the lifts. If you pay by MasterCard world credit card you get priority access.
Breathtaking!!. great experience and a beautiful view. I've definitely recommend everyone to go up in One World Observatory.

Amazing panorama!. On a clear day one can almost see forever! The view from all sides is spectacular. The trip up is fun, as the elevator gives you a look at the history of Manhattan island from the stone age to the present in one minute (down is slightly different). Information about the city is provided on the north and south sides of the room by workers who talk about the history, the food and other attractions to be found in and around New York. Very enjoyable.

Wow. Going to the top, was a real rush. Be prepared because the elevator goes quickly and really pops your ears. There is increased security at the new building with good reason. I felt safe enough. It is an awe-inspiring view to see all of New York City 100 stories up!

Great way to memorialize the WTC!. We really enjoyed our day visiting both One WTC and the 9/11 museum. This building is amazing! The elevator ride up is so cool and the view is breathtaking. It's not that much more than the Empire State Building, but I thought it was much better (probably because it's modern).

Amazing. . The videos in the elevator on the way up and down are worth it alone. We went on a sunny clear day. We were able to see for miles. It really is a must see for NYC. Save time and buy tickets online beforehand. Tickets are only good for 15 minutes though.

Worth doing. Worth doing but personally I prefer top of the rock - amazing view but so high up I felt like I wasn't able to see the buildings very well. Quite hard to get good photos through the glass, especially if you want someone in the photo with the view in the background, but I managed to get enough to keep me happy. We went at midday at the end of July and bought our tickets there, very small queue, very efficient lines through security and great elevator ride to the top. Remember to video the story on the walls of the elevator on the way up. Fantastic reveal moment after a 5min video about New York. The one thing that was less than efficient was the cafe in the observatory. I think I queued for nearly 20mins to get 2 sandwiches and there was 1 customer in front of me!! I then queued for another 5 minutes trying to pay for them - again there was only 1 customer in front of me. Not sure what the problem was but there was no sense of speediness at all in this cafe. It here was no where to sit either. Definitely worth doing but not sure it would warrant a repeat visit.

View amazing, experience awful!. Firstly there is the queuing! Even with timed tickets you queue outside, then inside, then after security, which is not a straight line so you can never see the end! When you actually do see the lifts you have another zigzag queue. The lift experience is very well done. Then when you get up to the top you queue for the theatre show!Then the selling starts!The theatre show is an ad for New York, when it's finished, the screen lifts and you see the amazing view, but before you get time to get a photo the screen comes down! Then you move to the selling of the iPad experience, with the view covered, then you go downstairs and there is the selling of photos, again with the view obscured! Finally you get to the level with the view! Which is out standing!The lack of any seating means that everyone is sitting on the window edges so the view down is hard to see! Benches set back from the window would've made it much more enjoyable for those who've queued for ages! Even the cafe didn't have seats and with water at $5 they can afford some! The selling continues with the man selling the portal and of course the gift shop!You then have to queue to get back down.

An amazing tower of beauty. Although we did not go into the tower, we viewed it from the outside.TIP: when you get close enough to the building (10 ft away or less)..look up... the building appear to never end due to its shape..almost like its reaching up into the clouds.Made me feel like it reached all the way to heaven be close to all those who lost their lives.

Brilliant in every way - a must when in New York. Worth the trip up for not only the views over New York but for the actually lift journey which is more like an amusement park ride. Shooting you up 102 floors in less than 60 seconds with projector effects on the walls.

Amazing View. We booked tickets for a specific day and the ticket booth lady told me it was scheduled to rain that day. I booked anyway. When we got there, there were signs "Zero visibility" we went up anyway. We walked right in with no line at all. We had the elevation all to ourselves going up to the top. When we got there we could still see the beautiful view. We stayed for lunch as the clouds parted. The view was awesome. Great experience.

Best view of New York. I literally breezed through here one Sunday morning before a flight home. I paid extra for express entrance, and I was escorted through the ticket line and along the way until I actually board the elevator for the ride to the top. The views are impressive. They had some interactive displays, along with guides, but I was just taking in the scenes. It's one of those things you just have to do. For me, it was a nice bookend to my visit to the Twin Towers in high school.

Elevator is spectacular, the rest OK. This trip is worth it only because of the elevator which apart from being the fastest in the world - 107 stories in under a minute also has another secret which is amazing. Go just for this. The view from the top is better from a more central building like Empire state and the ipad app quite a waste of money. On the plus side, there werent long queues - we went on a tuesday in July and not as much security as one would expect, but it is sensible to bring as little stuff in as possible.

Amazing views of Manhattan and beyond. Make sure you get tickets on line before you go and show up about 20 minutes before your appointment time. They will announce your group entry time and you will get in the line that leads to the door. The entry line is well organized and the trip to the top is fast. There is a restaurant but I did not check it out or the prices and there are restrooms at the top (critical to know when visiting NYC!)

Great views, but experience could be much better. There is so much to like about this observatory deck - the views are fantastic and the customer flow is well managed. The lift experience takes you visually through both time and height. Its really well done. The views here look up Manhattan from the south, so there is much more of a mixed Manhattan, water, other boroughs and NJ view, meaning the night lights are not as impressive as the uptown observatories.If you already know a bit about New York the iPad tablets are a a waste of money.A guide book would be much more use. Similarly the VIP package doesnt seem to offer much that is different as the customer entry is pretty quick for everyoneWhat was frustrating was the poor design meant that people flows crossed at points and the glass windows need to have the handprints cleaned off them to minimise the effect of the glass on photos. The worst design flaw is placing a presentation stand in front of the north windows - the ones with the best views uptown. If this is your only observatory experience of your visit, I would recommend looking at TOTR or the Empire State as they give much more impressive views over Manhattan. However, if you've done those, then One World Observatory will give you a much better picture of how Manhattan fits into its surroundings.

Very nice area. Beautiful architect. the observation is extremely high up for anyone that is fearful of heights I say enjoy the view from outside.The area is nice so you have to go down and take in the sight. It right near the reflecting pools
Beautiful New Building. Nothing will ever compare to the World Trade Center and no one will ever forget the twin towers, but the new Freedom Tower is very beautiful. It is definitely worth a gander.
stunning new skyscaper. beautiful structure and unique design..stunning views around this skyscraper.The area is very busy and full of life

If you do anything on Manhattan! . Every single person gave us great and friendly service and the best we received in NYC - this is a must and the best views from any building! Superb experience and great value.

Emotional stop. Each time we have visited New York(3 times since 2008) we are sure to stop at the memorial. Each time it has changed dramatically and it gets better each time. This was our first time at the waterfalls and they sure made this memorial spot on. To me it's reflective of infinity. We will never forget.
AMAZING view.. It needed more places to sit. Other than that, its an amazing view. My nephew and I had a good time.

Great view but no good photo opportunities. We visited One World Observation Deck. The view is good, but don't expect to take quality photo's because the windows reflect and are dirty. For the best pictures, go to the Empire State Observation Deck.

Could have been better. Considering all the time that it took to build One World Trade Center and Observatory, this could have and should have been a better experience. Did they not send anyone out to other observatories to see what they are doing. 3 days before going up One World Observatory, we were up to the top of the CN tower in Toronto and that was a better experience. We have also been to the ESB, Sears Tower, Taipei 101 and all of those landmarks offer better experiences.Here are the main things that didn't live up to expectations:- We had purchased tickets online prior to our visit for 2:30. We waited in line outside for 45 minutes before we were allowed inside. Why the wait if we had already pre-bought. Once inside, there was another line for the elevators. The final insult is a line where you are forced to listen to a sales pitch to rent an ipad to help you figure out what you're looking at. - "Sky Portal" was a joke. You stand on glass looking at a camera view of the street scene below while a cleaning woman mops your feet as she mops the glass. C'mon, the CN tower does it so much better with an actual glass floor looking down on the ground. - No outside observation deck. Seriously? I want to go outside and feel the wind blow through my hair. ESB does it right. - Prices at the gift shop were outrageous even by NYC standards. That said, there is one thing that OWO has that the others don't and that is a great view of Manhattan and the surrounding area. That alone saved our visit and made it worthwhile.
A must!. Great views, highly recommend this observation deck/observatory. Very special picture taking experience! Wish it was included as one of the attractions in our pass.

Majestic ... But overpriced. Great views of the city but seems really expensive to just go up in the building to the 100th floor. Don't get the pricey extras, especially the priority entrance. We got to the top and found that "special" group waiting for us.If you haven't been on the Empire State Building, this is worth the time, but you need two decide if it's worth $32.00 per person.
Great experience, great views. Great experience, great views. We did this right on dusk so was at a perfect time of night to take in the great New York views. Would recommend.

Amazing Views. Although it was pricey but by NYC standards, typical, it was worth it. Not only did you get to see the amazing views from the 102nd floor but everything they had to enhance your visit was awesome. You really should go!

On the Top of the World!!. My family and I visited One World Observatory last week and let me tell you it is just amazing!!We didn´t know that the tower was already open for public so we went there to visit the 911 Memorial.They have scheduled visits which is very good to avoid lines and crowds up there.We purchased tickets for the next day and if you arrive at your time, you do not have to wait to get in.The whole experience is spectacular!The elevator is also part of the experience because its inside is surrounded with tv screens which show a brief history of the construction of NYC while you go up to the 102 floor!! and on your way down it makes you feel like you fly away from the tower and back.Once you are up there, the view is breathtaking and you can´t stop taking pictures.You can eat at the observatory with Manhattan at your feet!It is really a great way to capture the city.Maybe better than the helicopter tour in terms of time and price.

Impressive new building. Impressive new building to stand in replacement of the two towers lost during 9/11. The exterior is mostly metal and glass, making for some striking photos on a sunny day and it's the tallest building around, so make sure you have your wide angle lens handy.

Pricey but wow! . Book on line and early so you don't have to wait or worse get shut out! The elevator ride up is a short time lapse film showing the area as it built up through the decades, very neat! Then a short film and the wall lifts showing a beautiful view of the city, very very sharp presentation! The views are incredible! Eating choices are decent, one very pricey and one with very good deli style food. Well worth the money!

World class views, a little pricey. Mixed feelings about this attraction. On one hand the views are phenomenal with a 360 degree view of the city and surrounding suburbs, better than the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock, hands down. The elevator rockets you up 102 floors in about a minute... wow. Also,they seem to limit the number of people in the observatory to prevent it from being too crowded. And the other, an all glassed in enclosure with idiots smearing their hands and face on the glass making it a challenge to get a decent photo while dealing with glare on the windows. High ticket price, numerous queues, and then high food/drink prices seem to weigh negatively on the experience. Overall a good experience and worth doing, with the $$ caveat and photo challenges in mind.

Awe inspiring views in all directions.. This building is awe inspiring from the outside, only bested by the views you get from the observation level. They are stunning, well worth the admission price. We got their early and walked up and bought tickets for 9:45 AM and walked right in. The elevators are really cool as they show how the skyline changed in NYC on the way to the top. I'd rate this as the best view out of the three top observation spots (Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, and One World Observatory). Make sure to rent one of the iPads for $15 to help identify all the buildings you can see.

Awesome Views from Financial District. Whilst Empire State and Top of the Rock will give you great Midtown views, One World will give you the Uptown views from the Financial District - great for Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Brooklyn Bridge etc. The lift and video presentation were well done and as we went on a cloudless sunny day, we could see for miles from the Observatory. Had to agree with other posters, that the gift shop was over-priced.Well worth the trip up.

Fantastic experience and the best views. In one word FANTASTIC. A huge amount of thought has gone into this and it is a fantastic place to visit and beats the Empire State hands down. Thought it was worthwhile and def worth the money.

Sight Seeing Trip to New York City. This attraction is a "must see" when in New York City. Just select your date and time you want to go up to the top and buy your tickets online before you go. Very interesting to learn about this tower and the view is absolutely amazing!

The top of the world. Do you remember the song "New York, New York"? The top of the world is at one world trade center. Go to the observation deck, see the city from all angles. Plus, take your selfies.
Enjoyed this place very much.. Glad I went. The elevator ride was cool and the restaurant upstairs was not bad. Would recommend to make reservations for the restaurant upstairs. Fills up quickly.

Book in advance!. Take all the pictures you like of the exterior. If you hope to get in however, you have to buy your ticket in advance and get a specific time slot for entry. We didn't realise this and didn't manage to get in before the holiday. Basically be prepared to queue to get a ticket to queue again to get in later. The rating reflects the process involved to get in rather than any views from the building - which we didn't get in to see

Brand new and brilliant . We agonised over going up the Empire State Building or Rockerfeller Centre. We did not realise that this was open and just stumbled across it. There was no queue. It was not too expensive. The views were stunning. We really enjoyed it. They even had some presentations in the indoor observatory. There is no outside which is probably a good thing. Highly recommend this!

100th floor !. This is well worth the $32 entrance fee in my opinion . The lift (elevator) to the observation deck builds your expectation and the view when you get there does not let you down. We got there at 9.30am and went straight in but I wouldn't leave it till later as it is very popular .

One Amazing View!. Buy your tickets online in advance of your arrival--the process is efficient and you are able to bypass the LONG ticket line at One World Trade Center. This entire experience is amazing and you should not miss this if you are in NYC! Spend the extra $15 and get the iPad tour! It's well worth it! You will not be disappointed.
One World Trade!!!. The best in NYC! This beautiful building is so spectacular! It's a must see for all tourist. I recommend to everyone please visit if ever you're in New York City!!!

Spectacular views not photo friendly. If you're looking to go to "OWO" keep in mind these things. Touristy, observatory is indoors only, and window birds. We bought our tickets in advance for time 7:15pm. We got there 30 mins early & was allowed up. It's like going thru an airport screening to get in. I got in with a small backpack. You go thru a mini documentary walkway of workers telling their story of building the tower. Then walk pass fake bedrock that the tower is built on. There is a line for the elevators and once inside all walls of the elevator show a video of NY thru a time machine showing all the ages of NY up to when the tower was built. It's so fast it didn't feel like you were moving. You get out and walk over to an area that shows a 3 minute movie of NYC then the screen rolls up showing you the view of NY. Now you walk out and they try to get you to rent an Ipad guide (we didn't rent). From there you go downstairs to the observatory deck. It's all closed in no outside deck. This was not a good idea because the windows are filthy with finger prints and marks and if you want to take pictures you'll get reflections and distortions. You have to put your camera up to the window for decent pics. So that sucked. Its hard to get a window view because people will sit on the low window vents instead of sitting by the inside wall on the floor. So you can't get up close to take a picture with less window reflection until someone moves. They should have workers preventing window birds from sitting on the window vents. It's a nice experience but I'd rather go to the Empire State Building where its outdoors for great photos. These pics were taken from inside OWO. BTW the 9/11 memorial park is open to the public at One World Trade. We didn't eat at the cafe so no review about that.
No, Food is awful, Views Amazing. No, NO, No. Go for the elevator red go for the views, go for the experience, BUT STASY AWAY form the highly overpriced Poor quality food!

"One World Trade Center". Gorgeous!! I went to the Evening Opening & what a Treat! The Views are Superb of the City of New York! Even has a Restaurant! Great Picture opportunity! A New World Downtown, like a City within a City! VivaNew York City!!

Great view. Great experience, great view. Only complaint is that although they charge $32 to get in. They try to get another $20 bucks out of you at the top for an interactive iPad to show you the names of the buildings. And they do it in a way that kind of traps you until you realize you can sneak away out the back. Crass. Anyway the elevator rides up and down are part of the experience. The 360 view is amazing. You can't go out on the roof as you could in the old WTC. There is a schlocky gift shop and of course a bar and cafe. The whole thing is well-managed. We bought our tickets at 10 am on a Thursday and couldn't get in until 2:15. By 2:15 they were selling 6:30 tix so be aware of that.

Stunning building. This is a beautiful building and I think the design of the building is very fitting for the area it's in. When you stand below and look up, the mirrored glass make it look as if it's disappearing into the clouds.The observation deck wasn't yet open when I visited but I will be going up it next time I'm in NYC.

ONE WORLD TRADE CENTER. A fantastic experience, stunning panoramic view, spacious platform... and a great build-up to the attraction. My advice, book the first time slot, it will feel even more spacious and calm.

You Can See For Miles. This was an Awesome experience you can see for miles in all directions if you know what day your visiting I definitely would recommend the Day Flex Admission especially if you know you are visiting on a weekday with this admission you bypass the long line of people waiting to get in security is tight so the less you are carrying the quicker you will get through security I also recommend the One World Explorer Ipad to the experience it definitely will help with locating a lot of buildings and landmarks. If you plan on dining here just be aware of the prices

Awesome. The One World Observatory is an experience that really shouldn't be missed.The memorial gardens are stunning, humbling and a reminder of the magnitude of those events of 9/11 in 2001. However the new 1 WTC is a fitting tribute to all of those who lost their lives and also survived those events, having risen from the ashes as a superb piece of architecture, to become the fourth tallest skyscraper globally.The purchase of tickets was extremely easy and after clearing security the trip to the 102 floor takes less than a minute.There is then a presentation with an amazing twist - that makes the $30 entry worthwhile in seconds.With panoramic views of the entire surrounding area, the observatory is by far the best skyscraper to visit, having also been up the Empire State Building and the Rockerfeller Tower.It is unhurried and gives superb photo opportunities, whilst also giving a sense of privilege that you have visited a landmark that stands for all that those behind 9/11 tried to take away.Freedom prevailed.

Human achievement meets spiritual wonder. This is a truly special place. I was a little nervous to go down to the site, but the way that they honored what happened and the way the building rises from the city is truly inspiring and beautiful. It's one of the great human accomplishments of our time.

Amazing ... Just amazing. We arrived at 9:30am and went straight in. the fee was $30 each and it was worth every penny.The entrance and introduction are very well done.Security is tight as would be expected but not over the topThe views from the top are fantastic and worth just sitting and looking out over NYC and the surrounding areas for a while.Take lots of photos as the views are brilliant.
Take pictures. This's was part of my tour I walked the whole area and took some pictures.every visitor to NYC has to take pictures here.

Spirit-lifting, awe-inspiring, mind-blowing beauty. I was invited to the One World Observatory as part of their #1NSPIRED event, along with other artists, innovators, and visionaries from New York City. I have to say, from the moment we got out of the subway and saw the building spiraling above us, it was one of the most amazing experiences of my life. I've never been so amazed by an elevator ride - the history of our glorious city (and such an important piece of our national development) unfolding before us as we sped into the sky. The first glimpse of the view was so breathtaking that I laughed, then started crying. And the views from the hushed silence and wonder of the event space were life changing. I'm working on a piece of papercutting art now inspired by those views. (The food was really good too.) After a few hours, we went down a floor to the public observation deck and that was wonderful too - buzzing with activity and excitement. A completely different experience, but invigorating, where the event space experience was absolutely spiritual. I can't wait to go back and intend to plan some very special events to be held there. I'm completely in awe and humbled by the capacity of human achievement - and human resiliency - that has allowed this wonderful building to rise up out of the city and show us the wonder of New York from a completely new perspective. A must see.
A must see . Amazing building, An important part of our history that should be experienced so that we really never forget! The place is quite serene but it does give you goosebumps.

Great views of NYC. Buy your tickets online to ensure your slot.Print screen all of your tickets because you won't have internet access. Show up around 20 minutes or so before your time. They let you get in line 15 minutes before your time slot. Be prepared for lines. The first set is the initial wait.Then there is the security line . Then the line to the elevator. They worked hard at trying to make this an experience not just an elevator ride. Get your video ready before you enter the elevator because there is a movie that will run on the walls. There is a short movie at the top. When the movie is over the wall rises and you will 10-15 second to take a pic then it closes. You will go down a few floors to the observation area. You will be able to see the city from every side of the building. Take as long as you like. Then take the return elevator down.
Breathtaking view. Breathtaking view from the observation floor. Crowds were not bad and the lines move quickly. Buy your tickets online ahead of time to streamline the process!

Mixed review hhhhmmm. Amazing building with the most amazing views ever. It's a must see/do. I felt there could have been a little bit more of the history of why the freedom tower was built and my biggest disappointment was the prices of stuff inside. The bar/cafe and the gift shop were extortionate ($40 for a water bottle) and over $100 for a round of drinks. I'd recommend going however I really feel there needs to be some major improvements the bar & gift shop were empty and it has to be because of the silly prices.
Go see it. haunting and beautiful. Go and see for yourself what we can do to rebuild after so much tragedy Worth the trip downtown
Beautiful tribute. This is truly a remarkable tribute to all that lost their lives on that terrible day 9/11. I loved the way they incorporated pieces of the old building. Definitely worth a visit

exploration of ground zero. its interesting to see the skyline of new york from this building because it has uninterrupted views of the hudson bay but i think if u have to choose , the Empire state building is a better option coz u can even go outdoorsstill the building is a must visit once in a lifetime
It stole my heart. Can't even explain the feeling. It's been something that words couldn't describe. Just visit it and let your hearts open

Long slow moving lines, but great view. The lines to get in are very slow moving and seem to go on forever. It took us over an hour to get inside notwithstanding our timed reservation. The view is impressive. There is a lack of information about the building and the sites. They try to get you to pay $15 for iPad that interacts with view.

Freedom tower. Visited the site of the world trade centres and saw the new memorial called the freedom tower a very impressive building. Found the whole experience of visiting here very quiet and thought provoking considering what happened on this site. Still good to visit and to realise just what the people of New York went through on that day. There is a observation platform at the top of freedom tower we didn't bother going up as we had already done the Empire State Building and the top of the rocker fella centre .
a must to visit. very well done, sobering, we did a tour which really gave us insight to what the memorial stood for with many background stories.
Truly Amazing. Fantastic tribute to so many people. Make sure if you want to go to the observation area you book tickets in advance - well worth a visit amazing views.

Steep in So Many Ways. Of course it's glorious particularly when you think of how it exemplifies the human spirit, of how the United States fights back and can't be kept down. The guides who demonstrate a circular computerized system are really great. Well-spoken and knowledgeable they never missed a question.The elevator is fast and also highly digital but it's too fast. It shows, over centuries, how the city grew -- but the trip to the 102nd floor is so very fast that you barely know what's happening before it's all over. Same thing happens on the way down. The restaurant is good and not as overpriced as many things in NYC but beware - your $5 iced tea is not refilled for free! The selection is limited.So you take a turn around the whole thing, then another. You listen to the guy's spiel and that's it. Nope not worth more than $30 - but really good.I went with friends, but it's for everyone.
Amazing view and special elevator.. The elevator alone is an expericience you don't wanna miss, The way they present the view is amazing, i wont ruin the surprise. In New York? You MUST go up !!

A must see when visiting NYC. Outstanding views!!!Elevator rides are fabulous. Buy your tickets in advance and allow yourself 2-3 hrs.Casual dining at the top was just OK and the prices at the souvenir stand were outrageous.But the views were amazing
Breathtaking!!. Wonderful 360° view of New York, great organization, value for money. Amazing the lift that takes you up!!

Spectacular. The trip up in the elevator was very fast and very smooth. Couldn't really tell you were going up. The observatory at the top of the World Trade Center has a great panoramic view of New York and all the surrounding areas. It was very neat to see the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island from way up there. Also, had a bite to eat in the ONE Café. Food was good but a little expensive.

A great way to see New York from the Wall Street end.. Decided to go up up up here rather than Empire State Building. Views although rainy on the day were great. A modern presentation which starts from the wall to wall video in the lift and ends up 100+ floors above everything around it. You can see everything and walk 360 with an optional ($15) iPad tour. Tips: Book on line for timed entrance.Do early on your visit to get a perspective.Plan a visit to close by 9/11 Memorial.

Freedom Tower = Long Lines!. My group of four decided to visit Freedom Tower at sunset. We purchased timed tickets for 8pm. We were told to arrive 15 minutes early to get through security. We arrived as told and waited in the first line to enter the building for 30 minutes. Already past our timed entry. Once inside, we then waited in the security line for another 15 minutes. THEN, once through security we waited in line for the elevator 10 more minutes. We finally arrived at the top with great anticipation at 8:40pm. Missed the sunset.... The top was a great disappointment! I'm not sure how this is possible, but the views weren't that great. Half of it is just twinkling lights of low level NJ and the view uptown wasn't much better. In my opinion, the Empire State building and 30 Rock are much, much better. You are in the middle of everything with 360 degree views. Maybe it would have been better in the day light?? It sure wasn't worth my $32. THEN, when we decided to descend (after only 10 minutes), we had to wait in a line for 25 minutes to take an elevator down. They just opened recently. Hopefully the logistics will be figured out and the lines will diminish.
Great view . The observatory is brand new, has an amazing view and love all the technology that has been integrated into the experience

Top of the World. Best Observation deck I have been to. The beginning is just breathtaking. However the whole Ipad headset bit just didn't work and it is quite heavy to carry around your neck for the duration of your visit. Good food options up here.

AMAZING!. Purchase your tickets ahead of time. You will wait in line for about 5-10 minutes to go into airport style security, then directed to the elevator.Don't want to give too much away but the experience was like no other. I was shocked, I'm still in awe! 9/11 will always be a touchy subject but think of One World Observatory as a new a positive growth along with the message that we will rebuild and come out strong no matter what tragedy is brought to us.

Fastinating Place. We used to visit the Twin Tower about twenty years ago. The One World Trade Center has given us a mixes memories. However, it is worthwhile to visit. You can see a wide range of New Yokk City, New Jaersey and Long Island.. You can also see other land marks such as Brooklyne Bridge, Verazano Bridge, Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, etc. it is a must place to visit even for a New Yorkers. Since, it is every crowded, advanced booking is highly recoommened.

Memorial is moving tribute to victims of 9/11. The Memorial and Tower are moving tributes to the victims of the 9/11 tragedy. The names of all the people who died when the World Trade Center was destroyed in the 9/11 attack are etched into the marble around the shimmering waterfall, a somber reminder of that very sad day in New York's history.
Amazing. The best view in NYC. Very well presented and a must do when in NYC. Very futuristic and is one of the most uniqe buildings in NYC.
Best view in NYC. The view is amazing and a must do when in NYC! Buy your tickets a few days in advance and you can pick any time to go up.

Another tall building in a big city. Big lineups for this destination. Once you are inside the building it is amazing how the simple experience of going up in a tall building has been turned into yet another tourist ride. Sadly the elevators do not show the scenery as you go up which is a real disappointment. Instead you watch a historical movie. Once you arrive on the viewing floor you watch another movie. The viewing deck is completely enclosed in glass so once you finally get to see out the windows you feel completely separated from what you are looking at. An outdoor viewing area would have been great but probably neither safe nor practical. All in all I was not wowed by this visit.

MAGNIFICENT BUILDING AND VIEWS - FEW DISAPPOINTMENTS. Magnificent building and views from ObservatoryDisappointments:Fake foundations bed rocks - hollow plasticFake sky portal - cheap tourist trap(After visiting Toronto and Shanghai towers with real sky portals)Overpriced beverages and snacks.

An Architectural Wonder. You have got to see this area. The building is amazing from every angle. Look up, look side-ways. Notice it with different lighting: morning, noon, and night. Take a boat ride, walk through the streets. Each angle of the building is amazing. A must see.

Awesome !. One World Trade Center was one of the first thing in our itinerary during NY visit. We visited the tower on a sunny day. The views from the tower is awesome. We can see many landmarks of NY & NJ and most of the main bridges etc.. Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island is one of them. Could not believe the elevator has taken us so fast to the 102th floor. Worth visiting

Spectacular Views. It doesn't compare to the originals, but it was still an amazing view of New York. The elevator ride is super fast and quiet.The price to go to the observation floors is over-the-top, but so is the Disney-like program that goes along with it. Super cheesy. It was like being stuck in a time share sales pitch when they corralled us to listen to a guy hawking an iPad rental for an additional $15 just to have it tell you what you are looking at. A simple NYC will do.It also felt a bit disrespectful considering 9/11, and how can you not?Anyway, hold your nose and avert your eyes until you are standing in front of the windows to take in the views. It is really something.

Do Not Pre-order Commemorative Pin: Scam. Although an incredible view, I find my visit marred by the fact that in the excitement of the view, we left the observation deck prior to picking up the pin we ordered from the gift shop. Once down on the bottom, we were unable to return to the top to redeem our voucher for the pin. So, they are now free to resell it again and presumably again. I consider that a scam when you have one opportunity and one opportunity only to redeem a voucher for something you bought and paid for.

See Forever. A beautiful building from the outside. We purchased tickets and then came back for our admission. A little pricey at $29.39 per adult. The trip up in the elevator was very fast and very smooth. Couldn't really tell you were going up. Good thing since one person in our group didn't like heights. Once you get out of the elevator the views are breathtaking. You can rent an iPad that will tell you about what you are seeing. We did not. You can spend as much time wandering around as you like. We truly enjoyed it.
New style freedom. Excellent style. We didn't go up but the memorial pools and survivor tree are something special. Area still heavily under construction but still worth the visit.

Awesome to behold. The first entry into the World Trade Center, Tower One, or the Freedom Tower beautifully slices the sky. Hard to believe there were two towers here once--although the former twin tower footprints are marked by awe-inspiring twin fountain pools that pour into the earth, and are marked by the names of victims of 9/11.
Buy advanced tickets on line. Very long wait, we couldn't get in for over 4 hours on a Tuesday morning. I really wanted to go in but we just couldn't wait that long.

Great view to see forever.. I visited the day it opened and again in Aug 2015. What a great place to see forever on a clear day. Very proud of it, since I am a New Yorker. I do not recommend the iPad app unless you are completely unaware of NY at all. Spent more time calibrating and looking at the app then looking out the windows.
Stunning. New One World Trade Center is nothing short of stunning. Such a powerful statement of defiance and rising up in the face of tragedy. An unforgettable experience.
Absolutely stunning!. Brand new building, very modern, very pretty! Of course the views are stunning, a very similar experience to The Shard in London.

Amazing view, poor crowd management . New York is charming so the view was amazing, however the organizers tried to slow us down with long Q's , presentations one after another, just let us reach the observation deck and leave us alone :-( ...

You must visit!. Great experience. The view is amazing. Very well organized.You can select the time schedule. The visit is complementary to that of the empire state building. If you must choose, I will definitively take this one.

Awesome!. The experience is spectacular! It is a well organized presentation that leave you breathless. After having a look to NYC as you never did, You can stop at the bar and have a drink with an unbelievable view.

Interesting and enjoyable. The views are incredible, of course, and there are also points of information around the observatory to learn more about New York City. There were even points of information along the line of waiting, so it didn't seem so long. Entrance times are reserved, so only a certain number of people enter each block of 15 minutes. This makes the waiting experience much easier to handle. There is enough room in the observatory, and at the windows, to see everything, and to spend a lot of time doing it, if you wish. A very interesting and enjoyable experience!
Beautiful Architecture that Speaks Volumes. The building is beautiful. They did a great job brightening up a terrible situation. There is a lot this building is saying. Must see

Pricey but worth the visit. I never thought I would ever pay $32 for a single ride and enjoy it, but enjoy I did. My children were even more thrilled and they were a bit cheaper at $26. The folks at One World nailed it. The appointment system works beautifully but don't wait to book. The sooner the better so you can get the time that works best for you. The ride on the elevator is as swift as advertised and painless. I'm not sure my ears even popped and they always do. Once you get to the observation area you don't need to fight for space. You are never crowded and you never have to wait long to get the view that you want. Great, great job overall. Kudos to all involved in putting it together.

Just a beautiful building. At long last, it's finally pretty much done, and has taken it's place among all the other beautiful buildings in downtown Manhattan. Definitely a must see, but you really can't help but see it from wherever you are in the area!

Go for the view but not the pricey extras. Overall, a nice experience. I would advise against paying extra for the glorified iPad. You are supposed to be able to orient the iPad to the view and learn more about points of interest from the iPad screen. The iPad had to be recalibrated often - it kept losing its bearings and it didn't really show very many points of interest compared to the vast number of buildings and other objects visible from the observatory. We ate at the restaurant (not the stand up cafe). Service was friendly. The entry to the restaurant was somewhat pompous for the cheap interior - the furnishings in the restaurant were no better than you'd find at a McDonalds. The food was marginal - and ridiculously over-priced. We ordered calimari and it was so salty we sent it back. The table next to us had the same experience.
Extrodinary. A must see location. If you have time also visit the Museum. I will bring back the sadness that people felt. Be prepared to spend at least 4 hours for the whole tour
a real beauty !. Beautiful and peaceful. And we can see it from a far ! The sight from the Manhattan bridge was amazing !

Amazing Views!. Stunning building, great elevator experience on the way up, well presented. Amazing views forever! Entry & merchandise a little pricey. Lines are long though move fairly quickly. Only negative is photo oportunities are limited due to the glare on a sunny day. Overall great experience.

A beautiful remembrance. We took a moment to see One World Trade Centre and I am glad we did. This is my third visit since 911 and I still feel emotional when I am at Ground Zero. The tower is a beautiful sight filled with hope and remembrance.
awesome!. I strongly recommend a visit to WTC Observatory. The elevator is fantastic, as well as the views of Manhattan.

Views are incredible. It is worth paying to visit the observatory - the views are incredible - 360 and not crowded. They also have some great ipads which follow the view with you and point out sites of interest and info on particular buildings.

Best View In Town. Stunning 360 degree view of New York City. The displays are so awesome. Amazing elevator ride! 102 floors in 60 seconds. You won't feel the ride because the elevator walls are projected with images.

Obviously a NYC must-see. A 104-storey skyscraper with panoramic views of any major world city is going to be hard pressed to disappoint. In that sense, One World Observatory is a 'does what it says on the tin' type attraction. Unsurprisingly, though, the views are breathtaking and I consider a visit should be at the top of any visitor's to-do list. However I feel more could be done to maximise the viewing experience. Call me picky but I found the dozens of window pillars slightly obstructive whilst it was difficult to capture the moment on camera as the glass seemed fairly reflective from almost any angle. It would also, in my view, benefit from a 'glass floor' type platform rather than the video-recorded alternative which is somewhat underwhelming. That said, this probably falls into the category of attractions that have to be seen first-hand and can never truly be captured on camera.

Loved it!. I rate this observatory above the Empire State Building as it never seemed too busy and all tickets are timed. It is nice that everything is so new and clean. There is also a nice shopping centre and seating near by for lunch.The price was good and if you book with a MasterCard for a Monday visit using the code MCMonday you get 20% off too! My only gripe was a latte in a paper cup was $6!

Great view, terrible experience. The view is tremendous at One World Observatory ... when you get to see it. But this place seems designed to make you wait and wait and wait to see it. We booked our ticket ahead of time. Sunset would be at 8:04 p.m., so we went with the 7:30 p.m. ticket (knowing we would be arriving at 7:15 p.m., as instructed.That leaves 45 minutes to get through security and up the elevator. That shouldn't be a problem for an organization whose lone goal is to get individuals through security and up the elevator. But it didn't happen.Arrive at 7:15 and find someone to ask where you're supposed to go. Show your tickets to get in line for 5-10 minutes. Go inside and follow other people down the stairs (not that anyway made clear we were supposed to do that). Then show your ticket again to get into another line. This is the security line: take out your wallet and phone, walk through the metal detector. Somehow it took 20+ minutes, a fair stretch of which included no line movement at all. Move forward and wait in another line for the elevators. Why were only three elevators running on 8/8/15 when there was clearly a backup of people? No idea at all. That's just how it is. Eventually we all get packed into the elevators (you know that cool elevator show on the way up? It's not easy to see when the elevator is packed, especially for your kids). It's now 8:05 p.m.; we have missed the daylight and sunset views. But at least we're on the elevator ... not much longer now!Get off the elevator and wait in another line. The regretful-sounding woman telling us to wait in this line notes: "This will be the last line you need to wait in!" (She's lying.) Now there's going to be a three-minute movie about the facility. They'll tell you to go to the left, but ignore them and go to the right. The right is where you can leave this room ... the left is where you'll be waiting in line again.Three-minute movie is unmemorable in EVERY way. Every way whatsoever.THEN ... the BIG REVEAL! The screen (the whole width of the room - 12 or so feet tall by 60 feet wide, maybe?) lifts up to reveal a live view of the city below! A beautiful view that actually elicits cheers from the tired crowd! Beautiful!For maybe 15 seconds? Seriously - have your camera ready. If you don't, it will close before you can turn it on. And now it's time to wait in line again, as you move out of this room through the one door. Then you walk down stairs from the 102nd floor to the 101st ... where the folks are holding people up to try to explain why you should rent this ipad to see everything you're seeing and have it all explained to you (the same thing you probably already chose not to buy if you bought tickets online). Then walk down to the 100th floor (which, if I understand correctly, is not actually the 100th floor). Here you get the actual view of the city. Or, more accurately, the view of the backs of people's heads as they get a view of the city. It was packed. In numerous places, there were people sitting with their backs to the windows eating snacks while (I guess) they waited for the city to light up as darkness approached. People actually brought snacks for themselves and their kids and staked out areas for who knows how long.The interior lights made it difficult to see at some angles - and made taking pictures quite difficult. And who decided the giant circular parks portal thing was going to be right at the north side of the building - taking up the best view of the rest of the city and the Empire State Building? Take your time, though, and you'll find some beautiful views. Watch out for jerks who lean over top of your family to take their pictures (and elbow your wife in the head before insisting "it wasn't that hard!").Take a look at the Sky Portal, if only to shake your head that they tried to make an experience out of standing on top of TVs showing "real-time, high-definition footage of the streets below."Then, get back into another line. About 15 more minutes to go downstairs. (My wife wondered whether people who paid extra to jump the lines to get up to the top also got to jump these lines - or were just left to suffer with the rest of us). And get down to the ground floor just in time to realize the World Trade Center reflecting pools close at 9 p.m., even on Saturday nights. Again, the views are great - when you see them. The overall experience here just isn't worth it, though.

One World Observatory A Big Disappointment. After a memorable and reflective three and a half hours at the 911 Memorial and Museum, my sister and I were looking forward to visiting One World Observatory but were greatly disappointed. Several of the personnel were helpful and pleasant, several others were not. When we finally got to the Observatory floors after waiting in line, we were greeted with "pitches" to rent an iPad for $15 which would show one all the sights of NYC and beyond - the same sights one can see clearly when walking around the Observatory; then there was a stop to have photos taken against a painted backdrop of NYC. Since we had waited in line in the hot sun and unshaded area before entering the building, we decided to get a sandwich and cold drink at the cafe, but were told that there was no place to sit - just stand at tall tables. The restaurant was open for drinks but did not serve food at the time we were there - between 4:00 and 5:00. The walk around the Observatory floors with the magnificent views of NYC was good but again no place to sit and observe the views. Finally, on approaching the exit we passed the Observatory store selling expensive and uninspiring merchandise. I would recommend other places from which to view NYC, eg top of Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building and would not recommend One World Observatory - it is too commercial - from the entrance fee to the sales pitches inside the building.Reflecting on the original World Trade Center with its magnificent Windows on the World, it was sad to see what has taken its place.
Wow, what a show!. Like a well-oiled machine, so smooth and polished for such a new operation. Reminded me of Disney with all the sharp organization and young, well-trained personnel.
What a view. Amazing experience to see the views, to learn about how it was build, the elevator ride was very surprising, don't want to give any spoilers.. it is truely amazing and worth every cent..

Queues!. We visited the observatory on a timed ticket and arrived 30 minutes early. We were told that we needed to wait to start queuing, which we did. Then 5 minutes later we heard them calling out the time of tickets 15 minutes AFTER ours so after questioning the attendants we joined the queue! The first part of the queue was fine - you go through security quickly. It was only then that we experienced the long and slow moving queue to the lifts. The line takes you through an area of fake rock, which did remind me of queuing for rides in Orlando. There appeared to only be 2 out of five lifts working, which meant that this whole experience downstairs was LONG! The actual lift experience was great and the first 'sight' of the view was also done well. What we didn't like was being herded through to listen to a presentation about hiring iPads and then having to have a photo taken. All we wanted to do was be able to walk around and take photos at our own pace! Finally we got to the 100th floor and were able to get our long-awaited snaps. I understand what people are saying about the glare on the windows and also the fact that people are sitting on the grills in front of the window but we didn't find that too bad. Coming down was fairly straight forward as we didn't need to queue for lifts at all (once we had found out WHERE they were!)All in all we all said that we were glad we had been but all preferred Top of the Rock!
World Trade Center. buy your ticket as an add on with your Gray Line bus ticket or at least pre order it online so you do not need to wait in long line.

Always Remember!. We were all struck by the combination of the beauty of the new building and the memorial of 9/11. We must always remember what happened at this spot, to over 3,000 people, their families, friends and the entire nation.

Great except the long wait. Knowing I had 2 kids with me, I choose World One because they had a timed entry. Know this: timed entry still means waiting in lines. We were not actually on the observation deck until almost an hour after our entry time. Much of that time was outside in the hot sun with no access to bathrooms. It was also frustrating to see people get to skip ahead of you for whatever reason. I am writing this review for families with little kids who might not like waiting in long lines. Also be aware that the only place to eat in the area are street carts (unless you wait to get into the building) If you can get past the wait, the views are spectacular on a clear day. FYI when we happened by the entrance late in the day, the lines were much shorter.

Long awaited , a dream finally realized, I will return again.... Unsurpassed views, only here can you get unparalled sights of the Manhattan and the Brooklyn Bridges. Of the Statue of Liberty, Governors Island, Battery Park. Its Unreal. I am a huge fan of Empire State as well as Top of the Rock. All of these iconic buildings have their strong and weak points. One World is no different.One World lacks the class and vintage style of yesteryear that ESB has. Nor does it have the friendly ambiance and good cheer and manners that ESB employees have. This tower feels new, lacking that fantasy lore historical magic. It also doesnt offer outside views like TOTR or ESB, or the stellar Central Park views either. So what makes it worrth your hard earned cash?State of the art introductions wisk you thru the entrance to your journey. A fast and furious ride to the top with a movie inside the elevator chronicaling the rise of lower Manhattan. Once up top the views take your breath away.My biggest surprise was the extreme rudeness across the board of the employees. I am hoping it is because it is still somewhat new. Never in all of NYC at any venue has my family been treated so dismissively. I didnt take personal offense as the employees were downright mean and rude to almost all they encountered. Save for the elevator operators, the rest need some serious training in how to treat other human beings, lol.The best part of the One World is respect of the fallen, of my memory of "THE" day. Of sitting in a quiet spot and looking out at Lady Liberty. Thinking of the lost...that once upon a time the Twins stood right here, and this was their view. In all its glory. Its back. I am sure there are a lot of angels that feel triumph too.

Chaotic outside but good enough inside. Warrants a big fat zero for the utter chaos outside. No signs, no clues from personnel and loads of people looking for answers in vain. Asked one staff member where to get tickets to be told to go by a tree. Which one of the twenty or more ? Found other lost souls asking where the mythical ticket Tree was. Real answer is to get let through barrier to front entrance on West Street to office foyer.Inside was good but badly let down by the outside wait. Lines far too long.
