We went through airport style security. You are NOT permitted to take in food and drink. You walk a corridor, and eventually get to a number of lifts. The ride takes just 60 seconds. You hardly notice it moving. You go through to short show, with a suprise, amazing. You then go through to an area, which leads you down to the viewing deck..... And the views were fabulous. Totally different from Empire State and Rockefeller Centre. (Which we'd done) you can walk round and listen to the City Pulse talk, an interesting and informative visual commentary. There is a restaurant, which we didn't use. The cafe was busy, of course. There was a wide choice of foods, pizza, salads, sandwiches and cakes and drinks. A regular coffee and cake was $9 in total...... Yep, I would say expensive.The gift shop, the usual items with One World advertising. Again prices were high. If things had been more reasonable we might have spent a but more than we did.Well worth a visit, great view of the lower end of New York. I'm sure it'll be busy as its newly opened. You can buy tickets on line, or at the location.

Amazing views from the Atlantic to Upper Manhatten. The New Observation Deck in World Trade Centre opened today. It was a roller coaster of a journey from bottom to top and down again. Go on a clear day and the views are breathtaking, I could see the curvature of the Earth and it was like looking down from a plane, in fact you are so high almost on past with the helicopters buzzing around City.Great views up the Hudson and East River and all the bridges, superb views across to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and up town. Even the Empire State Building looked small. Tip - buy ticket on line in advance, even if you can't access your smart phone they will print ticket at the box office. It took full hour from queuing to get in to actually getting into lifts which wizz in 16 seconds 100 floors up. There are no toilets in the queue so if you need to go, find a loo before going through airport style security. To get a full appreciation of the importance of this Tower to Americans, visit the 9-11 museum first. It sets everything in perspective. Again, to avoid queuing, book tickets for museum entrance first. A must see on any visit to New York.

One World observatory. see over 500 years of NYC history its so welldone. After you arrive at the 100th floor you get ushered into a room with the windows covered up by lots of different shape screens. You watch a 5 or so minute video of new york tgen all of a sudden the screens rise to show your first view of NYC everyone cheered and clapped. You then walk into one of the 3 floors. You can not believe how bright and modern it is. They have a bar and a snack cafe but for those who wish they have a premium restaunt. The gift shop is expensive but it doesn't stop them having big queues. The views are out of this world. I was lucky enough to go up the original tower but i think NYC should be very proud of a beautiful tower after such a terrible attrosity.

Hope they learn from first day. The views from the observatory are incredible and the elevator ride is really neat, but everything else about our visit was disappointing. The tickets are timed but there seemed to be no plan for how to handle a crowd. Very long wait outside, slow moving lines inside. We were in line for over an hour after arriving ahead of our appointed time. This was the first day the observatory was open to the public, so I am hoping they learn from the first day and improve the experience. For now, I would recommend the Empire State Building as the better experience.

My New Favourite Tourist Attraction in NYC. This will be my new number 1 recommendation for friends and family visiting NYC.It's an incredible experience from start to finish. To be honest, I was a little apprehensive about going here...the fact that this was the last view so many people saw all those years ago is so sad, and I thought it would be difficult to overlook that. But from the minute you begin your journey to the top, you can't help but think of what a strong and poignant symbol of hope this building is. The whole experience here leaves you with an incredible appreciation for the present and future of NYC. I don't want to ruin anything here, because you really should have the experience as they intended it...but I'll just say the lead up to the observatory itself was magnificent. So well thought out and so well executed. The views are obviously stunning...though, in my opinion....I still prefer the views from Top Of The Rock because it has a great close up of the Empire State Building, Central Park and then as far downtown as WTC and Statue of Liberty. Plus, Top of the Rock has outdoor viewing which makes for great pictures (without glass or wire). Having said that, the complete end to end experience at WTC completely trumps any other observation deck I've ever been to. The discovery level was also really great, found out a few interesting tidbits about NYC that I didn't actually know, which was very cool. Also a cafe and restaurant here....I didn't check it out, but I'm sure there is quite the premium to eat on top of the world. Staff here are also incredibly friendly and welcoming - hopefully this cheerfulness and professionalism lasts as staff eventually turnover. I really hope they keep up the amazing experience here...it's like no other attraction in the city and should be an example for all the other time wearied attractions that haven't changed since the 90's...pick up your game!
Best NYC icon. Being here takes you back from the early stages to the 9/11 attacks but at the same times you feel a sense of joyfulness when the 360 degree view is displayed

BE CAREFUL PURCHASING ADVANCE TICKETS - NO FLEXIBILITY!. I purchased May 29 tickets for evening entry for 2Adults and 2kids and cannot go due to an emergency. Contacted them for changing the dated or atleast asking if the tickets can be sold to someone else. I had contacted them on Facebook on May 13 and got a reply on May 13 that they are looking into it and will respond. This is the response I got today on May 28 from them:"Hello Tanvini. We apologize for the delayed response. Unfortunately, at this time we are unable to confirm if we can facilitate a reservation change for your tickets. If you have not done so already, please contact our Guest Services desk directly at (844) OWO-1776. Please let us know if our Guest Services team is unable to resolve your issue. Thank you again for reaching out to us. We appreciate your patience and look forward to having you join us at One World Observatory."I am just upset since this is like a rip off. I did not even ask for a refund, just change of dates or if the tickets are transferable. I remember same thing had happen when I had a booking with Statue Cruises for State of Liberty visit and had a premature delivery so could not go. They had refunded me all my money immediately. That's being human!

Breathtaking. Feeling very lucky to be one of the first 5000 people to visit the tower before being opened to the public next week ( 29 May 2015) Some things I am keeping a secret as I would not want to spoil some of the surprises it holds for future visitors.  If visiting NYC this must be on your, 'to do list!' The views are just breathtaking, I can say no more than that. A lovely fast food cafe (healthy foods being served ) we sat in the adjoining restaurant for lunch where sipping wine eating excellent food and still taking in the views. Every member of staff we came across were all excellent ! Overall a fantastic attraction for NY but we must not forget the reason it is there . I hope all visitors enjoy it as much as we did but take time to think of all the people who lost their lives so tragically on 9/11

Waste of Money. Save you money and avoid the Observation Deck at 1 WTC – it’s a 100% tourist trap, I was up there last weekend (free passes) and the best is the fake overhang, with 1/2 inch plexiglass, 2 inch beams and a video screen showing West Street under you, like you are actually 100 stories in the air. The food is pathetic, muffins, $5.00 water, then a restaurant and bar right next to it. Windows on the World was a fancy place, this is a dump. The company Legends, who is running it does not care about survivors just the money aspect, they can’t even answer simple emails. I have watched this new building being built from the days of the pit to 104 stories and am very disappointed in the company Legends and what I saw up there. Save your money and go to the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock.
